Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, unlucky situation.”
Reviews.Author: Allaroundthaworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is like Disney World for adults. Bike rentals, scuba diving, fishing, and drinking can all be done at hotel site. No free shuttles from airport. They do have events every hour like "pina colada tasting hour" or "teach you how to salsa hour". There is live music in the lobby. It is 20 minutes away from Old San Juan. You will not experience a dull moment. The down side is that the service absolutely sucks. The hotel xtras make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Rooms/Beautiful Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: Mblen
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before departing on a cruise the next day, got a great rate via their website. Room was adequate; small but clean and in working order. Front desk staff helpful and checkin/out was smooth. Tons of taxi's available with standard fees (same from airport) to cruise ship pier. Outside pool and grounds are beautiful and enjoyed watching fish at night from their pier with "fish lights". Drinks/food expensive but tasty and enjoyed Starbucks for breakfast and lunch at the poolside restaurant. Small and nice shopping area at hotel and Tower rooms at least on 3rd floor were good. Would most likely stay again but onlly a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable 8 night stay”
Reviews.Author: SteveH846
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4/10 - 4/18/2012. No issues. Great hotel for the grounds, the pool, the beach and all the amenities a large resort has to offer. Asked for a renovated room, got (421). It was fine, nice view looking NE. No fridge, so we asked for one, delivered in 30 minutes. Water was plenty clear for snorkling and there are fish to see and feed. Beach is especailly nice for kids. The grounds are well kept and the area around the Lemon Grass is full of animals and birds and fish. Nice place to relax in out of the sun. Ate at Lemon Grass and Morton's. Both were fine. Yes, expensive, but it's a resort. Many good resturants in Old San Juan and in the Condado area. Didn't have a bad meal anywhere. Cheaper than a taxi, take the M3 or 21 bus to Old San Juan. Bus stop is on Ponce de Leon. Go down the street past the Subway past the San Juan hotel. Look right and you'll see the stop going west. Stop on the way back is across the road. 75 cents per trip, need exact change. Catch the same bus back at the Old San Juan bus station, just down the road from where the bus lets you off. From same stop near the hotel, 53 goes to Condado and 21 brings you back, although you can walk there over the bridge. Only negative was one false fire alarm one morning.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: bama74
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days at the Caribe Hilton. Great Hotel with very beautiful grounds. The first room we were given was in the Hilton Honors tower. The views were great but the room needed some updating. There was a musty odor and we were moved to the main building. The 3rd through the 6th floors have been remodled and are in great comdition. We were on the 5th floor and awoke every morning to great ocean views. Parking can be a hassel if you self park. You must get a ticket stamped everytime you come and go. Spend the extra 5 dollars for vallet and you are on your way quickly. Everyone was very helpful. Be careful in locating the hotel. GPS systems did not work very well for us. Look for a Subway restaurant and turn to the right. There is diving instruction and snorkle rental at the hotel. Plenty of beach chairs and even hamocks. It is only about a mile to Old San Juan. It is usually easy to find someone who speaks English but remember Spanish is the common language. This was not a problem and I even got to try out my poor Spanish. As I would apoligize for my Spanish they would often apoligize for their English. Having said this let me assure you Spanish is not necessary in most cases. I would be happy to return to the Caribe Hilton and I think I would spend some more time on the property. One caution, if you are driving, these are the sweetest people on the planet until they get into a car. Defensive driving is not a pass time but a necessity. I was told they believe in using the right-of-way. This means if they find a way they are right! We lived laughed and enjoyed Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: kat64
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at the Caribe Hilton and we had a wonderful experience. When I booked originally I somehow ended up with one bed for 4 guests. When we arrived the front desk was so accommodating. We had to wait but they gave us a beautiful spacious room on the 14th floor. Nice and quiet and beautiful bathroom. Very comfortable beds. We rented a car, which was very necessary and used the valet. I thought the restaurants were very good however expensive. They do have a good happy hour for drinks which is nice too! I an planing a trip to Montreal next and think I will look into the Hilton there as well. Management was very nice and helpful too!

Reviews.Title: “A lot good but service and amenities not so much”
Reviews.Author: Tripp F
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel upon first impression with lots of shops and a boatload of restaurants. The view from the room in the garden wing was lovely. The trouble began when I tried to hook up my computer. There is no wireless in the rooms (they need to fix that soon) so I plugged in my ethernet cable. Nothing. I called for help and they said they would call back. They never did so I called back two hours later and they connected me to their internet service provider. He confirmed there was no signal from my room. He said he would call the front desk with instructions and they would call me back. They never did. I am a Diamond member and when I arrived at the room, there were no amenities (water). I called for that as well. It never arrived and two hours later, I called back for that too. Finally came. So the next morning, I re-reported the internet problem to the front desk for my room (844). They said they would fix it and leave a message for me. When I returned to the room that evening, there was no call and the internet was still not working. On the bright side, room service was very tasty, though $5 for a can of Diet Coke is a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “If not for the renovations it would be 5stars”
Reviews.Author: nsexplorer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, it's own Spanish fort, and its own private beach. The restautrant was exceptional and the loby and pool areas were also great. The elevators were not working correctly when we were there, so we had to use the service elevators and some of the rooms have yet to be modernized. This is an older hotel that is in a state of renovation, but once completed it will be world class once again. The staff was very professional and efficient. There is a great Subway around the corner that cooked fresh omlettes and french toast which is something you can't get from the Subways in Canada and it provided an economical alternative to eating at the hotel everyday even though the Hotel food was OK it was overpriced for what you recieved. The steakhouse restauraunt was the only exception and it was great. There is a small public beach next to the hotel which has "Scuba Dogs" who are one of the best and very well priced dive shops around. They have a small man made reef on site good for basic fish observation because the breakwater shelters both beaches. It can be crowded at times. They also give PADI courses and arrange dives at other great sites away from San Juan. This hotel is on the island of Old San Juan and you can get to the heart of Old or New San Juan on foot or with a very short cab ride. The location is the best and for anyone spending an extended stay rather than simply overnighting before or after a cruise, this is one of the best places to stay. They often have good deals on spare rooms for the cruise crowd as well and you can occasionally get a low rate even less than the budget chain hotels if you shop in advance online. This is a true resort property and not simply another budget hotel so keep that in mind when comparing prices online. Overall value is great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - Dine off site”
Reviews.Author: 150roomsAyear
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at the Hilton Caribe on business and found it perfectly acceptable, but not my first choice in San Juan. The property's rooms are well designed with a more contemporary look, the bathroom was great and the bed was comfortable. The room, as well as the rest of the hotel was very clean. Further, all of the staff was friendly, however not always that helpful. The two concierges I saw did not have great suggestions for dinners each night and both first recommended the hotel's many dining outlets. That said, I did eat at the Pina Colada Club and the Pool & Beach Bar and Lounge and was not impressed with either. The fish tacos at the Pina Colada Club may have been the worst I've ever had - over cooked, poorly constructed, fair ingredients - while the Pool & Beach Bar was just what one would expect, nothing special. The food tasted as though it has been reheated, not freshly prepared. Overall, I would stay here if it was close to the office or meeting I was visiting in San Juan, but not for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BigSaver
Reviews.Content: At check-in, the hotel staff couldn't find my corporate reservation. Luckily, i had my confirmation number. But seriously, what is up with that? Room (in Towers) was adequate. Furnishings a bit worn. Bed very comfortable. Shower very large but big rain shower head had no pressure. Phone buttons did not work. All I could do was dial 0. Light switch near bed was broken off, so I asked for it to be fixed. (They did.) But again, why should I have to point out that these things are broken? The last 2 days there was a microwave or safe or something laying in the hallway. The hotel staff is not attentive and takes business for granted. I ate dinner at the Pina Colada Club, and had delicious fish tacos. 2nd delicious dinner there. Both times the service was excellent by "Cat" (server). Third night Cat was not there, and the hostess seemed to not know where to seat me so I left. Ate dinner twice at Rotisserie Il Giardino, and the food and service there was very good. Hotel grounds are very nice, great view of ocean waves, but understand that you cannot swim in the waves. The ocean swimming area is a medium-sized lagoon/beach area with no waves because of break walls further out. Good place for families with small children. There are outdoor bar and snack restaurants that looked nice. Want a quick breakfast? Good luck with that! Try the Starbucks but you better get there early in the morining before the line is out the door. This hotel seems to be designed for large private parties & events, and for families with children. I liked the Doubletree much better, where the rooms are cleaner, newer, better designed, and where the staff is more focused on guest needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it first appears”
Reviews.Author: nhcruising
Reviews.Content: Stayed one day/night at this Hilton prior to getting on a Royal Caribbean cruise. I read lots of great reviews here and was able to book a good price through discover card. Arrived by taxi from the airport. First impression was amazing. The lobby is large and open, with a big wall of glass allowing amazing views of the water when you first pull up. Check in was smooth, we arrived just over an hour before check in time but immediately got a room. Our room was a "garden view" which means we could see the concrete top of one of the restaurants and little else. No matter, only there for one day and really booked it for its location to the cruise pier. The hotel staff was very nice and professional. Upon first inspection both the hotel and room looked great. Then you look at the details and really see that the hotel is on need of an overhaul. Walls all over the resort were crumbling, the windows/window trim in our room looked like they had never been cleaned. Dirt, cobwebs, and "black goo" was all over them. Then I sat on the mattress. I thought for a minute that the cleaning staff had taken away the mattress and left just a boxspring behind. I seriously thought about sleeping on the sofa bed because it was more comfortable. Food was good, but I felt it was way overpriced. My wife and I split a pizza in the Italian restaurant because it was the only thing we felt was worth the money. We had breakfast the next morning at the little buffet in the Italian restaurant. Be warned, you only get ONE trip through the hot item line, so stock up. Fruit, pastries, cereal, etc are all bottomless. The outdoor facilities are amazing. Beautiful beach, great pool, with tons of chairs. They also had a cool little observation deck out in the water where you could watch fish on the reef. At night they turn a big light on at the deck. We saw some huge fish out there at night. Plenty of taxis on grounds the day of the cruise, and it looked like there were tons of other people headed for ships. I would stay there again only if I got a good deal again on a room and going on another cruise. I would have been pissed if that hotel was where were spending our whole vacation.

Reviews.Title: “perfect pre-cruise stay!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February.. We didn't pick the hotel (it was picked by Royal Caribbean) but it is a beautiful place to stay!! The staff are really, really friendly and cheerful. There's a Starbucks on site for all addicts :) and free WiFi in this area too. Our room was not in the main hotel but it was lovely. We had a ground floor terrace type place to sit out in the evening. We didn't eat here. After travelling for over 24 hrs we wanted some simple food so went to Subway 2 mins away from the hotel. We did try the cocktails though, they are really nice :)

Reviews.Title: “The Caribe Hilton has gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: rebucfan
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Caribe Hilton 03/31 to 04/07. This was our 5th stay at this property and by far the one with most incidents. We changed rooms 2 times (3 different rooms). The 1st time they could not accommodate my type of bed despite the length of my stay and having requested it ahead; so they moved us the following day. First they wrote the wrong room number on the key envelope and we ended up trying to enter an occupied room with a Do Not Disturb sign that we thought was there in error. After they corrected their mistake; the next room was fine for 2 nights until it started raining inside the bathroom because they claim the guest above us flooded their bath tub. They offered to move us but we did not want to do that yet again. The next day the bathroom flooded again, so at that point our best guess is that the story about the flooded bathroom upstairs was not the truth. So we moved yet again to another room... For all our trouble all The Hilton management offered was a $50 breakfast for 2 voucher; and trust me you will need every penny of that $50 for your all you can eat delicacies on the steam tray. We may not stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice time”
Reviews.Author: serenity124
Reviews.Content: Saved up HHonors points for a year to stay at this hotel, and although I am not disappointed, I am glad that I didn't pay rack rate to stay there. To start, I love the entrance to the hotel: the shops, the restaurants (and starbucks), the birds, the open air design, the melon infused water... We arrived quite early and tried to get our room, which was not yet available, so we went to the PiNa Colada restauarnt for lunch to kill time. Came back and room still wasn't ready so we went to explore the hotel grounds (of note, they DID offer us a different room that was immediately available, but, said the other would have a better view so I OPTED to continue waiting). When we came back the room still wasn't ready (it was 4pm by now) so they gave up coupons for free rum drinks to kill more time. When we finally did get up to the room, I was not diasappointed by the view or the sound of the waves! As mentioned before, the rooms are older and could use some sprucing up, but it was nicely decorated, the pillows were AWESOME, and the bathroom and doors were really nice. Also, had a fridge which was nice. Outside, the main pool area was really nice (especially the swim up bar) and I adore all of the lounging options (hammocks, beds, chaise loungers, etc...although, good luck getting one during the day!) The playground is quaint, but sufficient. The bird sanctuary was fun. My daughter and I loved the little pier where you could go feed fish. Last, but not least, was the beach...the one area where I was disappointed. I was excited to check it out and try snorkeling, but, the area was rocky, not very clean, and the water was kinda murky. Had the continental breakfast in the morning and was pleased with all of the options. Didn't feel that we needed to spring the extra money for the full buffet. Overall, I would return, but only if there is a really good price being offered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pre Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeteL180
Reviews.Content: We stayed before our cruise departed San Juan. It's in a great location. Very Friendly Staff. Nice pool are with hot tubs and beach access. Short cab ride to old town San Juan worth the trip for great food and bars in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Susanlynn53
Reviews.Content: Some of the areas are a little tired and it was very busy but the staff were so very friendly and helpful. The property could probably use a litttle sprucing up in some areas but it doesnt matter as the staff were so nice. Had to wait for a room, and there was tons of luggage around and so many people, not a quiet relaxing atmosphere in the lobby, be prepared for hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Not all what its hyped to be!!!”
Reviews.Author: celiadahan
Reviews.Content: Just travelled for Spring Break 2012 with my four teenagers, husband and parents. For being a "Hilton" this resort was definately not all what it is hyped to be. Rooms smelled like mildew; husband and daughter coughed whole time. Beds are full size and tiny and we slept horribly whole trip. Beach? Really--water is brown not blue, sand is not white--totally overated. Pool is very small. We were bored every night since nothing really happening at hotel. We had to take a cab to go anywhere at night and trust me not much happening at the other hotels either except for the tiny casinos. And as far as service? We did have a great bartender Hernom at pool bar. Other than that--not so friendly service. Never go back again!! Oh by the way--Last two times I stayed in Puerto Rico we stayed at the Sol Melia resort and everything was sooo much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay again..”
Reviews.Author: TruBluSigma
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, PR during the second week of April. Our room was in the Villa area facing the old fort which gave us an ocean view -- Very Nice! The hotel staff is very helpful in getting you registered and settled in your room. You have so many things on site from restaurants, meeting rooms, pool/bar, private beach, workout facilities and spa.. Happy Hour every day was perfect for us and just the sheer relaxed atmosphere was perfect. I guess the only complaint is that the rooms in the villa stay damp, but with so much humidity, I'm sure it's hard to control. We just slept with our doors to the ocean most of the night and turned the fan on high to keep the tile floors from being wet 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swyantk
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, a little dated but not bad considering how old it is. The service was fine but not outstanding. Nice to have the private beach. It is a little tricky to find the driveway the first time, and even trickier to get back for a second attempt, but after a little practice it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but for the price, not great”
Reviews.Author: rochava
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Caribe Hilton earlier this month, in a two-bedroom villa at the Condado Lagoon. The hotel property in general is in a terrific location - close to the airport, close to old San Juan, with its own beach, etc. It is a very good option if you're traveling with small children, as we were, as there are kiddie pools, shallow beach, playground on premises, etc. Were it not for that, however, we would have chosen somewhere else to stay. The room, though spacious, clean and with nice, soft, Hilton beds, had the feel of a shabby beach shack. The showers in particular were cheap and old, and anything that was capable of rusting was totally corroded. We had a very nice ocean view from inside the room, but standing on the balcony itself made a bunch of trucks and equipment visible. Housekeeping service was very spotty -- one day we had to request that our room be done (the problem was taken care of going forward). And we had an episode at the end of the trip with the laundry service that showcased a real incompetence: a simple change of clothes that we had sent to have washed for each family member to wear on the plane ride home - we were told - would not be back in time despite our timely delivery to the service. What should have been a totally avoidable problem turned into a nail-biting episode of "will we have to wear the hotel robes on the plane?" (bags had been packed and taken by then). It all ended semi-happily - we got our clothes in time (though damp). But the passivity and "I am so sorry you're upset" attitude of the hotel staff was maddening and not representative of a so-called luxury first-class hotel. All in all, a pleasant stay, easy and convenient for families with small children, but for close to a thousand dollars a night, I would have expected a higher caliber of service and surroundings. I will look around for another place to stay on our next trip to P.R.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricanranger
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week and one of the best hotels i have stayed. One thing, the rooms all should have a refrigerator.... Otherwise a fine facility

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Kathy K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton San Juan in late March 2012. We chose this hotel because of its location, beach, and the Hilton name. We were very happy with the holtel as a whole. It was very convienent to take a taxi to Old Suan Juan or New San Juan. The service was top of the line just as anyone would expect. The cons were that the bar drinks and food were quite pricey. We found this to be true at least two other resorts we visited in the area so it is probably common for San Juan. Downtown areas restaurants provide a little relief in this department. this did not stop us from eating or drinking what we wanted though. There is not a Casino on site and you have to travel to a sister hotel to gamble if your desire to do so. There is also no nightly entertainment so you have to go somewhere else for this. The El San Juan Resort & Casino is a great place to go at night with a live Salsa Band and good casino. The resort is huge so there was never a problem getting chairs at the pool, beach or the restaurants. The hotel does look like it is ready for a new coat of paint, but over all we had a delightful time and the view from our balcony was breath taking.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Desk”
Reviews.Author: Atoussa D
Reviews.Content: PR is a big island with much to see; however, the traffic can be a challenge. Leo Malsonet at the concierge desk gave us wonderful and honest advice. It is best to speak to him face to face and plan ahead your days on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beachfront resort”
Reviews.Author: Janice B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I try to get to Puerto Rico for an extended weekend every spring and we just had our 3rd stay at the Caribe Hilton. Overall the Caribe Hilton offers a relaxing vacation at a good price. We had a great time. Our room was in the main/original part of the hotel. The hallway and rooms really look like they need some upgrades as they are showing their age, but the king sized bed and pillows were really comfortable. Each night, the temperature drops down to the 70s and it is just fantastic to sleep with the balcony door opened and not even use the air conditioning because there is such a great constant breeze. Our room was ocean view and we also faced the bird sanctuary toward the back of the hotel. We heard the sound of peacocks each morning. The pool area is beautiful and the staff try their best to keep it clean but at times when there are a lot of people things can get a little messy. Meaning garbage around the pool area and at the beach -- debris like drinking straws floating in the water. It is also a good idea to get to the pool early if you want to get a choice place to lounge. 7:00 AM is best. During busy times the pool area fills up fast, but there are plenty of chairs around, just not if you want some shade. Those lounge charis go fast. If you plan to stay on their beach, an attendant will help you set up your lounge chairs and umbrella. Quite a nice service. So we are big "foodies". We love the Pina Colada Restaurant. The best things we have tried are the pulled pork sandwhich (the bread is so light and tasty) and for appetizers the cerveche served with fried plantain chips is totally incredible. Nelson was our server is such a great guy and he really sees to it that you are having a good time! He even remembered us from our trip two years ago. Another favorite onsite restaurant of ours is Morton's Steakhouse. If you go, ask for a table by the windows so you can look out onto the beach. Try the potatoes au gratin as a side dish -- pure heaven! My only complaint was the Olas Spa. We booked 4 massage appointments (over two different days). Our massages were supposed to be 50 minutes, but we both felt they were less time. Also, if you have ever had a great massage, you know that getting your head, hands and feet rubbed is one of the best parts of the experience. My masseuse did not do any of that. We had two other appoints booked later on during our stay. Due to my sunburn, I decided to cancel my second spa appointment. I called the spa at 8:00 AM to cancel my 4:00 PM appointment. I spoke to Glenda who told me that I was not giving them enough notice and I would get charged for the service. When I told her that I did not think this was fair considering how early in the day it was. Plus the hotel was almost fully booked so filling that spot was most likely not going to be a problem. She told me she would have to check with her manager and then hung up on me! I wanted closure on this so I walked over to speak with her in person. She still was unwilling to help so I went to the hotel manager. In the end I was not charged. If you are someone who knows what a great spa experience is, I would stay away from there. Another really fun thing to do at the Caribe Hilton is feed the fish! There's a basket by the towel stand. In it is leftover bread and bagels from the breakfast crowd. You are encouraged to take some over to the end of their pier and feed the fish. You would be surprised how many beautiful fish come around to grab that bread. Make sure you have your camera ready! Overall great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Saturday Karaoke :) Planes and Birds”
Reviews.Author: Melinda&Eric
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Saturday evening. The Karaoke is done right outside the lobby. They could not hear us to check in and couldn't find the reservation. Just as an FYI, there's a lot small plane traffic noise. There's a small airport very close by and you hear the planes taking off, very early in the morning. Be aware their are birds that wake you up. If you like to sleep in, I'd not recommend this hotel. If you stay, there is a subway close by, cheap for eating breakfast and lunch.The place is very pretty. Clean rooms. Breakfast is expensive for the buffet

Reviews.Title: “Exactly Like the Pictures”
Reviews.Author: wordsmeetmusic
Reviews.Content: This resort is fabulous, end of story. We were captivated by how gorgeous this part of San Juan is in general, but this resort really adds to it. The pools, the beach, the snorkeling - so great! Our experiences were the staff were very positive - maybe not so much the cab drivers. But that's not the hotel's fault. Our room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. LOVED the bathroom and the sliding wooden door to shut it, the decor is modern and stylish. This is the kind of hotel that you would have no problem staying in all day. They even have a list of free activities that are going on in different parts of the resort all day. My first morning in San Juan I did a yoga class and it was so refreshing. Be aware - as with most hotels food here is EXPENSIVE and I don't recommend eating breakfast with their sad $20 something continental breakfast that doesn't even include meats and eggs. But everything else about this hotel is great. And just as beautiful as the professional photos.

Reviews.Title: “Spring in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: CameronToronto
Reviews.Content: Being a gay couple at a predominently family resort was not a problem; we never felt out of place, although we were not drawing any outward attention. Being the only property that offers a private beach with a gorgeous pool was our selling point. The other main feature is that the Caribe is a main access point to a wide array of recreational pursuits such as hiking, horseback riding, ziplining (Peurto Rico offers one of the highest elevations in the world) and historical tours among others. I found the staff accessbile and approachable, and they provide transportation to and from your day trip/ activity; along with free beach towels to use if you need one.They were offerring a $50 credit for use of any hotel service/ food for every 2 days of your stay. We spent $170 and only paid $20 for 1 week since it i[s a nice walk across the lagoon bridge (altthough a bit of a hike - 25 min) to neighboring Candado where there are ample restaurants, shops and services. Being a 5 star hotel the Caribe offers several restaurants but the realtive value and choice are better across the bridge in Candado; altough during our 1st night we had one of the best Pina Coladas in their "Pina Colada Restaurant" , but the food was lack lustre and overpriced. We were stuck a second time before a daily hike at El Yunque and visited the Il Giardino (family style restaurant) and were blessed with overpriced cafeteria style food. The rest of our $170 went towards drinks and Starbucks. If walking is not your thing, there is a standard $14 per couple to take a taxi to areas in the neighboring vacintity (Old San Jaun, Candado etc). The room was adequately appointed (remember this is a family property not a boutique hotel) and was very large and had a too-die for comfortable bed. Like us, ask for the new tower, high floor for a great view, quiet room, away from elevator and babies; and you'll have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “if you are above ground, this is the place to be if not, you're probably already in heaven”
Reviews.Author: CindySullivan
Reviews.Content: From the time my sister and I arrived at the Caribe Hilton, we knew we were in good hands. The gentleman, Felipe, who checked us in there was courteous, friendly, knowledgeable and so accommodating. Throughout our stay, we were treated like royalty. Our rooms were fresh and clean and the view from our room and balcony was breathtaking. The beds were so comfortable, and the pillows were 'to die for.' It was almost perfect, I am critical of the pizza served there, fed it to the fish the next day, and, I am so sick of seeing Starbucks everywhere I go, it's like I never left home. But, that's ok. And the only thing lacking was an ice cream parlor .....loved this hotel for the areas it provided outside, the pools were great, lots of choices and, the ocean was perfect. and I especially loved the huge area where hammocks were provided under the palm trees, a nice getaway out of the direct sun, you could still hear the ocean splashing.....yes, it was definitely a 9.5.....and , Jorge, was so helpful with all my questions, always so polite and accommodating

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families with Small Children”
Reviews.Author: Chris A
Reviews.Content: We have spent our winter vacation at the Caribe Hilton for each of the past three years. We have two children, now ages 6 and 4, who love the hotel and the beach. In our experience, the staff is especially nice to children -- several people remember the children's names a year after our last visit. We plan to keep staying there every year.

Reviews.Title: “If able go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: While the Caribe is a beautiful hotel and a wonderful location, its current management is currently not up the the Hilton Standard. As an airline pilot (we stay there on layovers) I have had to go through multiple rooms to find an acceptable one (water leaking from airconditioning and carpet saturated, moldy smells, overlooking car park and car alarms sounding, keys not working, etc). I just received a fraud alert from my bank and we were able to pin the problem on a waiter at the Caribe Hilton as the culprit. Large amount of tourists stay here on cruises and other vacations but I'd recommend another hotel if you're able.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: snoopy7982
Reviews.Content: My husband and another couple arrived on the 31st of March for a 5 day combination business/pleasure trip. We stayed in the villas and our friends stayed in the main hotel. Our room in the villas was nice with a refrigerator and microwave and a nice balcony, but basically just a hotel room. Bath was nice with a walk-in shower. Temp in room was either too hot or too cold, never just right. Walk to main hotel was definately a turn-off and I would not reccomend staying in the villas for that reason. Our friends had a room in the main hotel which had been renovated but was still just a basic room. One of the elevators was broken which made it pretty miserable. The hotel is in need of desperate renovation in all public areas. Very shabby and worn. One of the biggest things to note is that there were tons of children around and they were not monitored by parents or hotel staff. The hot tub was useless because it was constantly filled with children all under the age of 10 and many with floaties on. The wall around the upper and lower pools has an infinity edge and children raced around it constantly. They also climbed to the top of several walls and then jumped into the pool from the walls. In our opinion, this is a major disaster waiting to happen. It had a major "Disney World" feel to it. Towels were located only by the beach so if you were going to the pool you were required to walk all the way over to the beach to get towels. Service was OK. Could have been much quicker, however, one of the waiters at the beach and pool really stood out. His name is Yuriy and he was excellent! All 4 of us are in our early 50's and like to have a good time. I teach first grade so I am clearly not opposed to children but the way they were monitored was ridiculous. We stayed at the Westin on St. John last spring and they managed a great Kid's Camp for the children! We will be in San Juan 2-3 times a year and I would not reccomend this hotel. Go to the Conrad or the Renaissance right across the lagoon in Condado. Both are beautiful and without the craziness of the children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: Cjritch1
Reviews.Content: The property was really nice! We had a newly renovated room. In regards to San Juan....the first day was not good the concierge guy at the hotel was Very rude!! Every question that we asked he was very sarcastic and rude as if we were suppose to be familiar with San Juan. Once we got settled in and went to eat, the people at the restaurant was very RUDE!! The food was NOT good...the waitress took forever to come wait on our table...then when it was time to checkout the entire waiting staff allowed us to stand by the cash register forever and did not acknowledge our prescence. The next 2 days was much better!! There is a lot of good sightseeing in old San Juan! The tour of the Forts was really nice!! Do not pay for a tour of Old San Juan...because you can get on the city trolley for free and ride around the area. It is really a very small place so you can basically get a map and tour the are on your own. Make sure you go to the visitors information center near the CVS by the pier. They are very helpful in there. Go to the Parrot Club for dinner...they have good customer service and decent food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cisrad
Reviews.Content: My husband & I loved this resort. The staff was very helpful and accomodations were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Property not bad.... the service is HORRIBLE.”
Reviews.Author: PassportAlwaysOnHand
Reviews.Content: I really didnâ€™t like this hotel. Part of it was the â€œlittle thingsâ€� that kind of irked me the whole time I was here. And sometimes it is the little things that can ruin a stay. First of all, although the employees are pleasant and nice people all around, this place is completely disorganized. Yesterday, for example, I had to send a fax to my office. I went to the business center, and the person in charge was on their lunch break. There is a phone there for the operator, and they said the front desk could do it. I went down there and there was ONE person checking people in and SEVENTEEN people in line. I walked up to see if there was an area I could fax something, and the woman said yes, but I had to wait in line. I walked over to the concierge and said that lunch time was a â€œdifficult timeâ€� for that. Huh? Because people take lunch breaks during a time when a lot of people are naturally checking in? Took over an hour for me to send a fax. Yesterday morning when we were heading to the pool, I called housekeeping and asked them to make up room, but drop off shampoo and conditioner since we didnâ€™t have any. Came back? No shampoo or conditioner. So I called and asked. Went to the pool, then dinner. Came back? None. Called. Went to bar and watched a basketball game. Came back. None. Called again (it was now 10:30 pm). Said they would â€œbe right thereâ€�. Hour later? Nothing. I finally asked to talk to the manager of the hotel. Next thing you know? Woman shows up with a whole bag full of shampoo and conditioner. At 11:30 pm or so. Finally. Yesterdayâ€¦. Went to the pool. No towels. Went to the concierge. No towels. Went to the front desk. They said â€œone moment, we will take care of itâ€�. 45 minutes later finally got towels to go to pool. And then there is the rooms. Bathroomâ€¦ lock broken, no soap tray (broken off). Remote control on TV horrible. Numbers do not work on it, so you have to leaf channel by channelâ€¦ and you had to squeeze it with all your strength and even then it did not work sometimes. (It would be nice if they put a channel guide in the room alsoâ€¦ little things) Then this eveningâ€¦ my daughter and I had wrapped up some food and put in the mini-refrigerator that is in the room (We are in a villa). In the kitchen are cabinets, coffee maker, refrigerator, etc., but nothing else. No plates, no silverware, nothing. So we called for two plates and two forks from room service. They said â€œthat will be $5". ONE HOUR LATERâ€¦ nothing. Call again. â€œsorry sir.. be right thereâ€�. 35 minutes later, my daughter says she is starvingâ€¦ So we go eat. We get back her after an hour or so? No plates or silverware. When I came in to the room on initial check in, I couldnâ€™t get the lights to work on the desk or in corner of room. Everything was unplugged. Service in the restaurantsâ€¦ Sâ€¦Lâ€¦Oâ€¦Wâ€¦. Price in the restaurantsâ€¦ HIGH. Mortonâ€™s slightly more expensive than the one in New York City. I guess you have to import your steaks. However, the meal at Lemongrass was fantastic, and is highly recommended. Wonderful meal there. Overall, the location has amazing potential. It is a 10 minute taxi ride to Old San Juan, has a nice pool, good restaurants and bars. . The whole place needs a makeover as it comes across as a little 1980â€™s. Needs a good paint job, a new sign that you can see as you are coming in to the property. The place is just in disarray, and the service is just terrible. I would never come back here again. Ever. I was here for four days and felt like I wasted hours of my time waiting on them.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation- Super Beach location in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Annaplois
Reviews.Content: After 4 days in Ponce we did 4 days in San Juan. This location was super from a beach and visiting Old San Juan perspective. Beach had everything, including dried bread every morning to take in to feed your favorite tropical fish swimming around you. All the typical kids activity items then can drag into the water also. Nice warf with a +1000W lamp on an area of the coral reef to watch fish and occasional small sharks (they are outside the beach activity area and outer part of the coral reef, don't freak). Starbucks in the Hilton a +. Mortons attached, to Hilton steak & service aas +, the Italian restaurant in the Hilton is so so...recommend Sophia's in Old San Juan instead oif you want great and "homemade" ITalian instead. You can take a bus for 0.75 from near the Hilton to Old San Juan and roam around...or take one of the two trolleys that run through the old city. Forts fabulous. For the shoppers (or cruise hopper shoppers), you can get your Coach, Croc, etc shopping in and everything is walkable. Best lunch is outdoors at the Princess Cafe at the start of the southern wall...get the Mofongo. Recommend taxi back from downtown. Only down fall is while the Hilton Caribe is the original resort legacy of the 40's...nicely remodelled with their own animals in the garden area...including peacocks...is you really do not want to walk outside the area off the property at night. Cab it. Awesome park next door and great walking areas...in the day light. Overall we liked the Hilton Caribe because of the beach & fish there (I think it is the only private beach there because of legacy issues) and closeness to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Carly_Dawn3
Reviews.Content: The title of the review says it all. Our travel group was very disappointed with the lack of service with this hotel. Don't get me wrong the hotel is lovely as is the beach and pool area, but it is hard to appreciate these things when none of the staff can properly show you to your room! When our party checked in, we were given instructions of how to proceed to our rooms (or so we thought). The hotel is a maze of rooms and it took at least half an hour to find them, which is not very good after hours and hours of flying. We asked staff along the way for assistance, but none of them said they knew where the rooms were located and refused to help. As well, during the check in process the lady at the counter got the two rooms we booked mixed up and mixed up our credit cards assigned to each room. In turn, causing more confusion when trying to check out and properly assign the correct charge amounts to each room. So, it is with the relatively high cost per room combined with the lack of customer service that I give the San Juan Hilton 2.5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Overall Stay”
Reviews.Author: David I
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Caribe. I have never been to PR and was worried about where to stay. I traveled with my wife and my youngest son 16. The Caribe Hilton turned out to be a very good choice. My overall impressions, We had a nice room with a view of the beach, battery, and ocean. They told me it was a renovated room, so maybe I got the better end. The pool is very nice as it is with most big resorts, but what made the outdoor area great in my opinion was the man made lagoon. It's big, clean, and you can snorkel right there and see a lot. Service was good, nothing to bad or great, but definately nothing to complain about. It's a very short cab ride to Old SJ, so that was convenient. So what would the negatives be. Well, depends on what you are looking for. It's a verey big busy hotel, so if your looking for something off the beaten path, this isn't it. With all RESORTS, the food and drink are not cheap, but I didn't expect it to be on vacation. I wish there was a little more near the hotel you could walk to. So that's it, overall a nice stay I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to chill in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: DeEtte N
Reviews.Content: We recently went on a cruise out of Puerto Rico and spent our return night back to port at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. The grounds here are beautiful! There is a big pool, with swim up bar and a roped off swim area in the ocean with swim platforms to lay on and sun beds out on a deck over the water. They also have several hammocks set up on palm trees in the shade to relax in. The rooms are in need of a little fixing, but for the price it is a really great place to stay.The beds were very comfortable and the rooms are actually pretty large. We had an ocean view tower room, beautiful view! Do not eat at the Italian restaurant on site, however. It is very over-priced and the service is beyond lacking. Try a local spot called "Jose Jose" the local people could not stop raving about it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Resort Fee Charges to your Credit Card 15 mths later”
Reviews.Author: linda_cecchetti
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan. 14-17, 2010 - Booked through Hotels.com, when we checked out we were told we had ZERO balance. 15 MONTHS LATER out of the clear blue sky on March 21, 2011 found an unexpected charge to our bank account for $75.44. First thought - Identity Theft - Called my Bank & cancelled my debit card. Contacted Caribe spoke w/Mr. Pratts (GM-Finance), he looked into matter and said that it was a resort fee. I did not receive a letter, an invoice, NOTHING - they took out an amount that was NOT AUTHORIZED!!! I requested some type of document never received a thing! I guess the charge was for being awakened by the garbage truck every morning at 4:30 a.m. This was my second stay @ Caribe didn't have a problem the 1st time, loved the hotel, staff was nice, Mr. Pratts - NOT NICE! Had to wait 7 days for a new debit card because of your inconvenience. I WILL NEVER STAY AT THE CARIBE - WE WERE GREAT TIPPERS! WAS IT WORTH LOSING TWO CUSTOMERS???

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: dynzoutalot1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for business/pleasure in mid-March. Open air lobby was nice, but very little overview gien at desk about lay-out, options, etc. Our room was an ocean view tower room. It was clean, not particularly new, but great view and comfy bed. Couldn't get the air conditioner to let up, so we did freeze. But overall, room wasn't bad. The pools were perfect, as was the beach, ocean, pool bar, bird sanctuary. Really relaxing and nice. No silliness of reserving chairs on the neach, thre were plenty. The casual restaurants were SLooow and $$, the food was just okay there. The Asian fusion restaurant and Pina Colada had moderately quicker service,and decent food, but silly prices ($15 hot dog). It was always cheaper to get a 10 minute cab ride into Old San Juan for $15 bucks each way. The only rapid breakfast option was a tiny Starbucks run on island time, so expect a 20 minute wait online at Starbucks every morning. The bars were delightful, especially the mojitos. On our first night there, a serious drunk was in the swim up bar pool, and the staff handled it with such kindness and alacrity, it was impressive. But it gets crowded so watch your bill, they don't let you pay cash at the outside bar. Staff was friendly and helpful especially when tipped well. Bartenders outside were always better than those outside. allow forty minutes to get served food. From the hotel you can walk to two forts, and Old San Juan, I hear. My husband jogged and liked it, felt secure. There were cops everywhere. My cabdriver recommended the restaurant next door (natura? natriva?) but we never got there. Did find some GREAT restaurants, tho. All in all, it was relaxing and pleasant, good for business, families, couples, solo or friends!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Resort”
Reviews.Author: alexis2
Reviews.Content: First off I want to say that this resort helped save our winter vacation. We decided on a cruise instead of our usual all-inclusive resort in Mexico. We stayed at this Hilton property two nights before and one night after our cruise. LOVED it !! Beautiful grounds and the rooms were clean and nicely appointed. I had read some less than stellar reviews right before we left and I was a bit worried as I had chosen this resort not only for us, but friends as well, so I started to worry that we'd ALL be disappointed. The staff was very friendly, especially Victor at the lobby bar....they had a great "happy hour" which we did each night we were there. We did not eat on the grounds as we wanted to explore some of San Juan. We did hang out by the pool and it was very nice..drinks were a bit pricey so we kept them to a minimum, but I have to say the few cocktails we did have were quite tasty. Check in and Check out were quick and painless. We loved our room so much that we requested the same room for our night after the cruise...we were pleasantly surprised to receive an amazing upgrade that last night. A gorgeous HUGE corner room, price tag on the door was way more than what we paid so we considered ourselves very lucky. Our friends love the place as well. Reason I say this placed saved our vacation...we found out we are not cruise people, really missed our all-inclusive resort and the Hilton, on that last day, was a bit like our Mexico resorts... it made the trip not so bad. We would return in a heartbeat. Loved Old San Juan also, be sure to make a trip into town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: NMPCC100
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hilton Caribe for one night in March 2012. I was in the Villa section and my room was larger than expected and the bathroom had a separate room with a bidet and toilet, and there was a separate bathtub and shower as well. Very good location and value â€“ itâ€™s just a short walk across the lagoon to Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: GoBSUBroncos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple nights after our cruise. The grounds are very nice (make sure you check out the fish feeding pier and the hammocks!) and the pool and beach area are incredible. Unfortunately, the rooms at least in the main building, are very old and need some work. Our bathroom had tiles falling off of the wall, the shower was so corroded over that it barely sprayed, and the vents didn't even have room to take any of the steam out of the bathroom with all of the build-up inside of them. You will also be able to hear everything the people in the next room or in the hall are doing... They also tend to nickle and dime you for everything, even after a large amount of money spent initially on the room. It always irritates me to agree on the price of the room and then find out after the fact that there is an additional $25 per night charged for a "resort fee"... basically just an addition to the amount of the room since it is not optional... be honest and just charge what the room costs! Overall, the grounds would sell this property, and the location next to the cruise dock and in close proximity to Old San Juan make it very nice. Maybe some of the other rooms are nicer, but I'd stay away from the main building if you can.

Reviews.Title: “First time”
Reviews.Author: Asheyca
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went on our first trip to Puerto Rico in 2011. We are very pleased that we chose to stay at the Caribe Hilton, it seems to be one of the best hotel on the Island. the service was good, the accomodation was comfortable and there was enough activities to partake in. The staff was friendly and helpful, the food was good, I love the Pina coloda from the main lounge, Saturday night entertainment was good. In all we had a wonderful trip, and I am looking forward to staying there on my next trip to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic atmosphere, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DebH50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well appointed within the facility and very nicely located relative to Old San Juan and the Condado area of San Juan. We arrived at midnight the first night and were greeted with a nice welcome. The lobby is open and depending on the evening, quite lively. Multiple restaurants, Starbucks, etc. offer a great variety of choices, high end and lower priced options including several small stores within walking distance. The resort is laid out so that you have an opportunity to be totally on the beach/pool side or visit the garden area in a quiet, tranquil spot. We walked every day to the Condado area for exercise and it is amazing how many people are walking, biking, and rowing. Overall, the experience was really very special and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a relaxing Caribbean stay”
Reviews.Author: Anna911
Reviews.Content: Poor service at the restaurants, a pool area that is packed and noisy. Guest services said that it was safe to walk to Old San Juan but locals on the street said otherwise. For a one night stay before boarding a cruise ship it is convenient but if I had to stay longer I would have changed resorts. Rooms are at least clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Hotel but not the Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: MaryJo10789
Reviews.Content: The grounds and hotel are just lovely. Lush and beautiful. Rooms are clean, bright and have nice views. However, I would say that check in is a bit slow and I will also say that the dining options on site are all kind of pricey. They should also have free wifi, if you ask me! I would stay there again but I would plan on eating zero meals (and also, zero drinks) there.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: tourists_are_us
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at the Hilton Caribe and having read some of the reviews I did have concerns. Upon arrival we were given a room in the tower and I have to admit it was disappointing. The hallway leading to the room was grim and the room dull and unwelcoming. Whilst we had only asked for a standard double room I still felt that the room did not reflect good value for what we had paid. I went to the reception and asked for a different room. The receptionist Angel (both in name and nature) found us a room in the main building. It was like a completely different hotel. It was quite recently renovated, clean, bright and contemporary. The beds were very comfortable and (apart from the noisy air conditioning) we were happy with the facilities provided. We ate in the Italian restaurant. The menu was varied, the food was tasty and the service was attentive. We did not eat breakfast so cannot comment on it. Throughout our short stay all of the staff members were helpful and we did not experience the problems complained of by other trip advisor reviews. The only additional comment that I would have regarding this hotel is that the pool area is quite crowded which may not suit everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cruise stop over Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: PKerr
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel in Dec 2009 & Jan 2010 and forgot to review it. Since that time, we have had 3 friends stay here & praised it as a great spot that we reccommended. We arrived on Dec 23rd to meet 2 friends who were staying at the Conrad Hilton next door, another great spot. The Caribe HIlton has its own private beach that only hotel guests can visit & use. If you are a pool lover, they have that too. It has a great dock that guests can feed day old bread ( which the hotel puts out for guests) to feed the masses of fish that hang around the dock also exclusive to Hotel guests. Its fun for all ages there. The staff speak both English & Spanish amound other languages. Its close to Old San Juan by Taxi or by local bus which is really cheap. All views from the hotel are great. We had a room that viewed open ocean which was amazing. The gardens also have nice swans & birds for everyones viewing pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: ikeabird
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, modern, and have great views of the water. The hotel itself has many nice amenities (e.g., multiple pools, gym facilities, private beach, large hammocks) and seems to provide a lot of options for children (e.g., kids zone, life-size chess set). It has the feel of an all-inclusive...without being all-inclusive. Perhaps for that reason, costs add up quickly. Basic internet access can be purchased, but there is no wifi except in the lobby. It is difficult to find a reasonably-priced breakfast (except at the on-site Starbucks) and the drinks are very expensive. Also, I suspect that I got food poisoning from the only reasonably-priced restaurant (read: avoid the burger at the Pina Colada!). Generally, the staff are courteous, but service is extremely slow. Check-in was a lengthy process. Most importantly, the concierge was anti-helpful: he provided contradictory and incorrect information. They also have a strange booking system whereby they do not let you sign up for a tour unless at least 4 others have booked...which means that most tours are off-limits unless you have a large group. It is probably better to book tours online.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant in most respects”
Reviews.Author: JKDA
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is a large property that is consistent with most of the large tropical resorts you see in Puerto Rico, e.g., open lobby, bars, pools, and ocean beach. I have stayed here twice in the last month, once in the "tower" section, and once in the original hotel, both in rooms facing the ocean. The rooms are well appointed, very clean, and had balconies overlooking the ocean, very pleasant to enjoy a cup of coffee or to read a newspaper. The tower room was more modern- attractive and in good repair. However, the internet was barely functional. The room in the main hotel was similar in amenities and cleanliness, but the furniture was run down. Nonetheless the bed was comfortable, and the internet worked much better. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. The breakfast buffet (included in some, but not all rates) was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: JSCDBoston_USA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Caribe for our one-week vacation. It was clean and well-located between Condado and Old San Juan. There is not much of a "neighborhood" there, but Condado and OSJ are each within a 1.5-mile walk or drive. The hotel also has its own "lagoon"-type beach - rare from what we saw in the area - and the beach/pool area is large enough that it never felt crowded - with the option of lying on a double-sized mattress or a hammock. Beware that parking is $15 per night, and there is a "resort fee" of about $25 per day that they slap on when you check out. We avoided the overpriced hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the amenities... You never have to leave the property. The beach is beautiful, and private to the hotel. With Aqua Adventures, located on their beach, you can SNUBA, Sea Trek, Scuba dive, or snorkle, without ever leaving the resort! There is a long pier, that extends out to the ocean, with great views. A small lagoon area, with ducks, swans, and peacocks. Many restaurants and shops to choose from. And a casino, of course. A convient grocery store, just across from the resort entrance.. for those who need it. And the rooms are very nice. Service is excellent! Located in the Condado area... there's lots to do! And just a 5 minute taxi ride to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: liz w
Reviews.Content: We looked forward to our Puerto Rico vacation and booked the Caribe based on the website pictures. The pictures are completely deceiving. The beach is NOT turquoise blue. It is man made of rocks to form a reef to prevent the Atlantic surf from crashing on shore. The beach is miniscule for the size of the hotel. The drinks at the outdoor bar are expensive ($13 per) and poorly made. We were charged $70 for in room internet use and we didn't even have a computer with us! The balcony was a JOKE. It was wide enough for our shoes. Barely enough room for 2 of us to stand on to enjoy the "view" . There was a "bait and switch" at the check in. Our reserved king bed ocean view room "wasn't ready" at 530pm BUT they had another room just like it that was ready. Great! except that it wasn't ocean view but city/lagoon view. The next day we were switched to an "ocean view" room but it was closer to the traffic, and a construction site immediately next to the "balcony". For a decent beach we took a bus to Isla Verde....much better location! but had to travel there every day, and rent beach chairs. We did use the villa pool twice. Pool towel service here was minimal (couldn't always get one). And there was no waiter service. The Hilton family should be ashamed of themselves for touting this Caribe Hilton. If you are looking for a pretty beach, good drinks, and honesty do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: NRRGhaven
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little pricey but the grounds were beautiful. The pools and ocean cove were great. We were able to rent snorkel gear and other water sports gear. The restuarants at the hilton were very pricey. It was 2 miles to Old San Juan. It was worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing return”
Reviews.Author: BigApple1
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Caribe Hilton for over 30 years. We have watched the casino disappear, toured the lovely new villas, closed the Execitive Lounge, and slowly watched the restaurants go down hill. We loved the Palmeras where they served a marvelous buffet breakfast, had a lovely lunch, and a reasonable delicious dinner. Now they are only open for breakfast and the buffet has been downscaled. The Italian restaurant, Il Giardinno has below average food, and the Pina Colada Club has a very limited menu. Since the hotel is isolated from Old San Juan it is necessary to have a car, or take taxis to have dinner elsewhere. Taxis in San Juan are pricy and can add $20 to a dinner.

Reviews.Title: “ONE YEAR after my stay they fraudulently charged $150.88 to my card! my”
Reviews.Author: Misha B
Reviews.Content: I can't believe it. I happened to glance at my bill today only to see an unauthorized fraudulent charge from the Caribe Hilton for $150.88 to my credit card!!!! I stayed at this mediocre hotel over one year ago!!! Beware, beware, beware!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extra Mile”
Reviews.Author: SoItGoesVonnegut
Reviews.Content: I lost my phone while in a cab from the hotel and managed to use the Apple iCloud service to message the phone from my computer. The manager, Nelson, kindly allowed me to refer to him in the message and the cab driver, Limpy, returned the phone to the hotel prior to my departure. Everyone I dealt with was extremely patient and friendly. The hotel grounds are also Beautiful--beaches, palm trees, swans, peacocks, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Zaetz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Hilton prior to our cruise. This is a great place, a real resort with hammocks and beach beds, pools and Jacuzzis, bars, restaurants, beautiful park with swans and a change room. We arrived in the morning and before our room was ready we stored our luggage with a bellman and used the special changing room to put on our swim suits. What really makes Caribe Hilton unique - is that the hotel has its own bay separated from the rough waters (all around San Juan) by a strand of rocks. So, the water is calm and warm, you and children can swim in the bay, feed fish, you can even snorkel right there, because there is plenty of fish around. Service is implacable. Rooms have fantastic views of the bay and the ocean. Beds are so comfy, you donâ€™t want to get up. Our experience there was so wonderful, we did not want to leave for a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton great job!”
Reviews.Author: Frank T
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to thank Julio at the front desk for getting us the best room and caring for us throughout our stay! Also, can't say enough about Maria who manages the Pool Towel stand, who not only made sure we had enough towels, but acted as a poolside concierge and advised us on the local culture, great restaurant recommendations and provided a friendly smile (every day!).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, great location.......ahhhhhh.....”
Reviews.Author: carolinasunshine13
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds and an ideal location. Private beach for hotel guests was a plus! We actually stayed in Lagoona Villas (got it at a great price on e-Standby Upgrade as Hilton Honor members). Even though there was some street construction near Fort Geronimo during our visit (right in front of our room), management reduced our rate due to the inconvenience, even though that was a government construction project, not the hotel. Hotel had the most amazing views of the ocean! Every time I "check out" mentally, I "check in" to the Caribe!

Reviews.Title: “Il giardino is superb!!! Ask for Raul whose service and friendly demeanor is tops! He's the reason we dined there twice in a row”
Reviews.Author: Lizzzzzzzz
Reviews.Content: Please say hello to Raul who is a super server and who makes you feel right at home while delivering superior food and service!! He's the reason we dined there twice in a row including our last night here. :)

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: alainl03
Reviews.Content: I was there for one night only after a superb one week cruise in the Caribbean with my family (2 adults + 2 teenagers). I really enjoyed my stayed there: it was the perfect place for our last night of vacation! -Checking: we were at the hotel at 11AM and we had been able to get our room as soon as we arrive: unusual and lovely! It was also fast and efficient. -Room: I was in the tower, the â€œeconomy sectionâ€� of the hotel. Big room, balcony (but not the best view!), mini-fridge, large bathroom with an amazing shower (well appreciated after the tiny shower of cruise boat room!), 2 large and really comfortable beds. In regard of the price paid, it was perfect. -Fun: many pools, tiny beach with a lot of activity. As we wanted a lazy day before coming back home the next day, it was also what we needed. -Internet: free in the lobby. Only wired (with fees) in the tower rooms. Typical for 4* hotelâ€¦ -Business center: no services on week-end. I couldnâ€™t print there my boarding pass for the next day. On weekdays they charges you $0.50/printing pages. Expensiveâ€¦ -Location: except a small convenience store (perfect to buy coke for teenagers and beers for me!) and a Subway (it was our lunch), nothing else is really at walking distance of the hotel. As taxi are expensive in San Juan, you must consider it if you plan to stay for few nights there. -Restaurants: 4 or 5 restaurants from burgers place to top notch meals. I personally enjoyed their room services for the dinner. I will definitely enjoyed going back at this hotel, if the price matches my budget as it happens this time.

Reviews.Title: “Good pre-cruise overnight.”
Reviews.Author: Virginia R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for one night pre-cruise. Two adults, using Hilton Honors points to pay for our stay. It was a quick ride from the airport and we were checked in quickly and given two vouchers for continental breakfast the following morning. The room was lovely, updated and clean with a tiny balcony and a view of the ocean. We went down for lunch in the lobby: a quesadilla, shrimp skewer appetizer and two glasses of iced tea were $38. Ouch. It was windy by the pool, but otherwise pleasant with both shade and sunny places to lounge. My pre-dinner bacardi mojito was delicious. We had dinner at the onsite Italian restaurant. It was okay. Service was good. We had breakfast there too and chose not to upgrade to the full buffet (theres plenty of buffets on cruise lines; we were fine with the continental breakfast). I went to mass right in the hotel, very convenient and appreciated. Then packed up and set off to the cruise port...also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach, Ok Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LaraChicago
Reviews.Content: Beautiful public areas, lobby, pool, beach area but the rooms are needing to be refreshed. The rooms aren't bad, but they are more of a motel quality than a luxury resort. The restaurants are expensive and offer nothing in regional fare. Making our way into Old San Juan for meals was a quick cab ride, but with seven people in our party it was a $40 round trip outing. Plus, trying to get the kids off the beach in order to drive to a restaurant was more than difficult. I would stay here again because the grounds and beach was beautiful. But, I would budget much more money for meals and request a newer room if they exist.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, great service”
Reviews.Author: Ycib
Reviews.Content: After much research for our stay in San Juan we chose the caribe Hilton and I have to say I was not a single bit disappointed with our stay there everyone we in countered there that works is beyond friendly and accommodating. Jose at the reception was amazing very helpful. Victor and roberto at the pool bar were amazing best piÃ±a colada ever and the food is great too and inexpensive. The breakfast buffet was very rich and yummy. The rooms are very contemporary with a clean lines just loves our stay there and it is walking distance from old San Juan would def stay at the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Interlude before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: AmherstNY1
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Caribe Hilton for 2 nights prior to our cruise, we found it to be the perfect starting off point for our winter vacation. Check in, was easy, fast, and friendly. Our room was typically Hilton, modern and comfortable (especially the bed, I love Hilton beds). A bit of construction noise in the morning got us up early. As we got in late, grabbed a bit to eat at the bar. Spent the next day on the Caribe's beach. For an in town hotel, the beach is great, along with good service, and powerful rum punches. Has dinner that night in Old Town, just a short cab ride away. We ate at Marmalade which as modern and marvelous. The next day we still had time for an hour on the beach, before heading to the nearby cruise port. Overall a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LAD0306
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Caribe. The beach and pool area were fabulous. It was beautiful. Bar and grill was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation spot all by itself”
Reviews.Author: PioneerValley
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were taking a cruise out of San Juan and decided to spend the night in Puerto Rico a day before our ship's actual departure. Glad we did. I really loved this hotel on so many levels and I regret that I didn't have more time to stay here and utilize all of it's nice little extras and explore nearby Old San Juan. That aside, I enjoyed my stay. The hotel is expansive, housing a ton of rooms in multiple buildings and this would probably be my one minor complaint. This place is a maze and. while there are signs throughout, they're not that easy to follow, especially if you've just arrived in town after a long flight and are a bit tired. If you do book a room, DO make sure that the front desk tells you which building you are in (villa 1, villa 2, etc.) and DO request of map if available because I'm a fairly decent navigator but I had to stop to ask a couple of the super nice staff to point us in the right direction. The rooms are nice and while not everyone gets a spectacular ocean view, you're not exactly overlooking the city dump either so you won't be stuck with a really bad view no matter where you are. Our room came with a mini fridge, a microwave, sink, and plates. For some reason, there was no dish detergent to wash the dishes we used so I felt like a bit of a rat leaving a couple of dirty plates for the maid (I could almost hear my mother now). Another nice touch is the Peter Thomas Roth shampoo, conditioner and lotion in the bathroom. Good stuff. The Caribe has several restaurants on the premises to suit different tastes and needs and there is a pricey but tasty breakfast buffet offered each morning (you can order a la carte too but it runs up to be nearly the same price, FYI). For coffee-a-holics like me, there is a Starbucks on site and few gift shops as well. If you chose to stray off of the hotel grounds, you are still in the city and can probably get a cab or even walk to nearby restaurants. That's the beauty of this place's location. Finally, the grounds. As I alluded to earlier, this place is pretty large. It has a couple of interconnecting pools, an outdoor bar (and plenty of places to get sloshed indoors as well), it's own private beach (that's mellow enough for the kids to splash about in; no massive waves, anyway) and a ton of places to lounge about in the sun. Though there are chairs and chaise lounges all over the place, one of the cool things that they had were these giant foam beds to sunbathe on up near the footpath that parallels the ocean. They were usually occupied by the early birds but that doesn't mean you should'nt try to nab one of these comfortable places to snooze/read/people-watch. As for the footpath, it's a nice place to stroll by the water and check out the modern city skyline as it contrasts with some of the amazing, much older ruins of the ancient forts that share space in close quarters. You are relatively near Old San Juan and you can either walk there (it's about a mile, plus or minus) or, again, hail a cab. I really liked this place and I can't say enough about the extremely friendly staff that works there; they made us feel very welcome. I would absolutely return to the Caribe Hilton to stay for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, but it does not look like a Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Lmadrid
Reviews.Content: I went in a business trip to Puerto Rico and this Hilton was very convenient located. The property encloses a beatiful beach but the service is not at the same level of other Hilton properties. It has a very good bar with live music at night. There are three palces for breakfast, including a Starbucks, all very expensive for what they offer. Rooms are a bit outdate and renovation in the property is long overdue.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: CherryGrower1
Reviews.Content: Its a very large hotel complex and the music in the lobby in the evening is way to loud. almost to the point of painful. I will not return to the Caribe Hilton. Beach is OK but very busy. Much better options in this great place

Reviews.Title: “SHORT TERM ONLY...”
Reviews.Author: Forget M
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotel options today so I'd only stay here for a weekend since you won't have to run into any of the following problems for a short stay. I like the place, great location/right in the middle if you want to go to Old San Juan or to Condado night life. It's okay to stay in but NOT one of the most updated hotels. It has some GEMS of employees, but they are few and far apart. I've had the service staff leave my room OPEN at least 3 times. They have not supplied the room properly [even with tissue paper], they haven't taken the garbage out, the staff is overheard complaining about daily work while in your room, and the manager of the Villas tried to state some of the services provided by the HILTON are not complimentary here and was down right insulting. No customer service at this hotel and no one takes responsability. This is a hotel that only cares on quantity and not quality. They care about the turn over guest more than establishing good long term customer service. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to cash in your points”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: Am Hilton Honors Diamond member so I used points for the room. We stayed 3 nights Feb/Mar 2012. Had modern King bed room high in the HH Tower. View of the other building roof but if you looked past that we had a good view of the pools, beach and the rest of the coast line. Lobby, Spa, Restaurants are all very up to date and have a great feel. Spa was nice but you have to walk a couple of hundred yards to the front doors. Lots of room in lobby reception area to sit and relax. Pools were fantastic. There are hundreds of lounge chairs, hammocks and dozens of places to enjoy the breeze without being right on top of the next guy. The pool bar/restaurant is great. Poolside and swim up service were very good. It would be very easy to not leave the hotel compound. Having said that: get out of the compound and go to the Forts and the old town San Juan area. Bring your own sunscreen, it is VERY expensive (over double of the CVS in old town) at the hotel shop. Eat in the local restaurants, and enjoy the feel of the culture. The cab ride to/from the hotel-airport should be around $15 cash for two people and a couple of bags. The meters were mysteriously "broken" in EVERY cab we took so it appears the pre-trip negotiation is in order every time. We got screwed for an extra $13 on the initial ride to the hotel. The old town horse drawn carriage ride is "ok" but if you're tall you will never see anything unless you sit on the floor. If you weigh less than 230 you can take a Segway tour departing Pier 2 that takes you all over old town. Recommend this. Also recommend taking cab ($10) from hotel to old town (pier 2) and then utilizing the free trolley to move around. They run on a loose schedule but have roughly 30 stops and will cover all the area a casual tourist would want to see. Do yourself a favor and look up the schedule for arrival of the cruise ships at the pier. Old Town gets VERY congested when 3000 people disembark and fan out. Hit as much as you can early in the day, wear comfortable shoes to hike around and then enjoy people watching in the late afternoon. Get to old town restaurants late afternoon/early evening, or make a reservation. Cafe Puerto Rico in old town is excellent but busy after 6:00 P.M. Sit outside if you can. All-in-all we would do this again. Overall San Juan is moderately expensive in tourist areas but weather is great, people are nice, there is stuff to see for a couple of days easily.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, but you will pay for it”
Reviews.Author: Dr.TMac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for two nights in Feb 2012. We rented one of the villas that had a great view of Condado. The Caribe Hilton has expanded a lot since I first visited it. Parts of it are very modern, like the gorgeous lobby. Other parts, like some of the rooms, are not run down put past their prime. Of course, you don't come here for the rooms, but for the wonderful beach and the great pools. Our kids had a blast!
