The thing we liked least is the fact that you are basically either stuck on the property or you have to pay a $20 cab to go anywhere. New construction makes a walk to Condado pretty much out of the question. The food in the hotel is very good but outrageously expensive (we had to shell out $80 for two adults and two kids, for breakfast!). It is a nice place to stay if you want to ease into PR after a plane ride, but don't spend your whole trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: RestLov
Reviews.Content: I stayed for my son's birthday and they had a blast. The hotel does offer different activities for the family. The bad side: the restaurants are extremely expensive, the hotel's breakfast buffet is not the exception. Options: There's a buffet right next to the hotel's one that is a more feasible option. The PiÃ±a Colada restaurant right at the hotel's entrance is a nice laid back less expensive option. And also, my sneakers got stolen from my hotel room. I suggest keeping an eye on your stuff and not leaving anything out of order so that you can account for everything you have. keep it in your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “All Stared In A Senior Prom Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Charles17887
Reviews.Content: I stay here in May 2005, in my senior prom weekend. This hotel was great, the service was first class and also the PiÃ±a Coladas was to another level. The view represent the blue of the Atlantic Oceans are, specialy in the Caribbean. Since, 2005 a group of high school friends and I booked this hotel every summer. Feels like home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach property”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel2148
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise for 3 nights and it is in a great location. The 1st night we were in a room in the villas 2 tower and it was old and smelled musty. The room was clean but needs updating. I asked to be moved and the next day we moved to a room in the main building, much better. It is new and fresh and we had a nice view of the pool and ocean. This is where you want to be. The pool and grounds were very nice, you can find lounge chairs either on the beach or by the pool and they have a swim up bar which is a plus. We had breakfast in the restaurant which is buffet and they have a good selection but a bit pricey. We did not eat lunch or dinner at the hotel. I would go back to this hotel for sure if I knew I could get a room in the newer part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, some issues”
Reviews.Author: mlotway
Reviews.Content: We arrived the day before our cruise and after a long 12 hour flight, we were tired. We had never been there before, so didn't know where to eat. We knew the restaurants in the hotel were pricey, so opted for room service. We knew this would be pricey also, bu we were just to tired to try to find something cheaper. So, it was no surprise that 2 hamburgers and fries delivered was $50. The room was ok, needed a little work, but we were too tired to really look it over. When we finished our cruise, we again stayed at this hotel, but for 2 nights this time. We disembarked off the ship by 10am, so by the time we got to the hotel, it was way to early to check in. With this said, we had to wait, and wait, and wait for a long 5 hours for our room. Finally we checked to see if a room was available, and there was. We had the porters take our bags up and met them up at the room. It was only on the 4th floor which I didn't like but by that time I wasn't willing to wait any longer. The room was nice, except for the bathroom door. It was on a track, but only at the top, so it doesn't really "close". It slides, and it was broken, We then wanted to put some water bottles in our fridge, and that to wasn't working. We called the front desk and the did send some one to fix the items. I just found the bathroom sliding door to be weird. There was also a charge of $40 on our bill from the bar that wasn't ours, so we called the front desk and they cleared it up right away, so you might want to check over your bill closely. The bar downstairs has really good drinks, I think mix was optional as these drinks were very strong, but good. The pina colada was my favorite. The staff was really friendly and helpful and there was never a very long wait for a taxi!! The drivers don't have meters, so you just have to ask them how much they charge to go to certain places. All in all it wasn't that bad. Might stay closer to the docks next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: This was the second year in a row we took a High School baseball team to Puerto Rico. The Caribe Hilton was a great selection for our group. The grounds are big enough to allow the players a little freedom. Our fear with other local properties was the players wandering offsite and possibly getting into trouble. The grounds were such we could allow the kids the autonomy freely come and go on their own, but still stay on the property. The staff is great and the rooms were nice. Our games were in the local areas of Caguas, Carolina, and Canovanas. The Hilton was nice in that it was right off the main road and it was easy to get to the highway every morning. We stayed at the Caribe in 2011 and again in 2012. Plans are underway to stay again in 2013. As other reviews have said...great views, great service, and food might be a little on the high side, but for our group that was a small price to pay. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: litlhafgost
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here, from February 16th to the 21st, 2012. I loved it and would definitely come back. I've stayed in the Marriott in Condado, and at El Convento in Old San Juan, but this was my favorite place as a place to stay for a whole trip to Puerto Rico. We spent this trip in the San Juan area (besides an excursion to El Yunque, booked through the hotel concierge for $77/person). The Caribe Hilton has it's own private beach, unlike the other hotels in Condado (one long public beach with private pool areas) or in Old San Juan (no beach). We could walk 40 minutes west to Old San Juan or 30 minutes east to Condado, or 15 minutes south to Miramar, or take a fast $12 cab ride from the hotel to Old San Juan (not sure how much to Condado, since we walked it. We didn't rent a car, but if you did, they have a parking lot. As for the hotel itself, it's clean and chic, and we stayed in one of their "renovated rooms". Not sure if the check-in woman just wanted to make us feel better that our floor still had a little dust from putting in the new carpeting, and they just finished putting up the artwork by the elevator on our floor the day after we checked in. But it was good to know everything was brand new, and the hotel room was beautiful! But beware, we stayed on the 3rd floor on the west side, and it was right over the mechanical roof of the lobby, so when our door was open, we could hear a droning sound. But it wasn't anything too bad. If you are on a higher floor, you probably wouldn't hear anything. All of the hotel staff were pretty friendly, including the three parrots in the lobby, who know how to say "hola" and "hello". At night, you can hear the coquis all around outside. Something you'd miss if you stayed in Condado. The beach area was so great, we didn't even go in the pool. They used riprap to create a sort of lagoon, with a gradually sloping beach facing north and west. It's not a very large beach, but even though there were a lot of people (president's day weekend), there was still plenty of beach chairs, umbrellas, and room to swim. The hammocks tended to get filled up until the afternoon (but they are awesome for when you want to get a break from the sun in the dappled shade of the palm trees), and the couches out over the water also got claimed early in the morning. We were hitting the beach around 9am each time we spent the morning at the hotel. The bar food is surprisingly plentiful, which made the price not so bad (I'm from New York though, so if you're from somewhere else, you may think it's expensive). Pina coladas are $10, from a mix, but pretty good and refreshing, with a maraschino cherry in each one. All in all, it has a great location right between Old San Juan, Condado, and Miramar, the private beach is great, and the room was chic and comfortable. I will definitely plan to come back here on my next trip. Only took me three trips to Puerto Rico to find it!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great room, good service, pricey”
Reviews.Author: Abbeyny
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice family option near San Juan if you want the beach and resort experience. The porters were excellent. The mojitos and pina coladas were excellent. The food was only so so.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: Ellen J
Reviews.Content: Located a little to out of the way, noisy in the morning from nearby airport and construction. The grounds were well maintained, pool and beach were great. We thought the food was overpriced and not that great definitely plan to eat off premise although there is a Subway on the corner for an inexpensive lunch.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Bencas4
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot with our two children. We were apprehensive about staying at this Hilton based on some reviews. Yes, we had a few problems , eg. Had to change rooms to get the one we reserved, inconsistent charges in Palmeros for breakfast, had to have AC serviced, etc... that said we had a wonderful time. restaurants were expensive, but food was good. The staff was courteous, pool was nice, weather was spectacular. We like Mexico and found PR to be just as nice. We'd go back. Take a walk towards old San Juan to go to el hamburger.....great burgers really cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and grounds, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: The outdoor ameities and location are superb and so I would recommend staying here. However, the property is under-managed. The balcony on the side of our building overlooks a very loud fan ten floor below, so we were unable to enjoy the balcony or leave the sliding door open. The food was disappointing in quality and expensive, so eventually decided to walk or take taxis to other locations. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, but the hotel is understaffed, so service was slow (including fixing problems with the room, at restaurants, and the concierge desk). Also, they were strictly unwilling to provide a rollaway bed or futon, so be prepared to squeeze the family on the double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: michael h
Reviews.Content: My family and I returned home after a week at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. Despite an uncomfortable interaction with another guest, the hotel staff went to great lengths to ameliorate the situation. We deeply appreciated the way in which they handled what might have become an unpleasant day and turned it into a lovely one. I would like to particularly commend one of the staff members, Miguel Cestero for his kindness and professionalism. Miguel is a superb representative of the Caribe Hilton establishment. He took a personal interest in ensuring that our stay was enjoyable; in fact, because of his good work, our stay will be memorable! We travel often, and get to San Juan about twice a year. Because of the exceptional way in which the staff treated us, we will make the Caribe Hilton our destination of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need some work”
Reviews.Content: In the original building not all the floors have been remodled we stayed on the 9th floor and while our room was clean and had a great view of the ocean. Our carpet was stained and the furniture was wore out, the hallways were in need of paint and new carpet. I noticed that floors 2-7 have been redone, I would recommend this hotel but if you are going in the near future ask for a lower level room or ask to be placed in the Condado Lagoon Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm.”
Reviews.Author: GreenGazoo
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this hotel and both mornings the garbage truck woke us up at 6 am. The hotel has seen better days. There have been valiant attempts at updating, but they fall short of four star. The pools and beach are very nice, but also very crowded. Old San Juan is about 2 miles away. I walked and really enjoyed the walk and the ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “A Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: CyrilM1
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be an oceanside vacation resort near San Juan. We found it tired, very noisy, not very clean. Piped music blares continuously in public areas The pool area is overcrowded (1000 rooms in hotel). It has a small and miserable beach which slopes, so lying on the beach chairs is uncomfortable. The restaurants in the hotel (except for Mortons - predictable steakhouse) are not good. We left a day early.

Reviews.Title: “Meh..”
Reviews.Author: gretchstars
Reviews.Content: We went here on a trip my boyfriend qualified for by spending a certain amount with his supplier for work. PROS - The lobby has a modern logo and looks kinda cool - the bar inside is pretty cool too. Las Palmeras breakfast restaurant treated us really well. Loved the servers and buffet. Pina Colada lunch place was good too. Walking distance to a liquor store for water and beer. Taxi ride to Old San Juan and Casinos. Nice free chairs to lounge on the beach. CONS - We were put in a VILLA vs. the GARDEN rooms. Sounds better, but not.. Villas = long confusing walk to your room, loud hallways and maid doors outside your room, didnt always clean our room or vaccum, view of a bridge and not the ocean, A/C didn't work - wouldn't turn down. Garden rooms were gorgeous - we saw a friend's - more updated/ modern/ nice. All in all, Puerto Rico was a cool place to say we have been, but I wouldn't stay here again. I would choose a hotel with a prettier beach too.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want onsite for a hefty price”
Reviews.Author: mboileau
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a Hilton vacation resort, and the one thing that's consistent is the price tag. The property itself, although a little dated from the exterior view, has nicely updated decent sized rooms with all the amenities. The grounds and spa like environment is outstanding with its waterfall pools, pool bar with whirlpool seating on one side, many different levels and areas for outdoor lounging and my personal favorite, the hammocks hung between adjacent palm trees in a shaded area by the water where you could get lost for hours. The restaurant selection is decent with a Morton's Steakhouse on site, a decent Italian restaurant and the tropical dining Palmeres which serves breakfast with a stunning ocean view. Be prepared for add on costs including Internet, parking and the somehow overlooked in the ads resort tax of $35 per day on top of the regular taxes. Your daily room charge will likely inflate to about 25% more than the quoted cost. All that aside, you do get what you pay for and it was a pleasant retreat.

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: kristin41578
Reviews.Content: Months before we arrived my friend and I asked for adjoining rooms. When we got there we were across the hall from one another. Disappointing, but not trip ruining. Then I get to my room and realize that the toilet doesn't work properly. I call and they send someone up who "fixes" the problem. Clearly it wasn't fixed. I dealt with it for another day and then finally called again. When I got back to my room wanting to shower after a morning at the pool (which is fantastic) I find my bathroom in total disrepair with the toilet completely taken apart. Finally, that evening it was actually fixed. The next day I decided to enjoy a massage at the spa. Oops, no hot water in the showers. I discussed my toilet issues with two supervisors who thought that a free drink at the bar would take care of three days' inconvenience. Finally they told me that upon checkout they would take $50 off of my bill. Much like the adjoining rooms, that was not taken care of. The hotel was beautiful, but it was NOT the experience a Hilton should be. They were not at all concerned with customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach/pool area!”
Reviews.Author: Angela C
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding as first time visitors to Puerto Rico. We wanted to stay on the beach. This has a great pool and beach area with a lot of areas for lounging, including some great hammocks on the beach. The hotel is undergoing some cosmetic renovations, which is probably needed in regards to flooring/finishes in the rooms. But the lobby is very nice and open and very welcoming. The staff was great and the food was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Best Week Spent in January”
Reviews.Author: kspecial128
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was amazing! Everyone was so nice, friendly and helpful. At breakfast we meet such great waiters and waitresses. Our favorite was Hilda(she has been there for years)...she was courteous and very, very efficient. She was a pro at helping us and other partons at the restaurant. After a day she knew exactly what we liked and what we needed. She was wonderful! We hope to go back soon to see her again....she made our very needed vacation a pleasure. Another pleasant person working their was Victor. The young ladies at the desk were courteous and sweet to all who came in. The manager: Nelson Torres was great. He helped us any and all questions and suggestions we need...he was wonderful! P.S. Maria at the towel counter was Great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service but not #1 in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Swadeshi1
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spend 3 days at Caribe Hilton in San Juan, Puerto Rico. This hotel is located about 15 minutes drive from MuÃ±oz Marin Airport, and offers a variety of areas to stay: regular rooms and villas. After spending 3 days here is my review: This place is very nice for the following reasons: 1) has a nice private beach; and an excellent swimming pool area. 2) it has an excellent location from where, with a rental car you can visit most places; 3) views are great and place is rooms are very quiet. However think about the following before you make reservations: 1) Is one of the most expensive hotels in San Juan: rooms and food. 2) It might get crowded, having as a consequence a very slow service. 3) Hotel is not that big, and common areas might get crowded too. 5) The hotel was built during the 1970's, some rooms are old. Depending the season (low or hight) and if you're traveling or not with family I would select Caribe Hilton.But if you're just waiting for the cruise or spending a couple of days in PR, give a shot to Hilton Double tree in Condado. They accepted my Hilton Honors Points, the place and service was way much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great beach/pool area, helpfull front desk.”
Reviews.Author: junebaby52
Reviews.Content: The resort area was beautiful and well maintained. We stayed in the Tower, floor 9 and had a nice view of part of the ocean. The main building located in front of the Tower obstructed some of our view. (see picture). We liked the hotel location and walked to Old San Juan the first day, then decided to take the bus the second time we ventured into the old city. The room was clean and adequate for our 4 night stay. We looked at a 5th floor refurbished room in the main building, which was beautiful, but we decided to stay on the 9th floor Tower room because the view was better. Food was expensive, as most reviews claim. We ate in Old San Juan several times and frequented the Subway around the corner for quick lunches. Somehow, we were locked out of our room safe, called the front desk and within 10 minutes a maintenance man came to our room and opened the safe. We were more careful while entering our lock code number after that!! We would stay here again! We chose this location because we like the idea of walking to Old San Juan, tree lined streets and beautiful parks along the way. The "city" atmosphere of Condado's high rise hotel district and night clubs did not interest us.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, great location, and very good service”
Reviews.Author: melson3
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant luxury hotel with an absolutely huge, beautiful crescent beach that is accessible only to guests and residents who buy memberships. The hotel provides--free of any charge--lounge chairs (completely adjustable), towels, huge umbrellas and has about a dozen hammocks that are a lot of fun to fall asleep in, or just to swing in the breeze. The views of the ocean are wonderful; the beach is completely protected from rough waves by a reef (but still has some swell to permit you the sensation of waves). The cleaning service for rooms was uneven; on 2 days, our room was not cleaned by 5 pm (they did send someone when we complained). Also, leave absolutely nothing of value in your car in their garage; a friend's car was burglarized while parked there, and the management response was not very helpful. I am not sure this is different, however, than elsewhere. (The thieves used an RFID reader, it appears, to break into the car by "reading" the code when the car was being locked electronically.) The hotel is c. 2 miles from Old San Juan; easily reachable by car, of course, but parking availability is very poor and traffic in the Old city is horrendous. Avoid it on holidays; roads are blocked off and access is slow and difficult. Even so, this hotel is by far the closest luxury hotel to Old San Juan that is on a beach and a fabulous beach at that. It also has large swimming pools, with a swim up bar. They won't tell you, but some drinks are 75% off at the inside bar before 7 pm. ($5 instead of $12).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and the Most Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sue Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in February 2012 and were very impressed with the improvements made to the hotel. We have chosen to stay here 3 out of the past 5 years on our business/personal annual trip. The friendly accommodating staff, the room decor, the location make this a top-notch choice. However, the muzak sound system that was installed poolside this past year is loud, ubiquitous and annoying - a real buzz-kill. Reminded us of the intrusive "boom box" on the beach or pesky cell-phone-use-in-public. It was hard to soak in the sounds of the ocean: the crash of surf, the slap of palm fronds - let alone read a book. Ironically, there is no muzak (elevator music) in the elevators. Why not restrict the piped in music to a few pool locations: the bar, the hot tub, or far-from-the-ocean locations around the beautiful pools? In any event, turn it down. You have a fabulous facility and truly wonderful location. Take advantage of it and limit the sound system!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous, 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: NewLondonCTAdrift
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in San Juan. Clean, efficient, friendly staff. Wonderful (PRIVATE) pool and beach side amenities, loved the reef dock that lets you look at the fish in the ocean both during the day and at night, also loved the bird and fish sanctuary in the center courtyard. Everytime I stepped out onto our deck I had to pinch myself that I was not dreaming. We stayed in the Tower, it was quiet and modern, fellow members of our group in the main building had complaints. We were there during Valentines week, it was all couples and business travelers, the mood was relaxed but by Presidents Day weekend lots of families were checking in the tension level was rising and the pool area kaotic. Location is perfect for bus or taxi trips into Old San Juan or a walk across the causeway bridge to the casinos in Condado. The staff did a wonderful job on catering the meals for our group when we dined at the hotel. My only complaint would be that the gardeners start using power equipment at 7 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great surroundings”
Reviews.Author: DocRock27
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Caribe Hilton before our Puerto Rico Cruise vacation in Feb 2012 and wish we had stayed longer. Arrived by Taxis from the airport (Puerto Rico is divided in zones, fare $21 dollars up to 6 people in a taxis/ van, plus $1 per large suitcase). Staff was very friendly and organized. Kingsize room was clean and bed very comfortable. Poolside bar, Beach "beds" to work on your tan. I enjoyed the hammocks under the palm trees. Pina coladas were amazing. Going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “One night Pre-Cruise stay - very belated review, travelled Sept 2010”
Reviews.Author: SunSunP
Reviews.Content: Firstly I am well overdue in writing this review! I stayed here as a pre-cruise hotel, on Sat 11th Sept 2010. Travelled with family consisting of - Mum, Dad (mid-late 50s), Brother (23yrs) & me (28yrs): Transfer from the airport was fairly painless, drivers were waiting at the luggage collection point. It was about 10-15 min ride, very smooth on the motorway, down to the port area. We got to our hotel 'Caribe Hilton' about 9pm, and the first thing you notice is that the lobby is open spaced & bathed in pretty blue light - nice touch for weary travellers! Check-in was quite busy despite the time of night; seemed quite a few cruise passengers we checking in. Service was swift, but front desk staff seemed indifferent & devoid of any real welcome or warmth... We made our own way to our room - there was a bell boy service for those that wished to use it. Our rooms were a decent size & spotlessly clean - we were on the 15th floor which allowed for amazing views of the private beach, the sea/coastline & lake/bay area - this is what makes this location! As there really isn't much else to looks at... We had two lovely double beds, tea/coffee facilities, built in wardrobes, seating area with a flat screen tv & a desk area. Had a nice size bathroom with crab tree & Evelyn goodies, walk-in shower with two types of head - one massive one attached to the celling and another more standard one on the wall- water pressure was ok - expected it to be more powerfull. we were too tired and hungry to really appreciate or explore the area, we weren't missing much since there wasn't really anything nearby - a pretty lake/bay - but no bars/entertainment. And besides, after nearly 12hrs travelling, we could not be bothered to take a taxi to Old San Juan; plus we had torrential (albiet warm) rain within half hour of our arrival, so that further put us off going anywhere. Decided to just grab something to eat & then chill in the lobby area/oasis bar for a while. We ate in the PiÃ±a Colada Club, attached to the Honours towers - decent latino based food, watered down & wasn't spicy AT ALL - didn't have time to check out the Steakhouse Morton's, but it seemed that non-guests can also make reservations there & come quite dressed up... I woke up early to catch the sunrise over the beautiful grounds - it was worth it! The tropical garden, sun deck, cabana's, hammocks, pool area and beach are amazingly peaceful and empty at 6am so you can really explore & enjoy without anyone else there, only me & a few keen joggers. By 7:30-8am it started to come to life a bit. Note about the beach - there is two sides to the 'coastline' one side is rocky & a bit rough but it's not easily accessible to guests, there is a old fort there as well so makes for good scenic pics. The other half, is a small but nicely sectioned off & therefore makes for a calm, still water, sandy beach - yes, good enuff to build sandcastles!!! There were plenty of loungers available even at 11am. The hammocks were a quirky addition - I had a giggle with some random american chicks when we were all trying (not to elegantly) to get in them! The cabana's were nicely set apart from the beach, but close enough to all amenities, these are charged per day ($90) - good cross-breeze... Tropical gardens are very small & are situated out the back near the childrens pool, cool peacocks, lovely flowers & a lil pond area, got some nice pics. By the lobby there is a parrot cage - lovely birds, good temperment & caged was being cleaned out; they weren't there upon check-in so assume they only come out for the daytime. Met the rest of the family for breakfast in the Palmeras Restaurant - think this is the main restaurant. Nice views over looking the main pool & beach. All four of us had the buffet breakfast, that was a bit pricey $26 !!! Was just ok, usual fare to be honest, my dad said the coffee was amazing! It was puerto rican, but can't remember the name of it though... Had to leave the hotel quite early as we needed to get to the port & officially start our cruise. Shame really, as would have liked to have seen what the spa was like. Overall Caribe Hilton was a lovely stay, a beautiful, compact hotel & the staff were pleasant enough. However whilst I found it to be an asthetically pleasing hotel to stop at for one night, given the lack of entertainment (not even a singer or piano?) & the prices - I would be less inclined to stay there for a full two wk vacation, as I know I'd probably get bored! And realistically could find something with more variety, that's more holiday orientated & just as lush for the prices they were charging - I mean come on for $595 for a night & $26 for breakfast! Really?!? All I can say is I was extremely glad it was part of our cruise package! Read my full review for Serenade of the Seas (Royal caribbean) at: http://www.cruisecritic.co.uk/memberreviews/memberreview.cfm?EntryID=72795

Reviews.Title: “Private beach resort. No need to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Chitownee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights over winter holiday. Pros: - secluded beach - free umbrellas, chairs and tables - they put up rock barrier to calm the water a bit as it approaches our area of the beach which is safer for kids who want to swim - rooms were surprisingly quiet and we were right next to the elevator! - kid-friendly - nice pools - used the breakfast coupons (for DIamond members) at Starbucks and got many more food items than had we eaten at the buffet -movie theater for kid movies and adult movies -Subway is within walking distance from the hotel - they also serve individual small pizzas which was good for kids and cheaper than hotel food. Cons: - expensive mediocre food (but that's what we get for staying at a Hilton) - not many healthy food choices for kids - Starbucks' line is ridiculously long and if they run out of something, they might be out for several days while waiting for their next shipment We would stay here again. The rooms were clean, the place was clean, and overall a really pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CBandMM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to boarding our cruise. We arrived in the evening after a long flight and the reception area was chilled and the staff very helpful, check in was very easy. The bar area was very pleasent and we had a few drinks before heading up to our rooms, we also ordered a pizza which was lovely. The rooms were very nice, the bed was massive and very cozy. The bathroom was very spacious and the shower was brillient - it was a walk in with side jets etc. In the morning the lobby area was a lovely place to chill out with the tropical parrots in the centre which we thought was a lovely idea and it certainly entertained all the children around. There is a starbucks in the reception area which has a great choice of breakfast items, we were not B&B so this was ideal for us. Some of our party had a walk to the nearest shops for their breakfast which was about a 20-25 min walk. The pool area was very nice and the pool looked lovely - we never got time to use the pool with us catching the ship. But we did chill out on the terrace area with a jug of Sangria which was lovely. The gym facility at the hotel was excellent. Lots of equipment (cardio and weights), very organised and fresh towels on entrance. My mums case didn't appear when we got to the airport on arrival, everyones worst nightmare. However the staff at the airport were very helpful and ensured us that it would be on the next flight 2 hours later. The hotel were informed of this and that the case would be coming to them in an organised taxi from the airport. In the morning when we woke we had a telephone call from recpetion to inform us that the case had arrived and that it had been kept with them securly over night so that they didn't call and wake us during the night. Over all we were very impressed with this hotel and we would have been happy if we were staying here for longer. Nice decor, very clean and modern. It was a great way to start our holiday! We travelled with a party of 6 adults and every one of us had the same review of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: EPawlicki
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week on business in PR, and stayed at the Caribe Hilton. I hadn't been there in ten years, and I'm sure glad I returned. First, the room/resort spaces values were amazing. Not that my room was luxurious, but it was pleasant, and clean, and with a great view of the ocean. The hotel lobby/hanging out and pool/beach areas are very nice, and actually my favorite parts of the hotel. The location is perfect - a 20 minute walk to either Old San Juan or El Condado, depending your mood. Pina Colada restaurant was superior - and no surprise since I heard it was owned by the same chef of wonderful Agua Viva and Dragonfly (both in Old Town). Staff super too. Highly recommend for both business or pleasure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Long way to go for a one nighter”
Reviews.Author: Parpot
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on our way to our cruise for one night on Saturday 4th February, room great, hotel very busy & noisey on the Saturday night, drinks very expensive, great location though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: NYDina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights prior to and a day following a cruise. It can be a busy place, but it's big and accomodating. The waterview rooms can be either lagoon or ocean. The grounds are nice. Terrific food at Coladas. Be sure to ask for a quiet room. Some of the rooms are better maintained, nicer than others, The waterview rooms can be either lagoon or ocean so inquire if you book here. If you want true oceanview, ask which rooms are best for that (Though the lagoon was quite nice!) Pools were nice. Beach was small but adequate. Staff was very accomodating! I could see they are well trained and aim to please. All in all, a nice stay for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for pre and post cruise”
Reviews.Author: Cmp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for one night before a cruise, flying from the UK and getting to the hotel early evening. We stayed again after the cruise for two nights that enabled us to get on the BA flight schedule again. I had read varying reviews of this hotel and therefore had an open mind as to what to expect. I found in general the staff helpful, They provided early check in on asking when we came off the cruise ship and provided late check out when we had an evening flight back to the UK. The room was comfortable and not as noisy as I had expected from other reviews. The restaurants were a little indifferent. The Italian I would not bother with again. They are trying to be Italian however the evening we went they really could not be bothered and the food was not of a high standard. Mortons is typical Morton's steakhouse, expensive but good quality. Lemongrass restaurant was a good standard but overpriced in my opinion. Breakfasts were of reasonable quality but quite pricy for what you got. The beach bar/ restaurant was Ok but nothing special. Overall a good hotel for transiting between cruise ships and flights however not somewhere I would actively stay at for a full holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...old hotel”
Reviews.Author: wlbskb
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for the Caribe and asked for an upgrade. Since there is a language barrier I thought the desk help said there were none available. So when I got a room in the attached property of the "Villas" and found it to be old, in need of paint and far from the rest of the property, I thought since I didnt get upgraded I wouldnt complain. Then when the bill came I found out that it was an upgraded room with the charge for it. I called to complain that this was not what I would call an upgraded room, but they said I had initialed the check in paper so therefore the charge would stand. When I ask to talk to a manager , they said one would call me back, but never did. So I overpaid for an old tired room, with an ocean view if you leaned out over the balcony. I would have rather stayed in a lower priced room in the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton ever been too...should have been Crap-ibe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: s199056003
Reviews.Content: We had a room in the tower. We left after one day. Disgusting. Breakfast was horrible - cold. Drink order was all messed up. We checked out early and moved to the Ritz. We ran into another couple that had also checked out. I am a Diamond Member and still think this is a big joke. This is NOT a 4 star hotel. What a joke !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort; pricey food”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTravelere
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful resort with a private beach that allowed you to feel secluded from the hustle and bustle of San Juan. It's within walking distance of Old San Juan. The newly renovated bathrooms in the tower are beautiful and the lush landscaping is tropical heaven. The staff is truly welcoming and helpful. However, there were never enough chairs/loungers for all the guests -- although they had many, many loungers stacked up and locked against the retaining wall. I was there during a holiday weekend, and they should have had more loungers out for the guests since the resort was full. The food is very pricey ... I walked to the Subway across the street for a lunchtime sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: JulieOhio
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. The rooms were very nice, though they were going under construction which made for a few restless nights of sleep. The restaurants on site were very good. I highly recommend the Italian restaurant/Rotisserie Il Giardino. Their Oasis lounge was also great and the staff/bartenders there were very friendly. The pool area was great, the beach area ok, but had a dock with lots of lounge area! We would recommend this resort and would love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there on a vacation. We wanted to go on vacation but at the time my husband did not have a passport so we had to settle with Puerto Rico. The one really negative thing about it is that it was not all inclusive. We had to pay for every meal and it was a hassle. The beach is rather small. There is only a portion of the hotel that is accessible to the beach although the hotel is surrounded by the ocean which is very pretty to look at but inaccessible. If you are on one of the top floors, you can have a great view of the beach. The food was okay. My husband and I ended up going to the store a block away and getting food for lunch so we wouldn't have to pay hotel prices. There is also a Subway down the street. We spent good money on dinner but figured we could do away we a cheap and light lunch. The hotel is only a bus ride ( or if you feel up to it about a 2-3 mile walk) away from down town San Juan which was great. If you are into exploring the city and going shopping it is the place to be. They also have authentic Puerto Rican restaurants and supermarkets downtown. The tropical gardens are beautiful and so are the birds. We had dinner at the sushi restaurant there and it was EXCEPTIONAL. It was by far the best sushi dinner I have ever had. I was there in August 2008( not 2011, the calendar does not go back that far) and my husband and I still talk about that dinner. It was rather expensive but everything about it was amazing( the food, the service, the location). I can't recall the name of the restaurant but it is the only sushi restaurant on the hotel grounds and it is located by the gardens. Overall, it was a good time. I was looking for something different and more secluded but that doesn't make this a bad hotel. If you are going to San Juan, this is the place to stay but don't expect a luxurious, totally relaxing, fun Caribbean vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of Ocean from Room”
Reviews.Author: RaynelQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton Dec 12 thru Dec 15, 2011 and had a terrific time. The food at the resturants are expensive but there is a Subway around the corner that cooks breakfast on a hot plate. Also the trip to Old San Juan is not real expensive by taxi and you can catch the transit or even walk to old san Juan if you are in good health. I'm 69 and I did it. The Oceanside view from the main building was terrific. I believe room 840. The other side is OK but not as great. The weather was great. Low 70's at night, low 80's during the day. We slept with the sliding glass open and listened to the Ocean 24/7. Many conventions are held at the hotel and the ex-president of the Dominican republic was there having a breakfast to kick off his re-election bid thursday morning..

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless you are attending a conference that is paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Sunsnowfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property as part of a conference and extended our stay for a few days afterwards. Service was acceptable during the conference, but once the conference was over the staff was clearly changed to their second tier staff. Service deteriorated to below average and became unacceptable. Below is a list of issues with this hotel and why we would choose not to return: 1. Although the pool looks nice on pictures and in reality, the fact remains that it is freezing cold! 2. Wireless internet is only available in the lobby. 3. Internet access in your room costs $ 8 per day and is extremely slow..not business friendly. 4. Business center is rarely staffed. 5. Although there is a beach it is small. Thank heavens the ocean is warmer than the pool! 6. Breakfast buffet at Palmeras is extremely slow, as the hostesses seem to be working at a snails pace. On weekends there can be dozens of empty, set tables, yet there is a 20 minute wait for you to be seated! Food is good, especially the made to order omelettes.What you are charged for breakfast seems to be based on a magic eightball, since every day I was charged something different, despite the same people going and eating the same things! 7. Household service is inconsistent: one day they replace your in room coffee, the next day they replace your shampoos, but no day is ever the same consistent service. 8. There is a Starbucks, be prepared to wait as this one must be in the guiness book of records for world's slowest Starbucks! 9. The concierge is quiet arrogant and does not offer many alternatives beyond the rather pricey menu of bus tours they have on their list. 10. Security? Is there any? The open plan of the lobby allows anyone to wander onto the property at any time, so if you have kids, keep an eye on them at all times! 11. The property is located in an isolated area and there are no stores within walking distance. You'd have to take a taxi everywhere, including old San Juan. 12. There is a small airport nearby and small charter planes start taking off right over the hotel beginning at 6am! Thank heavens for tropical drinks...the Atlantico Pool bar has an offer whereby you buy a shaker with whatever tropical drink you want for around $22 the first time. You keep the shaker and bring it back to the bar for refills that are $16 and fill about four 16 ounce glasses. They may count on patrons having a couple of these to help them forget about the poor service at this property. And last but not least, they do claim to have invented the first Pina Colada which has caused a feud with a restaurant called Barrachina, in old San Juan. Apparently the same bartender, don Ramon Portas Mingot, worked at both places back in 1963. Having done a tast test of both in the same evening, we concluded that both recipes have since diverged significantly and personally we preferred the version at Barrachina.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous surroundings poor service and local information”
Reviews.Author: Lesley Caroline... G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton as part of the pre/post cruise experience we had with Royal Caribbean through the aforementioned company. We paid extra for the after cruise stay as the hotel looked fabulous on-line and it did not disappoint in reality. However we were disappointed by the service which for such a big name (and price) was poor. We arrived after 17 hours travelling time and were directed, rather than personally escorted to our room, having to carry our own luggage. That would have been OK if the room numbers were correctly or logically arranged, ok perhaps we were suffering from sleep deprivation but they didn't look any clearer when we were fully compus mentus! Oh and then we were woken at 7am after 4 hours sleep for a mistaken alarm call with no apology. The concierge was also only interested in offering advice if it involved booking a pre-arranged tour or a taxi but if we asked how to do it ourselves a map was roughly shoved in our hands and we were summarily dismissed. Everywhere was "10 minutes by taxi" whereas in reality many places were within walking distance and public transport is good, cheap (sometimes free)and reliable. Just because you want to treat yourselves to a lovely hotel after a hard year's work does not mean you are rich enough to throw your money around. Think we'll backpack next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VerySatisfied02
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton has the best location of all the hotels we saw and the staff are all friendly and provide outstanding service. I wish we could have stayed longer but next time we will. The hotel is very close to historic Old San Juan and it also has a nice clean beach if you want to hang out. I was also pleased to find their were several options for dining and drinking. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The oldest but still among the best.”
Reviews.Author: mayumi007
Reviews.Content: I stayed twive at the Caribe Hilton both before and after doing La Vuelta PR 2012 a 375 mile 3 day bike ride around Puerto Rico.Both times despite high volume of group business check in was easy the rooms were both comfortable and well appointed. The staff were efficient and helpfull. The beach and pool area are great. Two negatives,I believe that the room rate of the hotel should cover all asects of your stay so the habit in Puerto Rico of adding an additional resort tax/charge I think is wrong. The restaurants in the hotel are only so so with the exception of Starbucks in the lobby which was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: businessTraveller301
Reviews.Content: This property and the staff are a first class operation. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The location is superb, the hotel is extremely clean, great rooms/suites, the showers are amazing, very nice restaurant. They also have onsite shops selling many touristy gifts. I would definitely stay again. There were also many kids activities available too.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place - but cleaning staff has to be better trained”
Reviews.Author: zilbuzack
Reviews.Content: The hotel has different environments, all very nice. You have the small, quaint private beach to one side and a quiet place in the back where the Japanese restaurant is located (forgot the name of it) The food in that restaurant is something else - delicious and very different from any Japanese food I've ever eaten. The chef is a true artist. There are little birds walking around lose in that part of the hotel and the sounds of crickets. The rooms are okay. Mine faced a very nice green area. I had a problem with the floor as I walked in - I almost slipped badly a couple of times. When I called to let management know they told me all the floors were like that. The next day when they noticed how many towels I had placed on the floor they dried it and I never had that problem again during my stay. An elderly person could have had a big problem if they slipped on the wet floor. The cleaning staff has no idea about the meaning of towels on the floor in the bathroom (which means you want them replaced, at least in the US) and would hang the dirty towels back on the racks. But the hotel deserves four stars because the location is absolutely gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Caribe”
Reviews.Author: hkb2012
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at the Caribe. We were impressed with the property and enjoyed our stay. Everything was clean and fresh. The staff was always pleasant and went out of their way to be sure their guest were happy. Kudos to the management for staffing the right people and offering great service. Love it and we will be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but has potential to be so much more”
Reviews.Author: hugz415
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Caribe Hilton for five nights. We are frequent Hilton customers so we were looking forward to this highly recommended resort. The resort is beautiful, but a little off the mark in some aspects. 1) Room: we stayed in the Hilton Honors Tower and had an ocean view. The room was smallish but modern and seemed clean. We had a small balcony as well. The bathroom was pretty spacious and nice. There was construction noise from the parking garage each morning but it wasn't overwhelming. It would be much more annoying on a lower floor I imagine. Oh and the pillows are giant. As in, if you sleep on only one pillow you will wake up with a stiff neck. I am normally a 2 pillow girl, but these were kinda ridiculous! My husband had the same issue. 2) Pool area: The pool area is huge. There are plenty of umbrellas and lounges. The lounge chairs are not the most comfortable though. My biggest complaint is that the pool was freezing. We had nice weather, about eighty degrees, but the only people in the pool were little children because it was too cold. More people were swimming in the ocean than in the pool. 3) Service: Now this is where they really need to focus. My husband and I sat down at the pool one afternoon for lunch around 1pm. No one came to take our order until 2pm. The food we got was just ok. My husband had a chicken sandwich and I had the shrimp skewers. The shrimp skewers were over cooked and very dry. They were served with "garlic bread" which was wonder bread with garlic butter on it. We each had 2 drinks and the total before tip was over $100. I understand paying resort prices, but for the quality we really felt like we were getting ripped off. The drinks at the pool are $12 each. If they were fancy tropical cocktails, fine. But they taste like they are mostly sour mix and don't have much alcohol in them. The second day we found out they have shakers available for $22 and you can refill them for sixteen dollars. You get about 4 drinks in each so that is a pretty good deal. 4) Location: I will give them great points for location. The view is beautiful and the resort is close to the airport and Old San Juan for touring. I am fine paying the resort prices if you feel you are getting a value and are being taken care of while on vacation. I didn't get that vibe here. Not alot of smiles or hellos from the staff, with one exception. Arlene, at the pool was very nice. She waited on us our second day and was the one who told us about the shaker special. She was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishing badly!”
Reviews.Author: JeanneOx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this property in January before taking a cruise. We thought we'd be safe booking a Hilton Hotel, but were terribly disappointed. The grounds were nice, but the rooms were worse than a one star property. The carpets looked ancient and worn; the paint around the door frames was all chipped; the furniture in the room looked like it was 50 yrs old and all nicked; and the room had a very musty odor. The buffet breakfast was very poor quality and overpriced. We definitely would not stay there again and would not recommend it to anyone, even if the price was considerably less than the $300 per night we paid.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Mount Kisco, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place in Puerto RIco”
Reviews.Author: Alan M
Reviews.Content: I go to Puerto Rico often and if possible I will always stay at the Caribe Hilton. From the tropical feel of the lobby to the tremendous staff who always recognize me and go out of their way to make sure I'm happy it is my favorite place on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: CielitoToronto
Reviews.Content: the Caribe Hilton is a wonderful place to spend a week of relaxing holiday. People see Puerto Rico as a place to start a cruise but it is a lot more than that. Caribe Hilton has a fabolous set up. the beach and the pools are just gorgeous, the customer service throught the hotel is second to none.The staff is trained to do all they can to make your stay relaxing and pleasant. The view from each room is magnificent, and all together, we had a wonderful holiday. The weather is ideal, warm but always a refreshing breeze, just perfect. We will definitely go back. M K

Reviews.Title: “Not burning on all cylinders”
Reviews.Author: chancellor9
Reviews.Content: My organization had a mid year meeting at the historical Caribe Hilton. The exterior of the property is well cared for. The staff is friendly. The gym is lovely. So some of the cylinders are firing. Here is where they miss - The rooms are very tired. They are not well cleaned. The banquet food is inedible. The ladies lockers havent been updated since the 1950's The spa charged first class prices but does not have first class amenities. There is no nightlife in the hotel so one must take a cab to other properties. I think management has to have conversation with itself and determine what kind of a hotel the Hilton wants to be - a first class convention property or a faded grand dame who's time has come and gone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Suntra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a different resort before, but I really enjoyed the Caribe Hilton. The overall environment was cheerful. There were quite a few people that you see in this hotel - I was told this was due to this hotel being a stop for Cruise passengers. The continental breakfast bar at the hotel was good, reasonable price of $10. The hotel was within a 30 minute walk to a fort and I enjoyed walking to the fort and looking around. There is a Morton Steakhouse next to the hotel - what I really liked was the state of the art gym, not the small (I have one too) types that you see otherwise. The resort I had stayed in before had a nice beach path - but this one did not. They had upgraded my room to a Suite and it was very nice. Thank you. The bed was soft and not firm as I liked it to be - I was sour the next day after a 10 hour door to door travel. They have peacocks and a swan in the garden. My room had a nice view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: DCMate
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! It has a nice baby pool, and then a pool with a bar. The food is OK at the pool and they have good service. Staff are friendly; specially the concierge staff. They helped us in making restaurant reservations, gave us ideas on where to go, and even tried to help me find a place that could sent a balloon arrangement to my mom who was also staying at the hotel. They say they have a game room for kids, however, we went twice to try to check it out and it was closed. I asked around and was given different reasons of why it was not open (no electricity in the room, staff is out, etc). They have a playground that is nice. We found it by coincidence, so ask where is at if you want to check it out. The beach was OK; so if you have been to a really nice beach this one is not going to impress you at all! it is tiny, and more a lagoon that a beach. The view is very very nice though and you get chairs and an umbrella. The rooms are great. They are clean, new, comfortable and spacious. The bathrooms are great too. We went with our 1 year old daughter and there was plenty of room for the pack and play. I also liked their breakfast buffet. They have plenty of natural fruit juices, an egg/omelet station, and waffle station. The ambiance is nice since it has glass walls and you can see outside. They have a Morton's Rest. in the hotel, which was a plus for us since we love it, but if you want to eat more typical and less expensive food you can go to a little cafe they have (I forgot the name). Of course, there are plenty of awesome food options outside the hotel all over PR. Overall, I recommend this hotel and the location worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service - PLEASE Read My Review!”
Reviews.Author: CandymanOfOldForge
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay at this hotel because it had decent reviews and was semi close to the port. Check-in was easy and the young lady behind the counter was pleasant, but it all goes downhill from there. We booked 2 rooms and were sent over to the Villas. It was a VERY looooong walk for my elderly mother down several corridors, up a steep ramp, then onto the elevator.(While on the elevator with the bell, ironically the power went out as we were approaching our floor and it was a little scarry to be on a stuck elevator in between floors. Luckily, the generator kicked in and we continued our way to the rooms.) The rooms were clean and nicely appointed. ( For 238.00 a night plus all the taxes, it should be!) Upon check out, we called for the bell 5 times, (yes, 5 times) and waited MORE than an hour, but no bell came to help us with our luggage. So, I went into the "Employees Only" door on our floor and took the luggage cart and brought down our suit cases myself! We waited in the lobby of the Villas for MORE than an hour for a cab to take us to the port. I asked a passing bell why noone came to help us, he stated there are only 6 bells for the ENTIRE hotel, and everybody was leaving all at once. He went on to tell me that it is like this every single Sunday, due to all the cruise ship passengers wanting to leave the hotel and get on board. He seemed as frustrated as we did. There was an email from Caribe Hilton when I got home from their survey department. I filled out the survey and actually received a phone call from management who appologized for bad service and told me the manager of the Villas would be calling me the next day because he happen to be off when this person called. I never did recieve that call from the Villas manager. On my next trip to San Juan, I will certainly look else where for our accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nathan493
Reviews.Content: Had a great vacation here! The employees were friendly and helpful, the property was beautiful, and the place was filled with fun. There were fun activities for the kids, some of which even the adults had fun doing like they're daily game of bingo. The beach was beautiful, the pool was stunning and the hot tub was to die for. We had one minor problem during the whole stay, somebody had ordered drinks at the bar, and had it charged to our room. This was right away straightened out and I have no complaints. We will for sure be back very soon! - The Cohen Family

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Attitudes Destroy a Hilton Resort”
Reviews.Author: winemac
Reviews.Content: The employees at this Hilton have the worst attitudes and are the rudest individuals I have ever met at a vacation location! Our misfortune started with arrival at around 2:30 on Jan 15 for check-in. The surly woman at the front desk remarked that our room wouldn't be ready until 4PM, gave us a note card to that effect, then said "next". There was no apology, no suggestion to have a drink at the bar, hold our luggage, page us, or a smile. And she, like most employees at this Hilton, did not have a name tag. Not wanting to start our vacation on the wrong foot, we pulled our suitcases down the stairs (yes stairs!) to the bar. After sitting at a table for 15 minutes with no service, I got up to get some drinks at the bar. Immediately a bar server ran over and said "Relax, I'm coming." So I sat down... and waited another 15 minutes for this man with another bad attitude to come back. When he did, he didn't say anything but just stared at us. I asked for 2 beers, he said what kind, I replied the local Medalla, he said they were out, I asked what was available, he said only Light. This was ridiculous! Why not tell the customer you only have this one beer? We finally got our beers, watched the NFL playoff game, and then returned to the counter at 4:30. Another front desk employee (again no name tag), said the room still wasn't ready because they were understaffed. Again, no apology, no effort to help us with luggage and nothing was offered to us. My wife, who is normally the calm one, got quite agitated and asked what he was going to do for us. He replied, "Nothing." At this point she said as an HHonors Gold member she had never had such poor service and if check-in time is 4 then that was Hilton Caribe's problem not ours. They should have had more cleaning staff available to clean rooms, especially since this was MLK long weekend and the hotel was booked for several groups, including my wife's Annual Company Meeting. He stood there with a blank stare and again said nothing else nor offered us anything. She asked if we could at least get some free drinks for our trouble. After mumbling about needing manager's approval and walking to the back area, he finally returned and gave us 2 drink tickets remarking that we should check back in an hour. We returned to the bar and waited another hour. At 5:30 we went back to the front desk. The original front desk employee informed us our room was finally ready. My wife asked if the upgrade she requested as HHonors Gold for a newer renovated room was available. The desk clerk said that we were in a standard room. â€œWhat about the request?â€�, asked my wife. Again, he gave us a blank stare and no comment. So despite waiting 3 hours for a room, the hotel was giving us a standard, old room that anyone could get just checking in. We reserved our rooms over 6 months in advance! The other clerk said he had a renovated room in the Tower. Thank goodness! I asked if it was renovated and he replied it was. As the desk clerk was giving us the keys, my wife remarked that at least we got a new room. Incredibly, the other desk clerk said, â€œOh, this room isnâ€™t new. It was renovated 2 years ago!â€� Are you kidding me? We were referring to the recently renovated rooms like we requested!! My wife demanded to speak to the manager at this point. The desk clerk said he was unavailable, so we asked that he call us when he was. We never received a call or message or apology from any Hilton Caribe employee. Only Marisol, who I believe is an assistant manager, was pleasant to us when we told her our experience the next morning at breakfast. She asked us how things were going so that the Hilton Caribe could improve their service. Unfortunately, our comments must not have gone any further than her clipboard. Our room, #2065, was old and dated, with construction flaws, plastic counters, an old non-HD TV, and tired furnishings and linens. Pictures are attached so you can judge for yourself. This was a bit of a rant, but it comes after a week of no action from Hilton. My wife called and explained our experience to Hilton HHonors customer service, who said someone from the Hilton Caribe would contact us with resolution. We received a poorly written response, full of misspellings, telling us our next time would be personally guaranteed to be better. Next time? Thereâ€™s not going to be a next time! And of course the next stay would be better â€“ how could it be worse? One last thing, Hiram the bartender was the only other employee at this Hilton who smiled and gave us excellent service. Every other employee failed to provide the basic courtesy of acknowledging guests with a simple greeting, much less a smile. The Hilton Caribe has failed to provide the expected level of service their organization advertises and prides itself on, and will not be in our travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous View”
Reviews.Author: Mdenz455
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Beautiful pool area and grounds.Resort restaurants are very expensive and nothing special, find off location restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “NICE SAFE ATmosphere for single mom traveling with children....everything in one spot.”
Reviews.Author: ladyfsu
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to San Juan. My princess loved staying at the Hilton than Disney World. That says a lot. She is six. The private beach was her favorite and does not close early. The oceanview from the hotel room was amazing. I could also see Old San Juan. Food was not as expensive as others say. Drinks were great. THe folks at Morton made my birthday special. Staff was pleasant. I ask many questions. Subway is not far at all if you want a cheaper meal. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: SPman00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton twice on each end of a cruise. The hotel generally met Hilton standards, we were in the older building once and the Hhonors Floor during the other stay. The taller tower had a much nicer room, while the older building closer to the water had a better view. We had the full breakfast once and the continental the second time. I would highly recommend the continental, it is one of the best spreads I've seen at a full Hilton that also serves a full breakfast. The pool area and beach had plenty of chairs and umbrellas and the staff left everyone alone (as opposed to trying to sell drinks every five minutes). The food and drinks seemed expensive, even for a Hilton resort, but there's a Subway at the entrance for a quick lunch. Don't forget to save a little bit of bread to throw off the end of the pier, there's ton of fish and its good entertainment. Overall, the place seemed like a nice place to stay for a couple days or to have a conference, but there's not enough there for a week long vacation. Its a solid Hilton property that meets expectations. One note: Old San Juan is walkable from here, but it is 1.75 miles each way (per my Garmin watch)

Reviews.Title: “Beware Diamond Members”
Reviews.Author: kiwi2061
Reviews.Content: This was by far my worst experience as a Hilton Diamond Member. I was given a Dirty old run down room. There is no Concierge lounge... The free breakfast did not even compare to a Motel 6 Continental. Don't bother upgrading the $6 to the Hot breakfast as that is total crap also. They have the Diamond members shuffled off to a separate room for the free breakfast. I think it might be left overs from the other restaurant that charges a obscene chuck of money for breakfast... As Diamond members we spend many a night to earn this so I don't see why we need to be thrusted over to some little hole in the wall... This place truly sucks... It should have had one star but the surroundings were ok... Oh and the $10 beers don't taste any better than $5 beers from a normal priced Hotel.... I would avoid this place at all costs....

Reviews.Title: “Best beach in San Juan. The value ends there.”
Reviews.Author: tjjohnsto
Reviews.Content: Like most hotels of this type apart from the room you are nickel and dimed to death. The food at every resturant is below average or average and for breakfast at Palmeras buffet it's $23.00/pp. not worth it at all. We stayed in a King ocean view balcony. Our room was in the HHonors Tower which is old and run down. The view is partial ocean view and partial city which is not what we paid for. If you wish to drink down by the beach prepare to pay 8.00 for a single beer and 10.50 for a PiÃ±a Colada which are far from the best on the island. Also there is no in room wireless and wired Internet runs you 14.95/day unless your are gold or diamond HHonors member. Wireless is free in the lobby only. One thing I will say is the staff are very kind and helpful. We would stay again but if the beach did not exist this hotel has nothing going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Misty K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel before our cruise. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. They were also very helpful to educate us on things to do around town and places for dinner. We really liked people watching and relaxing in the lobby area. Our room was above average on the 8th floor. It was clean, quiet, and average compared to nice hotels in the states. The view was pretty and we were pleased. Service is very good at the front desk. At the bar restaurant is was ok. Service was horrible in the Palmeras and would not recommend it. The beach is smaller but nice. This hotel is very close to the cruise ship ports but is further from the airport than some other hotels. We would go back and definitely stay here again. We stayed at the El San Juan and hated it, per my other review.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie I
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here more than once and every time we visit we love it. Its a beautiful hotel with a great pool and great ocean views. On our last trip we discovered the liquor store across the street which was helpful. I don't think there is a a bad room in this hotel and the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton? Really?”
Reviews.Author: Kay71
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the middle of the night, the receptionist couldn't find our reservation and after a few searches on the computer he said: sorry, there is no reservation under any of your names - and he looked at us as to say: go find a room somewhere else!! I had the voucher and the reservation number and asked him to search again, and after a few minutes he found it â€“ they had misspelled the name.... no apologies though... The room (and bathroom) was OK, worn-out but fairly clean. Housekeeping was good (although it took 3 days to fix the remote for the TV), the room was ice cold, we turned the A/C off but there was a cold draft from the corridor. Restaurants: DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT go to Il Giardino - I have only 3 words for this: horrible, horrible, horrible... (both staff and food). Don't waste your time or money! Starbucks: long lines most of the day, but nice staff. Morton's Steakhouse: good food, good wine and very good service. A tip: for breakfast and/or lunch - there's a Subway 200 yards from the hotel entrance... nice staff :) Beach/pool area was OK, but looked VERY different from the hotel photos on their web site, fitness room was a pleasant surprise: good equipment, very nice staff (no a/c though, so it could a bit warm if crowded). When you book a room at Hilton, you have certain expectations and unfortunately none of ours were met. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a little dated but you can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: ETinSLC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one fo the best location in San Juan! THe beach and pool area are very nice. The hotel overall is a little dated but the room interiors are typical Hilton quality. Food was quite expensive. I would stay here again if staying for just a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “A suggestion”
Reviews.Author: NYC2007
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3. visit at Caribe Hilton. A great place for kids but the place really lacks a nice restaurant with a view. Yes, they have an Italian restaurant with good food but no table clothes and no view. The service is nice but with no windows to outside, you feel like sitting in someone's basement. And then there is the steakhouse but who wants to eat steaks in the tropics. The only restaurant with a beautiful view of the sea, palm trees and sunset ONLY SERVES BREAKFAST and is closed 18 hrs a day. If you want to have a nice and relaxing dinner on your Caribbean vacation, you have to go to (any) of the other beach hotels. SUGGESTION: Why not convert your pleasant and airy breakfast restaurant to a full scale restaurant with breakfast, lunch and dinner. Let it serve the kind of menu that we tourists from up North expect and wish to have on our Caribbean vacations! Place a few tables outside on the lawn and you will make even more money!

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton San Juan”
Reviews.Author: BigotesCalgary
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed with my stay at this hotel! Room's fixtures were old, worn and broken. Service was deplorable. Construction taking place during our stay was very annoying. Elevator security was not working. Overall attitude was poor. Very liitle value received for the extremely expensive price. Nice beach area but again service and food quality was poor and overpriced. I feel that we were treated poorly and with little respect. Condacending attitude is not appreciated! I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone. We will not stay at any Hilton chain hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: Agree with other negative reviews regarding cleanliness/appearance of rooms. The property itself is beautiful and we did enjoy our 1 day stay prior to departing on a cruise. The pool area and beach are quite nice, food at the on-site Italian restaurant was pretty good - our only option for dinner as Morton's and other close restaurants/bars were closed due to 3 Kings Holiday. Sandwiches from the snack/pool bar at the pool were also pretty good but pricey as would be expected at a resort. The 15-20 minute walk along the oceanside to Old San Juan was nice and enjoyed tour of Castillo de San CristÃ³bal fort - another 15 minute walk would get you to Fort San Felipe del Morro.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in the world is home but if I can't be there then Hilton Caribe is where I want to be.”
Reviews.Author: Matt P
Reviews.Content: I travel the whole world for work. I love Puerto Rico. I love San Juan. I love Caribe Hilton. But what should take 2 minutes takes 20 minutes in PR. If someone says they'll meet you in an hour they really mean maybe sometime today. Maybe. Unfortunately the Caribe Hilton is no different in this regard. So what would be a 5 star all the way around becomes 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim R
Reviews.Content: We loved the open lobby and large room. All kinds of activities are available and one of the best locations. The staff was mostly very friendly and helpful. One waiter at the Pina Colada was obviously having a bad day with very slow service. The breakfast restaurant is fabulous with great food options and very friendly and helpful staff. The Lemon Grass was a notch below first rate but the staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. The furniture in our room was showing wear but the bed was very comfortable. The AC quit and required a new filter that looked like it had not been changed in months. Getting wifi was very confusing and not available in the rooms. Only ethernet and $8 per day at that. The hotel needs to update their policy and wifi availability in rooms. Overall it was a positive experience for us and we will probably return but the hotel needs to tighten up a bit and upgrade its wifi policy.

Reviews.Title: “"Grand Old Lady" but”
Reviews.Author: aggietraveler76
Reviews.Content: First the good. Morton's steak house is excellent. the beach and pool are great except only one hot tub was working. the lobby is a nice area and the bar is typical. The concierge team was helpful but lacked some info on a few of the tours. comfortable bed. Now, the bad. the hallways on our room floor were dingy and dirty. Our room has been "remodeled" but looked to be only half finished. no trim on the sink just a cut out hole. shelves stapled together and workmanship shoddy. they did not clean well and i had to ask for the patio doors to be cleaned so we could see the view. we were on the 4th floor and there was a wedding on the 2nd. the noise was unbearable until 3 a.m. the desk said they sent security but to no avail. other than Mortons the resturants are bad and Starbucks is your only option. there is free wi-fi in the lobby so it is full all the time. the paid internet in the room has to go. i will say this, Paris Hilton would not stay here. i would but only if i could get different accomodations. the food thing can be overcome by going to town but that is a nice 2 mile walk or 12.00 cab ride. hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Improved service. Beautiful pool and beach. Ask for the Main Building rooms.”
Reviews.Author: FayeJ42
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that I have stayed here and I was pleasantly surprised on this visit. The check in process was smooth, efficient and fast (In the past it was VERY slow). Service throughout our visit was excellent. The Hilton Caribe gets mixed results for its room quality and I have finally figured out why. In the past we were in the tower and the rooms there were older and the AC struggled to keep our room cool. One room we had a musty smell. On this visit we were in the main building. Ironically, I think the main building is actually older than the tower, but the rooms are definitely more modern and nicer. We had a fabulous view of the ocean and pool. The room was clean and perfect. The highlight of this hotel is its pool and beach area. They have a large protected area so that one can swim in the ocean without getting in the intense Atlantic surf. The pools and hot tubs are large and clean. There are plenty of beach chairs. At night off their pier the sharks sometimes congregate and itâ€™s fun to watch. The hotelâ€™s location is good because you can walk to Old San Juan in about 20 minutes. You also have access to the restaurants on Condado by short walk. The fitness center is open 6 am to 10 pm and it has several cardio machines and weight machines. It is well-equipped and the machines are modern and well-maintained. They add a 15% resort fee to the bill which I found distasteful. Itâ€™s not optional so why not just include it in the room charge up front? However, this is a standard practice in PR and we have learned to expect it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time here.”
Reviews.Author: AnneinNewton
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful property. Feed the fish at the pier, the iguanas that roam around the grassy areas, and the koi and pheasants which live in their lagoon area. Take the free yoga, pilates and water aerobic classes (one of these is offered every day but Sunday), lie in the hammocks, take a float out in their sheltered private beach area, or swim in the beautiful pools... Have lunch steps from the ocean, at the outside grill, and then at 5-7pm it is happy hour with nice rum drinks for $5.oo each. I also loved my view from the balcony of the main building on the 8th floor. The room was clean and nice. (Not stunning perhaps, but perfectly fine.)
