Many people have said the tower is best but this older part of the hotel was closer to the ocean and we liked that. Leo, one of the concierges, was very helpful with ideas for restaurants. We had some great meals in various parts of the city. (Aqua Viva was my favorite). Things I would change: The jacuzzi did not get warm enough. The Starbucks should not be the only place to get a light breakfast here. Also, because two buildings nearby to the hotel are not occupied now, the area is a little isolated and walking around at night is not advisable unfortunately. **However, you can easily walk the 2 miles during the day to the Old San Juan area. Stop into the two forts you pass on the way-(they close at 6pm), and consider buying a kite for $2.00 at the Morro fort which we really enjoyed flying-even without kids!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice pool, nice beach, great mohitos, but near zip and food awful”
Reviews.Author: travel4lifenow
Reviews.Content: For a quick family vacation with college kids, one loved the sun and the other loved the drinks, so all were happy...until we tried to eat. Food on this island does not include fresh fish, a great disappointment. The hotel was what we expected: clean, decent sized recently renovated rooms with balconies, nice pool, private beach with snorkeling, pool side restaurant (expensive), nice bar for drinks before dinner. The Christmas music was still playing constantly in the lobby 2 weeks post holiday. Not really walkable to any restaurants and those in the hotel are poor. But, the room rate was excellent. If we go to the island again, we will pay more for rooms and stay closer to the eastern end of the island where the action is!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: MM57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for four nights during Christmas week. We knew the hotel was going to be crowded, but we were just looking to have a relaxing family vacation. Overall, we had a very good time. First, everybody we met from the staff to desk clerks, waiters in their restaurants to people handing out towels was very polite and tried to be helpful. I kept waiting to run into some worker who might be stressed out about the busy week, but it at least didn't happen to us. So kudos to the Caribe for high marks for their service. Other positives are the very nice beach and pool, the health club was good, and overall the restaurants were very good. The Lemongass was one of the best Aisan restaurants I have had dinner at. The looby was decent but nothing special; I mention this because one of the negatives is that the hotel only has Wifi in the lobby, so you see a lot of chairs taken up by people with laptops and iPads. Maybe they do this only during Christmas week, but I could have done without the afternoon musical performances there which were more noise than pleasant tunes. I read some reviews where the rooms were not in good shape, but ours was fine. Nothing special, and expectations would have been higher based on the price, but we had no problems with it, and the bed was very comfortable. The only other issue we had, and this may also have been attributable to it being the week we were there, but when we checked in, the room our older children were staying in did not have the bed arrangement we requested and that the hotel said they would give us. The hotel said they would change it, but couldn't until the second day due to being booked until then. This was frustrating as we thought this had been resolved when we booked the trip. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Dorwin”
Reviews.Author: Dorwin C
Reviews.Content: It took about an hour to check in. The person behind the desk was not allowed to make any decisions on his own. One elevator was broken. I had to have maintenance come and fix the inoperable air conditioning. We decided to go to the Spa and although they had three, none of them had hot water in them. All this for only $300.00 per night. The surrounding grounds were vary picturesque.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and expensive Hilton with a nice beach and a huge pool.”
Reviews.Author: malenky
Reviews.Content: It is a family oriented hotel, fairly self-efficient with a nice private beach and huge pool; the outside facilities - the beach, the pools, and the gardens - are beautiful and well-maintained. Not much around the hotel, unless you have a car or a cab fare to get away to either Old San Juan, or Condado, or Isla Verde â€“ there are a lot of very good restaurants in greater San Juan. The prices at Caribe Hilton are a bit high, however this is the Caribbean and higher prices at resorts are common. The staff is helpful and accommodating, but slow to provide service â€“ better with those who require tipping for their services. Lunch food is mediocre and is geared to kids â€“ French fries, hot dog, chicken tenders, burger, wrap, pizza, etc. All items are well over $10 but come with a few green leafs and FF or chips or more greens with dressing. Breakfast selections are huge, hours are from early to late but in a number of years Iâ€™ve seen the more expensive items being removed and become a la carte. Current buffet price is around $22. The room was very tired; cabinet doors donâ€™t close, the bathroom needs re-grouting, the carpet is old and worn. Bathroom is a bit younger and ok in size. Rooms need a good cleaning and a paint job but do have flat screen LCD TVs. My biggest problem is with A/C unit. It is either ON or OFF, thermostat doesnâ€™t work correctly. We stayed in the hotel 4 times in 2011 and 3 out of those 4 times the thermostat in the various rooms didnâ€™t work â€“ room temperature was either 69 degrees with A/C on and set at 74 degrees or it was 78 degrees in the room with the A/C off. Ocean view is great, but the sound of it on the beach-view side is drowned out by constant and very loud noise of air conditioning units 8 floors below â€“ on the lobby roof.

Reviews.Title: “Many thanks for a great vacation, especially many thanks to Marisol!”
Reviews.Author: Inger O
Reviews.Content: We had a great vacation at the Caribe Hotel partly thanks to a fantastic service from the personnel at the hotel, but especially from Miss Marisol at the Breakfast Buffee who where absolutely fantastic and gave us very valuable information which saved us a great deal of money. That is the kind of service and information you like as a customer. The hotel is situated very beautifully and we would love to come back. Ciao from the Oscarsson family from Sweden.

Reviews.Title: “Great location just steps to Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: gs07jas
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most popular hotels in Puerto Rico...More than 20 years old. Hotel have gone through many renovations. Resort type hotel where you will find many amenities including a private beach and access to a spanish fortress. If you want to visit Old San Juan this is one of the best hotels to stay in because of the location and the many things you can do. Hotel has many restaurants, including the great Morton's Steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ladycapt
Reviews.Content: Over priced/dumpy/needs a paint job- and re-do/and it's situated in a bad area. Way way over priced- 25.00 (usd) per person for a breakfast buffet? They're kidding? Walk 2 minutes from the hotel and have breakfast at the Subway- for 10.00 for 2- freshly made omelets with vegetables and coffee and you'll also get to view the really cruddy/run down area the hotel neighborhood is in. Abandoned buildings, trash---everywhere----not a garbage can in sight -so just toss it on the ground and walk away. Nice. Frankly Puerto Rico is really on the way down and I'm sad, because I really like PR-and I like the people and have been the several times-but in 1 year-it's really declined. Apparently 20,000 municipal workers were let go Jan. 2011--and it shows all around. The place has major political corruption. Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: johnkoehn
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at the Caribe Hilton with my wife and our 8 month-old daughter. We were excited for our first family vacation and had splurged to stay at the Hilton Resort because we expected it to be a clean and elegant hotel. Unfortunately we did not find this to be the case. The outside facilities - the beach, the pools, and the gardens - are wonderful. They are beautiful and well-maintained. We had a great time playing at the beach. I wish I could say the same about our rooms. The first night we stayed in a dingy, old room that would have been outdated in the 1990's. While it did have an ocean view, there was a parking garage right between. When our daughter crawled on the floor, her hands were immediately filthy with grime. We complained about the room immediately and asked to be moved but we were informed the hotel was fully booked. We could request again tomorrow, and they sent someone up to vacuum the room. The next day we again inquired about moving and were told we could move that day at 6pm. When we finally moved (we had to move our own things after waiting hours for someone to assist) we found our new room cleaner, but equally inelegant. The view was improved (over the garden now) and the tile floors were not grimy, so we were happy about the change. We found the walls to be horribly thin, with even moderate conversations from our neighbors echoing through our room. Passersby in the hall made noise at all hours of the night. Normally this would not annoy me very much, but with my infant daughter trying to sleep in the crib it made me very frustrated. In general we found the staff to be helpful and accommodating, but slow to provide service. We were very disappointed by the overpriced, nickle-and-dime atmosphere. We expected prices at the resort to be steep but were surprised to find them as astronomical as they were. The night before our departure, we called the front desk to request a late checkout so our daughter could nap in the room before we left. We were told we would need to call back the next day. Puzzling, but we agreed. The next morning we called and again requested a late checkout. We were told it would be an additional $80 for two extra hours in the room. We were stunned! Never before had we been charged for a late checkout. But this is consistent with the way the hotel operates, constantly reaching for your wallet. The bottom line is that I would not stay there again, even if it were half the price. It was not a good place to stay with children and it was not the elegant, fun place I had hoped it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: osufoot
Reviews.Content: For those who say the prices are a bit high ... you're right. However this is the Caribbean and higher prices at resorts are the norm at resorts. My massage at the spa was great, but it lacked the usual amenities at spas (i.e. razors, cologne, etc.). And it's a spa ... where's the hot tub??? And what's up with getting just one towel? Speaking of hot tubs ... the one by the pool did not work. There was a sign saying it will be fixed on Monday. I think that sign has been there for several Mondays. The facilities are nice. Check out the gardens. The beach is small, but clean with plenty of lounge chairs for everyone. The staff does lack a friendly attitude (especially the black woman who works in the gift shop) that you'd find at Ritz or Hyatt. The piÃ±a colada club restaurant is not worth the trip inside. You couldn't do room charges, the service was slow, and they were out of most of the deserts on the menu for the week we stayed. However, this hotel is where the piÃ±a colada was invented ... so that's pretty cool. We had a great time and I would not hesitate to stay there again. We met someone who has been vacationing there every year for the past 30 years, so that tells you about the quality of the hotel. To the management ... it is madding to me that the maids kept leaving the glass in the room above the refigerator. I know it's picking but leave the glasses in the bathroom. Some of us do actually brush our teeth and take medication, lol.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: M-LOhio
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton after a cruise and wish we would have stayed longer. The grounds and facility is great and the view of the ocean with the breeze was awesome. We will come back

Reviews.Title: “Xmas Week”
Reviews.Author: howard26
Reviews.Content: If you want to save $ on drinks, walk 10 steps across street and get your beer/wine/rum at one of the little stores on the street. Hotel drinks are very $$$!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: hurwitza
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at both the Marriott and Caribe Hilton before and after a cruise, respectively. I will include the same review for both, since it seems appropriate for comparison purposes. The Marriott is closer to Condado and the central action therein. This includes restaurants, Walgreens, and Starbucks. The Hilton, on the other hand, is at the outer limits of Condado and requires a good walk to get to Old San Juan or the rest of Condado. This said, as a hotel/resort, the Caribe Hilton is head and shoulder above the Marriott. The latter is worn and dated, with the exception of the lobby. The casino at the Marriott is not particularly niceâ€”more like a low-grade Vegas joint. The Hilton feels more like a tropical resort with itâ€™s open-air lobby, large pools, developed beach area, and multitude of dining options. The Hilton does not have a casino. I truly believe that the Marriott is WAY over-priced for what it currently offers. The Hilton is closer to a reasonable value. The staff at both properties are only partially helpful. We found most of the service in San Juan to be mediocre at best this trip. People were very disinterested in helping visitors. That was disappointing overall. Late checkout was a challenge at both hotelsâ€”Hilton charged me $75 to leave one of our 2 rooms at 3 PM, yet the other room was not cleaned until 2:30 PM. Itâ€™s a game with them. Be warnedâ€”if you are coming for New Yearâ€™s Eve, the Hilton hosts many parties and the restaurants are booked well-ahead. There is considerable hubbub from local residents attending the parties, so be preparedâ€¦.itâ€™s not really a family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “great for families, not incredibly service oriented”
Reviews.Author: Madgecat
Reviews.Content: we loved our week here and it was perfect for kids. Nice retro feel, not too many loud drunken or lecherous types in the lobby and bar area (drinks are too expensive for that). beautiful little garden area with peacocks nesting in the trees. Great beach, sand, pool (warning: no lifeguard in duty, and many unsupervised kids in pools). Close to old san juan which was nice. Good family vibe. Rooms are tired and it was LOUD, particularly on New Years' Eve. I'd definitely recommend eating out; breakfast is OK and the rest is kid food from what I can tell (to be honest we did go into town for dinner every night except one so I can't say anything about the in house restaurants. The Mortons on the property was very sub par, I must say) The big downside was what I would call the sort of sloppy service all around. Rooms were a bit tired and they could have been cleaner, much cleaner, and this was because they weren't properly cleaned every day. There was no eye contact, no greeting, from front desk staff. The greeter at the breakfast place was very friendly but the other waiters did somehow make you feel like you were in their way and several times staff members ran around us on stairs. There do seem to be some management issues. That said, this is a great family getaway and honestly the lack of genuine service orientation was a consistent issue with many places in San Juan. Perhaps that is the norm there, but somehow I doubt it. it doesn't seem to fit the vibe of the city. And if you go, expect to supervise your children in the pool and beach area because there are no lifeguards. That was fine for us because we went to spend time with them but many families might have differing expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas Vacation Trip was Great”
Reviews.Author: jett137
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in 2 rooms with great views. Rooms were large, very clean and comfortable with good amenities. Can't beat the location and the small but very nice beach. Lots of good sunning areas and beach service for chairs, umbrellas, drinks and food was great. Hotel restaurants had very good food but were a bit expensive. Frank at Il Giardino goes out of his way to make you feel welcome. Starbucks on premises was very convenient. Some nice shops and just a quick inexpensive cab ride to Old San Juan. Overall, if you are not watching your budget, this was a great family hotel. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property, but you need to heat the pools!”
Reviews.Author: LaylahG
Reviews.Content: There is no other property like the Caribe Hilton. It's private and beautiful. The staff was very helpful and service was excellent. Breakfast was good. Had the salmon with bagels, fresh OJ. Dined at the Italian restaurant...IL Giardino...these people will make you feel at home. Food was great, service was SUPERB! Try the salmon with the sauce on the side. Even the pizza they got for my child was great. Also went to PiÃ±a Colada Club...very nice place. Hubby watched Soccer game. Burger was huge! Really enjoyed the PiÃ±a Colada tasting hour by the pool. They even have a Starbucks on the lobby. A few pointers... 1) We got 2 full beds for the 3 of us...1 bed really small for two adults. Both got back pain from this. Try 2 queens or 1 king and a cot. 2) They really need to take advice from other Hiltons for children freebies. Our son was very disappointed. The bucket and the Frisbee were nice, but no free t-shirt or pizza or ice cream or water rental. These go a loong way with children and with their parents too ;-). 3) The pool was freezing. All guests (except 3, including my polar bear kid) were in the hot tub or at the beach. I manage to put 1 leg in, but it was too cold! Overall...this is a very nice property with excellent service and a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated and pricey, check your bill!”
Reviews.Author: hrme17
Reviews.Content: This is a good spot for families, no question, if you can handle the extras and the tired rooms. The good: The grounds are extensive and well kept, and you could easily spend a few days there without leaving (assuming you have a bottomless wallet to pay for the food and an iron stomach to eat it). The concierge and reception were very helpful. Our 2.5-year-old loved the pool and the goldfish pond. BUT (and there are a lot of buts) we were really put off by a few things. The "nickel and diming" got to be tedious. Almost every single meal charge we received had errors in favor of the hotel and we had to send the bill back, sometimes twice, to get it corrected. If this had happened once I'd write it off as a mistake, but it didn't. The food was mediocre at best, and the service slow and unreliable. Guests were running over to the nearby Subway, the only off-hotel food spot nearby, to get lunch, with good reason (the two inedible hot dogs we got at the poolside restaurant were $25!). In a city with such great culinary culture, it's a shame that this hotel is so isolated and has such bad food. The room decor was tired and hadn't been renovated in many years: cabinet doors didn't close, the bathroom grout needed redoing, the carpet was worn. Our ocean view was great, but the sound of the waves was drowned out by the sound of air conditioning mechanical units 5 floors below us (yes, they were that loud, and constant). The cleaning staff did very little during our stay. In general we just got a bad vibe here. There was no "we're happy you're here" feeling from the staff, they seemed more interested in making sure they got their tips. The hotel isn't that bad if you're not paying a lot, but considering the high price we paid for our stay, we've got to give it just 2 stars. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Djpoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week before New Years. We had numerous problems with our room key keeping its magnetic signature. Must have been to the desk 5 times to get new key cards. Food was way overpriced for similar fare at local eateries...not to mention prices of drinks at bars! If u have money to burn on 3-4 star experience, this is the place. Beware if u book through Expedia-we got crappy room first night and had to request "ocean view" room as stated in our reservation (rather than "behind the bar view").

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: prestonave
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Caribe Hilton and it met all of our expectations. We stayed 7 nights, two rooms, adjoining in the Hilton Honors Tower. The rooms were clean, the views awesome and beds very comfortable. The hotel has several restaurants but we tended to eat at restaurants in Old San Juan. The one restaurant that I would recommend in the hotel is Lemongrass. The others are expensive and the food is so so. We are not big fans of breakfast buffets, overly priced and food not that good, so we tended to get something from Starbucks. Expect to pay premium prices for all food and drink purchased on premises. It is a resort hotel so you pay resort prices. The one issue I had with Lemongrass was that they told me when we made a reservation that they had a strict dress code, which was not a problem. However it's not enforced. The four of us were dressed nicely while other patrons looked like they just came off the beach, tee shirts and shorts. If the restaurant has a dress code enforce it or get rid of it. The other thing we like about the hotel was that it was close to Old San Juan where there are a number of great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: krram
Reviews.Content: We booked somewhat last minute for the high season, and were very lucky to get a reasonable rate at the Hilton. It has it's own little beach, five restaurants, and a spa, so someone could never leave if they chose! That said, it's central to Old San Juan and Condado, so very easy to get cabs. Don't let the concierge tell you it's walkable to the Old City; it's at least 45 minutes and not the most scenic (it's about a $12-$15 cab ride, depending on your driver). The room was fantastic; we had an ocean view balcony. Everything was well maintained, and the property is green and lush, as opposed to some other hotels we saw while we were there. I would highly recommend this for families and people looking for a relaxing time in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: jgs_shs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Puerto Rico for his Birthday this December and had an amazing time. Overall the people of San Juan were warm and welcoming, and the food was great. All of the staff that we encountered at the Hilton property were also wonderful. They were very helpful and attentive and assisted with all of our requests/questions. The property is beautiful; sitting on a little bay with ocean views all around. Yes, the drinks and food were a little more expensive at the hotel; but keep in mind that it is a beach resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice private beach in PR, close to airport and Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: linzlegacy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton over Thanksgiving and found the resort to be great! The beach was private and had a nice swimming/snorkeling area, the sand was soft and a sparkeling gold in color. There is a main pool area and also a suite pool area for guests staying in the Lagoon suites. The main pool bar was great, Hiram the bartender was wonderful and will keep you entertained. He is always sharing a smile and a laugh with the guests, he is a top notch bartender! We stayed in the Lagoon suite which was a small studio, our view was of the lagoon area so if you want the oceanfront view your best bet is to book a room in the tower as this will give you a great view. All of the restaurants at the resort were very good, we didn't have a bad meal anywhere. The service was also excellent, everyone was friendly and willing to help when we had questions for the staff. The hotel is close to Old San Juan and there is a bike trail that you can actually walk to reach the town, it is approximately a 30-35 minute walk but you can always take a cab back to the hotel if you'd like. We had a great time at this resort and in PR!

Reviews.Title: “Good but for the nickel and diming”
Reviews.Author: cda008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a convention in early July 2011. The room was clean and the view of a fort and water was spectacular. The employees were always pleasant, and the grounds very well kept. There were hammocks near the beach that we were able to use once; however they were taken down the rest of our stay which was kind of a bummer. Once for a wedding (understandable), but the other three days there seemed to be no reason for them to remain down. Anyway - the private beach and protected swimming area was wonderful and clean. We snorkeled a few times and enjoyed it. The reason for 4 "dots" instead of 5 is the nickel and diming the resort does. This aspect comes in if you want an umbrella or snorkel gear or, well, anything but a towel. The food was fine; however pricey for what it was (and we're foodies, so not very picky at all). The hotel is in a good location, so keeping the above in mind we would still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reesee
Reviews.Content: We came to Caribe b/c we were in town for a wedding, didn't want to rent a car, but still wanted to be close enough to get to San Juan and/or the airport w/o taxi issues. All our taxi rides were about $20- even to the wedding in puerto nuevo. The hotel is out of this world beautiful. We were first issued a garden side room w/ a terrace leading out to a peacock filled tropical garden w/ two coy ponds accompanied by swans (black and white), ducks, and just beautiful scenary. We had an issue w/ the plumbing and the hotel responded immediately by switching our room to the main building, and bumping us to an ocean view...even then, we were offered the room, to see if it met our expectations b4 it was assigned to us....YES it met, and exceeded....room 1032 is awesome.. quiet, and has an ocean view, w/ terrace..it was lovely. I enjoyed the beach, the clear water, the tropical fish, which we snorkeled around, and then fed off of the pier. We hung out literally in the hammocks by moonlight and on lazy afternoons, and swam in the 3 tier infinity pools. What's not to say, i loved our stay! We also really enjoyed our dinner at the italian restaurant onsite, Il Giardino. We had the hanger steak, flan, and literally the best coffee, i think i ever had. If u are in PR and want to be close enough to town to walk (about 30 minutes), and not need a rental, this is a great option. I believe u could do excertions w/ them as well, but our stay was too short to really consider that.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Pool Area Nice, Very Noisy AC”
Reviews.Author: JRobertSo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in nice property and the beach is secluded and the pool area nice. Most of the visitors end up spending a lot of time to find and get to their rooms since they mostly are far away from the entrance area. Personnel is quite helpful but not to normal European/US Hilton standard. Concierge tries to get you do your researches/requests by yourself. The receptio folks are polite but somhow indifferent toward the customer. The most expensive breakfast is certainly very nice and service there excellent. The room was spacious but the ventilation system was so noisy that it was clearly hearable even with earplugs on. Spectacular view from the window. Local small plane airport is close and the planes start to take off at around 7 in the morning. May also disturb since the fly practically straight in front of your balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Thanksgiving Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Caribbean_D
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying that I have stayed at other resort hotels in Puerto Rico and I have to say that the Caribe Hilton has earned my repeat business. On Thanksgiving day we arrived at the hotel and were greeted right away and checked in to our balcony ocean view room immediately. What a great deal on the room, it was half of other places we had looked at in the old San Juan area and I truly feel it excided my expectations. Dinner at the Pina Colada club was fantastic, nothing like a gourmet turkey dinner to set the mood and the drinks were a wonderful delight. With a view of the ocean and the harbor from our room and the great breakfast buffet in the lobby to get the day going even better. Three days of wonderful service, great staff and a wonderful beach was more than I could have as for. I will be back soon. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is really nice, but there is a staff problem!”
Reviews.Author: Philie4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed (my partner and I in 1 room and a friend in a second room) for 6 nights, after a southern Carribbean cruise in this hotel. The lobby is really nice and spacious. The pool area is lovely and there are Iguanas walking around. The view is very nice and the area is clean. The water in the pool should, in my opinion, be slightly warmer. The room was really nice and well furnished but we had an awfull view on a couple of trees and an old air-conditionning building. Our friend was a couple of floors higher is still had the same view. We had problems with our room door which would not open a couple of times. They had to come and fix it. The restaurants are over-priced and the food is just not that good. In our rate, breakfast was included, but we still had to leave a tip (they were not happy when we didn't leave 1 the first day) so 15% on 21$, times 3 persons, times 6 days was about 60$. Since it was included I can not understand that. And it was a buffet so they didn't have to serve anything anyway... You have to put a card on your bed if you want the sheets changed, we did that twice, but they never changed the sheets. The room was not well cleaned. We took part in one of the hotel's bingo, it was meant to start at 2pm, the person in charge of it only arrived at 2:45 pm. On our last day, we left our luggage with the bell man, he told us we had to pay 1$ per bag (I think he said that to make sure he gets a tip) and we told him it was included in the resort fee, we would have given him 1$ per bag as a tip if he didn't try to make us pay as a fixed charge. The spa is really good and we had a great time there, but again, the prices were way too high. Everyday, there is a Pina Colada tasting, but don't be fooled, there is no alcohol in it... (That's not a Pina Colada to me). In the end, I would say that the hotel is really good exept for it's staff and the views from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short term stay”
Reviews.Author: thecraigs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of nights before and one night after a cruise. This hotel is ideally placed for access to both the port and the airport. Whilst you could walk to town it is in my opinion just a little too far in the heat. The room was lovely and the bathroom spacious. The bed and pillows were some of the comfiest I have had on holiday. The walls are quite thin and I did get wakened up at 7am by the conversations through in the next room. The bar and staff in the bar are wonderful as is the breakfast. Whilst the usual signs are in the bathroom about being eco friendly for washing towels etc, and they have a lovely conservation area for animals and fish, I find it confusing that they serve food from the pool bar in disposable polystyrene cartons and they have disposable cups in the room for the coffee maker. A little contradictory. The location of the hotel on the beach, the pools and the layout of the grounds make this an ideal short stay but I think it is too remote for me to spend a longer time here. We ate out in old San Juan where there is a good selection of pubs and restaurants. I cannot comment on the other restaurants in the hotel as I did not try them out although I did try the bar snacks and found them pretty bland and basic. As mentioned in previous reviews the only free wifi available is in the hotel lobby. In this day when you can experience this facility in small coffee shops, I do think it time that hotels rolled this out as standard in all rooms. This would definitely be a plus for us when choosing a location to stay. To sum it up a nice, comfortable hotel spread over a wide area with nice facilities that could be better with the addition of a few small extras.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: C1MorePlace
Reviews.Content: Welcome to Paradise! We stayed here the night before and after our cruise. The staff and grounds are wonderful and well kept. The building and rooms are in good shape - we would definitely stay at the Caribe again. Drinks and food were very pricey here, but that is almost expected in this area. You need a taxi to get to the Old San Juan and the cruise terminal. It takes about 20 minutes to get to the airport (without traffic or a road race). Bring your mask and snorkel for the swimming area, there are quite a few fish that they feed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for San Juan business trip”
Reviews.Author: Jordan1201
Reviews.Content: I say "Very Good" for San Juan...I'd say "Average" for the Caribbean. Pros: Private beach Large pool area Good Bars (they claim the Pina Colada was invinted at the lobby bar here) Mortons Steakhouse adjacent to the hotel Starbucks in the lobby Convinient (by car) to Old San Juan, Isla Grande Airport, Condado and Hato Rey Good rates (Corporate rate is $139/nt) Cons: Some rooms are a little tired. Some rooms are a little noisy Very few offsite shops/restaurants, bars, etc. within walking distance I am biased towards Hiltons due to their rewards program, but this is my first choice for San Juan hotels when traveling on business due to the access to highways and business districts. It is resort style hotel, but serves all purposes as a business hotel...and when staying in the Caribbean, why not stay on the water and feel like you're at a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Landscaping and Location, Just One Problem”
Reviews.Author: DF920
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14-month-old daughter and I just returned from a week-long stay at the Caribe Hilton. We enjoyed our vacation. The lobby was pretty and open and the hotel grounds were gorgeous. We loved relaxing by, and swimming in, the pools and ocean and talking walks to Old San Juan and the Condado. Our room was pretty standard, though it had a nicely-styled bathroom, a balcony and a beautiful ocean view. We found service at the Caribe to be decent except for one instance that made an otherwise fantastic trip simply very good. When we arrived to the hotel at the beginning of our trip, the staff member who checked us in was clipped in her delivery and did not go over any amenities with us or any details at all regarding our stay. We were simply given two sets of keys and left completely on our own to figure out everything we needed to know. When it came time to check out, eight days later, my husband questioned why the two breakfasts we ate at The Palmeras restaurant did not show up on our bill. Well, it turned out the breakfast buffet which typically cost $23/person (and free for babies) was free for our entire stay, yet no one told us!!! This was a major snafu in an otherwise wonderful vacation. Because meals were pricey, we usually just had Starbucks or granola bars for breakfast and our daughter ate jarred baby food. On the two days we enjoyed the breakfast buffet at The Palmeras, we had delicious omelets and oatmeal, fresh fruit and pastries, fresh-squeezed juices, lovely cheeses, bacon, sausage, french toast, pancakes and yogurts and our baby could eat as much as she liked! When we found out we could have been enjoying this breakfast each day of our eight-day stay because it was included in our vacation package, we were so disappointed! So, so disappointed! We had to make two trips to Walgreens over the course of our vacation to get our baby more jarred baby food because we just couldn't find enough fresh and soft food she could eat (like bananas, yogurt, oatmeal, cheese and eggs). She could have eaten these things each day if someone had just told us what we were entitled to as part of our package! When we asked the staff about this issue at our check out, they apologized and comped the "extras" we had charged to our room, drinks by the pool and a pool float for our baby totaling $50. But that would have been worth just one breakfast we were entitled to, not the additional five breakfasts which would have cost $250 more. It just mostly saddens me that our baby could have been eating the kinds of foods she eats at home during our stay if someone had taken the time to properly inform us.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better.”
Reviews.Author: Vickie86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our Royal Caribbean cruise. The employees were all very nice and helpful. We did encounter a slow check-in, but the open air lobby is lovely and the view to the ocean is wonderful. We stayed in a lagoon view room with a small kitchenette. i believe the room was newly remodeled or this section is new, but, we had a few issues. The room was difficult to find and we seemed to be in a maze of hallways and outdoor spaces to reach our room. When we arrived at our room and opened the door there was an overwhelming smell of mildew or something. I do not have any type of allergies, but, if someone was forced to stay in this room that had allergies I would hope the hotel would be able to accomodate them and give them a different room. We immediately asked for another room because of the smell and we were promised an ocean view ( not a lagoon view ) room. we were told that the hotel was booked to capacity. Oh well..one night won't kill anyone! The location is not the best if you want to walk arouond to find a bar or restaurant to go to. For dinner the one night we were there, we ate at a small bar in the hotel called Pina Coladas-the bartender was super and recommened several items on the menu that were local. The food was fine...nothing outstanding. In the morning, we got coffee at the Starbucks in the lobby and we walked over to an adjacent park and then grabbed a quick sandwich at a Subway around the block from the hotel before we left for the port. The pool area and sandy beach area are quite beautiful and the grounds were very nice, but, with all the hotels in the area and the price we paid for our one night stay, I feel there are probably much better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Business Travel and Short Stays”
Reviews.Author: Barry S
Reviews.Content: I like this place. Have stayed there twice on business. Very convenient to just about everything and the view of the water is great from many of the rooms and from the main breakfast restaurant. Rooms are well done and the hotel is quiet. Good selection of restaurants for breakfast. I have not yet tried their restaurants for dinner as there is so much to choose from in old San Juan. There is even a Starbucks on the hotel property. Very convenient to old San Juan and all of the attractions there. The hotel even has portions of the old fortifications adjacent to it. Not sure if I would want to stay for a long vacation - but for business or for a day or two before a cruise or such -- you couldn't do any better. One small complaint -- there is no wifi in the rooms -- for a business traveler, this is a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Post Cruise Hangout”
Reviews.Author: blockhouse
Reviews.Content: We choose to get a "day room" at the Caribe Hilton while we waited for flights out after a cruise. It was a great spot! We arrived by 8am and although our room was not ready, we were able to sit out by the pool and many took advantage of the hammocks. We sat around the beach, did some snorkeling and generally relaxed. The location is great and amenities very nice. The room was perfect and gave us a spot to shower and get organized before flying home.

Reviews.Title: “The Villas: a far cry from your private lagoon”
Reviews.Author: Chase71
Reviews.Content: Be careful when considering staying here for your San Juan visit. As others have pointed out the Caribe is in an isolated location which to the hotel's favor leaves guests with only hotel property dining and drinking options along with and their very high prices. This visit I tried the newer "Villas". The king was a small room with a crampt bathroom. And with the Caribe having no nearby shops, eateries or really anything else the kitchen is pointless. Don't let the website advertising hype fool you: the Villas are just another building with different style rooms from the main hotel.. There are much better options in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for pre/post cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: PinkyB69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton after our 7 day cruise with Carnival. The hotel had all the amenities a family needs including a Starbucks in the lobby. The pool area was a bit over crowded but the man made beach is perfect for watching your kids as they do water sports/activities. There's loads of things to do while at the hotel. For a cheap taxi ride you find yourself in the center of Old San Juan where you can shop, and dine at any number of restaurants or tourist shops. The hotel was clean and the rooms were a nice size. Room service is way over priced. The bar restaurants near the pool have basic chicken fingers and fries; again over priced. The check out was painful since they held money on two cards even when I paid cash at check out. Overall, the resort grounds make up for any short comings of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Try someplace else”
Reviews.Author: mo1279
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel a lot, and I very rarely leave a negative review. i am a pretty forgiving vacationer. However, I would not recommend staying at the Caribe Hilton. To keep everything fair - I've listed out some of the pros first: 1. Great pools, nice landscaping, there is a smaller sandy beach that would be good for young kids. Also, there is an outdoor area with peacocks, coy fish, swans, ect. My daughter loved this. 2. The bed was nice and the bathroom was spacious. 3. There were a number of nice restaurants on the property. 4. Rooms were clean. The cons: 1. They overbooked the hotel the week we were staying there and the situation was poorly managed. In fact, I would go as far to say that it was a bit shady. My husband and I did not know until we walked into our room and noticed that our bed was a fold out couch that we had been downgraded. In the Hilton's defense - we ended up getting a credit for our first nights stay - but keep in mind - this didn't happen until AFTER we said something, and even then it was an argument. 2. VERY pricey - E.g. $22 for a 10 in pizza, or $15 for a hamburger. or $20 for a 'warm' continential breakfast, etc.And, you are a captive audience there - the only food walking distance really is subway. Everything else you have to take a taxi to get there. 3. Rooms weren't great. Broad interpretation of the description 'balcony' and 'ocean view'...Our balcony was about 2 ft out. And - our 'ocean view' was really a view of the lagoon, which is really isn't a view at all. Regardless, we weren't impressed. Also, lights wouldn't work, fan wasn't working, and the internet connection wouldn't work. 4. Poor/inconsisent service at times. E.g., waited about 45 min to eat at one of the restaurants (we were already seated) and waited about 20 min for 2 drinks in the lobby. (service in pool area was always nice). 5. !Poor location in San Juan! - unless you are renting a car - stay downtown in Old San Juan. Or around Isla Verde. The Caribe is isolated and everything is at least a $10 taxi. We drove around our last day in San Juan and decided we had picked wrong. Initally - we picked Caribe because we have a 2 yr old. We liked the idea of the small beach she could play on, the pools, the playground on the property, etc. In reality, she didn't care, and if we had at least stayed in old san jaun - it would have been easier to explore in the evenings. Other comments: - PR was great. Go to old San Juan at night. Visit the forts. Go to the rainforest, it was worth the drive.Eat at Raices. - Don't rent at the Hertz on site at the hotel. Go to the Allied car rental across the street. It's half as much. Also, they will give you a free shuttle to the airport if you drop the car off at the airport location. Hope this helps someone! If you are already staying there, you will be fine. It's not an awful hotel. i just wouldn't stay there again and feel there are probably a number of better options.

Reviews.Title: “a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: gio044
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in april 2011, 3 days before a cruise and three days after. The price is fairly high, and i came to learn that Puerto Rico hotels charge a resort fee on top of the room rate. With everything in, the room we thought was going to be $199.00 turned out to be closer to $300.00 per night. The room was decent enough nothing great nothing bad. As many of the reviews have stated, we did not have house keeping on our first day. I called the front desk a cpl of times. I think you have to be very aggressive and demand that your room be cleaned. The restaurants were extremely expensive, although the food at the Lemongrass was exceptional. The rest of the restaurants were very basic. Good fitness facilities. The spa seamed more like an old hospital then a spa, very institutional, not a relaxing feel at all. The Pool and beach areas however were amazing. If you are coming for a sunny vacation, this can more than make up for some of the other issues we had with the hotel. Great beach and swimming area. Pool was crystal clean with los of seating and lounge chairs available.

Reviews.Title: “top marks for the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: drewbobs78
Reviews.Content: Like i said in the title, top marks all round for this Hotel. I got a very reasonably priced room with balcony looking over the private beach area and sea. The room itself was excellent, very clean, spacious and the bed was amazingly comfy. My wife and I stayed here when we came back from a cruise and the hotel delivered exactly what we were looking for which was a chill out couple of days before we returned back to Scotland. The hotels facilities are sensational, with a choice of relazing on its own private beach area (protected from the sea if its rough by a rock breaker) or by any one of three pool areas complete with pool bar and hot tubs. The staff were all very friendly and would go out of their way to help. We went to bio bay organised by the tours team who delivered a great trip for us. I like to try and give a balanced view but am struggling to come up with negatives - if i must and they are small points - there is no milk in the rooms just powdered cream which turns a black coffee into a very dark brown coffee (there is however a starbucks on site) and the hotel is a fair walk away from any of the bars and restaurants in Old San Juan. This isnt really a problem though as only a very short taxi ride away. If you are looking for a hotel before and after a cruise i would do what we did and maybe stay somewhere with OSJ on your doorstep (we stayed in Sheraton OSJ) and then Caribe Hilton after cruise for a continuation of the excellent service and relaxation after the cruise. If i was to pick between the Caribe and Sheraton i would certainly pick the Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and cold”
Reviews.Author: Stuart C
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 11 days at the Caribe on business. On arrival at night and in the dark the place looked fantastic, but almost immediately I found the desk staff less than friendly. There appeared to be a problem with our room and there was a room change for a reason that I was never able to understand. When we found our room it was not what we expected and it took some time to sort out. We eventually had a room with balcony in the Condado lagoon villa part of the hotel which was good and reasonbly quiet. Colleagues in the main part of the hotel repoprted that they were less happy with their rooms and several had to change. There is no doudbt that the pool and beach facilities are excellent, however, the bars and restaurants are very expensive (for a brit anyway) and to top it all there was a substantial resort tax - whats all that about?? The Caribe is somewhat isolated and a good walk or pricey taxi ride are needed to get away from the hotel and into old san juan. In summary, a good place for a few days to unwind after a longhaul flight provided you have a decent room and can afford to eat! Otherwise ther is the whole of Puerto Rico out there to explore and old san juan itself is far more interesting with a selection of boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ArtAMiami
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now and each time I've found the hotel to be first class in the way that everyone from the front desk clerks to the waiters, bartenders and maids treated me. The grounds and rooms are spotless. The food and service in the hotel's restaurants is great. The only drawback is that is no casino on the premises, but if you're not a gambler, that should not matter and if you are, there are plenty of casinos on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Brenna2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton last week because it was the host hotel for the Divas Half-Marathon in San Juan. Overall, I was not impressed. On the positive side, the grounds were beautiful, especially the pool/beach area. The hotel has a nice lagoon for swimming that is blocked off from the rest of the ocean by rocks. There were plenty of chairs for laying out by the pool or beach. On the down side, the rooms had absolutely no insulation. We could hear every single word of every conversation around us. We even asked to move rooms and still had the same problem. This was a real issue for us as we had to get up at 4AM the morning of the race and didn't really get a good night's sleep. My other issue is the food -- when we did have to eat there, it was overpriced and not very good. Same goes for the drinks. If you stay here - don't eat here! Lastly - I noticed they added a maid's fee and a bellman fee to my bill. Turns out they notify you of this in small print when you check in - but given that we didn't use a bellman and the maid didn't even show up one of the days, I wasn't that pleased to pay it. Overall - just an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique place, Unique staff”
Reviews.Author: SusyPape
Reviews.Content: Hilton Tower magnificent view, quiet, comfort, spacious shower Hotel Caribe Hilton has a rare 60ies atmosphere very much Fleming flavor that immediately make you feel in a James Bond movie, but with updates standards. The only private beach of San Juan coast, the best Pina Colada in the planet. Besides the good food of the restaurants, the many activities offered every day, from Yoga morning sessions to Pilates to Sand Castles, organized in a discreet way, the point that make the difference of this hotel is the way the client is served: a customized service. Their kindness is truly genuine, their care to satisfy their hosts is taken is a serious way and you can feel it. You recognize a great hotel from a big hotel not when things are going smooth, but when something go wrong. In my personal case I hurt myself in the beach and immediately the Security staff appears and took care of me with competence and kindness. They kept taking care of my little injury since the day I left. In this respect a special thanks to Mr Hector Merced. During our stay, my husband and I anytime we asked for help or info or the many request a client during a long stay (almost two weeks) may have Hilton Staff attend with prompt efficiency and friendly smile. Highly recommended: Hilton standard with a family care.

Reviews.Title: “Resort style accommodations in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: talietravels
Reviews.Content: I've grown up staying at the Caribe Hilton and each time it continues to improve. Family friendly. Clean grounds and hotel rooms. Friendly staff. Beautiful pool / beach area with hammocks too. Food is your average raised price menu (I suggest visiting Old San Juan for traditional dishes at better cost). Quick taxi to OSJ ($12) or Condado, you can also walk the distance. I really have nothing bad to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Kat-thryn
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the Caribe Hilton and probably the best, actually. Typically we like to stay in Condos in Puerto Rico but we did discover a real jewel with something we did different this time. I highly would recommend the cooked to order buffet breakfast. Espresso bar, stunning views of Puerto Rican beach, they make a cooked to order breakfast and probably the best array of fruits and breakfast items that I have ever experienced. It was well worth the money to add it to the room, and believe that you can plan it w your itinerary even cheaper if in advance. Orlando, their employee at Palmera Restaurant gave us exceptional service. He offered great service even by the Puerto Rican standards which are way superior to most places in the U.S. We had such a wonderful breakfast and the best tasting papayas and mangoes ever....! Be aware that if you bring a car there is a daily parking fee. It is well worth getting off the plane and taking a cab for a couple of days from the airport just to avoid for a couple of first beach days. Tip: We got off the plane and the taxi prices are fixed. Don't even bother negotiating those. But if you find tourists like yourself standing outside waiting for a taxi, just discreetly ask them if they are also going to the Caribe Hilton. That is exactly what we did and instead of paying $25., we split the fare of $30. (they charge a flat rate and then add for each suitcase and person). Tourism is basically the main stream of income in Puerto Rico. Just accept that and make it work for you. Why not just stay at Caribe buy the great breakfast buffet, get a snack for lunch and then go to one of the restaurants there on site for dinner for your first few days? Restaurants are Morton's -wow wow- w shrimp alexander and check online for web specials as they do not mention them unless you do....-the other is an italian restaurant but I order Comida Criolla -basic churassco steak, habicuelas=beans and rice w avocado. yum. One thing to consider: Avoid at all costs the Hertz desk-we booked a full sized car and the snippy Neuyorican lady behind the counter insisted we keep the reservation and take a compact. What?! for a full sized price?? Sorry, but why would we do that? For a rental car the best price in San Juan these days is at the Enterprise place. Take a shuttle or taxi back to the airport. You'll be glad you did. The other rental agency is only for like a one day rental. Enterprise offers better week rates, and a much better selection. Bell Service was excellent, front desk efficient and the parrots on site are hilarious. Also there is a starbucks on site. You can go to the business center 24/7, or get internet in the lobby. If you are taking a cruise, this is the best place to go. Really. You just have to know these little tricks to make it your best vacation ever!

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel......great service and wonderful employees!

Reviews.Title: “What a monster hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: With everyone saying how great the hotel is because of the people I guess I was there the night they were all off. Check in They were bombarded when I arrived to check in but it still took them an hour to check in the 5 guests in front of me. This is totally unacceptable. It was so bad I write the hotel to complain to which I did receive an apology letter. Finding the room After I finally received my room key I was off to my room. Well little did I know the mumbled directions I was given by the front desk employee were worthless. It was something like go straight, turn right and you'll see a sign turn there and you room is ahead. That would have been sufficient if this place was huge. I ended up going back to the desk to get a map and I was not alone I saw at least 8 other people that were also lost trying to find their rooms. Room The room itself was fine. Standard Caribbean decor. Bathroom No problems even with hot water in the morning. Food There are no close restaurant to walk to so you are stuck at the hotel without taking an expensive cab ride (they are all expensive no matter how close). The food was OK and the beer was cold but it was VERY EXPENSIVE! I ended up paying like $30-35 for 2 beers and fish tacos. Price The price was not bad at all but it not really close to Old San Juan so you are going to pay $25 round trip for a cab from the hotel and back. I would rather stay close to Old San Juan and pay more a night. Overall I was very disappointed with this Hilton. I really got the impression no one really cared and everything was lip service to the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Steven G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a day at the Caribe Hilton on each side of our cruise. The check in was very easy. Dinner at Morton's was as good as any Morton's I've ever been to. The views from our room were spectacular. I can't imagine staying at another hotel when we return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “People make the difference”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip for a conference and there were several issues that came up in trying to provide excellent accomodations from my clients. Mildred at the front desk really did an excellent job of correcting any issues, satisfying my clients with accomodations. She also did an excellent job of follow up with me letting me know what was happening. In the Business Center, I had two occasions that required assistance. Lizeth, the attendant in the business center, also did an excellent job and was a terrific assistant. People make the difference and both these employees are valuable to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: David0509
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived a couple hours before the posted check in time, our rooms were ready and registration was smooth. Our room was clean and comfortable. At the time of our stay, a political convention was going on at the hotel. Even though there were bands playing in the lobby area, our room was quiet and sleeping was undisturbed. We ate at almost every venue at this hotel. Each time, we were greeted by a friendly host/hostess and the wait staff was very efficient and helpful. I especially enjoyed the beach and pool areas. They schedule plenty of activities to keep you busy, if that's what you want to do, however, we chose to just take it easy, enjoy the sun and rest. Thank you Caribe Hilton for making our stay very special

Reviews.Title: “Our 50th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Marcia K
Reviews.Content: We returned to the same hotel where we spent our honeymoon. We received outstanding treatment from the time our cab arrived in their driveway to the time our cab left four days later to return to the airport. The bellhop,the staff at the front desk and at the concierge desk treated us with exceptional courtesy and concern. The front office manager,Ms Judy Merlano was aware that we were celebrating a special anniversary and she made sure that our stay was exceptional from our beautiful room with a balcony overlooking the ocean, to our daily breakfast, to the champagne and fruit platter she sent to us ,to her warm and friendly daily conversations. Ms. Merlano deserves our special cudos.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe = great! Long overdue review.”
Reviews.Author: CarsonRSX
Reviews.Content: Ok...I have stayed at the Caribe Hilton three times over the years and this is my first review of the hotel. This review is going to be a culmination of my experiences....here we go... Where to begin?! I have stayed in all kinds of Hilton properties in different states and countries...and the Caribe is my favorite Hilton property thus far. There are tons of little perks, gems, and eye candy dispersed all throughout the property. This hotel has everything including, and not limited to: parrots, peacocks, turkeys, iguanas, koi, swans, ponds, gardens, numerous beach-side pools, recreational equipment, indoor/outdoor bars, multiple hot tubs, open air lobby area, shops, free fruit infused water that rotates flavors throughout the day, a private beach area.....are you getting the picture?! The grounds are both expansive and immaculate. When you are sitting pool-side, you are also sitting beach-side! You have a wonderful view of the Caribbean sea and Condado from the pool area. The pool furniture is lovely as well....they have beds, chairs, hammocks strung between palms trees....it looks like something you would see in a movie! While the private beach is a nice option, don't be fooled....it isn't really a beach. The private beach is a small manmade cove with a manmade beach area. It is very small and is flat as a pond due to a manmade jetty that was created. However, it does offer some decent snorkeling and it is nice to have the option of switching from pool water to ocean water in a matter of seconds. As far as the rooms are concerned, the rooms/views vary depending on which building you stay in. If you want to pay extra money and get an ocean view....GO FOR IT. The view is outstanding and the onshore breeze is entirely refreshing! I would recommend getting an ocean view room in the tower or getting in one of the lagoon villas. I just stayed in the lagoon villas and the room was nice first and foremost due to the view. The only downside to the room was that it was a bit cramped for 2 people and it had an odd chemical smell that I did not like. Besides that....free wifi in the room, free coffee, free water, etc. The tower room I stayed in a few years ago was a lot better because it was larger, had a better view, and no odd smell. I only have a few complaints about the Caribe. One thing you should know is that they tack on all kinds of misc. taxes to your bill. You get hit with all the usual PR taxes and then you get hit with a 14% hotel tax of some sort that pays for the grounds, etc. I didn't like that. Also, as you would assume....the food/booze is overpriced. To be fair...the food is pretty darn good and I highly recommend the crab cake sliders offered in the lobby bar. A final word of advice....my most recent stay was a few weeks ago and August - Nov is the off season due to hurricane season, etc. Because of this, rates are significantly cheaper, and less people stay at the hotel during these months. With this comes yearly maintenance and upkeep. When I arrived, I noticed that the place needed some painting and the next thing I knew, painters were painting the whole property. Also, one of the main pools was closed due to remodeling and a lot of unsightly repair work was going on. However, I still had a blast and would recommend the Caribe any day! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “caribe hilton, san juan”
Reviews.Author: otooles
Reviews.Content: Good hotel , excellent service, some little things missing, no robes......no mini bar contents

Reviews.Title: “Great views, still a good option to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: cruz30
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business but had been several times with family in the past. I stayed at the Condado Lagoon Villas, this is my second time at the villas. Plus- 1- Amazing views on Atlantic Ocean and Comdado area. 2- Great option for family trips, remains only hotel in the San Juan area tgat has both a large pool and private beach 3- strategic location close to San Juan nigthlife 4- has a starbucks and good dinning options in hotel premises. 5- villas are comfortable in size. 6- Well kept hotel grounds Minuses- 1- daily parking cost if having a rental car, depending in number of nigths it can add up 2- musty smell resulting from high levels of humidity in Villas lobby, not the best way to receive guest. 3- ice machines in villas are located in closed rooms with poor ventilation, tried 2 and none worked. I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach!”
Reviews.Author: YAC
Reviews.Content: It's the only hotel in PR with a private beach, and is amazing! Nice hotel for a relax stay and great food. Close to Viejo San Juan, Plaza las Americas and Condado. I recommend it, wonderful views from balcony

Reviews.Title: “Great views and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jorge L
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several time. We love the location and the things you can do in the area. If you like to go to the old San Juan, the ride is about 5 mins in taxi unless you decide to walk (under a sunny humid day may not be the best idea). Heading to the Condado area, once you get over the bridge (walking distance as well), you can enjoy the restaurants and nice walking path of the Condado area. Some of the rooms will need some improvement but overall the hotel is good. We will stay back at this location on our next visit to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mumf23
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time in the hotel. The pool bar was fun and the service was great. The rooms (in the villa) were clean. We were supposed to have ocean view but didn't. The front desk was minimally helpful in obtaining a wheelchair for my friend. The brunch was overpriced but good. Lunch at the pool bar was average but the wraps at the restuarant in the front (name escaping me) were very good (and cheaper). Good location. Nice beach.

Reviews.Title: “"All the Single Ladies"”
Reviews.Author: Marisol28
Reviews.Content: "OMG" what a wonderful 5 days and 4 nights at this awesome hotel with my two best girlfriends. We arrived around 6 pm and it was such a easy check-in. We were upgraded to the HH towers and we even got vouchers for complimentary continental breakfast every morning. Wow! the oatmeal was so delicious. Although the following days the oatmeal was warm, I had to asked to reheat it. I upgraded my breakfast a couple of days to eggs, potatoes, bacon, for $6.00 you can't beat that price. We ate at Morton Steakhouse one night, which was OK, had happy hour on other night at Mortons which we loved it was so crowed with "MEN" because of the political event happening at the hotel. Steve at Morton's was very friendly and accomandating. Our last night we ate at the Italian Restaurant excellant food. Johnny and Leo were our waiters so friendly and funny. We met a wonderful couple from New York celebrating their 50th anniversary and have been visiting Caribe Hilton since their honeymoon. They suggested a Rigotti dish with hugh shrimp and we order the spagetti dish, caesar salad, fresh hot bread brought to our table everything was soooo delicious. We had puerto rican coffee (decaf) and coconut flan...OMG this was a dinner we will never forget. We ended our last night drinking mojitos at the Oasis bar and met some "cuties"!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaye B
Reviews.Content: I read some of the poor reviews and was a little nervous what to expect, but WOW was I the most pleasantly surprised ever!!! We were given this trip as a second honeymoon and this was the best vacation my husband and I of fourteen years have ever had!!! The resort was the most beautiful, clean, friendliest place I have ever been! We stayed in the HH Tower upon request with much help from Frances Archilla who also reserved our cabana for a day which was every bit worth it! I have never had someone so concerned and work so hard to ensure I was happy before! She even came and visited us personally our first day there at our cabana to make sure we had everything we wanted. ALL of the staff there was extremely nice easy to talk to and eager to please. Many went out of their way for me and my husband I think simply because we were nice to them and treated them as fellow people, not servants. They were all very knowleagable and helpful with where to go with restaurants, tourism, etc. Our room was the nicest we have ever had with an incredible view of the lagoon as well as Atlantic. If you want a view of the Caribe Hilton's private beach and sunset, then stay in the Main Building. We were looking for a more private, higher view and were not disappointed! We had the most romantic, relaxing, wonderful time and hope we can return again sometime soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton...the best in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: chio98
Reviews.Content: We recently re-visited the Caribe Hilton for our15th time over 8 years. Although some major renavations are in progress the service and ameneties her at Caribe remain the best. The folks at the Pool Bar and the Oasis Bar are on top of thier game. Nelson the assistant Manager patrols the hotel and is always ready to fix your every need. The hotels restaurants are wonderful, we especially love IL Giardino an Italian restaurant right in main lobby area, where Franco performs magically with table side ceasar salad.We say the Caribe is the best of the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “CARIBE HILTON - CAN BE THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: KarenMcM_11
Reviews.Content: Reading the poor reviews of the Caribe Hilton prompted me to respond. As someone who loves PR and the Caribe, I would not stay anywhere else in San Juan. The location is perfect, between the Condado strip and Old San Juan, has a wonderful history, (read up on the hotel before going and look at the pictures in the reception of the executive offices), the only hotel in SJ with a private beach, the best open air lobby, a fabulous staff and a welcoming vibe. I get out of the taxi and immediately decompress. The hotel has a very successful business, social and conference business, and can be busy,but that is part of the charm. I always meet some of the most interesting guests. If you are looking for a secluded all inclusive type of resort, this is not the place for you. I will agree some sections of the hotel are more pleasant than others. Request a room in the newly renovated main building or the tower. I have stayed in the villas, but feel it is more appropriate for families, and there is a smaller pool and beach access from the villas, so you do not have to go through the main lobby. Are there more inexpensive options, yes, but without the charm. Even the Intercontinental and Ritz Carlton, which will run more, are so far removed from the "action" that the taxi fares do pile up. At Caribe, you can take a great 15 minute walk along the Atlantic to Old San Juan, spend a morning exploring, have lunch and be back in time to enjoy an afternoon at the great pool and beach. The Atlantico pool bar is the best. If you can't have a positive "attitude adjustment" there, it's not because of the environment or terrific long-term staff, who will welcome returning guests by name. I am returning in early January and cannot wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gem2323
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The staff were really helpful and courteous, the rooms were nice and clean, everything worked, room service was excellent, there were a great choice of bars and restaurants... The best thing was location, right on the beach, I had a room on the 19th floor overlooking the sea and it was amazing! Even though I was on business, I felt like I was on holiday :)

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico not so enchanting”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: My experience with Caribe Hilton was far less than enjoyable. It started at check-in with my hostess Stephanny. She told me we would be staying in the Villas, room7424. She said it was just the next building over and pointed down a hallway. My wife and had booked this trip for four days and only had one suitcase and our computer bags so we we're going to take them ourselves. After getting lost trying to get to our room, one very attentive bell hop noticed we were lost and offered his assistance. He took our bags and escorted us to us our room which was about a city block away from the main hotel. The facility was very old and far away from everything in the main hotel. After getting our luggage to our room, I went to move my car to the parking garage. Another long walk, and after getting to my car, that was parked in the check-in area, a bell-hop was going through my car; I had left the back door open. He said he was looking for something with our name on it to call us. I was not gone any longer than it took to go to the room and back. Very uncomfortable. That night we attempted to get on the internet using their wi-fi in the lobby of the villas; they do not have free wi-fi in the rooms here. We were unsuccessful and after asking the front desk attendant for assistance, he suggested we go to the lobby in the main hotel. We did this, toting our laptops for another city block trip there and back. Here we were able to connect to the internet. Stephanny had told us we would have a balcony with a view of the ocean. We had a view of the corner of the ocean overlooking a building crane and construction site. Later that night, I tried closing the curtains to the room, but the curtain was torn at the top and it would not shut completely so I had to get a coat hanger with the 2 clips from the closet, and clip the curtains together to keep the light out. We had paid $16.50 a day for parking. Stephanny had given me a card that was stamped self-parking on it and said that it would cover as many in's and out's as I wanted to make in a day. When I tried leaving for the first time I had to get an attendant to let me out after showing him my card. What I found out was that when taking a card from the lot on entry, you are suppose to get it validated before leaving. There was no common courtesy of explaining this to me at check-in. After complaining the next day, they offered me another room in the tower, next to the main hotel, and closer to the beach area and restaurants. They said it would be available by 5 P.M.. When we returned at the end of the day, they did have our room available and my wife packed up our personal belongings and we moved. While this hotel has some nice amenities, be careful about reading the reviews they have posted on their site. NOT ALL THEIR ROOMS ARE EQUAL! This was a very bad start to what was suppose to a nice 4 day getaway for my wife and I. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone as there are others just as nice, and much less expensive, in the area. If you do stay here, ensure were your room will be in advance, huge difference in accommodations. James Bowlin

Reviews.Title: “Not helpful when it came to a bad travel experience”
Reviews.Author: timbuktu8
Reviews.Content: For a "luxury" hotel, I was not impressed. We had reserved 2 rooms with ocean views, and they booked us in the "villas" which seemed like an eternity's walk away from the lobby. One room was not ready when we checked in, and the room that was ready smelled funny. We requested a room change and ended up in a better room in the "Honors" tower, which was cheaper, but still no ocean view unless you consider a bridge and construction, "ocean view" I ended up only spending 1 night in this room as I had a jetski accident, and spent the next 2 nights in the ER (a whole seperate nightmare). When we realized we needed to stay an extra night before leaving, the staff booked us in a room that was over $200 per night that was not clean, (coffee grinds all over desk), rusted fixtures in the bathroom, missing mirror on wall, and generally not what I expect from Hilton or a "honors" room. The staff was not helpful in getting a wheel chair (not available was terse response) and when i needed to fedex a package I was rushed through process (package was packaged correctly and arrived a day late) yet was prompted to be sure to mention the "good service" yeah right! The pool, man-made beach area was nice and bar staff (pool bar) were fun and made great drinks. The breakfast buffet was poor and expensive. Morton's steakhouse rushed our final meal because we were late, and it seemed apparent to them that because i was not "dressed" (due to my accident and medical condition) that I had no $$ and they could not be bothered. Nothing could have been further from truth. Overall for the short period of time I was there, I was not impressed and would not recommend to anyone to stay. If you want a high-end hotel with good service, quality rooms and quality food, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Endy123
Reviews.Content: S taffeta were friendly and helpful. Rooms were huge and clean with a great view. Would stay here again. Pool and beach area clean as soon as I sat down a guy appeared with an umbrella. Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: willtravel1102
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 nights at the Caribe Hilton. I can't say enough about how nice the staff was. Nicole at the front desk went out of her way to be helpful in meeting my room request and was as pleasant as any employer could hope for. Hiram at the pool bar was the same. Friendly, and he mixes a great drink. He recently won first prize for creating the best drink in the Caribbean -- the Cucumbertini. Unfortunately, it's not offered on the bar menu. I think it could be a winner. Definitely ask for a Tower Room on a higher floor -- some very nice views. The restaurants were very expensive, without any reasonable options nearby -- hence 4 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton is the only place I will stay when in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca C
Reviews.Content: I was here for two weeks on business and hated to leave. I love the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, PR. Everyone made me feel like family and I felt completely safe. They have a Starbucks on site and other shops. The pool area is very relaxing as well as the beach area and everytime I got into a hammock, my stress melted away. They furnish you beach towels. There are comfortable seating areas in the lobby area to enjoy the view, your starbucks coffee or free wireless internet. They have activities for the kids. No problems at check-in, my room was clean, nicely furnished and a comfortable bed. I had an ocean view and enjoyed having my balcony door opened to listen to the ocean. The food is wonderful and I had room service several nights. The food was hot and they also had freshed baked cookies on the tray. Computer internet connection in the room was perferect and I had no problems when I used it. The housekeeping staff cleaned my room and I had plenty of fresh towels, shampoo and other toiletries. I needed a sewing kit and housekeeping brought one to my room sortly after I requested it. It is a short trip to Old San Juan and there are cabs available to take you anywhere. My last visit I did rent a car and the valet service was super. I gave them my valet ticket, went to get a coffee and my car was waiting for me.
