The Caribe Hilton is the only place I will stay when I am in San Juan for business or pleasure. I feel very safe, my room is clean, the food is excellent, the staff makes me feel like family and if I need anyting they are there to help me.

Reviews.Title: “Great start for a cruise”
Reviews.Author: ChelleBrailey
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a Caribbean cruise where we boarded the ship in San Juan, Puerto Rico. We had 1 night at the Caribe Hilton Hotel beforehand and the grounds & facilities were amazing. The Caribe is right on the beach & we were lucky enough to have a room on the 9th floor so the views over San Juan and the coast line were excellent. The hotel rooms themselves could've done with a makeover, but the bed was super comfy & room was clean, which is the main thing & the reception staff were lovely. The hotel reception area is open plan & a few shops sit directly opposite check-in, (Starbucks was great for a well deserved coffee injection, after a long time flying) however Subway round the corner, wasn't that helpful as they seemed to have only Spanish & not very good English skills, so ordering was a bit eventful. Altogether a good start for a fabulous cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Rah212
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were very pleasantly surprised with the huge, open reception area where parrots squawked away. The check in staff were very friendly and we were offered an upgrade to an ocean view but declined due to not wanting to pay any more money plus we were happy to stay in a room with a garden view. When we got into our room, we were not happy with the view (all you could see was the top of a restaurant, not very nice) and we were promptly moved without any fuss. The room was clean and the cleaners were in every day changing towels and replacing toiletries etc. We were so pleased with their service that we left them a tip. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, with fish, peacocks, lizards, iguanas, geese and swans. The birds are night were happily singing away. There are plenty of pools to choose from and also the beach area. The pool bar was expensive and please be aware that they take payment by card only. We didnâ€™t try out all of the restaurants but we did go to the Italian restaurant twice and it was very nice. The steak was beautiful and the staff were helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. We also went to the Pina Colada Bar twice (canâ€™t remember the exact name), the coconut popcorn shrimp were amazing! Donâ€™t pay for cabs to get to Old San Juan, take the bus, itâ€™s a short ride and only $0.50. The only very small thing that I would mention is that it would take nearly an hour for room service to arrive. We asked for a corkscrew and it took an hour. Another night we ordered food and that took about an hour too. I would like to point out though that when the staff did arrive they were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Precruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: knbmabry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to a cruise. Check in was smooth, our room was in the tower looking west with a view of the ocean and Old San Juan. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The public areas were very nice and the employees were very pleasant. We would not hesitate to stay here again. The only negative thing was that our balcony was located over the restaurant air conditioning system and it was a bit noisey, we did mention this to the front desk at checkout and they deducted the hotel fee from our bill. We will be back! The location and views are great!

Reviews.Title: “In Love with caribe Hilton Hotel(this is my second time there)”
Reviews.Author: NRNYC
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel.they have an awesome beach w no waves perfect to float all day long.the service is awesome the drinks are the best ever(very expensive )but good.I think this is my new favorite place to go.they have lots of activities .the grounds are so well kept.can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, Friendly Staff, Outstanding Room”
Reviews.Author: Judy W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days and were so happy with every aspect of this hotel. The front desk staff initiated assistance with a room-type problem and carried through quickly and pleasantly, the restaurant wait staff were efficient and appropriately chatty, and others we encountered always had a greeting and a smile. The pools, beach, and gardens are very nice and well kept, lots of palms trees, and a small reef viewing area. The hotel is convenient to Old San Juan ... about a 30 minute walk or take a frequent city bus a block from the hotel for 50 cents. Our only complaint would be that there were few restaurant options for lunch and they weren't open for dinner until 6:00. However, the food was good and the pina coladas were great !

Reviews.Title: “Good value, lovely property”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond052
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with lovely grounds, pools & beach. Stayed 1 night before a cruise and 99% of the service was excellent. Kudos to Max at the front desk! He was polite, professional, kind and courteous and resolved a check in problem to our full satisfaction. Nice Business Center with great view of ocean. Delicious Sunday buffet. Nice size room. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane C
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay for one night when we flew into Puerto Rico before boarding a cruise ship. I made my decision based on the "Hilton" name and the pictures on thier website. The hotel was EXACTLY as it appears in the pictures. It is beautiful, clean, and the rooms are so spacious and beautiful. We knew the moment we got there, that we would be taking our next vacation at this hotel. The service was excellent. A special shout out to the first person we made contact with, Julio, at the front desk. He seemed as happy to be there as we were. He was all smiles, kind, fun, informative, and a pleasant surprise to our day. Also very appreciated was the male server withing Starbucks in the lobby. I'm so sorry I didn't get his name but my husband and I loved talking to him and the service was great. The bartenders out at the swim up bar were right there to take your order and even the girl at the towel desk was very kind. This must be a great place to work because the employees are terrific! Would advise anyone to go and enjoy this hotel. You will love the beach area, the lounge chairs at the pool, but most of all, the service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, great views”
Reviews.Author: PMCranford
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, Puerto Rico. We had a nice room on the 10th floor overlooking the ocean with beautiul views of the ocean and surrounding area. The room had two double beds, a small balcony, a refrigerator, and a good sized bathroom. The room was a good size, clean and everything was up to date. The grounds of this property are exceptionally nice, with a walkway right up against the ocean and around the hotel. There is a private becah, whcih I beleive is the only one on the island. This is a nice feature as locals are not permitted o the beach to sell beads and wood carvings. There are 10 hammocks strung between palm trees which were fun to hang out on. Near the ocean there were outdoor all weather beds with cushions to relax on as you heard the waves breaking. There was also a raft a short swim from the shore that could fit at least 10 people. The pools was huge and had a series of cascading waterfalls that enhanced the overall appearence of the outdoors areas. There were also 2 hot tubs available for use. The nicest part of the pool and beach area was the fact there were always plenty of lounge chairs available, which made it a pleasure to visit as you did not have to search for a chair. There towels provided in the pool/beach area were also plentiful and plush. A a swim-up bar in the pool area was pretty cool and did a brisk business on the hot days during our stay. They were always good about checking your room key before you entered the pool area to avoid unregisterd guests from using hte facilities. We only ate at one of the 4 or 5 restaurants on the property that was a hamburger/sandwich place located on the far end of the hotel. The food was reasonably priced and very good. Other guests told us the food in all of the restaurants on the property was quite good as well. The drinks at the hotel and pool bar were priced quite high, but that is to be expected at a resport property such as this. We had a rental car, and there was a self parking garage across the street at a price of $16.00 per day. We were in san Juan for a convention and our room rate was $127.00 per day which I felt was a grea price. Every employee of the hotel was very accomodating in all departments. If I were ever to return to Puerto Rico, I would strongly consider staying at the Caribe Hilton once again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect any service”
Reviews.Author: Kanwalkwilltravel
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is not convenient...You have to take a cab to most places. We upgraded ourselves to a suite, but its really not worth paying the extra money for â€“ you just get a big living room with a kitchenette and a very uninspiring dÃ©cor. The worst thing about this hotel is callous service. The housekeeping folks accidentally picked up a pair of my shorts which had been wrapped in a towel. Not only did I not get those back, but the staff did not even offer an apology!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip!!”
Reviews.Author: nmgmail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Hilton for six nights as part of a convention. We had a choice of staying at the Sheraton Convention center or the Hilton. I was leery of staying at the Caribe Hilton because I read so many bad reviews. But, after much research decided to stay near the beach. My family and I were so happy we chose the Hilton. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff was so friendly. We called and faxed the hotel ahead of time to let them know that besides coming for a convention we were also celebrating 50th birthdays and a 25th anniversary. We were upgraded to the Hilton Honors Towers on the 12th floor facing the private beach. The view was beautiful!! The rooms were spacious and clean. The bathrooms were huge! We arrived at 1:15 AM because of a delayed flight. We were greeted by the most pleasant front desk assistants. Even at that extremely late hour everyone was so kind. I was afraid we would get rooms that were not very nice because we were so late but our rooms were beautiful! We were sent a bottle of Champagne from someone back home and the hotel gave us a complimentary bottle as well. Everyone that works at the Caribe Hilton is friendly and helpful! Try the Bingo at 2PM it is free and we won twice. Don't forget the free PiÃ±a Colada tasting at 1PM. Take time to eat at Atlantico Pool Grill. Choose a table right near the water. You'll think you are in a Corona commercial. Starbucks was awesome for a quick snack. Hammocks were so relaxing. There was always an empty lounge chair near the pool or beach. It never seemed too crowded even with a big convention staying there. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you are trying to decide between this and any other hotel in San Juan. Thank you Caribe Hilton for making our trip such a special and enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Podie
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to San Juan, I had mixed feelings when my national convention was scheduled at this hotel. Mixed reviews and my own personal visit earlier had shown me there could be a lack of service and adequate lodging. After 8 nights there, I feel a little better about this property. Checking in was non-eventful although the upgrade I'd been promised was not available. Being from Florida, I was not surprised at the large dead roach just inside our door when we arrived - I was just glad he was dead - but it was representative of the less than perfect housekeeping. Although we tipped daily, all we could expect was the bed being made, the towels replaced, and a replacement (most of the time) of coffee for the coffeemaker. The bed was very comfortable and the internet service ($49.95 for 7 days) was excellent. It is free in the lobby and people sit at Starbucks for hours on their computers. Our room in the Hilton Honors tower was nicer than the ones in the older building, which smelled like mildew to me. Interaction with the staff was okay. Some were great and some were just civil. The Pina Colada Club on property is owned by a successful restaurant group in San Juan and the food and service were very good. Beer everywhere is $6 or $7 for local beer and $10 for tropical types. Buffet breakfast at Palmeris Restaurant in the lobby was very good for $15 continental and $22 including hot items. Starbucks coffee and pastries could add up very quickly so this was a better deal. There is a Subway down the block but I didn't care for it. I preferred to walk to El Hamburger or KFC half a mile to the right, or left over the bridge to the Condado (ritzy area) for more choices. We walked to the Casino at the Conrad hotel just over the bridge (half a mile) several times at night and never felt threatened. The setting is very nice and there is a nice beach protected from waves but you need to wear water shoes. There are rocks and sealife and a man stepped on a sea urchin, getting several spines through his foot, and was taken away by ambulance. I did not see any recommendations to protect your feet. You can take a taxi to Old San Juan for about $12 or walk the two miles, which we chose to do. We passed several large iquanas and lizards along the way, which was entertaining. As a frequent visitor to the island, I usually stay with relatives but love to stay at the La Concha Renaissance when I do stay in a hotel. This will be a backup when the price is right, which for me would be in the $100-125 range. The resort fee and tax will tack on another 20 percent or so. Definitely better than expected but I'm not sure I would recommend it to a first time visitor due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property But Not Without Issues”
Reviews.Author: Frqflier
Reviews.Content: Before I get to my specific issues, let me reiterate what other guests have said. It's a lovely property, with wonderful pools, beautiful grounds and a nice beach. That said it provides an uneven guest experience which will account for the mixed reviews on here. My 9-year-old son and I stayed here for one night ahead of a cruise. The hotel served its purpose. It was luxurious, casual and had nice pools and a beach. If staying one night ahead of a cruise is your only criteria, might I recommend the Sheraton in old San Juan which is directly across from the pier where Carnival ships depart from. That said, it was an expensive property. Not sure I would ever book this hotel as a destination for more than one or two nights. And as a convention hotel, I'd love it. But as other reviewers have pointed out, it is not within walking distance of much and meals here are quite expensive (which begs the question, if you can't afford the meals, should you even be considering this hotel in the first place?) Service here seemed to be an afterthought. I'm a Hilton Gold member. When we checked in, there was a long line for the special "Hilton HHonors" checkin. Turns out that by waiting on the regular checkin line we got faster service than by waiting in the "HHonors" line. So a note to people who don't sign up for loyalty programs, in this case you actually got preferential treatment than the people who do sign up for the benefits! And now the part that was guest-specific. Our reservation someone got messed up (errors happen.) We booked a room with two queen beds. After we took all of our bags up to the 20th floor to our room, we discovered there was only 1 king bed. When I called downstairs they said there was nothing they could do because they were full. But when I went down to the front desk, they were able to accomodate us on the fifth floor, with 2 queens. Just puzzled as to how a reservation booked and confirmed 4 months in advance could find us potentially with 1 king instead of 2 queens. Bottom line is it was ironed out, but then had to go back and wait on line for checkin, and once again, the regular checkin was faster than the gold Hilton Hhonors! Another issue was breakfast. Yes, we had a "continental breakfast" included in our rate. But if you want anything more substantial than their skimpy offerings, there's a six dollar surcharge. Again, there are no bargains at this hotel. We also were berated by the towel people who oversee the kids' playroom for spending more than the alloted amount of time on the video games. Problem was that we went in, played for 20 minutes and then left to go to the local Subway and returned an hour later. A member of the staff saw us there and thought we'd been playing non-stop. It was all chalked up to a misunderstanding, but clearly we were guilty before proving our innocence with a Subway sandwich and a receipt with a time on it! Another objection during my stay, and again, guest-specific and subject to my tastes, maybe not yours, was the loud blaring DJ music at the pool. Some guests might consider it a nice touch to have a live DJ playing music during the afternoon, but I thought it was intrusive and loud, especially right by the quiet hammock area. Again, it's all subjective, but I'd prefer peace and quiet in a relaxing environment. This hotel could be a fantastic property. The grounds are lovely, the setting is wonderful and for the most part it's a well-maintained property. But pay attention to the other reviews. Food is pricey, it's an expensive cab ride ($15 for what would be a $6 ride here in NYC to and from Old San Juan) and there's not much beyond the property other than a convenience store, a subway and a wine/beer store. I'm confident my review will be getting a response from hotel management and I can't wait to see what they say. I might add I'm a low maintenance guest. I tend to suffer in silence and then vote with my dollars.

Reviews.Title: “This is a must”
Reviews.Author: Alex O
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest all around hotels in the Hilton family. If you visit San Juan, a must to stay here. Did you know the Pna Colada was borned here over 50 years ago? See Victor at the bar and ask him. You can find Mr Torres roaming the facility and engaging guests all day long, so you can pay a compliment or discuss any issues you may have. Personally, the Puerto Rico culture is reflected everywhere in this hotel. It is wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel, nothing really special though.”
Reviews.Author: Freek_sander
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights as part of our honeymoon. Upon arrival we were upgraded to the Hilton Honours tower which was a nice gesture. The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel has a good pool area but the beach was disappointing as is the overal location of the Hotel. staff is friendly and the in hotel Starbucks offers a good alternative for breakfast or a quick snack. The also in house Morton's steakhouse is another good alternative but the hotel also offers several good restaurants. Overall fine hotel probably better suited for business then Leasure. Try a piÃ±a colada it is said the drinks was invented there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly gorgeous resort and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chesapeake_crab
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything your carribean fantasy resort would have! The lovely soft sand beachs with a floating dock to swim to and lay on and let the waves rock you to sleep. Palm trees with hammocks hanging in them, infinity pool with a swim up bar and waterfalls into the large pool. Huge, cushy cushions on king-size wicker benchs where you can lay back under the palm trees and listen to the waves going over the rocks. My only criticism is that the food that I had at the pool bar was really lousy and if you weren't a hot young babe in a teeny-weeny bikini your service was going to leave a lot to be desired. Never leave a woman with an empty martini glass for more than a nano second!

Reviews.Title: “nice lobby, decent room, ugly beach, nice goldfish pond, and a cabride away from most places.”
Reviews.Author: SteveFromNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty average, and definitely not what the lobby presented itself to have been. The Starbucks was nice, as there really wasn't anything close by when a quick snack was needed. The pond is nice, and filled with like a billion goldfish, and there was a huge peacock that scared the crap out of my wife when it started to run towards us. The staff was nice, but again, nothing was spectacular. I honestly don't remember much else about our stay here - and I'd say that about says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, overall very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LovedLondon_0522
Reviews.Content: I really have nothing bad to review about the Caribe Hilton. It's a beautiful hotel and the views are to die for. We went right after Labor Day and, man, that was the time to go. It wasn't busy, it felt like my family had the beach all to themselves, etc. We brought our 3-year-old son and he had a great time. He loved the secluded beach (as did we) and the warmed pools. There was also a very nice playground/jungle gym that he enjoyed. Very kid friendly place. As kind of a random aside: There were TONS of iquanas/lizards on the hotel grounds. Which was fine by us - we made a daily game over who could find the most and they were never in the actual hotel, but if you're not a "lizard person," just be forewarned. I do have a few complaints (hence why it's not a 5 star rating): -- For a place that touts their pina coladas, they were certainly very weak and VERY over-priced. -- The air conditioning (at least in our rooms) wasn't that great. It worked, but it sure wasn't 68 degrees in my room like the gauge stated it was. -- The hotel is kind of isolated and there's no where to get anything to eat -- The surrounding area looked a bit 'iffy' and I would not recommend walking outside the hotel area at night --Which means you're generally stuck with their food/restaurants, and those are also VERY expensive. Our room service came to nearly $70 and all we got was a hamburger and chicken strips. But really, other than that, it was a great place. I would stay/vacation there again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK but rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton was one of the conference hotels for a recent conference I was at. The hotel itself is OK, not bad but not great either. The room was nice but it definitely showed its age. The hotel is not within waling distance to anything. Unless you have a car, you are pretty much marooned at the location unless you take a cab. Cabs are plentiful but this gets expensive after a while. The beach and pool are nice but all of the restaurants are overpriced for what you get; the bars are even more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business hotel, and not of your all inclusive vacation either”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSalesMgr
Reviews.Content: I had visited San Juan previously for work and have enjoyed staying at the Marriott properties, where my experience had always been a very good one. Having learned that Caribe Hilton was a high end and pricey hotel, I was excited when my company booked rooms for several of us for a week during a recent conference. Needless to say, I had high expectations about it primarily because of its history and being a the first Hilton operated outside the U.S. Sadly, I left with mixed feelings about recommending this hotel and I don't expect to return. First impressions count, and impressions during registration at the front desk and later finding a huge "Cucaracha" (Spanish for Cockroach) on my way to my room in the Hilton Honors tower (third floor) were not welcoming ones. From the business perspective, it is a known fact that Puerto Rico can be expensive, but I want to start by saying this is not a business hotel. There is only (free) WIFI on the first floor of the main building, otherwise in room Internet is available at US$15.00 per day. I was never pointed out to a business center, and staff was not even knowledgeable about where to find the closest copy center. The staff on the front desk were plain rude and they seemed having an attitude when one asked questions about how to get around the hotel. There was a gentleman who worked during the busiest hours and did not know anything, or care to research about it, and his excuse was that he had just moved a month ago from Florida and didn't know the island well. How come management placed someone with such limited knowledge in the front desk when the hotel was sold out for a whole week with visitors from all over the world? I was puzzled. Breakfast was priced at US$15-20.00, and I did not see myself paying $100.00 for breakfast for five days. I tried finding a supermarket or restaurants close by just to realize this hotel is located by itself in this peninsula and - if one wants to go else where - a taxi ride of $12-$25 (one way) was the only option. Thankfully, there is a Starbucks onsite, which became my best friend for coffee and snacks. There were some good moments during my trip: The cleaning lady was very friendly and always kept the room very neat. My air conditioning broke down and it got fixed the same day. My room view, which was on the 8th floor, was a good one. Even though I never used it, the pool was huge and it was a nice as in the pictures. The beach was a disappointment. The fitness center was to die for as it is managed by a third party company and, surprisingly, it was included in the staying. Finally, one of the bell hops (Esteban) was always very professional and helpful when the front desk staff did not know something. By the end of the week, I knew he was the best source to learn about the whereabouts of the hotel. I believe next time I will return to the Marriott hotels (Isla Verde or Condado) as not only one gets more for the money, but the staff is more friendly, and the properties are located at walking distance from restaurants, supermarkets, and nice beaches. Connectivity and breakfast was also included.

Reviews.Title: “okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: the service was good the parking was a bit too much good location beach was not nice pool was okay

Reviews.Title: “A fab vacation”
Reviews.Author: Shyam D
Reviews.Content: We got the accommodation at the Caribe Hilton at the very last minute. We were surpriced by the quality and beauty of the hotel and the beach. It was a very enjoyable stay and the service was very good and courteous. The only negative point was that the internet connection in the rooms was very bad. Since we came to relax, it was not a major concern. The rooms were clean and the beach was great. Overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, classic hotel, careful which rooms you get”
Reviews.Author: bbanks945
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is one of the original resorts of Puerto Rico. It must have been a very chic destination in the 60s, but it's showing its age now. We stayed in a cabin room, which is part of a low-rise addition up against the water. A nice four-star room. The tower rooms might be nicer, but are more remote. The older parts of the hotel looked more run down. The hotel pool areas are nice and clean. We liked the pool-area restaurant for family lunches. The nicer restaurants had superb food. The hotel is quite close to the old city - not walking distance but a short cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it's webpage and reviews, disapointing”
Reviews.Author: zoukman1916
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a buiness trip. Room- clean, but no microwave, paint peeling on ceiling, no internet (webpage says free wifi, but it's only in lobby and public areas, you must pay for internet connection in room) and smelled musty. Service was good, but not the greatest and at times, when asking someone where things were, just poor. Food and drinks- Food and drinks were way over priced to the point that we found a Subway across the street and lived on sandwitches. We went to the bar Pina Colada pub/bar for a few drinks and watched the waitress/barmaid dump a drink that was sitting on the bar for 25+ minutes that someone ordered, back into the drink machine.....so we finished and left. The pool bar closed at 5pm, just when we wanted to enjoy it. Can't believe this place won a Tripadvisor Award for 2011! Someone really needs to take a closer look.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLou32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend to attend a conference. This hotel offers the most comfortable beds you can think of and polite and helpful staff. The breakfast restaurant lets you enjoy your morning coffee with a perfect view over the Caribbean sea. But the best of it all is the location right on a sandy beach cove. Would not reccommend for families with children though, as there is not much for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: FITfalcon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights while working in San Juan. The room was above average with an ocean view and balcony. I was a big fan of the oversize shower which had a very large ledge for storing your soap, shampoo and shower beer; not having space in the shower is a pet peeve of mine. The real appeal to this hotel is the property. The pool is large and has a swim-up bar. There is a private beach that is sheltered so the water is very calm. You won't have to worry about finding a chair, there are too many to count. I was fond of the shady area with half a dozen hammocks hanging amongst the palm trees. Across the cove was a shack offering scuba and snorkel trips. My one disappointment was an old fort adjacent to the property which seemed ripe for touring, however the security gate was always locked. Being a vacationing hotel everything was expensive; food, drinks, parking, everything. I think my continental breakfast of fruit and a bagel was $16 (although free if you are a diamond HHonors.) I avoided buying food and drink at the hotel. There are two convenience stores across the street where you can buy cheaper beer and wine ($10 per 6-pack). And I opted most days for breakfast at the Subway on the corner, they open early. Overall, I really liked the hotel but only because it was on the company dime, For a vacation I would probably opt for something a little cheaper. If you don't mind paying a little extra this hotel is great. fyi - if you get a chance eat at the cafeteria san felipe: fantastic food, big portions, low price. My favorite place to eat, but not in a great neighborhood. The farmstand across the street also has the best avocados.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel is you want luxury right in the heart of San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: USMC_Retired
Reviews.Content: Overall Impression: Fantastic hotel is you want luxury right in the heart of San Juan. Hotel is large, but we stayed in the Lagoon Villas, so it felt very quaint and secluded. With my Hilton Honors Diamond status, we received certificates for continental breakfast each day. It was also good for use at the hotel Starbucks. PROs: -Relatively close proximity to Old San Juan -Private beach -Villas and ocean view -Grounds/Gardens CONs: - Food is a little pricey -Hotel size -Crowded parking garage

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Morrie C
Reviews.Content: Excellant place to stay. Stayed there in Jan 2011 for a company sales function. went back to stay in August 2011 for business. would stay there again with no hestitation. easy cab ride from the airport (about $20.00) {---}

Reviews.Title: “Hilton has disappointed us”
Reviews.Author: ubutatechnology
Reviews.Content: 1. September 03, 2011 Front Desk during check in was NOT detailed in the amenities included with our stay and where to find those amenities during our stay. She was even given a $5.00 tip to spark her motivation but that proved to be useless. 2. September 04, 2011 Went to what was supposed to be a full breakfast buffet which was not the actual buffet but a continental breakfast. The host (male) standing at the podium looked at us, turned away and started looking at the ceiling and gazing around the room. Not sure what his issue was. We only heard from him when it was time to collect money. Asked for two eggs over easy was not NO! Not here. Here you only get this and pointed to watery scrambled eggs. So we left but on our way out we were presented with a bill. We informed the host that breakfast was included. He said no that is for the other restaurant. I explained to him that if he was paying attention and greeted us like he was supposed to instead of picking his nose and scratching himself, we would have been in the right place. I do not work there so why should I pay a room rate and walk around and say good morning to each and every staff. I definitely did not pay to serve the staff! I went to the other restaurant and informed Gabriella Ponce the manager and she appeased the situation by inviting us for lunch. We ate at Atlantico Restaurant. The Mahi Mahi salad was good but the french fries were disgusting. Service from Yuri was good. Wanted to rent a car from Hertz in the hotel but the lady at the counter was more interested in eating and talking on the phone rather than wanting to rent a car. So I called Enterprise at the Conrad Hotel and they took care of it right away. Will NEVER rent from Hertz again until I die. Even if they give a free car I will never use them. September 04, 2011, Jose the manager on duty gave us two coupons for free drinks. He told us that we can redeem them for two drinks, complimentary of Rums of Puerto Rico. Very nice of Jose. Coupon numbers: 248683 and 248682. September 05, 2011 we went to the bar in the lobby and ordered an Oasis Breeze which was recommended by Jose the bartender. Drinks were made and bill was presented. I presented the coupon and he started making a big deal of the situation in front of all the other guests. He said that the coupon is not valid for special drinks and can only be used for "other rum" and not the good rum. So jose gave us a "slap" in the face by offering us third class quality liquor as a gesture to appease and set a positive tone towards a very negative Check in and overly horrid morning on the second day. Jose called the Bar Manager Joel Joel immediately said very loudly that those tickets are not for special drinks. They are only for Pina Coladas and those type of drinks. So with that we told Joel that he can keep his drink and we left the bar. We called for the manager on duty and Heydsha who was a supervisor came by. She wanted us to move to her office to talk but we were already comfortable in the lobby sofa. We told her of the situation and gave the coupons back. She offered to give us the drink, however, we REFUSED! We do not any freebees from the hotel. We are not poor and we will not be insulted by Hilton in the manner we have been the last few days. HILTON, you can keep your drinks and coupons and use them on yourself or other guests. What you have done is highly insulting. September 05, 2011, I called down to Valet like I was told the night before if I wanted my car. 20 min later I showed up at the lobby and the valet guy was sitting there cleaning his nails. Mark was having a casual conversation and talking to another employee. I saw not cars being pulled in or out and bellmen were all standing around the desk by the parrots. I asked for my car and he showed me the key and said, is this it? I said yes but why is the car not here???? " Well we are very busy Sir and there are other cars in front of you. Mark stepped in and said "it is very busy today." So this leads me to believe that cleaning ones nails and talking to employees is considered busy. No worries, I noted it down. As I did, Mark saw me write it down and he started to act sweet and say it will be here in a few minutes and so on acting like nothing was wrong. The car took forever to arrive. Later that day, I arrived back and dropped the car of to valet and it took a short while for someone to come to the car. They gave me a ticket and took no info down and left with the car without any words. This morning when I had breakfast, I asked Euclid to cook my eggs with butter only and no oil. He gave the most dirtiest face and starting demanding at the top of his lungs for me to go and get him some butter from the buffet table next to the honey and fruits. Finally his partner, whom I think was also Jose, calmed him down and basically told him to shut up. His partner got the butter and cooked my eggs for me. The freshly squeezed orange juice machine was not working and broken. There were several other guests complaining on Euclids behavior towards them and so that made the "made to order" line very long. I had a good experience with Leo in the Il Gardinia Restaurant. Employees to recognize on a positive note: Michelle in Room Service, Gabriella Ponce, Leo, Jose in the breakfast buffet, Jose in security, Jimenez the police officer. After housekeeping cleaned our room on September 05, 2011, the room was still filthy. My wife got her hair done at the spa. The receptionist at the Spa is very moody and rude but the lady that worked on my wife's hair was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and the bell boy Fraticcelli ia the best.”
Reviews.Author: Hput
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel because the location is great. Very close to the old san juan.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Ty731
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying this was my very first Island Vacation ever. So my eyes, mind and spirit were set on a positive space. Also I should mention that I have worked in different departments of hotel management for the past 10 years. I will start out by saying that I LOVE THIS Resort. The beach is soo convenient and the pool is great spent hours in both places during my 5 day 4 night stay. At check in the front desk agents was nice however she mixed up the keys and names of my reservation and my friendâ€™s reservation; however we were checking in at the same time. We were able to get this fixed later on in the evening. This was a girls trip and the four of us where so excited about our vacation. Like I mentioned I have worked in hotels for many years and so did the ladies I was traveling with. Dominick at the concierge desk is awesome and he helped us with many suggestions of places to eat and see. There is where we booked our snorkeling trip for later on in the week. (Which was awesome) We booked the Puerto Rico is Exciting package which included 2 free breakfast buffet each morning. We ate in the Palmeras Restaurant for breakfast each morning. Breakfast was great the mangos where my favorite along with the omelets. Soto was our server for 2 mornings and still assisted us on the morning when we were sat in a different section. He was friendly and attentive, he remembered what beverage we wanted and had our coffee and hot tea waiting before we even asked. Now that is service and should be treasured with employees. We were sad to find out that he wasnâ€™t working on our last morning because we wanted to say goodbye. Spa was wonderful and my 50 minute massage that I received from Alexis was the best massage I had ever had. I loved the open lobby found it amazing and I had never seen anything like that before. The housekeepers where friendly, only problem is they kept only leaving on glass in our room. It was two people staying in the room, not a big deal just thought I would mention it. We stayed in the newer renovated rooms. Room was nice spacious and I loved the balcony. Nice view of the garden. My only issue with the guest rooms is that they had small issues with the rooms that from my point of view where easy fixes. Like beside my bed there was a patch of paint missing. Easy fix and I didnâ€™t understand why that was left like that. I donâ€™t know how often PM is conducted with the engineering department but again just little nicks scratches at seem to be quick fixes. Again I had a great time at the Hilton Caribe and will definitely be back hopefully next year.

Reviews.Title: “Room with A View”
Reviews.Author: NYC-161
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in April and were given a room in the Condado Lagoon Villas, which took almost an hour to get into because of key problems. Although the room was new and clean, it lacked any charm or warmth. The particular building that we were in was also the furthest from the main building with the most horrendous view of a partially completed building and an abandoned construction site. At night a spotlight from the site would shine into our hotel room adding to the overall desolate and eerie experience- totally unacceptable. After three nights, we were finally able to move.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, perfect location, clean, and plenty to do”
Reviews.Author: Djgoldma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week after the hurricane cancelled all flights home when we got back from a cruise. Absolutely stunning resort, amazing facilities. Food is very pricey, so take a cab to supermax nearby and go grocery shopping. Rooms have microwaves and fridges. Only thing I didn't like was the resort fee of 23 bucks per room per day. They don't tell you this when you check in. Still recommended though.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0714
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a Saturday night before we left for a cruise. The hotel was about 15-20 minutes away from the airport. It seemed like the hotel was located off the beaten path, with only a Subway sandwich shop and liquor store nearby. I was amazed when I walked into the hotel. The open-air lobby was beautiful and a fresh breeze was blowing through it. There were plenty of comfortable couches and chairs to sit on. We arrived around 12 PM and our room was not ready. That's completely understable because it was early in the day. The front desk staff gave us a card with a confirmation number and phone number on it and said that later in the day we could call it to see when our room would be ready. They also gave us an access code so we could get free WiFi in the lobby, which was extremely useful and nice. We left our luggage with a bellboy. Do not leave anything valuable in the luggage you leave with them because I don't know how a couple of bellboys could keep their eyes on every single piece of luggage. We were a little scared about leaving it there. First, we took a walk around the property. It is a large hotel with a lot of ground around it. We walked down a nice path and had a breath-taking view of the ocean and rocks. Lizards and even an iguana walked across the path. There is a nice area with hammocks, although I never got to use it because it was too crowded. The Caribe Hilton also has a beautiful garden section. It was so pretty. There were flowers blooming, ducks swimming in the pond, and benches for you sit on and enjoy the surroundings. I even came across a peacock walking around. The gardens were one of my favorite parts of the hotel. Then, we had lunch at one of the pool bars. They had hot dogs, chicken, burgers, fries, and other finger foods. The waitresses were very friendly and provided us with good service. The food was also good. Later, we checked to see if our room was ready. It was not, so we decided to go to the beach. We were allowed to use the changing rooms and restrooms. Both were very clean and attendants were on standby to pick up anything that was dropped on the floor. The beach is a small closed in area, what I would call a man made beach. This is because the ocean surrounding the hotel is too rough and rocky, not appropriate for swimming. It was crowded, therefore I only was able to find one lounge chair. Towels were provided by the hotel. The water was warm, but somewhat rocky. The beach area was nice, but I would not want to have to come to this man made beach for a week. The swimming pools were lovely. There are several pools with waterfalls and swim up bars. Pools even lead into each other. There was a hot tub, but it was dirty and gross, so needless to say, I did not get in it. Chairs and lounge beds are plentiful around the pool area, too. After 4 PM, we determined that our room was ready. Our room was located in the Hilton Honors Towers on floor 8. The room had two double beds, a desk, balcony with an amazing view, and a huge bathroom. The room was clean and kind of small. The balcony was great! It had a table and chairs and had an exceptional view of the ocean and palm trees. A deserted hotel, the Normandie, sits across the street. The bathroom was very large. It had two sinks and a shower so large that it had a seat in it! The shower did not have very good water pressure, though. For dinner, there are various choices. From expensive steakhouses to Italian restaurants, you definitely have options. My family and I ate at the Italian restaurant. Service was slow, but the food was good. The pizza was tasty and you got a lot of it for your money. Later that night, music was playing at the bar and people were dancing. It's a happening place at night. Way across the street, there was a stage with a band and LOUD music. No lie, the band played until at least 2 AM in the morning. Therefore, don't expect good sleeping quality. Beds and pillows were just ok. For breakfast, there is an expensive buffet or a Starbucks. We decided to eat at Starbucks. It was really crowded and we waited in a long line. We used the TV check out, since lines at the front desk were long. We had no problem getting a taxi, there are plenty that come and go from the hotel. And as an FYI the cruise ship port is about 10-15 minutes away from the property. I truly enjoyed my stay here at the Caribe Hilton. I would definitely return. Everything was fantastic. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised :-)”
Reviews.Author: Ashdon37
Reviews.Content: I am a person who makes decisions from reviews on just about everything. So I was a little hesitant after reading some of the reviews on this site regarding the Caribe Hilton about a month or so ago. When I arrived......I was pleasantly surprised :-)

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE !”
Reviews.Author: stefstinie
Reviews.Content: I can't help, but it's still on my mind. We had a wonderfull time in san Juan .......... We returned from a walk in san juan and our handluage was desepeared from our room. The roommaid took it to the security ( we did'nt check out!)We hoped everything was O.K. when we opened our handbag all the money, family photo's and some papers were gone. The police made an PV and we still wait for some answers ! We almost missed our cruise without money !

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Not worth your time and money”
Reviews.Author: katherine1245
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the girl at the desk was rude. Thye also want to hold 75 dollars per day on your credit card until check-out. I told her I didn't want her to hold any of my money and I will place cash for incidentals she got upset and told me she needed to speak to a manager first..eventually they agreed. They placed myself and my party in these rooms that left dingy motels rooms in NYC look like five star hotels. They were dingy and smelly. My first room had ants and hair on the table. I asked to be moved and they did. The second room for my husband and I was somewhat o.k. The room assigned to my mother in law was not..a codom was in front of her door and the bathroom was dirty with pubic hair still on the seats. I called the front desk and complained only to receive much attituted from the night manager. He tried to offend me by giving me a 50 dollar voucher for snacks and meals. The following night we ate at one of the restaurants only to recieve poor service once again. It took one hour for someone to take our orders and finally got our food after arguing with people. After speaking to the manager, that didn't care..never made an effort to resolve our problems..fired the only waiter that was trying to help us get our food..and he did this in front of us after several times telling him that this particular waiter was trying to help us and the initial waiter only came to us once. We were there during Hurricane Irene and the hotel made no provisions for the people or guest who at the time were not allowed to leave the hotel as per the government of Puerto Rico. They still charged us full price for food and drinks..I was going to have my wedding there..guess what thats not going to happen..Never again..

Reviews.Title: “My mistake for coming back”
Reviews.Author: kewinpa
Reviews.Content: I've had problems in the past but the location is convenient for the business travel that I do. This time- the room I was assigned smelled terribly when I entered. (I'll spare you the details). I was willingly assigned a differnt room. Called room service but no answer after extended ring time. Called Operator and also no answer. Went to the front desk and was told they must be taking other orders and I could try later.... which I did. I've had so many annoying problems at this hotel. I need to just stop going there!

Reviews.Title: “Miserable night”
Reviews.Author: Twila E
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in our room at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan we noticed a small wet spot on the carpet. We immediately called maintenance to come up and assess the situation. The engineer arrived, could not identify the cause, shrugged his shoulders, and left without further comment. In the middle of the night one of our family members got up and found that the carpet throughout our entire room was completely soaked. Our belongings which were on the floor were soaked, including some of our clothes, handbag and its contents, and suitcases. When we called the manager to advise him of the situation and ask for a refund he was quite rude and uncooperative. He said he would offer us a "generous" (his word) 50% discount on our room charge. We explained that since our sleep was disrupted and our belongings were soaked we would like a complete refund, which he quickly and rudely refused. He did not even take the time to come and view the damage to the room or our belongings. We are long-term, loyal customers of Hilton hotels and the attitude of this manager made us feel that our business was not valued and that we were very unimportant to him. There are other newer and nicer hotels in San Juan and we will definitely be staying in one of them during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good place for family vacation..{if the price is right}”
Reviews.Author: fergus81
Reviews.Content: Booked this location through Hilton..very reasonable package: Travlled with spouse and three children (12-15). Had been to SJ last year and stayed at the Marriott Stellaris, but the special price (off-season certianly helped) led us here. Booked two conecting rooms and sent e-mail to remind them of request prior to arrival. We arrived early ( before noon) and 1 room was already waiting for us, and they had secured us the connecting room as well (something the Marriott was unable to do for our first night despite same request last year). Front Desk staff very helpful , as was bell service..Pool/Beach area are what make this hotel stand out...beautiful and user friendly. We had lunch at the pool grill as we were hungry from travelling all morning.. Ridiculously expensive ( $150 lunch (burgers/sandwiches for 5) with two adult drinks) and about what you would expect as far as quality from a pool grill. Okay, but nothing special... Our rooms were in the Tower Building, "partial" ocean view. The rooms were indeed dated and a little "beat up", but very comfortable beds, and everything worked. We did have an ac unit stop working one day, one call to the desk and it was fixed quickly. We tried the breakfast buffet @ Palmares after reading here about it.. only 4 of us went to that..$100 for the buffet breakfast for 4..tasty, but way overpriced..and they still have the notations on the bill for filling in a tip (15%, 18%, 20%) for the "serve yourself" breakfast..sorry, no way was I giving another $20 to our "waiter" who merely brought us water and cleared plates twice in the half hour we were there..I left a tip, but not a tip they probably expected as if it were a full service restaurant..After all, we did get up and get our own food... There is a minmart across the street where you can buy beer/soft drinks for your room (each room had a small fridge)..the snack/souvenir shop at the hotel was price gouging ($3.29 for a bottle of water) ($5.99 for a small cup of ice cream { that is $1 at home} so it was worth it to walk across the street. A beer was $7 at the pool, a 6 pack in the minmart was $10.. It is an easy/safe walk to Condado..we walked in early evening there for dinner on a couple of nights, purchased what we needed for supplies from the Walgreens ( normal pricing on most items).. the area seems well patrolled and safe.. a couple of panhandlers, but same as you find in any big city...Nice local restauarants up and down Ashford Ave...your choice from authentic local to Mexican to Pizza. Best meal of the trip was once again in OSJ at AL Dente...delicious Italian at reasonable prices.. All in all, we would stay at the CH again if the price was right..I have seen some people on this board claim they paid $200-300 per night..no way it is worth that..but if you can get in here for less than $140 per night..it is a good bargain.. For $200-300, I would go back to the much cleaner/more modern Marriott..

Reviews.Title: “Horribly Rude and Incompetent Service”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: A beautiful setting on the beach could not make up for shoddy construction and service, including a manager answering a complaint by calling me an "F-ing American". I am never going back and will now think twice before staying at any Hilton property. On arrival our rooms were ill-prepared - my wife and I had multiple lights out, light shades missing and an air conditioning unit that almost immediately started slamming against its' enclosure. It took multiple visits to get SOME of these issues resolved, though they left one light non-operational and the phone in our kids room was never fixed though they told us it was. That night a leak in our bathroom covered the floor with water, causing my wife to slip and fall in the middle of the night. She spent the better part of the next day of our family vacation in the dingy San Juan emergency room that Hilton staff brought her to trying to get seen by a doctor while other patients and a hospital security guard advised her that bribery was her only hope for getting seen. Eventually she was seen and misdiagnosed, as she also was by the "hotel" Dr that Hilton brought up when we complained. Hotel management then agreed to move us to another floor, telling us that we needn't pack up as they would handle it all. When the time came to move (we had to call several times to check as the scheduled move time kept slipping) we were told that they would not give us keys to the new room until we packed - the complete opposite of what we were originally told. When we complained a "manger" came down to intervene, eventually (and incredibly) complaining about the "drama" we caused and calling us "F#@*ing Americans". I was stunned to have anyone say this to me, especially the manager of a Hitton where I way paying to stay! I will happily oblige and leave this joint to the natives, taking my "mainland" drama elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Dwayne W
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel LOST our reservation and they were booked solid. After about an hour of scratching their heads trying to figure out what to do, they put us in a "parlor" room. The only bed was a fold out couch with a hard bar that ran right across your hips. They did bring in a cot for my wife since the bed was so small, but neither one was comfortable. The place was so unorganized, it was unreal. The bad thing is they really didn't seem to care too much that they had screwed up. When we told our travel agent what happened, she called the hotel and was told it "was taken care of". We spent $268 to spend one night sleeping on fold out beds and cots. Does that sound to anyone else like they took care of it? My gut feeling is that they overbooked for the night. Hilton should be embarrassed to even have their name on this hotel. If I could rate it less than 1 star, I would!

Reviews.Title: “Too good to be true”
Reviews.Author: cynthiame
Reviews.Content: Our room was wonderful with an ocean view.Restaurants were great inside the hotel.Employees were like family and took such good care of us! The private beach with towels and chairs was so perfect. We will be going back as soon as we can.....and we will stay in the same room "with the ocean view"

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: BigApple1
Reviews.Content: We have been here many times and have never been disappointed. The grounds are magnificent, the rooms are great. They are spacious and clean and up to date. The buffet breakfast is the most sumptious we have ever had. Fresh squeezed orange juice, champaigne and so much more. What we miss is the Executive Lounge, that was closed for economic reasons. We also miss the restaurant that was always open all day, but now is only open for breakfast. Since the hotel is a 20 taxi ride to Old San Juan we would like more dining options on the grounds. We shall return, however. We have yet to meet a more courteous and friendly staff, always willing to help and please.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers1987
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from an 11 day stay at the Caribe Hilton with our 13 and 17 year old kids and had a WONDERFUL time! Everything was exactly what we expected and more. Every staff member went out of their way to assist us with whatever we needed. Maria at the front desk checked us in and became our "go to" person throughout our stay and she was AWESOME. Thanks Maria! Eric at the concierge desk was also a lot of help. We watched the sunrise almost every morning with a cup of Starbucks before waking up our kids which I highly recommend! The staff at the lobby Starbucks are equally as nice as the Resort staff. Caribe Hilton opened in 1949 and they had a $60 million renovation in 1999. The beds are the most comfortable part in the resort which is the MOST important part of a Hotel room following a day of exploring. We hope everyone enjoys their stay as much as we did! Thank you Caribe Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would definately go back”
Reviews.Author: MorleyLeedsCaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, especially as we had our doubts with it being in the city. You definately got the carabean feel when out the back where the beach is and then from the front of the hotel if you turn left you have the option of a `15 - 20 min walk into town where there are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. If you turn right, you come to a public beach, but just before that there is a little shack that you can sit and get a cheap beer etc. You can see this little shack from the hotel beach but unfortunately you can't walk from the beach, you have to go round the street, It's ony a short walk though. Although the hotel is fantastic, the drink prices are very very steep which puts you off drinking here which is a shame with it having a swim up bar. As you can imagine it was always empty. We were half board, so we ate out for the other meal as the food was expensive too. The staff were not very friendly either. This would not put me off staying here as like I say the hotel is rather wow.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel on the water, but noisy and crowded”
Reviews.Author: Roaming_Fool
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week for a conference at the nearby Convention Center. The Convention Center is about a 15 minute walk and at one point you must cross a busy street. However, having the hotel on the water is a nice way to relax after a day of work. The hotel has its own lagoon area that is nice to swim in - the waves are subdued. There are also several nice bars, including one swim up bar. I had a room with a nice view looking east toward Isla Verde, so the sunrises were spectacular. The rooms were modern and clean, and the staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating. They will tell you to take a taxi in to Old San Juan (about $10-15), but on a nice day, you can walk (about 1-2 miles), or even catch the bus for about a dollar (runs every 15 minutes) and save the taxi ride for heading home after dark. A cab ride to/from the airport is around $25 each way. Unfortunately, all of the east facing rooms are right above some very, very noisy ventilation units on the lobby/restaurant roof. It makes it difficult to have the patio door open if you like to fall asleep to the sound of surf, or a nice tropical breeze (and I was on the 7th floor - those poor folks on the 2nd or 3rd floors must have been deafened). In addition, this is a tourist hotel. It is packed with a lot of tour groups and pleasure seekers. The restaurants are ok, but IMHO overpriced. A short walk across the bridge will get you to Condado restaurants and nightlife. There are also some good restaurants in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Delibop
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton in San Juan was perfect! It was close to a most everywhere. But, because of it's beautiful beach which is the only beach that isnt public, is calm warm and nice. You can rent kayaks and other fun stuff get snacks and drinks from the bar not to far away and hop in the pool afterwards! Make sure to set up farther away from the hotel though beacause of lots of seaweed and Coarl in the water the closest to the hotel. We spent 2 days of hanging out at the hotel. They have many restaurants in walking distance. One of which the whole family loved, pinnacolada club. My dad loved the skirt steak and mashed plantains. I loved all the food! Good service and good food. The rooms were exactly like other hilton rooms; nice, clean, and comfortable. Ask for the highest number room other than the governors suite. The one next to it. That is where we stayed and it had an amazing view. I think it was room 385 or something.... Not sure. But it was top floor next to the governors suite. The view was of palm trees and the ocean and even a small ruin. We could never get to see in it though for it was gated off. But over this was an amazing hotel with amazing views! Family friendly and just overall and amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every second!”
Reviews.Author: Vivi212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 7/10-7/16 & we loved every second. We arrived at 12p on a.Sunday and although our room wasn't ready they checked our bags, allowed us to change into our bathing suits and explore the grounds. After enjoying the swim up bar (buy the tall glass for $22 and refills thereafter are $14 so long as you keep the glass, great deal bc its literally 3 drinks in one and they do not skimp on liquor, strawberry mojito & strawberry lemonade werte the best) We went to check on our room. It was ready at 2 oclock, well before their 4pm check in (Thanks Nicole!) Our room was on the 12th floor of the Hilton Honors Tower and it was amazing! Great size room, super clean, walk in shower and his&hers sinks. Our view was great, decent size balcony with table and two chairs. Every single moment I felt catered to, for my bday we went to Morton's Steakhouse, many steak selections, knowledgeable staff, they knew it was my bday so they provided dessert on the house followed with a picture of hubby n I printed up and given to me in a picture holder signed by all the waiters.... Oh! Lets not forget a personalized menu printed up with my name!!! I loved every second. The grounds are beautiful, theres snorkeling offered on site at their private beach. We tried just basic snorkeling and theres so many fish all around even in the shallow area it was beautil but spooked me so im glad we only spent $20 before venturing into an actual deep water excursion. The beach was relaxing, more.than enough chairs and towels, one of the employees sets up your umbrella once youre on your chairs. Many activities offered throughout the day such as latin dance class, pina colada tasting, bingo, etc. We got breakfast included in our room rate and it was such a treat! Delish custom made omelets hmmmm. Take the bus to old san juan, cross the street when you reach Subways restaurant and walk towards the.highway. Bus stop or Parada.is to the right. Have exact.change .75 cents and take any bus to the last stop. Make sure to eat.at Raices! Delicious food and strong drinks. Just enjoy Puerto Rico! It's such a beautiful place, I'm already planning to go back im in love with this PR!

Reviews.Title: “What happened to this place?”
Reviews.Author: mflatc
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here in the past and loved it. Last visit was very unpleasant. I parked my car at the guest entrance to check in as usual. While in the middle of checking in a manager demanded that I move my car immediately because a big bus wanted to park there. I was in the proper place for check in and could not move my car. The bus was only 15 feet away and the people could have gotten off there. He was very rude and "authoritarian". The rooms ac thermostat did not work and it was freezing. It looked pretty beat up so we were obviously not the 1st to experience this. The lobby bar charges $8 for a bottle of beer. The food is so overpriced that we went elsewhere to eat. Its the typical "we have you here so now pay up" attitude that ruins San Juan for many people. On the plus side, most of the staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “Has it's ups and downs, but will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: CM90
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Puerto Rico August 1st through August 6th and I read reviews on here and on different sites for where to stay at. My parents have stayed in Puerto rico many times before and the Caribe Hilton is where they stayed at, so despite some of the negative reviews we booked our stay here. Upon arriving at the hotel both parents commented on how "run down" the facility has become. The staff, except the valet parking guys, are extremely rude and don't seem to care if you're there or not. The major upside for this hotel is that it has a private beach, it has the most restaurants on-site than any other hotel is San Juan, and they have a spacous lobby. Two days into our stay we got trapped on their elevator for 30 minutes. The call button in the elevator wouldn't work. My dad was in the lobby so we had to call him so he could notify the front desk that we were trapped in their elevator. And this hotel has MANY issues with their elevators apparently because right before we left that elevator got stuck on the 7th floor this time with someone else and the other elevator likes to let people off on the wrong floor. I emailed the H Honors people, and they said they would get back to me within 48 hours...but still no response. Hilton doesn't care about their guest. But while we were here we went touring some of the othr hotels so we could decide where to stay in the future...my opinion is to book at the Intercontinental. It is a very nice hotel and the staff are ALL VERY nice to you, they treat you like you're a guest instead of garbage like Hilton does. DO NOT STAY AT THE CARIBE HILTON, instead stay at the Intercontinental! Another thing is is that their lobby is OPEN which means while you're sitting there and while you're eating breakfast in the restaurants a bird can come and land anywhere! We were eating breakfast in the Palmaras and a bird landed on our table. DISGUSTING. And also, there is no wi-fi available in their rooms, it is only available in the lobby. Hope this review was helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere, do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: MCSCO2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very crowded, they played very loud music on the beach all weekend, the trash from the Hilton beverage service (napkins, stir sticks especially) were found on the beach and floating in the water (this was really upsetting considering the environmental impact, not to mention the unsightliness!), the pools were cloudy, the hottubs were barely lukewarm and actually had a faint smell of urine. I will say that our room - a 1 bedroom suite - was very comfortable and clean - however, it faced a regional airport so we heard planes fly by early every morning, and it also faced a very busy street with sirens at all hours. The breakfast buffet was decent quality (kind of) but was pretty expensive as was most of the food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the tropical atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Momoftwo-23
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, beautiful grounds, nice staff, really enjoyed the stay. Stayed at the Honors tower where the rooms are nicer with a gorgeous ocean view and one of the historic forts. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Way below Hilton Standards.....”
Reviews.Author: KimOp
Reviews.Content: If you expect a nice clean Hilton you will be disappointed. Rooms are very old and need an upgrade. Also, they really don't do well handing things when the hotel is crowded there was a one hour wait for a table for breakfast and meanwhile there were open tables. Hallways had the same dirty dishes and pumpkin seeds that were not vacuumed up for days. Pool was ok and staff was nice but just clearly NOT Hilton quality. I felt more like I was staying in a dirty Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at the CH and in OSJ”
Reviews.Author: Nittany&Fargo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 6 nights in celebration of our anniversary at the beginning of August. We had never been to Puerto Rico before, and I was looking for a hotel close to Old San Juan, but also with a nice beach. We got both in the CH. I scored a nice rate as part of a promotion late in the spring. I reserved a King Villa Stuido in the Condado Lagoon Villas portion of the CH. At check-in, we were upgraded to a larger suite with a full kitchen and right on the water. I am a Hilton Gold member, so the upgrade was automatic. There was almost no line for check-in on a Thursday. The weekends can be a different story. The lobby is beautiful, open, and airy. We enjoyed the parrots. The gift shop was well stocked and Starbucks was always busy. We were awed by the view from our fourth floor room. The balcony was directly facing the fort and ocean so we had a completely unobstructed view. There was a large table, two chairs, and a swivel chair and stool on the patio. We loved the patio and spent a lot of time relaxing there. The bed was very comfortable with a ceiling fan overhead. The kitchen was full size, with a dishwasher, full-size refrigerator, stove and microwave. There were lots of cupboards with pots, pans, plates, everything we needed. My husband especially loved the ice maker in the freezer. The air conditioner was downright frosty. There were only four small drawers, so for a longer stay for 2 people, we did have to get a little creative with where to put our clothes. I think every room must be a little different in the Villas section. The room was very clean, and the daily maid service was fantastic - they always came in the morning, which suited our schedule well. There was also a bar area with stools, and a dining table with 3 chairs. Lots of places to enjoy a meal in your room. A large chair with ottoman was also in the room. The bathroom was tiny, which may have been necessitated by the full size kitchen. There was a makeup mirror and scale. There was also a marble shower stall with a glass door that opened outward. The door was under 6 feet high, so while I had no problem getting in and out, my husband routinely bumped his head on the shower door frame. There was absolutely no hint of mold or mildew smell in the room or bathroom. The hotel itself was very clean. Based on prior reviews, I was expecting dirt everywhere, and it just wasn't so. We saw cleaning people all the time. There are lots of shortcuts that you can take to get around the resort, but it is sprawling and it took us two days to get comfortable with the layout. Therefore, this might not be the ideal hotel for just a one night stay. The beach itself is lovely. The breakers provide for a very large, calm swimming area. There were plenty of lounge chairs around the beach and pool area. We never had a problem finding a lounge chair. Most of the days, the beach was not crowded, but on Saturday, it was packed. I think they get a lot of families there for the weekends only. We never used the lovely sundeck, but I did take advantage of one of the many hammocks. The pool area is well designed with three levels including waterfalls. The swimup pool has whirlpool like jets with bench seating on either end, which were very relaxing. The service at the Atlantico pool bar was very good and everyone was friendly. There are also two heated jacuzzis connected to the pool area. There are also a separate small pool and jacuzzi in the Condado Lagoon Villas area. I knew going in that this hotel catered to families, and as a parent, I have no problem with that. However, as a hotel that is obviously also trying to attract couples, I have one small request. The swim-up pool (the smallest of the 3 pools) should be adults only. And please make one of the jacuzzis adults only. There were kids doing flips from the swim up pool to the second level, splashing, snorkeling, and it just wasn't enjoyable for us. The wildlife area was also a gem - we enjoyed watching the white and black swans, along with the turtles, geese, lizards, and peacocks. The fitness center is one of the best that I've seen in the Caribbean. Everything is new and state-of-the-art Precor equipment. There were 7 ellipticals, 5 treadmills, 4 bikes, along with numerous weight machines and free weights. It opens at 6:00 during the week and at 7:00 on the weekends. We used it every day and loved it. Plenty of towels, water, and sanitizing wipes, too. My husband jogged outside a few days, and thoroughly enjoyed the views. True, the hotel is not within easy walking distance to many restaurants. We did succumb to the temptation of Subway about midway through our trip after a full day of touring old San Juan. The convenience store across the street from the hotel is not a good option for stocking up for the week. We got a few supplies here (including an overpriced bottle of rum), then hit the SuperMax near the Doubletree on Friday. We made the decision to take advantage of the cabs. We enjoy a few cocktails with our meals, so we did not want to drink and drive. What a luxury to have cabs everywhere! The ride from the airport was $19 plus $1 per bag. The ride into Old San Juan was $12 (plus tips). El Morro was $14. When we factored in the price of a rental car and parking, it was MUCH cheaper to take the cabs. As long as you understand the situation going in, it shouldn't be a concern. Tip: the cabs congregate near the end of Forteneza Street and Colon Plaza, so it's easy to catch a ride back to the hotel. We got free passes for continental breakfast at Il Giordino (I think because of the Gold status). There was a huge selection of pastries, breads, fruit, cereals, juices, and even hard boiled eggs. We "upgraded" for $5 one day to try the hot selections, too. There were sausage, eggs, and the usual hot items, but you only get one go around, so we were perfectly happy with our free continental breakfast the other days. Seating was easy most days for breakfast, however the weekend was crazy. The line was out the door for the restaurant next to Il Giordino on the weekend. We had our anniversary dinner at Lemongrass. We ate outside on the deck area and enjoyed dining to the sounds of coqui. I had the angus steak special which was so tender I could have cut it with my fork. The total price was $180/two (including tip), but that included appetizer, bottle of wine, and cocktails (remember, we weren't driving, yipee!). We had to try to Pina Coladas at the Oasis lobby bar one evening. They were quite tasty and I believe under $10, so really just normal big hotel prices. We LOVED Old San Juan. We went into town several nights for dinner. Our particular favorite was the Parrot Club (live jazz on Tuesday evenings). The service there was fantastic, and the Cuban Burger is to die for (hamburger, pork, ham, swiss cheese and impossible to finish). Booty's bar and grill also had the best made from scratch Mojito in town. We toured El Morro early on a Saturday and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The views are amazing, and it is incredible to stand in a structure that was started in 1539. We loved strolling the narrow cobblestone streets of Old San Juan. We took a snorkeling cruise on the "Spread Eagle" which was coordinated through the Tour desk at the hotel. This is a very long day, as the bus picked us up at 8:10 a.m., and we didn't get back until 5:00. But the catmaran crew was excellent. They provided lunch and drinks (except beer, which was available for $2.14). We stopped at two different places to snorkel. One family brought a young toddler (less than 2), and I strongly caution everyone that this is not the place for very small kids. The snorkeling directly off the CH beach was just fine. Lots of fish towards the breakers and along the rock walls. All in all, we thought the staff were all wonderful and friendly and we completely enjoyed our trip. The only thing stopping me from giving the CH resort five stars is that I stayed at the Phoenix in Belize last year, and that sets the standard for five star resorts. Also, the lack of an adult only pool and jacuzzi was a downer at the CH. But other than that, we loved the Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pmramirezjr
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be rated higher. Stayed with family and was pleasantly greeted by staff as soon as the taxi door opened in the driveway. Full assistance with luggage. Small line at registration. Easy registration and booked through discount travel website. The room was very clean and air-conditioned with luxurious bed sheets and mattress. Bathroom was large and updated. Balcony big enough to enjoy the evening breeze with a cocktail overlooking the Carribean Sea and small fort. Very cool. The bar lobby was spectacular and the garden and pool area were lively. Parking and car rental located across the street and Old San Juan attractions are about a mile's hike away. Small beaches also in walking distance. Most restaurants are within taxi distance, maybe 5 minutes drive. No shuttle to airport but a line of taxis always available. The only thing I saw that might be a turn off was poorly maintained hotel hallways. Looks like they haven't painted in a while. However the roof was being replaced on another hotel building so it seems it's only a matter of time before the maintenance fixes it. Besides, you'd normaly spend 10 seconds in the hallways. Who cares? Overall, very pleased, excellent service and accomodations in a great centralized location between Condado and Old San Juan areas.
