Reviews.Title: “Adventures in paradise”
Reviews.Author: trailsofadventure
Reviews.Content: Where to begin. Selections of rooms (type, size, location) is unequaled in PR. This place is huge. Pool-side food is excellent. Bars everywhere, reasonable prices. Fine dining on the premises. Also, a buffet to die for. Tennis, gym, etc. All the amenities. Use the consierge service! Their dining recommendation were right on. Ten days worth. Sophies was our favorite. There is always a taxi waiting to take you to points of interest. Walk to Old San Juan (half an hour to 45minutes), you can eaily spend a day or two exploring the old town. Lots of shopping and dining selection. Or just walk across the bridge to the Condado district for dining entertainment and gambling. You will want to visit the rain forest @ El Yunque National Forest.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel precruise”
Reviews.Author: momof3crazykids
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Caribe Hilton once before in the main part of the hotel. This stay was even better than the last. We booked our stay on priceline and won this hotel for about half price. We booked 2 rooms as there were 5 of us. I HIGHLY recommend you call the day before and the day of arrival if you need something special such as connecting rooms. I think this made a big difference for us. We ended up in the villas and at first I wasn't excited. When I saw the rooms, I was thrilled. They are large with mini fridge and counter with sink. It was really great with kids. The room was clean and very comfortable. The beach area is nice, especially if you have younger kids. The pool is not terribly clean, but it was fairly close to the end of the day and had a ton of sand in it. The grounds and lobby area are really lovely. If you need a place to stay for a couple of nights I highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very accomodating and always gracious. The ONLY off site restaurant within a decent walk is Subway. At breakfast the Subway is at least a 30 minute wait and the folks there aren't too happy about working there. Save yourself some grief and eat in the Starbucks at the hotel for a less expensive, no hassles breakfast. I don't think I would want to stay in San Juan over 2 nights as it is crowded and congested, but it is fun for just a few days. Book this one on priceline name your own price and save a bundle!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel that makes it feel like a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Valyn70
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times for business and have never had a complaint. I always request the tower and I am never disappointed in the ocean view. It has several restaurants onsite including Mortons. Pricey but excellent food! There is also a Starbucks onsite and the staff is very friendly and recognize me so I never even have to order, they are very fast. This location has an excellent view of the ocean with a protected beach area, as well as a nice swim bar area. It is close to Old San Juan and the bridge over the lagoon is now open where you can wak to many restaurants, bars, and a couple of casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, just be prepared”
Reviews.Author: heresangie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of June for almost 2 weeks with my husband and 12 year old son. The line for check in was extremely long when we were checking in, but I never saw a line the rest of the time I was in the lobby. I guess if you hit it at the wrong time (4pm) you will have to wait a while. I did receive a complimentary non alcoholic pina colada while I was in line though. The grounds are really nice and I liked my room and big bathroom. One guest I met in the elevator said he had to move rooms b/c of mold, which I didn't see in my room, but housekeeping wasn't what I would expect staying at a Hilton (dusty ac vents and dirty rugs stick out to me). I know some other people complained about the AC but I found it worked fine and my room was able to get nice and cold, and then warm up if it was too cold. My major issue was regarding the lack of things to do in the area and place to eat. We didn't rent a car because we didn't want to pay for parking at the hotel on top of the rental fee, and thought we could just take a taxi everywhere we went, in an attempt to save money. It didn't quite work out that way. Since the only thing within walking distance was a Subway and a park, we had to take a taxi to go everywhere. After 7 or 8 days Subway got old, and the overpriced (though tasty) hotel restaurants were taking their toll. We did rent a car for one day, and made good use of it. I guess if you're prepared to spend $40-$60 a day on taxis or pay for the parking and try and navigate the roads yourself, you will have a better time. A few more things to mention. *The internet was not free. This is 2011 not 1996 when the internet was new and exciting and something only business people used. Seriously? Charge $5 more a night for each room and then take away the internet charges and provide everyone with internet, no one will know the difference and guests will think it's just one more awesome thing about staying at a Hilton. *The beds were extremely soft and comfy at first. But then after all the walking, my pregnant back began hurting. I have a bad back to begin with, so that may have been it, but the soft and plushness of the bed meant there wasn't as much support. *The fitness center was nice, and my husband used it almost every day. It has all the basic equipment you would see at a gym, and they have headphones to use and plug into the treadmills so you could listen to music or watch tv. I would bring my own headphones if I knew that was how the treadmills were set up. *The showers suck- water pressure isn't great and neither is the drainage. *The pool was a little cold, and I am surprised it's not heated (and I went in June when it was really warm out so that is saying something). Overall, it wasn't a bad trip, I think it was just too long of a trip. I enjoyed the amenities at the hotel, and my son thoroughly enjoyed the pool and beach. The garden area was nice and I enjoyed feeding the fish as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel on the beach close to Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: born4travelCA
Reviews.Content: Nice beach resort with good large rooms all with tile flooring and nice newer looking bathrooms. Restaurant, bar, gym and starbucks onsite. Overall we would stay here again; rooms nice and clean and staff pretty friendly. We did how ever walk in one afternoon and rooms was barely cleaned; shampoo, towels not replaced and we found a full pack of menthol cigarettes next to the bed, hmn.... called housekeeping and the room cleaner showed up and he was very happy since he lost his cigarettes while making our beds earlier on that day. In the his state of excitement he still forgot to replenish shampoo, towels etc. but later on we called housekeeping for the second time and a nice lady came with the missing supplies. Pretty nice staff just took at as the housekeeping department was not quite organized. Good property for older, younger folks, famelies with kids and pretty much all ages! Good value if you can overlook the "little" things that could happen.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Myrouck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton pre-cruise and won this hotel on Priceline. For the proximity to Old San Juan and the cruise pier this hotel is great. The rooms are clean and spacious. Unfortunately when we were there, there was one wedding and several other parties going on. Making the hotel VERY rowdy, busy and loud. We were on the ground floor, garden wing and kept awake ALL night by people talking, running, laughing and even playing the piano in the hallway. Upon requesting a change of room, we were then placed in the Hilton tower, where the atmosphere was tranquil and wonderful. Great bathroom and good beds. You will not need a rental car when staying at the Caribe Hilton, there are many taxis for the short trip to OSJ or the Mall de las Americas. Overall a good value (if won on Priceline). Positive points: Nice landscaping and pool, good location, clean rooms. Negative points: Loud music/people, long lines at reception and the front desk clerks are not very happy with their jobs, it seems. Would we be staying here again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice public areas, gorgeous grounds including garden, pool and beach. The rooms need major cleaning and renovation!”
Reviews.Author: snshn3
Reviews.Content: The first impression of this hotel is that is exactly what you expect from a tropical island. It is airy, open and light. The lobby area just like the rest of the hotel is very nice. The check-in very slow, especially the HHonors line is a joke. It would be faster to go through the regular line. The pools are beautiful, they are big, spacious, and plenty of them. Loved the swim bar. The hotel has a shaded area with lots of hammocks, perfect for a nice nap. My son enjoyed the playground right by the ocean, very nice too. I appreciated the secluded and clean beach. The water was a perfect temperature and the sand nice and soft. The beach could not be beat. The hotel also has a beautiful tropical garden with swans and fish. I also enjoyed a free locker while using the pool since our room was not ready since I was checking in early. As far as the outside spaces I would give this hotel an A. The rooms are a different story, I would give them a D. The only reason why I would not give them an F is because the beds were comfortable and it was quiet. I had room 1466, a balcony ocean view in the towers. The rooms are very dirty, the carpets stained, the lamp shades have multiple holes in them, a wall on the side of the toilet had a big hole, the shower floor had tons of mildew. It was really disgusting. It would not take much to maintain the rooms and keep them clean. The rooms were the worst I have ever seen at a 4 star hotel. In fact, I am writing a letter to their customer service about it. Breakfast buffet was great, the food and the service. Overall, if you stay outside the room as much as possible you will have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for us - Reviews need more context”
Reviews.Author: ILoveLouSee
Reviews.Content: Context: Couple (40 yrs old)...trip alone without our 2 young children. We both have traveled all over domestically and internationally for work and leisure. Looking for: Great location, clean hotel, great pool(s) / beach, good food. Not looking for: major entertainment, party scene, and lots of kids / younger crowd. Facts: 1. If you care about the exterior of the actual building, it does look a bit dated architecturally (but I thought it was fine). 2. Room: We were in the Hilton Honors Tower with ocean view / balcony. Room was large with king bed (one of the most comfortable beds ever), it was clean, air conditioning worked well. Bathroom was large (large walk-in shower with overhead rain shower head and also wall shower head). Were there some minor knicks in the walls from wear? Yes. Did I care? No, I had no plans to BUY the property. 3. Food and drink: Good options? Yes. Good quality? Yes. Expect to spend an average of $60 per meal for lunch and dinner if you're going to have a couple of drinks (beer: $7 / frozen drinks: $12). We ate at Mortons one night for dinner for a splurge - it was $200. 4. Property: LOVED the grounds and pools. You could lay out in well maintained grassy areas, sand/beach areas, or by the pool. A lot to look at and enjoy. The inlet water area was clean and beautiful - many fish to see in the water. 5. Service: Service was perfectly fine in the restaurants (top notch in Mortons). If you needed something, the hotel staff was helpful. 6. Location: Felt very safe (most times you feel unsafe beyond the fenced in property). Close to Old San Juan, which is lovely. It's an easy drive to the Rainforest (we spent the day hiking around). Some observations from previous posts: "It rained our entire vacation" - you can't blame the hotel. Yes, it does rain, but it clears away as fast as it arrives. "Poor service" - if you want an activities director and you're looking for tons of entertainment, pick a different type of hotel (e.g., all inclusive). We got a very good deal on this hotel that included full breakfasts. We didn't have huge expectations based on the reviews, but the negative reviews were off base, in our opinion. Again, know what you're looking for before you book. I scoured TripAdvisor for this trip and have never seen such contrasting positive and negative reviews for hotels as I did for Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time!!”
Reviews.Author: RegSma
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our annivesary and had a excellent stay. We went as part of a JetBlue vacation package so we got a good deal. On our fist day we we're taken care of by Genaro Rivera, Manager on Duty, who helped us to get an early check in and a free breakfast coupon. He and the entire staff were very friendly and accomodating. Housekeeping even gave us 2 free bottles of water on the day we checked out! That was right on time after an morning walk. Food on the resort was very pricey. There is a subway nearby for inexpensive lunch. Take a nice walk over the bridge to Condada for a variety of restaurants. Resort has hammocks, private beach, swans, peacocks (I didn't know that they fly), iguana, fish, birds in a cage in the lobby and much more....

Reviews.Title: “We will return within the next year or two. Great vacation spot!!!”
Reviews.Author: klarock03
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights(4th night free deal with free breakfast buffet and $50 total casino credit-booked through Expedia.com). Cab ride from hotel was $19 plus$1/bag-15 minute ride-we did not rent a car. People drive nuts there, especially the cab drivers. We arrived at the hotel three hours before check-in and the staff was able to get us a room right away. But when we got into the room in the main building it was not a renovated room like we hoped. The room wasn't very clean and the bathroom was falling apart with cracked tile and water pipes coming out of the wall. Thankfully I read a ton of reviews(good and bad) and remembered that people loved the renovated rooms in the tower buidling. The staff was very kind and got us the room we came for-no problem. The room was on the 17th floor and was awesome!!! It was everything a nice hotel room should be at a resort. Finally we were able to start our vacation! By the way the maid staff in the tower did a great job for us. The lobby is very nice with an open air feel to it, and there is free wifi in the lobby. We visited during the rainy season which wasn't bad. It would rain for about 10 minutes every two hours but the sun would come right back out. During the week was my favorite time because it was empty. The weekend did pick up but I never felt crowded. We had the breakfast buffet which is about $22 if not included-the meal was amazing and made to order omletts were great. Most days we had lunch at Subway across the street. Friendly people there and the price is right on...cause it's Subway. We had dinner twice in Old San Juan, once at Senor Frogs and once at Sophia's Place(an Italian resturant named after Sohpia Loren). Good food and staff at both places. We ate the rest of our dinners at the hotel and they were good but very pricey. I understand it's an island and they have to ship in most of the food, but come on now. I'm not a big sushi fan but the sushi resturant in the flower garden was awesome. Great service and food there. We didn't eat much local food but plan on it next time. Had a hard time finding a place to go dancing, which I am kinda glad cause I dance like a white guy anyway. She was kinda bummed though. Senor Frogs only had club music to dance to but no Salsa or anything else. We walked to the San Cristobal Fort in Old San Juan http://www.nps.gov/saju/index.htm and we loved it there. The history of that place is pretty amazing and an eye opener. The walk there was just over a mile. We took the bus back to the hotel which was 75 cents compared to $12 cab ride. Next time we may rent bikes and get around that way. We felt safe in Old San Juan but stuck to the tourist spots and dind't go off the beaten path too much. There were cops there blocking traffic for pedestrians and showing force. Thank you San Juan police! There is a trolly that will take you to many stops in Old San Juan for free. The souvenir shops in Old San Juan were all about the same with similar prices and product. The hotel actually had better prices on some things like T-shirts and shot glasses. This hotel used to have a casino back many moons ago. But now the nearest casino is only a 10-15 minute walk across the bridge to the Marriott-Condano Casino. Our hotel gave us $25 casino credit each. We won some money while playing with their money-gotta like that!!! For the most part we stuck to the private beach at the hotel and enjoyed the swimming pools and hot tubs. The pools were of great size but the hot tubs were small. Bartenders Jose and Fernando were great to us! We enjoyed the hammocks and slept half a day away in them with shade from the palm trees. Both of us snorkled in the water and found two small reefs with tropical fish in them. Copy and paste this link into YOUTUBE if you wish to see a short clip of the fish http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fWWt2SUKXCg We also had a visit from a small but friendly lizard http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AL5-RnmyZGQ again copy and paste if you wish to see the lizard. Drinks were about $10 each so be prepared for that if you are going to drink. There is a small shop across the street that sells water, beer and ready to drink rum. Both of us used this shop often, but it was kinda dirty. Overall we had a great time and will come back here. We found it to be family friendly, with nice guests and the service was right on point. I loved Puerto Rico because most people spoke English, there was no currency exchange, they fly our American flag, and no passports needed. Hope you found this to be helpful. If you have any questions feel free to email me at my youtube channel http://www.youtube.com/user/klarock03?feature=mhee Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Old san Juan”
Reviews.Author: nbad311
Reviews.Content: I brought my boyfriend to Culebra for his birthday, and on the morning of our last full day there, our rented villa flooded and we decided to head back to the mainland a day early. My boyfriend used his Honors points to book us a room last-minute here. It was a very nice stay. As with all Hiltons I've been to, the bed was super comfy. The bathroom was big and fancy. Outside, there are a lot of activityoptions. There is a private area of beach for hotel-stayers, with rental options for kayaks and other goodies. A pier that you can walk out on to. There are two pools to swim in, hot tubs, outdoor bars. We picked up a cab to Old San Juan the next morning and took a 10-minute drive over there, You could probably walk if you had time and energy! The only complaint I had was that the drink prices at the indoor bar were steep - $11 each for a rum & coke and jack & coke. Other than that, a nice hotel. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: FranCarrollton
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this hotel before departing San Juan.. It's just about 15 minutes from the airport. Yes, it's a little pricey, but service is important to me, as well as cleanliness and I always get it here. The small beach is very private and the gardens are inviting. Free Wi-Fi at the Starbucks at the lobby. Security is excelent. Ask for a room with a view or you'll get one that looks at the back of the building..

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Hotel with Private Beach”
Reviews.Author: UpstateNY621
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week's vacation at the Caribe Hilton. Although the reviews state that the hotel restaurants were pricey, the prices were about average for the area. You have to remember it's an island and many food items are shipped here. The hotel was "dated" but was not a bad experience. Typical Hilton Hotel that is sprawling, reminded me of the Hilton in Hawaii. As for the room, we had a room in the Hilton Towers that was clean, modern with a huge bathroom shower. Our view was ocean view but it seems all rooms overlook a "roof" area down below. The beach area is a nice "cove" that isn't too far from the pool with hammocks nearby. One downfall is that there is an abandoned "Normandie" hotel next door. Boarded up windows and broken windows you could view from the beach area. Hilton should but that property as it's an eyesore to their hotel. If you want hustle and bustle, get a hotel in the "hotel zone" just down the road. Many restaurants to go to at night and people walking up and down the street. We had the breakfast buffet which was always very well stocked. I didn't find any problem with service at the hotel, everyone seemed very accommodating, no wait for check in at all and we came in on a Saturday. If I were to go back, I'd probably stay somewhere in the hotel zone as this hotel with it's abandoned neighbor hotel was a bit creepy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pool & Beach Area”
Reviews.Author: LucyLou1010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week on vacation. The pool and beach area are awesome, staff is friendly and helpful especially the Bartenders. Has a very nice open lobby and close to things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMA_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 2 nights before taking a cruise. Great hotel! Many different restaurants to choose from on site. Plenty of chairs around pool and beach area. Room was spacious and very comfortable bed. Great selection for breakfast. Beautiful grounds. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GRITS-TO-GO
Reviews.Content: Although the pool and gardens at this hotel are quite lovely, the staff is less than friendly and the accommodations quite dated. The facility is in serious need of renovation. Not a good value and certainly below Hilton standards.

Reviews.Title: “is not always the same”
Reviews.Author: Yomo_fd
Reviews.Content: changing rooms and always hair in the tub and sink no wi-fi roof paint falling we had to make sure to close the doors it was damage an got stock had to poll every time we left nice people was the exeption i always do in travel the deference was the view and the bar and lobby staff in one gift chop there is this girl named walesca che had more info to offer than the house keeping manager Alex ho need a supervisor to translate last time i spend that much for so

Reviews.Title: “Central location, nice clean rooms but go elsewhere to eat”
Reviews.Author: slexico
Reviews.Content: My husband and I pricelined and by the luck of the draw Caribe Hilton was what we ended up with. Our stay was 9 nights, with my Hilton Honors account they upgraded us to an oceanview room for no charge. We were put on the Garden wing which is what I would recommend, it is on the side of the hotel which has the fort. The Garden view overlooks the small bird sanctuary (which has a beautiful peacock!) and Sweet Grass, it is more private than the other wings. We were impressed by the amenities and condition of the hotel, we caught them painting in different areas during our stay. The pina colada's are good, but $12 a pop- so, go down to Old San Juan for a drink. The food is pretty terrible in the 2 restaurants we tried, but there is so much wonderful food in San Juan that you should not be eating in the hotel (it was the middle of a downpour both of our exceptions- May is rainy season). The best part about the hotel was the location! You are just between the popular beach area and Old San Juan. The Condado beach area I would not recommend to stay in. It is more like frat party than a vacation, crappy food and the Conrad we tried for a drink is loud and cheap. It is a $15 cab ride each way to Old San Juan and it is a hike, it can be done- but, be prepared to be really sweaty!!! San Juan is awesome! My favorite trip everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic pool and facilities... customer service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: Swan-eee
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is great, although it is in a somewhat secluded location. It is important to have a car if you want to tour the island (parking is extra and not that close). The beach is nice and the pool is fantastic. I also highly recommend the breakfast buffet- it is worth the money. They have a great playground for kids and I went to a morning yoga class that was very good. I loved the hammocks in the shade! The only down side was the customer service. It took us at least an hour to check in and to check out and when we called to complain about the some construction noises down the hall from our room they were unresponsive.

Reviews.Title: “Eh. It was ok, but definitely room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: thedutchgurl
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Puerto Rico (but, hopefully not my last) and I did a lot of research on hotels prior, since it was to be my "home" for 10 days. The open air lobby & check-in desk were a nice touch compared with other hotels with a relatively speedy check-in; we got in at 1:00p on a Thursday with only one other person in line before me. Check-in time is 4:00p, I believe, but they checked us in early with no problems. And while I certainly enjoyed the location in proximity to Old San Juan(OSJ), as well as the privacy of the pool/beach areas, there is definitely room for improvement. 1. Initially given an ocean view room in the main tower. Based on suggestions from other guests, I had called twice prior to my stay to ensure that my reservation was for a more recently remodeled room, but our first room was very outdated and dirty room with a slight view of the ocean (the view was surpassed by the sounds of the restaurant vents, cars, sirens and check-in area below our "view"). The wood furniture was warped, splintered and some of the doors to closets/fridge didn't close. I'm short and my knees nearly hit the bathroom door when sitting on the toilet. We were moved to the Garden wing the following day without any resistance & were greeted to a room about 15 years newer (apparently this wing had been remodeled in 2008 or so?). 2. Most of the staff were super friendly & helpful (maybe one person seemed annoyed with my questions). I like to ask locals wherever I travel for ideas on food, shopping, etc. and nearly everyone I asked was more than happy to share their personal recommendations & advice. I truly loved the people of Puerto Rico! 3. Garden view room much more modern. Ask for view of garden & ocean (you will have a balcony over the garden with a fantastic view of the ocean; AND you can be serenaded to sleep by the coqui frogs). Quieter, but still not clean. Hairs covered floor, a/c broken(but they did repair, it just took a long time for the room to cool due to the humidity), patio door lock missing, shower drain plugged, mildew/mold accumulated (a/c not equipped for PR humidity?) 4. No wireless in rooms; not even to purchase. Free WiFi was supposed to be available in main areas. HORRIBLE RECEPTION. I would get a connection for a few minutes, then it would sign off and force me to reenter the password to connect again. Frustrating. It was easier just to find a seat in, or close to, the onsite Starbucks because they had wonderful reception for their free WiFi. 5. Workout facilities were good. But, you have to rent tennis racquets & other fitness items. One would think that the 14% resort fee would cover some of these recreational items. Nothing was free here except for the coffee in the rooms, which was a suprisingly good morning fix for this Seattleite. :) And the Starbucks employees were super friendly & accommodating (i.e. gave me a free pastry when the line wasn't moving & allowed me to fill a cup with half & half for free to take to our room mini fridge for that aforementioned morning coffee). Side note: Starbucks prices were about a dollar more per drink/item than in the Seattle area; prices were the same at all other locations throughout PR, too, so hit up Cuatro Sombras in OSJ. 6. Onsite restaurants very overpriced, although the $15(pre-tax) Hilton Burger was a pretty good substitute for a 4th of July BBQ. :) I suggest researching restaurants in Old San Juan, Condado, etc. Look online at the Travel Channel recommendations (i.e. "No Reservations" or "Man v. Food"), which were better than the suggestions given by the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will recommend to others who will visit PR!”
Reviews.Author: ShellyT2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton (CH) San Juan for 3 nights on a girls only trip, and it was awesome. I highly recommend this hotel. All the hotels in the 'Hotel' area are close in proximity, but when I looked around at the 'outside' grounds of the others, they were not comparable to the CH. It provided the most bang for your buck in terms of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip”
Reviews.Author: jj98
Reviews.Content: This trip was allot of fun. The wife and I went with our 18yr old daughter and her boyfriend as a HS graduation trip and we got adjoining rooms which was a nice set up. Our first night we were in one South facing room and we switched to adjoining the next night on the North face of the building. The views were great from both sides as long as you are up at least four floors. The ocean views are from every room in the large hotel. There are a few other buildings you can stay in that would not provide a great view in some cases. I had high expectations from some "over dramatized" stories that I heard about this hotel, like how it boasted one of the biggest and best nightclubs in San Juan with a huge casino. Both of those things are not the case. The main lobby of hotel walks down into the only primary area that could be considered a 'club' but it was more of a small stage and dancing area with a bar that you pass on your way out to the outdoor pool and beach. It was nice but not nearly as Grand as I was expecting. We didn't find any dramatic night club scene in San Juan, and it wasn't short of asking locals and taxi drivers. Senior frogs in Old San Juan was the only big party scene we found on our Sat-Th trip and it was mostly Regaton music with 99% locals all in Spanish (not complaining, that's just what it was). The casino is a short cab ride across the bridge. I found that every cab ride in San Juan is going to cost about $12-15 dollars, no matter if it's 2 miles or 10 miles away. So if you want to go eat in the 'hotel strip' acorss the bridge you can tack $12 to your tab. The Casino has about 100 slots and six card tables so it's not Grand by any means, but it was in a nice modern hotel. I left $70 up but spent $30 celebrating with two shots of Patron on the way out...lol You can walk from the Hilton but I'd have a couple guys with you since you have to travel past a building under construction thatâ€™s dark and spooky and looks like someone ran out of money on the project... One nice thing about Puerto Rico is you deal in american curency and they have some familiar restaurants like Chili's, a place that hits the belly nicely after eating some interesting native dishes for more than a few days. To save money I walked to the liquor store and stocked up on my favorite spirits which is only about 100yards from the front door of the hotel, purchased a jug, mixed batches of my favorite cocktails filled with ice and brought that to the beach....otherwise you'll pay $15 per drink at the Hotel. I spent just under $100 in liquor and it lasted the entire trip for everyone. The beach area was nice and diverse. Snorkel gear will set you back a rental fee so I would either buy a set at the local store for the same price as one hour and have no limitations or bring a set from home. The snorkeling right off the beach was cool. Tons of fish medium to small, sea urchins, saw a squid or two pass by....but it was nothing compared to the boat rental/snorkeling trip we did out of Fajuerdo. We rented a car for $60 for 24 hours from an independent car rental place located next to the liquor store. It was about an hour drive but a pretty cool one so the time went by fast. There are normal freeways the entire way with mountainous tropical surroundings. The pontoon style boats fit about four normal size people and we all got a chance to drive. We had about 700 lbs of people in our boat so it took a little effort to get them moving full speed within a chain of about five other boats. The sea was a bit choppy for these little boats at times but it made it an adventure and it was allot of fun and we were assured that these they were designed to be almost impossible to flip! One lady opted to travel in the bigger boat that lead us on the way back, everyone else went for it again! The snorkel spots you stop at are in the aqua waters with great visibility. The second stop brings you to the famous island shot in the latest Pirates of the Caribbean movie with the white sands and little patch of trees in the center. Very cool spot. You can relax with some snacks they brought or keep on snorkeling. I did both and ended up seeing a sting ray. So hanging at the hotel beach is cool and all, but this boat trip is what made the trip for us. We took another day to check out Old San Juan. It's about a five minute taxi ride from the Hilton. It's been kept up well and has some pretty cool historical features. This is where the big WW2 bunker attraction is that you can pay a small fee to walk through and catch some great views and learn a little about Puerto Rican history. The old paved roads and architecture is neat in this area. This is where the cruise ships dump everyone off so I would try to figure out when they port so you can either party with more people or avoid to limit the crowds. We avoided. There are a million trinket shops and places to eat. There is an old church you can walk through thatâ€™s pretty neat too. It's worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was so-so but better than others, I guess”
Reviews.Author: Kdflirt
Reviews.Content: I don't think I'm a picky traveler. I know what I like and I know what to expect, especially at a Hilton. I was disappointed with the hotel itself because first off EVERYTHING is over-priced. It was ridiculous. The entire 5 days we were in Puerto Rico it rained. 90% of our stay was inside the hotel/hotel grounds since we were in the middle of a tropical storm. We would wake up at 6 a.m., go straight to the pool area and lay out until 9 a.m. (that's when it usually started to rain). Our room was probably the worst! As a Hilton Honors Member I have experienced a lot of different types of rooms on our vacations. This was something else. We were on the 3rd floor of the old building. Our balcony view was of the air conditioning system for the entire hotel! Our balcony door was broken. It didn't lock. Actually, let me rephrase, there was no balcony. I'm not sure how to describe this slab of tiles. Only 1 person could be on the balcony at a time. It was adjacent to the roof of the restaurants we would always eat at. Here's the best part...there were workers on the roof every single day...all day! We would have to close the curtains in order to get dressed. And the lighting, it was pretty poor. It actually sucked. Bathroom was creepy because it was very old and outdated and disgustingly dirty. Nothing against the housekeeping staff, just obvious that some corners were cut. I actually have waited over a month to post this because I didn't want to post a bad review. But, in the end, this is what it comes down to: hotel room sucked, everything was over-priced and upon check-out we were notified that there is a 14% resort fee...for EVERY SINGLE DAY you are there. Not for the total trip, so basically we got ripped. I didn't like that aspect because I don't mind paying resort fees to be on a resort. There were never any activities planned, especially due to inclement weather. All we could do is roam the resort indoors, hit up the Starbucks and sit in the lobby for free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: AdrienneSender
Reviews.Content: Loved my recent stay at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. Very beautiful when you walk in- you see the pool area immediately. Everyone was really friendly and helpful. The rooms were really nice and we had a balcony. The hotel has restaurants and a starbucks. It was a good mix of couples, singles, families. We (2 girls) felt safe in the area. The location seemed cleaner and less trashy than Isla Verde's commercial strip. The location is withing walking distance of Condado, and about 5-10 minutes by car to Old San Juan, but about a $20-$25 cab ride to Isla Verde or the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Amazing...!!!”
Reviews.Author: joseha63
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed all expectations. From the doorman to the front desk, there was absoluetly no complaints. You get almost an exclusive treatmeant as if you were the only one in the hotel. Everyone was very friendly and seemed very sincere as if they really take pride in their jobs and the hotel, specially Mrs. Glenda Rivera who went out of her way to make my stay as comfortable as possible. She is just amazing, not only she helps on any situation or needs, she makes sure that every need was taken care of and followed up on. Love you Mrs. Rivera...!! (And she is beautiful...and hot......upsss..!!) The room was amazing with a view of the ocean on one side and the San Geronimo Fortress on the other. The bed has a comfortable firm mattress and your head just melts into the pillows providing you with the best night's sleep ever! The location is superb!!! As you walk in the hotel you actually forget you are here to work and the view of the pool, the pool bars, the ocean, the hamocks, invites for a vacation instead of a business trip. Staying at this hotel is just an amazing-espectacular experience. It just have everything Puerto Rico has to offer. Sorry to be so long winded but I just want the staff to know how appreciative I am of their outstanding hospitality and service. Giving this hotel 5 stars would simply be an underating.....!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler10026
Reviews.Content: I think that FAMURattler and my family were at the Caribe Hilton the same week because my family's experience was exactly the same - horrible from the minute we arrived!!! We also arrived on a Sunday. However, it was not busy at all. Despite this, no one greeted us or gave us any information about the hotel's amenities. At this point, we were disappointed but were looking forward to our beautiful room with an ocean view. To our great surprise, we were sent to a completely filthy and smelly room with a view of the roof and partial ocean view. Of course, we returned to the front desk and requested a clean room with a view of the ocean. This is what we had paid for after all. But, did we get this? No!!! They sent us to an even worse room. I have no idea how this was even possible. Again, we returned to the front desk and agreed to go to the original room they had given us because we had pre-paid for the hotel. We were trapped in this dump!!! And, to top it off, we had to wait about an hour to get into our room because the card key did not work. Did they even offer us water or something during the wait? Nope! We literally waited in front of that room until a staff member was sent to fix the door. How about that!?! Regardless of our experience upon arrival, we tried to be positive. We thought that the service would get better. Did it? Nope!!! It just got worse. Everyone that we encountered was extremely rude and unprofessional. For example, we went to eat breakfast at Las Palmeras on Monday morning. When we arrived, the hostess was having a personal conversation with another employee. Instead of greeting us, she completely ignored us and continued her conversation. At some point, my sister politely interrupted and asked if we could be seated. The hostess gave us a dirty look, made a rude gesture, and told us to follow her. Once we got to our table, she immediately left without saying a word and continued her rudeness. This behavior repeated itself during the our entire stay of six days. Needless to say, we will never go to Caribe Hilton or any Hilton hotel ever again!!! And, Caribe Hilton is responsible for truly ruining our entire trip and left us with no desire to ever return to Puerto Rico!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with a staff that went above and beyond.”
Reviews.Author: alice449
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Caribe Hilton last month. We had a tremendous view. The restaurants on site had great food and friendly staff. The infinity pool was beautiful and fun for my 8 and 9 year old daughters. The beach area was hotel-only accessible with a swimming area that was very safe and calm but still had beautiful fish and snorkeling. It was a quick cab ride to charming Old San Juan restaurants and shopping. My daughter lost her beloved stuffed animal and the staff was very compassionate and understanding and did everything they could to find the lovey and make things right! A week later, the manager sent it home to us via Fed Ex with a letter and photos from the stuffed animal explaining that he was sorry he had to stay behind and vacation there himself! I cried. I would tell anyone that this is the best place to stay in the San Juan vicinity. And we did visit many beautiful hotels in the area. The other hotels were beautiful, but their beaches were not as calm as the Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay in 10 years, terrible start to first stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: FAMURattler
Reviews.Content: I typically stay in a hotel once a week for business and/or personal trips. I've stayed at both mid-range properties (Marriott Courtyard, Hampton Inns, etc.), to higher-end locations (Intercontinental, Four Seasons, Waldorf, etc.). Based on my years of experience with hotel stays, I can honestly say that my experience at the Hilton Caribe San Juan was one of the worst hotel experiences I've had in about 10 years. My first complaint is regarding the service my family and I received upon arriving at the hotel. We arrived on a Sunday, which I later found out was typically the hotels busiest day. It was a madhouse, but this was no excuse for the lax attitude of the staff. After a long 3.5 hour flight and 35 minute drive to the hotel, we were greeted by a traffic jam of cars and buses at the hotel lobby entrance. I saw more than enough adequate staff to handle the volume of cars and visitors, but no one seemed to be leading the staff or the guests. I saw some bellhops helping guests, but no one ever came up to our car to assist, so I finally just hopped out of the car and unloaded my own luggage. While my wife went to check-in, I walked over to the valet and requested that they park my car. Isn't the valet supposed to greet you upon arrival and offer this service? I would expect better service for $20/day parking. Once we checked-in a received our room number, I then had to walk over to the bellhop station and request luggage assistance. Again, I thought the bellhops were supposed to great the guests, not the other way around! The bellhop supervisor didn't even ask for my room number. I had to ask him if he needed it. Had I not done this, I don't know how we would have gotten our bags. Prior to leaving for San Juan we were somewhat concerned about the quality of the rooms based on many of the Hilton Caribe reviews on tripadvisor.com. Thus, my wife had exchanged several emails with Hilton Caribe and Hilton Corporate staff to request a clean/upgraded room. This also includes several email exchanges with Nitzamarie Escalera, who you can see has responded to many posts about the Hilton Caribe on tripadvisor.com. We were assured that we would be booked in a clean/upgraded room. My wife is a bit picky about hotel room cleanliness. I am not as picky (I travel too much for business to worry about that kind of thing), I still prefer a clean room. So with that in mind, after spending about an hour in the lobby, we were finally able to go up to our room in the Hilton Caribe tower. What a disappointment! The room was filthy, even by my standards. Specifically, the baseboards were caked with grime and dust. I wiped one down with a wet wipe and it was black with months of gunk and grime. The rug clearly and not been vacuumed. The room had a tile floor that had obviously not been mopped. There were large food crumbs in corners. There were visible crumbs and dust on the entertainment system under the television. The air conditioner vent leaked water from the ceiling to the floor of the room. Overall, this room was not representative of any Hilton property I'd ever stayed in. When we called the front-desk to complain, they did immediately send a supervisor from housekeeping to inspect the room. She gave the room a quick once over, and sent someone up to clean the room. The guy they sent, did a quick spot clean on a few areas on the floor, vacuumed the rug with an ancient vacuum that spewed toxic fumes/dust and left. I still ended up wiping down the base boards and surfaces of the room myself (he couldn't be troubled to do that). Even the hallway entrance leading to our room was filthy. There was debris all over the floor. It was as if the vacuums that housekeeping used didn't work at all. This whole process had wasted about an hour of our time and we still didn't have our bags! I had to go back downstairs and again ask the bellhop captain to send someone up with our luggage. I should also mention that just about everyone we encountered at the hotel (valet, bellhops, housekeeping) I found not to be very friendly or helpful. Whenever we requested assistance it seemed like we were "bothering" the hotel staff. In our previous emails with Nitzamarie Escalera and Hilton corporate, we'd gotten the sense that the staff would really go out of their way to make guests feel welcome. However, this was not the case at all. To sum-up our nightmare at this hotel, after our experience at check-in we finally decided to throw in the (dirty) towel. We ended up driving across the bay to the Conrad Hilton to see if their rooms were any better. Of course, before leaving, it took us about 30 minutes to get our car out of the Hilton Caribe valet. We found that the Conrad Hilton, while also showing it's age, was quite a bit cleaner and more organized than the Hilton Caribe. After speaking with a helpful manager at this property we were able to get one of their few remaining double rooms. We then went back to the Hilton Caribe, packed our bags, and checked-out. This whole process took about 4 hours, note that we'd been up since 5 am to catch our flight to Puerto Rico. What a wonderful way to start our first trip to Puerto Rico!! Overall the Hilton Caribe is a very old property and is showing it's age very badly. Having an older hotel does not have to be a bad thing, if the owners of the property keep the hotel in good condition. This hotel is falling apart. I will say that they have one of the better locations/beaches in the area, but I still would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but damp and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Nichie2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice upon pulling up. Open air lobby, with immediate assistance from the desk staff. We were upgraded to a room on the lagoon side, and had a nice view of the water. BUT...upon entering our room, we immediately commented that it smelled musty, and was damp. We only stayed one night, before leaving for a cruise. The bathroom was very large, and offered a soaking tub, as well as shower, double vanity and separate toilet area. We wouldn't walk barefoot in our room (which I generally don't anyway), because the carpet felt damp, as did the bedding. The next day when we unpacked in our room on the ship, we noticed our clothes were actually wet as well, and had a slightly damp smell to them. The grounds were beautiful, and very large. There was a garden area with a Koi pond, swan and a peacock wandering around, a large pool area with swim up bar, and there was an old fort right in front of the property (Which is gated, so you can't enter). Overall, a nice stop for the night, but wouldn't want to stay for the whole week.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LUGIAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I just checked in the hotel and I'm here for business. I will be here for 7 days. Unfortunately the hotel was not what I expected from a Hilton property. The carpet in the hallways leading to the room was old. My room had dirty grout around the tub. There is pink gum stuck to the wall by one of the beds. I had lunch in the main bar area near the lobby and the floor was filthy. I witnessed a bird fly around the room and it pooped on one of the chair cushions. :o( I'm really not looking forward to be being here 6 more days. On a positive note, the staff is very nice and the bed linens look clean. I think that will help get me through. Also, I'm glad I'm not paying for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good family place”
Reviews.Author: gl05151999
Reviews.Content: The price was excellent for my family of five. Driving from the airport to the hotel i thought what did we get ourselfs into, the surronding city is pretty run down and rough looking. Once inside the resort we felt relieved. The food is extremely expensive especially if you have children with you. The only saving grace was the Pina Colada Club, the staff is excellent and the food is great. Lemongrass is way over rated and while there dining four seperate people complained about either their food or drinks. The italian place wasn't much better we have 5 different waiters and they kept screwing upp the order wouldn't recommend it at all. We never had the breakfast as we would go to starbucks every morning, which is also pricy. Overall i enjoyed the hotel , my family loved the beach and the pools and all the reptiles running around on the grounds. Maid service was a little slow which didn't really bother us unless we were out of towels. The staff were friendly and helpful. Also there is a subway right around the corner if your looking for some cheap food and a little convience store that has some things but not much.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: PapaGrande_1
Reviews.Content: Great lobby, amenities and location. Room was rather run down, and dated. But for the price, reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Jujubean1918
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip where we spent two nights at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan prior to getting on a cruise. The hotel itself was nice and the location was good - it's fairly closed to old San Juan. There is a private beach and a very nice pool which we really enjoyed. However, we were disappointed in the service. When we arrived and checked in, our keycards weren't working and it took awhile to resolve that issue which was a frustrating beginning. The concierge staff seemed brusque and didn't enjoy answering questions about getting around old San Juan. The staff at a restaurant on site, The Pina Colada Club, were all terrific and the food was really good at this casual restaurant. For the amount of money for the Hilton, I think that they should provide better service. If someone is planning to stay in San Juan for more than 1 or 2 nights, then I would recommend finding a better property, such as one of the really nice hotels along Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Jaybird528
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The lobby/front desk is awesome because it is all open air. Though the view from our room was pretty poor, our room was perfectly acceptable, and certainly expected for the great price we got it for. The bathroom was beautiful and the TVs were huge! It's kind of loud at night, but this is to be expected at most places in San Juan. One problem we found was that it isn't close to many restaurants like hotels across the bay in Condado, but there are several nice ones within the hotel. The grounds are immaculate and gorgeous. The private beach, pool, and other outdoors areas are excellent and the Caribe Hilton has so much more outdoor space than other hotels. Overall it was a great stay and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Z3NsMom
Reviews.Content: Just got home today, july 5th 2011. My husband and I stayed in room 332 with our 2 small children. The view was horrible. Its of the roof and a sliver of the beach. We had our reservations about going on vaca to begin with bc of the bed bug epidemic around the world. After checking the beds and furniture like two mad scientists and not seeing anything bed bug suspicious, my husband woke up on Monday morning with 15 bites on his lower back. We wrote it off thinking it might have been ants from the grassy and sandy areas outside as we sat and watched our kids play BUT THEN he woke up Tuesday with 22 total bites. Obviously he got the additional bites over night as we checked as soon as we woke up to head to the airport. I could bore you with the other negative reviews about this (soooo not like a HILTON) hotel, but we felt this was the most important to share. Safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “A shocker”
Reviews.Author: CentralQLDChalk
Reviews.Content: I am a pretty hardy traveller, but get pretty upset when it comes to value for money. This hotel was nowhere near what you would expect for a Hilton hotel. We stayed a night before and after a Carnival Victory cruise and this hotel put a downer on an otherwise perfect trip. POSITIVES The pool and beach area Starbucks NEGATIVES Both rooms had damp carpets, were old, rusty, felt dirty and various appliances not working. We were told alternative rooms were not available and if we had time we would have arranged another hotel. At 2am one night staff refused to get us another room, so we asked to turn AC off so we could get our 10YO to sleep. Next morning the floor was soaking wet from condensation(and hence the damp smell). Nowhere near enough tables or staff for breakfast resulting in 30 minute wait for a table plus 20 minutes for hot food. 250 dollars for 2A2C in the restaurant with only 4 meals and 1 drink each. FINAL COMMENT We wont stay there again and I am not confident in the Hilton hotel brand anymore. Suggest they spend a bit of money to upgrade the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect PLace on the Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: kiltilad
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in an Ocean View room in the tower from June 9-June 12 before boarding the Carnival Victory. The room and its view were magnificant and I loved the spa shower in the huge bathroom. The hotel staff were very friendly (we especially loved those working in the Starbucks on the groundsw) and the grounds had ample facilities for our entertainment.. We spendt quite a bit of time on the beach and in the many pools other than just strolling through the grounds. We especially loved the rain forest although the peacocks did get a bit loud squawking now and then. Its location is not to far from the airport and the perfect jump off point to visit sites in Condado or Old San Juan. We would definitely make this our regular place to stay when visiting the island.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveltracy
Reviews.Content: Had booked rooms @ the Villas to start with..upon check-in room and bathrooms were just not what I consider "Hilton" standard clean. Had 2 rooms, in one the carpet was actually wet -- when asked the bellhop said it was condensation from the A/C. Carpets were dirty and looked like they hadn't been vacuumed. Went to front desk and they offered to move us to different rooms, but they were about the same condition and the floors were also damp and rooms smelled mildewy. Then they offered to move us to the actual "hotel". We were happier with those rooms but I still was a little unhappy with the cleanliness of the bathroom, should have been better for a Hilton property. Now, the rest of the property was great! Beach area, pools etc were really nice. All in all, we were happy with our stay there, but I don't think I would stay there again if we went back to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute - Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: Sagagil
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have hectic busy lives and try to schedule a Sister Vacay at least 2x a year. Before we knew it, summer was almost over, so we searched the net and booked the Hilton as a last minute choice - turned out to be PERFECT. Great location. - our room overlooked the beach Great staff/service. - staff kept our room expertly clean and sand free AND even the valet staff was extremely helpful in suggesting non-tourist clubs/restaurants/shopping. ;) Great on-site restaurants. - variety of food choices - my sister still speaks of the Sushi she had...LOL...i know odd choice for PR...but it was good. AND I still have dreams of the Soursop Mojito ;) Great private beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach and pool”
Reviews.Author: tkelley000
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Caribe Hilton. We had an ocean view/ balcony on the 11th floor. The room was clean and well appointed. We booked through Travelocity and upon check-in were told we had an unexpected $75 hotel credit--that was nice. There were a couple of drawbacks, if you do not rent a car. Old San Juan is about 1.5 miles away, so it is a bit of a walk. Cabs are about $12 into town, but the local bus is only 75 cents. The hotel food is fairly expensive. Check out the "POWER HOUR" at the Morton Steakhouse bar for a great deal on a lite meal. The local Subway also offers breakfast items--including pancakes and french toast, which we ate at our balcony table.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views and public rooms, rather seedy accommodations”
Reviews.Author: nedhop
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is on the beach, a $20 (pre-tip) cab ride from the international airport. Its grounds, with swimming and wading pools, swim-up bar, and other amenities are large, beautiful, and well maintained. The hotel is made up of at least three separate buildings, one of which is the inevitable "Hilton Towers." The lobby and other public rooms are grand. There are both up-scale and tame souvenir shops as well as four (or more) restaurants. Among the latter is a Morton's The Steakhouse. The lobby also features a Starbucks. Our room, in the Towers was a bit worn as were the corridors leading to it.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton Spa not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Cyleestu
Reviews.Content: Used hair and make up services at the Spa next to hotel for wedding preparation. Person who did my makeup plucked a little on one of my eyebrows to "even them up a bit". She also trimmed the tops of both brows. When I removed my makeup a big chunk of my eyebrow was gone and the hair on both briws stood out like feathers on a plucked chicken! Please don't let them do this to you! As for tge hotel, beautiful grounds, location etc. We booked room 6 months ago -a room with a balcony. Several days before trip we called to double check room & specifically make sure about the balcony and they assured us our room had a balcony. When we arrived we had a room without a balcony. We ended having to pay an extra $50 each night to get what we were told we had booked 6 months earlier - not cool when you are already spending top dollar!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Hilton Caribe”
Reviews.Author: jcoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to San Juan for Memorial Day, and we had a great time at Hilton Caribe. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We love the private beach and the pools. I do think the drinks are expensive, so be sure to hit the package store across the street. It's a cheap ride from the airport to the hotel, so no worries about transportation. It's also very close to Old San Juan if you want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Getting worse with every visit”
Reviews.Author: travelotty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caribe Hilton three times during past 10 months (all for business travel). Service gets worse with every visit. Last time I had to wait for 55 min to check in. Receptionists did not seem to be in a particular hurry with about 20 guests waiting in line, they were laughing and socializing with each other, disappearing in the back office for 10 min at the time, taking 15-20 min to check in a single person, etc. Also, the "first come - first serve" concept seemed to be alien for those receptionists. The whole check in experience was just disgusting. I like relaxing in the pool after long day of meetings. This time I did not even attempt to get into the pool after I saw some garbage (plastic bottles, cups) and vomit like substance floating freely in water. They did not clean it until next morning. I'm already making reservations for my next business travel to San Juan, so I'll probably stay at Marriott, or try Sheraton Old San Juan for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option”
Reviews.Author: PatoyVicky
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately i was on a business trip and wasnot able to enjoy all the amenities. Great pool, beach access, gym, variety of restaurants.room was excellent as well as wifi access. I got free breakfast as i am a gold member of hilton honors. Overall great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Clients, not sure if we will return?!”
Reviews.Author: Irizarry316
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night, 4 day weekend away at the Caribe Hilton. We have been coming here since 2007, so we wanted to go back to a place where we felt comfortable, especially since it was for a short time. We are both very laid back vacationers and don't like to complain about anything, but sometimes you have to say something. here are a few things we noted on this trip. Grounds / Pool: Last stay before this was back in 2009, we noticed a little difference from the food, drinks, and maintenance of the grounds etc, but put it off as just a minor issue or maybe they were not staffed adequately? anyway, still had a good time, and gave them an outstanding review! This time around we definitely noticed a deterioration. The pool was dirty, cups floating inside and on bottom of the pool ground, gum, and other things like needing a treatment of some sort. This is a family oriented hotel, so we expected to see children, (which is always nice) however, the pools were filled with young teenagers, college kids and small children, so much so that they occupied the whole jacuzzi at one point. I don't know what was going on there this weekend, but it was chaotic and felt more like a budget hotel*, not the 4 star they claim. (*when your paying 4 star prices) Room: We originally booked a garden view room thru our travel agent. wasn't really concerned with the view, but more so a decent room. When we arrived, it was way before check in (maybe around 11am) the concierge graciously gave us a different room, i guess to avoid us having to wait for the garden view that wasn't ready till 4pm, which we would have waited for... she "upgrades" us to a partial ocean view. We get to our room, and noticed it was terribly dated (some bldgs and rooms are pending renovations), and our "ocean View" was of the roof of another bldg. We had to return to the front desk and ask for another room, preferably the one we originally had booked if necessary, as long as it was not one of the older rooms. We get the garden view and it was much nicer and definitely had some upgrading done. I don't get why they would have put someone there if you had a better room booked to begin with, or have stayed here before, but my observation in talking to other people we met there that have never stayed at the Hilton, is they probably give the good rooms to first time clients to get them to come back? that is what it appears to me. so i was a bit annoyed.. The garden-view room however was dirty, had food stuck on the desk from previous guest, and hairs on the floor. but again, we still had a great time. just disappointed on how the Caribe Hilton fell off from their original standards. will we return? not sure, alot of hotels in PR to visit. I will not take away the nice people you do meet there that have worked at the hotel for years, so when you come back they welcome you like family, but it is business and vacations are limited for some, so i would prefer to go back to a place that is consistent, no surprises :) hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but away from anything”
Reviews.Author: mauiboundLynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe on a recommendation for 4 days before a cruise. it was nice enough but it was neither at the beaches nor near Old Town. The best part was that the 30 minute walk into town was a great way to work off the great Puerto Rican food we had :-) We had lunch one day and breakfast another at the informal restaurant - which was quite good but wow the prices. We arrived around noon the first day and our room wasn;t ready so we went for lunch. On the last morning we had breakfast. Mostly this was because the hotel is near absolutely nothing so the only choice is to eat on-site when you have bags or are waiting for someone or something. The rooms were nice enough - very comfortable. The free internet was only in the lobby so we spent quite a bit of time there. Get a room as high up as possible - the lower floors mostly overlook air conditioning units. There wer 2 elevators and one was always broken so it was a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Employees”
Reviews.Author: bethv56
Reviews.Content: I was so delighted to have my jewerly returned to me after returning home! I left two bags in the hotel and when I realized this, called frantically to see if I could have someone look for it. The employees were very helpful and did everyting they could. Finally on about the 2nd or 3rd day, I got the call that the maid had turned in the jewelry!!!! I was so happy. Not only are the employees wonderful, but the hotel is beautiful, clean and very comfortable. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: benboyd5
Reviews.Content: The hotel concierge and pools make this hotel great. They are clean and perfect. The rooms leave a lot to be desired. They are dirty and old, but how much time do you spend in the rooms on vacation? If the rooms were much cleaner, I would have given this 4 or 5 stars. Buffet was great, and prices weren't too astronomical. Restaurants were great. Steakhouse was definitely a plus.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms everything else over priced”
Reviews.Author: chocoj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the beds are comfortable, and rooms clean. The staff was very friendly and accomodating The food and drinks are very, very over priced. My suggestion is to buy your beer, pop etc at a store nearby and put it in your fridge in your room. I would also recommend not eating at the hotel. We had breakfast for $14 pp and they only allow you to get the hot foods once (eggs, bacon,sausage). It reminded us of the free breakfast you get at Holiday Inn., definitely not worth $14pp. Their beach and pool area is nice. Can get very crowded as there is not much room for everyone that is booked in the hotel at once.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great resort.”
Reviews.Author: Calliope_123
Reviews.Content: This resort was a lot of fun. Our room was very nice so maybe we had an updated room. We also stayed at the El Conquistador and this place was so much better. The pool and beach facilities were really fun. The pool had several different levels with a swim up bar, an infinity pool, etc. There was a really nice hammock area. Check out the fish feeding area on the dock at night. There is a spotlight on the water and we saw some really big and scary fish come up. I am glad I wasn't in the water. The hotel is very close to old San Juan but I would recommend getting a car. It is very easy and cheap to park in a garage in Old San Juan and with a car, you can avoid eating in the expensive hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NRNYC
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel.the pools are awesome ,the beach is great for swimming ,the grounds are so clean and relaxing.front desk employees were very corteous.we first got there they gave us a room w no view and two double beds.i called the front desk and asked to for king bed .they change my room Right the way and gave not only king bed but an ocean view w a smile.Loved it.the rooms are nice .the bed was sooo comfortable.The drinks at the pool bar was the best ,expensive of course like every hotel.$10 For a Pina colada or mojito.$8 for a beer,$14.50 for a hamburguer .But everything tasted really good.it was a very relaxing weekend :)

Reviews.Title: “Better the Second Time”
Reviews.Author: chsmith
Reviews.Content: My bf and I spent the second week of May vacationing at the Caribe Hilton. We had a great time and aside from the completely unneccessary resort fees the Hilton tacked on since the last time I visited I don't have any real complaints. We had an ocean view room on the 6th floor with a balcony that overlooked the fort on property. The room was clean, quiet and had plenty of towels/amenities. Housekeeping was on top of things - we never came back to an unmade room. The beach and pool area were very clean and had more than enough chairs for everyone. The hotel only seemed to be about 50-60% full so no one had to fight for space. We mostly ate out for dinner but indulged in the breakfast buffet at Palmeras and lunch at the Atlantico Pool Bar. Food and drinks were as pricey as I remembered but portions are large and they don't skimp on the liquor in the mixed drinks. The servers were all friendly and quick (except for beach service where they only had one poor woman covering the entire beach and pool area. She was very nice but getting a drink took forever!) We walked into Old San Juan for dinner twice and I can highly recommend both Barrachina and Marmalade.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for garden view!”
Reviews.Author: dontgrowontrees
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a few days before our cruise to explore old san juan and we did enjoy the caribe very much. We stayed 3 nights in an oceanview room and it was very old and outdated to say the least. However we stayed 1 extra night on the end of the cruise and we stayed in the garden view rooms (new part of hotel) and I must highly recommend staying in those rooms for two reasons 1.cheaper, and 2. Much much nicer than you can imagine. The bed was incredible and the bathroom was very nice as well. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, but only if it were in the garden view wing! Also right as u get to the elevators and go out into the garden there is a little restaurant called lemongrass GO THERE the food and service is very good. Also the garden is very beautiful with peacocks, koi ponds, and all kinds of birds and animals almost feels like your at the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: The open air lobby where you check in is a great way to be welcomed to San Juan and the Caribbean. The hotel property is large and includes numerous restaurants, a massive pool area, and beach. The rooms are large and clean but slightly outdated. Carpet was slightly worn, and bathrooms are large but again a little dated. Beds are comfortable and pillows are firm. The A/C was cold but a little noisy. Halls have that great island smell, a combination of humidity, sun tan lotion, salt water and sand. Only two elevators mean you could wait awhile especially during the day if there's a conference going on. Rooms have balconies and ours had views of the resorts beach and rooftops of historic San Juan could be seen in the distance. The pool is great with pools on multiple levels and swim up bar. Lots of towels and chairs seem abundant enough to handle any size crowd(I was there in slow season). The bar claims to have invented the Pina Coloda but that is up to some debate. Restaurants on site include a Morton's Steakhouse, as well as an Italian restaurant and an Asian/Latin fusion restaurant. Starbucks and other shops(souvenir, shoe, Hertz, etc) are located in the lobby. I liked that the Oasis bar in the lobby isn't open during the day which forces you to the outside bar. On site parking garage is some what expensive at around $14 every time you exit. The staff is great all around, the concierge, the check in staff, the bartenders, the pool attendants, everybody! I'd recommend this hotel and would consider it on any return visit.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience”
Reviews.Author: moondoll12
Reviews.Content: I had been to Caribe Hilton , San Juan on a business trip. Situated right on the beach this is one of the best places in the world to stay in. The ambience and rooms are just perfect and luxurious. I was housed at the 15th floor with an entire wall (the balcony wall) made of glass and overlooking the Atlantic ocean! Very Comfortable beds, clean spacious rooms and friendly staff, willing to give you the best customer experience. There is one thing I cannot forget - It was my last day there and I was checking out in the next hour. I called the reception to locate a microwave to heat up the pizza I had in my fridge. They said the rule is to Book the microwave first and that I needed to go down to another part of the building for the microwave, for which I said "Never mind, I'll eat the pizza cold... I'm checking out in an hour and don't have time". They did hang up but the manager himself came up to my room WITH the microwave and asked me to heat up my pizza!How sweet is that! I really wish I'd asked him his name! The restaurants, shops and pools (hot and cold) are all a delight to indulge in! Check out the official video here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WEKL5IlpBoo This is one of the best hotels - expensive but worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danieatlanta007
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful property and is well kept. As for the room (two queens) it was very clean and in great condition. There's a huge walk-in shower! We were in the "tower" room 864. The view from our balcony was great; it wasn't a straight line of view to the ocean (oceanfront view) but then again we didn't go there to hang out on the balcony. I wouldn't do the buffet breakfast as it cost $27 pp; you're better off with the Starbucks which is on the property, lol. Having a Starbucks on the property was great , and it stayed crowded. There are 4 restaurants at Caribe of which we only ate at two of them; it's pricey. The drinks are excellent and they don't skimp on the alcohol either; you have to get the Mojito which is just perfect. It's only a $12 dollar cab ride to San Juan which is ok I guess; it was way too hot to walk which I wouldn't suggest. Other than that it was a great stay and I'll stay there again in the future when I go back to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed my stay at the Caribe Hilton....”
Reviews.Author: LCinTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 4 nights in May, 2011. We arrived around 10:45pm on a Sat night to the sound of music and to a very friendly welcome from the front desk personnel - Julio in particular. Big smile and very personable. We mentioned in passing wanting to try a mojito...next thing you know - to our surprise - there were 2 mojito's delivered to us at the front desk. My room was in the main tower - very clean, gorgeous view and a bed I wish i could have taken home with me. Did not hear any noise from the other rooms, which was wonderful! You have a small refrigerator in the room, which is a nice plus. Did not really eat that much at the hotel - admit if you do it will be rather pricey. Was nice having a Starbucks right there There were beautiful pools, a private beach, hammocks to relax in, a nice lobby .... made for a great stay, even if it was mostly business :) Based on my experience, I would certainly recommend this hotel. Seems like a nice place for a family visit. If you want the casinos and such I believe you need to stay a bit closer to Old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not a great location in the city”
Reviews.Author: fligirl013
Reviews.Content: I wish we would have stayed at a hotel off Ashford Avenue (about 1.5 miles away, towards the airport, away from Old San Juan) where there are lots of restaurants, shops and bars within walking distance. Caribe Hilton is nice with gorgeous views of the water, a fort and has a small beach area but the only thing within walking distance is a Subway around the corner and 2 convenience stores. It took us 1 hour to walk to Old San Juan for dinner and to tell you the truth I didn't feel safe walking there. A cab ride to Old San Juan is $12 each way, so we payed $30 round trip each time (with tip) just to get there and back. There is a bus stop about a little more than .5 miles away in the park which is only $.50 each way, we just figured this out a little later; and of course you have to wait longer and still walk some. This left us with eating at the hotel some, which is mediocre food for a crazy price. Breakfast is either a $14 per person buffet or Starbucks which is more expensive than your local one. Coffees were $4.50 and bagels were $2.75. Walking out of our hotel there's a run down abandoned hotel next door - the Normandie - with garbage all around. Next to that is an abandoned sports hall of fame and soccer field which is also not be used this season and is gated up and locked. Past that is a public beach/park which isn't kept up or maintained at all. If you are the type to want to relax at the pool all day it's gorgeous. And if you don't mind paying high prices for generic hotel restaurant food it's great too. I would have rather been able to have walked to experience local cuisine and been around the happenings.

Reviews.Title: “Festive Resort - A Bit Musty”
Reviews.Author: jjb415
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Caribe Hilton was for one night only between cruises out of San Juan. As has been the case in my previous stays in various San Juan hotels over 20 years, I encountered some of the friendliest and most effecient hotel employees of anywhere in the world. I arrived at about 9:30am and, as usual for an early arrival, I was informed that my room would be available as soon as possible & was given the necessary documents to begin using the facilites and told about the availability of luggage check. However, after having been without internet access for the week, I used the free wifi from Starbucks in the lobby to catch up on things and my room was available at noon. My room was in the Condado Lagoon section of the hotel, a short walk from the main lobby. At first, I was unable to get the room door open & after a stop at the Lagoon front dest, security arrived to assist. My room was large with a full kitchen and small bathroom. There was the dreaded connecting door to the adjacent room, but, noise was not a problem during this stay. There was also a nice view of the lagoon from my balcony. The room was well-equipped with lots of towels, kitchen supplies, and a comfy bed with lots of pillows. Lots of television stations were available on a large TV.
