Although the air conditioning and ceiling fan made the room nice a cool, it was quite musty in the room, which isn't necessarily a problem in the tropics, but, seemed to cause many fixtures in the room to rust, including waste baskets and some fixtures which could be updated. The Caribe Hilton is a short walk to the Condado area of San Juan, has a great gym with a very friendly staff, and very nice beach & pool area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Coffeemac
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in San Juan. Restaurants are awesome. Only problem is...not 2 much to do @ night. Anyway San Juan is full of night life and a $5 taxi ride will take you there in 5 minutes. Room AC has motion detector and it will turn off in the middle of the night until you walked in front of the sensor. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jgarcia2315
Reviews.Content: During my stay at the Caribe Hilton was one of my best experiences ever. The staff was professional and always helpful. The room was always professionally prepared, and everyone was always so helpful, and courtious. The ammenities are outstanding, well maintained, and very secure. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and plan on returning sometime in the future with my family again. I also had friends of mine reserve a room for their first visit to the island and they couldn't have been more impressed. They also plan on returning sometime in the future. Great job!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach, Great Water!”
Reviews.Author: Cairn
Reviews.Content: When I go to the Caribbean, the most important thing I am looking for is a great beach and great water. The Caribe Hilton has both. The beach is crescent shaped and a good size with plenty of lounge chairs for everyone. It is in the sun from sunrise to sunset, although late in the day (5:30 or 6:00) we moved to the sunny area for the last few minutes of sun in the day. Beach umbrellas and floats are available to rent. The water is warm, calm, clean, clear, and a beautiful blue. It is not stagnant however, the ocean washes over the rock jetty to provide a slow current of calm ripples and a small tide effect. The ocean bottom is beautiful soft rippled sand. It is one of the nicest beaches I have been to in the Caribbean, and I have been to many. The beach is private, so no one is wandering by or bothering you to buy from them. The pool, also beautiful, is nearby and uncrowded. We enjoyed five wonderful days, sitting in the sun, floating or swimming in the ocean and dipping in the pool . Our room was on the 15th floor of the Tower Building facing West, and we had a fantastic view of the beach and ocean, and the sunset. The room was small but adequate, and the bathroom was large with a great dual shower. The common areas need some updating, but we spent very little time inside. The food was average for breakfast and lunch. It is in a great location between Old San Juan and Condado, so we took turns going to both of these areas for dinner. Each one was a five minute, $12 cab ride. It was fun to get out and see other parts of the city in the evening and enjoy a variety of restaurants. I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone, especially those for whom beach and water is a top priority.

Reviews.Title: “Twice but Probably Not Again”
Reviews.Author: 2trvlppl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Caribe Hilton twice, both times with two couples. Depending on the room location, the room can either be hotel good or not so good at all. Rooms are either pretty clean or not so clean. Rooms can be either quiet or too noisy to sleep well. The pool area is wonderful, as is the small private beach area. The drinks are yummy. The dining is expensive and not nearly as good as going into Old San Juan or even as good as a few other hotels. If you want a good, inexpensive breakfast, grab a Subway sandwich right down the street. The concierge desk was actually rude both visits; at first we thought it was just a fluke, but not on the second visit; someone told us that the concierge/tourist desks are contracted by the Hilton. The business center was loud, did not work all the time, and had children using the center. The staff was barely okay; we have experienced so much better in Puerto Rico.We are unsure if we would recommend this hotel; it was recommended to us with the same reservations; too bad there is not a "maybe" choice. This is just an expensive hotel with not particularly good service in a really pretty setting. When we head back to San Juan, we will look elsewhere. In this price range, there are many other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Rocks”
Reviews.Author: TCHenri
Reviews.Content: My friends and I really enjoyed our stay at Caribe Hilton. The rooms are immaculate and the customer service is awesome. We had a few bumps with thinking that we reserved a double bed (which were all booked when we arrived), but Francesca did absolutely everything imaginable to accommodate us. I will definitely stay at Caribe Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “Swimming Bliss”
Reviews.Author: zoeandrobert
Reviews.Content: Stay here for the awesome pool and private beach, as well as the lovely grounds and gardens. This was our first night in PR and they upgraded us all the way to the presidential suite. Even without our luxurious two story suite, the swimming was great, we enjoyed the feel of the open air lobby and were surprised to encounter some wildlife too; fish, birds, geckos, frogs etc. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: lolita041
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again or suggest this to anyone i know or deal with. From the minute we arrived, there was problems. Room was dingy, so outdated, no ocean view, ac did not work, rug torn. Transferred to another room, over the week, the following happened to us, balcony door did not open, housekeeping did not clean, key got deactivated several times, once by an employee by accident, two time we do not know why, toliet overflowed 2x. This is just a few things that happened....Staff has a little bit of an attitude....pool was nice and spa gorgeous.....Would not stay here again or send anyone i know or like$$$$$$$$$$$$$

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Great Service, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: thedcdiva
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend with a girlfriend and was pleasantly surprised. We are both Hilton regulars, and a got a very nice rate for our stay in a oceanview room in the original tower. Rooms were spacious, well appointed, and the view was truly special. While the hotel is older, we found it immmaculately kept. The pool was lovely, and beach was beautiful. Better yet, the private lagoon is great for swimming, even when surf is high. Service was also great. We found all the staff to be cheeful and responsive. Special shout out to the concierge who was especially helpful. Food and drinks were good, but expensive, even for a resort. While we did eat at several of the restaurants on property, but we quickly found a more economical option for drinks. Just across the street from the hotel is a small market where we purchased a big bottle of local rum and some Diet Coke for the same price as two or three drinks at the pool. We also took advantage of the 'Power Hour' special at the Mortons on property. It's a great deal, so I'd encourage others to check it out. Overall, in spite of high prices for food and drink, I would happily return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: FortLauderdale76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from May 13 â€“ May 16. We were in San Juan for a wedding, and it was the first time either of us visiting this amazing island. The Caribe Hilton is a beautiful property right on the beach. While it rained every day during our stay, we were able to enjoy a couple of hours at the pool for a little R&R. Our room was updated and fairly clean (som mildew in the shower grout and around the shower frame). The pool area and grounds are gorgeous and really helped us to unwind a bit. We enjoyed a few meals at the restaurants on-site and each meal was high-quality. While the food is pricy in comparison to the states, the pricing is on par with most tourist-filled restaurants. The service was good. Nobody stood out good or bad. My only service complaint was when housekeeping came to clean our room in the early afternoon we were getting dressed for a wedding. So we asked them to come back later and when we returned to our room that night, it had not been cleaned. In hind-sight, we should have rented a car (though I am not sure if the hotel charges for parking and how much that is per day). Cabs are very plentiful, but they cost adds up. And while the location of the Caribe provides a little seclusion, you really are not within walking distance of restaurants, shops, or sights. A cab to Old San Juan is $12 ($24 round-trip). So if you want to go to El Morro and other historic sights during the day, return to the hotel in the afternoon to rest and clean up and then go back for dinner, thatâ€™s $50. Improvements to the hotel to make it a 5 in my book really are very simple. They should offer free internet service in the rooms, free-wi-fi would be great. Your spending minimum of $120/night and they charge for internet. Pretty lame. A shuttle/trolley to the airport and Old San Juan would be nice as well. While the service was good, it could be great. And lastly, mold in the shower is pretty gross in my book. All in all, I will absolutely return to the Caribe Hilton, price permitting. We fell in love with San Juan during our brief stay, and the Caribe was certainly a part of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ag98
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay there. Nice private beach, Hiltonâ€™s employees were really working to make your vacation easy. There were several concierges available during the day ready to help you with your problems and you could schedule any activities you want. Taxi was waiting for you any minute. Taxi from the airport is $19, to old San Juan is $10, to Condado is $12. I would like to mention the Rotisserie Il Giardino that is located inside the hotel. We went to dinner on our first night just because we were a little bit tired. The service was great. The dinner room looked wonderful too. The food was good but pretty ordinary and pricy. You would not remember the food after you left. In my opinion the food, the service and prices do not connect with each other. The glass of wine was $10. On other day we ordered their take out. Skirt steak with rice was $16. They have different prices for take-outs. This price was closer to the quality of food.

Reviews.Title: “room maids theives”
Reviews.Author: pvtpepr
Reviews.Content: 2 yrs ago stayed there.they took 2 dresses and when i called they said i could get them back for $35. i never forgot my dresses. my bag was packed but the maid said i left them on the bed...now who leaves clothes behind and never look back to see if you took everything. i was so hurt! the hotel is fabulous and the staff nice but the chamber maid staff are theives! i want to stay there again because of the pools and beach but i cant. hotel caribe is beautiful...BUT THE ROOM MAIDS ARE THEIVES.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with placid beach for small ones”
Reviews.Author: ASN1972
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Beaches near San Juan, including Isla Verde are deep for kids, but this hotel has it's own man made shallow beach that is perfect for babies. That's the main reason I loved this place. No rocks, no rough waves, shallow. Surroundings with faux or real fort remnants and landscaping was beautiful. Other than that, the hotel room and lobby were not anything special. Didn't eat here. Service was so slow at check-out. At least we didn't have to be forced to do valet parking. 4 stars for the beach alone, rest of hotel is 3 stars at most.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise. We miss it already! Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: julchicago44
Reviews.Content: Oh where do we begin? My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Caribe Hilton at the beginning of May for our honeymoon. Our only regret is that we had not planned a longer stay. Check in was easy and effortless, as Hilton Gold members were were provided with free internet access in the room and our choice of 1,000 extra points per night or free continental breakfast (which may have been the only subpar thing on the entire trip...skip the continental breakfast). We were put in a junior suite in the main tower on the 9th floor with a room overlooking the garden/bird sanctuary, lagoon, fort and the ocean. It was SPECTACULAR. I have heard that the hotel is transition in terms of a total renovation. I believe our room was one of the older ones, as some photos I have seen of other rooms look much more modern, but it was completely acceptable, clean, comfy Hilton bed...and again the view was amazing. We quite enjoyed being in the main tower as the elevators let us out right in the middle of the beautiful open air lobby and was just steps to the pool deck. The pools were fantastic. Temperature was great, the view overlooking the ocean was amazing and the swim up bar was a big plus. Hector and Hiram at the Atlantico Pool Bar were AWESOME! Drinks are pricey...$12 each, but if you get the pitcher for $39 it's a much better value and they are delicious. They will even store the pitcher in the freezer for you if they have room...so the rest of your drinks won't melt in the sun. We ate twice at the Pina Colada club. This is the least expensive dining option at the resort and actually has good food and great drinks. We enjoyed the Pina Colada and Passion Fruit drinks. They were only $8 & $9 and a little bigger then those at the pool bar, I think. The jerk chicken quesadilla is not to be missed, especially if you like spicy food. The spicy sauce that accompanies it is yummy! Saturday there was live entertainment outside by the pool and a party in the lobby bar with music at night. The lobby was very lively even at 1am -- but not loud enough to impose on your stay while in your room. There is a liquor store and a subway across the street from the main entrance if you want to grab a sandwich or mix some drinks in your room and save a few bucks. Most will find it more convenient to take a cab to visit Old San Juan as it's a few miles down the road, but we walked back after dinner one night and it was doable. Going the other way to Ashford Ave was a breeze, view a bridge that had a pedestrian walkway over the Condado Lagoon. In about a mile or so you have access to plenty of bars and restaurants -- lots of dining options. I had spent a good amount of time talking to other travelers and reading through posts on the travel forum of this site and many made it seem like the Caribe was to far to walk to anything. My husband and I did not find this to be the case, particularly if you are used to a city environment where you walk several blocks to get from point A to point B. We enjoyed the fact that the resort was tucked away, had a private beach and more privacy in general, yet a walk over the bridge and a 1 - 1.5 mile walk gave plenty of options. Dining options were expensive on site, but no different then other hotel restaurant options we've stayed in. Mortons Steakhouse has a great happy hour with very reasonably priced drinks and appetizers, try to catch that! The front desk personnel were very friendly. Jose in particular was a joy. We also happened to be at the hotel while the Best Buy event was in town and unlike the previous reviewer did not have any issue getting drinks at the hotel bars, etc. Maybe we got lucky, but just wanted to note that. Our friends were in town the same weekend and stayed at the Marriott. There was more of a night life feel in their lobby with the casino, etc. but the Caribe was definitely more resort like and had much prettier grounds. Everywhere you look you can see the ocean surrounding you, there are iguanas and other lizards walking around, the bird sanctuary and large koi pond was beautiful. They really have thought of everything. Starbucks in the lobby, as well as some other boutiques for shopping. We had an amazing time and are already planning our next trip... To everyone at the Caribe Hilton, we thank you for the best trip ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jackson442
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Caribe Hilton 4/26-4/30. Jr Suite with nice view. Julio at the front desk make the trip however by being very accommodating and professional with all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Could Use Improvement.”
Reviews.Author: athomas8705
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the beginning of May. The day we got there, Best Buy had some party there. That was fine, except they took over EVERYTHING. I couldn't even get a drink at the bar, there were signs outside of all the bars saying they were reserved for Best Buy employees only, and regular hotel guests were not allowed until 11pm. What kind of crap is that? I paid tons of money for this, and to have that on the first night, and to have tons of sales people totally hammered wandering around the resort. Not acceptable. Also, Hilton, you need to not charge people for internet use. You guys make enough money to be able to have free internet use. I've stayed at tons of hole-in-the-wall hotels that have free internet, why can't you? Also, be prepared...the restaurants at this resort are VERY expensive. Two drinks will cost over 20 dollars. If you want cheap eating, venture into Old San Juan, or the just east of the Condado Beach area on Avienda Ashford. This resort is pricey. Other than that, it wasn't bad. I'd stay here again, with hopes that Best Buy, or another company won't come and take over everything.

Reviews.Title: “Miss It Already”
Reviews.Author: KAB4375
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5 day stay at the Caribe. We went for my boyfriend's birthday. The hotel is a little old but very nice. The open air lobby is really cool. We upgraded to an ocean view not sure if it was really worth it. The pool area is great. Lots of seating. The beach area is nice. The restaurants are a little pricey. Had the birthday dinner at Mortons. They went above and beyond to make my BF's birthday great. They printed out menus with his name on them, they took our picture and gave it to him with birthday wishes and they gave us a free dessert. I also recommend the Lemongrass. Great atmosphere and the food was great. If you are a cigar smoker them seemed to kick us out during the day but at night was able to smoke with no problems. We also used our balcony to smoke on.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, pleasant and clean”
Reviews.Author: wbru83
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that a company event was taking hundreds of rooms, the service was crisp and the commons areas were very navigable. I had a great hamburger by the pool and enjoyed the Starbucks in the lobby. My colleagues and I all got upgraded into suites and the valet parking service was prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Great, family-friendly luxury resort!”
Reviews.Author: PamMomVacationer
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6-year old daughter, and I recently got back from a 5 day stay at the Caribe Hilton. We had an awesome time and would definitely return! The pool and grounds are lovely. If you are traveling with children, the hotel has a perfect combination of pool and beach. The beach is gentle enough for toddlers. The pool area is beautiful and great for adults and children alike. The hotel provides day-old bread and bagels and kids can feed the tropical fish that swim just beyond the barrier rocks. My daughter could have fed the fish all day long. The hotel has a beautiful garden where they keep a variety of birds including peacocks. My animal-loving daughter visited them at least twice a day. The hotel lobby was open-air and beautiful. The lobby and lobby bar were great places to just hang out. The restaurants were expensive so we only ate at one, the PiÃ±a Colada Club, which had very good food. As part of our vacation package we had free continental breakfast, which very good too. The breakfast had a self-serve latte machine which had such good coffee that I did not need to visit the Starbucks that is on-site. We rented a car from Alamo for $24 a day and it was well-worth it to do site seeing and to go off property for dinner. The hotel is really convenient to Old San Juan and parking in Old San Juan is really inexpensive. We drove the hour it takes to get to El Yunque, the only rainforest in the US National Park system. We like to hike and hiked to see some waterfalls. It's not often you can go through a rainforest and my 6-year old just loved it. After hiking, it was great to come back to a beautiful hotel, take dip in the pool and sip mojitos! Our room was located in the Condado Villas section of the hotel. We had a beautiful view of the ocean and the skyline of the Condado hotel area. The room was nicely appointed and always clean. Our only issue was that it was a long walk from our room to the main hotel areas. Overall, we totally loved the hotel and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect: Upscale but casual.”
Reviews.Author: Noonan187
Reviews.Content: Just 10-15 minutes from the airport, this luxury hotel is situated on a beautiful beach. The lobby is open to the air as you walk in which makes it breezy and welcoming. There is a always water with fruit to quench your thirst. I don't usually lounge out in lobbies, but I did here. It's a nice spot to take a break from the sun and read or chat, with lots of comfy chairs and couches. Outside there is a nice big pool and whirlpool. There are giant mattresses, hammocks and lounge chairs with big cushions to soak in the sun. There is a big round deck that juts out into the waves. The Spa and Fitness center is well-stocked and clean. There are 3 upscale restaurants to choose from including a Morton's Steakhouse and their in-house dining is a good selection as well (pretty typically expensive). The rooms are great - big and airy, pillows just right, nice big comforters, and great views. The only problem I had was with Internet service. It went down at about 5pm and did not come back up by the time I was leaving the next day... only a problem if you're there on business (which I was). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family vacation”
Reviews.Author: bostontraveler201175
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Caribe Hilton last week with our 2-year old son â€“ what a great place to stay for all ranges of travelers â€“ couples, families, business people. Beautiful private beachâ€¦good sand, private cabanas. Lots of activities â€“ kayaking, surfing, etc. Our son met a lot of other little kids his age to play with. The pools are great too â€“ multiple pools on different levels, waterfalls, hot tubs, etc. The restaurants were truly FIRST RATE â€“ we did not have a bad meal the entire time we were there. GREAT Asian cuisine at Lemongrass, and Il Giardino was fantastic as well. Good breakfast setup also. We had a beautiful room with a premium view of the ocean, a small Spanish fort, and Condado Beach. This hotel is perfectly located â€“ on a very scenic beach and about 10 minutes from old San Juan. We went to dinner in the old town a few times during our stay. The clientele at the hotel was very upscale â€“ lots of families, and a number of business travelers as well (there was a medical conference held at the hotel that week). The hotel manager met us personally and made sure our stay was comfortable in every way. The entire staff was friendly and helpful â€“ we couldnâ€™t have been happier! Definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: Ednpat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a great choice if you have it as an option . A little pricey but it is just a beautiful as the pics show. My wife and myself really enjoyed our 4 day stay. the staff was very friendly and helpful. the hotel cleanliness to be commended. We felt extremely safe and welcomed at all times. centrally located, it allowed us to walk west to Old San Juan and east to the Condado, as we decided not to rent a car. I read the reviews before choosing the hotel and will say that the negative reviews must be ignored. We can't say enough about the hotel except that we will be staying there again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: tseidell
Reviews.Content: Pool freezing! Prices out of this world. Draft Beer $9.00, Chicken Finger for kids $16.00. Taxi to downtown $12.50 each way. Hotel dated in older tower. We are Hilton Gold members, placed in awful room, Had to move because of elevator failure and electricity being redone. Name not on breakfast list in morning as promised for free breakfast. Garden tower AWFUL! Carpet peeling up. Spoke to manager to get points back for stay, promised them back then never did it. Had to go through Hilton to get them back. Did great trip to see glowing water micro organisms through Pure Adventure - AWESOME. Nice history but would stay elsewhere next time!!!! Could not even go into pool so cold on 80 degree day!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are willing to shell out some dough for a good time.”
Reviews.Author: Tentita
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right on the water. Great location. The employee who checked me in Lia was awesome and went out of her way to accomodate me. She was very friendly and patient. The room we had in the tower was nice and comfortable. Did not have any time sleeping. The hotel can get busy as I had trouble transferring time to time. However, the manager was very receptive and attentive and made sure I was called back and take care of. They also left me a birthday treat in my room. Taxi rides into town were decently priced at 12 to 18 depending on where we were going (dont let them rip you off, because some will). Hotel was close by. Only thing is drinks and food are very expensive here, average of $15--- but they were very good. The bar food was also not very good. Best deal was the burger and the pitcher of mojitos. Theres a mortons in the place which was good, and also a Pina Colada place which did have the best pina coladas. Music on the weekend at the bar area. Beautiful place to stay. Cant recommend it enough if you are willing to spend the money. Great place to relax. Other comment- the restaurants are closed from 3 to 5 so plan around that. I highly recommend an independent tour guide (with all appropriate licenses). We met during one of our trips to do scuba diving (he was our driver). His name was Hector Caolo Alvarez, caolito@gmail.com. He has a degree in tourism and is a native. He gave us a very reasonable price to go to Ponce. He was friendly, attentive, knowledgable, and flexible. The day trip we took had four of us, two groups. He was accomodating to what each one of us wanted to do. I highly recommend him over the group tour guides. Its a more personal guide at a better price. You will feel very well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Kid/Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: AMc28
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from San Juan after a 6 day stay at this hotel. If you get a good deal I would recommend staying here. Be aware that eating/drinking at the hotel will cost you a ridiculous amount of money. I recommend renting a car. We rented from Enterprise. I was going to rent from Allied, but it seemed sketchy to me. It's right in front of the hotel. Hertz is on property. Old San Juan is within walking distance if you choose to go (you should!). The fact that there is not free wi-fi is ANNOYING, but you can huddle by the starbucks downstairs with other guests to use your computer. We only ate at the hotel twice and both meals were not particularly great, but weren't bad, just pricey. Otherwise the hotel was very clean, staff was helpful. Check-in took a while and seemed like that was a trend for people each day. Do not get a room near the elevator, you will hear it running all day and night. Also get a room above the 4th floor, view is better. If you use concierge services or book tours, it seems that they are very limited in what they offer. What I mean is they work with one or two particular companies and try to push business towards them. I booked most things using tripadvisor recommendations and calling myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lerv925
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Caribe Hilton was great. The service was excellent,the recepcionist, Julio, made us feel at home. The beach,the pool,the food, the garden...all places were beautiful;made for pure fun and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: MegL1234
Reviews.Content: Overall, my husband and I had a great time at this hotel. The rooms were spacious and the balcony overlooked the water and felt very private because there was a full wall on either side (rather than just railings so that you are looking at your neighbors balcony). We don't have any children yet but, this strikes me as an ideal place to stay with little kids. There are multiple kids activities and the swiming beach is actually a large lagoon so, the surf is calm and because of the rounded shape it's fairly easy to keep an eye on the whole thing from any angle. There are 3 or 4 restaurants at the hotel and a Starbucks, we didn't eat at all of them but the ones we did try were good. The jerk chicken quesadilla wih spicy sauce at the pina colada club was the best meal I had. The downside is that the restaurants and drinks on sight are pretty expensive and there is not much else that we found off the resort within walking distance. You can take a taxi to old san juan for more restaurants and shoping, it takes about 10 minutes and the cost is 15$. I do have a couple of minor complaints about the service, which is not what I expected from a 5 star hotel with the Hilton name. First, when my husband and I left for the day (around 9:00) I saw the housekeeping staff cleaning other rooms on our floor. I made sure there was no "quite please" sign on our door and when I returned at 3, our room was still not made up. I had to call the housekeeping and request service. The other was when I went to get floats at the pool and the interrogated us about if we had kids, how many kids we had and how many floats we wanted. We were told rath by the crabby staff that told we could absoloutely not have more than 1 per person. Well they are rather small noodle type floats where 1 works for a child but, you really need 2 as a full grown adult. I would have no problem abiding by this policy or going without entirely so that a child could have one. My problem was the manner in which we were treated and the fact that this was monday morning, most weekend guests had gone home, there were a ton of floats and the beach was not crowded by any stretch. You'd think they could lend us 2 floats with the request that we return them as soon as we were finished incase other guests showed up or at least be a little nicer about the whole thing. The other minor issue was that when we went to get cash for a taxi to the airport both cash machines were out of money! We asked both the restaurant and the front desk to please run our credit card for 20$ additional and were told they could not do it because of the credit card charge. Well, I know credit card fees are usually around 5% so I hardly thought that the fee on an extra 20$ would be of consequence for a multi million dollar hotel chain especially considering the price we paid for the room not to mention food and drink. Also, my huband and I offered to pay the fees or more (we would have gladly tipped the waitress 50$ just to have her give by 20$ because we were really in a bind). The bell man did call us a cab which accepted credit cards (most there don't) but, it took a while to get there. Luckily our flight ended up being delayed. Anyways, sorry if these things sound really picky but, when you stay at a resort of this caliber, world class (not just fairly good) customer service should be part of the experience. All and all, if you decide to stay here you will probably have a nice relaxing vacation and not go home disspointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the younger set”
Reviews.Author: Fiveforme
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, would definitely rent a car though. Clean, good food and service. Nice pools and safe beach for young children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service from waiter & front desk, great buffet”
Reviews.Author: jana7227
Reviews.Content: Willie in the restaurant closest to the main pool (the name might have been Palmeras)provided fantastic service 3 days in a row for the breakfast buffet. I told him it was our daughter's birthday & he arranged a special cake and sang for her! The buffet was well-stocked & had a great variety. We stayed in the Lagoon Villas & found them to be roomy. Maria at the front desk there -was very helpful during check-in & in helping us locate local places of interest. The swim-up bar at the main pool provided a great Pina Colada & chicken tender/fry meal. Bring a mask to look at all the fish off the beach (or you can rent one there).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but expensive”
Reviews.Author: TBR0262
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay and for the most part loved the Caribe Hilton. The negative is that for the price we paid I would expect Wifi access in my room free of charge. Everyone was camped out in the lobby where the only free wifi access was. Very annoying this day in age. The food was delicious but very pricey and the drinks were outrageous and no good wine options with the exception of Mortons. The hotel itself was clean, the staff very friendly and accomodating and very conveniently located to Old San Juan. My friend and I traveled with our teenagers and walked into town every day. If you can get a good package I would recommend this hotel. just beware of the lack of access to the rest of the world!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Management staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosedewrigley77
Reviews.Content: I was visiting the island for possible locations to have my wedding. Once I arrived to the hotel lobby, I noticed an obese sweaty man, whom I found later on was the manager, was treating an employee very nasty in front of guests. I was later escorted to the executive offices and when I get to the door, I heard the voice of a nasty person screaming. It turned out to be the person in charge, a Mrs Nadal or Natal. I let her know that I do not appreciate seeing people be treated in that manner. She just shrugged it off and did not care for my opinion. Un be known to her, I am from Chicago, and most of my relatives would have to fly and require at least 30+ rooms. Thanks to my showing up unannounced I have decided to tie the know at the Ritz Carlton, where customer service is priority number one. My suggestion, If you want to see an old angry lady scream at the top of her lungs, or an obese person belittle an employee, then the Caribe Hilton is for you. Conrad Hilton would never have allowed these persons to work in his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views - check out the bird sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: ct-cruisers
Reviews.Content: We had booked a cruise out of San Juan and needed to find a room to stay in for the night before our cruise. We went on Priceline.com and were able to book a night at the Hilton for $120.00. Our room had two queen size beds and it was very quiet. We woke up and spent our morning relaxing and walking the beautiful grounds of the resort hotel. Our room was in the Garden Wing overlooking their nature sanctuary. In the nature sanctuary we found peacocks, geese, ducks, and a variety of fish in two ponds. After that, we walked along the seashore starting at the San Geronimo fort and then along the water to the other end of their property which had wonderful views of the ocean. They have a hammock area and a beach area. We did not bother with getting breakfast as it was $26 a person and we would have plenty to eat on the ship. This is a lovely resort, but the food and drink are at resort prices as well. Old San Juan is a very short taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed at many hotels in San Juan but the Caribe Hilton remains our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Jollyroger11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly situated between Condado and Old San Juan. The room and grounds were clean and beautifully maintained. The staff was warm and responsive. The place can be a bit crowded on the weekends but even so we had a great time. Special thanks to "Jose" the day manager who greeted us every day with a smile and made our stay quite enjoyable. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely but expensive”
Reviews.Author: meeky1964
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights after a weeks cruising for 25th wedding ann dont get me wrong the hotel was lovely but the price for everything was expensive yes I know you pay more in the capital but twelve dollars for a cocktail and nine dollars for a bottle of corona.There is a off licence and a Subway across the road good value. The hotel has a private little beach which is great and the pools are really good also plenty of beds for everyone staff were very nice and friendly we got a garden view room eighth floor excellent there is a resuaraunt called lemon grass definately worth a visit but again very expensive.All in all very enjoyable but wouldnt rush back but worth a stay

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton - All Show, No Consideration For Guests”
Reviews.Author: bobpic
Reviews.Content: As another TA reviewer has stated, this Hilton, does not live up to the Hilton name. There is no consideration offered by the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, Puerto Rico. We made reservation for a post-cruise stay at this Hilton for April 3 through April 8, 2011. I made the reservations in early January, 2011. I requested an early check-in because we had VIP Priority Disembarkation from the cruise ship. I realize that early check-in is not a guarantee. Two weeks before our stay at the Hilton, I called the hotel and again reminded them that we would be arriving early and would like an early check-in if possible. We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 and were told that our room was not ready. We were told to call an extension, (7000), request room status, and check to see if our room was ready. I would call the number and/or check with the front desk several times, and each time, I was told that the room was not ready. At 12:00, I was told that the people had checked out of our room and they were waiting for housekeeping to prepare the room. I checked the room status at 1:00 and again at 2:00; both times, I was told the room is still not ready. At that time, I asked to speak to the hotel manager; and he was not forthright telling me â€œthereâ€™s nothing that he could doâ€�. After another Â½ hour of waiting, I called another hotel to see if they had a suite available for the week, they did. I then proceeded to the front desk and told the salesperson that if a room is not available in the next ten minutes we were going to another hotel. She said to wait, she was going to talk to the hotel manager. Then, magically, a room became available. The room that was offered, was an oversized closet with an industrial view. Rejecting this offer, the salesperson again went to talk to the hotel manager, whereupon they offered us a smaller room. At that point, I cancelled the reservation and we proceeded to the Marriott for our week stay. Waiting for five and half hours in a hotel lobby for a reservation is not what I call customer consideration. When the room was vacated, (at noon), and the Hilton staff knew that someone was waiting in the lobby since 9:30 am to check in, that that room would be given top priority by housekeeping. I doubt very much if we will ever consider staying at a Hilton especially the Caribe Hilton. If this is the type of customer service that is provided before a stay, what kind of customer service can one expect during a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: gimptravel
Reviews.Content: During our recent 2 night stay, we loved the Caribe Hilton. My husbands cane fell over our balcony to the balcony below. It was located and returned kindly and promptly by the wonderful gentleman from security, Jose Colon. My only complaint was the cost of food, a little too pricey for me, but quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to learn how to snorkel”
Reviews.Author: smartymartyMinnesota
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely hotel, but a bit far from the action in Old San Juan. The main reason we stayed there is the beach. I wanted my 7 year old to learn how to snorkel and I remember how great the beach was there with a sea wall protecting it so the waves were very small. This worked out perfectly. She learned to snorkel and kept snorkeling for the whole week on our cruise! It was worth the extra money to stay at this Hilton just so my daughter could learn to snorkel. We all had fun and saw beautiful fish. Yes, the food is too expensive and we had to take cabs to old San Juan, but we could only stay one night and snorkeled as much as we could. It's a great place for that!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton EVER”
Reviews.Author: travelingsmygame
Reviews.Content: I stayed here March 24th with my mother and teenage son. I reserved the room 2 months before our stay, when reserving I checked the "2 beds" option and also left a note in the message box that we needed 2 beds in our room. Upon arrival at 11pm I was told there were no rooms with 2 beds available. Our king bed room was awful. The air conditioning did NOT work and room being on the 3rd floor was very hot. The frame on the sliding glass door was loose and when we opened it it seemed as if the entire thing would fall into the room. Our view was of awful rusty rooftops. Called for room service 4 times before anyone would answer. Breakfast buffet while good was over priced. Bottom line-when I complained at the front desk I was told there was nothing they could do! I have never received service or a room like this at a Hilton anywhere! Shame on you Caribe Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Multiple Visits to Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: rlmcent
Reviews.Content: We typically stay at the Caribe Hilton prior to cruising the Caribbean from San Juan. We tried the Marriott, Condada Plaza, Intercontinental (on Isla Verde), but none can compare to the Caribe Hilton because of its beautiful grounds, great location (near Old San Juan), and the terrific fitness center complete with state of the art equipment. In all of our trips to San Juan we have probably stayed at the Hilton 8-10 times and have goten on a first name basis with some of their key staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location plus Value=5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Pentwater--summerjoy
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on priceline ($90) and hotwire ($123) for four nights, and loved its location. Like the many other beachfront hotels in San Juan, it sits on the (very windy and wavy) Atlantic side of Puerto Rico, BUT unlike the others, the Caribe Hilton gives its clients access to (a) a magnificent, multi-level pool; and (b) TWO beaches protected from the Atlantic by reefs/barriers. The first beach is right on the Hilton property; the second--and better--beach is in a public park adjacent to the Hilton. This park offers swimmers and divers a large, deep (up to 45 feet) protected lagoon that is fed by the ocean. It may be the best place I've ever seen for students who want to complete their open water diving certification (as my daughter did there) as there are several structures that attract a wide variety of underwater life; in fact, diving there, we saw as much life as we did in the open water off Rincon. Two more points re: the Caribe Hilton: the hotel has a very pleasant "open" design that really gives you a good feeling. It also has a first rate, well managed fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Food is very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: saltydogpa
Reviews.Content: Great location. 10 minutes from airport; beautiful property on the coast and lagoon. Stayed in villas section of hotel which needs updating. Only real gripe is that we chose to stay on premises for our whole stay -- eating at the hotel restaurants exclusively -- and boy did we get gauges!!! Meal prices were overpriced. Other that gripe, a very nice place to escape winter!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel! We found it to be absolutely gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: KathyC1
Reviews.Content: After spending a week in Rincon, our group of four decided to spend time in San Juan but had to transfer from another hotel that could not accommodate both nights we were planning to stay. At first we felt inconvenienced, but once we got to the Caribe Hilton we found it to be a blessing in disguise. As soon as you get there you find the staff to be very friendly & accommodating. The grounds are enormous with paths, ponds, pools, beach, restaurants, bars & clean rooms with views that are beautiful. The people we met on our stay were a lot of fun & we even invited a new friend from New York to join our group for sushi dinner (which was excellent). I wish we would have spent both our nights here while visiting San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the Villas!”
Reviews.Author: noblebaigum
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a five night stay at the Hilton Caribe, and overall, we had a really good experience. Some tips to make the most of your stay: -- before you make a reservation online (either directly with the hotel or via any other web site), call the hotel directly to see if they are running any specials. By making our reservation with the hotel, we were able to get one night free along with free breakfast every morning of our stay. -- do not stay in the Villas section! The Hilton Caribe's web site makes it sound luxurious, but the Villas are definitely the oldest and most run-down part of the resort. We had booked our room there, but ended up switching to a room in the main building after being overwhelmed by the musty, moldy air in the Villas. We even looked at other rooms in the Villas to find a "fresher" one, but they were all the same. Despite the high-maintenance start to our stay, the hotel's staff was extremely patient and accommodating. -- there are mini refrigerators in every room, so instead of purchasing too many overpriced beverages at the hotel, stop at a store on your way there and stock up. There aren't any stores within easy walking distance of the hotel, but there is a SuperMax grocery store along the way from the airport. -- if you plan to venture out from the resort, look into renting a car. We went on daily excursions to nearby areas (Old San Juan, Condado, Pinones) and spent, on average, $30+ a day on taxis; it probably would have been more economical if we had rented a car. General thoughts on the hotel: -- it is a bit secluded as far as being within easy walking distance to anything, so be prepared to walk a lot, or take taxis, or rent a car. -- its seclusion, though, does mean that the resort sprawls over a lot of land so you never feel like it's over crowded. -- our free continental breakfast wasn't extensive, but it was totally adequate and was an easy way to start the day. It included: breads, English muffins and bagels; fresh fruit; hard boiled eggs; pastries; juice, coffee. -- free Internet service is available in the lobby only, otherwise it is $15/day

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel, beautiful beach and a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Russ2045
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Caribe for seven nights and truely loved this hotel. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. Housekeeping also kept the room impeccably clean. The grounds are beautifully set up with the pools, the palms, lounges and hammocks, and you are never wanting for lounges, even if the hotel gets a larger crowd on weekends. The soft sandy private beach is wonderful; because of the breakers you still get a current (without the waves) which allows you to swim and enjoy the ocean water without the rough surf that you have at most Condado hotels. The restaurants are good, and the only recommendation I would make would be that the hotel have some live entertainment or dancing for guests in the evening. Other than that suggestion our stay was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & facility”
Reviews.Author: DNA_J_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for last 2 nights of our stay (we were at Ponce Hilton the rest of the trip). The choices in San Juan are either super expensive, run down, or in a congested area. Caribe Hilton is the best bet. It is a large hotel (as are most in the area) but due to its location and set up, it allowed us access to Old San Juan and magnificent settings. The room was larger than in most hotels and very comfortable, but as the last review noted, not all views are good. That didn't bother us, as the grounds were so gorgeous, we got dressed and left! There are gardens to walk in with animals (peacocks, swans, etc) and the pool is exceptional. Didn't have a problem finding a place to 'set up camp.' But....the beach/ocean area was terrific! There rock breakers make it feel almost like an ocean pool. We could snorkel without worry in that area (didn't see as many or as big fish as we would in the open ocean, but didn't need a life jacket and had no worries about undertow, safety, etc). The boys (ours and others) had a ball finding lizards, iguanas, coquis (frogs), etc at day and night. The food there is outrageously expensive, but this is San Juan. There is a refrigerator in the room, so if you have a car, you can buy breakfast to eat in the room, and the staff was super helpful in helping us find alternative restaurants that weren't $20-30/person.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking service”
Reviews.Author: RoogieBoo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently when on a trip of a life time on an 11 night cruise around the Caribbean including three nights (2 nights before the cruise and 1 night after the cruise) at the Hotel Caribe in San Juan. The Hotel is located on the seafront and has a fantastic pool area but that's where it ends. The first disappointment was the room, we had booked a garden view room but instead it over looked a roof. The last night following the cruise again we were meant to have sea views but instead over looked a car park, and were woken up at 6am by construction going on next door. The restaurants were over priced and the food bland. Service is ridiculously slow in all the restaurants and bars but you are still expected to tip 15%. There is a general lack of communication between all the departments. The main agro as we were charged for breakfast despite purchasing half board. When I complained to the Hotel Manager we were fobbed off with the promise that the Accounts Department would investigate it when they reopened on the Monday - that was 8 weeks ago. After not getting a satisfactory response from the hotel I complained to the Hilton head office who promised to look into it. The hotel has offered to compensate half of the breakfast charge as a good will gesture - depsite having already paid for breakfast in the holiday package I feel outraged. Oh and I haven't received an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff at Caribe Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: QuinnieQuinQuin
Reviews.Content: I planned a surprise trip for my boyfriend and got a lot of our friends to go on the trip with us. I spent several months planning this trip with Vanessa helping me every step of the way. Of course, while planning I had people back out at the last minute but Vanessa was so great and let us keep the rate we had already agreed on. We had a little bit of trouble with the checking in and payments, but other than that, everyone one was fabulous!!! A friend also thought he lost his wallet and everyone was so attentive, especially Victor, who gave complimentary breakfast and drinks to my friend while they hunted his wallet down. A valet person found it and we were so relieved! GREAT STAFF!!! Victor and Vanessa are the best! If you ever need anything, I suggest talking to them because they get things done!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Impeccable service. Absolutely beautiful. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: BeachTravelLawyer
Reviews.Content: We booked the trip through a travel agent. When we arrived Hilton could not find our reservation. They hotel was completely booked but they found us a room. Gercef, the front desk clerk fixed us up with a smile on his face. We had a problem in the room that could not be fixed. They upgraded us to an even better room and made the transfer smooth. Every time I approached the front desk clerk greeted me by name, knew my room number and was always helpful and friendly. Over the one week stay we experienced unbelievably good food and service which was not overpriced. One day they had a problem with the swim dock. Several workers got in the water to get it placed in water. One of the workers in a t shirt and swim shorts joked with us asking for volunteers for a free piÃ±a colada. I later saw the same man in dress clothes and standing in the lobby at an event. I later learned that he was the Director of Operations. He was willing to get into the trenches to get the job done. A sign of tremendous leadership and management. I was very impressed. The location is absolutely perfect. Really the only private beach in town. The pool area and fitness facility is top notch. I left my front desk clerk saying I have one more problem. Gercef, I have a serious problem...I don't want to leave. He smiled and said let me see if I can extend your stay. Best vacation I've ever had. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: MikeandMoAustin
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the Caribe since the late '80's and just really enjoy myself every time. The private beach and pools for my children to enjoy, are perfect! Proximity to Old San Jaun is great! Easy access to the airport is a plus. A new experience this past visit was the Morton's Steakhouse...wow, we had an awesome meal! Thanks to all the staff at the Caribe. My family and I really enjoyed our stay. We look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Trip for Ironman SanJuan 70.3”
Reviews.Author: ironmantodd
Reviews.Content: Just to let you know, the people were always pleasant, Great staff at the Hotel Caribe! Cleanliness for the event, 1700 athletes and their families, pretty darn good! Service at Starbucks on property..good. Service at Hotel restaurants...good. Drinks at Hotel bars were expensive, $12 for slushy cocktails but when its hot out price is not an option. Hotel location not bad but you will need either a rental car, a big wallet for expensive taxi's, a good pair of walking shoes because Old SanJuan is a 30 min walk. Buses are also an option too. Condado is about a 10 min walk over the bridge with other dining options at the Conrad Hotel and downtown areas. Don't expect chic in town but you will get chic in the Conrad hotel. SanJuan area has alot of abandoned buildings for one reason or another. I felt very safe everywhere in and around the hotel and every where we walked. Rooms could use some minor fixes, like removing mold in shower, make common hallways a little more welcoming. Sleep quality..i love the smooshy beds and pillows. My partner had a bad back the entire trip. Depends on your sleep style. Fajardo beaches and town are about 45 minutes from the Caribe and not really worth it. El Yunque Rainforest..its a rainforest so expect rain and fog alot! Bring raincoats and change of clothes, don't know if I read that anywhere on TripAdvisor. If the rainforest is fogged in don't expect dramatic vistas. Quick sum up...best restaurant experience DragonFly, best breakfast any bakery. Great place for exercising, runs are gorgeous all the way to forts, cycling is risky so get out early and the ocean and lagoons are endless pools!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Frankieartist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel before going on a Royal Caribbean Cruise. It was most efficient at check-in. The Staff were very welcoming. Our room was clean and comfortable. I would stay there again. The Beach facilities were excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Island hotel”
Reviews.Author: lifeisbutadream77
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel and got a really good deal on price. Hotel was directly on beach and looks just like pictures on website. Enjoyed the Pina Colada Club and the pool side restaurant but had a terrible experience at other restaurant on property, Rotisserie Il Giardino. Service was terrible and the food was horrible and overpriced. Everything else about the Caribe was soooo wonderful that I would definitely stay again but just not visit the Rotisseroe II Giardino. Also be sure to have a car if you stay at this hotel. I suggest not to use the airport rentals because they are more expensive. I used Enterprise around the corner from the hotel and they picked me up and the rental was half the price as the Enterprise at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location! AVOID the WEST facing rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rangerstar
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great pool/private beach and a lot to do outside. the pool is great and the beach area is private and is blocked from waves, so it is perfect for kids. It is only about a $12 taxi ride to Old San Juan. Everything you need is in the hotel, including a Starbucks(although be prepareed to stand in line for about 20 minutes to get a coffee). Rooms and views are terrific! VERY expensive when it comes to food. We ordered a couple orders of bacon and eggs and OJ one morning at our bill was $65. The other downside was that the side of the hotel we were on was on the 14th floor above the garbage pickup. Every morining at 6:30am the beeping and banging started. So if you happen to get a room facing west, dont plan on sleeping in past 6:30am. I would ask for a room on the other side if you can. Other than that, everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4434
Reviews.Content: This hotel is GREAT! Rooms wonderful and staff always friendly and helpful. The restaurants have delicious food and service. The views from the Tower are spectacular! The rooms were kept super clean by housekeeping who did a wonderful job. Our 4 day stay was wonderful and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: alimithani
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best resorts in San Juan area. From Check in to Check out everything was great. The resort has a great private beach for the guests to enjoy. The only downside is that this resort is about 30 min walk - 5 min cab ride from the nearest bar/restaurant. So if you are planing on going out and about in San Juan then this might be a little inconvenience but other then that you wont regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: ellybell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the caribe for one night prior to our cruise. We arrived around 6pm and checked in straight away, our room was upgraded to a junior suite. The room was huge and in the main part of the hotel. Clean and comfortable. The room was a connecting room and we could here some noise from the room next door. There was a balcony overlooking the sea and gardens. Hotel facilities are excellent, Starbucks, restaurants, bars and shops. We used the restaurant for the breakfast buffet. The buffet was a good price and enjoyable. Best part of the hotel was the grounds, which were beautiful and well kept. Pools, beach area, observation area for sea life, tropical garden with peacocks etc. Only negative was checking out, large queues waited around 30mins. This was because another cruise had passengers checking in causing long queues. Enjoyable stay, would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Employees Get A Big 'Thank You'”
Reviews.Author: windieworld
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot, and have had our share of hotel employees who are indifferent to customer service. This place is known for their customer service. One delightful young lady whom we saw working the front desk for a very long shift (I wish I caught her name) responded "I love my job!" when we commented on what a long day she was putting in. When we checked in, a very helpful man named Omar saw to it we had just the perfect room. We were travelling with friends and we love to cook, so Omar saw to it we had adjoining suites and our room had a full kitchen. Perfect! We bugged poor Carmen from housekeeping so much to assist us in getting cooking utensils, but she was unfailingly polite and helpful. The day we were to leave we found out that "The Ironman Competion" was being held, which meant all the streets around the hotel were blocked off by the police for this Triathalon. We were frantic we would miss our flight, as the police told us no cars could go in or go out. Jose, the manager on duty, came to our rescue, and promised that he himself would drive us to the airport if we could not get a cab! Well, the day of departure, Jose was in the lobby assisting all departing guests and ensuring a cab was available for all of us. So my hats off to the employees who do more than just tell you a good restaurant or bring an extra pillow to your room. These folks are A++ in hospitality. (But they did give good recommendations---San Jose Cafe and Dragonfly Restaurant were fantastic). Oh yes, I also want to say the hotel is spotlessly clean, the beach area is gorgeous and beach chairs are always available. The AC in our room was a bit cold and we had trouble regulating it but I would prefer too cold than too hot! The beds are fluffy comfortable with lots of pillows for great sleeping. Did have trouble getting WiFi in the room, but once in the lobby I had good internet access. You do need to ask the front desk for the password to gain access to their WiFi. I highly recommend this resort for the wonderfaul amenities and the top notch customer sefvice.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, great service, great location, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: familyinnh
Reviews.Content: Stayed over school vacation with my ~12 year old daughter. First, I was really happy with Puerto Rico as a vacation location. 80's and sunny every day -- the Caribe has a sheltered beach and beautiful pools with gentle breezes, fantastic food -- both local and high end, lots to do on the island -- historic old San Juan, horseback riding, snorkeling, kayaking in the bio-luminescent bay (a must do), rain forests. Not super expensive, especially by Caribbean standards. The people were very friendly. The hotel was a big, convention-style hotel. Great breakfast buffet -- kids under 12 free, Starbucks, big lobby, lots of restaurants and bars, excellent fitness center, big grounds, nice gardens with swans, peacocks, fish, turtles, etc., lots of activities for adults and kids. Location is on a great calm beach near the airport and convenient to Old San Juan and Condado area. Very good for kids -- shallow calm beach. We upgraded to the "Villas", really just a separate wing of the hotel with slightly larger rooms with a sink, microwave, and bar fridge and separate front desk and concierge. The room and bathroom were dated, carpet stained. The beds were comfortable. The TV was a new flat screen. Staff was extremely accommodating and service was top notch. There is a charge for internet (wired) in the room (free with Hilton Honor Gold), but free wireless in the lobby area. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “The Caribe Hilton is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: fluffo
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 wonderful days at this hotel. This is a large hotel with over 900 rooms and therefore many guests. It was busy, but we never felt neglected. The entire staff was exceptionally warm, friendly and attentive. Our room was in the Tower Building on the 18th floor with an ocean view and large balcony. We could lay in bed and watch the sun rise. What could be better. Our Housekeeper was superb and cleaned our room each morning while we were at breakfast. The Hotel has a very nice beach and pool area with plenty of lounge chairs. The grounds were well maintained and clean. We had two great dinners at their Italian restaurant Rotisserie Il Giardino. Also, a great lunch at the Pina Colada Club. I highly reccommend the "Cuban Ruben" Sandwich. Another plus is that the hotel is centrally located between the Condado area and Old San Juan. We cannot think of any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Service and property beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: RSM1955
Reviews.Content: Eric our Consierge, pointed us to most delightful resturants and attractions. His follow up was wonderful. He'd call us on our cell to confirm, then he'd follow uo to see how our experience was, etc.,etc. Katherine at the front desk was teriffic. She was knowledgeable, and most accomadationg. She actually reviewed our room options before checking us in. Each day we walked by, she would acknowledge us by name and ask how our stay was going. Louis at poolside was like a personal assistant for relaxation. No matter what we wanted, he seened to always be around the corner to help. Judy Merlano, the front desk mgr. resolved a misunderstanding with poise and grace.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!..a must-go!”
Reviews.Author: Moemakdah
Reviews.Content: Im a 23 y/o male from Texas who travelled with 4 friends and fell in love with puerto Rico!..first of all, u don't even need a passport!..just an ID. Caribe Hilton is excellent!..clean, great service, and best of all the best location!..nice beach too Must-go places: zip lining at ecoquestpr.com, la respuesta is a hip local club that's really an art studio, tio Danny is a local salsa club that is awesome!, bed lounge is another great club with hookahs, kayaking and snorkelling at vieques island (go really early to catch the ferry.. Atleast an hour in advance)..eat the brisket sandwich at bili restaurant in esperanza (on vieques island)..eat red snapper at el patio de Sam..and rent a car and drive to el yunque rainforfest to see amazing waterfalls!..also go to old San Juan atleast once!.. Overall I rate my experience a 9.5/10!..yes, really that great..oh and everyone speaks English so that's cool

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: familytravels13
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time here, everything was nicely done. We're Hilton Platinum guests and were treated very well. The kids love the beach cove and the pool, and we liked the pool side service for our adult beverages! There's a warm vibe here and everyone seemed to be having a good time. We will be back next year! It made our vacation this year!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dated rooms and disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: QuietTraveler2
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors Diamond member, I expected more. I called the day before my arrival to inform them that although my profile indicates the preferred choice of king bed, that I needed two beds for this trip, only to find out upon check in that the room had a king bed. My original reservation indicated two beds with an ocean view, and we were given a king room in the Condado villas that looked out to the lagoon (not ocean). We were moved, and the room was o.k. The Hilton beds are always great, but overall, I was extremely disappointed in the overall service. I thought by calling ahead, that things would be handled, but it seems to all have been for naught. The pool beach area is nice, and the location is good. Everything just looks like it could use a bit of updating.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: plymouthtraveler10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there for an overnight before leaving on a cruise. It was beautiful. The location was superb, facilities clean (I loved the cushy beds around the pool area!!). We ate at the Thai restaurant and that was great, we had an 1 1/2 wait but that was our fault for not making reservations. But that was ok, there are enough bars to go to to wait. I really think this hotel would be a fantastic family destination. There was a protected beach area for little ones with plenty of activities to do. I will definately be back, maybe this time I'll bring my kids and my grand daughter.

Reviews.Title: “A nice getaway . . .”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPerk
Reviews.Content: Spent the w/e of March 5 with my spouse at the Hilton Caribe. Loved the grounds and the view around the hotel. We needed a spot to unwind and this is a great location for that goal. The hotel has a nice-looking gym (that we didn't get around to using). Our room was clean and more than sufficient. Our reservation through Expedia included a free continental breakfast and coupons to the Casino at the Conrad Hotel (a short walk away to nearby Condado). Several steps beyond the Conrad is the Ropa Vieja, a nice, reasonably priced restaurant. Keep this place in mind because many of the restaurants in the area, including the ones at the hotel, are expensive. Drinks at the hotel are also pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Location and advertised "tropical gardens" were disappointing; otherwise the hotel was very good.”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Isles
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. On arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite in the Condado Lagoon villas, and it was spacious and comfortable, with a wall of windows and a large balcony offering a partial sea view. (Not a full sea view, although it was described as such.) During our 7-night stay, we found the service to be pretty good, although the valet arrangement for our rental car was a bit disorganized. We enjoyed the Oasis bar in the lobby and we especially recommend the pina coladas! Wifi is available in the lobby only. We had two disappointments, however, because of the hotel's misleading claims! The Hilton website states that the Caribe Hilton features "17 acres of lush tropical gardens" and that it is "ideally situated between historic old San Juan and the exciting Condado area", which are "just minutes away". We were envisioning spending time exploring these tropical gardens, and walking to restaurants in old San Juan. In reality, there's perhaps half an acre of tropical gardens in total if you count every isolated palm tree on the grounds. And the location is not "ideal", it's actually very inconvenient, because there's almost nothing within walking distance. Old San Juan is 2 miles away - "minutes away" by taxi, not on foot. We were constantly taking taxis to Old San Juan or Condado, which cost $12 each way. (Having a rental car didn't help, as there's virtually no parking in these popular areas.) We plan to return to San Juan next year, but we'll choose a hotel that's right in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: songbird47
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in every way! Pricey yes but everything in San Juan area is. If you keep that in mind before booking you will go and have a great time. My daughter and I went and enjoyed the wonderful Aveda spa there everyday. The restaurants were great Mortons was excellent, they serve an appetizer shrimp cocktail that is just wonderful. In fact if you order one to go, put it in your room refrigerator, you can enjoy it on your balony for lunch the next day. The steak was the best I have ever had and is the restaurant pricey? Yes, so expect it. Worth every penny? Yes! Lemongrass is outstanding, we had the meal complete that they offer. It consists of appetizer, main course and desert. Their shrimp lo mein is excellent. We paid $50 each and it was worth every cent. The beach was excellent and sunny early and clouds up in the afternoon. So early is good. Taxis are always readily available but pricey, so prepare yourself. We didn't do tours from here, as we had also spent 4 nights at El Convento and they, upon our request, gave us the name of a private tour guide, James, who let us choose what we wanted to see. He was the best and hired him for the entire day. Our room was clean, spacious, great balcony with ocean view and nice large bathroom. Room service was super. The people of Puerto Rico I have found to be so sweet! Let me tell you this was a trip to never forget! We titled our trip, "The Best of Both Worlds" and it was 4 nights at El Convento in Old San Juan for the old world and 4 nights at Caribe Hilton by the ocean for the new world. It truly was the Best of Both Worlds! So my advice is save hard, believe me when I say this will be a pricey trip and be prepared and you will have an unforgetable vacation! Enjoy! Life is good!

Reviews.Title: “In San Juan, this should be your 1st choice of resort!”
Reviews.Author: loveparadise4
Reviews.Content: This is our 6th time in San Juan, and our 5th time staying at the Caribe Hilton. We stayed in the Hilton Honors Tower this trip, and the room was quite delightful. Full ocean view, and breakfast buffet included daily. The staff is always 100% on target, very courteous and accomodating. At the bar the best bartender around is Victor, at the Atlantis Poolside Restaurant/Bar Arleen is the best waitress! Don't forget to visit Ola's Spa, great package deals!! The only negative thing we can say about our stay was the elevator's in the Hilton Honors Towers have major issues. One was inoperable the entire time, and the other one got stuck 4 times while we were in it for a couple minutes each time. Though brought this issue to the front desk, it didn't appear to be on their high priority list whatsoever to fix. We will stay again for sure...............until next time Caribe............

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, 1st class staff.”
Reviews.Author: wolverines_go_blue
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property several times over the past few years for work and for leisure, my most recent stay being a 7 day vacation. I've always received top notch, 1st class service from the Caribe Hilton staff. There were a few issues during the 1st day of my recent stay. Individually, all issues were minor, but the sum of everything that happened prompted me to file a complaint with Hilton guest assistance. The Caribe Hilton office manager and staff responded very quickly and corrected my issues promptly and professionally. The remainder of my stay was wonderful and all those on the Caribe Hilton staff that I interacted with were 1st class people. This includes front desk, Atlantico, Palmeras, Il Giardino, room service, concierge, and business center. I will definitely return to the Caribe Hilton during future visits to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - not so beautiful service --- mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Ecj5429
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hotel is absolutely beautiful in San Juan. It sits directly on the beach and the water color and cleanliness of the beach are fantastic. The onsite restaurants are very pricey but the quality is great. I am a Hilton Diamond member, so with my stay, I thought I would receive complimentary breakfast. Turns out, the continental breakfast (toast, hard boiled eggs, coffee) was complimentary, but the GOOD breakfast (ie: mimosas and omlette bar) was a $15 upgrade for a diamond member a piece, or $30 a head otherwise! Norton's is right on site and is wonderful wonder wonderful. Some of the best steak I've ever had (and I lived in Argentina) and the servers went above and beyond to make my fiance's 30th birthday special. The front desk and other reception staff however, left much to be desired. Upon checkin, in the VIP line, we were handed our room keys and were hurried away from the desk. Left standing there, we had to stumble around until we found our room ourselves in the back tower. The room itself was spacious, had a great bathroom and nice balcony with a view, great for evening cocktails etc. The room itself was definitely well used, there were burn marks in the carpet from a hot iron falling on it, the carpet in the hallway was all bunched up so that when you opened the door it got stuck and there was a good sized hole in the wall in the bathroom that had a pretty strong breeze coming through it. (not huge issues, but at $300 a night, one would expect to not encounter these kind of issues). The bars at the hotel were very nice, staff was very friendly but they are SUPER overpriced!! Two 10oz beers will run you about $20 without tip. Best advice would be to go directly across the street from the hotel (if you head out near the tropical restaurant on the outside) and buy your beer there. You can get six packs of beer, wine and liquor for much much more reasonable prices. My boyfriend actually proposed while we were there and we requested champagne glasses for our room to celebrate. I called once and was told they'd be right up, called again a half our later, and then finally went to the bar myself and had to go get them since our request was ignored. Two other things to do while you're there: The Condado hotel is within walking distance of the Caribe and it has a great casino. Drinks and food is free while you're there, we spent several nights there before heading out and enjoyed the complimentary refreshments. Also, the Caribe will provide vouchers for $5 match betting on tables and points towards the slots (this really excited my fiance) - we were pretty lucky too! Ended up coming home with a few hundred dollars in winnings. Also, the Sea Ventures Discover Scuba program is AMAZING. We booked it through the concierge right at the hotel (DEFINITELY USE SEA VENTURES) DO NOT book scuba through the guy that has a hut on the beach, he literally takes you out in the cove at the hotel. Sea ventures took us on an amazing trip to Fajardo, Palomino and Palominito (where they filmed Pirates of the Carribbean!) Two dives, lunch, gear and transport for $180 a person, such a wonderful deal. The staff was incredibly nice and accomodating, our driver even took us grocery shopping on the way home. It was my first dive ever and I can't say enough good things about the instructor. He was awesome. Also, check out a restaurant called Budatai, its near the La Concha hotel and the seafood/sushi/ceviche is the best I have ever had. The Lemongrass restaurant attached to the hotel also had wonderful asian inspired cuisine and great service Overall, an amazing trip and beautiful country, I think we'll stay at the La Concha next time (the renovations they did there make it by far the most beautiful hotel in San Juan)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: Troopman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a cruise. We stayed 1 night at the Caribe Hilton before boarding the ship. I had been anxious about our stay based on some of the reviews I'd read and went so far to contact the hotel. Judy Merlano, of the Caribe Hilton, ensured me that there would be no problems and she kept her promise. We stayed in room 457 and it was more than we could have asked for. All the staff from the front desk staff, to the porters, to Hector (bartender), to the breakfast buffet staff were friendly and offered outstanding customer service. The hotel is about a 15 minute taxi ride from the airport and the cab fare was about $ 21. The hotel is located near the Pan American Cruise Terminal and was abouta a $ 10 cab fare. We had dinner at the Mortan's Steak House located at the Caribe Hilton. It's very pricy but the food was outstanding!!!! My husband is a member of the Hilton Honors program and we received a coupon for the breakfast buffet ($15 each). It was a champagne buffet with omelets made to order, fresh squeezed orange juice and just about anything else you could desire.
