The Caribe Hilton offers guests the use of the internet free for the first 1/2 hour. I also walked over to the Fitness Center to use the treadmill. The staff there were very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “A great time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: CamSarKidsTravel
Reviews.Content: I can't remember a better vacation! The hotel is in a perfect location to be the home base for exploring San Juan. Our room was in the Garden section of the hotel and provided a lovely view through the hotel's natural area to the ocean and a fairly private balcony with a small table. Room was clean and comfortable, and complete with fridge, which is very convenient! The pool area was fantastic for our 7 and 8 year old daughter and son - they made lots of friends, and we had a clear view of their activities through all areas of the pool. The beach part was very nice for families as it was calm, and provided decent snorkeling for the beginner - our son loved this feature. The bartenders at the pool bar were so much fun, and we ended up purchasing our drinks by the pitcher, which was convenient and less expensive than by the glass - the margaritas are really good! I suggest using any breakfast coupon and upgrading to the full breakfast - kids 12 and under are free in the full buffet, and the adults are only a $15 upgrade, which is great for those of us who like champagne with breakfast, as it's included on the buffet - self serve mimosas with fresh squeezed orange juice are always a good thing! We can't wait to go back to the Hilton Caribe, the perfect spot for us and for our children!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on the island!”
Reviews.Author: BobbieA
Reviews.Content: The location of the Caribe Hilton is about as good as you can get. It sits on it's own peninsula with private beach, two scenic forts, pools, tennis, spa, restaurants. It is probably the closest "non-city" hotel to Old San Juan, and a short cab ride to Condado area. We had an oceanview room with balcony, and enjoyed breakfast and late afternoon wine enjoying the view. The room was comfortable, the public areas, lobby and grounds were beautiful and well kept. The service was friendly and prompt throughout. Victor is a fabulous bartender, and the lobby bar was pleasant. The service at the outdoor bar was lacking at times. Would give them five stars, except for two little items. Concierge service was not as good as it should have been. The continental breakfast room was bedlam; noisy and not a very good selection. Ended up taking advantage of Starbucks, and the regular breakfast restaurant. But, this is definitely THE place to stay for location, looks and general amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Best Option in San Juan, but skip Lemongrass Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: brownhousechris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton while attending a conference at the big Conference Center (15 minutes walk from the Hilton). My wife and 2-year-old came along for the trip as well. At one point, taking a shuttle bus back from the conference, I ended up riding past all the hotels in the conference block, which were all the major hotels in Condado and Isla Verde, since the Hilton was the last shuttle stop (hence the walk thereafter). From what I saw the Caribe Hilton was easily the best hotel. It's location is fantastic, but it's facilities were obviously superior. The hotel pool and private beach are quite simply fantastic. My wife and kid spent five whole days outside in the sand and water and at the playground, and they never got bored. Anything except a private cabana is free, so you don't have to worry about paying for a beach chair, umbrella, towel or hammock. In fact, they had a guy who comes by with a drill and pops an umbrella next to you in exactly the right spot. From our room we could see the beach at the Conrad down the street, and it was pathetic compared to the beach at the Hilton, which is probably why nobody seemed to use it. We had a room in the tower, which was fine. We had a huge king bed and a crib for our son. The bathroom was updated with a huge shower, and we loved the balcony. At night we could put on of the room's lamps on the balcony and relax and read while our son went to sleep inside the room. We ate at all the eateries on-site except the steakhouse. The continental breakfast was OK, nothing to write home about but perfectly adequate. They could inform you better though about the selections (eggs, french toast etc) that are on display but cost more. The food and drinks at Club Pina Colada were outstanding, we ate there multiple times. The frozen mojito and Pina Colada were amazing there. Definitely eat there if you stay at the Hilton. We also are at Lemongrass, which is the on-site Asian fusion restaurant. It's setting is amazing, inside a gorgeous garden, but this meal was the lowlight of our stay. The service was simply atrocious, taking over half an hour just to get us menus and water with lots of waitstaff seemingly doing nothing. With a young child waiting that long is not fun. My wife and son's meals came out first, while my meal came out half an hour after theirs. They had no children's menu, but cooked up some chicken fingers for our son, then tried to charge us $20 for them! When we complained they reduced the price by half, but still, it's just four chicken fingers. The entire experience was infuriating, which is too bad, since the food was pretty good and the setting was idyllic. I would give this place a pass until they clean up their act, however. Overall the Hilton was fantastic, and we would recommend it to anyone staying in San Juan, since you can both enjoy the beach and also get into Old San Juan easily by bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Caribe has a great resort atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: drbrianjrachmaciej
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Caribe from 2/22/11 until 3/1/11. I was with my five teenage sons. The Hotel has a great resort atmosphere. It is clean and absolutely beautiful. We had a wonderful suite and great views. The boys could go to the ocean, play basketball, or use the pools. Great views and wonderfully maintained grounds. Our only recommendation is that the hotel place more emphasis on two key areas: the initial welcome and the young staff members focusing on the guests rather than their cellular phones. Upon arrival our room was not ready. We waited an additional hour and a half. The welcome staff did not apologize and were not sensitive to the fact that we had just flown and we were tired hoping to get settled into the room. I feel that the welcome is key to your customer service and staff should be more focused on ensuring that the inital contact with the hotel is pleasant and welcoming. Secondly, the young staff tend to be constantly on their cell phones texting or talking. They dont awknowledge guests until they are off their call or finished with their text. Management should make a rule that no cellular phones be used while working. Young staff in the parking garage and around the grounds spend too much time chatting and not attending to guests questions or needs. Overall, I think with these changes the Hotel Caribe could be first rate. We loved the hotel! We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort! Beautiful views, perfect location and fun activities.”
Reviews.Author: Robin329
Reviews.Content: Only a 10-15 minute drive from the airport and a only 2 miles from Old San Juan making this hotel a convenient location! When we first walked in the open-aired lobby and seen the ocean view, I literally got a tear in my eye...It was beautiful! Unfortunately, when we got to our room and it wasn't as clean as I had expected and was in need of updating (carpet, bathroom). After one night in the hotel we killed at least 11 types of ants/bugs. (These were NOT bed buds!) I called first thing in the morning (8 AM) to get moved into another room and the customer service was HORRIBLE! It wasn't until 6 PM that we were in a new room. The manager offered us a discount for a meal after I complained the 3rd time about how inconvenienced we were. A DISCOUNT?! I am sorry that was not enough. I declined the discount and just told her all I wanted was a new room. Once we were moved into our new room, I was able to finally relax. The new room was slightly cleaner and had a beautiful view of the ocean. Most importantly....NO bugs! Another complaint I have is that everything was overpriced, i.e. $9.00 for a virgin piano colada! I also wish they had live entertainment and nightly activities. I also think music should be playing at all times. The private beach area was great! They had a rock wall built in the water to prevent big waves, which was perfect for our young children. The grounds were clean. We participated in many activities on site, such as chess, the playground, rental of kayaks and cabana, lounging on the hammocks, dining, beach/pool, beach toys, workout room, and yoga on the beach! The pools were clean and beautiful. Overall, this was a great vacation and a beautiful resort...Especially for families. I would recommend to friends with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation for relaxation and fun”
Reviews.Author: ftfnyc
Reviews.Content: We needed to get away from the cold for a relaxing vacation with our 8 year old during Spring Break. This hotel was just what the doctor ordered. The facilities, pool, games (particularly oversized chess) for kids, private beach, spa, amazing gym, including trainers, well-maintained tennis courts, were all great. The staff was lovely and went out of their way to be helpful, beyond expectations. The rooms were comfortable and clean. And the fact that the hotel is just 2 miles from Old San Juan (you can jog there) adds cultural interest. We will surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quick getaway from East Coast, GREAT beach”
Reviews.Author: inna6909
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a quick getaway to PR from DC, taking our 14-month old daughter with us. We flew Sat - Wed over President's Day weekend. The location of the hotel is great for a quick escape, it's only 20 min from airport (and a direct flight from DC). We had a garden room view on 7th floor. Very nice view into garden and ocean (although we were looking at old rooftop as well). The beach was very nice b/c of a rock barrier that broke up the waves. Otherwise, the waves would have been way too rough to go in with a baby. This beach was more like a Carribbean side beach rather than Atlantic ocean. Room itself was pretty nice, very comfy comforter. We had a mini-fridge and coffee-maker, just wish we had a microwave. The cleaning people did a great job and left a cute little towel animal in our daughter's crib. Food seemed a bit expensive ($26/buffet breakfast, $30+/dinner entree), so we ate in our room or off-site. We had a rental car ($16/day parking!) and were able to go to grocery store, out of the dinner, to the rainforest, etc. Overall, great family trip and great service at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: zaydebrady
Reviews.Content: Warmly greeted. Thanks Ana to our private chef and Douglas her back-up. Victor and Manuel served us with warm personalities at the bar. Dominque and Eric were very helpful at the concierge. Great atmosphere. Thank you Wanda in the business center. The manager Nelson was exceptionally helpful even with his shortcoming as a Yankee fan.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples and families - Will return every year.”
Reviews.Author: TommyH_NYC
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Caribe Hilton and it was the best trip ever. The hotel's concierge help arrange everything including transportation, activities and dining. The front desk was wonderful and even the general manager (Nelson) was in the lobby personally greeted me and all the guests in the lobby (great welcome when a GM does things hands on). I had a beautiful room in the towers with a great view. Morton's restaurant was better then NYC's and the drinks at all the bars were perfect. The beach and pool area were very well maintained and the staff was friendly everywhere I saw them. I attended a 80th birthday celebration on property with over 50 people and the property attended to the whole group's needs and arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/beach/fitness center/ultra-clean room & exquisite views”
Reviews.Author: CEOtraveling
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton San Juan from 2/18-2/22/2011. Having read many of the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor we were somewhat concerned. Nevertheless, we were extremely satisfied. I am a Diamond VIP Hilton Honors member and have stayed at many Hilton Properties in the US, Canada, Japan, Finland, Spain, Curacao, Costa Rica, etc and have come to expect high quality from Hilton. We stayed in the Condado Lagoon Villas on a high floor. The room was exquisite, large, ultra clean and had a spectacular view of both the lagoon and the ocean. The room cleaning staff was thorough and attentive. The beach, unusually good and complete fitness center, Oasis Bar and Palmeras Restaurant, and concierge are all great. Also, the location is great and only a short cab ride to Old San Juan and other sites; excursions, e.g. to El Yunque, etc. were well organized and easily accessible with pick up and return to the lobby. We enjoyed taking a walk over a bridge across the lagoon to the Ashford Avenue area to Condado. We had a great time and recommend the Caribe Hilton highly!

Reviews.Title: “Dated Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: NYWorldtrekker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hiltonâ€™s Condado Lagoon Villas section, which has additional major drawbacks -- see my separate review of that property. This review focuses on the main resort. - The grounds and pools at the Caribe Hilton are first-class, but the buildings are noticeably frayed at the edges, with lots of awkward and poorly-decorated transitional areas. The whole property has a patched-together quality, the result of too many decades of incremental expansion with new wings and buildings, without ever having mounted a comprehensive redesign. Most conspicuously, there are tons of very dated design elements everywhere you look -- stuff that clearly has been in place since the 50s, 60s and 70s. It appears that management is hoping that youâ€™ll perceive all this as being charmingly retro, when in fact it is really just evidence that theyâ€™ve been stingy with re-investment to the point where the property has fallen well behind international 4-star resort standards. - Check in time is a late and very guest-unfriendly 4pm. The front desk clerk acted as if he would be attempting a move-mountains favor for me, for which I should be exceedingly grateful, to try to get my room ready a couple hours earlier than that. Since they are certainly charging you prices that are commensurate with the finest first-class resorts, I came away feeling ripped off by management who is peddling a product thatâ€™s well beyond its expiration date.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hilton Quality!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationmama77
Reviews.Content: Went school break so the hotel was at full capacity which staff seemed ill equipped to handle. It was chaos upon arrival - no valet; our luggage was left in the lobby for hours without being tagged, our room wasn't ready,on and on. The thing that made us pack up and switch to another Hilton on the other side of the island, was the stained carpet in our room and the fact that the "ocean view" included a view of the dilapidated roof. Skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a sales meeting”
Reviews.Author: MOBX
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here for a sales meeting and mini vacation. Enjoyed the yoga classes on the beach, the views of the ocean from the room. Was impressed with the property, first place I have stayed that had heated bathroom mirrors so they don't develop fog when you shower. Winds were a little unexpected but would be very welcome if it had been warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location. Terrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: Cav0903
Reviews.Content: Rooms outdated and need a fresh new look. Location is prime but the overall service was poor! No sense of urgency from staff. As a Hilton Diamond VIP I waited at registration nearly 30 minutes as Manager Nelson held up Diamond check in line to accomodate his friends. We complained about the time it took the staff to respond to a non-working toilet in our room, 4 out if the 5, and his excuse was simply" we are on island time here, this is not Manhatten!" A poor excuse for the guests that have to wait endlessly to indulge in any ammeneties. Will not be returning. Nelson can keep his " island time" slow and poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property with spectacular ocean views.”
Reviews.Author: nrishard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in one of the villas at the Caribe Hilton. The room was very nice, the staff was nice and we enjoyed our stay. The fact that the hotel is literally right on the ocean shoreline made our stay even more enjoyable. It was also great having a Starbucks in the hotel. The bar is also very nice. We didn't eat on site, but instead enjoyed a steak dinner at Morton's Steakhouse, which is adjacent to the hotel. If we decide to visit San Juan again, we will definitely revisit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They don't treat Hilton Honors Diamond Members like Diamond Members...”
Reviews.Author: Moxy12
Reviews.Content: I'm a Diamond Hilton Honors member for good reason, staying 100+ nights, multiple years consecutively. Not snotty about this status, but it's a fact that I've spent A LOT of time in hotels to earn this tier within their loyalty program. With that time spent, is a lot of money spent also! (for business and personal travel!) I have stayed at numerous Hilton/Hampton/HGI/Doubletree/Embassy Suites/Homewood Suites properties across North America and the Caribbean. I believe I have a healthy cross section of experiences within the Hilton Brand to have a good basis for an opinion, and expectations. Having stayed in major centres such as Chicago, Toronto, Nassau, Ottawa, Phoenix, Niagara Falls, etc.... I've seen Hilton done well... and done poorly. Happy to report- 9 times out of 10 my Hilton experiences have been excellent, mostly thanks to the HH Status, and properties truly valuing my repeat business. I am loyal to a brand, and am happy to recommend the brand to others when I have a good experience. My husband often travels with me, and he also has a standard in his mind of where service should be. Here are some highlights and lowlights of this most recent, 1 night visit to the Caribe Hilton. I do my best to keep the good and bad balanced, where possible ;) Highlights: >easy access to the San Juan Airport, and San Juan Cruise Port >beautiful open air lobby/reception area >nice touch to have a Starbucks on site... offering full range of beverages/merchandise >grounds were beautiful... large pool, large beach, plenty of chairs, etc. >room was clean, no huge concerns, and bathroom was updated/modern >beachfront restaurant was good for a casual lunch, "Atlantico" I think it was called... apx $35 for 2 adults to eat, no alcohol conumed on that bill. Server was awesome. >lockerr ooms/showers were great to use after a day at the pool, and before heading over to the cruise port.... hair dryers are provided, but be sure to bring your own soap and towel! >wifi in the lobby... (if you can figure out the access codes!!) not something they openly tell you at check in, you have to dig for the information it seems! Lowlights: >did not receive upgraded room (but also understand that its based on availability....if they were "truly" sold out that night, fine. Gut tells me they were not.) >free breakfast, also included in HHonors perks= extremely poor food quality, and was nothing more than a highschool cafeteria steam line atmosphere. Hot food items were an additional charge. We did not go for the bait! >If you need to call the front desk for ANY reason... be prepared to be transferred multiple times... The name of the game here is "pass the buck" and this (unfortunately) created a lot of frustration right out of the gate for us. >upon arrival to our room with our bags, the door was actually propped open slightly w/ the lock, lights were on, and we immediately felt somewhat nervous that we were not the only ones w/ keys to the room. Called guest services to get an explanation, got transferred to Security who said they'd look into it, who also passed the buck to housekeeping. Ultimately, NO ONE looked into it, and it was impossible to get it resolved. >no information was provided at check in regarding internet service in room....discovered wifi was not available in the room, and had to plug in to high speed cable. $14.95 charge that required a phone call (or two) to guest services to be resolved, again as HH Diamond Members do not pay for internet access at any property >pop machine on our floor spit out COKE when you selected DIET COKE. Kind of frustrating when you're paying $1.25 for a can. Again, it took a call to guest services who passed the buck to Security who then passed the buck to Housekeeping, who then passed the buck to Room Service. Seriously, all we wanted was the bloody can of coke exchanged for diet!!! LOL! Imagine explaining why you're calling, 4 different times. It gets old. Would I stay here again if given the choice? No. I think there's a lot to be said for correcting problems behind the scenes without transferring a call 3+ times, and forcing the guest to explain the issue three times. The staff seem to lack some basic customer service skills. We did not encounter anyone who was outright rude to us, but they do not have a "seamless" feel to their level of service. I've had exceptional service at Hampton Inn's where the cost is $80 a night. I expect a whole lot more when the cost is triple that!! Some of the best service I've had is when I'm staying on points or free night vouchers, and the hotel is literally making ZERO profit!! Hats off to the rest of the Hilton chain for making HH Diamond a big deal. This property doesn't make much of an effort with it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: SmithT65
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a beautiful layout. A awesome beach, great service,and a great location. And the security was great.

Reviews.Title: “As always, our stay at Caribe Hilton was wonderful and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanFred
Reviews.Content: First & foremost, the staff is incredible -- from the manager Nelson who always seems to making his rounds, to the concierge staff like Eric, to the bell staff like Fratti, the restaurant staff like Harry and the omlette guys too, the tennis pro Carlos, the Spa manager Yvonne. We always feel well taken care of and cared about. The setting is magnificent and wonderfully kept up. The beach and grassy knoll are so relaxing with the attentive men and women who set you up and keep you fed. We love the Lagoon and treasure our mandatory meal at Lemongrass, ah the Tuna Tacos!! We love the atmosphere of no gambling. So Caribe Hilton keep it up and we'll keep coming.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dpb132
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton HHonors Gold member, I get to experience a number of Hilton properties each year. I was particularly excited to make my first visit to San Juan and stay at the legendary Caribe Hilton. Unfortunately, the hype far outweighed the actual experience, and there are some real issues here which should give prospective vacationers in particular pause. First off, and this won't apply to all Trip Advisor readers, but I never felt treated well as a Hilton VIP. I was given a room in the far back of the hotel ("garden rooms"), the Gold/Diamond line at reception was always backed up (see "random charges", below), and the complimentary breakfast requires a $5 "upcharge" if you want any hot items (otherwise it's strictly a continental affair). Given the volume of business this place churns out, they probably don't need to pay much attention to Gold status folks, but it was still disappointing. More generally - there is a real issue concerning the location of the hotel. It's very much by itself, sort of in between Condado and Old San Juan. Unfortunately the location is also a little scary, once you get off property. I'm a young guy and I walked into OSJ at midday one afternoon, and I would definitely not do that again - lots of sketchy characters, abandoned businesses, etc. The concierge told me that they discourage guests from leaving the property at night, period, unless it's in a taxi. So - the bottom line is that there really are no restaurants or other resorts nearby that you can take advantage of, and a cab ride to any of the other tourist districts will set you back $12 (Condado) to $20 (Isla Verde). If you're here on business, as I was, you can write those expenses off, but for a vacationing family it adds up. The service at the Caribe Hilton is, as expected, "island quality". Generally this means friendly but unhurried, to put it politely. However I did have two negative service experiences. One was the housekeepers, who start pretty early (8-8:30) and were unbelievably loud in their hallway conversations. It was to a point where, if I had been staying any longer than 3 days, I would have asked to speak to the Housekeeping supervisor, the maids were that obnoxious. The second was the appearance of random "bellman" and "maid" charges on my bill, which totaled just $7 but completely baffled me as to their origin. I would have inquired at the front desk at check out, but, again, the lines were painfully long. A final note on charges: the 14% resort fee is pretty worthless if you're on business. It doesn't even get you free 1-800 calls or free internet or anything useful in that respect, just amenities at the beach etc. All that being said - the Caribe Hilton is a beautiful property, with a great series of pools and views of the ocean. Some of the restaurants are quite good (I particularly liked Lemongrass) and they do have daily activities like yoga classes, pina colada tastings, etc. There's no casino but there are several bars that stay open late. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel for vacationers - you'd be better off staying in Old San Juan itself, or in one of the two "beach" districts (Condado or Isla Verde). Similarly, I can't in good faith recommend it for business travelers - if my experience is a guide, you won't be the main clientele base and won't receive much in the way of attentive or personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “Public areas awesome, guest rooms tired”
Reviews.Author: slaterinde
Reviews.Content: We found that this resort is in a great location and the public areas are incredible. The guest rooms were tired and badly in need of updating. The only hotel people who seemed friendly at all were the housekeeping staff, the concierge(s), and the tour planning people. All other hotel staff were unfriendly but did not cross the line to being hostile. The woman at the Business Center treated us like we were there to steal something and enforced the '10 minutes of computer time' rule too forcefully. At one point we requested a new room key because one of our cards was not working properly. They simply asked for our room number and gave us a new key; no identification was requested at all! We could have been there to steal other people's belongings - this incident made me feel that the hotel has very lax security standards. Don't use the cabs to go into Old San Juan! Ask around to find out where the bus stop is and use the M3 or ME bus - it's only 50 or 75 cents; a one way cab ride is $12. Getting the bus back is as simple as finding the transportation center (down near where the ships come in) and grabbing the right bus. The hotel staff lied and told us that the buses are unreliable, but we found them to be very reliable. I will recommend this hotel, but with the caveats stated earlier (tired rooms, unfriendly staff).

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: pushkinhoward
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying in Carib Hilton for 8 nights. Itâ€™s a perfect place if you have small children. The grounds are beautiful, ton of things for the little ones to explore and everybody is very nice and helpful. We booked the ocean view room in Hilton Tower but there was a problem with the rug so we moved into Lagoon Villas that we liked much better. Our room had a pretty lagoon view, full kitchen, terrace and plenty of space for 3 of us. It was immaculately clean, new and VERY quiet. Lagoon Villas have a little pool area and the hot tub of their own and it was convenient if we didnâ€™t want to go far in the evening to relax in the hot tub. American breakfast was outstanding and continental breakfast was adequate to what we usually get in resorts as â€œfree breakfastâ€�. It was nice that instead of doing â€œbreakfast includedâ€� they give out vouchers that can be redeemed at Starbucks or used to purchase a discounted American breakfast. Gives you some options. I suppose it would be nice to have more restaurants around but San Juan is a short taxi drive away and food is considerably cheaper there. In general, people complain about food prices too much. We are from Boston and we didnâ€™t think that it cost any more than it would cost to go to a nice restaurant in Boston. We loved Carib Hilton, but this resort may not be for everyone. It is very quiet and family oriented so if you are looking to party, itâ€™s not for you (El San Juan in Isla Verde is the place, we stayed there last year and it was one non stop party :). Overall, we are very happy with our stay. Special thanks to Genaro R. Rivera who was very helpful in organizing our move to the different room.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joedittmar
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Caribe Hilton. The Hotel is beautiful and very relaxing. From the pool and beach area to the beautiful lobby area, we enjoyed every aspect of this hotel. Make sure you try out the restraunts at the Hotel specifically the Mortons and Lemongrass Bistro, AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay pre/post cruise”
Reviews.Author: GypsyOBRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton 2 nights precruise and 1 night post cruise. We were in the main hotel precruise on the 8th floor with wonderful ocean views and a comfortable King bed. It was a nice size room, with a safe, flat screen TvV, Microwave, and coffee maker. Breakfast was included and it had all you could imagine. We were high enough to see the ships come into Old San Juan port and it was a less than 15 minute taxi ride to the port. The post cruise 1 night was in the Lagoon Villas at the Caribe Hitlon. Our room was huge and over looked the lagoon and fort on the side of the main hotel. This room was much larger and newer than the main hotel room, would be a great place to stay with more room if staying in San Juan longer. When checking out their is a seperate desk so less of a line than the main hotel. The pools were very nice and this hilton has a property on the coast with a sandy beach. Plenty of pool/beach chairs with or without shade. All impolyees were helpful that we met. Pictures can be found at my webshots: http://good-times.webshots.com/album/579628410RWUKQJ

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful grounds, Average room”
Reviews.Author: Leftthedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights pre-cruise. We got this room on priceline for a great rate. The grounds here are absolutely beautiful. Pools, hammocks, sun beds, beach - it all made for a very wonderful day. The lobby is all open air, very classy. However when we got off the elevator the hall smelled icky and our room while ocean view was right across from the vending and ice machine. We used my sound machine to sleep. The room looked a bit worn and tired. The bathroom was not the cleanest. We did have a fridge in the room. Because of the area it was a very long walk to anything off the resort. The prices for food were really high. We had lunch at the pool bar - chicken fingers and fries, hot dog and salad for $25, no drink. I would return if I had enough time to enjoy the grounds again. We walked a long way to a Walgrens for snacks and drinks and ate dinner off the property.

Reviews.Title: “Been here 3 times, love it!”
Reviews.Author: Irizarry316
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here 3 times, and each year got better. the service is great, and the hotel is clean and up-kept nicely. We haven't been there since our last vacation in 2009, but would definitely go back. We are doing an all inclusive this year for the first time, and wished they had this option, because it get's pricey having drinks and food at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: oza_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with young children. The hotel was perfect for kids - from sand toys to pool floats to feeding the fish, our kids had a ball. Our room was clean and had plenty of room for 4 of us (in the garden tower).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: RoqueJ
Reviews.Content: At least at the Villas section of the hotel, the rooms are very noisy, have a horrible musty smell, sink backed up, and the bathroom door did not even close. Maybe the non-villa section is better...

Reviews.Title: “Met every expectation for a brilliant respite from New England's winter.”
Reviews.Author: DavidRabbit
Reviews.Content: I fortunately made my reservations to stay at the Caribe Hilton back in November, long before we knew we'd be living through the worst winter in recent memory. Fortunately, i picked the right day to travel, arrived on a Thursday and left on Monday. It was a perfectly delightful experience. The hotel staff could not have been more solicitous. The grounds are still impeccable--the patch of hammocks under the palms would soothe any harried emigre from the northeast chill. We got free vouchers for breakfast and the hotel tossed in one free night out of four! What more could one ask for--highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, a true resort, in urban city”
Reviews.Author: jishenker
Reviews.Content: Public areas are inviting and spread out along well maintained and attractive grounds, all on a beautiful oceanfront setting plus a small private beach. If it shows it's age, and it does, it only adds to the character, as all looks carefully maintained. Only complaints would be from them that seem to need to complain. Restaurants were all good. I especially liked the tropical garden setting of the Lemongrass pan-Asian restaurant. Lots of nice places to lounge by the ocean or pool, including hammocks by palm trees or large outdoor beds. Location is good for OSJ and Condando area (short walks). This is my favorite option in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: ChiTownLovin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights and overall was very happy with the experience. Stayed in Jr suite for most of the trip and one night in a regular room. Jr suite was very nice and regular room needed some work (new carpet, mold in the bathroom, needs some painting, etc). I love the pool and the private beach. Garden area and lobby are wonderful. About five years ago I also went here for a conference and it seemed like a good place to have such an event. Beds are very comfortable. Generally an older crowd, so if you are looking for an energetic party hotel, this is not the place for you. There are some negatives though. The hotel is away from everything except a Subway sandwich shop and a small liquor store. You need to walk at least 15 minutes to Condado and it is not a safe walk at night. The alternative is a $12 taxi ride to most places. Also, the restaurants are ridiculous. Went to Il Giardino and was disappointed by the service and value. Atlantico pool bar was overpriced but still nice and the staff was very friendly. Palmeras breakfast is disappointing for the money. Was very happy with Pina Colada Club. The staff there is very friendly and they make great drinks. Also, you get more for your money with the meals. If you don't go there, I would find a restaurant away from the hotel. There is a Hertz car rental site at the hotel (but they seem to close early in the day) and an Allied car rental site across the street. We went there (Allied) and were happy with the service and the cost. The concierge was helpful. Front desk staff was great also, but they made errors on the bill twice regarding parking fees. If you don't mind overpriced food and taxi rides, it is a great hotel and a must at least one time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Warmth and Courtesy by an Experienced Staff!”
Reviews.Author: rswinte
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Puerto Rico for over 30 years now and ALWAYS choose the Caribe Hilton as my "home away from home"! This hotel is a hidden gem in the heart of San Juan. It was the first major Hilton Hotel in the Caribbean and Conrad Hilton chose the best site! This hotel has a beach and pool that is not to be believed. Even when it is crowded everything is so spread out that you never have trouble finding a spot in the shade or sun, The staff at the hotel is warm and friendly, from the waiters to the office staff and housekeeping. Make sure to have a phenomenal pinal colada at the hotel bar! There are lots of hotels in San Juan but none have the resort feel of the Caribe Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “perfect beach for very young children”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDay1000
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the condado villas right near the beautiful area with swans, peacocks and birds. The service was wonderful, everybody from housekeeping to the waiters at breakfast were kind, friendly and helpful. We ate at the Palmeras restaurant for breakfast. It was delicious. The children enjoyed the beach area immensely. The waves are not strong so it is really perfect for little ones. The playground was an added bonus. The only downside was that the pools were not heated so we did not use them and instead ended up in the hot tubs. The camp for children only runs in July. They did have bingo, a scavenger hunt, arts and crafts and sand castle building at scheduled times though. The children got a kick out of the parrots that say "ola" and the fruited water in the open air lobby of the hotel. They also liked the mini golf on the premises. We ate at the restaurant Lemongrass. The portions were small and it was extremely expensive but yummy. The gym was really nice. Great equipment. The area surrounding the hotel is not pretty and there is construction going on.This is not the fanciest or the most gorgeous place. If you are looking for practical and easy, this is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great island getaway...even if you do have to go to meetings.”
Reviews.Author: lccoats
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton in mid-January for a conference. Overall the stay was wonderful. Most of the rooms have up-to-date furnishings. Some are a little behind the times, but who's looking at the room when you have that view out your window?! The beach and pool areas are great. Not the best place to schedule a conference if you want people to actually attend the meetings. Conference staff was wonderful. Meals and events were run smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “An aging beauty”
Reviews.Author: MarkTravel616
Reviews.Content: When you arrive to the Carib's open air lobby, it feels like it's 1950, mostly in a good way. The front desk was very nice, allowed me to check in even though I was very early (9am). I got the room which was much larger than the room I had stayed at in the city of San Juan (the Carib is a twelve dollar cab ride away from the attractions of Old San Juan). I had a partial water view, all for about 100/night through hotwire. The room did show some age but nothing like what other reviewers have posted here. The bathroom especially was clearly in need of a facelift but it was strictly cosmetic with everything in working order. Maid service was very efficient and cordial, always giving enough towels, soap, lotion, etc. I left the room to discover the real jewel of this resort is its outdoor spaces. A great pool, hammocks for lounging, a jacuzzi, and a great beach. The biggest problem with this resort is its location and the resorts incredibly expensive food (very poor quality) and wine. There are only a few restaurants on sight, none with anything special. The only non-resort restaurants within walking distance are a subway and a small local hole in the wall diner/bodega. You will be left with deciding to spend the money to go into town for a decent meal or forking over big bucks (I'm talking 100 for two people for mediocre food) at the resort. The cheapest wine was close to 40 bucks/bottle and was nothing to write home about. Examples of terrible food I tried: pizza for $30 (think frozen then microwaved pizza from the grocery store), breakfast buffet for $40 (using liquid egg product to make all egg dishes, including the horrible watery scrambled eggs), $70 seafood appetizer @ Morton's---very under spectacular for the price. The only restaurant serving anything close to good was the Pina Colada club at the very edge of the resort. While nothing was particularly local, the fish tacos were good and reasonably priced ($15). If paying for overpriced food doesn't bother you or if taking taxis back and forth to old san juan isn't a problem, I'd say go for this aging diva of a hotel. The outdoor area alone was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: jworm23
Reviews.Content: I was VERY nervous for our stay at the Caribe Hilton based on some of the previous reviews but I am so glad I didn't change hotels as the Caribe Hilton was GREAT!! The open-air lobby area was nice, clean and very modern feeling and the pool area was fantastic! The hands down best part about the Caribe if you are looking to stay in the Condado area is the protected beach area! Despite beautiful, calm weather our entire stay the surf was pretty rough and I really don't see how you would be able to enjoy the ocean at the other resorts but the protected inlet area was perfect! Our room was in the main tower and I can see how the views might not be so great depending on room number unless you are on a high floor, we were on a lower floor but towards the front so our view was great but if you are staying in the main tower as for a room with ending in 36 or higher. Since the main tower is older the rooms are a tad on the small size compared to newer hotels but still very comfortable and nicely appointed. The onsite dining and drinking options were expensive but it is only a 5-10 minute bus ride to Old San Juan and there are tons of inexpensive places. I was also disappointed in the cost of the snorkeling and kayaks as that is not included in the resort fee. Also wi-fi is only available for free in the lobby unless you are Hilton Honors member. Overall we had a great vacation and I would highly recommend the Caribe Hilton. It may not be the ideal honeymoon destination though as it is a bustling, busy resort and if you are looking for a quiet get away this may not be it.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: colegio74
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Caribe, specially Alexandria Wiscovitch, always make sures that every guest feels like home. A very steady staff, that always recognizes you and welcomes you with open arms. The best location, view, food, bar and staff..top to bottom. Alex, like I call her, has been a tremendous host, always seeking perfection, it is my favorite hotel in PR.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service, nickled & dimed to death”
Reviews.Author: JATraveler7
Reviews.Content: Room price was pretty reasonable given the location. However, watch out for some incredibly over priced food and drinks. Beer starts at $6 for small cup and mixed drinks start at $12. A hamburger goes to $15. The only off site place to grab food is a Subway unless you want to hop a bus to Old San Juan (great food there with reasonable prices). There are 2 mini marts near with very little selection, but you can pick up beer, rum, vodka and mixers to keep in your room. The service was terrible (checking in, bellman, waiters, and checking out). What out for hidden bellman and maid fees that they automatically tack on at checkout without warning.

Reviews.Title: “An Island Paridise”
Reviews.Author: chio98
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Caribe Hilton Iin San Juan for 4 nights after a business conferance at another property. There was no comparison. Our rooms were ocean view, and well maintained. What was amazing was the hotels staff's attitude to make our stay the best ever. Each staff member we encountered went overboard to make sure we were completly satisfied.The outside pool areas are wonderful and tropical. Nearby a few feet is the ocean beach. Outside Oasis bar and full wait service is anvailable all day. We also could not get over the resturaunt IL Giardino located in the hotel lobby. The wonderful and engaging staff as well as the owner Franco takes care to make the experiance unforgetable. Good food, piping hot and delicious

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mdebart33
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 5 nights at the Caribe Hilton and had a fantastic time. The hotel is about 15 minutes from the airport and in a great location with its own private beach. We had an oceanview room that was not in the tower and we were very satisfied with it. The room was in good condition and very clean. The beach/pool area was very nice and spread out with plenty of areas to lounge and beautiful views everywhere. We also enjoyed the swim up pool bar. We loved the fact that there was a Subway and a liquor store just a 1 minute walk away, which made it easy to save $$ on meals/alcohol. We enjoyed eating at the Pina Colada club on 2 occassions since it was reasonably priced and the food was of good quality (though the service was poor both times). They also had 3 tennis courts that were in excellent condition. We did the bioluminescent kayak excursion as well as the rainforest excursion and both were very memorable. The only downsides were that we found the concierge to be unfriendly and unhelpful on both occassions where we had questions about the area, and the elevators weren't working properly a few different times. Aside from those minor issues, we had a truly great time.

Reviews.Title: “A very good Puerto Rican experience.”
Reviews.Author: sschu
Reviews.Content: This is not an inexpensive choice, but it's worth the money (even including the "resort fee" which came to an additional $30 per day for two of us!). The older part of the hotel is the first high-rise resort in San Juan, but it has been excellently maintained. The hotel beach i ample and a break-water keeps the water calm. The grounds are very well kept-up. It is an easy walk across a bridge to the bustling Condado area, and about a 20 minute walk to the start of the Old San Juan area. The restaurants at the hotel are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tripbizzkit
Reviews.Content: My husband had business in P.R. and I tagged along. I found the staff to be friendly, accommodating, and helpful. Our room felt like it was three miles away from the lobby (Candado Villas II) - but the room was quiet, comfortable and well appointed. We didn't have the best view - but I didn't go to Puerto Rico to gaze out of my hotel room window. The bed was great - we both slept well in it. We tried every restaurant in the hotel except Morton's. Both of the Italian restaurants were wonderful with excellent service. The breakfast buffet held there was also wonderful (I'd die for more of that oatmeal!!). The Pina Colada Club was the worst one, as it felt like the staff was fighting over which person would wait on us - while we waited ~30 minutes for service. We did not go back. Now the Lemon Grass . . . well it was perfection. I had to convince my husband to go there with me, but he ended up loving the food and service as much as I did. Our waiter - Sam - was so personable and funny. The food was beautifully presented and was so good - I wish we had stayed longer so we could return for another meal. Also our waitress outside at the Bar & Grill (Ocean side) was a keeper. Her name was Yolanda and she was so friendly and helpful and came back to check on us frequently. Those two employees are a great example of what I look for when I'm on vacation. Pleasant and friendly smiles - and not being made to feel like I'm an intrusion to their day. The grounds were so well maintained. I walked every inch of them and especially enjoyed the hammocks under the palm trees. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want on a Tropical Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kingofcars7112
Reviews.Content: I have been vacationing at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan for over 20 years now and always have a wonderful stay and terrific time.The friendly, and accomodating staff take care of me and my family's every need and we always have a terrific time. The hotel provides every ammenity one could ever want, when looking for a relaxing time away, especially since it is situated right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star hotel near beach and old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: DSK3some
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. Room was a little beat up, but clean, quite, comfortable. I like the open lobby and overall energy. Food and drinks are overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “We had the time of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: karaannie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding. The staff were all amazing. Everyone was very nice and willing to help with anything you may need. We did not meet a single snobby or rude employee there, as has been said in past reviews. Our wedding was held on a grassy area by the beach and they made everything perfect. We had a great time not only because San Juan is a fun place to visit, but also because the hotel helped make our stay one to remember. I can't wait to come back and would definitely stay here again! The one thing that I would change if I could, is the prices on drinks and food. They were fairly expensive. But, all the food and drinks I got were also very delicious. And, if needed, there is a liquor store right across the street. We frequented it and used the small fridge in our room to make some drinks there. We have already talked about returning here for one of our anniversaries down the road. I'm already looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in such a crummy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike1000000
Reviews.Content: Here are the bullet points supporting the title (in no particular order): - Rooms were dilapidated - Walls were extremely thin (easily woken up multiple times throughout the night as people were going back to their rooms) - The city view was atrocious (nice view of the top of the hotel's ball room) - Check-in was extremely slow (~30 minutes waiting when I was first in line and there were 3 employees working the front desk) - Disconnected from room service multiple times when attempting to order dinner - Given the wrong room type (2 double beds instead of one with a king size bed) - Didn't need 2 messages per day, everyday of my 3 night stay, letting me know that there was a fast check out through the TV (which didn't actually work when I tried to use it) - Wi-Fi didn't work in my room for any device, nor did it work for iPads in the lobby - All food/drinks were extremely overpriced in the hotel (beers purchased for $2 one block away were $7 in the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Irish1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before boarding a cruise. Staff - helpful and polite and willing to answer any queries we had about the local area etc. We were upgraded to a ocean view room on the 12th floor. Rooms - while the common areas on the ground floor have the look of a 4 or 5 star hotel the actual rooms were dissapointing. They are dated in style and decor and in need of redecoration, many of the fixtures required attention - all three of the wall lights in the bathroom were crocked for example. Bed was large and comfortable and shower was huge with good water pressure. Food - we ordered room service the first night which was ok but over priced (a burger and some chicken wings cost us almost $50). Breakfast was fine with a buffet style set up with a chef cooking omlettes etc as requested. Location - ideal for anyone who is cruising from the Pan AM pier.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmf325
Reviews.Content: We booked ahead and spent a bit more than we planned to stay at the Caribe Hilton. Our package included the fees/taxes, plus breakfast, at about $300 per day for a double with balcony. When we checked in our rooms were not ready at mid-afternoon, and after a short wait and a requested change from the tower building, we ended up with very nice rooms in the Garden section. We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed everything about the hotel, especially the pool & beach area. We liked the breakfast buffet, drinks & lunch at the pool bar & later at the lobby bar (try the empanadas). It is a long walk or taxi ride to the shopping & dining at Condado and Old San Juan. We figured out the local bus system and saved money on the taxi rides. We also booked two tours from the travel agent in the lobby--both excellent although a little pricey. We stopped in at several other hotels and concluded that Caribe Hilton was the nicest--no casino, but that is a plus for us. The pool area is beautiful, with free floats in the morning and a couple of nice jacuzzi pools. Some tour books criticize the lobby but we liked it--it's airy and comfortable, with a Starbucks, beautiful parrots, fruit-flavored water offered at no charge and a nice vibe. The service was very good at every level, including Mildred at the front desk who was very helpful. The garden area is stunning with peacocks, swans & fish in a pond. The hotel seems to be a good choice for conventions & groups. Morton's Steakhouse is there as well, with excellent service & food. We celebrated my daughter's 21st birthday there & they made it very special for our family. We look forward to returning to Caribe--the weather was beautiful all week and it is breezy at the hotel's location--very pleasant. Check out the amazing murals on the outside walls.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Central”
Reviews.Author: Trip140
Reviews.Content: This place is truly one of the nicest places in condado , San Juan area in puerto Rico so close to many activity destinations in the area , But the most important reason for this review is the manager Nelson he was the Best !!! We asked to see a manager in reference to extending our " we didn't want to go home " the hotel was fully booked and he made it happen this kind of hospitality is what makes this hotel stand out more then any of the other i stayed @ in the San Juan Area .We wil be back later this year for sure !!!! Thank You !!

Reviews.Title: “three star hotel with five star prices”
Reviews.Author: sophinev
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a cruise stay with Virgin. Great vista, pools, beach etc but let down by lack of cleanliness and upkeep. Perfectly tolerable if price range was lower. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Room tired but clean (unlike the corridors). However, what really lets this hotel down are the resteraunts. Absolutely awful, particlularly the 'Italian'. Very overpriced for unpalapatable gloop! Breakfast ok. Location ok but you need a good pair of feet to get anywhere (we didn't mind as we enjoy walking/running). Lots of usual Hilton comforts like excellent towels/toiletaries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby, Rooms in Disrepair”
Reviews.Author: wecallis
Reviews.Content: The outdoor lobby, with restaurants, pools, gift shop, and Starbucks, is beautiful. However, the rooms were clearly not as well renovated as the lobby and other facilities. There are different towers on the property, and our room was in the main tower, closest to the lobby. This may be the oldest tower (but none of them are remotely new), so the HHonors tower may have had better rooms. Nonetheless, the hallway had a bit of a stench and the room had a generally unclean feeling. Furniture, linens, and bathroom was outdated. Has a relatively good location, and the grounds are very nice considering you are in San Juan. In fact, I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan and the overall grounds and beach access there weren't as nice (although the Ritz had a better pool, the swim-up bar, beach access, hammocks, gardens, and private lagoon give the Caribe Hilton an advantage). The value of the hotel was good, but only because we got an unpublished rate. Getting to the sights of Old San Juan is a pretty intense walk, which we did, but we ended up taking a taxi back and would recommend a taxi for the most part (under $10). There are more convenient hotels in Old San Juan, and the Isle Verde area near the airport has better properties overall (and they are simply newer).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Always a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jlandatty
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on business on numerous occasions and never have a complaint. The location is perfect, the workout facility is top-notch and the rooms are quiet and comfortable. I am always treated like a special guest when I arrive at the hotel. Carmen, who works at the front desk is second to none; she is simply the best! I will always stay here during my return trips.

Reviews.Title: “great place to visit and rest”
Reviews.Author: ric22Bristol
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the caribe hilton for over twenty years and I must say the caribe has the best staff and the ambiance is wonderfull. Thier pool and beach area are thier best all new chaise lounges and umbrellas ask for jose to set you up. Across the street is a little cuban store where you can get refreshments and breakfast. I highly recommend it. Nelson the manager is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awful”
Reviews.Author: rjperry15
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this dreadful hotel en route to the British Virgin Islands. Our room was billed as an oceanfront villa. Oceanfront yes, but an extremely cramped studio apartment would have been more spacious than this so-called villa. Where do I begin? Walking from our lobby to our room, incidentally at 12 am after traveling all day from Europe with a 4 month old baby: 1) we were offered no assistance with our luggage--enough for a 2 week stay away from home; 2) leftovers from the New Year's Eve bash (I assume) littered the hallways, broken glass and trash outside at the cabana; 3) God knows what floating in the pool. On arriving in the room, it was cramped, dirty, musty, the bathroom tiles--which appeared to have applied by a novice--looked to be in the process of slowly falling off the walls, and there were cigarette burns in the carpet. There was no in-room wireless service, but you could purchase ethernet service for $15 a day. Very limited channel selection on the television but you could purchase an episode of the office for $10. At those prices I shudder to think what an actual movie would have cost. Local calls on the telephone weren't free, you had to pay for them. We ordered room service and the food was passable for room service but a sandwich and fries (which we split) and 2 ginger ales ran us over $40. It may seem like a small issue but the picture hanging over our bed--of a surfboard I think--was askew. Like 45 degrees askew. I thought at first it was maybe an artistic touch but I think it was just inattentive housekeeping. Really the only plus about the place were the beds. They were very comfortable and we actually got a decent night's sleep. The view from the patio the following morning was nice if you overlooked the disintegrating and moldy deck chairs and the rusted and pitted door fixtures and peeling paint. And the bargain price for this unmitigated dump? $300. This is our first time traveling to San Juan and if this is what $300 gets you we'll never visit again. For that price I think it is reasonable to expect a modestly spacious room (being able to turn around in it without stepping over the beds would have been acceptable), immaculately kept and refurbished within the last decade. I also don't expect to be nickel-and-dimed for every little thing every time I turn around. It has been a long time since I stayed at one of these big-name chain hotels and had forgotten what miserable places they are. I have been reminded and hereby renew my vow never to stay at one again. At least until the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: basilf05
Reviews.Content: I recently had a few days stay at the Hilton on a cruise/stay holiday. On checking in the hotel in the early morning we were advised our rooms were ready but on entering the room it was obvious it was anything they could find for you and not the accommodation that was reserved and paid for. Reception was very slow about moving us to the correct room. The hotel has seen better day,s decor is tired and everthing about the hotel is outdated. It is positioned in the middle of blocks of hotels/ car park and unfortunately walking anywhere is virtually impossible . Buses are available but taxi is the normal way to get around and its expensive. The hotel is also very pricey if you are eating there ,resturants reasonable but not brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with service and family entertainment”
Reviews.Author: pumpkin012
Reviews.Content: I was recently here with my family during the holidays. We enjoyed beautiful days by the pool with lots of activities and entertainment for the kids and adults. I was very happy with my room and the atmosphere in the lobby. Nelson Torres was very helpful in orientating me with information and great hints of places to go in Old San Juan. On my second day there, my wife lost her glasses and purse and security found them within half an hour and returned them to my wife. After going through the belongings there was not one item missing! We are so grateful to the Caribe HIlton security team. And I can't leave out the very clean and modern equipment in the gym facilities. The gym overlooks the beach so it is a wonderful setting to start the morning with a work out!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return soon!”
Reviews.Author: NewHoper
Reviews.Content: After seeing the many reviews about the poor condition of the rooms, I feel compelled to submit this review with quite the contrary experience. My husband was there for a week-long, corporate meeting. I joined him for half of the week. Our room was in the tower and was absolutely perfect. Many of his co-workers were in the hotel which is part of the lobby, directly facing the pool and ocean and had complaints about the room conditions. So, I'm thinking the tower rooms have been more recently renovated. I've included some pictures that show the perfectly fine condition. I know there was a complaint about no water bottles left in the room, whereas we had two, new water bottles in our room each day. My husband is a Hilton Diamond member, so perhaps this is why...not sure. As far as the grounds..it was paradise! Between the private beach, the gorgeous pools and hot tubs, the hammocks strung from palm trees and the tropical gardens...there were endless lovely areas to relax and take in the beauty of the area. I also must say that the employees were extremely polite and helpful. Their service was impeccable! My husband and I just saw two things which needed improvement, in our opinion. One - there is no decent walkway from the resort/pool area to the tropical gardens. One night, I walked alone from the pool to the gardens and had to walk through an unlit, rocky pavement which was a bit scary. It almost felt like an alley way. Two - we were surprised that the pool bar was not open at night. Quite early in the evening, we would enjoy sitting by the pool and ocean, but had to go to the inside bar for a drink. Other than that - it really was perfect. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, not clean and not your typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: JASB20
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton has a beautiful lagoon and oceanfront property. The staff is friendly and helpful. However, it is not your typical Hilton. The rooms were not clean from the start, and not cleaned each day. The basics of wash cloths and small hand towels came only upon request and no each day. The air conditioning was weak until maintanence was called to release the temperature range restrictions. The food was variable. Morton's was delicious and the hotel buffet is expensive but tasty. The Italian resturant has poor service and mediocre food. Starbucks is great to have in the lobby. If you go during the Christmas week, you need to book your spa services well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here, look at my pictures!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tgullick
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and am not a picky person actually this is the first time I have complained. 1.I booked and paid extra for a ocean view room. Ya, you can see the ocean but have to look over their trashed out roof top to see it. (see picture) 2.Room restrooms are run down BAD. (see pictures) 3. Cordoor hall has railing going down hall with dirt and spider webs all behind it because it was installed away from wall.(see picture) 4. Food / Drinks are WAY over priced 8oz rum and coke $12.00 I contacted Hilton on this and they had the Manager of the hotel contact me and she said"i apologize if you come back we will make it better" I will never go back to this hotel It is in NO way a 4-5 Star. The lobby is a 4 Star that is all I can say good about this hotel. Don't forget parking is $22.00 per day. There are way better

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton has lost her bloom”
Reviews.Author: SGTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Although there are some hints of the charm that once existed, it has long since faded. This hotel is in need of a renovation - shabby rooms and two elevators for a 9- story tower. Customer is non-existent, even for the relaxed Caribbean. We stood at the bell desk twice with little even acknowledgement. We schlepped our bags ourselves. Not a big deal, but noted. Plan your exit. It takes quite a while to run the gauntlet - waiting 15 minutes for an elevator you can fit on with your luggage and then looooong lines at checkout. Some waiters are really great, others surly. Grounds are nice, but need some TLC. Food average at best. But the bed was very comfy. That took my rating from 1 to 2 stars! Sites are a long walk away through run-down area. And the abandoned building next door is slightly creepy. The fitness center, although on site, is at the far reaches of resort.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: jdavismcclung
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a delayed honeymoon package to Puerto Rico over the Christmas and New Year's holidays. Our travel agent recommended the Caribe Hilton over our first choice, the Conrad Condado Hotel. We were guaranteed a "Deluxe Ocean Vista Room," and we ended up with a room on the 19th floor of their Tower Building facing the parking garage, the Condado Lagoon and downtown San Juan in the background, and a stretch of ocean to the far right. We asked the check-in desk for a better ocean view room, but we were informed this was as good as it gets. In addition, the paint on the ceilings were cracked, the door to the balcony did not seal properly (we could hear the wind CONSTANTLY), and we were rudely woken every morning to the sound of trucks and construction. You must pay to park your rental vehicle at this hotel...be prepared for that. Restaurant prices were outrageous!! I have no problem spending the money as long as the food is quality! Drink prices were astronomical! We ordered two pina coladas in to-go cups to take up to our room from the hotel's Pina Colada Club. They were 9 bucks a piece, and they contained no alcohol. We payed 18 dollars plus tip for frozen Kool-Aid!! In-room internet service is 15 bucks a day! I have never been to a hotel that didn't offer its guests free wi-fi!! My wife and I used our iPhones the entire time because at least the area has 3G coverage. Outside amenities (including private beach and pool areas) were ridiculously packed everyday! Essentially, prepare to be nickel-and-dimed, and prepare to wait for everything!! Never again will I stay at this resort. Not worth the hassel!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is superbly managed.”
Reviews.Author: EAC002
Reviews.Content: Let me give you some specifics. In the morning my husband and I would come downstairs, get some coffee and go out to the pool area. We are early risers, so frequently we would be out while the grounds people were preparing the recreation areas. They worked quietly, with no shouting, radio blaring or machines whirring. They were efficient, and left the grounds in immaculate condition. The maids left the rooms in good order and the bathrooms were always cleaned and stocked with the requisite supplies. The bell captains at the front entrance handled very large numbers of luggage from large groups and there was never a sense of chaos. As with the gardeners, the staff coordinated closely, but did none of the yelling and bantering that is so often part of the way people do those jobs. We were treated graciously by the person who checked us in and by the concierge staff who helped us to get oriented. Our adult children went to the fitness center every day, and they each volunteered that it was one of the best fitness centers they had seen. The machines were kept in excellent condition, the staff was helpful, and the environment was welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, horrible dining experience”
Reviews.Author: Calvin_Anna
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week celebrating my mom's 50s birthday. The hotel itself is nice and the grounds are beautifull. The only complaint - you can hear everything and some from the ajoining rooms. Suggestion would be to at least provide bottled water in the rooms. Every resort i stayed in would provide 2 bottles of water daily. Beach is lovelly, so is breakfast. Although a little pricey is worth the money. My major complaint though is for the Rotisserie II Giardino - the italian restaurant. This is by far the worst dining experience i have ever had. PLEASE STAY AWAY. I am from NYC and have no problem with steep prices or even slow service but the shear lack of care, attention and the quality of food served were enough to put me over the edge. A plate of pasta for $25 that looks like a 3 year old made it and threw it on the plate. I am not a great cook but i can certainly serve better looking dishes and not take 1.5 hours to serve a plate of pasta. Long story short - the food was DISGUSTING, the service was SLOW and flat out IGNORANT. My husband had to get up 3 times to ask for menus, drinks and then someone who would at least ask us how our food was. I have never before walked out of a restaurant without actually eating and sending the plate back. HORRENDOUS EXPERIENCE!!!! Pina Collada Bar, Martons and Pool Bar were all great places to eat though so no complains there. Just do me a favor and dont even bother with the above mentioned place. Overall, it is a nice place to stay and if not for the bad dining eperience i would not have anything too negative to mention.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beds, but a bit tired decor”
Reviews.Author: dofter
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a cruise layover before and after. The check-in process was quite slow but once we got into the room, it was fine. The mattresses were amazing. Best sleep away from home in a while. However, the bathrooms looked really tired; needs new tiles, lick of paint. The bedroom decor was also a bit tired, but the bathroom was more noticeable. As a short stopover, it was good. The beach is great and there are lots of places to lounge around. The free wi-fi in the lobby was also a bonus. I wouldn't want to stay a week, but for a few days, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not perfect...”
Reviews.Author: DemTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Hilton for five days in December. We liked the tennis court, the private beach, the workout room, and the efficiency of the valet parking. We didn't like the noisy air conditioning unit outside our window (and we were on the 7th floor), concierge was usually not there and when they were there, they weren't very helpful. It was fine, but not a memorable hotel. Lemongrass was actually pretty good for a hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “It was more of a beat-up Days Inn than a luxury Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: fllw1
Reviews.Content: We were loyal to the Hilton brand until we stayed here. The hotel is rusty around the edges, literally. Our shower head was rusty, our balcony was rusty and there were clearly decorations like paintings missing from the walls. Another couple whom we met on an excursion had the same experience, so we weren't alone in this. It reminded me of a beat-up Days Inn rather than a Hilton. In addition, there was jackhammering going on 3 of the 6 days we stayed there -- once right in front of the guest elevators. It was so load that the noise traumatized my son and the hotel's parrots/cockatoos in the lobby. The front desk didn't care one bit about this or customer service in general. One day, it rained and flooded the lobby bar. All but one of the hotels six restaurants tasted like industrial cafeteria food (except we paid $100 for dinner and $50 for breakfast). The only positive about the hotel is that it had six pools and a private beach, though we spent most of our days sightseeing so we didn't even enjoy this. We were alos charged the 14% "resort fee" twice -- once when we prepaid for the hotel and once when we checked out. When I complained to the front desk, they told us that they cannot remove the charge -- a big lie, of course. If you are like us and have all your hotel loyalty points tied up with Hilton HHonors, try the Conrad a block away. Another person we met on our kayaking excursion said it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, not superb... & not much fun!”
Reviews.Author: travellover5606
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 5 day vacation stay. Solo traveler. Grounds, pools, beach were pretty good. Staff was ok, not rude but didn't go out of the way to be friendly or deliver exceptional service. Was concerned about my room, based on other reviews. Stayed int the garden wing, rooms were nice, very clean, housekeeping great & modern decor. Was expecting more flavor & a cool dining experience at the resturants but they were fair. Pina colada club was good & had best drinks. Spa was average, treatment menu was average, lockeroom was basic, not warm & luxe like most resort spas. Caribe also had no nightlife or activty, so if that's important don't stay here. Tour company @ hotel was good, tour was fun & price okay. Next time will stay somewhere else, hotel isn't near much to do & pretty boring after hours. Seems like a nice resort for over 50- quiet set.

Reviews.Title: “88 degrees and Sunny!”
Reviews.Author: LRL66
Reviews.Content: Very relaxing stay. Nice beach area although lounge chairs a bit uncomfy. Use the sofas instead! Victor at the indoor bar makes the best Pina Coladas ever!! Upgrade your room for a better view and bathroom. Worth the extra $15/night. Venture into Old San Juan for a pleasant half-day experience. It's a beautiful 2 mile walk along the coastline to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “totally great over the years”
Reviews.Author: jblouisville
Reviews.Content: i just returned from a 4 night stay for business; perhaps my 5th or 6th stay in the last few years (recurring conferences and business trips). I've always had great rooms, great service, friendly staff, and great value. it remains an outstanding hotel and is superbly maintained and kept modern. there's a great history that it respects, although maybe it doesn't blow its horn as loudly as it should. i could easily sign up for a guided history tour of it. quibbles over food prices indicate more that travelers aren't expecting to pay a premium for an island hotel. but, honestly, the prices are totally in line with hotels of this caliber. there's a great bar in the hiltonhonors tower with great mahi-mahi -- about $21. the local variation on the hamburger with plantain is wonderful. there's never been a problem, but i understand that you can't always please all the people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, just dont pay extra for "Ocean view"”
Reviews.Author: erikinfl
Reviews.Content: I booked online almost a full year in advance. Everything was pretty good except for the room view. I paid extra for the Ocean view, instead of their other 2 options, Garden view and Lagoon view. You would assume this means you will actually face the ocean. WRONG. Looking straight down from my room was the tropical garden. Glaze up a tad, there is the lagoon. Behind the lagoon , down town San Juan comes into view, then El Yunque behind that. Thatâ€™s right. Look straight out the back of my ocean view room and you see the mountains. Walk to the rail, look HARD left, and oh yes, there is the ocean. The hotel sits diamond style on a peninsula into the ocean. Using the same technicality they said I fell under, you can "VIEW" the ocean from any room in the resort. I was told I got what I paid for. no offer to move to a different room, no offer for a partial refund. Overall hotel was beautiful; food in restaurants was good, overpriced but good. I guess I expected more from a hotel like Hilton. Was treated worse then a comfort inn. Other then the front desk staff, all others were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and hotel - expensive food + drink”
Reviews.Author: ekspringers
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be everything we were looking for. Relaxing and quiet. There are tons of places to relax, by the pool, on the beach, on the "walkway"...all of which are wonderful! The beach is in a lagoon, which seems to be quite necessary as there are tons of waves, but listening to the waves hit the breakwater was one of our favorite parts. The food is expensive and sometimes good. We ate at the breakfast buffet which filled us up enough to skip lunch. The pool bar is ok...food selection is poor and its not that good and really expensive and service was just so-so. Service in all other aspects of the hotel was superb but for some reason, at the pool bar, it was not that good. There is a subway right across the street and if you walk across the bridge, towards the other hotels, there are many more choices (about 10min walk). The dinner choices are also limited and we didn't really think anything sounded all that appealing although we did eat at mortons one night. it was fantastic but you pay for that there. One night, we also walked across the bridge towards the other hotels and ate at a small place there, ropa vieja...it was excellent!! i would highly recommend this. We would def go back and stay here, however, maybe do it a little different and venture out more for places to eat. We did not rent a car but i still felt that within walking distance were enough choices. The hotel is 15mins from the airport so we were able to relax immediately. The drinks at the hotel are also very expensive, however, there is a convenience store right across the street also.
