We didn't, but should have, gotten some drinks there and brought them over to the pool - many ppl did this. Overall, it was extremely relaxing and fun!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT choice and Gay Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LouinMilford
Reviews.Content: This magnificent hotel has a history of elegance and an outstanding beach and pool. I've been staying there for over 40 years. It's GAY FRIENDLY too.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous, relaxing destination”
Reviews.Author: PRTravelbound
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico is beautiful as is the Hilton Caribe. We didnâ€™t find it old and dilapidated as some reviews has stated. The grounds, pools, beach and lagoon were amazing, and nicely situated t that you had a lot of a choice of where you wanted to enjoy the views . The pier is lovely, you can see the reefs and tons of fish, they even give you some bread to feed them and that is quite the sight. Our room had a beautiful view, as long as you looked past the roof top. Ask for a room in the tower but away from the roof so you get the best view, it was still totally amazing to wake up and see the grounds and ocean. Some of the rooms look over the construction at the bridge, or the back parking lot, so be sure to ask! We did find the hotel a little isolated but thatâ€™s what you have to do if you want a private beach and lagoon resort feel. The Hilton stands alone from the other hotels which are also nice. It is a 2 mile walk to Old Town and there is nothing much around the Hotel. We walked to Condado which is a mile or so to other restaurants as the Hotel food prices were truly exorbitant. The Pool grill food was awful and very expensive. The Hilton should really try to encourage people to stay but at those prices, and nothing local about it we opted to eat out for most meals. We did have the breakfast buffet one morning which was amazing but cost almost $50 for the two of us, a little excessive for breakfast! We found some fabulous restaurants in OSJ. This weekend was also the tree lighting ceremony and the food and cultural festival which offered some wonderful local and international foods. We ate at Marmalade one night, as it was my birthday, it was expensive but worth it if you really want to eat like a judge on Iron Chef, it was like art. We did walk back to the hotel one night, defiantly not advisable. There are lots of derelict and abandoned buildings on the main roads and I did not feel safe at all. We cabbed it after that, which gets expensive at $12 plus tip one way. The Hilton really should offer a bus service even just a couple of times a day would be nice. All in all I loved PR, amazing place and people.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Comfortable, Convenient for the Cruise”
Reviews.Author: MangaMan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a clean, safe place to stay the night before our cruise. I had read reviews for other reputable chains but kept finding comments about indifferent staff or missing articles. This is a first class operation. The room was a little smaller than I expected based on pictures I had seen. The ocean view was wonderful. You will have to be willing to pay for the excellence - it's one of the more expensive places to stay, but you will not be disappointed. The concierge took considerable time walking me to the separate lobby for the villas. Front desk was courteous and attentive. No indifference here. Very short drive to the cruise ship terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property but Room for Updates”
Reviews.Author: jneil
Reviews.Content: My DH and I recently traveled to San Juan for a cruise. Our flight arrived at 5AM the day before our cruise (on Saturday) so we took an easy cab ride ($19 plus $1 per bag) to the Caribe Hilton. My husband had stayed at the hotel 20 years before for a wedding. This was my first time to PR. We had set up with the hotel a half day rate so that we could check in that early and the rate was very reasonable. Since it was so early, very few people were around. The entranceway was beautiful with the lights and was quiet impressive. I also was impressed with the open air lobby. We were put in a Tower Room which at 5:30AM seemed very far away from the check-in. We were put in the 11th floor. Room: At that time, we were happy to have a nice comfortable bed, which it was, but were disappointed that there was no water available. We were quite thirsty from our travels and even the hallway vending machine would not take our money. DH had to melt down some ice from the ice machine. I know this seems minor but the hotel we stayed at the end of our week (which was less than half the price of the Caribe), provided two bottles of complimentary water. Anyways, as I mentioned, the bed was super comfortable and the pillows were the best of any hotel I have ever stayed in (I need to know what kind they were). The room was a decent size with a balcony overlooking the parking area and lagoon. The bathroom was quite large with a huge walk in shower and double sinks. There was an impressive flat screen television which we did not even use. Now come the complaints, while it seemed they have done some updating, it still needs some work. The floor was warped in places and the carpet seemed worn. Plus, you could hear EVERYTHING that was going on in the hallways! Others have mentioned this in their reviews, and I would have to agree. We were awoken to slamming of doors and people walking to the elevator. This motivated us to get up, put on our bathing suits, and head down to their pool/beach area. Grounds: This is definitely the highlight of this hotel. The grounds are very beautiful with many different nooks and crannies. You have the calm lagoon area, the pier, the seats along the sea wall (with the waves crashing against it) the pool area, and the back pond near the fort. We were lucky to find two seats on the round pier (see picture) with the water right behind our heads. We loved this spot! The resort was busy but we were still able to relax. The lagoon was calm and clean and a perfect place to cool off from the hot sun. There is a beautiful pool area with a swim up bar. We actually ate lunch here, and albeit a little expensive, it was very good. My DH had a salmon sandwich and I had a mahi one. There was only a mahi salad on the menu but they were very happy to accommodate my wish. We thought that the bartenders were excellent and enjoyed sitting there (and drinking pina coladas and mojitos). They do not take cash but only cc or you can charge it to your room. This is probably b/c the drinks are expensive and people donâ€™t care as much if they are not handing over the cash! Overall, the landscaping was very nice but we did notice some places that need to be refurbished (the bridge over by the pond and Asian restaurant is in desperate need of a good painting). Restaurants: Beside the one at the pool, we did not eat at any of the restaurants but that is because we were only there one night and already planned on going to Marmalades in Old San Juan. The property has three restaurants all in prices you can expect for a resort (a little on the high side). We did sit in the lobby bar which was a happening place on a Saturday night (prices once again on the high side). As we were leaving on Sunday, we both wished we could spend another day or two at the Caribe. We found that this is a great resort for an extended weekend but could be very expensive for anything more than that. Our TA booked this for us and she got us a good price (I donâ€™t think I would pay some of the prices they were asking). If we could get the reasonable rates again, we would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rumbera1967
Reviews.Content: I was deeply disappointed with this hotel. My husband and I went for a week on a leisure trip. The room was okay although a little worn around the edges (bathroom could stand some fresh grout, carpet looked worn and soiled). I frequently stay at Hiltons and this hotel was just not up to the Hilton standard. I was willing to overlook the decor, but several of the employees were surly and should not be in the hospitality profession. In fact, many looked as if we were bothering them when we asked for assistance with luggage and valet parking. There were some exceptions to the rule, but in general the service was terrible. I had to run the water five minutes in order to get hot water to shower. The saving grace of the property is the lobby, pool area and beach are lovely. The food at the Pina Colada club and poolside was good. I would not go back again if it were free. Go to El San Juan orthe Ritz`Carlton instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: Esther&Sam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Condado Vilas at Caribe Hilton in a one bedroom suite. The suite was OK except the kitchen did not have much to cook with almost like a show kitchen. It was part of a Travelocity vacation program. The hotel has a lagoon with beach. My wife and daughter went to the lagoon on a Sunday morning. They found a couple on chairs on the beach and settled there for some sun and swim. After about 45 minutes, the two hotel employees (one of them was Jose) came and told them they are holding the lounge chairs for other clients. They were very rude, they did not try to find other chairs for them, they did not help them to move either. We are non-white and felt they were purposefully rude so that we do not come to the beach again. We were told by other guests that these employees taking money from local rich ladies for reserving seats for them depriving legitimate guests. They do have a beach club for local people and take additional bribe from them to provide special treatment. It was truly a bad experience particularly as we paid $37 + tax for resort facility per day in addition to rental charges to Travelocity. They also charged $14.95 per day for internet that did not work very well and $16 per day for parking. Like MommaT1227 and parl2010 said in their reviews, we were also double charged like $37 resort chatges twice per day amounting $220+ for the stay. Local telephone calles were charged $3.65 to $4.95 as interstate charges. I went and spoke to front desk and they removed the duplicate charges. In general, our Puerto Rico trip was great except Caribe Hilton and Barrachina restaurant. Ironically, we are Hilton HHonors member and Hilton Grand Vacation Club Seaworld owner, We certainly did not expect this kind of treatment from Hilton. We were quite disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicago-planner
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Caribe Hilton after a week long cruise. The rooms are the normal size Hilton room, nothing special about them. The pool/beach area of the hotel is really a gem!!! The hotel has a private beach, with a great view of the ocean. The pool is also very beautiful, and there are 2 great hot tubs, right next to the pool with an amazing view. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing, no loud music or entertainment, which we really appreciated. Food and beverages are expensive, we didn't eat at the hotel. The Starbucks in the lobby is really convenient. You can't walk anywhere from the hotel, it's 12$ taxi ride to Old San Juan. There is a bus service (about 1 $) nearby, but it's not very regular, every 20-30 minutes. We were on the 6 floor and the noise from the machinery downstairs was very strong, maybe it's better on the higher floors. Overall we really loved the beach area and spent most of the time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: OleGal96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights - the first night of our honeymoon and then again two weeks later the last night. The first night we were in the garden rooms and the second night were actually in the Condado Lagoon Villas. Both rooms had comfy beds, were clean, very nice. The pool and beach area were great! We ate at Lemongrass the first night and it was wonderful. Very good food, good service. We also had drinks at the pool bar and the bar inside. We also had the breakfast buffet once - since I don't eat a lot of breakfast it wasn't a great deal, but the server was very friendly. We had breakfast at the Pina Colada club the next time and that was very good and again the server was great. Everyone was very friendly at the hotel! The location worked well for us since it wasn't too far to both the main airport and the smaller Isla Grande airport, both of which we flew in and out of. Since we were here sort of on the bookends of our honeymoon, I wanted to pick someplace easy to get to and that we would be able to be by the ocean and lay on the beach without having to go too far. The Caribe Hilton did not dissapoint. I would definitly stay here again if I were in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice public areas, but it ends there”
Reviews.Author: PackerFan12
Reviews.Content: I thought the Hilton was supposed to be a step above other properties. I was wrong. The lobby, restaurants, pool, and beach lagoon are all very nice. The Pina Colada Club was casual and comfortable. The burger was great. It gave me high expectations for the rest of the resort. I was unfortunately disappointed when I got to my room. The 70's wood paneling, broken lock on the patio door, the condition of the walls, and the condition of the floor with the large brown stain were all disappointing. The vending machines are in the hallway behind some louvered bi-part doors that need to be removed. The bed was the best part as every night offered a comfortable bed and a good night's rest. The worst part was on the last night when I began packing to leave. I grabbed my travel kit and heard some scratching. I found a 2 1/2" long cockroach in my travel bag. Not what I thought I would expect to find here. I had to throw out my toothbrush and dispose of the thing. It put me on edge when packing causing me to search my clothing and luggage thoroughly when I left and again when I got home. All I will think about when this resort comes to mind is the cockroach. Ewwww. Add on the $15 daily parking, the $20 continental breakfast, and the $15 daily internet access, it certainly was not a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Best business travel-hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: doctorpettit
Reviews.Content: I was graciously received by the Caribe Hilton personnel from the moment I stepped out of the taxi until the day I departed. Though the hotel has been around for a long time, the hotel and grounds are beautifully maintained, rooms are clean and very comfortable, available amenities are wonderful, the private beach is immaculate and breath taking, and the staff is more than accommodating. The Caribe Hilton is strategically situated for ease and convenience to Old Town San Juan and many other historical sites. The surrounding area is safe for casual walks and running for those more athletically inclined. Local restaurants and clubs are convenient and easily accessible. This is my third business trip in as many years; I stay three weeks each time, and I will stay at the Caribe Hilton again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “That Hotel has seen better days...”
Reviews.Author: move2dubai
Reviews.Content: ...that the rooms are dated would be an understatement... they are( kind of) clean, but I guess have not been renovated in the last 25-30 years. The moldy bathrooms do not add to a highend flair either. And even though the location of the hotel is good, the pool area and lobby are nice, the price for a room is by no means justified. I would not stay here again, as the Marriott "around the corner" is much nicer...

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: EssexLizzie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for one night. Our room was spacious and had tea and coffee facilities. Fantastic view from the balcony overlooking the sea, the room we had was in the Lagoon villa area, my sister in law had a bigger room but the view was awful, overlooked an out building attached to the hotel. Sleep quality was excellent very comfortable beds. I would stay here again but would check out that my room had a sea view first. Had drinks in the bar, a little pricey but on holiday thats just what you expect. Some of the outside areas needed attention but overall it was clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you are HH Diamond or Gold”
Reviews.Author: fiberwave
Reviews.Content: I returned to this property after one year and was I surprised when I went to the floor that used to house the Executive Lounge. It is closed because it was costing the hotel too much money! Is that the policy of the same hotel that you pay between $225-$350+ a night to stay? Is this the same hotel that you pay $38 for two small pieces of veal in the Italian restaurant? Is this the same hotel where breakfast is easily $25? How about the small $13 drinks in the lobby bar? They cannot afford the expense of the lounge???? At least when you stay at the Conrad Condado Beach or the El San Juan which is part of the Hilton Waldorf Collection (for the same or less money than the Caribe Hilton) you get the recognition that is earned by top tier HHonors members. This is off my list with so many other options including good Marriott properties in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: atxgrl79
Reviews.Content: the caribe hilton is a very nice property with all the amenities one could ask for while on vacation. although i did not get to experience the spa or fitness facilities i did explore the property and found these areas to be of good quality. the workout stations have their own personal tv attached and there is an instructor on site. the pond area has a few swans, coi and a turtle. the grounds are beautiful! mortons (on site) has great mini cheeseburgers and run a special from 930p-close at the bar. our server, miguel, was awesome! i had nothing but pleasant experiences with the staff at caribe and really enjoyed the swim up bar at the pool. the drinks are over priced however when on vacation thats not something i particularly worry about. the hot tub was very relaxing and i found the experience to be extremely pleasant at night. please take a towel from your room if you go at night bc once the towel bar closes whatever is left is all that will be provided. after that you have to go to the front desk and ask. the lounge areas by the pool and beach were very comfortable...i avoided the hammock due to my own personal fear of falling out of it ((smiling)). the only thing worth considering is the walls are very thin and at times, usually in the morning, i would hear other guests outside my room in the hallway. luckily this was a non eventful time so there wasnt alot of guests in my tower therefore the minimal noise i did hear was when i was already awake for the morning. taxis are plentiful so if you dont rent a car its super easy to catch a taxi anywhere..watch the prices though bc none of them use their meters. i found it best to ask the driver prior to him/her leaving how much they would charge to get me to my destination. overall caribe hilton was an excellent choice and i would stay here again if i get the opportunity to vacation in san juan again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing grounds, okay room, secluded location”
Reviews.Author: KRo0203
Reviews.Content: I just went for a 5 day stay at the Hilton. I have nothing bad to stay about the hotel itself. The lobby is breathtaking, the pools are well maintained and clean, and the private beach has to be the best in PR. They have a little lagoon thing with ducks and swans which is nice to stroll around, and pier where they have bread available to feed the fish which is really fun. Our room was a decent size, very clean, and the bed was heaven. We didnâ€™t request an ocean view, but we got one that looked east down the entire coast line of PR. Sure there was some view of a roof top, but we were high up enough that we saw WELL beyond that. The only complaint I have is we had to call the front desk a few times about issues, which they were happy to fix, if you were willing to wait a long time. Our hair dryer didnâ€™t work, and they said they would bring one upâ€¦.which they did over an hour later. Our remote didnâ€™t work, they said they would bring up a new oneâ€¦.which they did several hours and a second phone call later. We were on vacation so we were laid back about it, but it was certainly annoying. The restaurants are definitely not cheap, but I cant complain about the food, its amazing. The pool side bar and the Pina Colada restaurant arenâ€™t bad, hamburger for $14, chicken fingers wer2 $12, salads about the same and hot dog for $8. We went to the Itialian restaurant which was great, , pasta dishes are around $20-25. And you can never go wrong with a Mortons steak, but its going to cost you. We got to go to Old San Juan and eat out there which I HIGHLY suggest you do. Food is cheaper and Old San Juan is great. . Last a 100% must is a hike through El Yunque Rainforest. The hotel has a deal that provides guided transportation and the tour for $53 which is a pretty good deal if you donâ€™t have a car. We didnâ€™t get to go to the Bio Bay because of the weather, but really wanted to, the hotel offers a tour and transportation for $90 which is a bit much, but Iâ€™m sure worth it. The hotel is definatley secluded, so if you are looking for a quite, relaxing vacation, this is 100% your spot, especially if you love the beach over pools. If you need some place more lively, you might want to venture somewhere else. We went to the Condado (Conrad) to use their casino and it looked nice, and only a short walk from the Hilton. The Marriott and Intercontinenal are in a great and lively area. We walked to Old San Juan from the Hilton which was beautiful (but donâ€™t do it at night) but it was a good 20 min walk. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: AVecchio
Reviews.Content: Rooms in the "Towers" are very old, out-dated and very worn. Our first room had paint chipping; the showerhead was broken, falling out of the ceiling and mold on the caulking. Great view though. We complained, and they offered us a new room. Same type of room, but now we had no view. Apparently the first room (with the view) was an upgrade. Wow! Needless to say, we were very dissapointed. So, they offered us another room. Unfortunately, this room had someone in it!! YES... they gave us the key to a room of another guest!! Now, I realize people make mistakes, and the manager bought our dinner that night, but it left such a negative impression on us. This is not what I expected from a Hilton chain. We enjoyed our trip to San Juan and will probably go back, but we will not be staying at the Caribe Hilton. Ohhhh... but on a positive note... the breakfast buffet was "to die for." That's the only part of the hotel I enjoyed. Kudos to the cooks/chef!

Reviews.Title: “Like a dream”
Reviews.Author: frauduck
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and grounds. All that you can imagine in a Caribbean dream.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT recommend”
Reviews.Author: murphmomma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a convention for 6 days. I do have to say that the grounds of the Hotel are beautiful. But that is where it stops. They have very little outdoor lighting for night walking. The rooms are OLD. The door to the bathroom had scratches all over it. There was mold in the tub. Carpet was old and stained. The bed was comfortable but they had NO top sheet. You had to use the comforter and who knows how often they wash that. The biggest drawback of the hotel is amenities. The only close restaraunts were on the hotel property and the prices were OUTRAGEOUS. They were at least 3 times the normal price for anything. Trying to go off property was difficult as you had to take an expensive taxi as they have no shuttle service. There is bus service but the concierge desk did not know what bus to take to get to anywhere and the bus drivers spoke little or no english. Walking off property put you in a risky safety situation. The only other walkable distance was a Subway sandwich shop and they have locked security doors that they had to buzz you in. That should give you an idea how safe you felt there. Puerto Rico is beautiful and I do not want to discourage anyone from going (old San Juan is magnificent) Just find a better price, better condition and better located place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: deltadawn103
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Caribe Hilton for two nights after a cruise. We bid on Priceline and lucked out. Our rooms were great, clean and had comfy beds. The beach and pool areas were fantastic. We had dinner one night at the Lemongrass and it was amazing. We would definately stay there again. We took a cab into Old SJ and it cost $12.00 each way which wasn't bad considering there were six of us. All six of us said we loved the hotel. After our two nights here we went on to El Convento in Old SJ for a night and I wished we had spent our last night at the Caribe Hilton, live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fun Beach, Loud Rooms”
Reviews.Author: loan_girl
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in the Caribe Hilton for a friends birthhday weekend. We had a great time, using the property. The pool was a great place to cool off. The pool bar had friendly service and great views. The beach was quiet with plenty of chairs, umbrellas, and beach equipment. Interior bar had great service as well but the food and drinks are Pricey! We had a garden view room which meant you were looking at the tops of trees but, the room was clean, and the beds were comfy. The only issue we had was noise. You could hear everything in the rooms next door but it didn't hurt our trip overall.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: fsriol
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great gym and is very close to the water. On the negative side I'd stress the very poor noise insulation among rooms. If you sleep like a log or if you are a little deaf, no problem, but if you do not like to be awaken by next room's alarm clock or any movement of your neighbors, stay away. I find this hotel is very bad at taking care of guests' sleep. If you book it, bring your sleeping pills along. Seriously. Last, internet costs $15 a day. It should be included, at least for mail checking purposes.

Reviews.Title: “MOLD, MOLD Everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: MommaT1227
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a convention and the mold in the rooms was horrible! The sink rim was black, mold in the tub, the tub sink and toilet. The toilet seat was broken, main bathroom light was burnt out, and the desk lamp was burnt out as well. They did not have a top sheet on the bed and I was told this was a new Hilton brand standard! Can you imagine not have a top sheet, just the bed cover!?! I reported the problems to the front desk but had to return a second time in the evening when nothing was done while I was gone during the day. They did come and repair the lights, fixed the toilet seat and added a top sheet but the mold was not cleaned! No one ever followed up with me to see if everything was done. This hotel is a poor excuse for a Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, by the ocean”
Reviews.Author: TommyCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March, had a side view of the ocean from our balcony, the view was decent, better to go grab a chair by the sea wall and watch the pounding waves crash to the shore,,very very nice.Very relaxing.The pools are beautiful, enjoyed the resort grounds very much.The room was ocean view and decent.Alittle noisy in the outside hallways at night.Can hear doors slamming shut all the time, but that diminshed as the nighttime wore on,so did not disturb my sleep too much.Other than that a nice experience,and would recommend this place.Once again , the grounds are beautiful, the entire resort property extends out into the ocean.The food is pricey,but you can walk to places where you can purchase something cheaper to eat.Loved Morton's Steak House on the property, nice but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and the Beast”
Reviews.Author: Sweetlady101
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel on the outside. The only problem I had with the staff was at check-in. I had requested a Ocean View King and received a Garden View, which would have been fine only if the there was a view and not a BIG tree in my window. Otherwise they were very friendly and helpful. The electrical socket didn't work in the bathroom, thus I couldn't do my hair with a mirror. And when it rained the hotel started leaking in areas. My room was cleaned daily. I didn't take advantage of their tours but heard good things from other convention attendees. Upon check-out I was able to get my airline ticket printed which saved time at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: careyhc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but out of the way for most everything. Nice room with two queen beds and balcony with ocean view and a small kitchenette. Toilet had weak shower and toilet had to be giggled each tiem to keep from running. All in all a good 3 star but no better

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, somewhat out of the way, expensive food”
Reviews.Author: frappeboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights to start our honeymoon before getting on a cruise. Good: -Beautiful layout. Lots of area's to walk around. -The pool was amazing. Plenty of room, not very crowded. Swim up bar. -Had a bit of beach front property which was nice. Enjoyed having the option of beach or pool right next to each other. Basically I'm a sucker for hammocks too :) -There was a nice little tropical garden with swans, peacocks etc. Very quiet there. -The room's were fine. Nothing too bad but nothing very extravagant about them. We had a view of the old fort...and a bunch of building roofs ;) -Bed was comfortable. -Had a Morton's (more below) Not Good: -You're out further away from everything. My wife and I didn't feel like travelling too far away so often we just wound up eating/ drinking at the hotel. But... -The food and drinks were very expensive. I think a lower level beer was around $8. Any type of meal at the various restaurants ran you at an average $20. It just wasn't great food tho. That's why I brought up Morton's above. Yes, Morton's is expensive BUT i'd rather pay $35 for a large and very delicious steak than $25 for a disappointing cafeteria-like hamburger. Morton's also had some bar deals, happy hour, half off app's kind of deals. All in all, we did very much enjoy ourselves for the 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel maintenance and horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: wejoust
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a convention and I was disappointed. On the positive side, the hotel lobby is beautiful and the hotel is surrounded by a beautiful beach and tropical setting. As for the negative, my room smelled musty, probably because it has carpet and the room is overlooking the ocean. Some of my towels had stains which looked like blood. The bath tub and sink were clogged and the balcony door would not open. You can tell the hotel needs some maintenance and better up keep. The overall guest service was horrible; most of the front line employees were very rude and did not care including the servers in the restaurant and front desk. I was also charged a bellman fee upon check out and no one ever assisted me with my bags. I explained this and the front desk did not waive the fee. I was extremely dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: dlflightgirl
Reviews.Content: I has an ocean view but it was looking over the roof top and it was an ugly site to see however the fortress view made up for the roofs (somewhat). The pina colada's were great but overpriced. We ended up going to the liqueur store across the street just so we have a few drinks before going to dinner. The asian fusion restaurant was our favorite. The food was great even if it was over priced. The main pool was closed during our entire stay so we didn't get to enjoy it . My favorite part was the starbucks coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Birthplace of the Pina Colada lives up to the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Pealy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the nights before and after our honymoon cruise, and we loved every minute of it. The campus was beautiful, and ideally situated just outside old town San Juan. It's a long walk to the old town, but it's doable. The pool(s) are extraordinary. They have a small nature preserve in the middle of their property whcih contains ornate ponds, fountains and swans. Again, we loved every minute of it and often talk of going back - just need to find the time and the money (we live in Central Florida)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable hotel/resort although a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: mbg39
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort is very nice and the staff were nice and helpful. Restaurants are quite good although bar food is only ok. It is a bit out of the way but that also makes it quiter than the resorts out in Isla Verde or the Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Great time! Will do it again”
Reviews.Author: elman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from 10/02- 10/06 on business. I was a little worried due to the fact that I had read several reviews. All I can say is that the Caribe Hilton was awsome. Check-In was a breeze, I even got an upgrade. The facilities were clean and the staff was friendly. I will say that since I had a rental I did not eat in the hotel. We Went to Old San Juan and had dinner at Raices and other restaurants in the area. The pools are clean and not crowded. The beach was beautiful and also very clean. I will certainly stay at the Caribe Hilton again.The only issue had was with the fridge which I later figuered out was not at the coldest setting. I called the front desk and they came 3 hours later, at which time I was already sleeping. I did take a look at the menu and prices and it seemed very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Romantic and more”
Reviews.Author: milkyjo53
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised to see the hotel. The hotel has a beautiful open entrance with welcoming charming views of the Atlantic Ocean. The gym is small but it has the latest equipment. Pools, and beach area are amazing. For economical dining, leave the restaurant!! The only affordable restaurant on premises was the Pina Colada Club, which has one of the best churrasco flank steaks and the best Pina Coladas. Taxis are very easy to take and a ride from hotel to Old Sanjuan can run you up to $15 one way. Our ocean view room was spacious and guest services were good. I would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “You will have a great time here!”
Reviews.Author: Pat076
Reviews.Content: The Caribe is a wonderful hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful. The view upon checking in is beautiful. I love the flow of the lobby area. The room staff are very accommodating and at your service at all times. I have stayed here before and will again. Most dinner options are pricey but a quick taxi will take you to some delicious food off site. I will say the Pina Colada club had some good food that was reasonably priced. The only complaint is the self parking, ticket validation is a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, rooms not so clean, staff rude”
Reviews.Author: medtravel
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on Priceline but wouldn't pay hotel rates and I only stayed one night. The location was beautiful, the have a private beach and a wonderful pool area on the ocean. 1st room a tree blocked the whole window, I asked for another room. The 2nd room had a trashed door and no lock on the sliding patio door. The 3rd room (Tower room) the air conditioner filter door was broken so it was open. the filters were filthy. The staff was very rude when I checked to see if my room was ready at 3:30 after waiting at the pool since 10am. They never called me and I went back to check on my room at 4:30. Check in time is 4. They never called, I got the feeling that since I didn't want the first room they were going to make me wait for the next room. There was no line for check in, hotel was not full this was a Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hilton but NO SOUNDPROOFING ... again !”
Reviews.Author: siempreengira
Reviews.Content: This is the 3d Hilton i stayed for my buisness tour in North america , all of them had exactly the same problem! , EXTREME lack of soundproofing , specially coming from the adjacent room with the locked door that connected my room. This was the best hilton out of the 3 i stayed on my trip , the room was nice the bathroom was modern and it just seemed much more upscale than the others .. There is again no minibar , i only stayed there for a few 6 hours where i needed my sleep , unfortunately , i had a room relatively near the elevator so i could hear "din dong"every 5 minutes , the maids where also really loud and 8 am , i mean i know we are in latin america and people are loud , but please train your cleaning staff to lower the voice while on duty ! specially when the walls are paper thin! I had a terrible time sleeping , i got waken up by the annoying family beside my room about 10 times , they screamed at each other like wild pigs... what an annoying bunch.. I would really ask the Hilton to adress the problem with its adjacent door issues as this is the third time I had to face this annoying noise from other peoples room .. In Europe the hiltons are dead silent but also considered an expensive hotel... this issue will never be tolerated by europeans.. I did not try anything else or saw much from the hotel , they have a star bucks below which is quite nice... Would not recomment this hotel for Buisness or Flight crew If you need to rest go somewhere else , Puerto ricans are loud and this hotel has paper thin walls (like all NA hiltons i been so far)... not a good comb!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: halwtom
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, very pleasent and helpful staff. would certainly stay there again. Went a day early before our cruise and chose to stay at this Hilton. It was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “STAY FAR AWAY”
Reviews.Author: jadejoann4
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL CLAIMS 4 STARS BUT I HAVE BEEN IN HOLIDAY INNS THAT HAVE MORE IN COMMON WITH THE WALDORF THAN THIS PLACE. The rooms are old and the bathroom is scary. The midlew is everywhere and the dirt caked up behind the toilet was completely disgusting. My kids and myself wore sandlals in the shower cecause it was that bad..The grounds are very nice and the views are gorgeous. The pool, nice, the staff nice. If you didnt have to sleep here, i would say its great. By the way, 15 bucks for internet service. Stick to Isla Verde

Reviews.Title: “I refuse to allow a title to spoil my review...”
Reviews.Author: gruntlumber
Reviews.Content: To summarize my review in advance, this hotel is great. I researched the heck out of Puerto Rico before booking my trip, and the Caribe delivered within all the parameters I was looking for in a place to stay. Maybe itâ€™ll be helpful to take you through my decision-making thought process. I definitely wanted a good beach. While my idea of a vacation is more adventurous and active, my wifeâ€™s ideal vacation is to relax on a beach. That meant anything in the Condado area, Isla Verde, or out east to Fajardo would work in that regard. I seriously considered the El Conquistador in Fajardo. The only thing holding me back was the poor recent reviews. I saw it from a distance when we took a boat out to Calebra and it looked magnificent. I was drawn to the El Conquistadorâ€™s more isolated setting, but another negative is the beach is not readily available; it takes a short boat ride. That may have not been a problem for us either, but some people complained about the fact you canâ€™t just walk down to a beach on the property. The other area I considered was Isla Verde. The Intercontinental and Ritz Iâ€™m sure wouldâ€™ve been fine, and the beach great, but I really liked the idea of having a more private beach. Weâ€™ve done the south Florida thing a couple times and preferred something where not anyone and everyone can walk the beach. Isla Verde seemed too close to the airport as well; I imagined lots of noise. Also wasnâ€™t that excited to stay at a casino hotel (but we went and gambled at the Conrad anywayâ€¦go figure). The Caribe seemed to fit into what I was looking for. On a four night trip, we could do the Old San Juan sites, enjoy a private beach, great ocean views, and be off the beaten path somewhat (which is both good and badâ€¦the bad being too few food choices within walking distance). Having an ocean room was also a requirement of mine, and the Caribe compared nicely on price, but honestly cost was not much a factor; everyone was fairly similar through our CheapCaribbean.com booking. The Caribe lobby is impressive. Wide open, clean, and greeted by the ocean. We were completely happy with our room. Top floor, good view of the ocean, the fort, and Condado. The king bed was super comfortable and had at least 6 pillows. No issues with cleanliness or service. The maids were always helpful when I raided their carts in the morning for more coffee packets. We didnâ€™t have any beefs with customer service. Upon check-in, the receptionist gave us the option to upgrade to a villa for an extra $20/night. Otherwise weâ€™d have the 10th floor ocean view. She gave us a key to go look at the villa and we decided against it; although it was right on the ocean, the old fort was the primary focal point and the balcony was tiny (no room to sit at all). Also, itâ€™s removed too far from the main resort/pool area. If a person wants more privacy from the rest of the resort, this would be a good option; thereâ€™s a separate pool and hot tub, and the garden area with the swans is really peaceful. We opted for the pool where we could belly up to the bar and drink. Speaking of drinks, yeah, this place isnâ€™t cheap, but it also isnâ€™t as bad as some of the reviews made it sound. Câ€™mon people, itâ€™s a Hilton resort. Ordering a pitcher is the best deal: $39 versus $12 a pop. The menu says a pitcher will give you 5 drinks, but we consistently got at least 6 out of it. That averages out to chain-restaurant prices. The local draft beer Madalla is $6 so that isnâ€™t too horrible either. Besides, they werenâ€™t picky about bringing your own drinks down to the beach; just be discrete about it. We stocked up at one of the gas stations up the road on the first day (a Shell station I think). We only patronized one on-site restaurant during our stay: the Pina Colada Club. Not impressive. We were just looking for a laid-back, simple way to fill our stomachs the first night we arrived, but very small portions for the price. With so many good restaurants in the area we ventured elsewhere for the rest of our trip (unless you count Starbucksâ€¦nice to have in the lobby). We rented a car for the entire stay, mainly because I got it dirt cheat through the airport Alamo ($84 total 4 days, incl tax). Even with hotel parking, which is $15.00/day plus tax (but they only charged me for 2 daysâ€¦I didnâ€™t ask why), I figured Iâ€™d get my moneyâ€™s worth out of it. We drove to Old San Juan a couple times for dinner, and we wouldâ€™ve needed to rent a car for our Calebra excursion anyway so it worked out nicely. If youâ€™re in decent shape, the walk to Old San Juan is a certainly a doable jaunt. We walked it twice during our stay. We had no issues with safety, although our first impression of some areas between the hotel and Old San Juan (Puerta de Tierra) were sketchy. A local was telling us the government has been trying to push out the low rent stuff but itâ€™s been a slow process. Itâ€™s weird to see high-end condo towers scattered amongst trashy old buildings, but thatâ€™s what youâ€™ll see. Just turn your head and look toward the ocean insteadâ€¦much better! So, my marathon review ends on this: thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan's beauty”
Reviews.Author: larose322
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the island. The weather was great. The hotel was great. And the drinks at the hotel were great. The hotel food was alright... nothing to brag home about but the room was very nice and clean with a partial ocean view. I would stay here again and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic View...”
Reviews.Author: NoctisCaelum
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton at Old San Juan, has all the elegance and excellent service of other Hiltons, combine with the unique view of the Atlantic Sea, Condado's Lagoon and St. Geronimo's Fort. The pool and beach area, even though do not have water slides, compensate that fact with the use of every single space. Hammocks area, comfortable outside bed and seats, kids playground, basketball half court, etc... During the night, all that space, plus the sea breeze and the dim lights, provides the most romantic view in the Caribbean

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: parl2010
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE They double charged myself and others from my party nearly draining everyone s credit or debit card. gave such a hard time to return back the monies as if it were our fault. still did not recieve deposit money. never again

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Place”
Reviews.Author: turbotom1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a resort with all the things travelers like and need. Pools are great and lagoon is unbelievable. I cant recommend the Italian restaurant for any thing, don't even bother. On the other hand the breakfast brunch with Champagne and omelets was a big hit with everyone.

Reviews.Title: “We are in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: 52statetraveler
Reviews.Content: We did have a little snafu on arrival, the hotel took care of it expeditiously. My only complaint I'd $12.00 for a taxi ride for less than 2.5 miles. The hotel itself is gorgeous and beach is beautiful. Just to warn anyone thinking about the horse and buggy tour in Old San Juan is not worth the monies. I paid $50.00 for a tour (less than 20 minutes) and I knew more about Old San Juan than the tour guide. El Yunque waterfall is gorgeous but slippery wear tennis shoes are shoes with traction. Well i don't check out until Monday. I will jeep you posted.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nelsonrandall
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Old San Juan or by cab $12.00 eachway. Beach great!!!!! Food is exspensive and average. But we did not eat very often at the hotel. Subway very close and if you rent a car you are within minutes of great food much less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Got to SEE to Belive the BEAUTY !!!!”
Reviews.Author: rebecroadwife
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay!!! No problems that really need to be posted here. Delightful stay !!!! Great location. Wonderful staff- Great services. Love the Oasis Bar and Rest. and the Breakfast at Palamers food and staff, some of the Best I have Experienced... I travel with my husband. And they all treated me Kind....Will miss them. Thanks for the Memories Rebekah Cain and Jack Cain- April- Sept 2010..... Outstanding will return and recommend....

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing family retreat”
Reviews.Author: toyzco
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful vacation we had with our kids. The staff is magnificent. The property very pretty and well kept. Restuarants very good. Yes - they are expensive but so are all meals in better resort hotels. The Caribe offers a great meal plan for kids. My little one ate for free and the older one for half price. Great incentive to stay at the hotel for meals. Pools beautiful. Beach, though small was private and great for kids. Special thanks to the security staff who kindly took me and my little one who was suffering with ear pain to the Children's Hospital and brought us back while Hurricane Earl was coming through San Juan. They were so sweet and helpful. We stayed for seven nights and wished we could stay longer. Hurricane Earl only disrupted one day of our trip and the hotel had plenty of activities in the beautiful lobby to keep us entertained. It was awesome looking out those great windows and watching the waves crash and the palm trees blow while playing with the kids in the lobby.We have been to other high end resorts in Puerto Rico but will definitely be staying at the Caribe Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!!! Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RubenV76
Reviews.Content: I came to Puerto Rico for my anniversary and stayed at 2 different hotels. I stayed at the Ramada in Ponce and was horriffic and then came to Caribe Hilton. I have to say I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. The staff was polite, helpful, and prompt. I diddnt wait long for check in. The city was having a rave or something and parking was full, the staff provided me with Valet Service at regular parking price. I am so happy with this hotel I highly recommend this hotel they are GREAT, GREAT, GREAT. I most definetly will be coming to stay here again!! I have stayed different hotels on the Island since I have family here but this hotel was the best, Price wasnt too bad, it was well worth it and most important the bed was soft and the room very clean and fresh. Just try it and you will agree it will be a great stay. You may find it pricey but its the going rate on the island and some have very horrible service and not worth the stay. It seems that this hotel must pride itself on making their guest happy, thats just my opinion. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Preci0us1
Reviews.Content: This was the last day of a vacation around Puerto Rico and I chose this hotel for the upscale atmosphere and service. Upon reaching the room @ 3:00 I tried to take a shower but the drain was somehow clogged and water filled the 4" floor of the shower. When I called the front desk they said they would send someone right away. Over 2 hours later, 5:15, they arrived and for the next 45 min men went in and out of the room with a vacuum system tracking dirt and unknown debris and sludge from the drain back and forth across the room. They said they would send maintenance to clean the mess. After another half hour and no maid to clean, I went to speak with the manager, Mr. Blade, about the situation and lack of urgency to fix the situation and have some kind of compensation for the inconvenience. He listened expressionless, almost bored, then told me to come back later that evening and he would see what he could do. I told him I had dinner plans and the bathroom was filthy. He smugly said he would see that someone came to clean and I could come back later that night - with no offer to contact me or rectify the situation. When I got back to the room my spouse told me a lady came with only a mop and no cleaning supplies and he cleaned the sludge from the shower himself so he could take a shower. In the end I chose not to disrupt my evening any further with speaking to Mr. Blade again only to be further frustrated. We left the next morning at 10:00 - There were no calls from Mr. Blade (not surprising) and I received no attempts from the hotel to "clear the slate" and make my visit a pleasurable experience. I will not be back. Oh, and just a side note -For 40 years I have traveled all over the world and stayed at all kinds of hotels and resorts and this is my worst experience and the only complaint letter I have ever written!

Reviews.Title: “Great winter relaxation”
Reviews.Author: caexileinma
Reviews.Content: My family is deciding on a place for Christmas 2010. The last two years we stayed at the Caribe Hilton. At Christmas the hotel is packed, but the few problems that arose were taken care of in a reasonable amount of time. This is a great place to relax for week during the winter and has the added bonus of being with a long walk or a short taxi ride from Old San Juan. The hotel has everything you need, and the staff is great. The only real drawback, which is true of most fully-booked beach hotels, is that it is hard to get a nice place to sit at the beach because guests come down early and leave their stuff on the chair even though they don't show up for hours and then keep their places when the go to lunch. A problem that needs fixing here and everywhere else. Still, I think we will be going back for our third Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel/Resort in San Juan Area”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca194
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at various hotels in San Juan/Isla Verde/Condado/Ocean Park areas, and the Caribe Hilton has the most expansive grounds, best pools and picturesque views of all these establishments. Whereas other San Juan hotels are obviously just that, Caribe always feels like a wonderful and large RESORT for your enjoyment and relaxation. One evening we had dinner at Lemongrass and the service and food were very good. The drinks at the hotel were well made and the bartender at Atlantico spontaneously offered my daughter a virgin pina colada with cherries which she loved and was so kindof him to do so. Staff was always respectful and courteous, at no point did I witness any harsh exchanges between staff and clientele. Puerto Rican people generally take pride in presenting in courteous and conservative fashion. Meal and drink costs are no higher at this resort than at any other U.S. or Caribbean resort, so you can't fault the hotel. You generally expect to pay while on vacation, economically there is no better deal than an all-inclusive resort and these are virtually non-existent in Puerto Rico. Also, of critical importance YOU MUST RENT A CAR in Puerto Rico. If you don't, it's difficult to get around and, more importantly, you are missing the opportunity to explore new horizons and meet new people on the island. Consider this when making your travel plans. I wish I could have rated five stars during this stay but refrained from doing so because of all the remodeling going on i.e. tropical gardens, italian restaurant, but am certain that if I were to stay here again it would be five stars hands down. Thank you Caribe Hilton for a wonderful vacation. I know I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for the service and expect to find your room unlocked”
Reviews.Author: wkdgme
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at this hotel on my business trip for 57 nights after enduring 22 nights I left. I would have left sooner but I had a hard time finding availability at other hotels. The check in process at the villas was painful. When I entered I was the only guest there to check in however the gal on staff was too busy talking on the phone to say hello or acknowledge I was there. Finally after 15 minutes she started the check in process. After getting my key I headed to my room and found I was not given the room type I had booked. I booked a room with a kitchen however I was given a regular room. When I went back to inquire at the desk I was told they were over booked and I'd have to try again in the morning. No apologies just a very persistent unwillingness to help. The following morning I woke up to find that my room door had been shoved open and the only thing preventing whomever from entering was the metal bar at the top. When I asked about a new room in the morning and explained what happened I didn't receive an explanation or an apology... in fact my safety issue was not even addressed. The gentleman in the morning said he would check for me during the day to find a room and leave a message for me since I had to work. Upon return to my room that evening I found my room had been left unlocked by house cleaning. I just had to shove the door and it opened. No message from the gentleman who said he'd help me and when I went back down to the desk to complain about my room and explain what happened the previous night I received no apology or concern. Very disheartening. After a third day and return to find my room unlocked I finally was moved to another room but not after going to the same women as check in at the desk who I had pleaded my case to before. You would think after day three going to the same people, having the same continuous issue they would remember you (especially since you are an extended stay customer). Every time I went to the desk I was given the same I don't really want to help you attitude. I never did receive an apology or acknowledgement about my security issues, I was asked finally asked if I needed someone to come with me to verify my belongings were still there. The staff at the front desk made me feel like I was an annoyance and not of value. They even sent a bellhop to the wrong room to help me move my bags. I do have to say the new room was better. They area they say is a kitchen is not a kitchen, nor does it come equipped with anything. I've stayed at plenty of hotels who boast a kitchen and at least they had a cup or a plate. This was a sink with a microwave and a mini fridge. No utensils, dishes, or cleaning supplies. I had a few more bumps along the way on my 22 night stay. A fire in the main part of the hotel. It was on the local news and luckily it was contained and no one was hurt. There was never any notification to the guests at the hotel about the incident. I thought for sure there would be a note letting the guests know everything was safe but nothing. There was a day of rancid sewer smell as it was being pumped and spilled over into the street and pathways where people had to walk from the parking garage to the villas. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area is nice but that was not enough to keep me there. I have now relocated to another nearby hotel and I am so glad I did. The staff at the new hotel are like a breath of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Very good hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: clark314
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel with good service, great ocean views, clean rooms and a lot of amenities. I was concerned based upon the other reviews but as soon as the taxi dropped us off at the hotel, I knew we picked the right place. Check-in took 5 minutes, we stayed in the towers with two connecting ocean view rooms, which were really nice and clean. The beds were very very comfortable and the bathrooms were clean, large and the walk in shower was great! We did eat at the restaurants in the hotel, the pina colada is at the bottom of the towers and has a less expensive breakfast option on weekends which was nice. We also ate at palmeras for breakfast because our two kids ate free with accompanying adults. The location was excellent, however we are used to walking long distances so I wouldnt recommend it to everyone. We walked several times back and forth to Old San Juan, even at night and didnt have any problems. To get to Old San Juan it took about 30 minute and is a straight walk to and from the hotel. We also walked to condado and it is a much easier 10-15 minute walk depending where you are eating. To get there we just went to the back of the hotel to the lagoon villas and there is a red brick walkway going towards a condo next door and we just followed it to the main street, made a left and turned left onto the bridge and we were there. Dont be scared to walk around, there are many joggers, bicyclists and people around, even at night. The beach is small, but it was big enough to be enjoyable and swim around. We loved the fish swimming around and it was clear and clean. The pools are nice and were not crowded at all when we were there. There were plenty of beach chairs and umbrellas all throughout the day. Housekeeping did a good job and made sure it was cleaned every day. The front desk staff was efficient, nice and answered our questions without a problem. Getting a taxi takes about 2 seconds, they are lined up at the front entrance so you just tell a staff member and they will signal one and off you go. There is a business center on the second floor that let me log on and print off our boarding passes free of charge, which I thought was nice. Ive been to several Caribbean resorts and this compares favorably to the rest, including the price of food and amenities. No, this hotel is not a dump or falling apart, just set your expectations accordingly and do research so you know what to expect and you will have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: EWR2SJU
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a trip to the Caribe HIlton for our wedding anniversary. We had a wonderful time. We originally booked an ocean view room in the Hilton Tower. Upon checkin we upgraded (for an additional $15 per night) to a villa overlooking San Geronimo fort and the Condado lagoon, we were very happy with our upgrade. The bed was extremely comfortable and our room was cleaned each and every day. The staff always greeted us with a smile. The beach is the only private beach on the island and is protected all around by rock barriers. The water is crystal clear and very, VERY, warm! :) The pool area was beautiful! Plenty of space for us to hang out in! We could swear we had the place to ourselves as there were not too many guests when we stayed. The pool is a 3 tiered infinity pool. The most popular is the top tier which is located right at the bar. Upon check out, there is a hotel tax fee. I read one review on here where the person was upset with the charge... it's 3 dollars a day total!!!!!!!! The Caribe HIlton is not for penny pinchers. For those guests who've stayed at the Hilton and complained about how expensive the food is... Why did you stay here? The menus are posted online. We did our research and saved our money to have wonderful meals as we don't eat McDonald's or SUBWAY! We had the luxury of eating in all of the restaurants in the hotel. Each experience was better than the last. We had the buffet breakfast every morning. Their oatmeal is delicious. We also had egg white omelets made to order. We ate at Morton's steakhouse which was expensive, but worth every penny. We had dinner there for our anniversary and they put our names on the menu! :) They treated us to dessert as well! We had lunch in the Pineapple Club a few times! Delicious food! Their PinaColada tres leches cake is to die for! We had lunch at the Atlantico Pool once. It was really good. We had dinner at the italian restaurant as well. Our experience at the restaurants was fabulous! We took a cab into Old San Juan for 12 dollars each way. We walked to the lobby and concierge got us a cab in one second! We had lunch at Raices restaurant. The food was fabulous. We walked around the old cobblestone streets and were enchanted. (There are a few beggars here and there) If you like to walk, you can walk from the Hilton to Old San Juan, I figure it's about 40 minutes or so. I would not walk at night. We also walked accross the lagoon's bridge to the Conrad Condado Plaza hotel one night. Lots of joggers on the bridge! We had dinner at Varita. It was ok. We basically relaxed on the beautiful private beach! We were the only ones in the water at one point. They have plenty of chairs and umbrellas. You have to sign out the beach towels and umbrellas. They set up the umbrella where you want it. Simply return them and you will not get charged a fee. We had no problem with this. Just an FYI, they are constructing and remodeling. All to better the hotel. When we checked out... we realized we'd be back! We loved the people, the hotel, the private beach, the forts, the food, EVERYTHING. If you are a penny pinching complainer, this is not the place for you. Stay at an all inclusive hotel elsewhere where you'll get montezuma's revenge, bed bugs and mediocre food! :)~~

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dreemz05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Caribe Hilton. The rooms had very comfortable beds with flat screen tv's. I especially liked the bathroom, which was marble with oversized glass showers and double sinks. The hotel grounds were beautiful, and perfect for relaxing. I did not find any part of the hotel that was in "ruins" nor was it "old and decaying". Atleast that wasn't my definition of it. The hotel did have a 1950's atmosphere when you walked into the open air lobby, but I thought it gave it a nostalgic character, not an indication for a renewal. Yes, everything at the hotel was very expensive which seems like the prominent concern amongst all of the reviewers here. But all resorts have expensive restaurants and drinks. There are plenty of frugal options. For one, we always took a bus rather than a taxi to Old San Juan. The bus stop is just blocks away from the hotel, and runs until midnight. The Starbucks onsite has reasonable breakfast sandwhiches, and the Subway across the street makes great for lunch. Also, don't forget that you can order food to your room from anything from Dominos to Chinese food. The only thing is that you have to eat it in your room rather than the hotel grounds. Ask the concierge for the phone numbers of fast food delivery restaurants. In addition, the Morton's Steakhouse onsite has a happy hour most days of the week. My only complaint was that the beach in the resort is not a natural beach, it is a man-made beach blockaded by wavebreakers. It is quite small, and sufficient for swimming and relaxing. But I definitely suggest you take a day trip to one of San Juan's "real" beaches. Overall, from the parrots to the peacocks, this was a lovely hotel that was well worth what we paid. We wil be back!

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: tritone24
Reviews.Content: I think our stay might have been better if this hotel didn't suffer from overcrowding. The grounds themselves are nice, and the website make them look even better. In the website the pool looks huge and stunning. You can just picture yourself relaxing and swimming in it. What the website fails to convey is the fact that it is PACKED all the time. Supposedly, we went during low season. However, all the times we tried to go to the pool (early in the morning, late at night, right in the middle of the day) it was so full that we no longer found it enjoyable. It was hard to find a little space to swim or stay still without being really close to ther people or children jumping and splashing everywhere. Maybe because of this overcrowding, I felt like the staff treated you like you were one of a pack and not like an individual. When we calmly strolled into the pool area, a guy harshly demanded that we show him our key to prove we were guests. Maybe we so many guests it's hard for him to address everyone in a gentle tone? Also, I feel the towel policies are ridiculous. There are signs everywhere threatening to charge you $25 if you fail to return it to the pool area. Again, it seems like the type of blancket threats one would use on children or a huge crowd to get them to comply. What happened to a relaxing vacation? The tennis playing was fun, the room was clean, the view was nice and the bed was very comfortable, but I would seriously consider doing something to make guests not feel like a member of a huge crowd in a hotel with so many rooms. It seriously makes it feel generic.

Reviews.Title: “Tips for the price conscious traveler”
Reviews.Author: FunTravels123
Reviews.Content: We spent four full days in San Juan and had a wonderful vacation. The Caribe Hilton is in a great location for seeing everything the city has to offer, since the Condado area is a little farther from OSJ. We spent one day touring the forts and the old city, one day traveling to El Yunque rainforest, and the last two days hanging out at the beach and pool. The hotel itself is very nice. Bus â€“ The bus stop is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. We usually waited 10 minutes for the bus to come, and the trip itself is about 7 minutes. It drops you off close to all of the restaurants. It is a great alternative to taxing to OSJ if you donâ€™t mind waiting in the heat for a few minutes. The 50 cent fair each way beats the $24 youâ€™d spend on a taxi round-trip! At night, weâ€™d take the bus into town to eat dinner and a cab home since it would be dark. Food â€“ The restaurants in OSJ are all pretty much priced the same - $20-25 for an entrÃ©e. Lunch is about $10-15. I recommend Dragonfly (Japanese) and Sofiaâ€™s (Italian). Puerto Rican food in general consists of pork, rice, beans, plantains, etc. It was OK, but not exactly the healthiest option. We discovered that there is a Subway right next door to the hotel! We definitely saved some money eating breakfast ($5-6) and occasionally lunch ($6-7) there. Keep in mind the taxi fair if you do travel to OSJ to eat, because that adds to the cost of your meal. We did eat once at the hotel at the Italian restaurant. It was $25 for each meal, and consisted of nothing but a portion of pasta. I would not recommend eating here, even if it is convenient. The food quality was average. Drinks â€“ Drinks at the hotel are not cheap! $7 for a beer, $10 for a mixed drink or pina colada. They are good, of course, but pretty pricey. We chose to drink while at restaurants or buy our own alcohol at the convenient store next door. Touring â€“ The El Morro and San Cristobal tours together are $5. You can spend an entire morning+ at these sites. Very historical and interesting. Keep in mind itâ€™s hot! Bring a big bottle of water. We went on the hotelâ€™s excursion to El Yunque and loved it! We did the option with the La Mina Falls hike. It requires a lot of walking/hiking, but definitely a neat experience, and you get to swim in the falls in some pretty chilly water! El Yunque is beautiful. Overall we did a lot of walking, got a good tan, and had a great trip. Everyone at the hotel was very nice, the beds were extremely comfy, the beach was clear. I would recommend PR and Caribe Hilton to others!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation...Caribe Hilton is Beautiful But Pricey”
Reviews.Author: shaylee0117
Reviews.Content: My husband myself and our 11 year old son stayed at the Caribe Hilton the 1st week in Aug 2010, we had an excellent experience, our room was very nice and clean, we were on the 8th floor of the original building (not the tower) and I think we had the best veiw, we could see all the way to the port and took pictures of cruise boats coming into port and then on the other side of the veiw was the ocean and the hotel pools which are infinity pools right on the beach.... what more could you ask for!!! The hotel is a little pricey as far as food and shops go, however we ate mostly off site in Old San Juan to experince real Puerto Rican food, we found several very reasonable priced restaurants and the food was delciious and Old San Juan is a short taxi/bus ride away. We loved it so much here we are going back on the 27th of this month, ( Same Month) for our 10 year wedding anniversary with 4 of our friends as a adult couples trip and we are very excited. Highly recommend!!!! Dont let these "haters" change your mind, you will love it here!!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Destination_Seeker31
Reviews.Content: A definite return to this property; great location with an awesome historical twist to it. Our room overlooked the bay, the ocean and a Spanish fortress. From the moment you step into the lobby you know you have arrived. The tranquility and ocean breeze of this property are just superb. This is not the typical casino madness hotel with loud and large crowds running all over the place. There is no casino at this hotel, which I think is what sets it apart from all the other properties across the bay. A short ride in a cab will take you to those places, if that's what you are looking for. We even turn the AC off in our room during the day just to enjoy the breezes and sounds from the ocean. It was more than we expected, just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton tropical vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Beachlovergirl10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first 2 nights of our 8 night Puerto Rico vacation before we headed off to visit family around the island. This hotel property is very nice. We were first given a room in the orginal main tower, the furnishing was updated, but it was humid and musty and I requested to be moved after being in the room for about 20 minutes and feeling my allergies start to act up. The hotel staff quickly moved us to a newer building on the property and I had no problems there. The room was updated with a coffee maker, mini-fridge and a safe. We would have liked to stay here longer, but we were off to visit family. We enjoyed the views of the beach from our balcony, visiting the pool at night and laying in the hammocks under the palm trees. This hotel is not located in Old San Juan, but is a short bus trip away. There are restaurants and a Starbucks on site that can get to be bit pricey compared to eating off property. There is a Subway and 2 liquor/tiny convenience stores around the corner from the resort property. The resort property itself is very nice, clean, the shops and restaurants are priced for a "resort". I would recommend stopping by a convenience store and buying a small cooler for snacks and drinks. There is a parking garage adjacent to the property where you can park your vehicle for a price per day. My favorites were the view from the balcony, west facing the sunset and El Morro. The best nights of my trip to Puerto Rico. Don't forget to stop by the concierge adn ask for a map. When I stopped by the conceriege and asked about visiting Old San Juan he wasn't very helpful in offering a map or offering information on any tours, etc. I had to search around Old San Juan for a map, we managed. Overall, front desk staff were always helpful and the Pina Colada waiter was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton, San Juan Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: blackjacktraveller
Reviews.Content: Puling up to the hotel at 2am after a long delayed flight was amazing. The hotel immediately took me to visions of what the rat pack (well, Oceans Eleven in my case) experienced when traveling. I enjoyed the hotel, its restaurants and its location (close to the Attractions in Old San Juan and far enough from the airport). The beach area, the pool area, the grounds were beautifully kept and the room was clean. Maybe it was me but the downside was actually the staff. It wasn't until my last day there that I felt "welcomed" by anyone. A Waiter in the Palmeras named Soto was warm, friendly and just ...a cool guy. Up to that point no one really gave me a smile other than other guest. It was a bother trying to get extra towels for the entire family. They continued to give us just enough for one, not three people. Part of me wanted to think that as the only clearly African-American guest, that it was that but speaking to other guest it was just the way of the staff...unfriendly and unhelpful. I think you need to be a frequent traveler to PR if you are going to stay at this hotel. You NEED to know where you are going and what you want to do because they aren't helpful at all. And bring your own laptop...there's plenty of Wi-Fi spots whoch is good since the business center only has two computers that's hogged by young kids on facebook.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CapitanPatapalo
Reviews.Content: Overall we were satisfied with our stay at the Caribe and would stay there again. We had an ocean view in the main building. The room was comfortable, quiet and clean. The bed was super. We walked across the bridge to the other side of the lagoon for dinner (really liked Hacienda Don Jose) - no problem, we felt safe. Parking was $15 per day for hotel guests (although this rate was not conspicuously posted). There were some negatives, not too serious. We were surprised by the strong ocean-ey smell of the hallway. Our reservation included breakfast but as mentioned in other reviews, the cost would otherwise have been $26 pp and even if it's included, you still have to pay the tip. The breakfast buffet was good (made-to-order omelets, ripe local fruits, freshly squeezed orange juice, champagne) but not worth the $26 to us. On the weekend the pool and beach were too crowded, maybe the hotel sells day passes to locals. Finally, while the hotel does rent kayaks, you canâ€™t leave the inlet so thereâ€™s no point.

Reviews.Title: “The vacation that will take your breath away !”
Reviews.Author: Skyhawk92
Reviews.Content: While the views are stunning, the smell on the 7th floor of this hotel will take your breath away!!! The carpet in the hallway smells like a sewer on a very hot and humid day, a lot like the drainage sewer that is outside of the Subway, which is the only close offsite place to eat. The bathroom was dirty and the vent in the shower was clogged with dust, as though it had not been cleaned in years. Our room had a lovely view of San Geronimo, note that it is only a partial ocean view. The breakfast buffet is overpriced (60.00 for two adults kids under 12 are free), and the food was not that great. The pool area is great but they don't clean under the chairs very often i.e. cups from the bar and lime slices are everywhere. The beach is man made and nothing to write home about. There is a nice natural beach down the street from the hotel that seems to be used by the locals beautiful sand and crystal clear water. The stores on site at the hotel are very overpriced. The Spa was by far the best part of the hotel... I received a fantastic massage from Alexis, very relaxing, clean and well maintained Spa. In all San Juan is a beautiful city and Puerto Rico is a very enchanting island and I look forward to visiting again but I will not stay here again or recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Really nice property!”
Reviews.Author: delrayAlexandria
Reviews.Content: Just want to give a shout out to the Caribe Hilton. They allowed us to move from the Lagoon Villas (not recommended, same price and lesser views) with no hassle and a very high level of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: smb32
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not in a good location. Only shop can walk to is Subway. Taxi to Old San Juan is $15 one way. Staff does not tell you about the $1 bus. Hotel is on a inlet so can not walk on the beach. The waves are very rough with rocky shore for most of San Juan-so unsuable. Hotel is directly beside a boarded up hotel The Normandie, so your adjacent view is not relaxing. Bums hang out there. The hotel lobby is nice. I changed rooms 3 times as they are dirty. Bathrooms smell of mold and urine, floors and carpet were dirty. Breakfast buffet restaurant overpriced and not good food. Beware of the shoe store in the hotel lobby called "ORMA" as they sell $38 shoes for $150 and up. I was scammed by them over a pair of damaged overpriced shoes. I will not stay here again as this Hilton did not provide a relaxing, enjoyable Carribean vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great for families”
Reviews.Author: ScottRicho
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, located by a private beach. It is quite near the airport and San Juan Old Town via taxi. Great pool area, brilliant for the kids. Rooms are of a good standard and can accommodate up to 4 people. Only minor downside is that you do need to take a taxi to go anywhere to far to walk. Also they offer wireless internet in the lobby area for free but must pay in the rooms, would be better to include internet in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaAlicia
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at The Caribe Hilton, Puerto Rico August 4 - 8, 2010.
