The staff was friendly and attentive yet houskeeping could be improved some of the rooms were not cleaned properly and left dirty. As a hospitality person myself I felt as though the rooms could be inspected better. The front desk was fast and efficient and the overnight red head clerk was attentive and gracious. There is no overnight room service. We arrived late around 12 am and there was nothing in the area we could eat. The overall experience was great and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: hwarb
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel twice once being on business a couple of years ago and more recently for leisure i have no problem in recommending this hotel. The hotel reception is lovely and airy and check in never a problem. There are also a few shops in the reception area (be warned these are very expensive... one shoe shop did take my fancy!!) and also a Starbucks, which is a great way to start the day. When i stayed on business i was allocated a room in the tower block. This block could do with so updating, but the room was spacious and clean. The bed was actually to die for!!! one of the best nights sleep I've ever had! The more recently stay was alot better.... the room we were allocated had been refurbished to a very high standard with a flat screen TV mounted on the wall, ipod docking station and hairdryer. One of the best rooms i had stayed in. The bathroom was very modern, clean, with a massive double shower and fluffy towels! I cant really comment on the restaurant as i never ate there, but the hotel bar area was very relaxing in the evening. The pool area is very spacious and quiet with free sunbeds and towels. Most people while i were there choose to lie on the small beach area. San Juan old town is a beautiful town and definitely worth the visit. With its cobbled streets and cute bars and restaurants. There is also the old fort that is definitely worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Well Mixed”
Reviews.Author: EasyTraveler3
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference last week -- interestingly a conference of professors of hotel management. My experience could be characterized as mixed. Almost all of the food service and front desk employees gave pleasant, helpful service. The guest room was average to slightly above for such a property. There were issues with proper equipment in conference rooms. My room cleaning was skipped one day. Took a call to housekeeping and a subsequent visit to the front desk to eventually get a housekeeper up a couple hours later at about 10pm. I might not have bothered, but I needed facial tissues, and that's all I asked for when the house keeper showed up. But I got charged extra. If I would have the same experiences next time, I go again, but I'd book with my fingers crossed. BTW, the front desk clerk with the red hair who checked me out just before 6am Sunday was more pleasant than she ever needed to be at that hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCAnonymous_8
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I returned after four days and nights in Puerto Rico and stayed at the Caribe Hilton. I like the service provided by the staff- from the front desk, to porters and room service. Everyone is helpful and professional. The hotel lives up to the positive reviews I read prior to leaving for PR and booking a room. The room is big and clean and feels luxurious. The beach is wonderful and clean and well maintained. Food sources are limited, you have to go to San Juan or Condado for other options. The bus stop to San Juan is near and cheap (75 cents) and the hotel is walking distance to the Condado area. Otherwise, if you don't drive, taxis will deplete your budget just to get around from place to place.

Reviews.Title: “Private Beach, Short Stay, New to PR....This is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: wtklemp
Reviews.Content: Reviews on this hotel are mixed, to say the least. I had my concerns. Even voiced those concerns via e-mail to the GM before staying at this property. Mr. Torres was very quick to respond to my concerns. I was on points, but my extended family was paying rack-rate and I didn't want them to be dissappointed. They weren't. They absolutely loved the property....but it is still a slightly mixed bag, to be honest. My room was in the older tower. Not a bad room at all, but not the greatest Hilton room I've ever been in. View was great. Room was clean. Nothing was missing. I was pleased. The only problem we encountered in the entire stay was one of the two guest elevators was broken. Hotel staff was quick to put up signs directing us just around the corner to the service elevators. Not a major problem in the scheme of things. My family all had rooms in the newer tower. They were elated with their rooms. My wife visited one of their rooms and said it was nicer than ours. So I was very pleased that the family got great rooms. (remember, I was pleased with our room) We didn't really eat at the hotel, other than the HHonors breakfast and that was better than typical Hampton Inn type stuff. Here's why you stay at the Caribe Hilton.....The beach, pool and property location. This is the only private beach on the island and it is fantastic. Not huge, but perfect for kids and family. The pool area is just the right size and beautiful. Outstanding location between some lagoons with views of one fort and the Candado area. The Caribe is only 2 miles from Old San Juan. Perfect jogging distance in the morning or a cab ride in the evening. I was out both mornings jogging to Old San Juan and never felt the least bit concerened about my safety. Some cudos to two folks in particular at the Caribe: Luis in the bar. Bald guy. Very fun and informative on San Juan. Was very good with our kids and the rest of my family. Dominque in the Executive office was insturmental in our stay as well. Thanks to both of you guys. Don't know when we will get back to PR, but will definitely stay at the Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “This site is great”
Reviews.Author: mbrown9930
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel because it is not far from air port not far from ports there is beach front Had great view from room. Service was great. Floors were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready to be nickeled and dimed!”
Reviews.Author: savvy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor, and find another place to stay. I recently stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a business conference and was very disappointed in the quality of accomodations, service, and amenities. When you reserve your room, you should note that there is a 14% resort fee, but we were also charged a portage fee of $10.00 and a room cleaning fee of $6.00 both of which I found to be unacceptable. To make matters worse, the level of service we received (or lack there of) by no means justified the excessive fees. In my opinion if you are going to charge these additional fees, you better be delivering exceptional service. Additionally, we had to pay $15.00 a day for parking and everyday it was a battle to get our car out of the garage as the attendants were rude and incompetent. Also, the hotel is an older property and it showed. Mold and mildew were rampant, there were stains all over the carpet, and a 3 inch hole in the tile that went all the way down to the cement subfloor in the bathroom. We had to request for maintenance 3 out of the 6 days we were there. Our air conditioner was not properly working and leaked water all over the carpet. We had to walk on wet carpet as there was no offer to move us to another room. When they finally fixed the leak, no attempts were made to dry out the carpet. The finally dried naturally by day four. We also had to request maintenance fix our sliding door to our balcony as it would not open and no telling when the last time those windows had been cleaned. You should also be prepared to find alternative dining solutions unless you enjoy paying $26 for breakfast. We were fortunate to find a great place for breakfast in Old San Juan where they were friendly and reasonably priced. Unfortunately, the hotel has no reasonably priced dining options. We saw a lot of people bringing in sandwiches from the Subway down the street. The good news is since there was essentially no service offered on the beach you can take your food and the drinks from the outside and enjoy them guilt free on the hotel's beach.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag but more than acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBoy
Reviews.Content: After reading these mixed reviews, I thought I would throw my two cents in as well. My wife and I attended a conference at this hotel last week and took our youngest daughter and our granddaughter along to combine business with pleasure. We rented a Garden Suite and although we had a few minor issues, for the most part were very pleased with our stay. I think in fairness, that prospective guests have to view this place for what it is and recognize that there will be inconsistencies and that you get what you pay for. First, it is a 61 year old property as others have pointed out. And, it shows its age in a few places. Our room was fine----a bit dated and retro, but well appointed, spacious and clean. We did hear from some our colleagues at the conference, who rented at the conference rate, that some rooms really needed work. However, the rate that they were paying was far below the standard rate and the place appeared to be rather full. I would guess that either plans for renovations are in the works, or that ownership is milking the property. If the latter is true, they will most certainly loose the Hilton flag and diminish the value of the real estate. Second, it is classified as a 4 star resort, so expect to pay higher than average food and beverage rates. We stopped over in South Florida at the Breakers, for a few days before the conference, and paid about the same. Third, the property has over 650 rooms, and probably a billion employees, so there will be minor service glitches. Finally, from what I could tell, the rates are below those of the competition for standard and superior rooms, and if you were to stay at competing properties, you would still pay comparable food and beverage rates. I guess there is an issue with the only choice being the $26 breakfast buffet and the perceived lack of nearby low cost alternatives for dining. However, we were able to use both the hotel facilities and find lower cost alternatives for minor meals and snacks. One that comes to mind is El Hamburger which is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. El Hamburger serves cheeseburgers with a variety of different toppings and the burgers are hand formed and delicious. A cheeseburger, fries and soft drink will set you back about $6. There is also a Subway and a convenience store located right around the corner from the hotel. Some of our colleagues also said that there was a low cost breakfast place near the hotel as well. We do not eat breakfast so this was not a problem for us. Now, for ours stay. We only had two minor service glitches. One occurred the first two nights of our stay when, it appeared as if the room service department was overwhelmed and it took an hour or more to get room service. However, in fairness, this was explained to us at the time our order was taken. The other problem occurred when I tried to get more than two glasses in our room. I called housekeeping and was told that this room was only supposed to have two glasses. I tried to explain that we there were four people staying in the room and that we were expecting guests. I got nowhere for a few minutes until I said that I really did not care about what was specified for the room and to get at least 6 more glasses up here ASAP. They arrived within 10 minutes. Other than that service was fine and the staff was friendly---especially the folks who worked at the pool beach complex. The staff soon learn what you like to eat and drink and are quick to recognize you and offer you your favorites. In fact we had one server who volunteered to look after our childrenâ€™s needs when we were at meetings and he did a a great job without taking advantage of the situation. Also, the pool/beach complex is magnificent. There is a swim up bar, waterfalls and infinity edges. This breaks down into several pools and is quite attractive. The beach may not be to everyoneâ€™s liking because it lacks surf but it is protected from heavy surf, private, and the waters are clear. I heard of numerous other beaches and the next time I come, we will rent a car and check those out, as well. There is also a beautiful garden area with Swans, a Koi pond, roaming Peacocks and lush foliage. On balance it was a good experience and the pricing was as expected. I do not know if we would stay here again because there are a lot of other options but we would certainly consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Should have read the reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler62
Reviews.Content: We are here now. Staff is not friendly. Prices for on-site dining are ridiculous. No reasonable options nearby for quality breakfast. Front desk does not take the time and is annoyed for asking about options that are less than 26 dollars USD for breakfast. Can't imagine what the rest of the week will be like. More to come.....oh and noise from the room next door and the hall keeps you awake even if you are in a jr. suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: eyzwdeshut
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was a nice size, but the walls are like paper - you can hear everything! I noticed this not only in the room we stayed in, but also in the meeting rooms. The pool & the beach were wonderful & the scenery was beautiful. Unfortunately, the most of the staff were very slow to respond, slow to act, slow to make things happen. We ate several times at the Pina Colada Club at hotel. The food was wonderful, but the service lacked in a way I have rarely seen. We waited 20 minutes to have our order taken and when we were ready for the check, our waiter threw a fit when we asked to have the check split. To note, the slow service was everywhere in San Juan and we felt this was a direct reflection of the "caribbean time" they are on. The weather was hot & humid & the open air areas of the hotel were sometimes too hot & muggy to bear. We felt the need to seek out air conditioning much of the time we were here. The hotel lacks reasonably priced dining venues within walking distance. There are more restaurants & options on your average cruise ship these days.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach but INCREDIBLY POOR SERVICE and too many other problems”
Reviews.Author: revpar7
Reviews.Content: Attended conference at this venerable resort for 5 nights. Hotel is 61 years old and still looks it in certain parts. Very awesome beach and wonderful pools. But it really ends there. Service rendered by employees was often very poor. My party of eight waited 50 minutes seated at a table for service in the lobby bar at 9pm at night after a group function. We went to the bar 3 TIMES requesting a server be sent over. Alwyas told one would be sent, never was, until one person went to the lobby to complain. The server then made excuses how it was not her fault and the lobby bar was staffed short.Yet, the bar was not that busy and it was a Wednesday night. The hotel knew we had a big group function that would end at that hours and should have staffed appropriately. So many people at this conference requested room changes because of "old and tired" guestrooms. See photo of rusting door hinge. I changed rooms once. Some changed 3-4 times. The front desk clerk that checked me in barely spoke wth me. Seemed not interested in creating that "welcome magical memory". Had problems at the pool snack bar area and several times in the lobby lounge attempting to get service. Not that they were busy, employees just displayed a "I don't give a damn" attitude. It was apparent in their facial expressions, body language, and interactions.If you wanted something, you basically had to get upset to get action at this hotel.Desk in guestroom had tiny ants crawling over it for two days. Bathroom had hair stuck to the ceiling and it was never removed during the stay. Found a few stray hairs in the bed linens (not mine). Scuffs and gouges on the hall and guestroom walls. One of two guest elevators didn't work for two days in the main building. Housekeeping staff never vacuums the guestroom floor hallways. I saw the same lint, trash, and even gum on the carpet outside my guestroom for 6 days (see photo). Staff did vacuum the guestroom though during the stay, so their vacuum DOES work. Stained furniture in guestroom (see photo). Hotel charges mandatory resort fee of $23.66 for beach use, towels, newspaper and .50 housekeeper gratuity. Never saw a newspaper during entire stay despite being Hilton Honors prestige level member (I will not mention which level I have attained; but I stay about 20 nights a year at Hilton brands, and about 75 nights a year in various hotels.). Eric the concierge was very helpful and should be recognized. Buffet breakfast for 2 costs about $63.00. Natasha in the Pina Colada casual restaurant/sports bar was a real "gem" with her awefuly attitude, unless you sucked up to her with compliments. Otherwise, good luck getting a menu or a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: arteeter
Reviews.Content: I'd like to preface this review by explaining that I am fairly easy to accommodate on vacation--decent location, access to local culture, and friendly staff members are my musts. After reading multiple reviews on tripadvisor, I decided to dismiss the less-than-flattering reviews & search for the helpful positives as a guide. Perhaps your travel-research style is similar to my own and maybe you're also someone who likes to frugally explore new places. If so, my honest review may be of use. What we enjoyed most about the Caribe Hilton was the lounge area by the beach. Unfortunately, the storm fronts limited our access to this area. What's not so great? The costly on-site dining options, our room phone not being able to answer incoming wake-up calls, needing to call for assistance three times before having a staff member come to our room to correct a non-working toilet, broken lights within our room, water-damaged/moldy bathroom floor boards, & a concierge that seemed only slightly knowledgeable about how to enjoy the less expensive parts of Puerto Rico and annoyed when asked a series of questions. The hotel's proximity to dining options and stores is limited. OSJ is over a mile from the hotel, but is accessible via a direct walking path from the hotel. This is a plus if paying $16 for one-way taxi access isn't something in your travel budget. Unsure this is something you can handle? Being five months pregnant, it was a minimal expense of energy--you can do it! A word of caution: the path can encounter some sketchy areas. OSJ is a tourist mecca, so expect high prices on some menus. A lunch recommendation would be Cafe Manolin. It's inexpensive & it features local, homemade food. We found an older artist near the Radio Shack & happily encourage you to visit him & view his artwork. For $300, we bought two original paintings--one framed--& had the larger one shipped to us in Upstate New York. I can provide a name at your request. Venturing to other parts of Condado also comes with a price. It has a trendy appeal, but the restaurants are not cheap. Furthermore, if you're from an area that does not require parking meters to be filled after 6 pm, this does not apply to the streets of Puerto Rico--my $35 parking ticket is proof. We rented a car for $70 and drove to El Yunque which I'd recommend. Allied Car Rental is adjacent to the hotel. Overall, my husband & I will most likely look to travel to future destinations--not including Puerto Rico. Sadly, it's coastline is a littered mess (you'll see this as you walk toward OSJ) & the resorts along the San Juan coast unfairly portray the status of Puerto Rico--true socioeconomic disparity.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ubish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton before and after our cruise. Upon arriving front desk checked us in efficiently. Both times we were in an ocean view room however the room in the Hilton Towers was not as nice. The hotel was very clean and the grounds/pools are wonderful. Food and alcohol is very expensive and there aren't any restaurants nearby. We took the city bus ( which was about 5 min walk from the hotel) to Old San Juan . It was great having a Starbucks onsite even if the prices were jacked up.

Reviews.Title: “If you are booked here...cancel immediately! Website photos are a lie.”
Reviews.Author: wchen224
Reviews.Content: Where to begin?? Hotel itself: impossible to locate; calling the reservations desk while enroute, the woman spoke little English and could not get us there. It is a dank and dirty location that offers you views of the crumbling hotels around it. The room: peeling paint off the walls; carpet ripping at all the seams; bathroom was moldy and the a/c unit remains at 64 degrees. Calls to the maintenance only produce people who claim "there is nothing we can do." The staff: rude and not helpful; most of them speak minimal English. The housekeeper left her used and dirty cleaning brushes in our room daily despite me placing them outside our door each afternoon when we came back to find them there. Wow...that's really clean! The "sundry shop" consists of 3 shelves where you pay $10 for a travel size can of shave cream. Worthless! There are absolutely ZERO local shops like CVS or Walgreens within walking distance. Parking: valet for $25 each time you use it, or $16 per night. The restaurants: are a joke. These are restaurants who charge you $17.50 for a chef salad, but I can get better salad quality at Wendy's. Supremely overpriced for all on site resaturants...most of the food will be something you've never heard of, and you're expected to pay 5 star pricing for zero star quality. The pool: dirty and small. We were booked for 5 days...we are frantically trying to change our flights to leave 2 days early. Hilton is also going to get an earful from us as we are Hilton Honors members, and they state of this hotel is atrocious. This hotel is in the ghetto, but looking at the website, you'd think you are seriously in for an amazing experience. We will definitley not be back to Puerto Rico in this lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time here!”
Reviews.Author: laura8310
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice and the lobby looking out into the pool/beach area is gorgeous. From the moment we arrived, everyone was really nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and we had an ocean view, so woke up to a great view every morning. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 rating is because #1 the hotel was a little further away from all the restaurants than the other hotels, so we had to take a taxi everywhere. #2 the food is outrageously expensive. #3 there was no casino #4 there was loud banging, like construction being done one of the mornings near our room. #5 the agent who was booking the excursions was quite rude, I dont know if they work for the hotel itself, but I did not appreciate their snooty demeanor. Despite those minor inconveniences(it looks like a lot went wrong, but it really wasn't anything major), I had a great time and I did NOT want to leave! The employees, the pool, the ocean...everything was great. You will not regret coming here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful vows on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: pamalamz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married on the beach at the Caribe Hilton and all we have been hearing from our guests is wow. We chose the Caribe Hilton because of the private beach and the Las Olas Terrace and room. We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights and were upgraded to a suite, the room was spotless, huge and had two balconies. I cannot express how helpful the entire staff was and went above and beyond to make our day special. Maricarmen had made sure that we had a backup plan for the chance of rain since rain was being predicted for our wedding day. The backup area was fantastic but thankfully we did not have to use it. The beach was beautiful and the Las Olas was a perfect fit for our 60 guests. Vanessa Lopez was also phenomenal and so helpful with setting up and maintaining our wedding block up until the day of our wedding. Felipe from PSAV worked directly with my husband and knew exactly what we would need for the wedding and the reception. Everyone could hear the pastor during the ceremony and the sound was perfect for the reception. The entire banquet staff that serviced our wedding was attentive and very personable. They helped my dad make a bed (table clothes and cushions) for my niece to sleep, so no one had to leave the party. I have to do a special thank you to Hiram the bartender at the Atlantico grill for his attentiveness to our guests. Everyone could not say enough great things about him. He was so thoughtful and brought the wedding party beer before the ceremony and gave my husband and me a glass of champagne for the reception. He has left a lasting memory with us and our friends. Thank you to everyone at the Caribe Hilton for making our special day extra special. We will be going back to Puerto Rico and the Caribe Hilton is our top hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LMParker
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to a villa. The room was great. The staff was excellent. The pools and beach was fantastic. Be aware that you will spend most of your money on food in the hotel restaurants if you aren't careful!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much here”
Reviews.Author: Eureka5
Reviews.Content: The staff at the check in desk and front service areas are rude and obnoxious. They are not helpful nor did they know answers to questions. The hotel itself was last renovated in 1996 and it is in dire need of a new renovation. The prices are extraordinarily high, even for this area. They charge $27.50 for a breakfast buffet and they put it so high so they can get the tips(just incase you get the "free breakfast" reservation). The only thing going for this hotel is its location--near airport, cruise port and downtown as well as private beach area and pools.

Reviews.Title: “The grand dame of the caribbean still delivers”
Reviews.Author: Fg82
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel for families. Great service. Private,pristine and super safe beach. Great pool area with the best view of the Atlantic Ocean. Lagoon with swans and peacoks. Open tropical lobby with a nice expansive bar. Beautiful grounds with hammocks under cocunut palms and " bridge-pier" from were to feed fish on the reef below. Rooms are a little tired,but comfortable. We stay at the Tower ( built in1970s) with ocean view. The Main Bldg. although remodeled and more central is a 1949 structure. Modern and well equipped small to medium fitness center. New Trek bicycles for rental to go to Old San Juan or Condado. Be careful and stay on the sidewalks!! Not much night life, but close to other hotels with night life and a stone- throw from Old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Top 3 Hotels in San Juan for family and me”
Reviews.Author: mflatc
Reviews.Content: I meant to write a review a few weeks back on this hotel. I stay quite often with my family at various resorts/hotels in and around Puerto Rico. From the old school outdoor check in to check out this is one of the consistently best hotels in San Juan. The property is beautiful and lush, due to its maturity it has that cool old Caribbean feel. It does not have a casino, but most casinos in San Juan are dominated by penny and nickel slots anyway. Pools are great, I did not see the beach though cuz of rain. Convenient store across the street, subway nearby, Starbucks on site, many restaurants on site, and close to Old San Juan. The Conrad Condado Hotel (or whatever they call it now as the name keeps changing) is also very consistent, you always know its going to be a good experience, as is Ritz. But most others in Condado and Isla Verde and even those in old San Juan that we have stayed at leave me wanting to come to this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I saw for myself...”
Reviews.Author: nel10034
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I don't usually write reviews, mostly because most of what I have to say has been said already. But this case is different. I started NOT to book this hotel based on several negative reviews which highlighted expense, specifically of the hotel restaurants, shops etc. What a mistake that would have been. You can do just fine at this beautifully wonderful hotel if you are willing to venture off the grounds. Our goal was not to visit a Hilton, it was to visit Puerto Rico, and trust me coming back to this hotel after a day out and about is wonderful. Here are some ideas that worked well for us in sticking to our vacation budget. 1) take the public bus to Old san Juan. It costs 0.75 per trip and get you there in 10 minutes. The bus stop is right down the block from the hotel. Old San Juan is the last stop on the route so there is no confusion, and coming back just tell the driver you are staying at the Caribe and he will announce your stop coming back. A cab back and forth costs $24. We hit Old san Juan 4 out of 5 days. 2) While in Old San Juan - EAT. There are tons of authentic PR restaurants most of which are reasonable. We fell in love with Mojitos Restaurant (please google for reviews). We ate there 3 times and never paid more than $65 (for 2). Other suggestions are Raices and Tio Danny's. 3) Also in Old San Juan there is a supermarket and Walgreen's, stock up your room with snacks etc. - especially if you have children with you. 4) Rent a car for at least 1 day. As an alternative to paying $100 for the rainforest tour we rented a car for 39.99 and drove to the El Yunque rainforest. The information center at El Yunque gives you all the info you need to find the trails and attractions at your own pace, and it only costs $4. 5) While you still have the car, drive to the Isla Verde hotel strip (10 minutes from the Caribe) where there are all types of food options (fast food and small inexpensive restaurants), as well as casino options at other hotels such as the Intercontinental. The Isla Verde strip is a nice place to visit for a while, but the Caribe is definitely the much better place to stay. Hopefully this is useful to someone. This is a truly great hotel, from the beach to the pool to the rooms to the staff. I am already planning to return in November.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a large bathroom”
Reviews.Author: irwinjosephneil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice for the night before a cruise. Itâ€™s fairly close to the cruise terminal and you are likely to get a good deal on Priceline. Our room was on the corner of the tower with a nice view of the ocean and the pool area. The bathroom was particularly roomy with a large counter-top and an over-sized stall shower. The staff was attentive and polite.

Reviews.Title: “LUV - LUV CARIBE HILTON! had my wedding & group vacation here :-D”
Reviews.Author: SarahJayNYC
Reviews.Content: We had a beach wedding - ceremony & reception on the beach - (which was PERRR-FECT!) at the Caribe Hilton...and had friends & family staying there as well...we were there for about 10 days and the stay was wonderful! Service was great & friendly and the cleanliness was exactly what i expect when I stay at a hotel - just great! One of the best part of the Caribe is that it's a hotel / resort in one...you have restaurants & stores downstairs and all the necessary amenities in one place (fitness center, tennis courts, swim-up bar!)...I also had such a relaxing massage at Las Olas Spa...but the BEST part is that you can literally go downstairs and choose to hang at the pool OR at the private beach...OR both in a day! lol There were a lot of guests; however, Caribe Hilton is so big that no one was on top of each other, no crowds at all! Love that! Also, the bar in the lobby was such a hot spot at night...it was great that I got to see the NBA finals theatre-style in the lobby too! I would definitely stay there again! & I know my friends & family would too! Some stayed at villas and some had rooms and suites. All were awesome! We had the Condado duplex Suite - breathtaking view!!!! So when you go - make sure you ask for the Hilton Honors Tower - the ocean view is spectacular! If you are planning your wedding - make sure you ask to work with Myrna and Vanessa! I love them! They really made my destination wedding wonderful, special, & unforgettable! I think we will make our trip to PR an annual thing just cus we love Caribe so much! :)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel the people that worked there were the best.”
Reviews.Author: emersondale
Reviews.Content: here is a list of people that made it an awesome stay. 1. Noemi Claudio front desk Manager 2 .Hosa Bell man 3. Axle Bell man 4. Jose' Ruiz I stay in hotels all the time and this is the first I have ever sent a compliment. That is how impressed I was. Dale Ames 678-855-1730 daleeames@bellsouth.net

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotels with a nice view”
Reviews.Author: Boiled_Dove
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise left San Juan and I wish we could ave had several more days there. We arrived late at night and were greeted warmly. The lobby/reception area is open air and it was a nice welcome to Puerto Rico. The check in process was quick and we made it quickly to our room. The room was spacious and clean. It did have signs of wear that are to be expected from an established hotel but it did seem to be well maintained. We had a ninth floor room and the view from the balcony was spectacular. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was large. The shower was huge with one fixture on the ceiling and another hand unit at a sitting area. The pools and grounds were nice and well kept and the little beach was grand. My family very much wanted to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but the Staff Left a Lot to be Desired”
Reviews.Author: txags95
Reviews.Content: I decided I wanted to do something different for my 40th birthday, so my best friend and I went to San Juan, PR. After agonizing over hotels and trip packages, we finally decided to stay at the Caribe Hilton. The hotel was great. The rooms, pool area and private beach were very nice. However, the staff wasn't as helpful as I would have liked. Being a tourist in a new place, it would have been nice if they would have been more helpful in suggesting places to go or things to do away from the hotel. Aside from the bartenders at the swim-up bar and at Pina Colada's, the staff wasnt very friendly either. I would definitely stay there again, but I will do more research next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, staff strives to make your stay a joy”
Reviews.Author: VMRiver1
Reviews.Content: Great ambience. Wonderful open air lobby over looking the ocean. Comfortable guest rooms with luxurious showers, plush bedding and in room coffee maker for those that can't wait for that first cup of java. Fantastic pool area and a workout facility you'll love. If you have children they'll be entertained too with fun activities planned just for them. Convenient to Old San Juan and Condado. Not far from the banking center in Hato Rey. This property is suitable for both business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “All personnel are friendly, and competent- they really try to be helpful.”
Reviews.Author: SueColorado
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Caribe Hilton was for a week-long workshop. The event manager who worked with me before and during the conference was extremely helpful and patient. The resort itself was beautiful and well-maintained. All personnel from the front desk to the concierge, to the bellmen, to the wait staff, to the catering staff, to the AV support were extremely helpful and cooperative. They were flexible with last minute changes and tried very hard to meet all our needs and please us. The food served during the conference was very good. We were very satisfied with the location, the resort, the daily meeting location, the food, and treatment by the staff. The restaurants on the premises are quite pricey - as usual with resort settings. It is an easy cab ride to Old San Juan or the Condado strip to find other eating locations. You'll love it here. It is always busy with weddings and parties and events. A great resort - with great services.

Reviews.Title: “A week of relaxation”
Reviews.Author: PRVistor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days in the villas at the Hilton. The first night we arrived, we got in late and they only had a first floor, lagoon view. We were so tired, we headed for our 1 bedroom villa and fell fast asleep on a great bed. Everything was nice and clean. The next morning, I headed back to the front desk and Omar hooked us up with a beautfiul 3rd floor ocean view room that over looked the old fort. It came with a balcony off of both the master bedroom and adjoining living room. The oversize tub was my son's favorite place. We didn't expect 2 bathrooms but were pleasantly surprised. My son loved having his own space and it was nice not to compete over shower time. The couch folded out to a full size bed which suited his sleeping needs just fine! As for the beach - we rented a beach cabana 3 of the 6 days and thought the space was really nice to leave our stuff plus it came with cold water and a beautiful, delicious fruit plate. We did have to remind the staff 2 of the days about the fruit plate and 1 day it never arrived, though management gave us a prompt credit. If I were to do it again, I would rent the cabana only 1 day. It was a great place for taking a nap on the beach, but my son wanted to spend most of his time in one of the 3 pools. I did not feel comfortable enough to leave our personal belongings behind jumping from the beach to the pool. The swim up bar at the pool was a lot of fun for all of us. Hiram made some great drinks for us but with all comments, I too agree - PRICEY. I did find out ON THE LAST DAY, that you can buy a pitcher of any drink for $39. The pitcher equals 9 drinks vs. each drink for $12 AND they will keep the pitcher in the freezer for you and pour as you need a refill. Even if you don't finish it, you will still be way ahead. The meals are also big enough to share which we learned after our first lunch. My son was young enough to eat for free. A PERK! The conceirge did a great job and gave us some great advice on island hopping to Culebra for a day trip. We had a great time at Flamenco beach for one day. I would highly recommend it. Flamenco is listed as one of the top two beaches in the world. BEAUTIFUL! We took a charter plane for $100/each but you can also ferry for $35/each. Two nights in a row we walked across the pedestrian bridge to Condado Plaza for dinner. They do have Chili's, Fuddrucker's and Outback. If you are looking for local flair, they have a wonderful seafood and mexican restaurant that sits right on the water that is very good. My 5 year old made the walk just fine on his own two feet, two nights in a row so you know that it isn't far. We had a great week but I think it is all what you make of it. If you don't expect too much, you will have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location - Beautiful View!!”
Reviews.Author: AIRISLAND
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before our transatlantic cruise. We've stayed in Old San Juan before another cruise several years ago so we decided to stay here this time since our cruise wouldn't allow much beach time. We took a cab from the airport (2 adults, 2 suitcases, 1 carry-on). The cab stand attendant asked us where we were staying. The prices are pre-set based on location. It was $19 and $1 per bag plus tip. The hotel sits alone on the beach away from town so the only way to get anywhere you must take a cab or the bus. I understand it to be only $1 or so round trip by bus. We didn't leave the property as there was plenty to see and do. The lobby is open-air to the front of the hotel. We didn't wait very long at all considering the number of other cruisers that were staying there along with several wedding guests. I booked the hotel over the phone then opened my reservation online and opted to upgrade to a suite if it was available for $35 more. I am a Hilton Honors member so the buffet breakfast was included. I have never seen a buffet breakfast where they will slice proschutto for you. It was the best! Our room was on the 10th floor facing northwest. We could see the old fort in San Juan in the distance and the cruise ship in the harbor. Straight out from our balcony was the three-level pool (with swim-up bar), the lawn area with beach beds and hammocks, and the beach beyond. There were several restaurants and snack bars to choose from - sandwiches and beach drinks at Atlantico Pool Bar, all the way to the Morton's The Steakhouse. Or you can walk across the street to Subway. You won't go hungry. There was a small fort just to the east of the hotel that was a great photo opp. The hotel is one of the oldest in San Juan so it does show its age in some areas but that just adds to the character of it. I don't let a spot on the carpet or a cracked tile in the bathroom affect my impression of a hotel. If that were the case, I'd spend $500 for less than 24 hours somewhere else. The bed was comfortable, the room was spotless, and the view was beautiful. Too much to describe. Already planning a sisters getaway for later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly pricy in Services but highly recommended overall. Great Location for a family vacation for daytime and nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: Nycgodfather
Reviews.Content: The services were outstanding, right from the lobby staff and bartender to room service and restaurant staff. Amazing pool and beach area. Slightly expensive for food services though. Parking was also not cheap, $16 a day. Several restaurants to eat in and around the hotel. If you eat at the oasis bar though, make sure you do not order their veggie pizza...it was the worst I ever had in my life (including microwave pizza). Other than that the food was great. Breakfast buffet is a great value for it'money, $26/ person. Very highly recommended hotel for anybody's stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend - Knowledgeable, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: leigh9890
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my wife and I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Hilton Caribe. Although San Juan may be in an economic slump, like much of the world, it does have a very European charm (Old San Juan), sans the overload of cheap T-shirt/jewelry shops. Many people seem to complain about the cost of dinners, cabs, etc. My wife and I took the bus each day to Old San Juan for $0.75 each. The ride was straightforward and easy. The other local riders were friendly and openly willing to assist when my wife and I must have look puzzled. Supplies were purchased at the local convenience store across the street, as other guests have mentioned (bottled water in the room should be available like many other Hilton properties) . Ways to save money are definitely available, if you look, which you will always have to do when staying at a beach resort. They are not in business to save you money. Meals were at restaurants serving local or Caribbean food recommended by the concierge (Cafe Puerto Rico [Pork Mofongo, black bean soup] and Ropa Vieja Grill [skirt steak, black beans and rice]), for reasonable prices and excellent food. No meal cost over $100 with drinks, except the last one at the hotel. Drinks at the hotel are priced like any other Hilton I have been too (not cheap but expected). Beach and poolside service is available, but if you position yourself away from the crowds you may have to hunt down a server. One comment I must make is the friendliness and knowledge of the concierge staff. In our four day stay, we visited the concierge several time for ideas or recommendations. Each time we where extremely impressed by their knowledge of the area and their ability to provide us with exactly we were looking for. Dominic helped us several times and really stood out but the others were extremely helpful also. Kudos to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Here a little slice, there a little cut”
Reviews.Author: GTMoogle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty nice if you know what you're getting yourself into. The 'cheap' rooms aren't in the greatest condition. Ours had peeling paint and some sugar ants that we didn't bother notifying the hotel about, as we'd rather not move once we settled in or stay in a fumigated room, and we just had to not leave food lying around. The other amenities are great, but you're going to be paying three to ten times regular price for anything. The resort fee covers a paltry few towels and chairs, but be careful, as the towels have to be returned hours before the pool closes, or whoops $20 charge. And the attendants will tell you different times. And be sure to check your bill carefully at the end. We had a wrong charge and when I challenged it, the receipt wasn't to be found. I'd have been a lot more willing to do them the favor of letting something like that slide if they would have reciprocated. It didn't ruin or vacation or anything, but it was really obnoxious. We witnessed another guest snap at an attendant for similar reasons, saying that he'd been coming there for 20 years, but he'd had the last straw with their increasing charges for everything. So I guess it wasn't always this way. The rest of the facilities are great, the beach is nice with lots of fish to see snorkeling in the cove, the pools are nice, the jacuzzi's hot, the view is terrific. If you're willing to spend a lot and can ignore the price tag on everything in sight, you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but expensive for a 1 day lay-over”
Reviews.Author: toasted643
Reviews.Content: We grabbed this room from Hotwire and so we didn't know want to expect. We paid $146.00 so overall not bad considering the options. The pool and beach are absoutely spectacular. Similiar to a Sandals resort the big downer is that it's not a resort and everything is Ala carte and very expensize. $14.00 for a Hamburger lunch $9.00 a budweiser. There's a small store next to the Hotel but they know what you pay at the Hotel thus there their prices are trumped up as well. Getting about was completely expensize as the cab fares started at $12 each way we went into to town for the night but my wife and I found it to be boring we really didn't find anything all that interesting other than a street fair which was boring after 20 minutes. The restaurant prices seems to be trumped up as well. Basically our 1 day in PR cost me $350.00 which I wished I saved for the Cruise. The Hotel is really pretty and if you're accustomed to going on vacation and paying for everything, than you'll like it and it won't be a problem. But we're use to all inclusive traveling so spending that kind of money once on vacation is tough. As I walked around the Hotel, you could almost tell folks were in shell shock with the prices it just seems out of whack. Affordable room rates, with riduclus

Reviews.Title: “Choose anoher vacation spot besides depressed San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Iselective
Reviews.Content: What were the architects thinking when they desiged the intricately long walks to connect from some of the bldgs to the main lobby/pool?! The hotel is laid out in a choppy manner. The pool and the beach are nice. Surprisingly, the Pina Colada was undrinkable at the poolside! What is this reputation of the origin of the Pinia Colada here and the fact that you will be served from a prepared mix? Many complain. Delicious at the Pina Colada Club, in the lobby area of the property. $8 and $9 cost. ASK FOR IT TO BE MADE W/COCO LOPEZ AND FRESH or they will serve you the prepared mix that sits in a machine, like a frozen frape. Buffet bkfst is a disappointent. The buffet is lacking anything special or tasty. Eveyday is the same. Only omlettes are made in front of you as you stand and wait to order. The french toast and pancakes sit in a pan under heat lamps. Dry and tasteless. The waiter service is nill. Ask for coffee or tea and wait until after the meal. You'll get it then. I sent back two stained cups and one very chipped one. My tea came long after I finished eating. We forfeited the free bkfst and ate in Old San Juan bakery with the locals. Greasy fried stuff, not like our foods here. The recommended restaurants on this site are the same recommended by the concierge. Not one restaurant was satisfactory to everyone in our party. Only the black bean soup and rice and beans were tasty. All main dishes are in the mid 20 price range. Desserts $7 or $8. After your third night of rice and beans and flan, you can leave now! We were convinced that there really is no good retaurant worth the cost of the meal. Now for the reason for the title of this review. Ashford Ave, Condado, in San Juan is a suffering from the evidence of a very depressed economy with stores closed and graffiti on some of the bldgs. The hotels are worn and the streets in disrepair. I felt like I was in a country deep in poverty. There is no pleaseure in walking upon broken streets in humidity, looking at abandoned bldgs and some undergoing a facelift of construction. As for Old San Juan, the cobblestone narrow and hilly roads are quaint and remid me of what you see in Europe. Most of the stores are rip off jewelry stores, so many trinket sovuneer shops, and some restuarants. We ate in many that were recommended here. The Parrot Club served two under cooked salmons that tasted like the most oily fishy taste I have experiencd. $9 for the small tossed green salad and add'l $7 for the unedible fish we both sent back. The spoon had a dried piece of food on it. Server was nice. We do not recommend. The menu was lacking anything imaginitive. Cafe Puerto Rico was liked by my husband and O.K. with three others. Small and stuffy, only a few tables on each level. The cabbie told us it was his favorite place. Ropa Villa in Condado (Ashford Ave) had a live, too loud entertainer, hard to make conversation in this small restaurant with a man playing an instrument and singing. If sang more quietly, to create a sense of ombience, it would have been a nice idea. I had a fish that had a cilantro sauce that was very tasty. Food was served warm, not hot and fish was spongy and hard in the middle. Waitress was lovely and bread was good. Ceasar salad was a nice size and had the shavings, but the dressing was much too thick and made it difficult to enjoy. One dinner sent back because it was not warm enough to eat. Not worth the $$$$. Our first night we ate at Raices. Cold hard to chew steak sent back by two people. I only ate an appetizer of cod fritters. They were brought before all the other appetizers and placed in the center of the table, so we all ate it, thinking it was complimentry, like bread. Weird. So I had to order another one just for me to eat. When we asked why it was served right after the drinks were served and not with the other appetizers, the english speaking waitress could only laugh. She suddenly did not understand. That was our first awareness that many here pretend to understand and really do not and some choose not to when it meets their needs. There is really no attraction to come here. IF you plan to, then stay at a resort that offers it all. The staff here are friendly for the most part. Housekeeping is a mess. All calls take an hour to respond to and you will get less than what you ask for, the wrong request, etc. The operator is a total idiot who connects you to the wrong extensions. It takes forever for her and the housekeeping dep't to answer. We had water leak issues with our rooms and were moved twice. Construction begins at 6m and then so does your day! Low flying plans begin at 6:30am and are right next to the hotel. The pkg garage is heard from the room as well. If you plan to stay here and get rest, ...no, you will have little sleep. I did not see any kyacking, tennis or snorkeling that is advertised on their site. I did see a few men in shallow water wearing snorkel gear. We were told there is no snorkeling. 17 miles of beach? No way. A small, but nice area adjacent to a small public beach. From the pool area, you verlook jutting rocks and the ocean. There is no 17 miles of walking or usable beach here. That is an outrageous misrepresentation that may mislead you to thinnking it's a sizable place beach. No beach service. At the pool, I never saw a waitress in the week we were there. This site is has false and misleading attraction info that are just not true. P.R. is in a slump and that's reality. The food is over priced crap, and the cabbies try to charge more than the rate. Find another vacation destination that a friend has been to and recommends. I read these reviews and was astounded how no one spoke of the above comments!!!! It could have saved us from our miserable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shaqie1
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton was such a great vacation spot.The location is right on the beach with an amazing private location. We are early birds and therefore had the beach almost to ourselves for several hours every morning. Its proximity to Old San Juan is ideal. We stayed in the villas and we felt so isolated from the hustle of the main area. It was as if we were the only ones there! We loved that. The only down side was that we thought staying in the villas meant a kitchenette, which we did not get. Besides that it was a perfect stay! The staff was so accommodating and helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions! Love, love, love the Caribe!

Reviews.Title: “A place of fun and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Kaufman7
Reviews.Content: Room overlooking the ocean, great beach, good facilities

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Caribe Hilton in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Ewalamb
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our trip was business/pleasure. We stayed on the 18th floor in the Towers. The view was incredible - the ocean, Condado, the old fort and of course San Juan. We stayed for 7 nights. We had a very comfortable king size bed, a down filled comforter, lots of pillows. The room had a safe, a mini fridge, a coffee maker and air-conditioning. The bathroom had two sinks, two shower head options and lots of towels and shampoo, conditioner and soap. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. There is a Subway around the corner walking distance. There is also a small variety store that sells beer and snacks across the street. The staff was very professional and courteous to us at all times. The pool and beach areas are immaculate and the views stunning. There are many chair options to choose from. Towels must be returned by 6 pm or you will be charged. You can get free internet access in most parts of the lobby - if you use it in your room you will be charged. Old San Juan is a $13 taxi drive from the hotel. We took the "Flavors of San Juan" food and culture tour I found on Tripadvisor our first day - it was the best! We learned lots about the city and where to eat and drink for the rest of our stay. There is no way we could have walked from the hotel to Old San Juan - it's really far! We had a wonderful stay here and I would totally recommend this Hotel! Oh ya...we also survived the earthquake that woke us up at 1:22am! Room rate was $125 plus all the taxes per night. (corporate rate) * Now for the review of the Olas Spa which is part of the the Carible Hilton. I booked a massage, facial, pedicure and lunch. The massage by Henry was magnificent...the pedicure was nothing special...in fact they served me my lunch while I was getting my pedicure which I thought very strange. The facial was a total rip off...Gladys a very pushy Puerto Rican talked me into a more expensive treatment for my face saying it would even out my tone...I agreed. The facial was very unprofessional, cold, sloppy and not soothing at all. Gladys basically slapped on some creams and left me laying in a cold room for 20 minutes. When she returned she cleaned up my face with a cold cloth and showed me in a mirror how even my tone was. I was very happy at the time of the results...that is until I got to my room to shower - when I dried off my face the towel was covered in foundation!!! What a rip off! I just paid over $150 for a foundation facial treatment!!! I do not recommend this place for any kind of treatment!!! I would give this spa only one star if I could find a place to review it on it's own. Total cost of spa $340 including tax and tips. RIP OFF!!!

Reviews.Title: “So much potential, so little lived up to”
Reviews.Author: AkulaTheShark
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like it would be an off the hook good time. Checkin was speedy and efficient. As an elite level in the Hhonors program I received free Internet and free continental breakfast from the front desk. I had a room on the 8th floor. The hotel interior needs serious updating. Carpets are terrible, all the walls are chipped. The room had a balcony with a door that is rusted so badly it is inoperable. The smell in the hall way is distinctly, sewer gas. The bed is very comfy, but that is all the good to say about the room. I wanted to go for a swim after work, I walked down to the pool area and was greeted with a sign that said the pool closed at 9pm. I walked over to get a towel, had to sign one out (because they charge you $25 if you lose it). The attendant said the towel must be returned at 6pm. I had 30 minutes to enjoy the beach and get the towel back. I decided I didn't want to chance it. I asked the front desk about this policy and they said that I could just use a towel from my room. Seems they need a memo sent around about this. I was afraid I would be charged $25 over the 14% pool surcharge so I never did use the pool or beach area. The staff at the front desk seems angry you are there, with the exception of the gold/diamond area. I am going to be back in San Juan, and though this hotel is the best for my business location, I will never be back. I don't suggest you go either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, mediocre service, crappy food”
Reviews.Author: akloer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 5 nights in May. Overall, we had a good experience. The location is awesome, being close to Old San Juan and near other resorts, casinos, and right on the beach. The hotel itself is very nice. The pool and ocean are lovely, and we found plentiful and comfy lounge chairs. Everything is clean and well-maintained. The swim up bar is fun, and they have lots of activities like snorkeling and kayaking available. The service was far from stellar. The concierge, in particular, ranged from surly and unhelpful to giving out bad advice and wrong directions. Don't expect great service, and you won't be disappointed. The food was terrible and overpriced, like all resort food. But I've stayed in a lot of resorts, and this one seemed to have even less appealing and even more obscenely priced food than most. Rent a car and go out for meals. We went to the grocery store in OSJ the first say and bought bagels and fruit for breakfast, saving the $50+ per day it would have cost us to eat at the buffet. Best decision ever. Overall, a good time. Just make sure you can feed yourself offsite and don't expect anyone who works there to be overly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: jettjon
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what the "normal" price for this place is but we booked on Travelocity and I think we got a killer deal. The main downside to booking this way is that we got a room at the back of the hotel which overlooked a roof. However, the roof was clean and attractively painted and we could still see the ocean. The room itself was spacious and comfortable; we chose a king-size bed that was extremely comfy. There is a refrigerator, 32" TV, and hair dryer in the room, but no microwave. There is a safe which I'm pretty sure requires a fee to use. Internet in the rooms is 25/day but wifi in the lobby area is free. Parking is 16/day in the nearby lot. There was plenty of room in the lot and we were able to park right next to an elevator every time. Staff was moderately helpful and friendly. Unfortunately one of the concierges only seemed to be able to say "In Old San Juan" every time we asked him a question. He spoke perfect English but unfortunately seemed to give lazy answers; for example, when we asked about buying stamps he neglected to tell us that we could mail letters at the front desk for 60 cents; instead we visited both CVS and Walgreens to no avail before we discovered the hotel's postage service. Other staff was very friendly, and helpful, however. We really appreciated the hotel's flexible cleaning schedule. We could freely place the "do not disturb" on our door at any time, multiple times per day, and still be sure that our room would be magically made up if we left for an hour or more. Beach access is fantastic with a large, clean, and well-appointed beach area with free towel service. There are several expansive pools including a smaller pool and whirlpool at the rear of the hotel in a quiet, secluded area. There is a quiet tropical garden complete with swans, peacocks, and carp. The small San Geronimo fort is clearly visible nearby though at this time it is not open to the public. Shopping and eating amenities were plentiful but expensive, so we didn't take advantage of them. 12 buck cocktails served in small plastic cups or 6 buck local beer was the norm. However, there is a small package store and deli nearby which serves excellent breakfast and lunch, and there's a Subway within less than a block. Further, most stores in Old San Juan sell beer and hard liquor that can be brought back to the room fridge for a fraction of hotel bar and restaurant prices, and good restaurants abound within a short distance either in Old San Juan or across a short bridge in El Condado on Ashford Ave. Additionally, many bars and clubs are located nearby but we wary of taking a cab--we paid 15 bucks each way for a short ride. Renting a car to get around is definitely recommended, though parking can be hard to find. Old San Juan is within walking distance and a good free trolley service will take you around the city if youâ€™re tired from the walk in to town. Overall for the package price we paid on Travelocity, we were extremely pleased with the Caribe Hilton. Had we paid a premium price I might have been less enthusiastic, but for what we paid we received and outstanding value. Highly recommended for a visit to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: beto09
Reviews.Content: Friend of mine and I,spent 4 nights at the Caribe Hilton. From the minute we got there until the minute we left,the entire staff from the front desk was excellent and very attentive and helpful,Mr Blade De La Rosa was great and very professional,THANK YOU VERY MUCH,BLADE!!! The staff from the full buffet breakfast,there're great and super friendly...Thank You guys!! The room was very nice and beautiful - We had an oceanview room and the beds are very comfy,the bathroom was big and very spacious...love it!!! The hotel had a nice and clean beach area and a private lagoon.The pool was nice and had a couple of whirlpools.Next to the pool area was a shaded area with nice hammocks to relax in. There were also many areas with outdoor beds. Our stay was great.We had a great time. All in all,our stay at the Caribe Hilton far exceded our expectations,having read many of the negative reviews we would come back here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with excellent employees”
Reviews.Author: happyjorge
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Caribe Hilton for 3 consecutive years when I come down for business. I would not change this hotel for anything. The employees consistently treat me with the respect, service, and friendliness that I am looking for. The facility has the most up-to-date gym which I use every morning to do my excercises. Nelson Torres and Ivan Ayala have been extremely helpful and professional for the service they have given to our company. I highly recommend this hotel and its wonderful facilities to all business travelers and families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bbsstuff
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Caribe Hilton at the tail end of a week in PR. This hotel is a beautiful property with a very tropical feel. The beach is great because they have wave breakers that keep the water calm. I know there are some bad reviews on the beach here, but you don't come to PR for the beaches (they just aren't that nice, except for Culebra). As far as PR main island goes this beach is about as good as it gets. I found no issues with the staff and all encountered were pleasant and curteous. In fact as a whole, the Puerto Rican people seem to hold friendliness and customer service to a much higher high standard than the rest of the Caribbean and the US for that matter. This hotel also has an excellent gym. Some say the restaurants are expensive, and they are, but no more expensive than any nice hotel restaurant and only a couple of bucks more an entree than Old San Juan. The best meal of the week was at the Lemongrass in this hotel. Some minor gripes were that the A/C seemed to cycle wrong so it would get a little warm in the room before kicking on and the hot water in the sink kind of trickled out (shower was OK) so this may have been a problem in this room only. The one thing that really bugged me about the hotel was the bar drinks. I watched the bartender make 3 frozen drinks and drop about 1 1/2 oz's of alcohol in the blender for all three. I mean, it's hard to justify charging $14 a drink as it is but it is a downright ripoff when you cannot even taste the slightest hint of rum in the drink. I could see why so many have posted bad reviews on this subject. But all is not lost, there is a restaurant on the property (Pina Colada Club) which is privatelly owned and makes killer frozen drinks for $8. All in all this hotel was a good experience and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL I HAVESTAYED in on the island of PUERTO RICO!”
Reviews.Author: EVIEGrandRapids
Reviews.Content: Location: Close to Airport and small shopping area Staff: Outstanding - very helpful and friendly Rate: 1/2 off January sale - with buffett breakfast Breakfast - Unbelievable - so many choices - fresh fruits - fresh squeezed orange juice - fresh pastires - omelets - etc.. Restaurant Staff: Fantastic Room: View was fantastastic - good amenites Pool Area - Dd not use pool - did take pictures at the Cabanas which were available at no cost - very nice all around My cousin and I stayed here for two (2) nites pre-cruise. Do not regret it one bit. On the contrary - will definitely return with our spouses :) All in all, the friendliest staff I have encounterd in many, many, years. Beautiful grounds and area - worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Destination Wedding - horrible service”
Reviews.Author: LLucyo
Reviews.Content: My family and i have recently returned from my daughter's destination wedding along with 50+ guests at this hotel resort. I was one of the few lucky ones that did get the room that i wanted.. beautiful room on the top floor with an ocean view..accomdations? great. guest services? non-existent. When I say "guest services", I will tell you that I am talking about everyone from the hotel operators, front desk clerks, managers, housekeeping, outside bartenders, one of the sales people, reservations, etc. the wedding planner and wedding planners assistant i will have to write on another review because they were not part of hilton staff but were completely utterly useless. Lets see, where do i begin, so much to say. this will not be in order but here goes: at check in, which is 4:00..late to begin with, a lot of guests' rooms were not ready. many of our guests were arriving on friday (wedding was saturday). some guests did not get into their rooms until 6:00pm. the groom, who instead of relaxing the day before his wedding, had to be in the lobby with the person who was in charge of the room bookings, directing her as each guest came. it turns out that a lot of the guest werent given the room they wanted/needed (king bed versus double beds or vice versa) so the groom spent a considerable amount of time directing and helping to coordinate the guest rooms with the sales manager (what a joke title). my sister in laws ceiling had a leak. one guest sat at the edge of her bed and the upper end went flying.., housekeeping NEVER came to clean our room.. i checked in Friday, saturday it was never cleaned. the morning of the wedding, my daughter was in the honeymoon suite and the ac was not working. temp was 90 outside with humidity high. it took over an hour for someone to come to the room and attempt to fix it. we called again after another hour goes by and room still hadnt cooled. they came back up rather annoyed and told us that because we were using a blow dryer (ONE BLOW DRYER) that must be the reason the air wasnt cooling. (WE WERE IN A 2 STORY SUITE, HOW CAN ONE BLOW DRYER HEAT UP A ROOM AND OUTDO AN AC) My daughter was trying to get ready for her wedding day for christ sake! another request to guest services went unanswered (2 calls within one hour) phone rang off the hook before someone finally answered. i simply asked for 10 champagne glasses to be brought up (the photographer wanted to take pic of bridal party pretending to drink champagne before heading off) the glasses NEVER came). housekeeping did not come to clean room later. they did not come AT ALL. the maid of honor (my 15 yr old and grooms sister snuck away during cocktail hour) to clean the honeymoon suite for them) after all, there were about 10 of us in there that sat morning getting ready. the atm machines in the hotel were not working. at check out time, my bill was totally wrong. we were supposed to get a discount for saturday nite because of the group rate for wedding at $165 per night. the bill said $185. i "calmly" argued with the front desk clerk (who never once looked me in the eye but instead kept his eyes on the computer screen the entire time i was talking to him - Joel was his name) he said, well, do you have the confirmation for that???? hellllllooooooooo we have a CONTRACT. no i dont have it, but the bride does...for gods sake. i told him, well, every single guest's bill is going to be wrong. so out comes Victor who also insisted that was the correct charge. (IT WASNT) but rather than "calmly" continuing to argue i just paid the bill at $185 for both nights. later, i was correct, yes, it was supposed to be $165 as my daughter told me.. its in her CONTRACT. do you think i will see my money? no....why, because i paid cash and they probably just pocketed the extra. when i mentioned that housekeeping never came there was no comment.. nothing, no apology or explanation.. just more looking at the screen.. he was probably playing a video game for all i know. also, i fyou want to sleep late, forget it, they want to kick you out of there as early as possible.. but check you in as late as possible.. and trust me, you will not get a discount if you get checked in late through no fault of your own. forget breakfast. at the hotel..everything is way overpriced,. go out the lobby, take a left and walk right across the way to Subway where you can get breakfast for $4.00 including coffee. you can take the bus to Old San Juan from the bus stop near the Normandie Hotel for .75 cents per person. the taxi in front of the hilton cost you $3.00 per person plus whatever else fee they want to charge.. the reality is, a taxi, even if there are like 5 or 6 of you travelling to Old San Juan, should cost $10 flat. Jose Gonzalez who runs a private taxi and is wonderful will take you his number is 787-909-2236. he picked us up in front of the hilton and he got royally yelled at by the staff. make sure he picks you up across the street! I can honestly say that guest services in this hotel do not exist at all, although i cant speak for the concierge as i did not use their service. as far as the actual SITE.. as in the reception area..was beautiful.. outside by the area to the left of the pool was spectacular and the food was delicious. the photographers and videogrpaher and musicians hired by my daughter and son in law were phenomenal (not referred by the Hilton) but researched on their own. as far as the scenic beauty and the privacy of the beach by the Caribe Hilton, it is truly amazing as is the tropical garden, however, if that is ALL you are looking for and you want to fend for yourself in every other way, then by all means stay, but if you want to get your moneys worth in terms of oh, say, having someone answer the guest service phone when you dial their number.. or... i dont know.. say, you ac in your room is not working and you're getting ready for an important day and your makeup is starting to smear down your face cuz its so hot, and you might want someone to fix it, yes, well, then i say, stay at the Marriott or any of the other just as highly priced but much better service at the Condado strip just a little ways down, the Hilton area is appealing..but what are you willing to give up to stay here? (ps; did i mention my sister in laws room ceiling leaked)

Reviews.Title: “Good Amenities, but Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: FrankMLaw
Reviews.Content: The Caribe is impressive when you first pull up. There are no doors to the lobby - it's open air. Very cool concept. The bar, pool, and private beach are nice too. But I was disappointed in the room. It was a bit on the small side, the walls were marked up a bit, and my television didn't work for about half the time I was there. The concierge wasn't knowledgeable about local attractions (and forget about asking for directions) and the overall service was not quite what you'd expect for a hotel of this caliber. Also, the hotel restaurants and businesses around the hotel are ridiculously expensive compared to heading into Old San Juan. I'd stay at the Caribe in the future, but my expectations would be a bit lower and I'd plan to eat away from the restaurant to experience the culture of Puerto Rico while saving a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: JayBee102
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton while attending a conference. It has excellent conference facilities and good food. It was unseasonably hot while we were there, but inside the hotel it was nice and cool. I liked the lagoon swimming area with the beautiful fish, and I took my first scuba lesson there on my free afternoon. This is an above-average hotel that has magnificent ocean views from the lobby and the lobby bar. It is very near the sights and restaurants of Old San Juan. It is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hectic mess of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: bokim777
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Hotel Caribe the day before our Royal Caribbean cruise. I booked it through the cruise package. It was a real disappointment. Although the discription said beachfront, there is no beach but rather a very small, manmade lagoon. No real views. The service was nonexistent. The reception area was crouded and hectic. I was on my own as far as finding and getting my bags to my room. Maybe it was an unusually busy day. The decor was ok in the restaurant area but has no lobby per say since the registration desk is outdoors. The general decor of the hotel was dated and old. The outdoor aviary had no birds in it. The only positive is that there was a starbucks at the hotel. There are so many options of vacation hotels in Puerto Rico. I would stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton has lowered there standards”
Reviews.Author: ChristineZ13
Reviews.Content: Positives on this hotel is mainly the property...its beautiful. Plenty of room at the beaches, the pools & lots of areas to just sit, relax & enjoy the view. That's where it ends. As an HHonors member I have stayed at many Hilton Hotels, this was the worst. We had ants in our room. Housekeeping came to clean but we were never offered a change of rooms after 3 days & they didnt go away. It took until our last day to fix the light fixtures in our bathroom. The ocean view room was nice, it overlooked all the construction and the jack hammering had us up at 6am. And the elevator continued to break down. The staff is friendly but slow. It takes at least 45 mins to get anything. And everything is extremely overpriced. We paid $50 for a buffet style breakfast that was cold & awful. Drinks are $12 a pop and we paid $8 for a plain hotdog & $7 for 2 pieces of bread & a slice of cheese that was supposed to be a grilled cheese. There is not alot of food choices, so if your hungry be prepared to re-mortgage your house for lunch. There is nothing to do here, unlike all the advertisments. There is no live music, just a CD player in the bar area. The restaurants are understaffed, overpriced & if you want authenic island food, your better off taking a $12 cab ride into Old San Juan. I had presented my concerns to the hotel management & they apologized but no corrections were made. It was a waste of money & points - I would never elect to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: JTobin
Reviews.Content: We are Gold memebers and stayed in the HHonors tower. We also stayed using points so I can't comment on the price of the room. I can comment on our stay however. My Wife and I went down on vacation and were not sure what to expect from San Juan or Puerto Rico. We were pleasently surprised with the culture and experience. The Caribe Hilton was very nice and clean. They are in the middle of remodeling some of the rooms and painting the hallways. The hotel had a nice and clean beach area and a private lagoon. The snorkeling was not great...but they do feed the fish and there were some great ones to see. We came across a sea horse, a lion fish, and about 15 other species. The pool was nice and had a couple of whirlpools. Next to the pool area was a shaded area with nice hammocks to relax in. There were also many areas with outdoor beds. The fitness center was one of the best I have been to at a hotel. The pool bar was expensive but the service was good. At night Morton's has a reasonably priced "power hour" for cheaper drinks and food. Across the street is a small convience store where we bought most of our liquor, beer, water, snacks. For some great Puerto Rican food we walked to Escambron Beach and ate a small restaurant behind the stadium. It was more reasonably priced and the food was good. Don't be scared off if no one is in there....it was not a very crowded restaurant. It was good though. You can walk to Old San Juan from the hotel but it is about a 40 minute walk. I took a run there in the morning which was nice. Instead of taking cabs my Wife and I took the bus everywhere. Every bus driver was so helpful and so were the locals taking the bus. To get to old San Juan it was .50 instead of a $10 cab ride. We also took the bus to Isle Verde which was a nice public beach and to the Art Museum in San Juan.
