We only took a cab to and from the airport. Make sure to get out of San Juan though...the island has so much more to offer. We went on a trip to Toro Negro (the tallest forest on the island) with Acampa. These guys were amazing...and it was a great tour. We also rented a car from Allied Rental across the street....$53 a day and went to El Yunque, Seven Seas beach, and the kiosks at Luquillobeach. Our stay was great. We had a great time....the staff at the hotel was great. The service was slow...but everyone was nice. We are going to stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't meet up to what is advertised as”
Reviews.Author: geminibill
Reviews.Content: Let us start with the positives first. The grounds to the hotel are amazing . The pool designs and layout are nicely done. The calm private beach is a snorkel's dream. Other than that there is nothing else to rave about this hotel. The Caribe staff as a whole has issues with customer service and structure. There is not one area in this hotel that doesn't have customer service programs. For example, the outside bar had the bartender go to the main resturant to get the food orders vs. having a someone else being as the runner. This caused 45 minutes in getting a drink at this bar. The main reason why my family elected this hotel was based on their advertisement as a family hotel with a kids program called Kitz Paradise and swimming activities. What we found was the Kids programs was lacking any structure. For example my two kids ages 5 and 7 had an art activity that was done in 10 minutes. The food was extremely over priced - bar/grill hamburgers were $14 (US) and chicken salads $18. I can go on and on with what went wrong with this hotel. I assume I will get that standard cut and paste response from Hilton manager as everyone else gets apoligizing...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: cynderemy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay if you are not into gambling. It has no casino which eliminates the crowds from invading the resort. The rooms were nice - we had an oceanview room and the beds are very comfy although the bathroom are in need of a major makeover. There are plenty of beach/pool chairs and lots of space so you are not jammed into an area anywhere on the resort. The hotel's spa and fitness center is great - lots of variety in services and equipment. The hotel is only a $12 cab ride to Old San Juan and is in a perfect location - close enough to the action but far enough away for peace and quiet and lots of relaxation. A few negatives - service and prices. The hotel staff needs to be trained in attentiveness towards guests and the prices for food and drinks are a little out there for lunch. We'd stay there again just based on our experiences at other hotels in the area. The no casino was a total win for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good facility, mediocre service, over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Marco20009
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is the oldest and grandest tourist hotel in San Juan. It has its own private beach (the only one on the island), a lovely open lobby, bar, and restaurant area, outdoor restaurant seating, and a large and well-kept pool area. Our room faced the ocean, and the decor was average hotel fare. Overall the service was mediocre: when we needed something we had to hunt someone down, and then it seemed we were bothering them. The food at the "Italian" restaurant was bland and over-cooked, and expensive. Which brings me to the prices: you pay a lot for the name "Caribe Hilton." Try a $16 chicken sandwich or a $20 "continental breakfast" for examples. My guess is the room and amenities (like restaurant food) are about 150% of what you might pay elsewhere. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you like Resort-style”
Reviews.Author: gmae1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room and loved the spaciousness of the room, the view off of the balcony, and the VERY comfy bed. We loved the look of this resort and the layout. The pools were soooo nice and not crowded. The views spectacular. Enjoying a fine dinner at The Lemongrass Restaurant is a MUST! Sit outside in the gardens and enjoy the ambiance. They make the absolute BEST pina-coladas. The grounds are impeccable kept and a nice park is just a walk down the road. The Condado is where the nightlife is and where more restaurants are located. We walked to the Candado area one evening and very much enjoyed the walk and the scenery. We felt completely safe. Now, for some downsides to the Caribe Hilton: If you are a couple with no children you may not enjoy this place so much as it is full of kids and teens. Check-in is usually a 20 minute wait in line, even if your Hilton Honors! The walls are thin, so you can hear everything. We had teens on our floor who didn't go to sleep till 3am everynight--and we could hear everything everyone said! Hated that! The service here is just adequate, not spectacular, and usually a little late or dismissive. In addition, breakfast is $28.00 a person. So the food is very expensive. I would suggest staying here for a couple of days, probably not for longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the room on the 10th floor was nice and had a great view. The pool was pretty and a bit crowded. Everyone who stayed here was American. It was not anything unique but the location was good for getting to Old San Juan. We just stayed one night and got a great rate through Hotwire. The food and drinks were expensive and very ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway vacation!”
Reviews.Author: aaangelaa
Reviews.Content: Accomodations: Our room was located in the Garden Building and it was perfect! There was enough space for both of us to put all of our clothes and the beds were very comfortable. Our room looked newer and had granite counters throughout the room and very modern fixtures. The best part of the room though was the ocean front balcony and the view of the tropical gardens below! We had a great view of the ocean and the Fort behind the property. Pool/Beach Area: The beach area was great, but a little small. You definitely had to get over there earlier than later if you wanted a good spot. The main pool area got a little crowded too and was where the children would swim and played. My sister and I ended up finding a smaller pool area where we spent most of our time. It was very quiet and VERY SUNNY! I would definitely suggest walking around the property the first day you get there and scope out the different places where you can lay out and relax. There are a lot of secluded chairs if you just want time to yourself! Food: When it comes to the food, I definitely suggest when booking the room you see if they have any package deals that include breakfast. When we booked our room, thats what we did and go free breakfast every morning. We went to breakfast at the Palmeras Restaurant and it was great! They had just about everything you could think of, including an omlette chef! Another cheaper option for breakfast is just going to Starbucks. The prices at Starbuck are basically the same as they are in the States. For lunch we pretty much ate at the Atlantic Bar & Grill or grabbed a pre-made sandwhich from Starbucks. The Atlantic Bar & Grill is a little pricey, but nothing beats having your food delivered to you by the pool or while you're laying on the beach. We tried to go to Subway one day for lunch and it was horrible. The service was horrible and the food was disgusting. Dinner was our favorite part of the night ;-) One night we tried the Italian restaurant at the hotel and it was fantastic! Our waiter was very sweet and made us laugh. Pasta plates ranged from $20-$25 and the seafood/meat dishes were around $30-$40. I personally thought that everything was reasonaibly priced there. Another night we tried to go to the PiÃ±a Colada Club because I wanted to trie the Mahi Mahi fish tacos, but they we're very rude and ended up just ordering drinks and going back to the Italian Restaurant. Entertainment: We were there over a weekend and there was a lot going on. THe hotel lobby/bar area was the place to be on Friday and Saturday night! They had live music playing pretty much all night, it was great! They even had a Rum of Puerto Rico party, great time! The hotel was pretty isolated from pretty much everything, my sister and I personally wanted it that way. We tried to go to Old San Juan one afternoon and it wasn't our cup of tea. The cab driver dropped us off 2miles where we told him we wanted to be and the cab ride costs us $15. The hotel however is really close to the airport, its about a 5-10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Priceline one night stay”
Reviews.Author: greecer
Reviews.Content: We won a Priceline bid for this hotel, and it was a fine choice for our pre-cruise overnight. We were asked at check-in if we wanted a King or two Double beds. We were given a King room on the 3rd floor of the main tower. The room was clean and everything worked well, and quiet too. Very comfortable bed. The pool was too cold early April for us to swim in. We expected a larger garden area based on the hotel's description, it was really not much larger than our yard at home. The wandering peacock came right up to us, begging for food. Food options on site were all expensive. Convenience store across the street has basic snacks and beer and liquor at okay prices, we picked up some wine for our cruise ship, and you can buy beer by the bottle. There was a regular liquor store too, but it wasn't open when we were there. Subway restaurant was about a block away and also had breakfast, so is a cheaper alternative if you don't want to pay for an expensive sit down meal. Really nothing else around, so you would have to go elsewhere for shopping, bars, and restaurants. I would never pay the regular rate for this hotel, I think that would be overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - Food a Bit Dear.....”
Reviews.Author: gwb54
Reviews.Content: We had only one night here but the room was ( in the new part of the hotel ) beautiful. Huge bed, bathroom all marble and very spacious. Grounds were clean, there's a swimming pool and sunbeds looking out over the bay. Food was good too , although ( I thought ) expensive - $60 for breakfast - and they expect a tip. I didn't notice that on the bill, and the waiter caught up with us so we could circle one of the cost options for his tip. Bit much, that. Mind you, the whole Caribban operates on a ' Gratuity Culture', so expect some pressure wherever you go to shell out.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful escape in the middle of lively San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler35y
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived to the hotel, I was not overly impressed by the lobby. My room had been beautiful but 20 years ago. But the view from my balcony was absolutely amazing, as well as the pool and beach area. I just loved. I spent one of the most relaxing moments in this hotel. Also, this is the only hotel in San Juan with own beach. So yes, I do recommend it. See my pics and you understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel awful service”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Hilton. The staff are totally disoragnised, not customer focused and require some basic training on how to speak and treat guests. The hotel it's self is wonderful and no complaints. The prices are so high. Check in was so slow as was the check out. Reception is just surrounded by constant queues and there is never enough staff. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, but overpriced commodities and some customer service issues.”
Reviews.Author: tropicana49
Reviews.Content: This is an older San Juan hotel that is perfectly located on the beach near the Old City. It has a great swimming pool and beach, and many activities for children and adults. The rooms are small, but ours had a balcony with a view of the ocean and pool area, which was nice to wake up to. The rooms are remodeled and the beds are very comfortable. Two issues: 1) the restaurant prices are very expensive given the average quality of the food ($22 for an individual pizza for a child). There is no snack bar for a quick bite to eat; the only option is a Subway a few blocks away. 2) The two ladies in the pool booth distributing towels and play equipment need major training in customer service. They were extremely rude to everyone, including children seeking inner tubes or toys. They were not busy, so there seemed to be no reason for the rudeness - many of the hotel guests we met commented on this attitude. I must note that this was on 3/30/10; when we went there again on 4/1/10, there were different staff on duty and they were much more customer-friendly - maybe management heard the complaints and acted on them. Finally, the tour desks were open late, so it was easy to book a tour to the Rain Forest and the Camuy Caverns. Note: the old casino is gone, replaced by convention meeting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not concerned with safety of guests - and don't trust the concierge”
Reviews.Author: kay6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit isolated which is fine if you would like to just stay there, but if you would like to travel to old san juan (for a decent restaurant) or condado area it will cost you $24 round trip for a taxi. The Hilton could run a shuttle - but they want you to stay at the hotel and pay the very high prices for their mediocre food. To be expected I guess, but the Hilton took it a step further by having the concierge lie to us about restaurants in old san juan being open on good friday and easter. He said that "not many restaurants would be open good friday, and just about everything would be closed on easter." He was very clear about this. We decided to brave it anyways on Good Friday and guess what - there were many restaurants open and we had no problem getting dinner. After that we decided to go there again for Easter and there was a traffic jam to get into old san juan it was so packed! Shops and every restaurant we passed was open and the streets were packed with people. He lied. The most disturbing part of our stay happened when the power went out in the hotel. We woke up about 7 am to the smell of chemicals and burning. An awful smell. My husband ran out into the hall where the smell was much worse and saw 2 staff members who told him the power went out and to go back to our room. It was clear that something other than a power outage was happening, so we decided to leave. We went down the fire escape from the 5th floor. The last 2 or 3 floors had no lights or power in the fire escape stairwell and the staff had put a few glow sticks on the stairs which barely lit the stairs at all. It was scary. When we got to the lobby - it was business as usual. No alarm, no announcement - nothing, we were shocked. We saw a small group of about 6 people crowed around a security officer and we went to join them and figure out what was happening. One women told us that her room had filled with smoke and she had set off the alarm on her floor and ran out. We also told the security guard our story and he just kept repeating that "the power went out." Nothing happened for sometime and at least 30 minutes after we had come downstairs we finally saw other people coming downstairs. The staff was aware of smoke and chemical burning and allowed the guests to breathe it in for some time before they decided to tell them. My husband and others kept telling the security officer to evacuate the hotel, but he waited. This experience made me realize how much trust you put in a hotel that you stay in. You trust them to protect you and alert you to fires, toxic fumes etc. Unfortunately, this hotel will not do this. We never got a real explanation. We were told they evacuated the hotel as soon as they realized that there was a problem, but we know first hand that this is NOT true. Given that there were staff in the hallway when we woke up - they knew of the problem before we even woke up. One staff member told my husband that there was a power surge that caused some of the air conditioning to burn before the power went out. This seems like what the burning chemical smell could be and could explain what caused the smoke. The manager, however, told us with a good deal of attitude that it was sewage, not chemicals, that we were smelling on the 5th floor (it was not a sewage smell but he would not back down and told us that we were wrong - so I asked him about the smoke in the other guest's room and he said that "sometimes air conditioners smoke when the power goes out"...?). This was hopefully not a problem that happens often - however it shows this hotel's attitude towards safety and their guests. I would never stay somewhere like this again and will be much more cautious in choosing a hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights pre-cruise, a fine place, met expectations”
Reviews.Author: JLind
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor, our expectations were set in the right place- and so our stay was great. We booked through PL and the room was only $110/nt, and then a resort fee was added on top of that per night. When we checked in, I mentioned TripAdvisor negative reviews, and very politely asked that we please be placed in a room that is not shabby ("please, no mold in the shower"), a reasonable request, I think. The person who checked us in was lovely and placed us in the newer "Garden" building. The room was new and beautiful. We did not eat at the hotel, as we had read that it was resort-priced - we rented a car. For us, it was worth renting the car because we have driven in many cities and countries, and for the price of taking taxis we came out ahead financially having the car. It rained while we were there, so we did not hang out at the pool or beach. We enjoyed exploring Old San Juan, and spent a fun day at El Yunque rain forest. When we first arrived it was about 4:30pm and we ended up going to Morton's Steak house (onsite) and had one of the famous Pina Colada's there- it was 'happy hour' so drinks were reduced priced and only $6-7 and also enjoyed some $7 appetizers. Loved the drinks, service, food and the view. In the non-raining moments, we walked the grounds - and it is a beautiful property. (Still not an equal to the property at the Iberostar resort in Costa Maya Mexico, but fantastic for a hotel on outskirts of a city). So the bottom line is- Caribe Hilton was perfect for a 2 night pre-cruise stay, booked through Priceline. I do think that a hotel in Condado area would be my first choice, because there is so much there within walking distance. *Favorite restaurant was "Rope Vieja" in Condado!* I'm glad we rented a car. We didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel, but it was a beautiful place to have as home-base for a couple of days. If I was planning a longer leisure vacation where we truly stay at the hotel the whole time, I'd probably choose something different. But pre-cruise, knowing that we were heading for a week of Caribbean beaches, these days in San Juan were just what we wanted/ expected/ hoped for. Many thanks to TripAdvisor reviews for giving us the tips and insight to make the most of our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton can use some minor updating of their rooms (bathroom inparticular). While the staff was very friendly, service lacked a little. I requested a microwave during reservation and then again at check-in and everyday during stay...still waiting. Also, my younger child had a bed "accident". Housekeeping just made the bed and I had to call them back to change the sheets. Hotel food is VERY expensive. $14 Hamburgers, $8 Hot Dogs, etc. Breakfast buffet was $26pp. Make sure to get breakfast included in your room rate and the 14% facilities fee as well...I did. Again, front desk, bell-hops and wait staff all very friendly. Rooms are fine, beds are comfortable. Pool area is very nice and has PLENTY of lounge chairs for soaking up the sun. The hammack area is very nice also, espcially at night to catch the ocean breeze. Beach is small.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy and Badly In Need or Renovation (Main Building)”
Reviews.Author: Hesitant-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here four times now. Last two times in the main hotel buidling (apparently built in the 50's). The rooms in this building are in pretty bad shape and in terrible need of renovation. The tub/shower area looks original to the building, although I'm sure it's not. There are two other, much better options on the property. The newest rooms are the Lagoon Villas and they are very nice. Very large, some with kitchen facilities, if not a little strange - the room connects to the adjacent room on both sides of the room unless yuo have an end room. But the construction is new and the rooms nicely decorated. The downside is that the Lagoon Villas are a far walk from the main lobby. The next good option is the Hotel Tower. This building is not new, but must be newer than the main hotel building. The rooms in the Tower (at least mine) are very nice and don't suffer from the worn out, run down look of the main building rooms. The hotel is right on the beach and there are great views of the water (some of the main hotel rooms I understand face an interior garden area, so ask). There is a designated restaurant for the free HH continental breakfast, and it's pretty good. There is a Morton's Steakhouse on the property, an Asian restaurant (very good) and a sports bar type place (Pina Colada's I think) which is actually very good. Bottom line - a fine property as long as you stay away from the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Old school Hilton, has some island charm but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Comitis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is similar to the Hilton Hawaiian Village in that you check in at an outdoor reception area - but that's where most of the similarities end. This is an old property. The room I had was badly in need of updating and the balcony overlooked a room with debris and broken bottles. The hotel has a nice little beach area and great outside options - a beautiful pool and grounds. The interior restaurant/bar has floor to ceiling wndows that overlook the ocean and pool/beach. The staff was very nice and accommodating. If you are okay with a substandard room, then the rest of the hotel experience will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: melissabh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in March. We really enjoyed our trip, and the Caribe Hilton was a good choice in San Juan. We were in a "renovated" room in the garden tower. The room was nice enough with modern furnishings. The bathroom does have mold/mildew because there is not a fan (poor design). The A/C was loud at night. Other than that the room was perfectly fine for our stay. The property is nice, with a pretty view, beach and pool area. The service is slow, but relax.. it's the Caribbean way! We did stop at the El Conquistador in Fajardo, which is a fantastic property. Next time we go to PR on vacation, we will stay there. The Caribe Hilton was very nice, but more business travelers than leisure. Also, the hotel is very close to Condado. The concierge and everyone insisted we would need a cab to get there and back for dinner. After spending $14 each way a few times, we decided to walk. It is definitely a short walk, and we felt safe. The cabs are a huge rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer....Ignore the negative reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkpaulandliz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a long weekend in Puerto Rico of which three nights were spent at the Caribe Hilton. From the minute we got there until the minute we left, the entire staff was excellent and very attentive and helpful. As Hilton Gold Honor members we were given a room on the 9th floor of the main building. The view from the room was absolutely fantastic with a view of both the beach and the pool area. The room was neat and clean with an oversized flat screen TV. The bathroom was average size and quite acceptable. As with any resort, food and beverages on site are on the high side. We had lunch at the pool bar which was good, and with soft drinks it came to about $32 for the two of us including tip. There is a Starbucks in the lobby that is very reasonable but since we were on a mini vacation we treated ourselves. For the five days we were in San Juan we rented a car (Charlies Car Rental) which worked out great. Parking is $15 a day, however we opted for the valet service which was another $6 but well worth it. All of the valets were friendly and yes you had to tip them on top of the charge but then that is what you are paying for the service. The pool areas and beaches are clean and there was always plenty of available seating either on the beach or by the pool. As Hilton Gold Members the Continental breakfast is included however we opted to pay $11 more for the full buffet which regularly is $26. The buffet was excellent, however at full price, $52for two plus tip for breakfast is a bit much. As for the rooms, they were more than adequate. They were very quiet and the air conditioning worked just fine. They do not have the adjustable beds as do many of the Hilton Garden Inns but in spite of that it was fairly comfortable. By the way, sodas from the machine on the floor were only $1.50, a bargain considering the other prices. As previously mentioned we found all of the staff from the front desk to the housekeeping service to be extremely friendly and helpful. When dining or drinking outside by the pool, only credit or room charge is available which we thought was a good safe way to avoid having to carry cash with you when going to the pool or beach. By the way, for parrot fans, there is a cage in the lobby with three very pretty and friendly parrots. I found myself going to the lobby for the complimentary high speed WiFi and ending up feeding sunflower seeds to the parrots especially the white one. They just loved to take the seeds from your hand. All in all, our stay at the Caribe Hilton far exceeded our expectations, having read many of the negative reviews. We would come back here in a heartbeat given the opportunity. By the way if you do come down to Puerto Rico, and enjoy great jazz piano, you must definitely visit Carli's Cafe Concierto in Old San Juan at the bottom of the Banco Popular building. Carli plays every night but Sunday. Food is pricey but excellent and you can sit all night and listen. to Carlii play. Great way to spend an evening.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip To Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: mjdarrell
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Caribe Hilton was a no brainer b/c I am a fan of the Hilton chain. We arrived around 2:30pm so our room wasnt ready but the concierge suggested leave our luggage with him and go change and head to the beach/pool. The kids had no complaint with that. we stayed about 2 hrs. When the room was finally ready I was a little disappointed because I was expecting a suite instead of a room but we made do. The restaurants were a bit pricey as everyone else has said. But, the good thing is kids eat at 1/2 price and kids under 5 eat free for b'fast

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for young families.”
Reviews.Author: nm_roadrunner
Reviews.Content: We were in Puerto Rico for a week on a family vacation and we stayed at the Hilton Caribe for the first two nights while we were in San Juan. We got a good price by bidding on Priceline and the hotel was an excellent value for what we paid. We stayed in a room with two double beds with our two boys (age 2yo and 5yo) and we had ample space. The room we were in was a little dated but was fine overall (we didn't spend much time in the room anyway). The pools are great! The beach is fantastic! It a private beach in a protected cove so the waves are minimal, no undertoe and nice sand. The hotel restaurants are expensive and food is decent but not great. One downside is that the only nearby restaurant outside of the hotel is a Subway. It's located not far from Old San Juan and it was very easy to take the public bus there and back. Overall we were glad we stayed at the Hilton Caribe...but we also enjoyed getting out of the city as well (Luquillo for the rest of the week).

Reviews.Title: “Beautful grounds, not so beautiful room.”
Reviews.Author: pjsubway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe for a night before our cruise. The grounds were great, with plenty to do with the kids and wonderful landscaping. Our room in the main tower was nothing to write home about. The woodwork showed lots of wear and tear and the walls needed some freshening up, while the bathroom looked like it has gotten some rough use. That said, I got a good price on the room, so I can't complain. I would, if I paid the rack rate. Avoid the restaurants in the resort, they're not worth what you pay. Otherwise, enjoy the great pools and gardens. The staff was friendly and helpful, as well.

Reviews.Title: “overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: 514VABeach
Reviews.Content: Decent location although plan to take cabs to all restaurants off site. We had a two bdrm with kitchen in the lagoon villas. Nice rooms overall and love the extra space. Didn't realize till after we went grocery shopping that there wasn't an oven or a toaster! The pools and grounds were very clean and well maintained. The beach was wonderful. Plenty of chairs and umbrellas. We went to Lemongrass Restaurant in the hotel after hearing it was not owned by HIlton and was recently ranked in Bon App. magazine. It was a wonderful meal and I would rec. it to anyone. Il Giardino was lousy. Best spot for breakfast is a little cafe right next to the liquor store just outside of the hotel. Great bkfst sandwiches for just $3.50 vs. the $20++ you could pay for eggs in the hotel. Starbucks is handy to have on-site and there was a great shoe store in the hotel. This was our first vacation after having a baby and I will return. Cell phones work, easy 10 minutes from airport and no problems with flights or airport security.

Reviews.Title: “It's Been Around for Awhile; but it Still Gets the Job Done!”
Reviews.Author: ShebaM123
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Caribe Hilton when we visit San Juan. This time we were given a nice room with a beautiful view of the ocean. The grounds of the hotel are lovely and well maintained. The elevators are fast and the staff is friendly. Shopping is very limited; however, I am not a shopper when traveling. The Olas Spa is wonderful with a very friendly, helpful staff. The concierge is extremely helpful with dinner reservations and travel advice. Only ONE real negative: When you entered the hallway to our room, there was a distinct musty odor coming from somewhere.....maybe the carpeting? Therefore, everytime you walked down the hallway, the odor greeted you. It's fun to sit at the little poolside restaurant and have lunch and a drink. It's even more fun watching Hiram (award-winning bartender) mix drinks and provide excellent service at the Atlantica! He's a machine wearing a smile! Our experience at the Caribe Hilton was delightful!

Reviews.Title: “great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: jackatelukemolly
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel with a great pool area.the only annoying thing was that they hit you with a 14% resort fee and the food and drinks are extremely expensive.we would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “For the masses”
Reviews.Author: barry_silverstein
Reviews.Content: We were recently at a fantastic wedding at this Hotel. This is a very large commercial family resort catering to the masses, with many pools and a private beach. Because we heard very mixed reviews about the Lanai Villa suites, we decided to play it safe, save and stay in the Honors Tower. It was a wise decision. We requested a high floor with ocean view and got the top, the 20th. The only issue was the room next door had a "problem child", whining and crying in the morning. The noise was so bad that the Hotel finally moved the family after the neighbors on the other side of "the Whiner" complained extensively to Management. Hilton needs to either sound proof the connecting door between the rooms, or get rid of the door altogether. Otherwise, while the main building needs an exterior facelift and the restaurant prices can be ridiculous ($15 for a hamburger!), the new Pinacolada restaurant by the Honors Tower is reasonably priced and serves great drinks ($9 Martinis), and the food at Lemon Grass is said to be exceptional. The friendly staff could not do enough for us. Our room was very nice & recently renovated; very clean, the view was outstanding w/ large balcony, a/c worked great, the king bed fantastic, the marble bath beautiful with large marble shower, a waterfall shower head & a second adjustable hand held, and a bench on which to sit. The bathroom also had dual vanity sinks. You need to take a taxi into Old San Juan and can catch one any time at the entrance to the lobby. It is a beautiful town, but a fixed $12 ride each way, or you can catch the bus for only 50 cents per person each way. We took it back from town. The terminal is not great, but the bus is clean and gets you back in about ten minutes. Also, definitely rent a car (Allied $39/day) and explore the Rain Forest, an hour and a half drive. It's completely different and Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints from me”
Reviews.Author: Dannymarino131
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel/resort thru priceline and got a great deal on it....most people who complained on here before looks like they booked it for 300-400 a night which is crazy becz i got mine for 125 plus resort fee. This is a very nice place and is close to everywhere. The fruit water in the lobby is good and the hotel itself if great for relaxing and lounging. If you're worried about money (which you shouldn't be if your on vacation) then maybe this isn't the place for you. 12 dollar cab rides to old san juan do add up but again its vacation people and id take a place on the beach over in the city any day. The beds are great and i slept like a baby as well as my mom...the 2 beds in our room were queen sized and very comfortable. the starbucks in the lobby is priced the same as any and we would get sandwich's and snacks there to hold us over til we would go out and eat. Everyone was very nice and helpful....although very helpful i would book my own tours if i were you because we booked the bio-bay kayak tour thru the hotel which only took like 5 minutes but were displeased by the company who took us. Plus the bio-bay tour is very overrated the plankton were barely luminescent and we only got 10 minutes out there once we made it. Overall this is a Great place to stay and My mom liked it even more than i did.

Reviews.Title: “Old run down buildings, large rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Avishai625
Reviews.Content: Old run down buildings, large rooms and/or villas very poorly renovated, non-existent service or attention to the guests at the reception, restaurants, housekeeping, pool and beach area, a/c units that run when they want as they want, porters with an attitude. Very disappointing specially considering the very high nightly rate we paid for a two bedroom villa. This hotel has seen us as it's guests for the first and the last time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: broe0901
Reviews.Content: We booked the cheapest room/ garden view and were suprised by the great ocean view staight ahead outside our window. The garden was below us, we were on the 6th floor and honestly i think we got a better view than the "ocean view, more expensive rooms". There are pros and cons to this hotel. ... Pros: 1. walk to Old San Juan ( 2.5 miles) if you are active you can do this walk, we did it twice, took a cab back, that is alot of walking, bc in old san juan all you do is walk. 2. 4 restaurants right at the hotel, each restaurant had specials and if you walked in the door and looked at the menu you could get food at a decent price. I recommend Mortons their bar hours menu, was great and reasonably priced. 3. Pool was great, the hotel grounds were beautiful. oh, and 3 hot tubs! and a poolbar. 4. Service was great, we did not have any problems with that, cleaning staff was efficient and we always had towels. 5. Cabs always available on the spot. 6. Room was clean and very nice, bed comfy down comforter. Shower was wonderful, i want one like that at home. Cons: 1. Hotel tax is extra. 2. Food and drinks at the hotel are way expensive, get your food elsewhere. Buy liquor or beer at the liquor store across the street. But take advantage of the specials at the hotel restaurants. 3. Cab fee's expensive. 4. Renting towels for the pool is annoying, they charge 20 bucks if you dont return it by 6 pm. just bring towels. 5. There isnt anything within walking distance from this hotel at night. you need to take a cab at night. Overall I loved my experience in PR and this hotel was great! Just do your research and know the CONs going in then, they wont bother you as bad, bc you already know they are coming. We had a great time at Caribe Hilton and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great service and beautif. views!”
Reviews.Author: femachad
Reviews.Content: Also, fitness center with new equip. and and delicious fresh seafood @ hilton's room service :)

Reviews.Title: “A resort in the city”
Reviews.Author: GordonChicago
Reviews.Content: As far as I am aware, they do not bill this hotel as a resort, but they could. Though it is located in San Juan -- a much more urban experience than I had realized could be had in the Caribbean -- they even have an el train -- the hotel has spacious and beautifully landscaped grounds and its own beach and swimming pool, for starters, as well as a full daily schedule of activities. The highlight of the rooms in the main building (a better bet than the Tower) is the view, which is a wonderful view of the Atlantic Ocean and shoreline of San Juan. On several occasions during our stay I just sat on our balcony and savored it. You can walk east across the bridge to the Condado where there are numerous restaurants and some lively night life too. In the opposite direction is Old San Juan, which is accessible via a 50 cent bus ride which you can board just a couple blocks away from the hotel. The hotel's restaurants are on the pricey side, but they also have a Starbucks just off the large open-air lobby which is great for people-watching; and there is a Subway and a convenience store just down the block. Oh, one thing: watch out for the swans in the tropical garden. They look so graceful, but as they swim toward you, be aware they intend to have your middle toe for food!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Forget the Pina Colada Cub”
Reviews.Author: Terri001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carib on Feb 25 & 26. Not a bad stay. With the exception of the awful smell of the hotel's cleaning chemicals, the atmosphere was much as I remembered it from pervious stays. And if asked, we wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Carib again. If you decide to stay at the Carib, try the Pina Colada Club. It turned out to be the highlight of our stay! Linda and her staff are an exceptionally friendly and efficient group. The food is of the sports bar variety well prepared and generous in portions. But if the menu doesn't appeal there is a large blackboard of yummy daily specials. My advice, order what you like and make sure to taste their Guava Margarita. It's to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AKAKandie
Reviews.Content: We were in the Condado Lagoon Villas, ground floor, with a lovely patio overlooking the lagoon and the dog of stone. The grounds are beautiful and have 2 lovely pools, a hot tub, and a very nice beach. The hotel's location is excellent, 30 minute walk or $12 cab ride to Old San Juan. There's also a public beach/park next door, which made for a lovely walk. The hotel also had a Tour desk, so you can arrange for excursions if you aren't comfortable finding your own way. Although we anticipated food and beverage to be expensive, given this is a Hilton, we weren't prepared for how expensive it really was. There's a Starbucks, though, in the hotel and a Subway across the street, which worked out perfectly for us. Hotel staff was excellent and everything was clean.

Reviews.Title: “seclusion in the big city”
Reviews.Author: Benefits
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights post cruise in late februrary 2010. Checked in late around 8:00pm and was upgraded to a lagoon villa. Newer studio with full kitchen allowed us to save some bucks by stocking up on groceries, (we had a car rental), $16.05/day to self park. Very nice grounds which appeared to be well maintained. You are basically on a peninsula so plan on spending at the hotel for food and drink. Subway restaurant about five minute walk, other than that your in a cab, or car rental. Definitley enjoyed the pool and beach areas as the weather did cooperate. Good value for what I paid,(priceline), not far from old san juan, condado, isla verde. Certainly a family friendly resort. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best grounds”
Reviews.Author: linareva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise and, although the hotel itself could use a facelift, the grounds and private beach are still the best we've encountered in PR, I guess because it is genuinely a PRIVATE beach. They have really built up the outside areas and you can snorkel and scuba right from shore. Post-cruise we booked the IC and this Hilton was a palace compared to what we expereinced there. Our room was nice and refurbished but the view was poor, overlooking the parking lot and a rooftop. The problem we had with the shower door leaking almost became disasterous when the door fell off its hinges, crashed to the floor and broke into a million pieces while my husband was in it! He used a towel to move from the shower back into the room to call maintenance. All he got was a free breakfast buffet. The Pina Colada Club was very relaxed and the breakfast buffet was generous. Loved the peacocks, swans and the Koi pond. the ruin is still there for you to explore as well. You can get lost pretty easily because of all the condo development

Reviews.Title: “Don't have your wedding here!”
Reviews.Author: ghekommm
Reviews.Content: The hotel had acceptable features. I had to argue to get my room upgrade for the bridal suite after it was promised to me. I had my wedding and reception hosted at the hotel and I left EXTREMELY disappointed. I used one of their recommended vendors for my New Years Eve wedding who were supposed to provide music for my wedding ceremony and a DJ for the wedding reception. After paying a hefty deposit to the vendor, the vendor never showed up. I was left to try to improvise for the wedding ceremony and the reception....so imagine, my friends and family traveling from all over the US to come to Puerto Rico to ring in the New Year at my wedding reception and there is no music. I had to purchase tickets for my guests to attend the Hotel's New Years Eve party AND for the three hours of open bar for my reception we didn't use. The hotel would not refund the money for the reception, nor would they assist in obtaining my deposit back from the DJ. The DJ was EVENT WORKS, managed by Manuel Emmanueli! BE WARE! The most the hotel would do, provide a speaker for an ipod (that screached) and promise to remove the vendor from the list!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fartrip
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and willing to let us see the room prior to check in without any hassles. The beds and linens were so comfortable. The restaurant on property, Lemongrass was one of best places I ate during our stay. The best thing is it had it's own private beach. One of two hotels in San Juan that has it's own beach. There was a huge area to layout and catch the rays along with hammocks. The hotel was a little short staffed but nothing to noticeable. All-in-all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Caribe is a place you don't need to leave.”
Reviews.Author: SQE_traveler
Reviews.Content: Our family reserved a room in the Villa's which I do not recommend. I was told the rooms were 50% larger than a standard room and newly renovated which was not true. Construction is closer and loud during the night. We changed to a room in the HHonors towers which was very well appointed. HDTV, dual sink bathroom, large shower. Enough room for 2 teens and adults with an awesome view! As many reviewers we did not eat at the hotel, minus the free continental breakfast and Starbucks, no executive lounge. Lunch was served (by me) daily on the beach from the Subway shop across the driveway. Dinner was always a cab ride to Old San Juan downtown (Latin Roots, Al Dente, San Juan Cafe all excellent!). With the private beach, tanning deck and gym/spa you only need to leave for excursions. We also had the concierge arrange a day trip on a catamaran for snorkeling. excellent time. free wifi in the lobby. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Donna
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Caribe Hilton and commend the outstanding service that we received during our most recent stay there. (Feb 9 thru Feb 17). My wife and I have been visiting San Juan, PR for the past 10 years and we have stayed at several different hotels. However, once we stayed at the Caribe Hilton 4 years ago, we only want to stay there each time we go! The beach there is the most beautiful in San Juan! It has gotten better and better over the last few years due to the obvious presence of the general manager, Mr. Jose Campo and one of his top hotel staff, Mr. Nelson Torres. Both regularly walked the grounds to ensure that the guests were taken care of and to ensure that the staff were providing the best service possible. Every aspect of the stay was fabulous....from the excellent housekeeping services to the wonderful consierge service and the fantastic service staff at both the indoor and outdoor bar/grills. The food, both in room and outside was outstanding! Our favorite was having the Mahi Mahi at lunch. We stayed in the Laguna Villas and love the beautiful view of the ocean and the San Geronimo fort and the peaceful atmosphere provided there. We will be going back again before the end of the year. Our daughter, who is getting married in August, is planning on spending her honeymoon there! I'm sure it will be a wonderful time for her and her husband. We have recommended the Caribe Hilton to family and friends who have gone there and came back loving it, as well. We don't know all of the names of the wonderful staff but we would like to especially thank a few that made our stay as though we were visiting our family. Thank you to Mr. Campo and Mr. Torres: to Hiram & Jose from the outside bar/grill; to Aneudy, from the lobby bar/grill; to Isabella, our main housekeeper and Omar, the Villa's consierge/manager. We look forward to our future visits to the beautiful Caribe Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Getaway for Families with Small Children”
Reviews.Author: illinoisboy71
Reviews.Content: The Location: The location was great. Short cab ride from the airport (20min/about $20), short cab ride to Old San Juan (10 min/$12-$14). Right on the water. The Beach: The main reason for our trip was to play in the sand and surf. The beach at the hotel was perfect for our 6 year old. It is in a crescent shape with breakers so the waves were not big. The sand was clean, the water was clear, and It was shallow for a distance. We did not have a problem finding beach chairs, and the staff were helpful putting up our umbrellas. The chairs, umbrellas, sand toys were complimentary. We did rent a life jacket for $5. Don't forget sunscreen and goggles for the kids. The Pool: There are 3/4 pools on property. The main pool is split by a bridge with a very shallow kids side and the main side. There's an infinity type pool up a level which spills over into the main pool. The last pool is a small area around the pool bar. Finally there are two small jacuzzi type spots near the infinity pool. None of the pools are very large but they serve their purpose. Most people laid around the pool, leaving the actual water to the kids. We went in late February and the pool was rather cold, so we spent more time in the ocean. The Room: Basic room. We paid for a balcony with an view but the balcony was teeny tiny and the view could be seen at a diagonal so we would not pay extra next time. Otherwise, a standard room, clean, with nice big tv. The Food: We liked the starbucks in the lobby. We had their sandwiches a few times - inexpensive comparatively, easy and good. The poolside grill was okay, small menu, nothing special. The breakfast buffet was very nice. It was included in our package, but we would not have paid for it if it wasn't. ($$) There was also a subway a very short walk away. They had fancier restaurants but they were not for us. The Staff: Very nice and friendly land helpful. Overall: We loved the hotel for the location and the beach. It is a perfect getaway for a family with small children that want to spend time building sand castles and swimming in the ocean. We would go back, just not pay for the balcony/ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: slafrance3
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton San Juan was our base of operations for a week long, overdue family vacation and the fulfillment of a promise I made to my wife 14 years ago. We stayed in the main hotel the night we arrived, then spent the weekend with family in Cabo Rojo, then returned to the Caribe Hilton on Monday. We were please to find out that they had upgraded us to the Villas and boy was the money well spent. The beds were fantastic, the service impeccable, and the grounds and beach were a dream. The Caribe has its own private beach with sorkeling and a slide, plenty of hammocks to sway in the wind and read, and the pool area is absolutely beautiful. Then we found out that the hotel was the film location of Wizards of Waverly Place and our kids had a thrill running around taking pictures of all the places that the movie was filmed in for bragging rights with their friends. The hotel, grounds, and staff made this one of the most enjoyable vacations I've been on in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weeklong Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Caribe Hilton the week of Feb 20-27 and had a very relaxing trip. The pluses for the hotel are the private beach, friendly staff, great food and convenient location. You can walk to Condado over the beach or to Old San Juan. The latter is a bit of a hike so I suggest taking the B21 public bus. The same bus also goes to Condado if you don't want to cross over the bridge. The bus is only 75 cents and is convenient. Overall, the Hilton is a safe bet. My only suggestion is to return the towels everyday before 6pm otherwise they will add to your bill. If they do, just say you did return and they will take off. I recommend restaurants, Ropa Vieja, Bebo's and Cafe del Angel (all in Condado). Have fun in PR!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shaseh
Reviews.Content: the atmosphere, staff and beach were awesome. Enjoyed my stay,

Reviews.Title: “nice but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Rae4555
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Puerto Rico for 5 days was awesome. We loved hiking in the Yunque Rainforest a couple days, visiting other beaches, touring the ruins, hanging out in Old San Juan. Overall the hotel was fine. The gardens were pretty, fitness center nice, didn't try the spa, beds were good, the beach was calm and clean. Because of the reef you couldn't experience swimming in the ocean waves. But this beach was great for kids if you bring them. I loved the beds by the beach and pool but needed to grab them early in the day. We usually sat in chairs/beds farther from the pool. We never had service come all 3 days we sat there. I asked if they provided pool service and they said yes and that the guys are out there somewhere. I never saw them. The room was small and needed updating but it was clean. Our view was a rooftop and a glimpse of the ocean. They had a small refrig. which was nice just to keep a few things for our next days hike. The conciege was helpful in choosing restaurants offsite. We did stay at the hotel one evening and ate at the Rotisserie II Giardino. It wasn't great food for what you paid for. There are lots of great places to eat in old san juan which is really close. When we checked out the hotel tried to bill us $150 for Mortons Steakhouse but never ate there! They looked up the bill and showed it to us. It wasn't our signature. We had to argue with the manager who wasn't apologetic at all but rather rude. They said to pay it and they would talk to Mortons when they opened for the day and refund it once they looked into it more. We wouldn't settle for that b/c most likely we would never get that refund. It was Mortons fault for not matching name (which was just a scribble for a signature) with room number when they signed for the bill that night, but that is to be disputed with Mortons and the hotel. We didn't pay and like I said, the manager was rude about the whole thing. When we check in they give us small slips with our room number on them to give to resaturants and gifts stores to add to our hotel bill. I'm not sure why Mortons didn't use this procedure. It took over 30 minutes to go through this hassel and we needed to get to the airport. So check your hotel bill carefully for details before you leave. That just ruined the end of our stay there. I wouldn't stay here again b/c there are other Hiltons and nice hotels out there but the hotel does have nice features if you want to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico is great....Caribe Hilton is overall nice”
Reviews.Author: snews77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved visiting San Juan....the Caribe Hilton was a very nice property overall.....it was generally clean, our room was a little small...but the ocean view was very nice. If you looked closely you could tell that the hotel is a little worn in areas, the bathroom particularily. The gardens, pool and the beach are outstanding. I wished we had got to enjoy the beach more and snorkel because the fish were beautiful and you could see plenty just by stepping a few feet in the water. The restuarants were pricey, but there were some options close by. Starbucks was always busy but the staff was efficient and worked for a quick breakfast. We haven't stayed anywhere else in San Juan but the location seems to be ideal, and not too far from things if you don't mind walking...although going towards Old San Juan...traffic can sometime be heavy...so if you have young children, elderly or not used to city traffic I wouldn't recommend walking. Not geared for young romanatics or singles type environment, but you could make it work. I really loved looking out at the ocean and the nice pools and gardens. The only other thing I would say is, that we had to keep the balcony door closed for the most part because it was pretty noisy when open. Again, overall it was a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “I Love vacationing in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: drewpa
Reviews.Content: I'm from the Mid-Atlantic area on the east coast, U.S. I think Puerto Rico has IT ALL for a relatively short plane ride. I've been to PR 4 times. This was my first time at the Caribe Hilton AND the first time with my family. I generally liked the Caribe Hilton. We rented a car at the airport and drove to the hotel via the highway. You have to be careful if you drive because the Caribe Hilton entrance is tucked back from the road....easy to miss. I found the staff (as well as the residents of Puerto Rico) to be very friendly and helpful. As others have mentioned, the food and restaurants at the resort are a bit pricey..but there are options to eat off-site (nice restaurant at Escombra (sp?) public beach...only minutes walk from the hotel. I self parked the car and went in and out rather easily. We drove into Old San Juan (5 mins if no traffic) AND drove to El Yunque. My ONLY gripe and advice I would give would be regarding our room. I "upgraded" to a Villa with a "waterview". I booked my room probably about 5 months before our trip. When I got up to our room, I found that we were able to view some lagoon water hitting rocks...otherwise the view looked out on construction, traffic, and buildings. I'm not one to usually complain, but I felt like I deserved better for a "waterview". I was told at the front desk that most rooms were taken. They switched us to a room where they said that we would be facing and have a direct view of the ocean! Well, the room was on the ground floor, there was a wall with big potted plants on the patio. If we stood on our tippy toes and looked between the pots...we could see the ocean. I would not spring for a Villa in the future. On the day we were leaving, I viewed a "regular" room. It appeared to me to be just as spacious. The only thing it didn't have that the villa did was a little wet bar area that had a microwave. As others mentioned, the grounds and views are gorgeous, plenty of pool area, very nice protected beach for swimming, snorkeling, etc. I would/will go back again. My family enjoyed it as well. I don't know what you have do..or how early you have to book to get the rooms with the best view?

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you don't mind mold and expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: mikenisky
Reviews.Content: The location is great, especially if you rent a car. There is even a car rental place on-site if you want it for day trips. Close to Old San Juan, clost to Fajardo for snorkling trips and rain forest. We stayed in the Lagoon Villas...beautifully located about 30 feet from ocean lagoon..that's the good part. Bad part is the one bedroom had carpet which would turn your feet black if walked on...no surprise so close to water, but it was surprising the carpet existed. Take advantage of close subway and mini-mart if you want to pay less than $8 per beer, $15 per sandwich...they are very close so not bad. Best grocery store is right on way when you exit airport on 187. It's big, clean, and great place for all the staples...about 10 minutes from hotel. Views outside in ocean pool areas are as good as a family could want. Hammocks under palm trees, great accomidations around pool and beach make this a great place. Security is without question great here...no problems. If close to water, able to open doors and listen to surf is what you want, this is your place...lagoon villas. If not, find a cleaner place alike the Wyndam on the east coast. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing choice for pre/post cruise holiday”
Reviews.Author: travelangel777
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Caribe one night before our cruise and one night after. We took a cab from the airport which cost us $19 plus $1 for each suitcase. As mentioned previously, the grounds of this hotel are beautiful and we loved walking around the garden and taking pictures of the swans. We got the hotel on Priceline and saved tons of money. Yes the hotel food is very expensive, but there is a Subway right in front of the hotel that stays open fairly late. The rooms were clean and the bed comfortable. The pool is also very nice place to relax. Staying here a week would get pricey as it is a $12 cab ride to downtown. We thought it was perfect for spending a few days before or after a cruise or even a business trip!!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: DBIGMAN
Reviews.Content: Just got back home and I had to write this review... Caribe Hilton is historically known as the glamour destination for celebrities in the past decades... Unfortunately, it has not held up to its reputation; not even close. 600+ rooms including a high rise building for Hilton HHonors members. Breakfast Buffet, Italian Rest., Asian Rest., Pool side lunch/bar, Starbucks, coffee shop... Pro's 1. located less than 10 mins from the San Juan airport 2. located less than 5 mins via taxi to Old San Juan 3. Property includes beach front with a spacious pool 4. Concierge is great once you have waited on the endless lines... Con's 1. A lot of kids! - NOT the place for couples, honeymooners, or even singles. I would ONLY recommend this hotel for families looking for a noisy packed budget resort. 2. Poor Service - The staff pretty much everywhere was rude, nasty, and not willing to help (except at check-IN, Robert or Rafael was great!). At the Lemongrass Restaurant my $32 entree was soo salty. I asked our server (who happened to be the assistant manager? and she looked at me with a blank stare. She didnt even ask if I wanted something else. I paid in full just because i had enough of the horrible service. What really pushed me over the edge was our last night we decided to take a dip in the pool. After being on hold for minutes (which seems like forever) they told me that after 5pm the towel stand closes but pool is open till 9pm. So we used our bathroom towels... When we got back to our room, we called housekeeping and they answered with "Hello, Mr. XXX" i assumed that they have some kind of caller ID. She told me it would be 20 mins for someone to bring us towels... we waited 30 mins and called back. she told us another 10 mins. at 45 mins, we called again, same response... over an hour passed and we called for the last time and she apologized and said that the delay was our fault because she misunderstood our room # !!! What doesnt make sense is the fact that SHE ANSWERED THE PHONE GREETING MY NAME!!!!!!!!!!! I called the night manager Giullemo? he apologized and wanted to send up towels STAT but i deferred because I had an early conference call. 15 mins later, not showered, tired, agitated --- Housekeeping is banging on our door. I answer and she presents me with 2 bathROBES... I asked what this was about and she said that I requested bath robes over an hour ago!!!!! She was very sweet, but I almost lost it. Upon check out - i mentioned that I spoke with the manager regarding these incidents and he just looked at me with a blank stare. I paid the bill and was happy to be leaving... NEVER HAVE I EVER LEFT A VACATION IN SUCH A HURRY!!!!! 3. Front desk lines are horrible during check in/out times. As a Diamond HHonors Hilton member, the "VIP" line was still tremendous.... I think i waited over 20 mins just to check in and be told that the room wouldnt be avail. till 6pm! 4. There is no club lounge. As a HHonors member, breakfast usually is included... we went for the included breakfast the first morning and walked right out... a couple of bagels, coffee, and fruit with flies everywhere... 5. A couple was getting married at the resort... i felt so bad for the bride, she looked miserable and I even overheard her saying "this doesnt look like the pictures they sent us." I can go on forever!! Overall - Horrible. If you are looking for a quiet, romantic time its a BIG NO NO. I would ONLY recommend this hotel to low budget families (although the room rates are high) with kids. Never Again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon on the beach”
Reviews.Author: none07
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned here on HHonors points. The property is beautiful - on the water and with a lagoon beach. The hotel had some trouble finding a king bed room for us as they apparently had a full house, but put us in the villa (time share, sort of) section. The hotel spa was average. The beach cabana, rented by the day, was amazing. Hotel service could be slow (an hour plus wait after requesting bathrobes from housekeeping and almost 45 minutes one day for a beach umbrella). Perhaps that is the island way though? The hotel has a list of daily activities including yoga, pilates, fish feeding, Latin dance lessons, and the very important daily pina colada "tasting." Honors Gold and Diamond get a continental breakfast in one of the restaurants that has been converted into a breakfast lounge of sorts. Restaurants are resort pricey ($26 breakfast buffet, about $100 for an appetizer, drinks and dinner for two at Morton's or the Asian or Italian restaurants. Two burgers and drinks at the pool bar were $65. We later found the Subway at the end of the entrance driveway and excellent pizza/Italian delivery from Charlie's. We also enjoyed the Parrot Club and Puerto Rico cafe in Old San Juan and Delirio in Miramar/Condado for our romantic Valentine's dinner. While hotel relaxing was nice, also check out Old San Juan ($12 cab each way), El Yunqe Rainforest and/or the bioluminescent bay (through Kayaking Puerto Rico).

Reviews.Title: “Not flawless but still one of my favorites in the world”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: I used to work in PR right out of colege and the Caribe Hilton was my favorite hotel in the world. Old world ambience, the best staff, their own beach and the best tropical bar I had ever been to and I stayed there on and off for 2 years. 25 years later we decide to bring the family to PR and my first choice, of course.... is the Caribe Hilton. Fly into San Juan late at night, cab ride takes less than 15 minutes and is less than 20 dollars. It's 3 am in the morn but we are greeted warmly, we easily find our room and we sleep soundly wakening to yet another beautiful day in paradise. We stayed in the lagoon villas where they are a bit more spacious and a bit removed from the main core of the hotel, they have their own pool and hot tub and it was very nice. However, the AC blew only one speed and temperature and so we asked to move to a room so they could fix it. The staff was very accomodating and our second room on the 5th floor ended up w/ a much nicer view and an AC that worked. The Starbucks was the choice for morning fare 4 of the 5 days and was great. However, even though my teenager had one of the cards that showed he could charge and he was on the list to charge, they wouldn't let him so it was a bit disconcerting for him the first day. We also ate at Morton's (great), tried to get into Lemongrass when supposedly we did not need reservations but actually should have had them, and Malerbas for breakfast one day (nice buffet w/ great fruit and cooked to order eggs). Wifi always worked, we rented a cabana one day for $100 and it was well worth it, the staff needed to be reminded on the waters etc, but came through w/ shining service, the outdoor luch by the pool was casual and unhurried, the towel return was inconsistent and we had a charge on our final bill even though we had returned the towels(be careful as the pools are open to 9pm but the towel return closes at 6pm) and they gracefully removed the charge. There is a Hertz rental right at the hotel and it was an easy pickup and return one day when we took a spin @ the island. The concierge printed out of boarding passes, gave us a great recommendation on an ATV trail riding adventure, they had coolers of water in the lobby w/ fresh fruit in them for the thirsty throughout the day, the beds were comfortable and the weather divine. Nice pool and hot tubs, great views across the water and a really pleasant experience. I really like the private beach and NOT being in Dorado which is just a strip of hotels like any other place, the location of the Caribe Hilton makes it special and private. The cab into Old San Juan is only $12, although you could walk it if you want. While the Caribe Hilton still retains a bit of it's old world charm it has moved on and while a bit inconsistent w/ its services, the staff makes up for a very good experience and still my first choice when I go back to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: nikki721
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 10 minutes from the airport. Staff is great and very helpful. They have a tourist desk which doesn't rip you off like other ones do. Was at the Conrad first and it was very bad. Staff was rude there. Changed to the Hilton and staff was so nice. Pool area great and beach area was very clean. Had nice places to eat but can be pricey but hotel restrauants are most of the time. If you have time book the snokeling tour through the hotel great price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!-But not cheap...”
Reviews.Author: lermndo
Reviews.Content: Best beach area imaginable-perfect! Nicest group of employees I EVER encountered! Even the Executives say HI! Food quality is excellent. Prices are quite high. Try the new Pina Colada bar for the best wraps in San Juan. Room was lovely, quiet, clean, well appointed. No live music or casino-can't be perfect...

Reviews.Title: “The pool and the grounds make the hotel....”
Reviews.Author: richiegags
Reviews.Content: While I gave the hotel 4 stars, I may not have if it were not for the great price I got on Priceline. ($90). Don't get me wrong, not disappointed in the least with the hotel, but you do get the feel that it "used to be" a five star resort back in the day. People are correct in saying there is not much in 'immediate" walking distance, but there are a couple of small places to eat/shop. Pros Phenomenal grounds, pool, beach. Perfect for kids and couples alike. Nice ambience Great check-in staff, housekeeping Close to old San Juan Great fitness center Cons Overpriced restaurants. (people are correct in saying that a 20% reduction in price will probably double the customers) Weak concierge (although Antonio was great) and a horrible towel stand representative. I didn't get his name but he was tall with glasses. He literally acted like he was doing the guests a favor and used his all-powerful authority to treat people with an attitude. My wife and I personally encountered it twice. If the hotel was stronger they would have/should have picked up on him. Hotel definitely caters to business clients. Not that it's a bad thing, but on vacation I'd rather see other vacationers and not be reminded of what I left behind at home. All-in-all, we were happy and after visiting the Condado next door, we were pleased that Priceline chose this one for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, beautiful and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: marlindrak
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days at this resort. We were able to get it at a great price on Priceline. There is no need to go anywhere else. Great food at the recently opened Pina Colada Bar (they have the best servers of any restaurant we have ever been to and we travel all the time) , private beach and beautiful pool area. Very relaxing...just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: stiglitz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel for a 5 night 6 day vacation last week. This is a beautiful beach front property with well manicured lawns. The reception area is beautiful and they welcome you with fruit flavored water. The internet is free in the lobby area but you have to pay 14.95 for in room internet access. The hotel location is a little on the downside as there is very limited food options nearby. There is a subway apart from the hotel restaurants within a minute walking distance. The next closest decent restaurant is on asford ave which is a good 15 minute walk over the bridge. The hotel restaurants are pretty pricey for the food they serve so we choose to walk to ashford nearly everyday and for a quick bite we resorted to subway. The biggest downside for us was the beakfast at the hotel. My husband and I are both Diamond Hilton Honors and we opted for the free breakfast every morning instead of the free internet. The breakfast was the same every single day and there was no hot food option. It consisted of cold, slightly hard croissants, cereal, toast, bagel, fruit choices and coffee out of a coffee machine that was just not good. The juices (orange/fruit punch) was again from a machine. I wish they had a variety and maybe 1-2 hot breakfast options. Apart form that, the hammocks and the beach are wonderful and its a beautifully lit hotel. We would recommend this hotel for a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GrannyIrene
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in almost every hotel in Condado and Old San Juan. Booked at last minute and was prepared to be disappointed but WOW. Room was upgraded and found the pool, beach, ambience, service just great! Believe me I am not easy to please but this hotel was a real treat. Maybe the carpet could be changed but other than that no complaints. Fun being in a hotel that had some history. If you dont want to take a cab, take the bus 75 cents but be patient! Would like some fresh vetetables is only complaint and food was pricey but same in other hotels. Ye

Reviews.Title: “My $.02? Some unfair negative reviews of this hotel on this site.”
Reviews.Author: Bobeana
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a six-day trip to the Caribe Hilton. My mother booked the hotel on Priceline ($109/night) and after we learned of the hotel, I was concerned re: the many negative interviews I read on TripAdvisor. I needn't have worried. This was our first time staying here for both of us and we were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel, the level of service and the nice beach and pool area. We both travel frequently to San Juan to visit family (we also travel a lot internationally and domestically). We'll definitely stay here again. Mom has stayed at nearly all the nicer hotels and some apartments/condos and this was by far her favorite. Our room was on the 16th floor of the Tower. It very comfortable and designed to a high standard. Our balcony had a gorgeous view of the beach/lagoon. Beds were really comfortable and the bathroom was large with a nice, huge, glass enclosed, double-headed shower (including one of those "rain"/"sunflower" showerheads). Yes, food and drinks at the hotel are expensive, but not much different from other hotels where I have stayed. The challenge here vs. staying in Condado or in downtown San Juan is not being able to walk to more affordable restaurants. If that's really important to you, this might not be the best place. Otherwise, be creative. Go to a grocery store your first day and stock up. Enjoy coffee in your room vs. Starbucks. Have breakfast at Subway or the little diner nearby. For food, our favorite place to go was the Pina Colada Club that recently opened. Management has done an excellent job here: service was great, they were patient with children and the food at better prices than the other hotel restaurants. We watched the SuperBowl here and had a great time. Congrats to Marco and his staff there on a job well done. Morton's was running a deal on drinks and bar snacks from 5:-6:30 and 9-close that I had hoped to check out, but didn't. $4 beer and wine and $6 tapas plates. We took taxis sometimes and took the bus a few times ($.75 one way, $.35 for those over 60). A bus stop a few blocks from the Hilton can take you to Old San Juan or Condado. Disclosure: my sister often picked up and gave us rides, so we definitely benefited from that local connection re: transportation. Taxi's are $12-15 depending on where you want to go. I walked to Old San Juan one morning -- it was 45 minutes to Plaza Las Armas. The west end of Condado would be a good bit closer. Yes, you're certainly off on your own here, but I find that a plus -- a quiet respite to return to after sight-seeing and visiting my family. I particularly enjoyed the nice beach/lagoon for swimming. The "round" deck was my favorite place to hang out. Property and grounds were very nice, in general. I was able to check in to my room on time, they upgraded our room to a higher floor upon request, and they granted me a late check out. Can't say that for many other of my hotel experiences. Staff, for the most part, was friendly and attentive. So, as you read the other reviews, be mindful of the whiners and those not accustomed to life in the tropics. Caribe Hilton was excellent -- and the $12 Pina Coladas? Best I've ever had. I enjoyed fewer as a result of the price tag, but also didn't have to do as many laps in the lagoon to work them off.

Reviews.Title: “I hate, and rarely will write a critical review, but in this case.....”
Reviews.Author: The_Leske_Gang
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful, the pools delightful, the views outstanding, and the staff attentive and friendly, but there the positives end. As previously noted, this hotel is past its prime and in need of some serious up grading for areas outside of the lobby. The prices are downright exorbitant ($12 for a rum punch, $9 for a hot dog). Watch out for the "add ons" like the $50 resort fee. Excuse me, but aren't towels and use of the beach and pools included with our $375 room (which ballooned to over $500 in just one night)? Oh, and the included Continental breakfast? Absolutely abysmal with hockey pucks for pancakes(truly inedible), very old fruit (come on, this is the tropics folks). The coffee was good. However, the worst thing about this hotel is that it is not near anything except a liquor store and a Subway so to go out to dinner, or anywhere for that matter, also includes a $30 round trip cab ride. We didn't dare risk huge bucks on the hotel restaurants considering our experience with breakfast. Oh, and here's a tip. When the elevators break down, you can go around the corner and use the service elevators located right behind the guest ones. Its too bad too, because this could be a spectacular hotel, but they seem to have just let it go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Dondonee
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic ocean view, nice pools, clean and calm beach. Our room is on the sixth floor of the main building, having a lovely view of the garden and the ocean. The room is clean, however the bathroom needs a little work to keep updated. Hotel staffs are friendly. We checked in at 1 pm without any problem. We were also permitted to check out until 2 pm which was very helpful. My 1 year old and 3 years old boys had a wonderful time in Hilton Caribe. I will recommend it to any family with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsSpoofa
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Boston Friday Jan 29th leaving behind 11 degree temps and arriving with 83 balmy wonderful degrees. A quick cab ride from the airport to the hotel and we arrrived to a beautiful property. It was only 2:00 ish but we attempted to check in a sure enough they checked us in and off we went to our room. I forgot to mention I used Priceline for the first time and paid under $100 for our nite stay. The room was clean, two double beds, bathroom with a tub, clean but the view from the window left much to be desired, I think it was the airconditioning units. The property offers swimming pool, a small beach and georgous views. I had researched alot of reviews and knew I wasn't going to eat at the Hilton due to the prices so we headed off to the Conrad on Ashford Ave where we gambled and then walked down the street to a Chili's where we had dinner and walked back in the dark with no problems. Oh I forgot to mention after we dropped our suitcases off in the room we headed to Subway across the street and it was the worst Subway I've ever had in my life, the bread was stale, I was really disappointed.
