We asked for directions from a hotel employee where the bus stop was and we still couldn't find it to go to Old San Juan but all and all I will give this hotel a good review and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel during Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Caribe Hilton for one night (December 20-21) prior to departing for our Carnival cruise leaving out of San Juan. The lobby is open air, and check-in was pretty painless. Even though we had arrived a little earlier than check-in time, they had a room ready for us, and we quickly threw on clothing more suitable for the tropical climate, and went out to venture the grounds. The grounds were beautiful, and we ate a quick lunch at the little cafe right on the beach. There were lots of birds around, but food came out quickly and was delicious. We didn't get to see much else of the resort because we went back to the room and fell asleep shortly after that. We ordered room service the next morning (omlettes and fruit) and waiting down in the lobby until it was time to take a cab to the pier to board our ship. We waited in the lobby for about two hours because we knew we could not board the ship yet, and utilized the free internet access on my laptop--definitely a plus! If we ever come back to San Juan, we will stay here. The room was classic, and the carpet was tasteful and distinctly Caribbean. The bed and pillows were fantastic--no wonder we fell asleep so early! Our quick stay was great, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Don`t bother. worst service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: odeand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The worst 2 nights of my life i think. First they couldnt find my booking. Then we got one room instead of two that i had ordered and paid for. Then it was wrong and we had to get new rooms and so on.. we used 5 hours of our time just to wait at the hotel to decide what room we would have. The staff was rude and not helpful. I paid 2000 dollars for two nights and would have felt better wiping my a.. with it then giving it to the hilton caribe. We also stayed at hotel milano in old san juan and that was a perfect hotel. I don`t know how they have got 4 stars it should have been one or two. Never again caribe hilton. Never again *Hilton hotel. I am shocked by the bad service. And they charge 14% service charge for no reason.. waste of money

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: NEBeachbunny
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on priceline for this hotel, less than $100 per night, so had I paid over $200 I would have had a much harder time swallowing how expensive everything is at the hotel for drinks/food, etc. But I did really enjoy the room, the bed was very comfortable and I slept better than I do at a lot of caribbean/mexico hotels. Also, I thought I would not like the beach, being small and blocked from waves, but the waves were so large that I was glad we had a little protection while I was there. Sand not the bright white I am used to but it was still a pretty quaint beach, good for relaxing swims. Everything else was good. I enjoyed the pina colada club, the new restaurant on site, which is a good, cheaper option for dinner if you don't feel like spending $100 each. The people in this restaurant were very friendly and welcoming, so I spent a lot of time there at nights. Also went to the dragonfly in Old San Juan and it was $$$ but super delicious! Great atmosphere and vibe and the food was to die for. I still am thinking about that meal. Get a good deal on this hotel and it will definitely make a difference in your views. I had a great time and enjoyed the grounds a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: RocketmanMC
Reviews.Content: We went to the Caribe Hilton for a long weekend getaway. The hotel lobby is amazing! The lobby is open to the outside environment with no doors or windows to the outside. Upon check-in the hotel staff gave us our keys and directions to our room. The room was very clean and top-notch, everything you would expect from a $260 per night room: 3rd floor, with balcony and garden view. They also had a nice empty fridge in the room which was perfect for drinks and snacks that we purchased at a drugstore down the street (Walgreens). This hotel has 4 awesome pools (1 pool bar). The pools were clean and the towels and chairs are nice. The hot tubs are luke warm at best which was a little bit of a let down but being at this hotel and resort is like heaven. You can snorkel right at the very calm beach swimming area and the fish are awesome! Expensive Extras: A drink or food at any of the hotel bars is extremely extremely expensive. $12 mixed drink, $8 beer, $12 hamburger, etc. Also everyone is charged a 14% resort fee for use of the pool and beach on a daily basis. They include the use of towels but you have to pay for use of kids floats ($10/hour), kayaks & peddle boats($25/half hour). You can lay on an outside bed near the beach for ($35/day) and they are always empty because who is spending that kind of money? We felt like they were kind of milking you for more money every time we turned around. Those things should all be included in your "resort fee". Food: We ended up walking to Ashford Avenue each night for dinner (10 minute walk at a very slow pace). There you will find 4 and 5 star restaurants and very reasonable prices. People dress nicely for dinner there so men wear khaki pants and a collar shirt. One final note is that we were not impressed with the hotel staff. The cleaning ladies were really nice and did a really super job but the rest of the workers were not helpful. The concierge never picked up his phone when we called and when we asked him questions or directions in person he was really only minimally helpful. I could get that kind of service from calling India #411 on my cell phone and asking them for help. This hotel caters to business people who mostly keep to themselves and focus on their laptops and blackberries. It is a family friendly place but don't expect too much from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: Bklynmom
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Caribe Hilton. The beach is small but was not crowded and the water was clean,beautiful and calm enough so that our 10 year old daughter could easily swim alone. The pool area was very nice and close enough so that she could go from the beach to the pool. Be aware that the hotel does charge a daily resort fee and 14% tax on top of the rate, and also charges $15 for self parking and $20 for valet parking. We rented a car and drove to the rain forest, which was beautiful. We also went to Old San Juan for dinner several nights. Parking in Old San Juan is extremely difficult - it's probably easier to take a cab. The hotel gives free beach toys to kids, but charges $10 a day for rafts - if you think your kids will want one, pack it! They also have a free non alcoholic mini pina colada at 1:00 every afternoon and free fruit flavored water in the lobby. The lobby is very pretty - open and breezy with parrots in a cage for entertainment. They also have an area with ducks, peacocks and a koi pond, and free miniature golf for the kids. The Hilton Towers rooms have terraces with nice ocean views and new bathrooms. We found the restaurants that we ate in at the hotel to be quite good: the Pina Colada room for a quick dinner; the Italian restaurant was delicious, contrary to the reviews; and the breakfast buffet was good with a large selection - it is served up until 11:30 so you can have that for brunch if you are a late riser (it is a bit expensive at $26, but kids are free). The poolside bar & grill food is also decent and the prices are what you would expect for a hotel. There is a Subways right outside the hotel if you want a quick sandwich, and you can also walk over the bridge to Condado if you wish - its about a 10 minute walk, where there is the Conrad Hilton with a small casino and other restaurants. There is not much else within the area around the Caribe Hilton, however I would definitely not call the area around it a slum whatsoever, as other reviewers have stated! Everyone we met in San Juan was very nice and helpful - and we kept getting lost and asking directions. We did see a few homeless people in the streets, but we are from New York City, so I guess we are immune to it. One complaint was that I found the concierges at the hotel to not be as helpful as I would expect - the driving directions they gave every time were vague, and they never printed out anything on mapquest or google. Considering that the signs were all in a foreign language it made it even more difficult to get around, but after a few days we were fine. The rainforest (El Yunuque) was beautiful and definitely worth seeing - not necessary to take a tour if you have a car, just drive there, park and hike on one of the trails - it's amazing. Also, Old San Juan is a beautiful historic place to see, and CafÃ© Berlin was a great restaurant there (especially if you are a vegetarian but they have meat also)! The main thing missing at the Hilton was a casino, but you can't have everything. All in all, a very relaxing, low key place for a vacation - would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful well kept property”
Reviews.Author: thorntree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre and post cruise through Priceline. Even at the very low prices we paid we were upgraded to the Villas. We stayed in rooms 7110 (the same number as our room on the ship) and 7311.. Both exceeded our expectations.The grounds, pool area and beach are beautiful. I do not share earlier reviews that this place is showing its age or is rundown, as it is showing its class of having evolved over the past 60 years and as the first Hilton outside the continental US. The prpoerty is on a 17 acre site at the beginning of a Penninsula leading to Old San Juan. On each side of the property are remnants from an old Spanish Fort dating back over 500 years or so. We were able to check in following our cruise at 10:00 am which was a real plus. Our only negative housekeeping issue was that the Everyready bunny in our TV remote died and we had to wait over 1/2 hour to get a new remote. There were 2 other negatives from our stays the first of which can not be blamed on the Hilton. The weather was not sunny for either of our stays which is quite unusual in that we only had 1 previous bad weather day in our last 7 visits to San Juan at this time of the year. Second I concur with the previous reviews that the prices for food and drink were excessive, even in the Starbucks. We ate at the bar on each of our 2 nights and I had the bacon cheeseburger and fries with a beer for $16 which is only a little overpriced, My wife had shrimp and iced tea which at $4.75 per glass (no free refills) was a bit high. The alternatives which many guests seem to do is the $12 or $15 dollar cab ride each way to either Old San Juan or Condado each of which areas is loaded with a variety of normally priced restaurants. There is a Subway and 2 convenience stores just outside the entrance to the resort/. We were able to buy pop, water and Orange Juice for 1/2 the price charged at the Starbucks inside the Hilton. While the Starbucks at $6 for a bagel and coffee is a reasonable alternative to the $26 buffet breakfast it is still too much. While the pool food was pricey you were paying for the convenience. The hotels Asian and Italian restaurants seemed to do very little business at the prices they charged. The bar area could be rocking and full but for the $10 and up drinks and overpriced food. With reasonable prices they could take advantage of accomodating the 800 guests and even have people coming there to eat and drink from outside the hotel instead of leaving there to eat and drink elsewhere. Oh what a shakeup in the food and drink prices could do for this place. They could easily be on there way to a 5 ***** star rating and be the top hotel destination in San Juan with such a shakeup.

Reviews.Title: “Family had a great time at the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: greenbeltdan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Caribe Hilton about 10 times, and this was the best experience I've had there by far. Don't get me wrong - it's not perfect - the comments on the overpriced food and drink, dirty windows obstructing the incredible ocean views, staff who couldn't care less are all accurate. I booked the spa vacation package for my wife and I, and the treatment that we received at the spa and the fitness center outweighed all the negatives. The location is great - I prefer it to Condado and to Old San Juan as it's isolated enough to be private yet close enough to all the attractions. I stayed on a few extra days after putting my wife and son on the plane, and she was in tears - not because she was going to miss me, but she was going to miss the Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: cr230
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a four day trip at the Caribe Hilton and had a great overall experience. Our room was located in the Hilton Honors tower and was very comfortable with fantastic views of the ocean and Old San Juan (great rates too!). Coming from Manhattan we were not overly shocked at the high prices of resort drinks and food (pretty standard for Caribbean), so we would go into Old San Juan for dinner where you will find more wallet-friendly and fantastic Puerto rican food. Overall the pool scene was nice (never had a problem finding a chair), the gym is great and very modern (lots of new treadmills and ellipticals), and the beach while small was perfect for a four day trip away from cold NYC temps. The location of the Caribe Hilton is just a quick cab ride or bus ride away from Old San Juan and much more conveniently located than the Ritz Carlton (where we usually stay). Please do not hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else if you can do more research”
Reviews.Author: Treker2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a last minute trip somewhere hot. P. Rico fits that bill in January. High 80's everyday. The pool area is beautiful but the strange towel procedure the hotel practices changes everyday. The rooms are OK but everything seemed dusty. The patio window was never cleaned and for a $200 a night hotel, I think that's crazy. I mean the view is amazing, but looking thru a dirty window isn't. The room decor needs to be updated. The people they hire don't seem sure about anything. The conceriege gave us different info everyday, and we were asking the same question. You need a car to get anywhere. Parking is exspensive. The food and drink you order near the pool is incredibly tastless and exspensive. Second day we went to the grocery and got cheese, meats, breads and breakfast stuff to tide us over. We also bought beer and would go to the room, pour it in a plastic cup and take it back down to the pool. The coffee issue is just WRONG. You can make coffee in the room, but I don't trust who uses the machine before me. So walk down to the lobby and get raped by Starbucks. We discoverd the Subway 2 minutes from the lobby offers a decent brew for 1.40. (double). The Dorado area is where the action's at, so stay there if you want food & sites. Otherwise if you just want the pool and view, this is good but not worth the 200.

Reviews.Title: “If you paid full price, you overpaid”
Reviews.Author: globeseeker007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a day before our Caribbean cruise. The hotel is not in a great location when one compares it to the location of the Sheraton in Old San Juan. The place is huge and the restaurants are expensive. However, they will hold your luggage for you for a few hours after you check out. We pricelined this hotel and got it for $100 plus tax. Upon checking in, we found out that a resort fee is added to your bill. It you paid full price for a night here, you overpaid as the room we were in was not really worth the price we paid. it did have a small balcony and a fantastic view. We have stayed at cheaper hotels in the states which were nicer and had a continental breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! This was a horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: littleribbit
Reviews.Content: Let's see where do I begin? They lost my car in the parking garage. Sure these things happen, no one is perfect. However, after waiting for 30 minutes for someone to bring my car around, I addressed the issue with the staff. WOW! The men who handled the baggage said it wasn't their concern, and then starting laughing at my group the longer we waited. I brought the matter up to the hotel manager, and was told to go wait on the corner for my car. After 15 minutes, I approached him again, and he said in an abrasive shout "let me do my job", so I waited another 10 minutes, then decided to go looking for my car on my own. I found it within 5 minutes. If you enjoy not having your room ready, being treated like garbage by hotel staff, and paying $5.00 for a 12 oz coffee, this place is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice mid-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: open2travel
Reviews.Content: For all the people who wrote bad reviews...you paid too much! I price lined this hotel and got a great deal. I guess that's why I was able to enjoy myself. The location is prime for going out...it's centrally located, but far enough away from the hubbub to be calm. With the only private beach in San Juan, the beach area is very very small. But if all you care about is having sand between your toes, it's worth it to go to this hotel, because you won't get it anywhere else. Nice grounds...beautiful tennis courts with free racquet and ball rental. Nice pool with plenty of chairs and hammocks to laze around in. The hotel is somewhat commercial...the rooms are uninspired and the grounds are pretty small, but it's a nice little hotel to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Disappointing service, cleanliness, and function for the price”
Reviews.Author: DMackster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton as part of a convention. Brought my wife along because we'd never been to San Juan and the accomodations sounded nice - its a Hilton, right? Well, yes and no. Started off needing a new room because the walk out door in first floor room they put us in (7113) did not lock. Unacceptable. Called and requested a new room. I was told they would have to call engineering because the hotel was at capacity. I declined that offer and said I wanted a new room. They said to wait in the room and they would call back. 30 minutes later - no call. I decided to call the "special" hotel manager number we were given at check-in in a welcome packet. Low and behold the "special" manager number just rang and rang - for 15 Miniutes! Finally fed up, I went back to the front desk and demanded an new room. The obliged and we moved. Room was OK. Carpet in needed repalced in both rooms. We were put in the Villas section (which is a long and initially confusing walk from the check-in.) Room did have nice large bathrooms with walk-in shower and garden bathtub. Big annoyance was that the toile ran constantly. Even tried to fix it myself with limited luck. Floors were recently re-tiled, which was nice - but on par with everything else at the Caribe Hilton, they failed to adjust the doors when they tiled the floor. So, when you opened the door it came to a screeching halt about half-way open and you either had to step around the jammed/wedged door or step back and hit it like a linebacker to get it to open. Food and drink at the restauraunts were ridiculously overpriced (as to be expected at a Hilton) and merely OK at BEST. Just a really crappy and disappointing experience. The joke at my conference table was "So what doesnt work in your room" About the only thing i didn't have a complaint about was the pool.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laurenmcg
Reviews.Content: Worst stay anywhere, we got a great deal on Priceline and should have stayed anywhere else. When I say expensive, I mean 12 dollar pina coladas, with very little rum, 18 dollar hamburgers that are burnt straight through, and Mortons was a nightmare. Our waiter was too busy watching a football game to bring us water, menus, the food we ordered, we left before we got anything past appetizers, and had to go to the bar to pay......after two hours. Internet was 14.95$ a night, to use in your room, I was again greatly disappointed that I had to pay for EVEN MORE that should be included. The beach was man made, small, yellow harsh sand. The snorkel gear was 25 dollars to use for 1 hour, so we didn't see the man made breakers......not a big miss Im sure. It is a 15 dollar cab ride into OSJ, about, sometimes 12, sometimes 14.....but we were stuck for a while at the horrible hotel because both ATMs were out of money....it was a busy festival weekend and no cab would stop at an atm on the way, traffic was backed up for the entire way. Things we didnt want to bother with on a vacation. The consierge knew nothing about getting to Fajardo, he told us it would be 150$ and that no cab would take us early.......so on the way to rent a car, our cab driver set us straight and told us anyone will take you for 80$......the cab drivers are your best friends....especially if youre staying at the Hilton......crap, stay elsewhere. OR...go to Vieques, Villa Coral was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay...Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Drzhivago123
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, we upgraded to an ocean view room with balcony. The room was comfortable with a good size bathroom, comfortable beds, and a nice view of the ocean. Complaints about the room: the air conditioner would sometimes rattle which wasn't good when you're trying to sleep; the ocean view rooms in our tower (honors tower I think) all faced the front side of the hotel which is where the lobby and a busy street are so it was fairly noisy most of the time. The rest of the hotel grounds were very attractive. Other posts stating how expensive it is are exactly right. First day there I went up to the pool bar and ordered two Pina Colodas which were served in a small 10-12oz plastic cup, and with a 15% tip I paid over $32. The beach area is sheltered with rocks and bulkeds from the waves so beyond going for a dip there's not much to do in the water. There wasn't much in the way of activities. The pool was just ok. Not sure I liked the layout much. Overall it was an ok stay. The last three days of our trip we rented a car and drove to Fajardo and took the ferry over to Culebra Island. This was the best part of the trip and I wish we would have stayed a few more days there. It had more of a laid back vacation feel, the people were more friendly, and the snorkeling and Flamenco beach were great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!”
Reviews.Author: IfiiN
Reviews.Content: Caribe Hilton es Mui Bueno. Over five restaurants, beautiful beach front, swimming pools, bird sanctuary (rain forest), etc. lots of activities

Reviews.Title: “Great Setting, but...”
Reviews.Author: Shariland
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at Caribe Hilton in San Juan. Some pros & cons: The grounds have suffered some damage and have not been repaired, i.e., the bridge to the beautiful round deck is broken, and it's the best place to sunbathe. Also the big iceberg is gone. When I went into the lagoon I felt little stinging things all over my legs, but the people at the towel desk said they didn't know what I was talking about. (Another guest told me she experienced the same thing). If the weather is good, the pool/beach area is the main draw for this hotel. If it's not nice, there's not much in the area to do. Oh, a big disappointment was the mojito at the pool bar. Last time I was there it was the best mojito I've ever had. Now they don't even use fresh mint, blaming "their supplier." Funny, every other bar I went to had fresh mint, including the Pina Colada Club on the Hilton property. At $12 it the pool bar version was a rip off. The first room we stayed in, which was considered an upgrade because my friend is a Hilton Club member, was pretty tired and in need of renovation. And the A/C didn't work properly. We then moved to the Garden Tower, which is renovated and quite nice. Last time I stayed in the Villas, which was also newly renovated and pleasant, altho a bit of a walk to the pool area if that's a problem for you. A couple of the restaurants were closed the entire time. Because there really isn't much nearby this hotel except a Subway (it's a bit isolated) this could be a problem. We ate a lot of meals at the casual & friendly Pina Colada Club on the property. The manager Marcus and the entire staff are very friendly and it's a pleasure to hang out there. Good salads, mahi tacos, and mojitos (with fresh mint). Also used the fitness center, which is clean & well equipped. All in all, I enjoyed the Caribe more during a previous stay. Part of this was weather-related (it rained a lot this time). Also, it's a better bargain if you get it thru Hotwire. They charge a 14% resort fee, which pushes the price up pretty high. We took the bus (75 cents) to the Mariott Stalaris one night. The Tuscany Restaurant there had an excellent $20 prix fixe dinner. Nothing like that at the Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “Large, family-friendly, money-sucking machine”
Reviews.Author: JB_Boston
Reviews.Content: Summary: This is a large, well-run, self-contained, corporate-efficient machine. Pros: - Well designed, well-staffed, efficient. - Has it's own beach. NOTE: If you want to lay on the beach, go down and get your towels from the towel stand EARLY - 7:30 or 8am - and put them on the lounge chairs you want. Only _then_ go get breakfast, etc. You must stake your ground early, or you won't have a chair. Note the beach is self-contained. You can't walk several miles up and down a long beach; the pictures show a lagoon - and that's what you get. - Several large pools. However, think large with lots of people in them - including kids. If you're squeamish about water, think carefully. - "Good enough" food, though nothing really remarkable, IMHO. We only ate breakfasts, and a lunch or two here. - Family-friendly. They have ways to keep kids of all ages happy and busy. It's very safe. I'd not hesitate a moment to bring children from infants through early-teens, and would let my 8-14 year olds run free. Well-staffed, responsible staff does a good job. - Free WiFi in the lobby area. - Fun to learn that the Pina Colada was invented by the bartender here in 1954. Cons: - There isn't anything cheap. A very standard-ish buffet breakfast is $30/person. Drinks are $15 and up. - LOTS of guests. This hotel can hold a lot of people, and it's evident. Never do you feel like you're in a hotel with any kind of exclusive feel; it's a machine. There's _just_ enough room for all of them when sunbathing, but you won't get your choice of locale (unless you stake it very early), and you'll be chair-to-chair with those next to you. - Long taxi lines in the evenings. Plan on waiting 15 minutes to get one. And you're likely to share a van-taxi with 3-6 other people. No fare-sharing - all of you will pay full fare. It's $12 to either the Condado area or to Old Town San Juan. Both are walkable - but plan on a 30-45 minute walk. - Did I say it already? LOTS of guests. - Internet in the room is $15/day. - You pretty much must take a taxi either to the Condado or to old San Juan if you don't want to eat on-site. There's nothing nearby. So you tend to go there, and stay there. - Very standard, cheesy resort-style atriums, and cheesy steel drum music throughout (and live). We were fine with our stay? Yes. This hotel does what it does, just fine. But all in all, though my wife and I will probably be back to San Juan, we won't be back to this Hilton; not because isn't a hotel that does _it's_ job badly; but because it's just not our type of hotel. We'd rather have the more boutique hotel with a very neon-lit finish, contemporary lounge music, and a very chi-chi / chic, jet-setter feel, or a villa or condo-hotel room. I'm going to put "No" on recommend a hotel to friend, because my friends would look for the same kind of boutique hotel I would. But I wouldn't necessarily say NO for all other people. If you're looking for a place to take a family, and like getting somewhere and staying put, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Layover pre/post 14 day Caribbean Princess cruise”
Reviews.Author: rcinsacca
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, exceptional service, convenient, and great location! Shop for good price on villa towers short walk from the main hotel towers with private pool, jaccuzzi(sp), & very close to LemonGrass (i think), a yummy & nice latin/asian fusion restaurant on the property. (Morton's is also available, as well as 2-3 other options)...

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sultan213
Reviews.Content: Every hotel/resort is not without its faults with the exception of those in the "Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous". We've been regulars at this property since 2003 and what makes this resort truly great, to me, is that they've managed to retain the great 1950s & 1960s Caribbean atmosphere with the modern amenities of the new century. Yes, there are still rooms that smell musty, have old carpets, old bathrooms and they are being refurbished. The hotel is working on those. One stay, during one of those refurbishments, we were in the new tower with the hammer drills working 9 to 5 - VERY, VERY frustrating. But, the overall atmosphere is excellent, rooms are spacious and clean, the pool is great, the protected lagoon is fantastic and the beach sitting areas have something for everyone. When you first check-in the lobby, which is the entire ground floor with a totally open plan all the way to the pool and the beach beyond is impressive and the sea breezes feel good - even in the summer. There is a great work out pavilion with a floor to ceiling glass wall facing the sea. The garden area is worth visiting (I like to rooms facing it): a secluded spot with very nice walks in the lush landscaping, the sea walk and pier, especially at night, lets you look at large fish coming in to feed. There's no casino but, take a 15 minute walk (or short cab ride) to the condado, enjoy the casinos there plus take in some of the flavors of San Juan and then cab it back. Old San Juan is a 5 to 10 minute cab ride in the other direction. The restaurants and bar is expensive so think about eating out now and then. It is not up to par with the Ritz-Carlton but I prefer its location, beach and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I was there right now!”
Reviews.Author: mnp19148
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! We arrived in the early afternoon before checkin and we told that our room was not yet ready. However we were promptly escorted to the changing facilities so that we could freshen up and change to go to the pool. The pool was so nice and the service so friendly, we ended up staying all afternoon and didn't check in to our room until 4 hours later!! :-) Our room was in the Hilton Honors tower. The room itself was very nice; however, the views from the tower do leave something to be desired. It is located behind the original building so you pretty much look down at the roof of the hotel. BUT the room was clean and comfortable and our rate included the buffet breakfast , which was also very good. The location of the hotel does have its pros and cons, the pro is that it is very secluded and quiet (it's far enough away from the airport that you don't hear the planes taking off and landing, which can be a problem in many SJU hotels). The con is that its far enough away from everything that it will cost you $10 - $20 in cab fare when you want to leave the hotel. All in all, we had an extremely relaxing vacation at the Caribe Hilton. I hope to stay there again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Lizzeh
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic, friendly staff, outstanding facilities. Very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reviews overstate the problems--Good for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: seasonal-jamaican
Reviews.Content: OK, you're in San Juan, not an isolated part of the world. It's New Year's week and snow is piling up throughout the East Coast. Yes, it will be crowded. Those expecting empty beaches will be greatly disappointed. But, they have many lounge chairs, and a security guard doing his best to keep the beach for hotel guests. Packed like sardines, maybe, but in nice surroundings and with many pools. The original hotel must have been stunning 40 years ago. Still in good shape. Many restaurant choices here, but expensive. Coming from a East Coast city environment you're well served to remember that nobody here moves quickly. Too much sun or whatever, but if you're looking for fast service don't come to this island. Neighborhood is way better than average. Any complaints here are exaggerated. So what do you have--a busy hotel on a beautiful beach 10 minutes from a busy airport in the Caribbean. Temps in the 80s in December. Certainly not pampering. More like Grand Central at 8 am on Tuesday. If you are looking for peace and quiet go to Bermuda. Just bring your jacket in December. Come to Puerto Rico for what it is and you will go away happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and location but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: FayeJ42
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Caribe at about 5 pm. It took us 45 minutes to get a key for one room. The second room was not ready until 7 pm. The first key that we got was to an occupied room. My husband literally walked into a room with a guest in the bathroom â€“ it frightened both of them. It took another 20 minutes to re-check in. The next day, my sister checked in quickly, but her key did not work and she had to return to the lobby. That night, there was a plumbing leak and we had to change rooms in the middle of the night with 2 kids. I have stayed at Hilton Hotels all over the world and never had such bad service. This was really a shame because the pools, beach, gym and location are almost perfect! At night you can go out to the hotel's small pier and see sharks swimming in to the reef - very cool! The hotel gym is awesome. The beach and pool are superb for kids. You can walk to Old Town in about 30 minutes. The hotel restaurants are good but VERY expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - hate to write a bad review but...”
Reviews.Author: Singerstravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in February and it was wonderful. This last visit in December will definitely be our last. We had to visit the front desk not twice but three times upon arrival as our key cards would not work for our room. Our "villa" was one of the new rooms in the furthest tower. Very nice indeed but nothing worked. We called about no air conditioning and no hot water. No response for 7 hours. The front desk is useless and has no remorse with helping the situation. We eventually got a manager to our room and after minutes if negotiatons... We got 50% off one night and keys for a new room. The pool is beautiful if it's all open! They typically close off the beach and grass areas due to bad weather so then the lawn chairs that are available are all reserved by 8:30am. People are packed in like sardines. Expensive food/drink go along with it all. Sure the Pina Colada was born here but for $13 each???? I don't think so. Best kept secret is the Mortons Steakhouse that is in the lobby. Great "Power Hour" (5:00-6:30pm) specials like $2.25 oyesters, $4 beer, $ 7wine and other half off appetizers! if you like walking- only 20 min walk to old San Juan. Eat at Raices and get the mofongo!

Reviews.Title: “For every plus there is a minus...”
Reviews.Author: KristenK1979
Reviews.Content: For the record, I LOVE the Caribe Hilton. I've stayed here three times in the last five years, and I'm loyal to the Hilton brand. That said, to put it bluntly, the Caribe Hilton is overpriced and the service sucks, but has the best location on the island and is absolutely gorgeous. If you are looking for service, this isn't the place. Every time I've stayed here I've had a problem, from being erroneously overcharged $800 to ordering room service and it never being delivered. But you can walk to Old San Juan (approx 1 mile), and if you don't want to explore any further, you could get away with not renting a car or renting a car for a day from the car rental place right outside the hotel. The older man that works there is super cool and prices about $50/day if you want to take a day trip to Luqillo, El Junque, or Fajardo. You can also eat at the Subway on the corner or walk to Old San Juan for El Jibarito (ask the bellmen) for a much more reasonably priced meal than you can get at the hotel. I'm getting off topic :) In a nutshell: The Pluses of the Caribe Hilton: GREAT location, beautiful grounds, delicious food, every amenity, infinity pools & spas, no car needed, close to Old San Juan & cruise ships, Starbucks in the morning. Bellmen are really friendly and helpful, skip the concierge and ask them questions about the local area instead, BUT TIP THEM TOO. The Minuses: Below-aveage service as a whole, including the front-desk staff, pool staff, waitstaff, and housekeeping. HORRIBLE concierge and activity staff. Room service was ordered but never arrived. We were overcharged -- LOOK OVER YOUR BILL CAREFULLY. It seems by the way the staff handled it that this was a regular occurrence. So if service is your thing, skip it. I only stay at the Caribe Hilton if I can get it for less than $150, otherwise it's not worth it. But if you can get a good rate, service isn't your thing, and you just want to lay around a gorgeous pool, swim in a protected ocean bay, walk to downtown shopping and dining, this is the place for you. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here as a last resort.”
Reviews.Author: borrego1985
Reviews.Content: Although we got 4 nights for the price of 2 ($487 for 4 nights, not exactly cheap), it wasn't worth it. The hotel is located in a slum with no alternatives nearby for dining or convenience store items. A Subway was it, and it was marginally clean. Minimum $12 cab ride to Old San Juan. The bus is possible but very dirty. Dining at the Hilton was out of the question. $26 for breakfast? Crazy. They didn't replace our used towels, we had to call and ask, same for TP. TV in the room was of such poor quality that we could hardly watch it. Free wi-fi in lobby only. Even the lobby Starbucks didn't have wi-fi. There was no courtesy transportation at all. Stay anywhere but here. I would never stay there again, or even go to Puerto Rico again. What a dump!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay was a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Zabka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our cruise. This hotel is directly on the beach and our room was overlooking the sea. It was very nice surprise as our room was large with two queen beds and balcony, on the 11th floor. We did not eat at this hotel but their cocktail menu looked good. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed staying at this hotel but the Spa is not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: cmeru51
Reviews.Content: There have been a fair amount of negative comments about this hotel, but I certainly do not agree with any of them. I travel about 150 days a year for business, so I have certain expectations when staying in hotels. This hotel more than met my expectations. We had a great room with a beautiful view. The pool area and beach area is very nice. Beautiful landscaping and very friendly staff. The breakfast buffet is very, very good with a very nice selection of food. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The one issue that I have is with the bedding. The beds are typical Hilton beds with very heavy, covered comforters and a feather bed under the bottom sheet. It was 91 degrees when we were there. I had to keep the A/C on 65 just to keep from sweating in bed. What a waste of electricity. I wonder why this has become the standard of comfortable beds even in tropical locations. The SPA, which apparently is privately owned, had some issues. The level of service was inconsistent. Three of us had facials and each treatment was very different with one of our party receiving the bare minimum of service with her facial. The person giving the facial left the room for long periods during what was supposed to be an hour treatment. I would not recommend this Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Larryort
Reviews.Content: This sprawling resort has some history behind it. The "Pina Colada" was invented there! As soon as we checked in we hit the "Atlantico" poolside bar to drink in the nostalgia. I must say I've had better, but it wasn't a lousy experience. We loved the pier that extended into the private beach area where you could lounge. The pools and landscaping were also lovely. The room was recently renovated and had a great bed, a nice size bathroom as well as a 32" plasma TV. I would recommend you ask for a room away form the elevator so you don't experience the excessive hallway traffic noise in the early AM. We also discovered that they have a "Morton's Steak House" there that offers great Happy hour specials. I don't know if it only was a "recession special", but check it out if you're going there soon! All in all we felt well treated by the staff and enjoyed every minute of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great ammenities, not great rooms”
Reviews.Author: KeithRusso
Reviews.Content: Great place to relax during the cold winter months. Fun for the whole family. Spectacular views of the Atlantic while you frolic in the comfort of the pool drinking a pina colada. Everything you could ask for in a fun Caribbean vacation. Depending on when you travel to the Caribe Hilton plays a part, as we were there at an off peak time and it felt like a ghost town. The pool and lagoon and quite amazing, and worth the trip alone. Also, the hammocks out back by the ocean and perfect for some quiet time. On the negative side, the rooms in the main building leave a lot to be desired. The carpet looks like it has not been changed since the Kennedy administration. And you basically get the same room for what you pay for at a Holiday Inn. Nothing special. Be careful around the surrounding areas as at night it is quite desolate and dark. All in all, the grounds of the hotel make up for what it lacks in room accommodations. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Hernando33
Reviews.Content: Hotel was only a few miles from airport. Renting a car is a must so u can explore. Hotel was clean and rooms were spacious. We had a 6th floor ocean view room and the view was really amazing. Fridge in the room which is a must when u have a 3 year old. There is a Mortons at the hotel - we ate there twice. Two other restaurants at the hotel but we didn't eat at either. Hotel food and drinks were quite pricey but I already knew this from people reviews. There is a subway (the sandwich shop)a short 5 minute walk away so we ate this one day by the pool. that night we drove down 187 and stopped at one of the little shacks that was cooking food on the side of the road. Yummy!! The 2nd full day we drove to El Yunque National Forest - this is a must. Be sure to have coco frio and coco helado!!!!! Stop on the side of 187 in luquillo at a row of restaurants/shacks. We ate at #52 and it was wonderful!!!! Then walked out back for a quick dip in the ocean. The hotel has a starbucks which is nice and the inside bar makes a wonderful piÃ±a colada and mojito. We liked PR so much we will probably return for a roadtrip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced food and lousy service”
Reviews.Author: kmcnai01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and the beach / pool area is very clean. However, the restaurants (with the exception of the Asian) are overpriced for what they offer. Do not go to the Italian restaurant - I do not think the chef has probably been to Italy! The service at Breakfast needs to significantly improve but the buffet is good. The rooms have recently been refurbished and are in good order. The fitness centre is very good though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, room, and pools but food and bar tabs”
Reviews.Author: Chase71
Reviews.Content: My g/f and I stayed together the night before a cruise. the Caribe is a Puerto Rico classic. Its beautiful, timeless, and a very pleasant site to see after hours of travel. Arrive during the day time. The rooms are well appointed. Lobby beautiful. And the pools; for the first time guest the Caribe's beachfront pools are quite a site to see. Unfortunately there was a downside. This hotel's bars and food are very expensive. We sat at a pool side bar and ordered two rounds of drinks for us and a couple of simple snack food items like a couple of sandwiches. for that alone our check was close to dinner for two at a higher end steak house back home. Later that night we sat for an hour at best at the inner bar near the lobby relaxing and enjoying the music. After three rounds of drinks we had a $80.00 tab. I understand that hotel property restaurants and bars tend to run higher. But the Caribe's casual food and drink is very expensive and I'd watch your tab closely if you chose to wine and dine there. If you are hungry grab a taxi over to old San Juan and experience the highly recommended dining choices there. Afterwards you can go to a nearby pub as well and relax and save a lot of money. The hotel taxi stand attendents can make good recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrw11
Reviews.Content: Service from check-in to check-out was great. Any issues were attended to immediately by staff. Room was large and luxurious - high quality finish and features. Looked over gardens. Beds were incredibly comfortable and room was spotlessly clean. No problems at all. Location is a bit away from the Old town but the resort is really designed to be a destination in itself - own beach, etc. Beach and pool area is great. My only complaint would be that aside from Starbucks, there is not really any eateries at the hotel that I would consider affordable on a day to day basis. People staying more than a day or two should consider that. Also should note that this hotel is currently rated as 3 star not 4 by the Puerto Rico Tourism authority.

Reviews.Title: “a fun place to have a relaxation”
Reviews.Author: janeleeuf
Reviews.Content: It's a fun place, with ocean frontview, beach and nice pool. From the room, you can even see the historical something. Tropical garden, particularly the recreation area are just gorgeous. It's a fun place. If I have to have a complain, I think they shouldn't charge additional service fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Robert76
Reviews.Content: This hotel has received some mixed reviews. However, I had a really great time there, with no complaints. I think it's a great place to stay for a couple of nights before or after a cruise, or even longer. The hotel itself is set in beautiful grounds which are well tended. It has a nice beach (it's not like the beach on smaller Caribbean islands, but I don't reckon you'd get any better in San Juan). It also has a really lovely pool and pool area around them. The breakfast was superb. I ate in the restaurant two evenings - it was quite pricey, but then again this is a 4 star hotel. Food nice. I travelled alone and didn't feel uncomortable in the Caribe - the hotel was full and had a certain buzz about it which was great. The hotel is about a 40 min walk away from old San Juan which is nice to look around. Cost from airport in cab is $22 and only 15-20 mins. If I was picking up a cruise again in San Juan and I would definitely return to the Caribe Hilton. As an added bonus, it is where the Pina Colada was invented! So they are freely available, and great! If a little pricey! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Satisfied, however bring your wallet !!!”
Reviews.Author: CPT_DirtyPHIL
Reviews.Content: Here is a QUICK recap: Positives: Hotel Staff was great, food was good, rooms were clean and view was great. Breakfast buffet was great, however PRICEY. Negatives: EXPENSIVE, EXPENSIVE, EXPENSIVE. After recently traveling to Mexico and South Africa, I was amazed how expensive this place was. Puerto Rico itself was moderately priced, however this hotel was EXPENSIVE. My GF and I shared food at AsIan restaurant --appetizer, fried rice and pasta + 2 drinks each cost $100. YES, foo-foo drinks were $12 each. Go to pool bar and drink coors light for $5 each. Location was OK. Although it was located In the middle of Old San Juan and Condado, you needed a taxi to get to either location. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Spent a few hours before our flight”
Reviews.Author: Three Island Virgins USVI
Reviews.Content: We got off a Royal Caribbean cruise with some friends and got a room for the day before our flight later that afternoon so my review will be first impressions. Likes: Location, pool area, beach area, grounds, clean updated room, shops, Dislikes: Price of drinks ($12 for small bloody mary), worn outdoor furniture, smoking only by the water, pool bar opens after 11:00 am, check in/check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: butter
Reviews.Content: Back in October, my husband & I went to Caribe Hilton with our 10 month old and our 3.5 year old for a long weekend. I would say that the Caribe Hilton is great for a family vacation. The hotel is very family-friendly. Kids eat free (I can't remember if it was for ages 5 and under or 10 and under). There is a kiddie pool, a playground, great gardens, a pier where you can feed fish - they even leave out bread for you to feed the fish. The towel hut had beach toys to borrow so you didn't have to buy or bring your own with you. We had called the concierge in advance and they recommended a babysitting service so that two of the night, my husband & I could go out on our own. As Hilton Honors Gold level members, we received vouchers for free continental breakfasts or we could upgrade to the full buffet for $11 each. Our hotel room, while nothing special, was fine and the mini-fridge was empty so we could store our own food in there - especially for the baby. The sundry store downstairs had yogurt and snacks, and even a cute floatie for just $8 that we used there and were able to bring home for future use. We also got lunch from the Subway one of the days - it is a just off the hotel premises and a quick walk. I loved the pool area, except that I wished the different levels of the pool were somehow attacghed so that you didn't need to get out of the water to go from one to the other. My 3.5 yr old fell in love with the "food pool" where the swim-up bar was. It was so hot when we were there that we really just sat in that pool for 2 hours straight and it was great. As for some of the negative comments from previous posters: 1) Rooms/Hotel is dated - yes, i agree with this one. The room did look dated and could use a refresh, especially the bathrooms, but they were clean and comfortable. Don't expect Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton level of luxury - but these rooms also cost 1/4- 1/2 as much so you shouldn't expect that anyway. Also, there was a balcony on the room, but it was tiny and not really appealing to sit out on, especially since my room overlooked the top of the meeting rooms. 2) Food is expensive - what hotel doesn't have expensive food and drinks? I know when I go on vacation that if I eat at the hotel, I will be paying up for that convenience and it is just part of the cost of going on vacation. The kidis eat free helped with that, as did eating at Subway for lunch a few times and my breakfast vouchers. 3) location - our intention was really just ot hang out with the kids by the beach and pool and it was perfect for that. it got really hot during the day so we actually had to go inside from 12-3pm. I wish there was more shade at the outdoor restaurant for lunch and that the playground was shaded so that my kids could have played there during the day. the beach is small but a nice, manageable size for little kids. Because it was so hot we barely played on the beach - if we were outside, we were in the pool. You do need to take a cab to go out, but it wasn't too expensive and it was a quick trip. We had a great dinner at Puerto Rico Cafe (recommended by the concierge) and then at BLT Steak in the Ritz Carlton, where we then did some gambling since the Hilton does not have a casino. Had this been a getaway for just me & my husband, I probably would have preferred somewhere a bit more modern and luxurious... but if you are looking for a great hotel to spend some time with the kids, i think this was about as good as you will find, especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: “love it!”
Reviews.Author: Impoolside2000
Reviews.Content: Where to lay and get sun? On the beach, by the pool, on the sun deck? Close to Old San Juan and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Still good but needs to refurbish rooms”
Reviews.Author: vinnyjake
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to San Juan on business 1-2 times each year for over two decades. I usually stay at the Hilton or the Marriott. Over the past few years, I have stayed at the Hilton more often because it is more easily accessible by car than the Marriott. It also has much larger grounds which means it is never crowded. No problem finding a chair near one of the pools or along the beach front. Unlike the Marriott, the beach has a nice break water making it easier to swim. I like the restaurants more at the Marriott but usually eat off-site so this is not a factor for me. I did notice that the rooms, of late, are showing their age (unless you are a VIP Hilton card member and are assigned the executive tower which has very nice rooms). In contrast, the Marriottâ€™s rooms are â€˜newerâ€™ and generally superior. In all, a good place to stay but they really need to do some upgrading if they want to remain a premiere destination.

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: GoldTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton in San Juan has known better times. Currently, the hotel is noisy, service is poor, and it hard to get warm water in the shower. When I arrived I thought I got a decent room, but at night the travel through the hallways made it sound more like NYC Central Station than a hotel. The noise and the mosquitoes kept me awake for most of the night. Next day I asked for a another room, which was indeed more quite, but the water in the shower is colder than the water in the ocean. And that is the (only?) good part about the Caribe Hilton: the waterfront. The beach and swimming pool area are nice. Finally, the location is also not one the best: to go downtown to old San Juan you are obliged to take a cab, because apparently the 3 miles stretch between the hotel and downtown is one of the most dangerous areas of San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: loquito_92
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is simply beautiful. The best Hotel in San Juan. Great location near the "Old San Juan" shopping district. Private beach. Across the way from "El Condado" High End stores and restaurants, right next to the Marina. What else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JMP_Chicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally-located, within easy walking distance to Old San Juan and Condado. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was pretty empty during the weeknights, but filled up over the weekend. We got a free room upgrade to a villa, which had a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Young kids with allergies”
Reviews.Author: nicolaseusebio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 4 nights with two children (ages 2 and 6). Our 6 year old has several allergies (dust mites, peanuts, pollen) and often when we stay at hotels he gets congested. However, he had absolutley no problem at the Caribe Hilton. We did have issues with food since they cannot guarantee that the food be peanut free. This is normal for most hotels so we prepared ahead of time and brought food with us in our suitcase (bagels with cream cheese, canned goods, etc). I'm pretty creative with this since we travel a lot and we are dealing with this peanut allergy. We had to bring food with us because there is no grocery store nearby. There are two little stores but they only have junk food, nothing healthy. The hotel was great for adults and kids. There were 3 pools, gardesn with peacocks and geese, the hotel had baskets of dried bread to feed to the fish in the little garden stream, there was a playground for toddlers - 6 year olds, there were huge chess games and connect four games (all of this stuff for free), there were little crabs on the beach at night to catch, and hammocks (tons of them to swing in or just lie around), there was free pina colada tasting at 1pm. You cannot get bored at this hotel in 4 days. It is a huge hotel with stores and a coffee shop, etc. We spent the whole 4 days there with the kids are were not ready to leave. We had a fabulous time and will definitely go back there again. I should also say that we stayed 2 nights in Isla Verde at the Hamptom Suites. Although the hotel was clean, I would not recommend that area. The beach was very dirty and the whole area of Isla Verde looked really rundown. We wished we would have stayed the whole time at the Caribe Hilton. We tried to switch our hotels back but it would have been to expensive for us. Also, I attended a conference at the Condado Hotel (5 minutes walking distance away) and although it looked nice inside the beach/outdoors area is not as nice for kids. it is much smaller. The Hilton Caribe has tons of space outside for kids to run around. Also, we had a promotion where you pay 2 nights and get 2 nights free. So, it ran us about $625 total (including resort fee) for 4 nights in an ocean view room--villa suite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suite, perfect views, unforgettable honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: obamasucks
Reviews.Content: Considering my in-laws stayed at the Carribe Hilton for their Honeymoon 30 years ago, continuing a tradition was a must. Upon arriving, we were informed that our room was upgraded to a suite. To this day, I don't know if my in-laws did that or it was the genorisity of the hotel due our honeymoon visit. Despite that, the room and reviews were specatacular as was the Asian restaurant. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fun amenities!”
Reviews.Author: TravelChickDC
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton offers everything you could ask for in a Caribbean beach vacation resort. The room was comfortable and nicely decorated - not luxurious, but certainly nice enough. The food was plentiful, and service, for the most part, was very attentive and pleasant. The best part of the hotel, by far, are the amenities - the pool/beach area is FABULOUS! It's huge, and you can easily choose a different area to sit in each day of the week - be it at the large pool with many levels, the circular sun deck (definitely the spot to see-and-be-seen), or the long, sandy beach. The landscaping is gorgeous, and it really feels like a lush, tropical destination. The rock-climbing, inflatable "igloo" in the water provided tons of fun for adults and kids alike. I especially loved the parrots in the lobby - my husband had to pull me away from them each time we walked through the open-air lobby. The location is really well situated - a short walk to Condado, or a 10-minute taxi ride to Old San Juan. It couldn't have been more convenient for everything we wanted to see and do. We really had a fabulous time and have no complaints about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: katiebeth6
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay here last weekend. I particuarly want to compliment the staff. At check-in we were offered an upgrade to an ocean view room for $25/night which we decline. After arriving in our room we realized we'd gotten the upgrade anyway. It was a gorgeous room and a nice gesture, as the hotel wasn't anywhere near full in the off season. The really impressive part came after we'd checked out of the hotel and continued on the Viesquez only to realize we'd left our passports, money, and jewelry in the Hilton room safe. I frantically called security. They were very quick to check the room and return my call. I returned to the Hilton 24 hours later to retrieve my things and found the security staff was again very pleasant and quick at returning my valuables, including all the cash. I really appreciated their professionalism and honesty.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: shally77
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews I just had to set the record straight. We just arrived home last night from our first vacation to Puerto Rico with a 4 night stay at the Caribe Hilton. It was absolutely wonderful! Our large room in the older part of the hotel was updated, very clean and comfortable with a view of the Ocean, Lagoon , Small Fort, along with a private sitting area on our balcony. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful and friendly unlike what you read. The beach area is very large and private with many palm trees surrounding the pools, lagoon along with hammocks right next to the water. I've never been to a hotel where you could snorkel right at your own beach and see so many wonderful schools of fish, sea horses, and sea life. We met several people who have been to this hotel many times because of the beauty and location. Please overlook all those reviews where people complain about everything under the sun. Are the drinks expensive, yes but you are on a resort and other hotels in the area also charged alot of money for food and drinks. The Pina Colada was great! Please treat yourself and forget those who find a reason to complain if everything isn't just perfect. Glen and Paula P.S. Amy if you read this thanks for all your advice on this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe their web site”
Reviews.Author: deborahquade
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough not to have had the misfortune to stay at the Carib Hilton Hotel. I went to the web site and it was promoting stay 4 nights and two nights were free. July 20 til Dec sometime. So I called the hotel direct, and they were sorry but even though they were advertising this special you were not able to book the special. I asked to speak to the manager, Ivan Ayala and he told me he would honor the web site. We discussed the "room type" I had selected and he said it would be honored. He told me to just put it in writing. So I did. I asked Mr. Ayala if he had taken this off the web site ( it was very disturbing to "think" you're getting a deal only to find out it had expired). He said he had. I went to the web site and that was a lie. I made my flight arrangements and the next day received a reservation for 1 person in a smoking room at full price. When asked why the "special" was not included, Mr. Ayala said he thought I had rejected the stay 4 nights and pay for 2 and opted for another "special". Really! At 10pm I finally spoke with another manager. By this time, they had posted a small sentence saying the stay 4 nights pay for 2 was not available for the room options. So, they would not honor the web site from two days ago. Listen, does anyone there care how upsetting this is? That would be NO. They make a mistake and then take it out on the customer. So, now I go to bed, with no hotel plans but non refundable plane tickets. Tomorrow is my birthday and next week is my anniversary. It was suppose to be fun. And what I received from the Hilton was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Felt lost in the crowd”
Reviews.Author: KC-Boston
Reviews.Content: Over all I would say the Caribe Hilton has a lot to offer, It s just was not what i was looking for in a relaxing escape. I was recently in P.R for buessness/pleasure for a week and decided to spend 3 days at the beach and 4 nights in old town San Juan. My first 3 nights was at the Caribe hilton and have to say it was a dissapointment. I could go on to sharing with you the negitives but thats boring. Positives-beautiful property-friendly staff-great gym! I guess I felt like I was lost in the shuffle at times- this is a big property and when I had to chat with the front desk I felt I was always waiting in line....I spent close to 2 hours in line at reception during my 3 day stay. The Caribe Hilton is a bit isolated but there is a small market and sub shop 4 to 5 minutes walk from the entrance. There is also a car rental agency by the market which I used and it was about 40% less expensive then the one offered at the hotel. Also the new updated gym is fantastic possibly one of the nicest hotels gyms I have ever used. Looking back i wished i upgraded to La Concha hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: robino2
Reviews.Content: I am shocked by the positive reviews of this hotel. We stayed at this hotel at the end of our honeymoon, and it was a disappointing end to an otherwise fantastic trip. We tried to check in early (having made a prior request to do so), and we were told to come back at 2:00 p.m. We spent the day exploring San Juan and returned (after having been rained on) after 2:00 p.m. The clerk kept telling us to give him 10 more minutes, then completely ignoring us. It was several hours before we were shown to a room, that was supposedly an upgrade, but seemed like a very average room to me. There were no apologies or acknowledgment that the hotel had done anything wrong. I will never stay at another Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “All Your Needs are Attended to”
Reviews.Author: floridianinschweiz
Reviews.Content: We had a long Columbus Day Weekend stay at this fantastic hotel. Truly one of the most memorable hotel stays I've ever had. A wonderful property, friendly staff who cater to your every need, food was great (we hosted a Brunch for 6 on Sunday), and by the way they make Pina Colada's, you can tell they were invented here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for "lazy days and evenings out" people”
Reviews.Author: KathyinManhattan
Reviews.Content: Great setting on the beach, lovely grounds and pools, so if you want to hang out on the beach or poolside all day, this is a good place to do it. The hotel itself is large, modern and the rooms are nice, clean and well-equipped with fabulous high beds and lots of big soft feather pillows. It's worth paying a little extra for an ocean view, but try to get a high floor (we were on 6, which was fine). Food and drinks are expensive, and the food is nothing special. There are no other nice resturants nearby, so eating out usually means paying taxi fares ($12+tip each way to the old town). On the other hand, if you plan to eat out in old San Juan most nights, this hotel is closer than most of the other beach hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at bargain”
Reviews.Author: sang123
Reviews.Content: Just make sure you get a room through priceline - I paid less than 100 dollars including tax. This is the best place to stay if you enjoy beach and proximity to old san juan.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world.”
Reviews.Author: Graphicalimpressions
Reviews.Content: I love the open front lobby. The greenery and friendly staff. I've stayed in a lot of 4 and 5 star hotels and this is still my absolute favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat the experience”
Reviews.Author: CTRight
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a business conference/vacation. The service was great, the location was ideal, the hotel was beautiful and our room was perfect. I loved the complimentary flavored waters in the lobby and the large tropical flower arrangements. When we were there we had the hot tub, pool, and lovely private beach practically to ourselves. This hotel has two sections. I like the older section which has carpeted rooms and the main lobby much better than the newer section with tile floors and a lobby that felt more like an apartment building. We did not eat any meals at the hotel as they were above our price range, but that was not a hardship. We brought some snacks with us, which came in handy. One of the things we liked about the Caribe Hilton was that it was so quiet and uncrowded, probably because our conference reserved many rooms with people who really didn't have much time to use the amenities. The bad reviews I see for this hotel often refer to busy times like the Forth of July. I cannot wait to get back to this hotel, but I think it is worth doing some research to try to pick a slow period. We enjoyed Old San Juan, the Rainforest, and the bioluminescent bay.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton is one of our favorites in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: lisazax
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Caribe Hilton several times and always have a wonderful experience. Rooms are large, very clean and lots of the things we look for (oversized flat screen TVs, coffee makers in room, great bedding, etc.). The staff is very friendly and helpful as well. Although not within walking distance of the Condado tourist area, this can be a blessing as it's a bit more quite here. We love the large pool and quiet beach (one minor complaint...not enough shaded areas). Morton's Steak is located on the property, in addition to Lemon Grass with it's amazing ambience. Be sure to stroll the grounds near Lemon Grass at night to see the swans! I would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: KellyBarrett
Reviews.Content: Great views, spa, pools, beach, close to Old San Juan and Isla Verde. We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel”
Reviews.Author: ann_p_n
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice and the room was comfy. This is definitely a party hotel. There always seemed to be noise every night either music coming from the restaurant downstairs or other hotel patrons partying throughout the night. The checkin was very slow. We waited about 40 minutes to check in. The drinks were expensive especially if you ordered in the pool area. Overall service wasn't very good. The location wasn't that great as there weren't really many restaurants, casinos, site seeing places nearby. You either had to go to San Jan or different areas to eat unless you wanted to eat at the hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, but over run with children”
Reviews.Author: dragonrn67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, we had a room on the 10th floor with a spectacular view. We had two complaints however: 1) Children in the hot tub. Hubby and I were on our honeymoon. It was COMMON to find young children well under the age of eight, with floaties on their arms to keep them from sinking, jumping in and out of the hottub. After two days of it, we complained first to the pool manager, and then to the general. Did I mention their moms were sunning themselves and no where to be found? The general manage agreed it was wrong, but did nothing about it. I am a mother myself, but when I go away with my children, they follow the rules. The hot tub rules were 12 and over for one, and 14 and over for another. No one cared. 2) Mortons restaurant. We dropped $200.00 on a meal for two, and were not offered coffee with desert. Our waitress was in eye view, plainly flirting with another server, and not worried about serving. We complained, and were offered an after drink beverage. We declined, we wanted COFFEE. Other than these complaints, we LOVED the hotel, it is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Would not Recommend...”
Reviews.Author: Agent003
Reviews.Content: I went to San Juan on business and stayed at two hotels, the second being the Caribe Hilton. Once I got there, even though I am a Hiltons rewards member, the rewards member check-in line was the only line open, so I had to wait up to 30min while one desk attendant had to deal with everyone who was checking inâ€¦ Why even have a rewards check in line if there is no advantage to using it let alone only having one poor staff person!?! I had booked a room with a King size bed, when I got to my room, I found it to be a room with two double beds, when I called the front desk and asked about it I was told it was the only available roomâ€¦ What's the point of asking your preference when you book a room if they are not going to accommodate you? The room ceiling was cracked and sagging, the bathroom was moldy and dingy, and overall the quality of the room was poor. Then next morning I went to the breakfast buffet at the Hilton with my coworker where we were told it was going to be a 10min wait. The design of the restaurant is in such a way where you can see the entire seating area when you walk inâ€¦ After our 10min wait we were seated at a table that was empty and set the entire time we waited! The quality of the breakfast was fine, but our waiter never once came to offer us coffee, water or juice. Finally we couldn't wait any longer for the bill so we left $30 on the table and began to walk out. As we walked out we finally found out who our waiter was as he ran after us to let us know that the breakfast buffet was actually $27 per personâ€¦RIPOFF Luckily I only had to spend the one night there, because needless to say my opinion of the hotel continued to declineâ€¦ There is little to do at the hotel, and even less to do within walking distance, the beach is tiny, drinks and food are expensive and If you have a late flight and would like to hang out at the hotel for a bit and just need a room to shower and change after the 12 o'clock check outâ€¦ expect to pay $75 to $150 for that luxury (Complementary at the other hotel I stayed). Unless you want to pay top dollar for very little in return I would not recommend staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just say No!!”
Reviews.Author: Kobe2009
Reviews.Content: Horrible Service..and I mean horrible. When the sky opened up and rain began to pour I asked a Hotel Employee where I could buy some snacks, you know chips, soda etc. He pointed me in the direction of the "nearest" store which according to the direction of his finger was right in the eye of the storm..he literally pointed out and away from the Hotel. I chose to ignore his advice and investigated further and found the Hiltons own store where I found Soda, chips, etc. Idiota. When the Key to my room didn't work I went to the front desk to activate my Key and expressed my displeasure for the afore mentioned Soda, Chips incident as well as the Toilet not flushing, the Interenet Access not working or the fact that the Previous evening Room Service took so long to get us a menu that when we called down to order well before the Modnight closing time, we could not get Room Service or any food anywhere in the Hotel..when I expressed these issues to the young lady at the front desk, she told me, 'Don't Worry". I wish she said more, or maybe I don't because it woudn't be appropriate. As chain hotels that rip off consumers and force them to eat terrible food, drink watered down over priced drinks and pay for a name..this one delivers on all fronts.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Caribe Hilton San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SilSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: My sister and me stayed in Caribe Hilton and loved too much. It's a unique resort in San Juan with private beach and friendly staff. Is a big complex very beautiful and great location, you can go to Old Juan walking. The rooms are very good. Very very very excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience!”
Reviews.Author: DMorrow611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton Labor Day weekend. The hotel was beautiful inside and out. The staff was friendly and helpful. I am a frequent traveler to the Caribbean and I would totally recommend this hotel. The only negative thing is the beach is not that big-but I really don't think San Juan is known for big beautiful beaches. As far as the price for food and drinks-yes it is expensive but it's not anymore expensive than any other place I have stayed in the Carribean-unless you do an all-inclusive. Consierge was helpful at making dinner reservations that fit your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Best concierge in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: Settles
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton was as excpected. All around just fine for a business trip. The pool if time allows was stunning. Dominick Rodriguez, the concierge was truly exceptional! He was way beyond helpful and his restaurant recommendations were spot on for all types of requests. He made my stay infinitely better.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: mustangirl05
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, not far from Old San Juan easily and affordably accessible by bus. Hotel was unexpectedly loud as far as machinery - air conditioning unit is in front, construction sites nearby. . . Staff very helpful - concierge (Eric and Dominick) was exceptional as far as providing information!!! Rent a car but I would stay away from the Hotel Hertz affiliation - rent-a-car location right across from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: APetersPA
Reviews.Content: This was a family vacation, however, I came to the hotel the second day, so I cannot comment about the check in process. My family and I (three adults 21+ and one adult 18) stayed in the Villa Area and we had a one bedroom villa. It was nore like a two bedroom suite as the rooms are connected by pass through doors. My brother (18) stayed on one side of the villa, which had a sofa bed, full kitchen (complete with stove, refridgerator, and diswasher), and full bathroom (with a walk in shower). The three adults stayed on the other side of the villa, which had two Queen beds, mini fridge and microwave, and another full size bathroom (this one with a tub). We were on the first floor, so we could walk out and see the ocean, no problem. We chose to stay in the smaller pool area when we wanted to swin as it was less crowded than the main area. This area also has a hot tub and you can also see the natural habitiat that has peacocks, swans, and ducks. The main pool area and beach were nice, but a little crowded. I do like that private beach, but had some trouble in the water as there were uneven rocks. My mom enjoyed the hammocks so much, and I liked the big beds that are on the deck that overlooks the ocean. I was a little upset with the fact that I would have had to pay to use my laptop, so I didn;t use it. Concierge was great! Dominic pointed us to this restaurant in Old San Juan called Puerto Rico Cafe. To this day, I cannot stop talking about the Seafood Paella and my mom LOVED the fritters. I had a great time here, not only because I was with my family, but we stayed at a GREAT resort!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing! Nice view”
Reviews.Author: suburb123
Reviews.Content: I think its perfect for one of those vacations where you want to relax and don't want to get out of the resort much! It has a couple of pools, and the part I LOVED - 3 beautiful hot tubs and a wet bar!! Loved it! There are hammocks all over the place close to the beach for a nap in the sun. Overall, the trip was very relaxing. The town isn't too far off, we went out to eat in a few places just to experience the town. The view, if you have one of the top rooms, is beautiful.
