There is sort of a bridge in a corner in the resort, if you go to the very end you can stand with only water around you, perfect to watch the sunset! Don't remember much of the room because I was either in the hammock or in the hot tub! The beach is not huge, there is a small strip of sand, but there is access to water from other places. If it's a family vacation, there is a little area with kids' water toys.

Reviews.Title: “Motel, hotel, Holiday inn~ or Hilton?????”
Reviews.Author: Ginger12346
Reviews.Content: In my mind I thought I could never go wrong at a Hilton Hotel however, it was all wrong. My husband and I went for our 1st wedding anniversary this year to celebrate. The rooms were small, out dated, had wood paneling (updates from the 1970s), three paintings and a flat screen TV which froze all the time. We were to have a room with an ocean view... It was not much of a view except for the view of the top of portions of the Hilton Hotel. wifi is only available in the lobby unless you bring a cable to hook up in your room... ask for the code at the front desk! The sheets were dirty, stained and because of there go green policy only washed every three days... yukkkieeee. The food was not good at all and very over priced. example chicken wrap called the Mexi cali was 18.00 and a burger was 19.00 dollars.. Drinks beer 8.00 and mixed drinks 12.00 or more.. Or the more expensive restaurant like Morton's steak for 45.00 dollars???? The hotel is actually 7 minutes from old San Juan but after a day you can see it all.. The Hotel was boring and had nothing to do. It had a pool and a small beach that you may find at a bay area. There were no hotel shuttles and so you had to pay 12.00 each way into San Juan. The gym was not truly operational and shut down. We had to go across the street to an expo center and in a small area the size of a bedroom there were a few treadmills and weights machines. The Hotel did not offer any activities ...for free.. If you wanted to pay 118.00 per person you could go hike through the rain forest... OR 54.00 to go into town.. Just get a taxi and go your self its only a few streets. The hotel staff are not helpful and there are not other restaurants around the area??? just subway... and I am not into fast-food. We had to go into old San Juan. to eat daily... We felt stranded on a desert island... stay at the Conrad or the Ritz ...... or if you like to party the Hotel San juan. I want to save you from making the same mistake I did :( The only thing I liked about the hotel was STARBUCKS!!!!!!! There is nothing close to the hotel.................................................... THe Professor and Ginger! (Gilligans Island) If you go to Old San Juan eat at the Dragonfly... so good asian/Latin food really good sushi!

Reviews.Title: “The Caribe Hilton---A Jewel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SPTN58
Reviews.Content: My partner and I celebrated the Obama victory last year by flying to San Juan on vacation the day after the election. We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 8 days. The resort is clean, up-to-date, and situated on one of the most beautiful pieces of real estate in the area. The staff was professional, friendly, and helpful throughout the trip. The room was nice-sized, clean, and well-appointed. We had a spectacular view from our 10th floor balcony (see picture) which we enjoyed each morning while we had coffee and breakfast. My partner enjoyed use of the hotel's great fitness center. We both enjoyed the pools and beach area. There is an attached concrete pier at the end of walkway that wraps around the property. It's fun to carry leftover bread to feed the fish that congregate below. The on-site restaurants we very good, though pricy (as is usual for such a property). At night, when we would leave to go into the city for dinner, I enjoyed listening to the sounds of the native Puerto Rican coqui. The views of the Atlantic from the resort are stunning. The adjacent fort is fabulous. While we enjoyed our excursions into the city and other parts of the island, I can well see where folks could check in and never leave the property. I'd stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place, excellent location, private beach, expensive food/drinks.”
Reviews.Author: cheburashka109
Reviews.Content: We loved the proximity to the airport, the beautiful private beach, free lounge chairs/umbrellas, property layout and many other amenities. What we wished for was a better option for dining for families with small children (the restaurants on premises are really expensive), so we are at Subway across the street and went to the supermarket ($25 cab round trip). Also, they could have used more activities for rainy days. There was an attempt - bingo every day ( 15 minutes only) and Kidz Paradise room ( game room) but both were pretty lame. Despite that, we had a great week and would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Overly rated”
Reviews.Author: jestjohn
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 5 day stay at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan on 8/20/09. I'll begin with the positives. The grounds, pool areas. beach area. and property amenities for children were excellent. The views of the ocean from various sites of the hotel were awesome.There was a daily activivty program for children but appeared to be absolutely NO structured supervision. Therefore, my 10 year old daughter didn't engage in the program. The lobby area is a completely open area allowing birds to fly freely within the open areas including the main restaurant area. Birds would perch on tables and chairs throughout the restaurant and other open areas. Then there was my favorite...the LOUD and inceessantly noisy screams from caged mucaws and a cockateil in the lobby. It was horrible ...especially since my 10 year old has a fear of birds!! Upon registering , you are greeting by this inescapeable sound....and all day until about 6pm. Then there was the 4.5 star rooms....NOT! I requested and paid for an ocean view. I was assigned to the towers which overlooked roof tops in need of repair and a hole in the adjoining buliding which I assumed served as a door. The second room was located in the Garden view of the hotel with cracks in the floor leading to the small bathroom and walls inadequetly painted in an attempt to hide molding. At this point, I called the hotel manager. My third and accepted option given 4 hours after checking into the hotel was a view of the ocean and tropical garden. I was told that this area was the "new" section of the hotel. The word "new" was obviously used in relative terms. At this point, I was too exhausted to continue my opposition. The slate floors were filthy. I left a note requesting housekeeping to sweep and mop the floors. The floors were swept once but not mopped. I mopped the floors withTHEIR hand towel by using my foot to wipe up the floors. The towel was BLACK. EVERYTHING was outrageously expensive as well. I expected and desired to pay for a top rated hotel, however, the Caribe Hilton failed to live up to the rating. At best, I would give the hotel a 4.0 for the grounds alone. The hotel itself would be given a 3.0 I'll try the Ritz or the Intercontinental next time,even though I understand that there are less amenities for children.....hopefully each lives up to the rating.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC TIME AT THE HILTON”
Reviews.Author: candidocolon1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton from August 20th to 24th. Wonderful hotel my son Brandon had a blast! the hotels location is ideal just a couple of minutes from Old San Juan! The staff was curtious and friendly. The bartender Victor was very gracious and accomidating. the food was way too pricey! Breakfast for 3 was $65.00 dolllars a Pina colada at the pool was $18.00 bucks. if you walk about a block and a half from the hotel there is a small grocery store / restaurant they serve wonderful puerto rican food! 3 people can eat for about $24.00 bucks!!!There is a Subway next door. The pools are fantastic! The hotel isn't that crowded during the week so it was perfect for us. Would stay there agan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: carly317
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the hotel from August 10-13 and we had an amazing time. I had stay at the hotel numerous time but my friend this was her first time. She absolutely loved it. We both were amazed at the beauty of the hotel. Everybody was gracious and helpful. The food at Plmeras was great but need to be careful. It can be expensive. Most of the time we left the hotel and had lunch and dinner in San Juan. Other than that we enjoyed our stay in Puerto Rico and at the Caribe. We left sorry when we had to leave. We are already planning our next vacation but this time we will be staying for at least 7 days and bringing more of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MOMSBUSY
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 and we loved the Caribe. The pools and beach are fabulous. A short cab ride to Old San Juan and the cruise ships. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kidrican69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for an anniversary. The hotel lobby was beautiful, beach and pool also. We stayed at a garden room on the 8th floor. Great view of garden and ocean. I want to say that the bellstaff like always was incredible. I stayed there before. I was upset that Juan Carlos the bellman was no longer there. The rest of the guys were and like always were very helpful and friendly. I am going again next month for business. I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: sdudek1490
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for two nights after our Carnival cruise. At first I thought the extra resort charge was a rip off but let me tell you, it was worth every penny. We don't have very much money but this property is so beautiful that we never left. The restaurant Il Guardino(sp) was expensive but had wonderful service. We bought food by the pool and yes it is very pricey but the entire experience was wonderful. If you can swing about 200 a night, then go for it. It was one of the highlights of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: JLoz
Reviews.Content: Positives: The Caribe Hilton in San Juan is by far the best resort on the island of Puerto Rico, It has multiple large pools and a nice beach with calm, clear water. The lobby's atmosphere is always energetic, and the surrounding area of the hotel is safe. There are two small Spanish-forts by the hotel, there are many hammocks to lay on and there are enough lounge chairs for everyone. Negatives: The food and drinks are super expensive! $13 for a pina colada!!! Also, if you do not return the towels that you use at the pool/beach by 6PM you are charged $20 per towel. Other than these two minor details there is really no other negative comments I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Bowildhax
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion there July 24-29, 2009 with my mother, sister, husband, two teenage boys and myself, husband and our 12 year old girl and 9 year old boy. My mother (who is Puerto Rican) wanted to stay at the Caribe Hilton after staying there in the mid 90s. And the Caribe Hilton MORE than surprised me with both it's natural beauty and location as well as the renovated areas of the hotel. Check in is at 4pm, but we arrived at 2pm. Because of the multiple packages (my sisters on Continental Tours, ours on Expedia) the woman at check in found us all rooms in the Tower though on different floors. She gave us a claim to use the pool and beach and we quickly changed into bathing suits and were thrilled at the accomodations on the beach. Chaises, umbrellas and towels are free. We brought face masks and snorkels with us so we had an amazing afternoon swimming by the rocks near the beach and viewing the schools of fish - like being in an aquarium! Once we received our room location in the tower, the bellhop brought up our luggage and made sure we had enough towels. We had lunch at the Subway down the street, filling and less expensive than the restaurants at the hotel. After a wonderful day on the beach, we took a $12 cab ride into Old San Juan to Buren' on San Christo Plaza (same street as the great upscale shops that close at 7pm) where the food was wonderful but the service was slow. For 9 people to move easily was not difficult. The Caribe has wi-fi in the lobby (get the code at the front desk) and that was perfect for just enough work connection while on vacation. For breakfast - kids under 12 are free at the buffet with an adult. However, the adult buffet at $26 was too pricey for my husband and I. My mother took the smaller kids with her to breakfast and we ate at Starbucks, which is a wonderful addition to the lobby. Get to the beach by 9:30 to get towels and lounges as well as umbrellas. Hammocks go quickly, The pool, beach and grounds are amazing - if you eat at the pool grill, the kosher hot dog at $8 was huge with a generous plate of fries. We found that 9:30-1pm at the pool/beach was plenty (don't forget the 1pm pina colada tasting at the swim up bar , no alcohol, but tasty) and then a quick nap on the beach and up to shower at 5pm. Dinners in Old San Juan were excellent at Cafe Puerto Rican, Sophias and at JAM in Condado Beach (their sister bar, Marmalade in OSJ is also excellent) and that the Caribe bar is not that exciting at night. The Salsa Congress started during our stay, so we had free entertainment each night with bands and dancing. The hotel was overcrowded and fully booked and still I felt that the rooms were clean and the hotel was keeping up with the crowds. The room itself was spacious and the bathrooms in the Tower were wonderful with a two person shower, double sinks and lots of outlets. The double beds were very comfortable, the air conditioning excellent and the safe under the TV console were perfect. Elevators were a bit slow, but the blast of air conditioning when walking into the Tower lobby was refreshing. The kids loved the parrots in the lobby (and they are indeed a bit loud when excited) the options of pool, hot tub and ocean, the water trampoline (it was being repaired the last part of our trip) and all the fish when snorkeling. While I was suspect, I would NOT hesitate to go back to the Caribe Hilton. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ... pricey on the drinks but promo makes up for that”
Reviews.Author: DreadPR
Reviews.Content: Perfectly clean modern room. Clean but small Beach. Clean pool. Outdoor jacuzzi with hot water. Awesome bartenders. Get pitchers instead of individual drinks. They will make a pitcher out of anything and it turns out much cheaper. Delicious french fries by the pool. (yes ... good enough for inclusion in a review). Swans and koi in the garden. Parrots in the lobby. Free wifi in the lobby. Starbucks in the lobby. Liquor store a few feet from front entrance. Subway next to liquor store which helps as the restaurants are pricey. Mortons Steakhouse next to subway. Cant really walk anywhere else. Went to a mexican restaurant in the Condado area one night ... amazing food (Tijuana's bar and grill HIGHLY recommend). Would have rated this hotel at 5 stars if it was located in that area. About a $10 cab to get over there so not that big a deal. About a $12 cab to old town San Juan. The hotel promotion was ridiculous: fourth night free, $200 resort credit (usable at restaurants bars etc), $100 in cash (yes cash) and some very good coupons. There was a salsa convention while we were there and it just made the stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Obviously popular with families.”
Reviews.Author: pairofloafers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from July 14-19. He was in San Juan for a convention and this was the primary hotel in which attendees were housed. Had we come to Puerto Rico on vacation, we probably would have stayed right in Old San Juan to sightsee for a couple of days, then rented a car and left the city to explore less developed parts of the island. Nevertheless, we thought the Caribe Hilton was a nice hotel in general, and we enjoyed our stay. On a side note, I arrived a day earlier by myself (due to my HUSBAND telling me the wrong dates when I booked my airline ticket) Since the Caribe Hilton was full, I had to stay one night at the Condado Plaza Hilton, which I have also reviewed. (So if you are a Hilton Points member and are trying to decide between the two, you can read both reviews). The following are things we liked about the Caribe: BEACH. Small but fairly pretty crescent shaped beach with nice view of ocean. It would have been even prettier if not marred by the ugly concrete sun bed jutting out into the little bay. Also the giant inflated trampoline smack in the middle marred the natural beauty, but lots of kids sure enjoyed it. There were plenty of recliners in spite of the hotel being full. It may take a while to get the attention of the umbrella guy. You may have to go fetch him, but he will surely bring you one. The water is calm and it is possible to see a few things if you snorkel by the edges. They rent equiptment, and sometimes there's a free equiptment hour- see activity sheet at towel stand for times. GROUNDS. Lovely and fun to explore and look at the animals. Just like the photos in the reviews. Disturbing, though, how the bellies of the swans are dyed blue from whatever additives they put in the pond, maybe to retard algae or mosquitos? ACTIVITIES. At the towel booth, you can pick up a list of the week's activities. Some are for kids, some for adults. I certainly would have been at the daily pina colada tasting at one o'clock. Unfortunately, I didn't find out about the activity list until the last day. No one tells you. Here are the things we did not like so much: CROWDED. The lobby seemed crowded and chaotic at times. If I were on my honeymoon, I would have been devastated because, Man, this place was full of kids! We didn't care so much due to being there primarily for convention, not vacation. In fairness, July/August is the big time for vacationing families and somewhat for conventions as well. I imagine the resort would be more tranquil at most other times besides Xmas or Easter. EXPENSIVE FOOD, DRINKS. To be expected. But my $16 chicken caesar salad was very mediocre. The exact same dish at the Condado Plaza was excellent. Drinks were good, though, and they had better be for the $$$. INCONSISTANT SERVICE. Probably due to hotel being full. Hard to get attention of bar staff, though, in spite of good tips and few patrons. On the beach, there was a call button for if you wanted to order something- sometimes you'd get a quick response, sometimes you would wonder if someone was ever going to answer. Good points in service were the efficient banquet service at the functions we attended and also how extra hangers (even more than we asked for) were brought to the room quickly when requested. All in all, I got the feeling that most staffers were trying their best. ROOM AND VIEW. It was room 7114 in the lagoon villas section, all of which I think come with fully equipped kitchen. It looked newly remodeled. Bedroom was good sized and comfortable. AC, appliances, everything were functioning well. Bathroom small but new, no tub. This unit would have been great for a family. It was more a matter of personal taste for us. It just seemed ugly and not what I would want on vacation to be sitting in bed and looking right at a kitchen. The room was done in a dark tan and green scheme with heavy fabrics and drapes that seemed depressing and out of place in a tropical environment, especially after my pretty, modern, stylish and airy room with tropical decor that I stayed in at the Condado Plaza, where my room had a free safe. Here they wanted to charge for it. That really irks me for some reason. Regarding cleanliness, we noticed a couple icky hairball-dustbunny type things in the hall and in the room as we first entered after check in. Otherwise OK. The unit had a nice patio, but we spent zero time on it because view was just plain BAD. It is of a lagoon with an ugly bridge under construction with big cranes and traffic. Sadly, the view will still be unattractive when the construction is completed. The lagoon is surrounded by blah concrete hotels and appartments. It isn't just this hotel, either. It seems to be a similar case at many San Juan hotels. I strongly suggest ponying up for ocean view wherever you choose to stay. That way you can forget you're surrounded by development. LOCATION. The Caribe is on a point of land and other than a Subway and a couple of high priced little convenience stores that carry liquor and snacks, there is not really anything within walking distance. Walking within Condado once you get over the bridge is doable. It is not adviseable to try walking longer distances such as between neighborhoods, as everywhere is crisscrossed by busy roads, highways, and some gated residential areas and you kind or get trapped by all of it. You will be spending a lot on cabs. If going to OSJ, you can ask where to catch the bus for only 35 cents. One may come immediately, or you may wait a half hour (just like Chicago, ha ha) and it only goes as far as San Cristobal, aproximately. It does not go furthur into OSJ. But you can then pick up the free tourist trolley. In sum, because of the calm beach (with trampoline), activities, and grounds with animals, I think the Caribe would be a great choice for families planning to not leave the resort much, especially if you could get a lagoon villa with kitchenette like we stayed in. You could store lots of snacks in the full fridge or pop a frozen pizza in the microwave or oven to feed the kids lunch or dinner and in that way avoid buying expensive food at the beach. So even though I rated the hotel as average, many of those points I disliked would be favorable if you have kids. It was also a good hotel for the convention. I feel like they tried to treat us well, sometimes in spite of how some of the guests acted. We were happy to be contributing to the local economy and felt appreciated in turn. My husband has spent quite a bit of time in PR in the past, but it was my first visit. In spite of being turned off by overdevelopment in a lot of outlying San Juan, I was charmed by Old San Juan. I like the diversity, creativity and urban worldliness exuded by Sanjuaneros. I don't like how everyone responds in English when I try to speak Spanish (but my Spanish is lame). I think it's awesome how everyone really dresses up to go out at night. I hope to return to Puerto Rico to explore more of the island's beauty in the various other regions and cities I have read about. I loved the Puertorican culture, music and food. Highlights were a night of the Le Lo Lai music/dancing show at Fuerte San Cristobal, the views from El Morro, Museo de Arte de Puertorico and its sculpture garden (in Santurce neighborhood-don't try to walk, big mistake), impressive folk art and indigenous cultures display at Museum of Puertorican culture in OSJ, awesome coffee everywhere and yummy pastry called ?quesilla? that I couldn't get enough of, Bebo's restaurant, the great fruit and world's sweetest mangoes at municipal market near art museum, roast pork with skin all crispy, beans and rice.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: 63galaxie
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is simply perfect on so many levels. We have stayed here three times (pre and post cruise), the last time was in June 2008. I have seen so many negative reviews yet so many other reviews that are polar opposite. Our experiences have been so memorable that I wanted to take the time to share. Expect a short cab ride from the airport and/or the pier. The bellhops are always waiting to open the car doors, take your luggage, greet you with a smile and a big welcome. We found them to be efficient and friendly without exception. The front-desk staff left nothing unattended. They were cheerful, quick to answer questions, informative, and very willing to check for upgrades. We were given a partial oceanview room which overlooked the gardens. The view was spectacular. The room was modern, fresh, and spotlessly clean. The beds were perfect for us. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the bellhop. He unloaded our luggage and seemed eager to share his suggestions for a local dinner spot. He took time to greet us and check on us every time we saw him in the lobby. And, his dinner suggestion was spot-on for authentic, homecooked food. Dinner was inexpensive and delicious! We were given access to the Concierge Lounge which included free food and beverages in the evening and for breakfast. Sofas and seating were plentiful, including seating on a balcony overlooking the deep blue sea. Free internet and computers were available as well as local newspapers. The food was fresh and the lounge made our living space all that much more. We spent time in the magnificent lounge/bar area in the lobby. I couldn't decide which was more relaxing, the view over the pool and out to the ocean, or those soothing ocean breezes. Another great find was the Starbucks in the lobby. They carried all the usual drinks, but what we enjoyed were the homemade local pastries. Again, inexpensive and unusual. Others have mentioned the birds in the lobby. They are colorful and lively and we enjoyed bantering with them! There were plenty of interesting shops in the resort which made for some great window shopping. The prices were, shall we say, not exactly budget friendly, but then again, we are in a resort. We ate bbq'd burgers and caesar salads outside. Again, the views were spectacular! The portions were large and the flavors were first-rate. And the Pina Coladas were predictably top-notch. After lunch we walked through the botanical gardens, stopping to sit in the gazebo to watch the fish and the big black swans. It was a cool and quiet spot to read a book. We noticed a restaurant with huge glass walls tucked in the corner of the gardens. It wasn't open for lunch and we never made it back for dinner, but I'm betting the Lemon Grass was elegant and cozy dinner venue. The resort has an old fort right on the grounds. Unfortunately, it was not open to the public. There's a beautiful stone wall with a lovely walkway alongside the ocean. It included a long stone pier which one could look down on and see the waves crashing below. At night, they turn on spotlights and the fish are actually fed. It's like snorkeling without getting in the water. My favorite feature had to be the lovely and large palm trees strung with hammocks. The ocean breeze will literally rock you to sleep while you gaze up into their shiny green fronds. The infiinty pool has a waterfall and a swim-up bar. It overlooks the ocean too. A short walk will bring you to the private beach. Free nonmotorized sports equipment was available for guests. The sand was soft, the water was gentle and shallow for quite a long ways out, and the water was just the right temperature. In the middle of the lagoon is a slide and a small floating dock. We never visited the spa or the fitness center, but they have both available. They also have a children's play area with several plastic climb-on/over contraptions for the little ones. We found a Subway just up the street. The prices were equal to stateside prices. They had a full coffee and ice cream bar, as well as local soups, and the standard Subway sandwiches and salads. Breakfast choices included pancakes, eggs, meats, and pastries. Directly across the street from the resort is a small local market. It had soups to nuts (wine, souveniers, beer, local food items, cameras, you name it). We saw at least one other restaurant onsite but we never ate there either. Kudos to the concierge staff who graciously packed up a guitar my husband had purchased precruise. She arranged for Fed Ex to pick it up and she had it shipped back to us in the U.S. This resort has been almost a mecca for us. We recommend it to families, couples, singles, travelers, and business people. It has a lovely laid-back vibe with enough luxurious touches to let you know you are in a resort in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “..... Maybe Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyTripper
Reviews.Content: Tips on what to do while staying at the Caribe Hilton. Accessibility. The Hilton is about two miles away from the beginning of the center of Old San Juan. It is about as far to get to any significant area in the Condado area. So here are your options: You can walk but in hot and humid weather it may not be the suitable option (Especially if you are dressed to impress). The cheapest fare would be to find the bus schedule and bus stops. This costs about fifty cents for a ride. You can rent a bike but you are confined to the hours you are allowed to take the bike out. It is twenty five dollars for the day. You can rent a car. Not recommended if you are going into Old San Juan (There will be trouble with parking and traffic). Also Hilton will charge you for parking. You can take a taxi. Can be pricey especially if you are comparing a fifty cent bus fare to a twelve dollar taxi ride (one way). Food and Beverages. The Hilton is ridiculously overpriced for its food or drinks. Eight dollars a beer. twelve dollars for a Pina Colada. A "small" salad from the outside bar was ten dollars. We ate at the lemon grass, which is an Asian fusion type restaurant and the prices there were expensive as well. One Sushi roll there is a minimum of fifteen dollars. There is a Subway and a small restaurant next to a mini-mart right outside the Hilton. I would recommend going to these spots to eat to save money. You can also get beverages (regular drinks and alcohol) at the mini-mart which would save you money as well. The Beach The Beach that is provided by the Hilton is closed off by rocks so if you like waves you will not like their beach. The rocks stop any waves from coming into the Hilton beach area. In my opinion this defeats the purpose of going in the water! You are better off just using the pool (Which is nice). If you want the waves there is a public beach around the corner of the Hilton on the other side of the ball fields (surfers go there). Nightlife The bar sometimes has something going on but it usually is not a happening spot. The closest spots would be in Old San Juan (Busy night life only on the weekends). La Placita in Santurce (ten minutes from the Hilton) is a happening spot on some nights with a lot more local flavor. The other side of San Juan on Isla Verde Avenue is much more bustling with nightlife (About a $20.00 cab fee one way). The busiest spot seemed to always be El San Juan Hotel and Casino. There is a lot going on there especially on the weekends (If you go there on the weekends dress to impress). The Room We stayed in the main building and I had absolutely no problem with the room what so ever. I will say this though. When I plan my trips I never really care about certain amenities the room has to offer such as cable TV or whatever. I use the room to sleep and that is it. All I care about is if the room is comfortable and clean. The Hilton had that. Oh and yes the Hilton did have cable TV, air conditioning, and an internet connection but I believe you had to pay a daily rate for that. The lobby has a free wireless connection. Overall I went there with my wife looking for adventure but from what I have seen it did look like a place for the whole family (kids). The place may not be a hot spot but it is far from quiet (The loud parrots at the front of the lobby will attest to that). It is like everyone is there for business though. I would recommend somewhere else. If you want to be closer to Old San Juan find a place closer or get a place that is right in Old San Juan. If you are looking for night life I would recommend the El San Juan Hotel and Casino on Isla Verde Avenue (A lot of things are in walking distance of this hotel) and I think the beach is better.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: ChantelleSTX
Reviews.Content: This is the type of hotel that will nickel and dime you. But that is often the case with a large resort that has trouble keeping itself full. So that wasn't that big of an issue. I've lived in the Caribbean for about 10 years and customer service is often lacking, but I have never come across anything like this. Every single employee I encountered was sour. From the Check in to the check out., no smiles and no courtesy. Check in took over 45 minutes and most of that time was for us check in, not waiting in line. All we asked was to upgrade to a King Villa with Ocean View (we were not asking for it for free but to pay for it), from an ocean view deluxe room. He said it was available as soon as we asked for it but then took FOREVER to check us in, never chatting with us or telling us what was wrong, just frowning silence. On a side note I hate the loud squawking parrots in hotel lobbies. Feels like its going to pierce your ear drums, but I guess kids like that. So after a long very confusing walk to the villa area of the property we get to our room. I was really disappointed. It was beige, beige and beige with a white bed (Who decides to make a Caribbean room brown? Just makes it look dingy). It was a very dark room and on top of the disappointing first impression we had no ocean view but some kind of canal with construction going on. The windows and the walls are extremely thin, we could hear our neighbors every night and construction woke us up every morning!!! And the room would barely get cool. We paying all sorts of taxes and energy charges and we have a hot room. Also after discovering our room OPEN (if you did not lift the door handle back up it wouldn't lock) we called down to the operator right away and reported the problem, no one came, reported it again, not one came. That was pretty much the last straw. We ate at Mortons several times and had excellent service. That is the best part of the hotel. Ask the Concierge for recommendations twice and the recommendations were awful. And again she acted like we were putting her out by bothering her. We moved to the Marriott San Juan & Stellaris Casino, halfway during our stay because I could not stand the service any longer at the Caribe. We had a wonderful stay there. I told Caribe front desk at check out how awful my stay was and they had no concern about it at all. Caribe made my stay so awful I am telling everyone how bad it was.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from 6 days in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: DutchBoy47501
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from 6 days in San Juan. We stayed at the Caribe Hilton. It is about 15 minutes from the airport. We took a taxi from the airport. We had 4 people and 4 bags and it cost $23 plus tip, total. Very reasonable. The hotel is a bit aged, as it was built in the 50's, but has a lot of activities. The pools and beach areas are nice, they were not crowded at all thru the week, but got busy on Friday and Saturday. The beach hammock area is very nice. The food is very pricey and there is not much within walking distance. There is a Subway nearby. Old San Juan is only a 50cent bus ride away, but we took a taxi when we went. The taxi cost around $12 plus tip, each way. Very easy access to taxis in Old San Juan. I would not recommend driving in Old San Juan, because it is very hectic, and no place to park. We stayed in the main tower in 719, but our room did not have a very nice view, although we could see the ocean. Mostly you see the top of the lower floors in the main building. We had trouble on four consecutive days with the lock on our door. We had to have new room keys made daily. They worked on the lock, but did not seem to know how to fix it. Finally they just moved us to another room, but then I noticed they just checked someone in our old room right away, without fixing the door lock. The rooms had high speed internet, but it was not free. You could get internet access for free in the lobby only, wireless. Overall, I would not stay at this resort again, due to the isolated location, and the age of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “headaches galore; credit card charged repeatedly”
Reviews.Author: latinabrendastarr
Reviews.Content: While the hotel grounds are nice and the private beach is an added bonus, I would not stay at this or any Hilton again. The first night I checked in the hotel put a hold of nearly $1900 on my credit card; the next day they attemptedf another $900+ charge to the card. Thankfully credit card fraud unit contacted me. I spoke with the manager on duty that night and after giving me three different reasons for the charges he assured me nothing was being charged to my card. I was under the imprerssion all had been cleared up. WRONG! By Wednesday morning there had been more charges to the tune of several hundred dollars. Finally spoke with the main manager. They attempted to make things right with complimentary champagne to our room and two breakfasts, but it took me telling them over and over this would never happen at a rival hotel to get this concession. We switched rooms our second night there...the first room was in the main building the bathroom was antiquated. The second room in the Tower was much nicer and what one would expect at a Hilton. All in all, I would not stay here again. While taking care of our bill we overheard a conversation about similar issues of unexplained charges, etc. While management attemepted to right the situation, the experience simply left a bad impression on me of the Hilton. It was not the service I would have expected. And lines to check in were always long, it appeared only two clerks were working at any given time to check in people. I will not stay nor recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: doublel107
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I was nervous I might not enjoy my stay at the Caribe Hilton. Well, those nerves disappeared the moment our taxi pulled up. The view from the entrance of the hotel of the ocean and infinity pool is amazing. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. The beach is not the best on the island but it's a good place to just lay out. There are so many places to just chill out and enjoy the view. The pool by the garden is always empty if you want to relax in peace. Check in was fine and there were no lines. We had one of the garden view rooms in the newly renovated wing. The room was very clean and well decorated. All the basic essentials provided. However, there is no bathtub only a standing shower, which I didn't mind. The view from our third floor room wasn't great. All I could see were some trees in the garden and the back of the Lemon Grass restaurant. I asked for an ocean view prior to my stay but the woman at the front desk told me I had a newly renovated room so I decide to stay where I was. There were several minor problems with our room. First, the shower had a odd/ faint smell of throw-up. I'm not really sure what the smell was but I saw the maid clean our shower several times we were there. Second, the ceiling had a small leak from the air conditioner but we didn't inform the front desk til check out because we didn't want them fixing it during our stay like they did with the third problem...our broken/jammed door. But none of these problems really bothered us. I don't know if we didn't let all the small things get to us because we enjoyed everything else the hotel has to offer or if we're just laid back people. Whatever the case, it really is a beautiful hotel. I will definitely recommend it to my friends and family. Especially, those with kids. P.S. The food is expensive but not excessive. We spent more eating out in Old San Juan than we did ordering room service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Get-A-Way”
Reviews.Author: Sherwood-99
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Caribe Hilton, it is absolutely beautiful !! I highly recommend this hotel, it is very close to Old San Juan and the airport. I went just to relax by the beach, shop and to enjoy the spa. The beach was amazing and the staff was wonderful. The one gray area was the Olas Spa, I would not recommend going. The services are mediocore and overpriced - I was very disappointed with the experience and would suggest you not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “awesome is all i have to say”
Reviews.Author: mcmelton2
Reviews.Content: We read several reviews and i have to say we had a blast. We stayed in the villas and they were beautiful and i cant wait to go back again. I highly recommend this hotel. i loved the private beach , yes the drinks were expensive but it was worth it. If you go to Peurto Rico plan to spend some money, we were there on our honeymoon ...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 3 Day Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Klikbek
Reviews.Content: Right after our wedding, we planned three days in San Juan at the Caribe Hilton. When we first arrived, we were greeted with a congratulations on our recent wedding and we were upgraded to a villa. The room was beautiful and we had a gorgeous view of the ocean, Condado Bay and Forte San Cristobal. When we arrived back in our room after dinner, we were greeted with champagne and chocolates. Since my husband is an Hilton Honours member, we thoroughly enjoyed the breakfasts in the executive lounge and the happy hour in the evening. We were both very pleased when we were served Crown Royal Canadian Rye and quite heavily-handed too! At the Madrid-San Juan restaurant, we had the best paella we have ever had. It was so good that we went back on our last night to have more! You definitely can't beat the Pina Colada's here...they are the best! The hotel grounds are very well kept and the pool and private beach are great for lounging. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we have planned to go back this coming November!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: GATraveljunkies
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for two nights to attend a conference. I arrived in the late evening, and the reception was very helpful and attentive. The meeting rooms were fine as meeting rooms go, and the hotel-catered meals were good. The staff were all very pleasant and friendly. I was in a king room on the 16th fllor in the tower area. The room had an excellent bathroom - oversized walk-in shower and nice amenities. The room was a nice size, and included a balcony that overlooked the beach. The grounds were beautiful. My only complaint would be the disco that went on until about 1am in the pool area, which was loud enough to hear in my room on the 16th floor. Internet service was available in the room for a nominal fee (~$15 for 24 hours). I was not able to access WIFI service in the common areas, but that wasn't a big problem. Overall, it was a very enjoyable stay for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected pleasure”
Reviews.Author: replouis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ventured to San Juan for a conference that being held at the Caribean Hilton. Upon our arrival we found the property to be more beautifully tropic than expected. The lobby was open ended with an exquisite entrance to the main hote and shops. The bar area extended out the doors into the pool area complimented with palm trees, a beautiful view of the beach and ocean. I had reviewed the hotel before our departure from home and knew their prices for beverages and food would be quite expensive. We found several stores and a nice restaurant, El Calambron, within walking distance so if you wanted to venture out and not take a taxi to Old San Juan, you could do quite nicely. A twelve dollar taxi ride got you to Old San Juan which had a plethera of shops and restaurants to suit any palate. We took a snorkling trip on a catamaran and were picked up and delivered at our hotel; it was great. We are looking forward to another trip, God willing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller999
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in a king suite and absolutely loved it. Our room overlooked the water. The beds were amazingly comfortable, the bathroom was luxurious and the amenities were excellent. The hotel has a great pool area w/ a swim up bar as well as a hot tub. The beach was wonderful and the water was clean and calm. Beach chairs were comfortable and they have hammocks as well. Also, in water they had this huge inflated rock climbing 'igloo' that was a lot of fun. The only hiccup of our stay was a ridiculously long wait one night to get our car out of the garage. It's not a cheap hotel, but it's definitely worth the money! Also, while you're in PR, I highly recommend a restaurant called Miro Marisqueria. Great food and not expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Albeit Expensive, Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louis59
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is likely the nicest of all of the large, major chain hotels in the San Juan area. Situated perfectly between the airport, Condado, and Old San Juan, it occupies a point of land that gives the feeling of an oasis amidst the bustling San Juan area. My room was in the â€œmainâ€� or â€œoriginalâ€� building and was just what I was looking for. While none of the rooms actually face directly out over the sea, all rooms in the building have angled end walls and small balconies, so everyone enjoys a combination â€œocean viewâ€� and a view of either the Condado beach area or over the adjacent Normandie hotel, with Old San Juan in the distance. The room was very large, and included a large, flat screen TV (although not a high-def signal), refrigerator, coffee maker, and combo AM/FM/CD/auxiliary clock radio. Cabled HSIA is available for an additional $14.95 charge per day. The room was spotless, and the a/c more than adequate. The bathroom is large and well appointed, although not overly luxurious. The Food & Beverage department of this hotel may be its low point. Lunch service at the Italian restaurant was painfully slow, and prices at all of the on-site restaurants are high. Getting a bartender at the lobby bar to even make eye contact is a challenge, let alone obtaining prompt service! On the other hand, the breakfast buffet was good and well-stocked. Dinner at the on-site Mortonâ€™s Steakhouse was up to Mortonâ€™s standards, but again, very pricy. There is a Starbucks on site, offering the usual coffee and related beverage choices, as well as pastries and Puerto Rican sandwiches. We found a Subway restaurant just a block away, which made for far less-expensive lunches. The pool is inviting, but not overly large. There is a well-designed play area for children, and the hotel has its own small beach, protected by a breakwater. Service at the hotelâ€™s front desk and concierge areas was first rate. Overall, the hotel is a very inviting, well operated, but somewhat pricy choice for lodging in the San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family with small child”
Reviews.Author: krazyfool
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for my husband and I with our 3 year old son. The grounds were beautiful. The beach was very calm, protected from waves by a wall of rocks, and lots of shallow water for little ones to enjoy. The water was clear so you could see the fish swimming around as you were swimming. The hotel also had rafts and beach toys to use, some free of charge. The pools were wonderful too, and very clean. Our son also loved strolling the grounds looking at the iguanas, lizards, swans, peacock and other wildlife in the gardens. As other reviews had mentioned,the food was expensive if you ate there, but it was pretty good, and I did not think it was too outrageously priced for a resort. We did have a few occasions to call maintenance and houskeeping about things that had been overlooked, and always got a quick response. I do wish there were more of a variety of restaurants/shops within a short walking distance of the hotel. We did walk to Old San Juan one day (2 miles) and to the Condado one day (about 1 mile). We had gotten a rate of $109/night through hotwire, and were very pleased to see that our room had a balcony and a great view of the ocean and a balcony. It was much more than we were expecting. I had read reviews of others having problems with the hotel not being able to find their reservations when they got there, and we did meet other families when we were there that had the same problem, but that was not our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome,warm weather,untouched beauty”
Reviews.Author: grltrvln
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Caribe was a skeptical one. I am an avid reader of hotel reviews and a very picky hotel guest. After my actual arrival, I fell in love. The rooms were very clean and anything that was needed was just a phone call away. I loved the pool party and the music. The rooms were modern and the ocean view from the balcony was priceless. The conciere was very helpful and all of the people were welcoming. I must've downed a thousand Pina Colada's, they are very tasty. Though this hotel and the restaurants are not cheap, Whaddaya expect?! It's a vacation PEOPLE!! They were not that bad, I've had far less and paid far more. The food was excellent and it was a vacation to remember. The Plaza Las Americas is a must see..that is what took all of my $$$!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: dinos_p
Reviews.Content: Spending our holidays in a beautiful city like San Juan was a wonderful experience for me and my friend. In addition to that, our hotel was in the very heart of the city, walking distance some interesting spots and a 10 minute driving to old San Juan. Hilton Caribe excelled our expectations, the service was superb and our room was spacious and elegant. One can even sunbath from the balcony. The view from most of the rooms were breath taking. The hotel is set on its own stretch of private beach accessed from the hotel basement. You have to show your room key to collect fresh beach towels as you exit. And lastly, the staff was very nice and helpful - always smiling... I really recommend this hotel to anyone who intend to visit the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible service, very expensive dining options”
Reviews.Author: westvafam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Caribe for 5 nights for an anniversary trip from late May through early June 2009. Upon arrival, we waited in a very long, slow line for check-in, only to be told that the hotel did not have our reservation information. We were quickly sent to an "ocean view" room, which we had paid additional for upon booking. The room we received was in the "Villas". It was a beautiful room, but was NOT an oceanview. It was a Lagoon/inlet view with scenes of the bay, skyscrapers, and construction vehicles, like cranes! NOT the view we had paid extra to have!! See our photo labelled "villa room". Additionally, the room did not have a balcony, as advertised. There was a ledge approximately 12 inches wide to stand on. If you turned your head to the extreme left, there was a sliver of ocean visible--- apparently where they got that it was an "ocean view". We contacted our travel agent, who efficiently arranged for us to be moved to another room, in the Tower building. We waited for two hours in the lobby for this room because the front desk clerk told us that the room was waiting to be inspected by the housekeeping manager. Our original room keys had already been taken, so we were forced to sit in the lobby and await the new room. We were told that the bell hops would take our bags, but not to a secured area. Rather, they keep a large area in the middle of the lobby stacked with suitcases around the clock. Not secured. Not under constant surveillance (and next to the taxis!), which we were not comfortable with AT ALL. At the end of the two hours, our travel agent again called the desk. The same person at the desk "assisted us" and was extremely rude. No apologies for the fact that we'd spent two hours when she had initially told us to come back in 15 minutes... not once, but three times! This time, the office manager immediately gave us keys to an ocean front room. Our room was on the 20th floor and faced the ocean. It was a great room and we woke to spectacular views every day. The private beach was more of a moat than a beach. It is walled off from the ocean, so snorkeling is obviously very limited. The pool was very nice size, although not very clean. The swim up pool bar closed before the sun went down every day, even on the weekend, even though the pool was still opened. Additionally, we had to sign in and sign out beach towels daily under the threat that our credit card would be charged $20 per towel if we did not comply. Each day there was confusion about where to do this? The cabana outside or the front desk. The trips to the front desk meant ALWAYS waiting in a long line and unfriendly service. High speed internet service was a whopping $15/day. Don't buy it! Go to starbucks and get online for FREE. The location was great and we were able to walk to the bus which took us into Old San Juan. In fact, we walked from the hotel to El Morro at the far point in Old San Juan. If you stay in the hotel, consider the bus as decent transportation. It costs only 75 cents to ride to Old San Juan, whereas a taxi costs $12. We went on the snorkeling excursion and had a blast! We met a lot of fun people, had lunch and (weak) drinks on board. It cost $89 each, which included the boat ride, equipment use, transportation, lunch and drinks. Our bus driver was awful, complained about the US the entire way home... but that is the bus company, not the fault of the excursion company. The Bacardi factory tour was fun, BUT don't pay at the hotel for the excursion... take the 75 cent bus and then the 50 cent water taxi. You can catch a 3 dollar taxi at the dock. This will save you about $49 dollars per person! As a side note, the little restaurant across the street and to the left from the dock in Catano has excellent pizza (when you want a reasonable, fast meal) and the staff was extremely friendly and happy to have us! We ate in two of the restaurants at the Hilton, as well as ordered room service. Breakfast in Palmeras was very good, lots of options, including the ability to mix a mimosa. It cost us $26 pp for the breakfast buffet, but we felt it was worth it. After breakfast, we would be able to skip lunch and then eat dinner. We had Mortons one time while staying in the Hilton. It was very pricey, $50 for a steak which DID NOT include a salad or side dish! Those were an additional $10-14 each! The food was very good, but not better than we can have in our local steakhouse and Mortons was more than twice as expensive. Room service was prompt, but pricey. $73 for two sandwiches and dessert. Overall, we would not recommend the HIlton Caribe to our friends and family. Although the location was great, the service was awful. The staff was very short with us... what we would expect in NYC, not in the Caribbean at a vacation destination. The food was expensive. The pool bar closed before the sun went down. No one went out of their way to apologize for inconveniences we encountered or to provide us good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 01SouthEasterN
Reviews.Content: General comments, The Hotel was clean and well kept. Rooms were nice, comfortable and clean. I did notice that the hallways were in need of minor repairs. The pools were nice but needed to be cleaned at times there were leaves and stuff that blew into the pool, which I'm sure is very natural especially since there were a few trees near by. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, they did have a buffet but we ordered off the menu either way it was expensive. We also ate at Mortons which is at the hotel, which was also very expensive. To begin with It was a bit confusing when driving into the entrance of the hotel. We use the valet parking service, which was very slow when you needed to get your car and go.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously Expensive and what about service??”
Reviews.Author: jrhp
Reviews.Content: One night in a two beds room was $189... yeah but adding hotel fee and tax was much more than $200. This price is just to sleep, nothing else. No breakfast, no water, no coffee... It have like 3 restaurants inside but veeery expensive all of them. It have a cute pool and bar area where a little "piÃ±a colada" cost you $13 plus tax... The worst: Valet Parking is more that $21 pear day and if you want to use your car you need to wait a minimum of 20 to 30 minutes to get you car. If you choose the normal parking, it is 19 per day and is faaaar away form the hotel. I think the prices are stupid and for more than $200 a night I would expect to have at least a piece of bread in the mornings and a good valet parking service(because I'm paying!!) Caribe Hilton really sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: coconor123
Reviews.Content: http://www.cruisemates.com/articles/ports/sanjuan.cfm This was our bible for old san juan. Follow this advice, its super accurate and helpful. Practically no complaints about the hotel. Just please refill the water in the lobby more often! Bring your own tennis equipment and you can play for free on 3 great courts at the hotel otherwise you have to rent. ask the front desk for the wireless password in the lobby and you'll be set to surf the web. Tips to save money: La bombonera on calle sanfransico in old san juan has a killer mallorca, and is cheap. Hotel has a starbucks and subway across the street which isnt too pricey. If you go less than half a mile east on calle ponce de leon, there is a Pueblo grocery store to stock up on cheap eats, and drugs stores to get sun screen ect. Bug spray didnt seem necessary even in teh rain forest even though we bought some.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a place”
Reviews.Author: querqus
Reviews.Content: the hotel was just like the photos and descriptions on their website. The staff was exceptional, professional and friendly, the price was much more than anticipated, but probably within "normal resort pricing" but my husband and I don't have the opportunity to travel too often, so we were taken aback on the cost of EVERYTHING! It took abit of the fun out of the trip, but we didn't let it ruin the day. Just know that a Pina Colada (their signature drink) is small and 13.00. By walking into Old San Juan we were able to enjoy the day without going bankrupt. The views were spectacular..would definitely stay here again, but would better prepare for the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Grand for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: liked_copper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before departing on our cruise. It is a huge hotel and really reminded me of a high rise flat complext. The room was fine, clean and a nice view of the sea. Checking out was a nightmare! I don't understand how they can be so slow. The beach and pool area was nice, would I like to stay here for a holiday - NO, but it did fine as a stop off for the cruise. Old San Juan was beautiful and we spent an evening and day down there such a pretty place.

Reviews.Title: “Near enough to old town”
Reviews.Author: YnkkaStrider
Reviews.Content: Me and my better half wanted to see the old San Juan. We choose Caribe Hilton due to it is situated near old town and it had reasonable rates. We stayed there one week and at two different rooms. The staff was good, they knew what they were doing and were friendly. Rooms were quite good, but old. There were lots of signs of hard using and disregards. But the bed was amazing! The other room had just weirdly planned bathroom.... Restaurants at the hotel were really good. The beach was nice but at some point there were too many people at the same time, and the children are quite noisy=) The interior, reception, lobby, beach and park were clean and beautiful! Thanks also for the great staff at reception, concierge, Starbuck's and the amazing parrots!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business travel, mediocre for vacation because its expensive”
Reviews.Author: MB3448
Reviews.Content: The ambiance is modern and swanky with its latin jazz and its decor. It is very hip but it leaves a lot to be desired because there isnt much to do besides over pay for drinks. So you will probably venture out to Condado (shopping/dining/gambling/clubs) which can be walked. Or take a 12dollar taxi to Old San Juan(shopping/dining/gambling/clubs). So that being said the location is good. And any day trip can be booked at the hotel (El Yunque, Bacardi...). Another positive is that the pool and beach were not overcrowded and were decent enough size and decent quality. I have also stayed here for business which was excellent because I expensed everything. :) Which meant I was eating at Mortons where there is no Filet Mignon Mofongo.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dragonlittle1979
Reviews.Content: I stay here every single time I come to Puerto Rico. The open lobby is beautiful and the front desk, concierge and bellhop staff are very pleasant and helpful. Checking in is usually fairly quick for us and we have never had any problems with our reservations. The rooms are always nicely kept and always have all the basics (hair dryer, iron, coffee maker, etc). The view of the Atlantic Ocean is absolutely beautiful and we almost always have a view of the garden. The housekeeping staff has always been so nice and kind to us, and they always keep us stocked with towels and such. The location of the hotel is perfect for us because it is located right between Old San Juan and the city of San Juan (which includes Isla Verde and Condado). Old San Juan is about a 5 minute drive to the west and Isla Verde/Condado is about a 10 minute walk to the west. I really have no complaints about this hotel. I love it and will continue to visit every year.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: LaDuquesa
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I would recommend it to anyone. Its very clean, staff is very professional and nice. The hotel being located right on the beach was a plus, the pool was beautiful. I loved everything about it. Im looking for a good price on it now because I want to stay again now in July. Its close to all main attractions and valet was also great an inexpensive. I forgot my camera in the room and while I was at the counter checking out room service called front desk to make sure I didnt leave because the found my camera. This hotel is A++++ and families with children would also enjoy this hotel Room was spacious and in lobby they offer free wifi,

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is NOT child friendly”
Reviews.Author: LongerKG
Reviews.Content: The balcony door on our room would not close, so the room was hot, noisy and potentially extremely dangerous. I was given another room but had to move everything myself, leaving the baby unattended. The final straw was having to leave an elevator (even though we were in there first) and wait for the next one because the bellboy kept crashing the luggage trolley into the stroller, eventually waking the baby. The bell-boy never uttered a word, let alone apologise.

Reviews.Title: “A good pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: adawosdi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe one night pre-cruise. The pool and beach area were perfect for my 8 year old to play prior to going out on the town in the evening. Check in was a little slow. The lobby was beautiful though. And yes, there is a Starbucks right there. I did have two margaritas from the pool bar. They were expensive but very good. There is a mini mart across the street. We ate at The Parrot Club in Old Town. Our room was dated, clean. It was suppose to be an ocean view room...and while I could see the ocean-I had to look at the roof of another building too. (Disappointing). For breakfast we followed other ta suggestions and went to Subway. The bell hop made an excellent suggestion of going to the pier and dropping off our luggage and then visiting the Castillo San Felipe del Morro. The taxi rates are set now based on zone. There was a difference at times though...usually a dollar or two more. If we were to depart from San Juan for another cruise we would stay here. I do not think I would stay here for a weeks vacation.

Reviews.Title: “$7.50 for a local bottle of beer at the bar”
Reviews.Author: PILOT199
Reviews.Content: Way over priced. I think we all expect to pay a little more for food and drinks when we stay at hotels, especially at "resorts", but $17.00 for a hamburger. WOW..... Nice pool and beach area. Room were run down and musty. Service was typical for the caribbean. "ISLAND TIME" Much better places to stay in P.R.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, some hidden charges, services/food overpriced-but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytraveler1
Reviews.Content: Bad: Hotel will add a $14/day resort fee at the end of your stay which is not clearly apparent. Drinks/food/services are expensive. They charge for internet access in the rooms-$15/day, although wireless in the main lobby is free. There is a charge for using the phones in the room-even if local calls. Good: The facilities here are beautiful-one of the nicest hotels/resorts I have stayed. Staff was pleasant and allowed us to check in early. Room was clean and nice but was really nothing special in particular. Nightly rate on Priceline was very reasonable. There are much more reasonable restaurants within walking distance. Overall: Definitely would stay again if I obtained another good rate on Priceline. I would recommend this hotel to a friend. On a side note, if you don't want to get overcharged by the taxi services in San Juan, agree on a price beforehand with the driver and you won't have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach”
Reviews.Author: jacquelinetravel
Reviews.Content: My my mother, aunt and i stayed at this hotel after a recommendation by my travel agent. Upon arrival, the reception desk and lobby are beautiful. But the actual check-in was painful. We requested 2 full beds and a cot- which was printed on my reservation. Apparently they do not provide cots, due to fire-codes. I was given the option to check out another room, but after the 5 min walk over to the villas (which is just another room- nothing fancy) i told them it was too far away. After an hour of sitting in the lobby, we were given 2 rooms in the main building, but had to pay $100/night for the extra room! Overall if you're looking for a quick trip to puerto rico, the hotel has a beaufiul pool/beach area. Much bigger than the Ritz by the airport. Beware, the breakfast buffet is $25/person which i tought was a bit much- but you can ask for a to-go container and have some food for later. There is a door to Mortons steakhouse in the lobby and their food is just as good as their NYC location- but be prepared to spend. I had a late flight home and they held our bags while we used the pools & beach. They were filming a disney movie during the time we were there, but it didn't bother us as much as other guests who kept complaining. The grounds are pretty, but if you're looking for luxury, i'd stick with the smaller Ritz. There are several actitives a day which gave it that cruise ship feel, but also kept you entertained if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 with Ritz-Carlton prices”
Reviews.Author: clatoo
Reviews.Content: Literally just checked out less than 12 hours ago. I have quite a bit to share. If you have no expectations, then go to this hotel. If you are expecting a palatial resort with more amenities than you can shake a stick at with the personnel to boot, don't do it. I had an early check-in. The front desk was VERY helpful getting me in before the allowed 4:00 (room was ready at 3:15). Gerardo escorted me to room 738, but he asked to enter first to make sure it was up to par. It wasn't. The A/C unit had no cover & there were visible wires. He apologized profusely, got us another room and then sent a bottle of champagne for our troubles. Hello!? I was happy. Tired from the flight and hungry, we checked out the room service menu. I had read the reviews on prices, but I was NOT expecting a $23 sammich. I was starving, I ordered it, and it was the last day I ate room service. Pool was nice although I never got in it. The Beach was also nice. But "nice" isn't what I paid for. My hopes were WAY to high and I was expecting something a little more than what I got. Two words: Rocky & Man-made. Although there were no children in my party, the kids seemed to enjoy the iceberg & trampoline. Service at the pool and/or deck was POOR. After the 1st day, I found it hard to believe anyone worked in that area. On the second day, I timed the appearance of a CH employee on the deck. There was a 3 hour delay and the hotel was not even full. It was cloudy and there weren't many people in the area. Third day, went to get a towel from the towel stand (which by the way you sign for and have to return by 6 or they charge you $20 PER towel), I was greeted by a sign. Yep a sign that said the stand opened up an hour before yet not a single soul was protecting these rather valuable towels. I grabbed 2 towels & laid out. I did not see anyone for another 45 minutes. Yes, I had on my watch. The spa- I don't even no where to start. Seriously. My massage was more like a rub-you-doen-in-oil session. I know what a massage is supposed to feel like. What I paid $150 for in San Juan was something I do every night when I get out of the shower. I treated myself to a pedicure, her name was Ana and she was fabulous! The salon area is lacking. Not a wide range of polishes and magazines from December '08. I am not picky I just believe in the value of a dollar! The sauna was nice if you avoided the top, right bench which was broken into pieces. The ladies steam room well......that was scary. The paint is peeling from the ceiling, the moisture collects on these hanging pieces and it BURNS real bad if you don't know it is coming. Trust me. I stood in the doorway rather than sit. It was the only place that didn't have boiling raindrops falling on my head and skin. If you want to try these out for yourself, then it is free if you are receiving a treatment. Otherwise, expect to pay $20. What you read about high prices here is true. I paid $7.50 for a brush at the Sundry store. My husband bought a toothbrush for $6.50. We knew this going in but were amazed at the prices. Oh, how can I forget the $10 pina colada in a plastic cup? Classy! There was a young male concierge working who spent more time on his iPhone than one probably should if they are there to assist. There is a young female concierge who promised to call me back Wednesday night. (I was stranded in Old San Juan there was not a taxi in sight, I called her). She hasn't returned my call yet. Which brings me to another point, I had a member of the front desk promise to call me back last night. Never happened. Instead, two hours later, I went down to the desk. There were 2 trainees manning to fort. They had no clue what the devil I was talking about. This property is too big and understaffed. Please be advised, that once I realized the minimart sold items for cheaper, I would walk over. I did this more than once and each time I encountered a strange individual on Hilton's property. The first man just made me nervous. He did not appear to be a guest and followed me into the Subway. The second was an elderly gentleman who tried to sell me some ice. Yeah. Some ice on the Hilton lot. I also met a couple staying at the Normandie next door. They told me that they preferred the Hilton to their hotel and came over (each day) for b'fast, hang out in lobby and on the beach. Now, I'm sure these were nice people but Hilton, really? Security? Oh, and last but certainly NOT least for those of us who <3 our internet. Internet is free as a bird in the hotel lobby 24 hours a day! This increases the number of lobby loungers throughout the day. For a small fee of $14.95/day you can have internet access in your room. (I was there 4 days, my internet doesn't cost that much per month). I will not return here. I am used to service, attention, and better kept common areas (did I mention the dead fish in the pond? or the bathroom off of the lobby? YIKES!). For the money that was spent, I am left to wonder what exactly did I pay for.....

Reviews.Title: “It using Hilton Points good deal, otherwise seek out other hotel options”
Reviews.Author: twosassyk
Reviews.Content: I had read all of the reviews prior to taking our trip to Puerto Rico and booking the Caribe Hilton. I used Hilton points for the stay and was the highest tier status Hilton has at that time. We went over Valentine's Day and President's Day for a long Thurs - Monday stay. We were Not upgraded to the Hilton tower for preferred members so I can not speak to those rooms or that bldg in particular. Our room was on the 7th floor and it was somewhat out dated in the carpet and furniture, but not awful. When vacationing at a resort one expects the food, drinks and restaurants to be somewhat more costly than the average off site restaurant. But saying this we felt that this resort was outrageous! We paid $14 with tip at the pool bar for a Pina Colada in a 10 oz plastic cup. A burger with a side of fries and water was $21 before tip and it was not huge or the best by any means. We had the free breakfast buffett for the preferred Hilton members and that is the only meal we ate at the resort. We walked to the store at the entrance of the hotel daily for Subway for lunch and adult beverages. I thought the walk would be long since the hotel was on 17 acres but it was very close. The concierge resources were very helpful and went out of their way to make sure we got the reservations and types of food and restaurants we requested. The beach area was not anything what we were used to from the Carribean or Mexico. It was somewhat murkey and more like a man made beach at a lake or state park in the United States. The majority of the coast line along the hotel was sharp rocks, so the only option for getting into the ocean was the small man made area. This was not appealing so after checking this out we did not use this area of the resort. The pool area is nice but the way it is set up with the waterfall there is not as much deck area as one would expect. Luckily each day we were able to secure two lounge chairs side by side without much effort and we did NOT go out to the pool by 8 am - more like 9:30 ish. The drink service around the pool area is good, frequent , but expensive. I was not overly impressed, but not so disappointed that it ruined our weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Caribe Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: loolz
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Caribe Hilton! We stayed at the resort for one night before embarking on a Caribbean Cruise in December of 2008. Before we arrived at the hotel, I emailed them to let them know that we would likely be arriving a little earlier than check-in time (arriving around 12:30-1pm instead of 4pm, which is check-in time). I received a prompt email response telling me not to worry, that they would be able to have the room ready for then. When we arrived at the hotel, they had our room all ready for us and got our room keys right away. The hotel lobby is beautiful - there are parrots, some complimentary water with fresh fruit, and some shops. Also, there is a Starbucks right on site (very important for coffee lovers!) as well as some restaurants, a bar, etc. Our room was very clean; the bathroom was very spacious. Our only complaint about the bathroom is that the towels tended to leave some fuzzies on your body after you bathed - an incredibly minor complaint! You know it is a good hotel when all you have to complain about are the towels! Our room had a fabulous balcony that had a great view of the hotel grounds overlooking the ocean. Absolutely beautiful! The grounds had a wonderful area that was a sanctuary to some fish and birds. It was a very relaxing area. We didn't end up using any of the pools or the beach at the hotel, but it looked like a great place to relax and swim. We ate at the Italian Restaurant on site and even though it was a tad expensive, the service was excellent and the food was delicious. The buffet breakfast had a lot of options as well, including many hot foods. All in all, the Caribe Hilton was a great way to relax after a long flight before we boarded a cruise, and it also seemed like a great place for a longer vacation in Puerto Rico. I would highly recommend it to anyone! If you would like to see more images, you can check out my travel blog: http://poolieandloolie.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: leeleemarie
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights during the week after Easter and we (me, husband, 2 kids ages 8 and 11) had a very enjoyable, relaxing time. Yes, what a few other reviewers have said is true.. the restaurants and bars are very expensive. We followed some others advice listed here and frequented the Subway and the minimart/liquor store across the street in order to save a few dollars. With taxes and resort fees included our cost per night for a standard ocean view room was around $230 and this included the breakfast buffet. We certainly did not find the food here to be inedible- there was a very large selection of breakfast items, fruits, juices.. also an omelet station. Our kids loved it! Also ate at Mortons, food was very good and it is very expensive and no kids menu, but the waiter (really nice, funny guy) accomodated us by splitting one entree for the 2 kids. Same for the Italian restaurant (there is a childrens menu here but my kids again split an adult entree) although I would rate the food as just good. Service can be a bit too "relaxed", particularly the housekeeping (no washcloths), but we never once felt that we were being treated rudely. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful - if you greeted people with a smile and a friendly attitude, it would be returned. The room itself was a bit worn and "oceanview" isn't exactly what you would expect since you're looking at the water at an angle and because of the unusual layout of the hotel, we were actually looking down at the front lobby. Street noise would make it's way up to our balcony but didn't interfere with sleeping. Beds were comfortable and room was clean. Loved the grounds, esp. the various options for lounging (hammocks, lounge chairs, wicker "beds") and the kids absolutely loved the pool. The hot tubs could have been a bit hotter. Again, the drinks at the outdoor bar are pricey, but the Pina Coladas and the Mojitos were very tasty! Only spent one morning at the beach - the kids preferred the pool. It is only a short taxi ride ($12) to Old San Juan. Loved the forts, restaurants (Cafe Puerto Rico- 2 thumbs up, Parrot Club -great coconut mojito) and shops. Also, rented a car (from Payless across from the hotel) and went to El Yunque to hike down to LaMina falls and go swimming - highly recommended. Finally- we went a snorkeling/catamaran excursion in Fajardo on the Salty Dog Catamaran (there are discount coupons at the concierge desk). What a fabulous time we all had. The captain and crew were very friendly and helpful. Great food, great drinks, warm turquoise water.... wish I was still there.....

Reviews.Title: “Calm beach and great for doing nothing”
Reviews.Author: Ready2Go2008
