Reviews.Content: Because this classic hotel is set at the back of a cove with a breakwater, the water is very very calm. The sand is lovely - it's a great place for people who don't want undertows. There is shade under a grove of palm trees but also lots of sun elsewhere. The unbrellas are free. The Asian Fusion restaurant is excellent; the Spanish and Italian ones are OK but nothing to write home about. And, as noted by others, the food is expensive. The lunch menu at the beach is limited - pretty boring by the end of the week- and almost everything comes with fries. If the food improved and they put a muffler over the aircondition this would be a 5 star plus hotel. As noted in other reviews, many rooms look out on the air conditioning. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby but it's very hard to find a free plug if you have weak batteries.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property ... Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: TrvlingGuy
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this property are very nice. It is an older hotel that has been maintained & upgraded nicely. We had a room on the 5th floor of the "Garden Wing". It was nicely furnished and had looked out over the lagoon. The pool and grounds are beautiful and calming. There were plenty of lounge chairs by the pool and the beach. The main problem with this property is the service. It charges like a high-end resort but has the service level of a low-end property. The sink in our bathroom had hot water coming out of both sides of the faucet. This was reported to the front desk every day of our 5-day stay but was never fixed. One day, the housekeeping staff forgot to leave us additional soap for the shower (we were out of soap). We asked at the front desk, more was delivered but were charged a fee at check-out for a revisit from housekeeping! In the 3 days that we laid out by the pool, no one ever came by to see if we wanted a drink or needed anything. This is especially amazing since this is where most resorts make a lot of money. The food at the property is practically inedible. The first morning we went for breakfast and the only option was the buffet. We paid over $60 for 2 and had to go to Starbucks afterwards to find something to eat. The next evening, we were in the same restaurant for a late snack. We ordered a burger & chicken sandwich and 2 drinks. After paying over $58 for this, we again found the food inedible. Needless to say, we never ate at the property again. Every morning, the hotel puts out 3 lovely, glass serving vessels of water in the lobby with various fruits in them for their guests. After a couple of hours, the water is gone and they sit there all day empty and no one ever refills them. This is a perfect example of what is wrong with this property. When these things were called to the attention of a Manager, we were told that the hotel spends $25M a year on training. It sure seems to be wasted as no one is paying attention.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: hlmhrt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently were in Puerto Rico and had 5 hours to kill before our filght home.Â  We had just left a cruise and the flight was late in the day.Â  We decided to stop by the Hilton Caribe because we wanted to check out the property and have lunch.Â  I had read on Trip Advisor that the property was nice but the staff was rude and the rooms needed updating.Â  Well, we stopped by and proceeded to head toward the restaurant.Â  We were stopped and were told we need a pass from the front desk.Â  We went to the front desk and we were told they don't have day passes.Â  When I explained I wasn't looking for a day pass, but just wanted to go to the restaurant for lunch we were told the hotel restaurant was for guests only.Â  The other main dining room didn't open until 4pm.Â  Now, who ever heard of a hotel turning away guests for their restaurant at lunch.Â  I never did.Â  However, this hotel told us to leave and we were not welcome unless we were staying there.Â  The staff at the front desk was rude to say the least.Â  On top of this, I am a HIlton Honors member and stay there all the time.Â  They just turned away a member of their elite club.Â  We had planned to spend money both in the restaurant and then would have went to the casino to kill a few more hours.Â  Once asked to leave, we decided to go over to the Marriott where we had no problem with eating lunch and visiting the casino.Â  We probably spent a coule of hundred dollars by the end of the day and the Hilton missed out on that revenue!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: irishfreak
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at the Hilton. Overall I would have to say it was a decent hotel but located in an area where I did not feel safe walking around outside the grounds. The hot tub was cold and that was a bummer b/c we love to enjoy that at night. There is a smaller pool with a hot tub that actually works over by the villas. We spent most of our time there because it was less crowded and the hot tub worked. The pools can be dirty. All 3 of our kids suffered from swimmers ear because of the dirty water in the kiddie pool. Met a lady on a tour who said she paid $125/night on priceline. That would be a great deal. We used honor points

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful”
Reviews.Author: Colorado3Travelers
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, elegant, friendly, courteous. Stayed 2 nights prior to departing on a cruise. Close to pier; however, hotel does not offer shuttle service from airport or to the pier. Always ask the price of the taxi service, varies. The pools were wonderful and the lagoon was fantastic. Do not eat breakfast at the hotel...the buffet is pricey..$25 p/person, but it was very good. Several restaurants onsight..ate evening meal at the restaurant by Tower C...wonderful food, a little pricey. Took a taxi to Old Town, clean, beautiful and full of history...a must when visiting. Our taxi driver gave the 3 of us a one hr guided tour of Old Town for $50. Will be returning for an extended stay, but will look for another hotel slightly cheaper than $300 p/nt.

Reviews.Title: “Review for traveling here w/kids - detailed”
Reviews.Author: vacaMomGA
Reviews.Content: Sorry very long - My family of 4 (3yr old & 10 yr old) visited the Hilton for 7 days beg. April 1st. Now we did pay the full price of $300per night so I am basing my review on that as well! We arrived and waited for our room only about an hour (we were early). We headed out to the grill next to the pool and had lunch - what a great start. The Mahi Mahi was perfect and only $16, we were not drinking much because of the kids, but did have to try the Pina Colada's (they originated at this hotel). They are $13 each. So if you are a drinker, you will blow some money! We first booked the villa for the kitchenette, but it looked straight onto a crane and the highway bridge, we changed to a standard room which was actually larger. They are filming a movie here (starring Johhny Depp) so all the villa suites and good rooms are taken. Room was ok, balcony was a little scary - did not let kids near it, railing was a little wobbly and very small. SUNBLOCK!!!! We reapplied but kids still got burned first day, the cool wind is very tricky, you don't realize how intense the sun is, we ended up reapplying every 30 mins to make sure. KIDS ACTIVITIES: The kids club (drop off club) was not open and did not get clear answer on what dates is was open, they do have an arcade and an area to play in the arcade. There is a trampoline in the ocean - must be able to swim well to get there, also a climbing iceberg. My 10 year old loved these. He loved to snorkle so it was fun for him, perfect beach for little ones, my 3 yr old had a blast making castles and the water is calm for her to splash around in. Pools were awesome! The paddle boats and water riders are $25 per 1/2hr. To much for us, but looked fun. Kids can feed fish off pier, there are swans, and peacocks, and coi fish near Lemongrass rest. On the website it offered 4 hrs of Nanny Service with package, glad i printed that off cause they said they no longer offer this, but did honor cause i had a copy of it. Nanny service is safe, but that's about it (she managed to rent 5 ppv movies w/in 4 hrs???? - concierge actually took 3 of the movies off our bill - which was very nice. (Nanny service is $25 per hour w/4 hr min) DINING - was good. Lemongrass was good. All others were awesome, Breakfast did run us $60 every morning until we found the Subway across the street and had breakfast that was good for $16. I suggest taking the kids across the street to subway for lunch a couple days and or am. Also, this sounds stupid but also take them to the liquor store across the street, it has soda, candy, chips, etc half the price of the hotel - we made daily trips there. Mortons Steak house was $300 for our dinner! and my 3 yr old did not order, she had some of mine. Not worth the money, was very good though, but your on vaca so you do what you can :) Kids only eat free and 1/2 price for hot dogs & Chicken fingers at the grill, and for breakfast. You pay full price everywhere else and they dont have kids menus at morton's, hence the 300 bill :) SERVICE - Very good, all were accommodating to kids and always friendly to us. **Take bus during day, only 3 min walk to stop and 50cents, but they dont take dollars must have change - it is safe ** Parrot club in Old San Juan was good dinner with kids **Cafe Puerto Rico in Old San Juan was awesome for lunch! **Domino's does deliver to Hilton :) Still $30 but that's cheap dinner there **Breakfast Avg - $60 **Lunch Avg - $60-80 **Dinner Avg - $80+ (norm was $120) I wanted to see more of Puerto Rico but all the kids wanted was beach and pool, so that is all we did. And i was ok with that, this trip was for them (their 1st plane ride also). Did not do any excursions, it was an hour ride away to get to boat docks, not up for that with the kids. They did not care anyway. Overall, was great time, would not return. Not because of Hotel or Hilton, but we would rather do an all-inlcusive somewhere else. All-inlcusive would be more budget friendly with kids. My husband travels everyweek and we have been to all inclusives so we do know what to expect from resorts and hotels, this was a very nice hotel overall just very expensive, but we knew that going into it :) Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience--just not a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: I rarely spend this much on a hotel, but we'd thought we'd splurge for a night of relaxing by the beach after our Caribbean cruise. I'm a Hilton HHonors Gold member, and reserved a standard ocean-view room, and received an ocean-view room from the new tower. The hotel consists of three parts: the old tower built in 1949, the new tower, and the time-share suites in a more secluded part of the hotel past the garden and duck ponds. I have to say this hotel really wowed me. It's a visual feast, almost on par with the Hilton Waikoloa Village on the Big Island (and unlike the Big Island's Hilton, the pool here is heated). Unlike most of Puerto Rico's beaches, which are public by law, this beach is man-made and private. There is a breakwater to keep the water calm and safe for the children, but I didn't find it made the water stagnant, unlike what other reviewers felt. The lobby was beautiful, with macaws and free fruit punch. The beach was beautiful, and there was a trampoline and "iceberg" in the water, which was harder to climb than it looks (I only made it half-way up, and I'm not fat). The drinks and pool-side food were not that expensive by luxury beach hotel standards. The mixed drinks were $10, including a Coco Loco made with 151-proof rum which will knock your socks off. We got a turkey wrap with fries for about $7--enough to share. The main pool is also beautiful, with a mini waterfall, and a wade-up bar. There is a pretty little garden with a duck pond, amply filled with blue dye for some reason (the swans' bellies were blue due to the dye). There are also a couple of peacocks and geese wandering in the area, as well as a centuries-old fort which is currently closed to the public, but nice to look at from the beach or rooms. Our room on the 13th floor was beautiful, with a nice balcony where we could sit in the evening sipping beers and watching the cruise ships leave for the eastern Caribbean. On our floor, we were a little too low to see over the old tower to the hotel beach, but we did have a good view of Condado, the fort, and the Conrad Hilton's beach. I had the sense that our place was nicer, although I have to say that I haven't stayed at the Conrad. I think one would have to be at least on the 15th floor to see over the old tower to this hotel's beach. The room was REALLY quiet--I didn't hear a peep from any neighbors--above, below, or to the side. The location is rather good in that it's within walking distance of both the Condado area and Old San Juan (about a mile or so in either direction). Although it's a bit of a walk, there are tons of great places to eat in either Condado or old San Juan, so we didn't eat at the hotel (except the free Continental breakfast buffet for Gold members). My only two complaints were fairly minor: (1) the drink/snack service to the beach was very infrequent--I don't know why, since I'm sure she earned plenty in tips, and (2) I wish they had made a bit of an effort to have our room ready by 3 PM, when we checked in at 10 AM. Yes, I realize they have until 3 PM to get our room ready, but since they knew we were there, they could have called housekeeping to ask them to speed things up. Well, with the resort fee, taxes, and internet, it came to over $300 for the night, which is quite pricey. That being said, I really like the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families”
Reviews.Author: beefsterNY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a relaxing stay at the Caribe Hilton. It's not the most beautiful beach on the island because it's man made, but it serves its purpose. There were plenty of beach chairs and loved that they drilled the umbrellas into the sand where you ask. Traveling with a 3-month old, I was worried that we would have to fight to find shade, but that wasn't the case. There were also a lot of different nooks to relax. It seemed that families with young children stayed on the beach, the college crowd hung out on the round dock and everybody else was pool or jetty side. I could see that as a plus if you're traveling with a large group and wanted to get some quiet time. Loved that kids under 12 eat free -- although the food isn't that good and way over priced as everyone has mentioned in their reviews. However, there is a free pina colada tasting at 1:00pm at the pool bar every day. If you don't mind virgins, they let you take as many as you want in tiny cups. Perfect size for the kids. Our room was okay. We booked a standard with points then upgraded to the junior suite upon arrival. The standard was just way too small for 2 adults, a 3-year old and a 3-month old. I saw in another review that the outlet in their wall was falling out with wires exposed. That was the case in our room as well. Wasn't too happy with housekeeping. They literally just made the bed and neglected to do turndown completely. One big plus ... the night we arrived our 3-year old woke in the middle of the night with a double ear infection. We called the front desk and they had a doctor in our room by 9:30 the next morning. We could have gotten a prescription from our home doctor, but it was good to have someone actually confirm the infection. The doctor did not speak English well, but my husband speaks Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton was a relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: lulou77
Reviews.Content: We were placed in the Hilton Honors tower on the 16th floor, with our balcony facing the ocean. If you are a Hilton honors member, included in your stay will be coupons for the Continental breakfast; which we enjoyed daily. I would park in the parking garage since it is not that far and we either took taxis or walked to most destinations. There is a $5 difference between valet and self park. If you have a car; you pay either way. The layout of the hotel had an open Carribbean feel to it. There is a Starbucks and several restaurants on site. The price of food and drinks was high. 2 beers cost us $16.00. Lunch one day on site was $64.00 which did include a couple of Pina Coladas. The computer in the business center was free the first 5 minutes and a charge assessed beyond. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced -- beautiful property but LOUSY service”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property -- some rooms nice, some very tired -- staff is indifferent, rude and service is lacking for a property charging so much for a room night

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: doodles740
Reviews.Content: Just returned with the family. We have two young children - access to the beach and toddler pools was very easy. We stayed in the Villas because of the kitchenette, though if we return, we will get a suite instead of a studio. The food was expensive, but the children did eat free for the most part. Check first, some of the hotel restaurants do charge for children under 5. The room was clean, though there was a lamp that was disconneted from the socket with wires hanging out. A bit scary because it was still plugged in. Other than that, the room was fine. Service was also good. The concierge was a very helpful resource for restauarnts outside of the hotel. I would really recommend a trip out to Old San Juan. There were only two drawbacks. The first was the children's playground. The description was no where near reality. It basically consists of a very small area of hard plastic shapes/slides. The second was the Disney movie they were filming the entire time of our stay. Access to several areas of the hotel were restricted which was a huge inconvience especially with small children who want to roam free. If I was made aware of this at the time I booked the trip, I would have stayed elsewhere. Overall though, we had an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: foody1000
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice lobby, good choice of restaurants, has beach, beautiful ocean views, ok service. Cons: I was disappointed when I saw my room. It looks fairly antiquated and needs to updated and remodelled. The doors, furniture, closets, and trims look old and weather. My room had a musty smell - probably because the previous customers left teh balcony door opened too long and the humidity got to the carpet and wood furniture. Probably not the hotel's fault but in any case, a musty room should not be assigned nonetheless. I would not stay here again. Hotel has no casino.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: barbaraUsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton recently for a medical conference. I must admit that I was not expecting much after reading the other reviews on Tripadvisor. I completely agree with most of the other reviews. The hotel is lovely, but in need of some updating. Most of the negatives are out of the hotel's control. It is within walking distance of Old San Juan, though we always took the public bus home after dark (50 cents) which dropped us off right behind our hotel. It is also close to the airport but not so close that the planes bother you. First of all, do not let them book you into the Condado Lagoon Villas. These are tired, worn out and dirty time share units that are far from the main complex, beach and pool. After seeing two of the units, I requested a regular hotel room in the Tower and was much happier. Our room on the ninth floor was large, clean and had a very modern updated marble walk in shower, but no bath. It had a view of the lagoon and the fort, but also overlooked the roof of the building below. Maid service was prompt and good. Room service was expensive, but delicious. We ordered off the "kids menu" and the portions were fine for adults. We did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants as they were very expensive, but did get sandwiches and bagels daily at the Starbucks in the lobby. We also found two very good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel--Atlantico and Escabron--which was right on the public beach. The concierge and the travel agents were very helpful with directions and excursions. We did kayaking in the Biobay with Island Kayak Adventures and Zip-lining in the rainforest with Ecoquest. The private beach was bigger than expected but not very clean. Lots of garbage in the water, including a used condom floating by!!! There is some snorkeling along the breakwater which had a nice variety of fish. The pool was nice and clean but cold. The hot tubs were also too cold to sit in for long at night. The gardens were lovely and well maintained. There is a nice gym and mini golf for the kids. Daily activities were posted but not well attended. There was absolutely no nightlife, and only one small bar in the lobby. If you wanted dancing or gambling you had to take a taxi elsewhere. Overall, it is a nice hotel in a good location for something like a conference. But if we return to Puerto Rico for a personal vacation, I would likely choose a smaller city and a nicer resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wet Theft”
Reviews.Author: dink2213
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and price but they were no help after my wife and I left our garment bags (with two suits and several dresses) in the closet. After checking out, we took a Royal Caribbean cruise and soon realized that our garment bags were absent (my wife had put the garment bags in the closet and I didn't realize it). We called the hotel and the concierge told us he would check on the missing bags immedeatley. Needless to say, the hotel never found our missing bags. I will never stay at this hoel again and I would recommend that if you stay here you keep an exact inventory of your luggage. An additional condemnation - The air conditioner in our room leaked all over the floor. Our room smelled like dry-rot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJSTeeter
Reviews.Content: We got the spa package which included facials, massages, manicures and pedicures. It also included a great breakfast buffet. We loved the private beach, the ocean trampoline, the climbing "iceberg" in the ocean, and the refreshing fruit water in the lobby. Our bedding was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and modern. The hotel is located a short taxi ride away from Old Town San Juan. We opted to walk instead because the traffic was terrible! We were unimpressed with the food or prices at the restaurants we tried at the hotel. Try something in San Juan instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: AnjanieN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in March 09 with a 2.5 year old child. The hotel was great for the price we paid ($100 a night on priceline). Experience broken down below: Check in - a breeze. we arrived at the hotel around 12:30PM and were given a room immediately. we did need to change though because we need a king room, but it was very simple and they sent the bellman to help us move our luggage. the room - a little better than expected. we stayed in the tower section, which is furthest away from the beach and pools. that section seemed reserved mostly for business travelers. every room has a balcony, and we had a great view of the ocean. the 24 hour sound of the waves is amazing. had a flat screen TV. comfortable bed (though a little too soft for my taste). fine sheets, blanket and pillows. bathroom was a stand up shower with a rainshower head and completely tiled in travertine. very nice. loved showering in there. i never take baths a hotels, so not having a tub was no big deal. dual sinks was nice too (we could brush at the same time). the beach - easy access but because on an inlet, the water seemed stagnant. huge waves, but they didn't reach the beach because of the rock barrier. brown sand. we didn't go in the water here at all. tons of chairs. beach was empty most of the time. the pools - there is one giant pool with two levels and another smaller adult pool by the villas. there are also two kiddy pools, one near each adult pool, but the kiddy pool by the main pool seemed dirty. we used the kiddy pool by the villas which was much cleaner. the adult pool by the villas was deeper at 4.5 feet than the main pool (3.5 ft.). water is cold, but you get used to it really fast. tons of lounge chairs. hotel restaurants - we only ate at Palmeras for our breakfasts (buffet $25 p/p) and had one dinner at Lemongrass. The breakfast buffet was adequate and had everything you'd expect: hot breakfast items, cooked to order eggs, pastries, fresh fruit, cereal, fresh fruit juices (including mango, yum), cold meats/cheeses, breads, yogurt, and even champagne. Lemongrass was a bit pricey. the location in the tropical gardens was beautiful though and the restaurant is very stylish and high end. we had two drinks, one appetizer, one sushi roll, one entree and one dessert and the total was $140 (incl tax/tip), but the food/drinks were delicious. also starbucks in the lobby was wonderful. the coffee there was perfect every time, and the pastries/sandwiches were great. the rest of hotel - many touristy shops in the hotel, one that carried lots of drug store items if in a bind (everything double price, but that's expected for a hotel store). also carried kiddy water toys, which is also great if you forget to bring some. the tropical gardens were very nice. i don't know why they color the water to look like windex though. i felt bad for the swans whose undersides were stained blue from swimming in it. i'm sure it's non toxic, but still, why the need to color the water? lobby area was nice and always lots of people coming in and out. lobby had a nice buzz. starbucks on site was huge. we're coffee drinkers and stopped by here twice a day. a hot latte after a cold swim in the pool was the best. hotel staff - all very nice and accommodating. i tried to discreetly tip second check in agent when we asked to change rooms, but he declined and seemed kind of offended. i felt weird though since he changed our room no problem anyway and said that was not necessary. didn't mean to offend. **money saving tip** - we did not rent a car and used taxis every day to get to/from the hotel. ask the drivers YOURSELF BEFORE getting in what the cost will be. several times when taking taxis from the hotel, we asked the person hailing the cars what the cost was (standard for to/from zones) and when we arrived the driver charged us more. even though from the hotel to old san juan was to cost $10 (very quick ride), we were often charged $12 or $14. it's not huge, but it does add up, and i hate feeling taken like i was overcharged because i looked like a "stupid tourist." whenever we asked up front, the charge was always $10. **recommended catamaran day trip** - use Salty Dog (yeah, i love the name too)! we asked the person near the concierge desk for information on the catamaran trips to culebra or iacos and they kept aggressively pushing two charters. the person at the desk does NOT work for the hotel, and receives a commission from those two companies (damn, i can't remember the names, but you'll see when you go there). they act like they are a part of the concierge desk, but they are not. i remember now that spread eagle was one of the ones they were pushing and that boat was PACKED (we saw them when we took our trip on salty dog). it looked like standing room only on that boat...soooo glad we didn't use them. the lobby has $5 coupons for salty dog, and they were one of the most reasonably priced day trips. we were treated fabulously on the boat. great food, drinks, music, and NOT too crowed. the snorkeling area was fantastic and we saw lots of fish before even getting off the boat. do this trip! it's totally worth it and was the highlight of our trip (and esp our 2.5 year old's)! other restaurants - DO NOT GO TO Escambron Beach Club for dinner. though it looks like it in the brochures, it's not a regular restaurant. it's a wedding/conference venue and it was soooo weird to sit in that HUGE space having dinner practically by ourselves. go to Raices, Aqua Vida, YuerbaBuena. we ate at Mojito's one night, but were not impressed. there are lots of restaurants in Old San Juan near Raices if you can't get in that one, so walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ollie12
Reviews.Content: My family and I were extremely happy and impressed with this hotel. It was centrally located between Old San Juan and Condado and only approximately a 10 minute ride from the airport. We were there a couple of days early before our cruise and this was a 5 minute ride to the pier. So, the location was great for us. The lobby service was fast, efficient and very friendly. There was a lot of action going on in the lobby with all the guests arriving and departing and all the shops and restaurants, but the lobby area is so large that it wasn't an issue. There are very nice lounge areas in the lobby, Starbucks, shops, and at night the bar inside the hotel was very nice. We ordered dinner and drinks and enjoyed ourselves right there at the hotel. If you do want to venture out, there are plenty of taxi's waiting right out front of the hotel and to go into town is just a quick ride. We went to a restaurant in Old San Juan called Mojitos. It was delicious and I highly recommend that. They have some of the best Monfongo-a classic Puerto Rican dish. The hotel is clean and our room was great. We overlooked the garden area and could see the ocean from a distance. The service was great, the food was good-but I must say it was very overpriced, the location was perfect and overall it is a beautiful hotel. If you are looking for a convenience store or liquor store, there is one right at the end of the driveway of the hotel. Just ask someone and they'll point you to it. We saved a lot of money buying our own wine and enjoying it in our room. There's also a Subway restaurant at the end of the driveway too. If I ever go back to Puerto Rico, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: angcpell
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and room was superb. However everything on site at the hotel was way overpriced. Restaurant food was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Pre cruise stay!”
Reviews.Author: coldinerie1
Reviews.Content: I had read a great deal about this hotel on this web site and was a bit concerned about staying there. We were there one day prior to a cruise and got the price on line for a steal. The grounds of this hotel are some of the very best I have ever witnessed. I have traveled a great deal and love beach hotels. This was great. The staff was friendly,no issue with them at all. Maybe they are reading the comments on this site about staff being rude and are doing something about it. The room. while very nice, was not 5 star material, more like a 3.5. The bed was very comfy but the room was small, and we had a double studio room! Overall, I would stay at this hotel again. The grounds are to die for, the room, well a bit on the small side and the staff nice and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BazHokie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over 2 years ago, so the details might be a little lacking. Overall, this was a pretty good hotel. Rooms were nice (from what I can remember). Food was average to good. Location/beach were great. We definitely weren't disappointed, but at the same time...we weren't blown away. Rooms: Unfortunately, this is the one area I can't remember much of. I do know we had a suite, and it was quite spacious. TVs in both the lounge area and the bedroom. Beyond that, about what you would expect. Service: The service at the hotel was adequate. We never felt mistreated or ignored. And employees there were generally helpful. Food: The food was decent, but not great. We actually preferred eating dinner in downtown San Juan over the hotel's dining options. We enjoyed eating out at Agua Viva and Dragonfly in downtown...both of which were much better than Lemongrass (which was in the hotel) in our opinion. Location & Grounds: The hotel was situated on a very beautiful beach. Looked especially nice at nighttime. Both tourists sites and nightlife in downtown San Juan were just a short cab ride away. Lots of games and things to do for children as well (see the pic of the giant chess game). Other: We also had access to the Executive/Club level during our trip. That was a definite plus! It included free drinks, continental breakfast, and snacks throughout the day. Also, there was a computer there with free internet access if you need to use it. The Executive Lounge also had flat-screen TVs and adult beverages. Overall, we would recommend this hotel...but we would probably want to try somewhere else if we ever came back to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable, xtra $$$, all rooms not =”
Reviews.Author: vista4u
Reviews.Content: loved the open air lobby, good variety of pool, beach, deck locations. king room had great view of fort and water but included the rooftop vents above the banquet/meeting areas, competing with the sounds of the surf. the main building room was showing wear but comfortable. the coffee maker/fridge were a plus, cost saving if you buy your own drinks, fruits, wine. viejo san juan is a treasure and easily accessable by bus for 50cents nearby, and wonderful for sightseeing, walking, shopping, and eating. bring a carryall and streety map on your first trip in and make a stop at the 'supermax' market on the east side of plaza de armas which has a decent selection of wines, juices, fruits, cheeses, cream for your room coffee, and a bit of everything at reasonable prices...cash or credit. eat with the locals around the corner on calle san francisco at la bombonera...have a mallorca with ham and cheese, get a few of these local rolls to go for a morning treat. there are also 2 very good local cuisine restuarants... el jibarito, 280 calle sol, and raices on recinto sur. moving up in price el picoteo tapas in el convento hotel courtyard never disappoints, from there you can walk back along the water by passing through the san juan gate to the paseo la princessa. if it is late, i recommend the $12 taxi back to caribe hilton; afternoon or early evening a 75cent bus trip...b21 or c53 get off before the bridge! you can walk over the bridge to condado there are many restuarants and shops after a mile or choose from..i enjoyed yerba buena. the olas spa and restuarants at the hilton are over priced. spa treatment $155 compared to other local spas $110. a cup of soup, appy, and glass of wine $35 at hilton, compared to dinner entree and mojitos at Raices for same becomes a buyer beware moment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beach - Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton end of Feb. early March 2009. Overall, it was a nice experience. As a Hilton Gold member, we were upgraded to a Villa Suite. The Villa section is a bit of a hike from the front desk, but very nice with it's own pool and hot tub. The rooms are nicely laid out with good amenities. Okay, here are the good things about the Caribe Hilton: The Beach - a beautiful sandy beach, warm ocean water with enough chairs for all of the guests. The Pools: large, lots of chairs. The Hammocks: lots well laid out for privacy. (Frankly, pretty much everything outisde of the hotel was top notch. The grounds, pools, etc., were all great) The Hotel: friendly staff, nice number of shops (including a little sundries store), easy to find front desk/concierge. Tourist stuff: Close to Old San Juan, easy drive to rain forest and airport. Here's the down side: The food. Very expensive and not very good (the $20 hamburger was not better than Burger King). Especially room service. Food over cooked, not very flavorful and of limited variety. Most of the restaurants open at night are "dress up" restaurants. If you want some local flavor, you need to go to Old San Juan or the Condado. Fortunately, these are not too far away. Lobby gets really busy and noisy at night. Construction on the new hotel next door and the bridge across the lagoon was loud and could be pretty annoying (like driving pilings for the bridge at 2AM). Internet went down for two days - not their fault but still annoying. Hot tubs were not much warmer than the swimming pools. One restaurant recommendation is Panza in Old San Juan. Good food, great service and a cozy, modern atmosphere. We really enjoyed ourselves here. Over all, the hotel was nice and I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: jimandnango
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 6, including a 6 month old. We stayed here one night before our celebrity cruise. Although it was not close to the cruise pier, we got a great rate of $75 a night on priceline. The pools were very nice, and the beach looked nice, although we didn't have the time to go there. We ate at the Italian restaurant, which was just okay. The portions were not that big, and the prices were a little high. The rooms were wonderful with comfortable beds. Balconies were a plus. Baby had a ball in the heated pool. The check-in was fast and easy. Staff was friendly and helpful. I don't think this would be a good place to stay long term, as it was far from everything. Good for a one night stay, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy on the eyes... Hard on the wallet... But only if you let it... Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: Typically my wife and I stay at either much smaller or slightly higher class resorts. With the bad economy we decided to give the Caribe a try. We booked the SPRING BREAK rate which includes breakfast (tip #1, ALWAYS book the room that includes the hot breakfast even if your gold or diamond, its worth it over the "free" breakfast.) The resort is very easy on the eyes, the lobby still shows that this Hilton was once the Queen of the company. We didn't experience any of the service problems with check-in (perhaps because of my status). We booked into a King Villa -- the Villas are in the hotel/condo building at the far "right" of the property as you face the ocean. They are slightly larger than the standard king rooms in the main building, and have a full kitchen, larger dining table, and better balcony furniture. Alas, Hilton no longer upgrades from these villas to larger villas, but for two people it was perfect. The beach is very nice, it was uncrowded (even though the hotel was 98% full), however beach services were slow to non-existent (drinks, mists, relocation of shade, etc). We did not use the SPA or even the main pool. Onto the food! As I mentioned, get the hot breakfast with your rate... its $25.00 per person + tax and tip -- for two people you save around $50.00 a day... In our case, our rate was "lower" than the standard rate AND included breakfast. Since we usually stay at upscale properties, the prices were actually pretty much inline with what you would expect at at Four Seasons, Ritz, etc. The problem in my opinion is the quality and service -- no one wants to eat a $20.00 lunch of chicken tenders and a drink out of a plastic container (sides are extra). Our advise is to skip lunch AND dinner at the hotel and head out. The subway across the street is perfect for the lunch time snack, and you can pick up a six-pack of soda for the price of one at the resort at the store just up the street from the subway. For dinner, ask for directions to the newly named Conrad Condado Plaza Hotel & Casino San Juan Puerto... its a easy walk (save the money on the over priced taxis). If you feel the urge to gamble go into the Casino, if not, walk PAST the hotel entrance until you come to a series of restaurants... the Cuban / Puerto Rican fusion place on the left is excellent. All things considered, it was a very solid and good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Nice, Hotel okay”
Reviews.Author: spny83
Reviews.Content: We used points to stay here pre/post Cruise. For 60K points a night, I'm not sure it is worth it, place has definitely gone downhill, this is our 3rd stay here. There is a Doubletree not on beach which we may try next time we visit San Juan. The Beach/pool is very nice. The hotel is outdated (we stayed in the main building one night and the Tower the other) but it is under construction. The Main desk staff really is rude. We usually don't have a problem with people but the two ladies on check in date were rude and didn't have any paperwork done and when asked them questions they just ignored you. I asked questions of the conceige and the tour operator and they were more helpful and correct than the front desk. The lobby help didn't even ask if we wanted help with our bags at checkin (we've never had that happen anywhere). The Executive Lobby has dramatically changed for the worse. I had read you pay for drinks now which isn't a problem but you pay $3 for a bottle of water. Use to have chairs in sitting groups around the room to relax and visit in. We didn't visit more than once and even then our card didn't work, had to bang on the door for a while for someone to open. Again the main desk staff didn't give us the breakfast cards but the restaurant was use to this and called to confirm you belonged there. Breakfast was good continental and there were bottles of water in a small frig. Most people grabbed two (as Honors Members we're suppose to get in the room). The walk to Old San Juan is about 2 miles (easy) on a very busy road but the view along the ocean is very nice. Only walked during daylight hours and didn't have any concerns. The restaurants are more expensive but not so far off a really nice restaurant in Old San Juan. Someone's reviewed mentioned room service prices weren't bad and they really weren't so keep that option in mind.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: MoondogNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days/three nights with my spouse and two teenage kids and found it to be a fabulous beautiful place. Very well laid out and designed. Loved especially the pools, beach and hammock area as well as lounging in the lobby/bar area with a coffee or drink. Service was good and friendly...special thumbs-up to Manuel the mixologist. The rooms were ocean front, high up, a great value for the price and were comfortable for us. Great to sleep with the sound of the waves. Agree with others that the restaurants were too pricey to frequent with a family although my wife and I did go to the latin/asian restaurant after getting kids sandwiches from subway across the street. Restaurant quality was great. WE did have a car however and drove or walked to places in old san juan/candado for lunch/dinner. The Starbucks in the lobby was a plus and got us going in the am. Would go back here in a second especially at the price we paid for the room. Not having a casino at the hotel was a big plus also. The two mile walk to old san juan was a highlight as you go along the scenic shoreline.

Reviews.Title: “Really fun ....bring your wallet”
Reviews.Author: ymaike
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four day stay at the Caribe Hilton. I knew it wasn't going to be cheap when i booked the room. Initially I didn't really mind the $250 a night rate either. The open air lobby is truly spectacular, it opens right up to the beach and the ocean.Service at the front desk was okay; we got really lost trying to find our room, and no one ever offered to help us find it, or carry our bags. But once we got to our room, it was fine. View was incredible of the bay (and the roof of the convention center), room was recently updated and comfortable. We had breakfast at the hotel a couple of times, $60 for the two of us of mediocre food seemed a bit outrageous. But the Starbucks next door was very good and much more reasonable. Went to the Atlantis a couple of times, once for $11 rum and coke, the other time for a $60 lunch that was served in plastic trays. Next day we went to the beach next door, and had some yummy Puerto Rican food until we were full, and spent about $7 for two people, including an ice cream and a beer. Go to Payless Car Rental just outside the hotel. Get there at 9, as they don't take reservations. Had a a great car for $39 a day; the hotel wanted $57. Jeeps are available for a bit more money. The beach made this place worthwhile, despite the hotels's best efforts to make it unpleasant. Snorkelling was fun along the rocks, the sand was clean, and my kids adored the infinity pool. Not so nice was paying $25 to pedal a boat for 20 minutes, nor the hyper dude who must have recently retired from Abu Graib prison who was demanding room keys be shown prior to entering the pool area. All in all, we had a good time snorkelling, but I wouldn't stay here again unless my company was paying the bills.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable at bargain price”
Reviews.Author: BlueSkies500
Reviews.Content: I picked up this hotel on Priceline for just $95 per night, and it turned out to be excellent for that price in this market, but not without some concerns. Starting with the positives... The rooms were good size and pleasant, though the furnishings were somewhat dated. The view from the balcony was excellent and the sound of the ocean was refreshing - except when the fans from the ventilation units on the roof below were going. The in-room safe was large and easy to use. The rooms were cleaned well, but had an irritant seen all too often, sheets too short for the bed. The beach is protected from the waves by a sea wall, which is good or bad depending on your perspective. But, it was clean and well maintained, as were the nice pools. We really enjoyed the large hammocks, large beds, and traditional recliners near the pools and ocean. We'd never seen anything like the beds and thought them a great touch. As noted in some other reviews, the prices of adjacent restaurants and shops are very high - Starbucks' prices were about twice as high as at their airport location. The nearby Subway provides some relief from this, and one can always walk a ways or take a bus or taxi to old San Juan or Condado. Internet service was expensive, but fairly typical for city Hilton's: about $15 per day wired in the room or on the Hilton wireless in the lobby. But, you could use the Starbuck's wireless in the lobby for free (called "Centennial" or something like that) so forget the Hilton connection and fee. Front desk service was terrible, even for the Hhonors line. There were long waits each time, and paperwork had to be retrieved with great difficulty from their poorly organized files. Security was visible and apparently effective. But the hotel wasn't very crowded, so they might not have been challenged much. All in all, I'd stay here at $95 per night again, but would have a hard time justifying the regular rates of over $200.

Reviews.Title: “Things have changed....for the worse”
Reviews.Author: javakai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in 2004, and again with husband and 2 kids this year. The hotel property has had some updates, and the property itself is beautifully situated (they are lucky), and has one of the loveliest beaches in San Juan. Here is what I was looking forward to coming back to this hotel with 2 kids: 1-Playground. Went from an amazing playground to a bunch of plastic crap that only a 2 year old could enjoy. 2-Arcade room/checking out toys. Was NEVER EVER staffed. 3-Chess and other games - Thank you Hilton, you got points here for not taking them away. 4-Kids eat free under 5. Well not any more. I don't think. I don't know. That was the vibe I got from all the employees we encountered in the 3 days we were there. No one knew the policy and we were bummed that we had to pay $12 per child per breakfast, thinking were were going to save some dough with their 'kids eat free' plan. **sigh** 5-Eating outside...well basically it's better if you eat out, at cheaper places. The indoor restaurant is only open for breakfast. I came home and read a reviewer mention the Olas Health Spa cafe - i WISH I had gone there. Food got really really pricey and it's just disgusting (for me) to eat burger after burger and I was just craving something simple and healthy.... 6-Starbucks saved the day. Open until 11:30pm. Can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds but everything overpriced and outdated room furniture”
Reviews.Author: Twinkles2008
Reviews.Content: I just returned from San Juan yesterday after spending 2 nights at the Hilton post cruise. Our room was in the older part. The bed was just fine and the tv was new, but other furniture was old, for instance handles on the closet were loose and the thermostat didn't appear to work. The hotel grounds are very nice. There are parrots in the lobby and a pond with fish and swans. The pools are large and the beach entry was easy. I snorkeled along the rocks and saw a small barracuda, trumpetfish, and lots of small fish and the usual parrot and blue tang fish. There was an iceberg float to climb, but I thought it was hard to do. For some reason, the water trampoline was not in use. We got some items from starbucks, but all restaurants are too expensive here. We walked across the bridge to the Condado area and ate at a Puerto Rican restaurant just past the Condado Plaza hotel. It was very good. It was called the Ropa Vieja Grill. The walk was not long and I definitely recommend you do that to eat. I would have to say the employees were not that friendly. I think this stood out more to me after just getting off a cruise ship where all the employees say have a good day, etc... There was a line checking in so I walked outside to get a look at the pool and beach. There was a guy standing at the door checking room keys, but I thought he was rather rude and like a beach nazi. I mean I don't look like a local trying to sneak in to make trouble. I also didn't like how they charge a resort fee; however you have to pay to rent the kayaks or paddle boats, and it was very expensive to do. Needless to say I didn't do that, but with that resort fee, every room should be entitled to at least 15 free minutes to use a paddle boat if you want to. Overall, I liked the beach area; however, I won't be staying here again the next time I'm in San Juan. I also took the bio bay kayak trip and the east island trip to Culebra I will write separate reviews for. So check them out if interested.

Reviews.Title: “Poor, unfriendly service”
Reviews.Author: DLK26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and I was very excited to stay there on my trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed for a week at the Ponce Hilton and then made our way back to San Juan for one evening. The Hilton Caribe is definitely the fancier of the two, but unfortunately it is plagued with unfriendly staff. The front desk was not terrible though not friendly. I don't believe I received a smile at any point. Despite being a Hilton Honors member, my room was on the third floor and overlooked an ugly roof of one of the buildings. Room service was very rude both when I ordered and when my food was delivered. The gentleman delivery my lunch, despite being unfriendly anyway, had the audacity to hand me the bill and reply that it "doesn't include gratuity." Service in the restaurants was mediocre. Checking out was no more pleasant. In fact, the gentleman at the front desk didn't even ask me if I enjoyed my stay. I'm rather certain they didn't care. Just when I wondered if it was only me, my colleague told me the next day that his experience was similar. An instance of note was when he went into the gift shop. He informed the sales lady that he had an 8 year old son at home and wondered if she had any recommendations for a souvenir to which she replied, "no" and proceeded to turn her back on him and continue talking to one of her colleagues. The two instances of good service I received were at the Starbucks on site and the bartender--I was so thankful for a friendly face! The bad service left a very bad impression and cast a negative pall over my entire stay. I do not ever intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: zojanaha
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Puerto Rico and we didn't do any sight-seeing, we didn't want to leave the hotel! The public areas, beach, pools and sunbathing areas are all wonderful. Rooms are big, although try to get a high floor because some of the lower floors look out over the roof of the foyer. Be aware, though, that the restaurants are expensive, but if all fails there's a Starbucks in the foyer. Food in the restaurants is of a very high standard. A lovely place to visit, whether for romance, a family holiday or just a really fun time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: surferjoe5899
Reviews.Content: Well the hotel is excellent and would have got five stars except they didn't have my room ready until after 5, checkin is at 3. The hotel has great resturants, nice soft beds, amazing views(especially if you get the rooms where you can see Fort San Geronimo), big swimming pools with bars, a private beach with a trampoline and climbing mountain in the water, etc.....The hotel is a five minute drive to downtown San Juan so the location is perfect. There is a tropical forest area in the middle of the hotel and you can hear the famous Puerto Rican Coquis calling at night. Great stay. I would definetly recommend that hotel to a friend. http://travel.webshots.com/album/569160001CqWVih?vhost=travel

Reviews.Title: “Muy Bueno- LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: dptvnews
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hilton Caribe and I can not say enough good things. I was nervous after reading some of these reviews but wow was I pleasantly surprised. It amazes me how jaded some travellers are! Maybe I dont get out and about enough but I thought the entire experience was heavenly. The open air lobby is gorgeous and we loved all the shops and restaurants. I especially loved having a Starbucks in the lobby and got to know the staff quite well! They made the best lattes I have ever had! Our room was great- lovely balcony with a fantastic beach view. We enjoyed having our coffee and evening cocktail out there each day. The private beach was the best and the pool was also clean and huge. I loved the waterfall in the pool and of course the swim up bar was a huge hit! My husband was addicted to the sushi at Lemongrass-says it was the best he ever had! The tempura chicken with brandied apples roll was to die for. The food and drinks were expensive on the hotel grounds but I thought the portions were very big, the food was excellent and the drinks were very strong and generous in size- so i did not have a problem wtih the prices. I was glad to read about the prices on this site so we were able to plan ahead. I brought cereal and protein bars and we saved a ton of money by eating breakfast on our balcony or at the pool. We bought milk, a hunk of cheese, crackers, a gallon of water, and 2 bottles of wine at the little store across from the hotel entrance on our first day and that prob saved us a couple hundrd dollars i figure. We had our appetizer and cocktails before we went to dinner and it was so relaxing! Be sure to walk a few doorsdown from the Subway to the store there - it has a better selection than the liquore store mart you'll see first. As many others have mentioned the Subway is also a great spot to save on a few meals. The breakfasts are really cheap! We also loved the Oasis Spa grill at the health club and the prices were much cheaper over there. We had a chicken salad wrap that was out of this world and the breakfast was also amazing. Everything is made so healthy too. A word of thanks to Jose at the pool bar. I recently had gastric bypass surgery and have to keep my sugar intake very low. I wanted a margarita but was afraid of the sugar in the pre mixed stuff. I told him my situation and he happily squeezed fresh limes for me then added some splenda, tequila and voila....it was delicious! He made my trip and I was so grateful. The staff went out of their way to take care of us and everyone was so nice. The only time we ventured off the property was to go into Old San Juan. It was great for walking around for a few hours, mostly tacky touristy shops but we found a gorgeous street with high end stores and the best was this place El Convent, a hotel with some great tapas restaurant. Be sure to go for lunch and sit in the open courtyard- it is beautiful. The church across the street is also really nice and if you walk down to the water across from the church- you will find a National Historic site, a nice walk on the water around the old walls that surround the city. Overall it as one of the best hotes we have ever stayed at and we will definitely be back. We would bring our son next time- he is 4 and would have loved the parrots in the lobby, the swans and turtles and ducks in the tropical garden, feeding the fish, the playground, hammocks, and Kids Klub. Oh be sure to walk next door to the National Escambron Park- it was a nice walk and beautiful beach. And dont forget to try the Pina Colada- allegedly created at the Hilton and sooooooo yummy!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Jetzon
Reviews.Content: We were a party of seven just a couple weeks ago and stayed for about a week. The Hoel and rooms were spotlessly clean. The employees were obviously well trained, courteous, obliging, very pleasant. We noticed in particular how they all respected the General manager, a Sr. Campo, who we eventually met since it wasn't difficult. We saw him on the lfoor constantly, day or night. Cannot undrstand when the man rests, he seemed to be all over the place making certain everyone had their questions answered and wishes attended to. His associates were also most accomodating. Would recommednd this lovely vacation spot to any and everyone, we will be back Al Hoffman P.S Rumor has it their Casino may return

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton is O.K.”
Reviews.Author: concors
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan for business and my hotel stay was booked through a corporation. I didn't have a choice of hotel. After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I was apprehensive but it was O.K. if not great. I will list below the pros and cons of my stay. The negatives are divided into things which didn't really bother me and things that did. Pros: 1. How bad can sitting on a balcony in 80 degree weather, overlooking the Caribbean be? 2. The staff was friendly if not super efficient. The bartender at the pool really does know how to make a good cocktail. 3. The pool and beach are nice. Not as nice as some other beaches (e.g. Luquillo) I've seen but, again, how bad can 84 degree water in January be? 4. There are some wonderful restaurants relatively nearby. The liquor store across the street is good for most drinks and snacks. 5. The complaints of paying $12 for a cab ride to old San Juan or most locations in San Juan seem silly to me. When is the last time you were able to take a cab for $12 in New York, L.A. or any other big city? Cons: Things that might bother some people: 1. I stayed in the Hhonors Towers 18th floor. There is some sort of hallway nearby where carts are being pushed all day and night. This noise didn't bother me as I am a sound sleeper but might bother you. 2. The air conditioner made a loud clunking noise when it cycled on and off. I slept through it. 3. The room decor is a little dated but the room was clean and comfortable. Things that bothered me: 1. My shower door, I suspect, was installed backwards, requiring me to scrunch up in the corner of the shower against the cold stone wall to get in out out. 2. The toilet had a slow leak in the floor gasket which created a very slow trickle of water. This was easily dealt with by placing a towel at the base of the toilet. I reported this to the front desk and was told someone would be up to take a look. Nobody ever showed up. I did not call back or ask for another room but I shouldn't have to. If I go back to San Juan I will likely look at and probably stay at a different hotel but if my business sends me back to the Caribe Hilton I will be very happy. A few restaurants you may like are: Bonbanera in old SJ on San Francisco street. The locals go there for breakfast. Try the Mallorcas. Panaderia Espana Reposteria is a great cafe and bakery. Locals eat there. Our cab driver took us there for a late night snack. Great coffee too. La Fonda del Jibarito 270 Sol St. Old San Juan. I didn't eat here but one of our fellow travelers who is a native of Puerto Rico recommends it highly. It is also reviewed elsewhere on this site. Likewise a restaurant called Picayo. I also agree with other members that seeing the old forts is worthwhile. Take the tour at San Cristobal. When you buy tickets for admission you can get a combo ticket for both forts. I recommend seeing both but you have to really like forts to fully enjoy both. You may want to see just one or the other. If you see just one I recommend San Cristobal.

Reviews.Title: “Best location near San Juan/Cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: beachhouse5
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel for a 3 day pre cruise stay, on the basis of its site, on its own promontory with sandy bay, tall pines, and the ocean in 3 directions. Boy did the Hilton grandpa get it right! the original hotel was built here in the 1940's. I dont normally like chain hotels too much but this scored on all fronts. 4 different style resturaunts on the site. The Hotel breakfast was great,as good as it gets! Conveniently located for the cruise terminal,5 mins by Taxi. The old Town of San Juan 10 mins by taxi, Airport 15mins by taxi. My standard room was in the Garden Block was spacious,up to the minute and befitting of 4 stars. and had an excellent view of the tropical garden and ponds and through the trees the ocean. Not surrounded by tacky dives and no casino on site! stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be better for the price.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be above average, but unfortunately owing to laid back management and poor upkeep, I cannot recommend this once proud hotel. To be sure, The Caribe Hilton has advantages no other San Juan hotel enjoys. Since it was one of the first resorts on the island--the main building dates from 1949--it has an incomparable location, spreading out over 17 beachfront acres halfway between Condado and Old San Juan. 60 years later, the city has largely grown up around the property, so the beach, pool area, and park complete with a fort, is even more notable given the surrounding congestion. The main building, situated to enjoy ocean balcony views from nearly every room, connects to a later tower with a large open air lobby-cum- shopping mall; the tower also enjoys waterviews from most accommodations, though the number of roofs and loading docks may make that vistas less than postcard. The hotel's bars and restaurants are numerous, and most surround this lobby area. There is even a Starbucks. I am a Hilton HHonors Gold member and I used points for my stay. It took me three rooms to get what was appropriate accommodations. My first room had two beds--I'd requested one king--and the second room had the doors ripped off the armoire; just the hinges remained. These two were in the main building--the third one was on the 11th floor of the tower. While I remained in this one--and in my opinion, it was nicer than the other two--upkeep issues are apparent all over the hotel, and in a number of cases, the decor is a bit dated. One notable difference between the main building rooms and the tower rooms is in the bathroom. The main building, dating from 1949, has very standard bathrooms, now updated to include curved shower rods, whereas the tower rooms have only showers--but very nice ones. Still my shower head was duct taped in place. Guests here get used to such makeshift remedies. The emergency exit door in the hallway opposite my room had peeling paint, and the carpet in my room was stained--as was the lampshade. Beds throughout the hotel are very nice--quite cushy--and the bedroom portion of the tower rooms is smaller than the bedrooms of the main building. Your resort fee--14% of your rate, so a $300 per night room for five nights will cost an additional $210--includes two in-room coffee bags. I asked twice for decaf to be delivered--it never came. The resort fee also includes the fitness center--nice, but usually crowded--beach towels, and a few other things that might prompt you to ask what you are paying for in your room rate. The hotel's beach, a likely man-made comma of graham cracker-colored sand, is quite popular, and the hotel does a nice job of creating a comfortable place for sunbathing around its crescent. It is customary for Gold and Platinum HHonors members to get complimentary internet and breakfast. Such guests here get both, but with a catch. You must visit the ninth floor lounge in the main building to access wifi--not supremely convenient for a guest in the tower. And the breakfast for HHonors members is a special continental breakfast buffet in an otherwise closed Italian restaurant. If your idea of a tropical getaway includes a lavish breakfast outside by the pool or beach...well, the hotel's "most valued" guests aren't treated to that. The breakfast area is windowless, and capped by a cracked skylight. The spread is carb-heavy...and not particularly well restocked. The room itself is made even more depressing by inattention to detail...the second day I was there, half the tables had had their tablecloths removed to expose bare, unvarnished wood. Better still, the staff was using paper placemats over again, so the previous guest's coffee stain was on the mat you got to reuse. Coffee comes out of a machine like those you might find in a college dorm's dining hall, and a jar of peanut butter--half used, with a butter knife standing upright was among the only protein on the buffet...not even yogurt was a part of the morning menu for this "special" breakfast. Even for free, this was just too much--so I had breakfast in the restaurant the other mornings...the buffet there, with tip, is $30 a person. For the record, that is a nice spread. The staff overall wasn't hostile, but you aren't likely to confuse them with any Nordstrom help, either. In fairness, I brought a number of these issues up with the management --the hotel manager bought me breakfast two mornings, and re-credited my account with one of four nights' worth of points. What he didn't do, and really couldn't, is renovate a hotel that was last redone 9 years ago in 2000, or even make the repairs that would paint doors, fix ceiling stains, or touch-up caulk in the bathtub. If you are considering this hotel, ask whether such inattention to detail is worth $300 a night plus a $42 resort fee (though in fairness, this hotel is also available with some frequency on Priceline at very advantageous rates--I've seen $85 a night in season, in fact. And yes, at $85 I could overlook these lapses...) Will be interesting to see if other competition makes things a bit better here. The newly renovated 1958 La Concha, down Condado Beach from the Caribe Hilton, sports stunning public areas and a new parkside setting--and seems to be trying harder, if such appearances are any indication. For now, unless you are getting a screaming Priceline deal, or have mega-points to burn, best to wait until the planned 2010 renovation is done. It will be great, for sure. Right now, however, it is just an unfortunate shell of what this once-glamorous resort once was. . .

Reviews.Title: “Hold onto your belongings...”
Reviews.Author: travellingedna
Reviews.Content: After spending two weeks at the Caribe Hilton this January on business I can say I've seen all aspects that the hotel has to offer and I have to say, I was highly disappointed. The hotel is beautiful and fun to walk around but bring a lot of money if you plan on eating and drinking (drinks range from $10-$14) a piece, $10.00 grilled cheese. Also,word to the wise... if you stay there for over a week they will charge your card without contacting you. The rooms are very standard, not what you would think was worth the extra cost. We ended up switching rooms three times only to find that there was really no difference between any of them from the villas to the tower. One plus would be the front desk staff, they were all very helpful and always went above and beyond to find us answers. And now for the bad. There is absolutely no security at this hotel, we had three bags stolen while we were at the pool. There were no cameras in the facility to help find the people who were to blame, and no one manning the front pool area to make sure that only hotel guests came in. The property boasts a private pool and beach but it is generally inhabited with non-guests day in and day out. The worst part of the stay was how the Hilton handled the theft, this resulted in buying us room service at 11:30 p.m. after we were forced to switch rooms once again. The meal that we got from room service did not make up for the hundreds of dollars lost due to their lacking security. My personal dish was cold. I would not recommend staying here to anyone that likes security. You can just stay anywhere else and use the facilities as it seems everyone else on the island does. Word of caution...keep your stuff in your sight at all times.

Reviews.Title: “ZERO SECURITY -- WATCH YOUR STUFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: caribbeanqueen88
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 2 weeks while participating in a study abroad course in Puerto Rico through our Master's Program. Our university booked the students as part of this program in a locally owned hotel in Condado, but we felt we'd be much safer at the Caribe Hilton and chose to pay extra to stay there instead. Unfortunately, we learned a lesson the hard way. The third evening of our stay, my wallet and my 2 friends' purses were stolen from the pool area with us just 10 feet away. The hotel security guards claimed this sort of thing "never happens" there, but we have a very hard time believing that when there were no security cameras and absolutely anyone is allowed in the pool area. Our belongings were stolen within minutes because we made the mistake of allowing ourselves to feel safe at this expensive hotel. Hotel security was very cooperative and nice and did what they could to "lessen the blow" of having our items stolen. By the next evening, hotel security had retrieved our belongings, minus the cash, medications, cell phone and cameras (basically anything someone could quickly sell). However, cooperation aside, this event made us hyper-aware of the lack of security at the hotel for the rest of our stay. ANYONE, and I mean ANYONE can walk right through the lobby, into the pool area, take a towel, and stay for the day. Only ONCE in TWO WHOLE WEEKS were we asked to show a room key to enter the pool area, and it was the morning we were checking out to go outside and take a few last minute photos!!! One afternoon, there were several shady-looking local adolescents at the hotel (who were very obviously NOT guests) hanging around the pool area, scoping out everyone and their belongings. PLEASE, if you stay here, WATCH YOUR STUFF!! Better yet, don't bring anything to the pool. The hotel security guard slipped and said people get their cameras and cell phones stolen all the time from the pool (after he already told us this sort of thing "never happens". Riiiiight). Another disturbing incident happened one evening when we returned to the room and none of our room keys were working. I called the front desk from the lobby of our building (the Towers) and they said they would send a bellman up with new room keys. That's it! They didn't ask my name, didn't ask me to come to the front desk to verify who I was or where we were staying. They just -- in blind faith -- sent someone over with new room keys to let us in. They didn't even know who we were or if it was our room. Again, ANYONE could have gotten in our room!!! SCARY!!! This was my 4th trip to Puerto Rico and I would NEVER EVER stay at the Caribe Hilton ever again. I have been a travel agent for 12 years, stayed at resorts all over the Caribbean and have never experienced less security in a facility in my life. The hotel is very pretty and I hope you enjoy your stay if you are already booked, but PLEASE WATCH YOUR BELONGINGS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton... Complete Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: IslandFlyer1
Reviews.Content: Let me just preface this review by stating that I booked this trip extremely last minute through priceline.com. And thank god I did, because had I paid the rack rate at this resort I would have been one unhappy individual. Having flown in from JFK on January 11th, through the snow and rain which pummeled the Northeast region, we finally arrived in San Juan after countless hours of flying and delays. However, upon initial views of the resort it looked amazing... to be exact it looked something out of a magazine promoting South Beach. Now we checked in at about 11pm, and let me tell you the agent who was checking us in was COMPLETELY and UTTERLY rude, without question. She assigned us a room in the tower, which was what I had requested she NOT do. She continued to give me an attitude stating the resort was at full occupancy and then continued to tell me to â€œdeal with itâ€�. Well, I obliged and went up to our room. Mind you at first view, it seemed stunning until you saw the 70â€™s motif bathroom and countless stained carpeting, along with an odd caddy-cornered balcony. Which led to my immediate call to the front desk manager, who changed my room immediately (thank you, blade). He also let me know that the â€œresortâ€� was only at 20% occupancy and it would not be a problem, only proving that the agent who had checked me in was only worried about one thing, and that is what most people at this resort and on this island are worried about which is their plans for that evening or congregating with their co-workers to chat and ignore customers. Now after they placed us in the Condado Lagoon Villas, which was an adequate room if the lighting in the bathroom did not have to be changed because they were inoperable, along with fixing the phone because we got no dial tone as well as the lack of internet availability in the room. All in all, this proves to be one of those Hilton hotels which IS NOT kept up well. The pool chairs were ancient looking with straps falling off and the cushions having a brown/black tinge to them. After complaining to the pool crew, we were told they were new and made aware of an apparent $600 million dollar renovation. On which I had no comment because the pools were dirty, the chairs were dirty, the beach was rocky, dirty and not raked once while we were there. This leads me to my next gripe which is the apparent resort fee to use the facilities. Isnâ€™t this fee supposed to be disclosed to you at check in? Well this was another aspect that my inadequate check in agent neglected to go over. The resort fee is 14% nightly according to your room rate and apparently is used to take care of the beach, pool towels, etc. Which if such a fee was being charged I would expect clean pool chair cushions, a raked beach without ketchup packets, magazine inserts, as well as cups and silverware from ordered lunches. Perhaps I would even expect towels which arenâ€™t torn and thinner than a t-shirt. The resort had many restaurants which are overpriced and inadequate so much so that we had ordered room service on multiple occasions and had one of the people in our party get sick because of the breakfast ordered one day. I called and spoke to the front desk manager about it and was told â€œno one else got sickâ€� essentially blaming it on one of us. At any rate, this is a three star hotel at best, and for the $600 million dollar renovationâ€¦ I donâ€™t know where the money went because this place should be torn down and rebuilt. Or this money should be better spent on up keeping this property simply said. I would NOT choose to stay at this property if it was offered to me for free, the facilities are dated, the restaurants were decent at best, the staff was completely and utterly rude, and the only bright spot of our trip was our tan and the best housekeeping staff in the hospitality industry. If you want to have a great stay on the Island of Puerto Rico, visit the Wyndham Rio Mar, or wait for the Ritz Carlton Dorado Beach to open next year. It is suppose to take place of the two Hyatt resorts in Dorado and bring true luxury to Puerto Rico. And if your looking to stay in Condado stay at the La Concha or the Condado Plaza. Two AWESOME resorts in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “not just a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vaughnie
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is not just a hotel... it is a resort. We stayed here for four days before our cruise and absolutely loved it. With the private beach, pools... restaurants even stores... there was little reason to leave the resort. We did however find it so coveniently located that we took a taxi one day into old San Juan and walked the next time. We would absolutely love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks Upkeeping”
Reviews.Author: SO_Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: We booked a two day "pre-cruise" stay via priceline and selected "resort" class hotel. Our rooms had balconies with views. The hotel has undergone renovations in it's public areas and hotel rooms. Unfortunately, the hotel rooms lacked the type of upkeep I'd expect. The room my husband and I checked into in the main building was updated, however, the lock on our balcony door was not functioning. Rather than fix the lock, we were offered another room on a lower floor. We were advised to take a look at the room before moving into it. The room overlooked the top of another building and the tile in the bathroom was moldy, so we requested another room. We were told that the only available rooms were in the hotel tower and that those rooms were nicer. We accepted a room on the 7th floor of the tower, the level was for Hilton Honors members. The room itself wasn't that bad at first glace. The woodwork was updated, flat screened television, our view was of the parking ramp and we could barely see the ocean, but it was still better than the view of the top of the building. The bathroom at first glace was nicely updated with a tiled shower and glass door. Double sinks with a sitting area. Unfortunately, the wall above the toilet had mold stains and had a slightly musty moist odor. I mentioned this to the front desk staff, but they didn't seem to care. The bed and bath linens were dingy and stained. The carpet was weathered. A bit of cleaning could have easily rid the walls of mold. A bit of bleach could have brightened the linens. I was a bit bothered by the staff's lack of concern for the upkeep of the rooms. The room my sister and mother stayed in had a better view of the ocean. It didn't have a moldy bathroom, however, the bathroom door itself was very weathered and it appeared as though the wood was peeling off. The sheets on one of the beds was dingy and stained. My sister requested new linens. Housekeeping came with an attitude and changed the linens.
