The new linens were also dingy and had very visible black stains, yet the staff member didn't seem to notice and quickly left the room. My sister later found the location of the housekeeping linens and replaced the sheet herself. The location is right on the beach and has a nice pool area. The beds are comfortable, classic Hilton style. The drinks were a bit overpriced; $12 for a mojito. There are several restaurants on site, but quite pricey as well. Service at the bar and lounge was good. I was glad that we only paid $155 per night for the two rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Caribe”
Reviews.Author: westsideweld
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel over the New Year with my wife and son. Could not fault the service and cleanliness of rooms. We found that the food and drink was expensive in the hotel but if you walked into Old San Juan about 40 minutes, there was plenty of places to eat and drink. New Years eve party was great, paid a 100 dollars each and you could drink as much as you want in about 12 bars, nearly all with different types of music playing. The hotel is set in a great location right on the beach no problem getting chairs. Would definately stay there again maybe next New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Place, not amazing, not awful”
Reviews.Author: codependent
Reviews.Content: Checked in to Caribe Hilton 12/28/08, left 1/2/09. All in all, there wasn't anything worthy of major complaints, and there wasn't anything worthy of major praise. Plusses: - Beach and pool areas were nice, and though crowded, we were able to carve out an area for the two of us every day we sought to. - Staff was generally friendly, particularly the guys running the comp breakfast (for HHonors Gold & Platinum VIPs only) at the main restaurant. - Our room, located in the main building (not the tower) with a small balcony and ocean view, was clean and comfortable if slightly dated. - Concierge desk was helpful for local restaurants and getting around. - The comp breakfast at that restaurant (noted above), which normally goes for $18 pp, was solid and a good way to start the day. Not an amazing spread, but adequate and really satisfying if you're getting it for free. - The on-site Hertz makes renting cars easy, and we only paid $78 (all in) per day during a peak time. We were also able to return at the airport at no charge, saving a $25 cab ride. - The dollar is still all-mighty in PR (translation: you don't have to exchange money or worry about rates). Minuses: - Property is not central to anything. It's not far from the airport or Old San Juan, but it's certainly not walkable to anything particularly worthwhile (I know because I ventured out by foot my first day, wandering into a pretty shady neighborhood where I was warned by a fellow gringo to not be walking there, and this was at 3 in the afternoon). - There are two small shops just off the property, both offering a limited selection of basic supplies (beer, liquor, sodas, chips, etc.) at inflated prices. Still a better deal than the hotel, but it would be nice if there were more selections nearby. - As far as we could tell, there are no restaurant or bar options near the property, which was unfortunate when coming back at night hoping for a late bite or nightcap. - Everything at the property is, as other reviewers say, over-priced. This is a direct result of the notes above about nothing else being nearby. Light sandwiches, drinks at the bar, internet time, massages at the spa-- all cost more than they should have, probably contributing to ill-will among some guests. So much for "being hospitable" or "travel taking you places" (or maybe travel should take you into debt?). - The hallway leading to our room on the 5th floor was absurdly cold, to the point we would jog between the room and the elevator. - The actual swimming pools aren't that large, so don't expect to get your laps in or anything. - The hotel hosts a few separate New Years Eve bashes, which turned the place into a bit of a zoo. It didn't really affect us, although we could hear one party thumping well into the morning, but I suspect it ruined the night of some guests. - While the concierge desk was helpful, on the first night (12/28) we were told by both the concierge and the bellman that taxis to Old San Juan would be charging double the normal rate (from like $12.50 to $25) because traffic was so bad. This didn't happen any other night, and when we mentioned this to another, apparently higher-ranking member of the staff a few nights later on New Year's Eve, he gave a puzzled look and said that couldn't be the case and that the taxi drivers must have been up to something. When we told him the concierge and the bellman both told us this before getting a taxi, he seemed to be more concerned and confused by why this happened. So I think there could have been something shady going on there, and the staff might have been a part of it, which is very disturbing if true. General Comments: - In Puerto Rico, like most other places where tourists flock, there will be shadiness among the locals to make money off the tourists. So just be wise to what seems weird (like, say, taxis charging double on a random Sunday night). - Depending on what you're vacationing for, it's either a pro or a con, but the hotel was packed with families and kids. Happily, I didn't witness much misbehavior among the kids, but if you're not into hearing or seeing kids, this isn't the place for you (at least not at a peak time). - Yes, everything at the hotel is over-priced, just like at every hotel I've ever stayed at. But if your goal on a vacation is to never leave the hotel, while I can't relate, perhaps you should look into all-inclusive options elsewhere. - As noted, the Hertz on premises (in addition to the PayLess Rental Car directly across the street) make day trips to El Yunque, Luquillo and Fajardo (or all three, which we did in a day), extremely accessible. For the $120 you might spend in a day at the hotel pool on sandwiches, drinks and activities for the family, you can rent a car, see/hike the rainforest, sit on a much less crowded beach and eat cheap local food (or stop by a real grocery store and pack a picnic lunch, as I was advised to do by one of the concierges). Something to think about. - Full disclosure, I used HHonors points for the stay, so it made high-end dinners in Old San Juan and taxi rides less of an issue in terms of overall cost of the vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton good location/value for couples & families”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBC
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 2 days & 1 night prior to taking a cruise. The Hotel is very clean, the staff very helpful & friendly. If you're a Hilton Honors Member (whether using points or paying for the room) the hotel will put you in a separate tower for Honors Members only (from what were told the rooms were larger and more updated than the ones in the main building). The hotel had the specifications as noted on the reservation (ie: upper floor, etc.) and had a room available for us for early check-in at 10AM, as well as, honored the request for a late check out at 2:00PM. The rooms have a refrigerator in them & the bathrooms have a separate shower & two person bathtub. The beach is very nice at the hotel, there are several chairs, tables, etc. on the beach & and at the pools next to the beach. The swimming area is clean and separated by a coral reef, with a trampoline & rock climbing float in it, but the undertow/tidal pull around the sun deck is strong & could be dangerous for children and/or weak swimmers, even though the water depth is around 3-6 feet (1-2 meters). Additionally, there are several hammocks on the grounds that shaded. There are a few bars and restaurants by the pool (including a swim up bar) & on the grounds too (including a Morton's Steakhouse) that are better than the average one at hotel. Overall, the hotel is very nice, worth the price or points, location is ideal, and worth staying at & visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: orion1782
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is on a very large and pretty property not far from the airport. We stayed there Dec. 29-Jan 1 and it was a very busy t ime at the hotel. First, the beach was small, but usually if you looked you could find two recliners to lay on without having to walk up and down the length of it. The service at the beach was the usual food service- My burger was $15 but it came out quickly. The inflatable rafts are a bit steep, but they do have a huge inflatable trampoline out in the water that is free for everyone to use. The beach is in a small lagoon type setting, and the waves aren't anything like you would see on the U.S. Atlantic Coast, but there are waves and the water is very warm even in December. For the proximity to the hotel, you can't beat it. Always keep your room key on you, as they ask you to show it occasionally to enter the pool/beach walkway as you leave the hotel. Other than that the maids were very nice, and most everyone spoke English more than adequately. We rented a car the first day and drove it to the hotel from the airport- there is a garage next to the hotel that is easy to park in and seemed to always have spaces. It at least saves teh cab fare from the airport to the Hilton, and if you go with Hertz you can just return it at the hotel, since they have a desk there (without having to take it back to the airport). It was a very convenient option we took advantage of. Make sure you pay an extra $10 or $15 to get an ocean view room, it's not that much more and totally worth it. Don't eat at the hotel though for dinner- go into Old San Juan and experience PR for what it is. The cab fare is around $13-15 before tip. The restaurants in the HIlton are pricey!

Reviews.Title: “This Place was Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: cswein
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us travelled to San Juan to celebrate my parents' 50th anniversary. While we went to San Juan primarily because this was the departure sight for our cruise, we went a few days eraly and stayed at the Caribe Hilton. If this facility was not paradise, I'm not sure what paradise would be. While the rooms may need some updating (nothing major), the grounds; the setting; and the amenities more than made up for this. You have a sprawling pool on one side and the beach about 50 yards away on the other side. When you arrive at the hotel, the lobby is open air and the check in desk is about 15 feet away from where you get out of your mode of transportation. There are beautiful parrots in a large cage in the lobby as well as refreshing stations of grapefruit flavored, pineapple flavored, & lemon flavored ice water water with fresh fruit. As soon as you arrive, you can't help but feel that this was a good choice. The breakfast buffet was a little pricey, but offered anything / evrything you'd want, including omelette station (somewhat slow), papaya, mango, pancakes....you name it. While there were 10 of us (6 adults; 4 children / teens), everybody had a ball. If we arte able to someday return to San Juan, I would not even bother looking into other hotels. While I am sure there are other nice facilities in the area, it would be hard to believe that any other hotel would match up with the Caribe. We would definately return! Hope this helps you decide.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: HeavenCh
Reviews.Content: I am writing a long review, so if you are busy, here's the bottom line: there are better deals than this hotel. When I made a reservation in a world famous Hilton resort hotel chain, paying a certain amount of money, there was a certain expectation, but this hotel didn't meet my expectation. First Impression: My first impression of this hotel was that it was old and crowded. I saw wear and tear, here and there, although our room in the tower seemed new. Location: The location was good for old San Juan and Ashford Avenue, and about one hour or more one-way driving to the biobay, scuba diving, ferries for Vieques, or El Yunque, which is ok. However, it was not easy to find a market or a restaurant nearby. Room and Tower: Our tower room was nice and new. Our bed throw had black spots here and there, which I strongly suspected as mold, so we never used the throw. Other bedding stuffs were good and comfortable. The bathroom didn't have a bathtub and ventilation, which was a minus, but had a nice shower system with good hot water pressure. No minibar, which translated to a free empty refrigerator. The tower didn't have any security, so anyone from the street could go in and out freely. Also it was a little bit away from the private beach or the swimming pool. Beach and Swimming area: The swimming pool was OK but didn't look as good as other resort hotels' pools I visited including other Hiltons although it didn't matter for me because I spent time not in the pool but on the beach. The private beach was good and safe for children as it was protected by a breakwater or something. There were some floating things to climb up and enjoy, and a sunbathing balcony on the sea. Although it was crowded, we had a good time on the beach. Food: Everything is overpriced. One bottle of Bud Light will cost you $8+tax+tips. A McDonald quality hamburger was $13+tax+tips at a bar, and it was the cheapest snack you can get in the hotel except Starbucks, which was the only place with reasonable prices in this hotel. If the food quality was good, we wouldn't complain about the price because we were on vacation and ready to spend some. However, we didn't want to pay that money for this quality of food, so we always drove out to eat and to shop for the next day's breakfast. BTW, this hotel claims that its pool bar is the birth place of the pina colada. If you want to try it, it is $13+tax+tips. Staff: Most of the staff was friendly and nice except for the front desk manager. The concierge was so helpful, and even house keepers were always smiling although they were not good at English. However, when I was in trouble, the front desk manager was very unhelpful and gave me a why-should-I-be-bothered-about-your-fault attitude. How she neglected me really astounded me. Fee, Parking, Internet, ETC: You need to pay the additional resort fee (about 13 or 14%) even if you already paid for your room. Everything costs you money. I already wrote about the overpriced food. Parking also costs like $15 a day, and the parking garage was not connected to the hotel facilities which was very bad while raining. Internet was also like $15 a day. Although they said the wireless Internet on the lobby was free, we couldn't get the signal at the lobby and ended up paying the money to get the wired access. Overall, I am willing to re-visit Puerto Rico, especially to do the biobay tour again, but I would not stay at this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and dated”
Reviews.Author: Petunia6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise. I thought it would be worth booking this hotel for the beach, and it was. What was disappointing was the room. Very dated. Wood panelling on the walls gave it a 70's appearance. We booked a "deluxe" oceanview concierge room. The oceanview was great, but I did not see any advantage to having concierge service. The room was VERY small... leading me to wonder what the room would have been like if it were not a "deluxe"! On a positive note, location was good, beach was good, lobby is great. Everything at the hotel is RIDICULOUSLY expensive. We regularly stay at high end resorts, but we do not like to feel ripped off at every turn. There is a difference between paying for quality, and paying for a "name" and I felt at this resort that was what we were doing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for stop over”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights before boarding a cruise at San Juan. I was very worried when I read the reviews but thankfully was pleasantly surprised. As Hilton Diamonds we were upgraded to a room in the Tower Block, it was a very nice room clean and pleasantly decorated with great sea views. The girl who checked us in was not very friendly but efficient. We were using points for this stay as the prices were quite high at this time of year. Expensive by Hilton standards given that parts of the hotel are dated. Breakfast free for HH guests was fine but very limited in terms of chocie. The resort with its pools and beach locality is very beautiful and the public areas well maintained. The Caribe is not that centrally located and a taxi reiode to Old San Juan is expensive. Overall a nice place for a short stop over but perhpas not for a week as limited eateries nearby if staying for this length of time I would hire a car.

Reviews.Title: “Stupidly Expensive”
Reviews.Author: workinNplayin
Reviews.Content: As HHonors Diamond, I've spent plenty of time in hotels over the years. Overall the lobby and the room were clean and updated, but the hallway to the room was badly in need of a fresh paint job. The steel door frames were already showing rust holes. The big suprise was that they seem to think if you were on vacation there would be no limit on what you would be willing to spend on everything - parking $16/day, beer $9, burger $10, entrees at least $25 + 10 for a side, internet free in lobby, $16/day in your room - lucky for me the Condono Plaza across the bay takes care of their guests with free wireless and I was able to get it from my room. It seems greedy to me, it became my goal to take every penny offsite, luckily their parking attendant is so consumed was her personal life that she didn't make me sign the book, which resulted in me only paying for 2 of 8 days I parked there. We had a rental car so we went and ate at local places for a normal price. IF prices had been resonable we would have eaten several meals on site just for convienence. We talked to several other guests who had the same complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: semilo
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about staying at Hilton Caribe after reading many of the posting on this site. Because of this our expectations were so low. We were there from Dec 19 - 24th and we had a wonderful time. The resort facilities were clean. The service was crisp and friendly. The staff we encountered was courteous and professional. The only glitch we had was with our initial room which was a handicapped equipped one with shower. I went back to the main desk and politely asked if we could be moved. We were immediately moved to an ocean front room in the Hilton Towers on the 13th floor with amazing views. The private beach was great and with plenty of chairs and umbrellas and towel services. The pools were very nice. The exercise room we used every day and was one of the better equipped hotel ones I have used. In terms of pricing, it is true the resort is pricey. Internet is $15 if you want it in your room, but free in the lobby. We also stayed away from the restaurants and bar by having breakfast at the Subway (which was much better than the ones in the US. The omeletes were made fresh in front of you.). We ordered carry out Cuban sandwiches and Medallia beers at the local liquor store. The Cuban sandwiches were amazingly good. The liquor store is right across the street and perhaps looks a little seedy on the outside, but it is a family run business. We saw many locals and police eating there. There were the best Cuban sandwiches we ever had. The beer was $1.50 a can and we stocked them in our refrigerator in our room. And, for dinner, we took the bus to Old San Juan. The bus stop is about 3 blocks away and costs 50 cent. We never waited more than 5 minutes for a bus. We took it both ways. We have lived in Chicago and this bus was clean and the people riding it were working class people, students, and locals. It was great. Old San Juan was a delight. We thought the location was terrific for us and my wife said she wanted to stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Grounds, Worn Out Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bilyclub
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline bidding on 4 star and above. One night pre/post cruise. Was given a first floor room in the Condado Lagoon Villas, This is a seperate building that must be used for something else like timeshares. The room was worn out and dirty. It did have a nice ocean view porch. The hallways of this building are open air, contributing to a very loud night, especially by outside A/C equipment. Made a comment when checking out about the noise for the postcruise stay, The main pool and beach are a hike, but a great area. A week later we checked in and were "upgraded" to a seventh floor corner room at the Villas. Same worn out, dirty kind of room. The upgrade hit us at 6:00 AM when the workers from the construction site next door started work. Not a good situation when you want to sleep in and have an afternoon flight. I feel that the Caribe Hilton knows these rooms cannot be sold at the regular rate and throws them on Priceline to make the quick buck. One last though. Their website advertises the fort on the grounds. The fort is there, just gated and locked up tight

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good... appeared to be getting better”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoonmadness
Reviews.Content: Decent Hilton, appears to be family friendly. Definitely a good hotel to use as a stopover between cruising or heading to other islands in the carib. Towers were being built at the time so, the general condition and quality of the hotel appear to be improving. We stayed in the Hilton VIP tower and the accomodations were very nice with stone bathroom/shower, great views, comfortable bed, always clean, etc. We would definitely stay there again but would not spend an entire vacation/week at this property. It is best used 'in transit' to your next location or would be an excellent option for a quick/long-weekend getaway since you are so close to Old San Juan and can explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with lots going on”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Caribe Hilton numerous times. Good location and lots of things going on. Has a great pool and beach scene. Good service. Nice room amenities. Drinks are very expensive....had two Medella Light beers for $17.50. But it is a fun place so you spend the money and think about it later! Ate at the Spanish Tapas Restaurant. Service was good. Food was ok but prices were very expensive for what you got. Caribe Hilton is a nice hotel if you want options for beach, pool, restaurants, shopping and a spa. If you want something small and quiet, you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK but pricy”
Reviews.Author: ABFine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on 11/14, the night before our cruise and on 11/22 and 11/23, following our cruise. We arrived around 11am and check-in went very smoothly. Desk personnel were very pleasant. We used our Hilton Honor points for the first night so the price was right. Our room was ready on the sixth floor and we found the room acceptably clean. I had read somewhere that the property had undergone a 90 or so million dollar renovation not that long ago. I don't think they spent it on the rooms. There was a nice view at least. On our return stay, we again arrived around 11am. and proceeded directly to our room, this time on the ninth floor. This time was a bit pricier. We paid $274 a night plus about another $60 in taxes. Ditto on the room condition but the hallway had a rather unpleasant odor. The food prices were a bit extreme with Morton's being the worst. The steaks were good, I'll concede that, but let's not even talk about the $10 baked potato. I don't care how big it is, a potato isn't worth 10 bucks. I found the $15 a glass wine at my local liquor store for $23 for the bottle. We had a free buffet breakfast one morning which was mediocre at best. Our second morning was a choice of an overpriced buffet ( $25 a head ) or order from the overpriced menu ( $15 omelets and $4 orange juice. ) Before some one replies with a typical " Hey, you're on vacation, if you don't like it stay home.", let me just say that I have no aversion to spending money. I just like to get something of value in return. On the brighter side, the pool and beach were very nice. The hotel staff was outgoing and helpful. Victor the bartender was exceptionally nice and makes a mean mango colada. The cab rides to and from Old San Juan varied from $12 to $14. I think it was about $25 from the airport, I don't remember exactly. This being our first time in San Juan, we picked the Hilton based on reputation, not location. We're not party animals by any stretch but it seemed pretty dead around the hotel after dark. We could see a hotel / casino from our room but when we tried to walk there, we quickly ran out of sidewalk, light and pedestrian traffic and decided to turn back. To wrap things up, I'd have to say that we have stayed at Hilton Gardens and even Hampton Inns that have been every bit as nice as this Hilton. I doubt that we would return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again....”
Reviews.Author: kmenne
Reviews.Content: Priceline chose this hotel for us, so I am glad that we got a good deal. I would have been really bummed out if I would have had to pay full price. The hotel is nice when you first pull up, but it's another story once you check in. The hallways smell really musty and the rooms are just ok for Hilton. I guess they did a $60 Million renovation 10 years ago, I think it needs another. The pools and beach were great, the prices at all the restuarants were ridiculous. The gym was awesome, the location of the hotel is NOT by any means convenient. You have to pay $12-$14 PER cab ride whether you are going to Old Town or across the bridge to Condado. That was a total rip off. The staff said not to cross the bridge at night (walking) so we paid $12 both ways just to go to the hotel that we could see from our room! The staff also said not to use the bus at night....next time I would stay in the Condado area for sure or Old Town. Sorry Hilton, didn't pass this time.

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED IT”
Reviews.Author: nonchalant84
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is a gorgeous resort and we enjoyed our stay very much. The secluded beach is a plus. The forts are beautiful and the pina coladas are by far THE BEST I have ever tasted! We stayed in Room 1665 in the HH Tower, which is a fairly new building and the room was beautiful. My only complaint was the air conditioning made a loud crashing noise every time it turned on and off. It started on our last night there so we didnt bother. I was a little worried about not having any security in the tower since anybody from the street can literally walk in there. Not one person was ever sitting at the front desk, which was odd. At night, the hotel's halls were empty and quiet. Very relaxing atmosphere but if you want to party, I'd strongly suggest El San Juan Resort just a few minutes away. The nightlife there is sizzling. A few tips for those traveling to San Juan and staying at this hotel: book your room on their website using the pre-pay method ... it comes out much cheaper that way. DO NOT eat at Mortons as it is extremely and ridiculously overpriced. Take the bus as it is free until next month and once they do start charging, it's only 50 cents. Taxi rides are expensive and can run you up to $21 for a 12-15 minute cab ride. Walk El Paseo del Morro ... you'll find a dead end at the end of the trail but it is worth it and very beautiful. Rent a car if you plan on going out of the San Juan area, it is much cheaper. There is a Subway around the corner from the hotel. We ate there for lunch almost everyday and they even serve breakfast ... about 70% cheaper than eating at one of the hotel's restaurants. We liked the Spanish restaurant called Madrid-San Juan and we also enjoyed Lemongrass which serves sushi and asian dishes. All in all, we had a lovely stay but would have prefered El San Juan for more nightlife. The location of the hotel is perfect. Be sure to visit the local park which is within walking distance and also try their pina coladas!!! It's their specialty :)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: HenriNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton probably is the worst large hotel in San Juan: poor room clealiness and maintenance, unexisting service, excessive food and drink price, old style and dusty room furniture, absent security in the HH Tower. The only positive side is the nice and clean beach. First and last time in the Caribe Hilton. Happilly the choice is wide in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Rowan1550
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a business trip. My drive in from the airport which is only 7 miles away was extremely stressful due to the unusually heavy traffic created by the upcoming elections and the fact that the all of the road signs were in Spanish. This caused me a terrible amount of stress (especially knowing that I had to drive to Ponce which is about an hour and a half away) the next morning. I tried on several occasions to use mapquest to no avail. When I went to the concierge desk the next morning, a very nice young lady named Sonia Alvarez gave me a piece of paper with directions to Ponce. She also made sure to give additional information as to which exit to get off at and landmarks to help me find the hopsital I was looking for. Thanks to Sonia, I found my destination without any problem and had an opportunity to enjoy the beautiful countryside of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaandCarlos
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Caribe Hilton from Oct 18-24th. The lobby was gorgeous, the staff very friendly and helpful. I had read reviews and was a little nervous when we received a room in the Main tower, but we loved our room. We had a little balcony overlooking the private beach and cove. It was lovely. We also had Ms. Puerto Rico contestants staying on our floor. They were a little noisy in the hallways in the morning, but they got the message and were more courteous as the week went on. We loved the pool, activities, cab rides from the lobby and the folks in the bar (Victor especially) were great. The prices at the hotel were expensive for drinks, but it was so convenient. They gave great recommendations for restaurants in Old San Juan. Cab ride was $13 each way, but there was also a free bus across from the hotel. We also visited Isla Verde and were very glad to have our own private beach at the Caribe. Only drawback- beware of the menu prices at the pool- they say one thing, but charge you something else. When we inquired, we were told that the prices had changed and the menus were old.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Caribe”
Reviews.Author: gensher101406
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying at the Hilton Caribe for 6 days. After reading the reviews before we left, as we always do, once again, the people's comments were ridiculous! The Hilton Caribe is a top-notch hotel and resort. We always were greeted with a smile and a hello from all the workers, as well as had great service the entire stay. The thing that threw us is that people complained about a missing tile here, or a spot of mildew there. The fact of the matter is the hotel is 100% open to the outdoors, and seeing as though it is surrounded by water, what do you expect? The grounds are immaculate and being worked on daily. The pools are really nice, as is the beach. We do a long vacation once a year, and chose the Caribe because we had Hilton Honor points we wanted to use....we travel. Yes it is pricey, but its vacation. If you want it to be inexpensive (meals, etc) stay home and cook, or better yet, go to Vegas and stay off the strip and try to find the covetted $9.99 buffet ! This is a tourist destination, people! The food was excellent, as well as the room. The beds are some of the most comfortable we've ever had, especially out of the states. All in all, the Hilton does it right at the Caribe. I highly recommend it. If you are going in trying to pick apart the place, you should go and stay in a penthouse in downtown New York or LA. Get over it!

Reviews.Title: “Only One Big Problem...”
Reviews.Author: gererdo
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent two nigths from October 10-12 at the Caribe Hilton making the reservation directly trough the reservations department at the hotel.The check-in was very easy,the facilities are way better than our last stay(May last year) but noting new at the Oasis Bar and now is more expensive.We live in Humacao Palmas del Mar Residences and we were having souch a great time like many other times before,but on saturday the 11th my wife was in the jacuzzi at the Lagoon Villas and she call me very scared saying that a man from security named "Amador" was asking her to leave the area because it was 11:00 pm and the area was close,so she have to follow the rules or leave the hotel,my wife as a good lawyer said that she understand the rules but the way he was aproaching her(rude and unrespecfull) was not the best one,the "security agent " start calling people from his radio and my wife decide to leave the area,once I arrive to the hotel we went to the front desk to report the situation and to talk personaly with the "security agent" but nobody,nobody was able to help,I got a 27 years marriage and I won't let anybody disrespect my wife,so my answer about the hotel is that I wouldn't return....period.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NebrHD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton on Sept 19th & 20th for a quick 5 year getaway. I am a Hilton Honors member and try to stay at Hilton when I travel for work. It was a great stay, and we loved it. Ithamar and Norma got us rooms on the Executive Floor in the Main building, which were fantastic rooms. And Dominick R. (Hotel Ambassador) was one of the best. He had great recommendations, always friendly and helpful, and always greeted us. Very clean and a great view of the ocean. The concierge lounge was a nice touch. We loved out stay, ate lunch in the swim up bar and spent a lot of time in the pool. Very clean and quiet (when we were there). The hammocks were nice, feeding the fish was fun, and the restaurants were nice. There was a fashion show there Sat night, but we didn't have any problems with noise. We would definitely go back, and maybe even take the kids. We have no complaints about this hotel, it was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: GiveMeSunNorCal
Reviews.Content: Spent two night recently awaiting our departing cruise. Thought it would be a great opportunity to see Puerto Rico. Very mixed feelings about this property. We do stay at Hilton's and this one gave an outstanding presentation upon arrival, e.g., great lobby, shops, excellent pool area (although overrun with many many children), great open air feeling of the tropics. The room we had was in the Honors Tower 17th floor with a great ocean front view and obviously recently remolded but not really to standards of the Hilton Tradition. Sloppy work and as stated in another review needed newer higher quality towels not those you can get at Costco. Another odd thing was they recently eliminated the top sheet...just the bottom sheet and the comforter on top. My question...how often do they clean the comforter? Service was mixed from extremely helpful (front desk, concierge, and bell desk awesome, pool area fair, valet rude at times) to at times rude. A bit confusing, really lacked consistency through the entire property. Not so much a tourist location, much more a local hot spot especially on Saturday nights. Busy and loud. Although the location is pristine it is not so geographically located to other tourist areas such as Old San Juan. Really no where to walk to and taxis are expensive. Thank goodness we had a rental car but that runs $16-$21 per day depending on if you self-park or valet Not so sure I would return unless it was an extremely good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel & Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: coqui1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Caribe Hilton was absolutley wonderful. We stayed for a whole week and enjoyed our time tremendously. The hotel is blessed with one of the most spectacular locations in San Juan with its own private beach, a vast array of activites, great pools, we enjoyed the various restaurants, especially the romantic and very beautiful Lemongrass restaurant. The bar area with fantastic cocktails, the pool bar was a lot of fun. The setting is magical with two small forts to the left and right of the property and lush green surroundings, the palm trees and the magic of the "Coqui" with thier special song call. The room was divine with the breathtaking views of the Lagoon, beach and pool from the balcony. The service was top notch and very friendly from the housekeeping right through to the Concierge Eric, who was a source of information and perfomed miracullous feats in getting us into all the restaurants and organising everything we wanted to do. Our overall recommendation is this hotel with all its amenities and services is world class. We will return happily.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality generally assured...”
Reviews.Author: Kenn_P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton in late August this year, having stayed there 4 years ago, with positive memories. In general they didnt fail to satisfy, and earned a slightly above average score. Location The hotel is very nicely located in close proximity to Condado (touristy), and old San Juan (a must see), and 10 minutes from the airport and Plaza Las Americas (shopping). It has its own beach -not great at all by Caribbean standards. But a very nice pool area and relaxing hammocks under coconut trees. Rooms: True to my memory, the beds were more heavenly than other brands promote - certainly very comfortable. My room viewed the old fort and Condado shoreline. There were two spoilers to the view, however: (i) the hotel restaurant rooftop in the foreground; (ii) an intensely bright beam of light from across a close section of the condado public beach area, where apparently there may have been some music festivals. this not only prevented an enjoyable viewing experience, but also facilitated noise and affected privacy at nights forcing use of the drapes. The room i had was close to the elevators and therefore a little noisy the first evening especially. When i asked for a change i was very pleasantly advised that the hotel was currently full to capacity, however if i checked back the following day they could inform whether or not another room would be available. The better response would be for them to follow up with me the following day, but hey...its not a five star! Restaurant Only had breakfast. It does make sense to book the breakfast buffet package. The offerings were wide, varied and delicious. Absolutely no complaints in that area. Valet/Parking This made no sense to me. I rented a car, but the hotel had no parking whatsoever on or apparently near property. Once you arrive you are ambushed by the valet service and charged a mountain for the dubious benefit of having them take your car to an undisclosed location (I did ask, and was told vaguely that it was at a location "nearby". When i asked further, the valet agent suddenly had a difficulty speaking in English!) The difficulty i had was that it took an average of 15 minutes for my vehicle to be returned each time i visited the valet with my ticket. The frontdesk informed me pleasantly (yup, always pleasant) that the valet service was not affiliated with the hotel, but was unable to assist with options other than use of the valet. Service Apart from valet service, generally very pleasant and willing to assist. Room service and restaurant scores high points. Overall Because of the rooms, the location/environment and the service this hotel scores high points with me. It was easy to forget the valet service, once inside the hotel, however it certainly would cause me to reconsider staying there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Easy Transportation to Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Linda929
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from a one week trip to San Juan. We booked a stay at this hotel and loved it. I'm not a beach lover so I wasn't sure if this would be the hotel for me. Fortunately, there's a little something for everyone here. There's a private beach for the hotel guests, a pool, a jacuzzi, a fitness center, and spa. My favorite thing to do was swing in the hammock at night, staring up at the palm trees against the evening sky with the sound of ocean waves crashing in the background. It was great. There are exotic birds in the lobby, swans and other birds in the garden, and tropical fish in the back. To get up close with the swans, just follow the signs to the garden. To see the fish, you just need to follow the green pier that stretches out into the water at the back of the hotel. Go in the evening. The giant fish swimming there will be a sight worth seeing. In terms of location, it was pretty easy to get to Old San Juan by bus. About a 5 minute walk to the bus stop and less than a 20 minute ride. Since this year is an election year, the city buses were all free. Otherwise, it would have cost around 75-cents per trip. Still better than the $15 cab ride (for five people) we paid on our first day! Also, if you're up for a walk in the heat, you can walk to the Condado Hotel & Casino that's across the bay. There's a little bridge that stretches over there. At one point, you may even bump into some kids jumping off the bridge and diving into the water. The bridge is pretty low so there's no danger with the height. Just watch out for the rocks if you choose to follow. For meals, the hotel restaurants are somewhat pricey. As an alternative, there is a Subway sandwhich shop located at the corner across the street. They also sell gelato in there. It's pretty good. Other restaurant choices are either in Old San Juan or in the Condado Beach area.

Reviews.Title: “For events or family stays they are incredible”
Reviews.Author: Ferdi2u2
Reviews.Content: We hosted an event where we had to accommodate over 100 people including artist. At the same time I took the opportunity to take my family as well. While I was there for business and pleasure the hotel were able to meet both business and family expectations. I thank specially Vanessa Moreno for her incredible attitude to serve our needs and Luis and Annette from the front desk for going out of his way for us when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: DORInd
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by the reviews of the Caribe Hilton. My husband and I and our two children(8 and 11) had a great experience. My husband travels for work and we stayed using Hilton Honors points (diamond club member, I think) so we had a room in the executive tower which is newer and very nice. We actually lived in PR for six months and this was our mini vacation before flying home. We had been all over the island and my husband and I had also stayed in the Ponce Hilton (south side of island). I admit that the service and overall appearance of the hotel is not as nice as some hiltons and even the Ponce Hilton, but it was still very nice. (don't expect the same quality of service in PR as in the states - they have a much more laid back approach to everything and you will wait for food everywhere you go - even fast food - just let go of your Western expectations, relax and follow the local motto -"no worries") I also admit that the food is VERY expensive, even compared to other nice hotels on the island. (there are restuarants within walking distance, both cheap fast food and nice ones - you can also always take a cab as well). Having said that, I will tell you what I liked and why I would recommend it to anyone. 1. It's within walking distance to one of the best beaches in San Juan - Escambron. It's very popular with locals, which gives you a taste of the local culture, and it is a great place for beginners to snorkel. It's one of the places we always took visitors. The peninsula of sorts is a great place to walk at night and there is a decent nice restuarant there with an outdoor patio overlooking the beach. make sure to try the Red Snapper (traditionally cooked whole, fins and all in a beautiful presentation - check out their sign which has a picture on it) 2. It is also with in walking or short cab ride to Old San Juan, which is a must see and do. 3. The scenery is very nice. The beach is in a cove and looks over toward escambron beach. There are ruins of the old wall of the city across the little bay. You also get a great view of the San Juan coast line, especially at night. 4. The grounds are attractive and large enough to find a quiet place, most of the time. It is a great place to sit and look at the ocean. 5. The pool is large and good for kids or adults wanting to lounge, with a bar in the adult pool. 6.The beach is great for families - who cares that the sand is imported - at least it's clean. There is a raft with slides that our kids liked. Beginners can also snorkel here - try over by the rocks . One of the tourist groups that takes people to snorkel is often out in the bay just outside of the beach markers. 7. It's off of the beaten path away from most of the other Hotels. FYI, I have also stayed at the Intercontinental and loved it very much. It is on the nicest white sand beach on the Island and in the heart of Hotel row near the airport. (Isla Verde) It may be a bit nicer, but the grounds and pool area are much smaller. They do have a great place to sit on the beach and have a casual dinner watching the sun go down. Take a cab there to spend an afternoon and stay and have dinner on the beach. We recommended the Caribe to a friend going to SAn Juan for work. She's traveled all over the world. She spent a week there (including a night at the Intercontential) and LOVED the Hotel Caribe. She sat outside until late at night never wanting to go inside. Annother of my husbands co-workers who travels extensively and is very picky about where he stays, has stayed in many of the upscale hotels in San Juan and always chooses to come back here when on the Island. He even chooses it over the Ponce Hilton and the Intercontinental . Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: margtrav
Reviews.Content: My husband, teen-age son and I spent three very pleasant days at the Caribe Hilton. The rooms were well-kept, on the small side but functional. The bathroom was large with a walk-in shower, no tub. The beach and ocen were delightful. The pool was on the dirty side but I think that was due to the aftermath of the Labor Day week-end crowd. The pool is weell designed however. There is a very nice tapas bar in the Tower building lobby that serves good Spanish wines by the glass at very reasonable prices. This is a good hotel to come to without a car. There is a bus (75cents) to Old San Juan and other attractions. There are always taxis lined up in the driveway. It costs about $10-15.00 each way into Old San Juan. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: Perrieli
Reviews.Content: My experience wasn't personal, however it was even better since I was in the United States and through telephone conversations and emails with the hotel personnel, I was able to execute a surprise for a dear friend who was spending his vacation for the first time in Puerto Rico, specifically at the Caribe Hilton. Everybody from the Concierge to the Food & Beverage Supervisor and Manager was excellent at following through with what they said they will do. Not only that, they also made sure they covered every single detail to ensure the surprise was a success. I definitely can count on them and will highly recommend the Caribe Hilton Hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “NOT Impressed with the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun08
Reviews.Content: Let me start first by saying for a Hilton I expected much better, I mean come for almost $500 per night I wouldn't think you would have holes in the floor!! We arrived in San Juan around 2:30 on a saturday so of course the airport was very crowded. We finally got a cab and he took us to our hotel. We waited forever to check in (and there really weren't alot of people in line) in the open air lobby, so by the time we were done we were hot and sweaty. We were "upgraded" to the Honors tower. We were very impressed to begin with the shops seemed nice and the honors tower lobby was beautiful, we took the elevator up to the 15 floor, and it ended there. As soon as we stepped off we saw dirty walls and stained carpet. We got to our room, and it was worse. The walls seems filthy and needed repainting in the worst way, the air didn't work well, and while the bathroom was very large, with nice tile floors and showers, there were holes in the floor under the sink. Not sure what they were doing in there but maybe they need to finish their renovations before renting rooms out to people. We had to turn the air down to 65 just to get it to run for more than 2 minutes at a time. We first set it on 70, when it was close to 80 already in the room, and it ran for 2 minutes ( we timed it) then went right back off. It finally cooled off when we went to bed around 10:00 that night. We finally decided that we only had to stay one night (at least it seemed clean, and the bed was comfy I will give them that) so we would go explore the grounds. First we walked over to where the fort was and watched about 50 crabs crawl around walked over around the pool, then finally over to the fish pond to see the swans and the peacocks. We enjoyed that, then went back to order room service and waited over an hour for a cheeseburger. I don't know if it was really good, or I was just really hungary, but since I hadn't eaten for 14 hours, (not even peanuts on the plane) it seemed to me like the best cheeseburger ever, my husband says otherwise; not bad but just ok. The view was ok, pretty to the left and right but straight in front of us was a "very nice" roof if looking past it you could see water. We only stayed one night, as we were leaving on a cruise the next day, and when we checked out we were stuck with over $100 over what we were quoted as our final price. We spoke with the Hilton before we left and were told what our total would be complete with taxes and hotel fees, and we were lied to, because our total bill was close to $100 more than that. To sum it up, it would be worth staying there if they didn't charge so much. But with the problems we had I wouldn't stay again. I guess you only pay for the name, not the actual quality of the hotel. I will be wiser next time. On the bright side we had excellent weather, the day after hurricane Faye!!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking at Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: hel4fun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from 8/15/08 to 8/21/08 and we were very disappointed. I had called the hotel 5 days prior to arriving, just in case, to confirm our reservation and let them know we would be arriving late (11:00 pm) and to request one king size bed instead of two queen size beds. They confirmed us for a late arrival and one king size bed. So naturally, when we entered our room (right by the elevators) we found we had two double/full size beds. Not king size, and even smaller than queen size! So my husband headed downstairs, spoke to the manager on duty and was told there were no other rooms, but that the next day they should have rooms become available and we would be switched to another room. He also said to just leave all our bags packed the next morning and staff would move our suitcases to our new room. So that night we slept in kid-sized beds, as best we could with the constant noise of the elevator all night long! It literally sounded like a roller coaster! The room itself was seriously out dated and abused. We weren't expecting luxury here, just a certain standard of cleanliness and care in the room. Very disappointed. The next morning we headed out and, just in case, stopped at the front desk to remind someone about our room change. No one knew a thing about it. No notes were left by the manager for anyone to follow up on. But they did change our room to one in the Hilton Honors tower. We thought that sounded great, but it still turned out to be less than what you would expect of a Hilton Hotel anywhere else. Again they put us right next to the elevators, but at least in this building you couldn't hear it. The room was......okay. Nothing great, just okay. There were stains on sofa and carpet, a hole punched in at the base of bathroom entryway (odd) and a leak in the bathroom ceiling that landed on the bathroom counter. (I had noticed a stinky wet towel on the counter when we arrived and figured the maid had left a dirty cleaning towel there by accident. No, the maid had left a towel there on purpose to sop up all the dirty water that leaked through the ceiling! I had to keep doing the same every day to keep my personal items from being soaked!) We didn't bother to change rooms again as I can't imagine that any of the other rooms in the BEST tower would be any different. Also, the parking is atrocious. Seems like the Normandie Hotel next door is quite the hot spot on Friday and Saturday nights, and they all park at the Hilton! So you can forget about parking on the street and or even in the "hotel" parking! Everyone parks there, hotel guest or not! We had no choice but to go with valet parking, and even still our car stayed exactly where we left in front of the lobby for about 2 hours because even the valets had nowhere to park it or even move it. The food and drinks at the hotel are overpriced, as expected. The pool definitely didn't look clean. The beach is okay, definitely not a "Caribbean white sand and blue water" beach....far from it! We really only picked this hotel because the location was convenient for our needs on this trip and because we figured (wrongly) that we could count on Hilton quality. If you require a clean hotel room with few visible signs of wear and tear, do not stay here. The lobby area is very nice, and deceiving if you think the rooms will be similar in quality. But the rooms are what matter to me, so I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for Upscale? Go Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgreen1
Reviews.Content: Well - My husband and I just returned from a 7day/6night stay at the Caribe Hilton...and I have A LOT of mixed feelings about our stay. First of all - The staff for the most part is very helpful. We arrived on the day of our check in at 12noon. We were provided passes for the executive lounge and a promise that the room would be ready by 2:30pm. By 1:30pm. We were in our room - EXCELLENT FIRST IMPRESSION! It was located in the Hiltons Honors building room 1268...our view was of the fort and ocean (very nice) EXECPT we also had the view of the roof... very large eye sore. But from the 12th floor we just looked beyond it...and that was fine...The room was in okay but had it's issues... there were cracks in the wall that were painted over...the frame of the bath room door was rusted and the inside cabinet of the mini frigde was gross - the water never got hot enough in the shower or double sinks. hey seemed to put a bit more effort into the bathroom...as it did have somewhat of an upscale feel. And the bedding was comfy. Housekeeping was very nice but we had to call for wash cloths 5 out of 7 days. We had roomservice for breakfast one morning which was delicious and for $60.00 for eggs bacon and french toast for 2...it should have been delicious. We ate at the pool twice and at the lobby bar one late night...other than that we did not experience the restaurants. I must say that ALL the common areas of the Hilton are nice - not spectacular, but nice. On some days the pool cleanliness was questionable so I decided to just catch some sun...the water was NOT appealing at all, and when we asked the pool area staff, they said it was all the sunscreen/suntan lotion etc. creating residue??? YUKE. We visited the LaConcha for cocktails one evening - very upscale feeling at the LaConcha and the Marriott Stellars Casino another evening...they are within two blocks of each other and are nice properties...I cannot say anything about the rooms at those places but the common areas were beautiful and felt upscale...more so than the Caribe Hilton. Oh well...in the end...we did not spend a lot of time in the room and were gone most days by noon and rarely returned before 9 - 10pm. The Caribe Hilton was an okay home bases...Oh and did I mention we only paid $130.00 per night - direct internet deal directly with Hilton, which included full access to the executive lounge which as cool for free soft drinks, assorted fruits and contentental breakfast...On the day we rented a car(to go to the rainforest), we parked on the street, walked about a half block to the hotel and saved on the $15.00 daily parking too...In the end, we had a great time in San Juan...that great time had very little to do with the Caribe Hilton as the Hilton does not offer anything in the way of daily activities...unless feeding the fish with the free bread they provide is your idea of activity. A pool side band/music would add some needed atmosphere to the day time pool area....for sure. Based on a few pool side conversations with other guests, I think this hotel caters more to the business traveler...many of which seem to bring families along.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: TravDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton before departing on our Celebrity Cruise in March 2008. It was a great hotel and a great location - very close to the port. Our room overlooked the ocean and had a nice sized balcony. The staff was efficient and extremely helpful. The only slight negative was that the AC was not that cool - but we were only in the room for a limited time. We will definitely stay there again when in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: 2001elan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 6 year old child for 2 nights in July. We paid $210 per night including the buffet breakfast. The final bill totaled $560 after taxes, fees and parking. Well what can I say? In December 2006 I stayed here and wrote a fabulous review on this website. Now, I am disappointed that all did not go well. As others have mentioned, there is a problem with rooms in the old tower. An employee mentioned that a big remodel will begin in the near future. The AC could not be increased above 62 degrees. We changed room twice. The general atmosphere in the lobby is beautiful. It is classic 40's modern and is very cool. The rooms however, were shabby. Paint peeling, rusty pipes in bathroom etc... When I complained the staff were very accomodating and understanding. I get the feeling that they hear complaints all day long and must change rooms frequently for customers. I heard everyone complaining and lots of room credit charges being given. I guess I should have asked for financial compensation for my headaches. Instead, they just kept changing my room. The rooms never seemed to get much better. The kid activities were minimal. The game room had broken machines and a change machine that never worked. I inquired about the kids camp but it never seemed to be functioning each day. The pool is kind of dirty. The pool cleaning guys tried to clean each day.The buffet Breakfast (forgot the restaurant name) at the hotel was very good! As others mentioned, no direction is given. The hotel amenities are not explained. The business center offers 5 minutes free internet use. There is a cute rear garden with rare birds. All of this stuff I just happen to stumble upon. The gym is free and very nice with new equipment. Bread is provided next to the towel stand for fish feeding (fun for kids). But again, no one told me about it. The 9th floor VIP lounge is pretty good. Continental breakfast and evening dvoudores, cookies all day. During the day you can use the computer and you have your own VIP desk person to assist you with check out and concierge services. No one told me this, I just again, stumbled upon it. I was granted VIP lounge use after the foul ups with my room. FYI - the kids movie theater is only open during the winter holidays. The staff are hard working and very kind. They just have a hard job because the rooms are pretty crummy. If you go, you must request the new Hilton Honors Tower, otherwise you will have room issues. I'll try the Marriott Stellaris next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: WinnieNewYork
Reviews.Content: All I can say about the Caribe Hilton is that it was just OK. The facility and grounds were fine and enjoyable but the room was totally NOT what I expected from a Hilton Resort. Our room was in the main tower on the 5th floor and I hated it from the moment we walked in. It is old and dated and in desperate need of a facelift. I have stayed here in the past (which is why I decided to stay here again) but it was nothing like I remember. It was very disappointing and I highly doubt if I would ever stay here again. For what we were paying I expected better accommodations. I have stayed at other Hilton Hotels and at least you felt like you were getting your money's worth even if it was not an executive suite ! This room does not hold a candle to those. I attempted a room change but was told by the staff member who checked us in that unfortunately there was nothing else available and would not be for a few days. Let's see where do I begin. On top of the fact that the room had seen better days, the TV did not work properly with or without the remote. The dresser had a door in front of it that was loose and coming off the hinges. We complained about both and they sent two people up to fix the door but the TV problem was NEVER resolved. At first they blamed it on the cable company, then on the remote, then on the TV itself. (however our friends across the hall had no problem with their TV from the start). Let's see what else...the air conditioning was difficult to control. One minute we were hot and the next we were freezing. We had a problem with the tub because the water would not drain properly. The bathroom also had loose fixtures. I spent the first four days trying to correct the various problems with the front desk staff and several managers. One manager explained that this is an old hotel and they are in the process of renovating...but it's a very slow process. The maintenance staff must be pretty busy round the clock ! We did however like the facilities, spa, and grounds. We were traveling with a 14 year old who enjoyed the pool. Most of the staff were polite and pleasant. All I can say is please heed the warnings on this website and do not be fooled by pretty pictures on the internet. For what they are charging, unless you are planning on staying in one of the executive suites (which I understand are much nicer)....go somewhere else !

Reviews.Title: “Change in management - beware”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelohyeah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a week. According to the friends we traveled with who have been coming to this resort for the past 10 years, things have slipped with the new manager. Staff confirms he has fired workers and kept middle-managers. This was apparent with the "work slow down" we experienced. Our room was older, but dirty. I can live with the missing art on the wall, but the mess in the fridge took hours for us to soak off and clean. On day two, our toilet quit working so we were moved to another room. It was okay though there were only two towels and the fridge, again, was dirty. On one occasion, due to the aforementioned work slow down, our room was not made up at all. The restaurants are ridiculously expensive and we ended up eating all meals except three, off the property. We paid $22 per person for a breakfast buffet and they didn't refill food items in a timely manner. The Atlantico charged $15 for a small burger and $11 for a wrap that was dry. The Spanish restaurant, while spendy, excelled with customer service thanks to friendly, and very funny, Victor. He was charming, funny, warm, helpful and I wish we would've eaten there more often. He is a diamond. Beware of the pool towel scam, they make you sign for pool towels and then charge you if they're not back by 6:00 p.m. We questioned this because their posted sign says you have until 9:00 to return them but the pool staff said no, 6:00 or you pay $20 per towel. If you go early you don't have to sign for the towels. Also be careful in the pool. On the weekend it was completely out of control (foul language, drinking, jumping off the waterfalls and other permanent fixtures, etc.). The pool staff did NOTHING to bring order to the chaos. We ended up leaving the pool when it appeared two very loud women were about to fight. It scared us. They now allow drinking IN the pool and hot tubs. We picked out litter, cans, plastic cups and removed glasses and bottles from the pool deck so that no one would get cut. The pool decks also are coated in a slime that really needs to be power-washed off. Be careful if it rains because they are SLICK. After overhearing two different couples complaining about some of the same things we decided it was time to talk to the general manager. He explained that since it was off season he only had staff at the pool during the weekend. We told him about the chaos and he pretty much blew us off Evidently there used to be a daily activity schedule but they have stopped handing that out. It's hard to find out what's going on and what you get for that 12 percent resort fee. So, I while I would give this hotel another chance it begs the question "why?" since there are so many other resorts in this town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room But Overpriced/Not for Couples”
Reviews.Author: MaxWish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton on the recommendation of our travel agent. We were staying one night in San Juan before going on our honeymoon on Royal Caribbean. Although the room and ocean view were nice, it was quite expensive ($350/night) and the hotel offered little else. The photos of the pool and grounds on the website looked enticing, but in reality were small. The hotel food available was expensive ($8 for a Bud Light and $16 for a hamburger!) so we opted to eat at the Subway a block away. The area around the hotel is run down and we were even told by a security guard to not leave the hotel grounds after dark. In addition, there were a lot of families with small children running around - which was not what we wanted for the first night of our honeymoon. After we ventured into Old San Juan, we wished we would have stayed there instead. There is plenty to do within walking distance (restaurants, bars, museum, etc.) and the hotel rates are much more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: amylkn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Caribe for 3 nights 7/28 to 7/31. Cab ride from airport to hotel for 3 people with 3 bags was $23. checked with others, and everyone paid under $25. Nice hotel, nice people working there, very clean. Lots of places to eat at hotel, some more expensive than others. Drinks are not cheap, pretty standard for resorts. No complaints. Our room was in the tower and was very nice. It was clean, the bathroom was updated and very nice. Our housekeeper was a wonderful lady that did a great job and went out of her way to make our stay comfortable. We had a small fridge in the room that we stocked with water and drinks from the shop across the street. No complaints at all. The beach area is sheltered by the man made reef area, we enjoyed it, great for kids to play in, and mine loved the big slide out on a "float". We snorkeled every day at the Caribe beach and saw amazing fish! Highly recommend - they rent the masks/snorkels for $5 at towel hut. Every room can get a beach umbrella free of charge, and that made staying out for long times bearable. We liked the pool, although it is a small one. My child liked jumping off the sides into the pool, and the waterfalls. The pool does get a bit dirty, however, I saw them "scooping and cleaning" everyday. Only downside for this hotel is how far away it is to Old San Juan. We wanted to shop and sightsee, and heard cabs were about $12 to get to Old San Juan. We did walk to the bus stop, easy walk around the corner. Bus ride is easy and quick and no more than .75 cents. Bus stops running at 9pm. We went with a big group in cab and they charged us $3 per person instead of flat rate, so just be upfront with them. The bus stop in Old San Juan is right by cruise ships, and it's quite a bit of walking to get to the old forts and the other side of shopping area, so wear good shoes and bring a map. There is a free trolley that goes around Old San Juan, however we found that the cruise ship people took up all the seats and you could waste much time just waiting on a trolley. We had no problems with the trolley the day there were no cruise ships in port. We did eat at the Parrot Club- very good, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a lot more”
Reviews.Author: jzee79
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are superb, from the private beach to the pool bar. However, the accolades stop there. To start, the lady at the check-in counter wasn't overly welcoming. The in-room safety deposit box keypad wasn't working. The deadbolt on the room door wasn't working. The lock on the balcony door was about to fall off. The pool water was dirty. The room carpet was dirty, as was the carpeting in the hallway. Bathroom light was out. Overall, I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!”
Reviews.Author: Candy16
Reviews.Content: I chose the Caribe for a pre cruise stay because of its proximity to the piers in old san juan. It was awsome. We arrived early (around 2 pm) and had to wait for our room to be ready. Check in time is 4pm, the bellstaff stored our luggage and we headed to enjoy the facilities, the front desk staff took our information to let us know when the room was ready. By 3pm they had already called us to give us our room. At the desk we noticed several other guests complaining about having to wait for their rooms since noon. As the bellman escorted us to the room I asked if it was frequent that guests have to wait so many hours like those other guests. He told me that this hotel runs full almost everyday, which makes it hard to have vacant/ clean rooms during the day for early arrivals. He also mentioned that the more of a hard time you give the front desk the worst of a room you will get. So beware. Thankfully our room was lovely, we stood in room 1865 at the tower building, it had the most awsome ocean view. The hotel layout is side ways so no room is ocean front but this side of the tower building is the only one where you wont see the roof of the next building in the hotel. Since it was the 18th floor we saw some of the front garden , a park , and the ocean, during the day you can even see the ships as the approach the pier. The room was spacious and had a great marble bathroom with a walk in shower instead of a tub. We always had fresh towls and sheets, although you have to request them, as a hilton standard the beds now have only a duvet instead of sheets. Since we are hilton honors members we have free access to the lounge in the executive level of the main building. It was nice because it offeres continental breakfast in the day and in the evening they have appetizers and cocktails, if you are not a gold or diamond member you might want to consider upgrading to the executive level to have this access because the food in the hotel is expensive and there are not much options outside the hotel unless you take a cab or rent a car. Walking distance there is a minimart, a small local coffeshop that makes great sandwiches and awsome eggs with bacon, and a subway restaurant. But thats about it. The options inside the hotel are good although expensive, they have a Morton's steakhouse, a pan- asian restaurant called Lemongrass, an Italian restaurant called Il Giardino and a Spanish restaurant called Madrid - San Juan. My favorite was Lemongrass, wonderful sushi. My least favorite was Madrid San Juan, the service was not so good and the food was just ok. The grounds are perfect, a nice big 3 tier pool,very kid frindly beach, plenty of hammoks to nap under the shade of the palm trees, we always were able to get umbrellas and towels, although the hotel was full we never felt crowded. They also have a nice quiet tropical garden with a pond with swans in it, also they have peacocks that stroll around the garden , this garden also has a small pool that you can enjoy if you pefer to be in a more quiet and private surrounding. Our check out was ok we did the express check out option to avoid the lines, we booked with travelocity so we had to pay the extra resort fee and occupancy tax that is not covered by these wholesalers ( Travelocity, orbitz, hotels.com, priceline,etc) the resort fee is about a 12% of the rate and the occupancy tax is 5 dollars per person per day. If you book with a travel agency ask if its included so you wont be surprised when you check out. Also, be carefull when you give your credit card, as in all hotels they put a hold on the card for an estimated amount of your total nights rate with taxes plus 75dollars per day per person for incidentals, if you use a debit card these funds will be automaticly deducted from your account and you will not be able to use your money . If you use a debit card I suggest you withdraw the money and pay in cash. In my case i was promised they would not make a hold but rather keep the credit card number to charge me at check out. I gave them my card and a few moments later I checked my balance, they had taken an approval for 800 dollars, when my total stay did not sum up to 400 dollars. I had to wait a week to get the money back in my account. I would surely return to the Caribe hilton , the staff was always friendly and had a can do attitude,I always felt welcome. I'm already planning my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinnychase
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton in late July 2008. In my stay I was able to experience two towers of the hotel. First they put me in the "Main Tower." This part of the hotel was just ok. It was older, but the rooms looked renovated with new furniture & large bathrooms with two sinks & an overhead "rain" shower. The bad part of the room was my view looked at a construction site, & the noise woke me up every morning. After 2 nights of my air conditioning breaking down & the staff trying to fix it, I asked for a room change. The Hilton staff was somewhat unwilling to do this (said the hotel was booked & could not change rooms), but after talking to a manager I was able to be moved into the Executive Tower. This part of the hotel is much nicer. The rooms are newer, although bathrooms are smaller (no rain shower) than the older tower. I had an awesome view of the beach & ocean. This tower also has the "executive lounge" where they have breakfast every morning (bagels, fruit, pastries, cereal, coffee) & hors devours after 5pm. In both towers the rooms I had featured safes & small fridges. The resort part of the hotel is nice. They have a 2 tiered pool, hammocks, a gym & tennis courts. The private beach is a little small, & the water was somewhat choppy. Old San Juan is around 15 min by bus & the bus stop is a 2 min walk from the hotel. Condado is about a 15-20 min walk from the hotel. If you take a cab its about $15 to each destination. One of the problems with the hotel is the area. Besides the resort & neighboring Normandie hotel, there is not much around. If you want to eat quick, the only options to eat close to the hotel besides the overpriced hotel restaurants is Subway Sandwich across the street. After visiting Condado, I wished I stayed there because of proximity to restaurants & nightlife. There are many nice Casino/Resort Hotels there, and a ton of restaurants on that strip within walking distance. So, if you're a person who doesnâ€™t want to walk, take a cab, or bus every time you want to eat stay in Condado. Overall, my stay at the Caribe Hilton was decent. Although, I'm not sure if it would have been as good had I not been able to switch rooms & have access to the breakfast lounge. Like I said, if I was to stay in around the San Juan area again, I would probably stay in Condado. Extra Info: You will be charged a resort fee every day of your stay. Also, had some good pizza at Via Appia in Condado & if you're looking for close nightlife to the hotel the La Concha in Condado is nice. The lobby & pool of this hotel have a Miami nightlife feel. Good looking crowd, good music. Must do tours: The Rainforest Tour The Biobay Tour (watch your hand glow in the water!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louisianagirl29
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! We stayed here pre-cruise. Very nice start to our trip. Very updated.

Reviews.Title: “amazing accommodation, not good representation of PR”
Reviews.Author: johnson2589
Reviews.Content: The Caribe hilton is located between two main areas of San Juan: Condado (beach center) and old San Juan (old town, history, etc). Therefore the hotel itself should have adequate stuff to do...and it does! There are several excellent restaurants on grounds. The newly added lemongrass was incredible with a nice latin/asian fusion restaurant with the most amazing cocktail ever: a guavasaketini. Words can't describe this one. Also there is a starbucks, pharmacy, gift shops, swim up bar, etc. On top of all these american-esque features, the resort is bordered by two old forts. They are not open to tour, but it is nice to be reminded that you are actually in an older city. If you are coming to see puerto rico and explore the culture in puerto rico, don't stay here. If you are coming to have american-like facilities, treatment, and cuisine, this is a perfect hotel. Great service, english speakers, many american tourists. They also have a great beach for San Juan, although i would encourage driving 1 hr. east to Luquillo for better snorkeling/swimming/waves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: eatlocal
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews on this site. However, we noticed that the majority of reviews were positive and went in to the stay hoping for the best. We wouldn't be disappointed! The hotel grounds, gardens, pools, beach, and overall scenery and views were spectacular! The staff was all very friendly, helpful, and always willing to go out of their way to make the stay more enjoyable. The staff at the pool bar was wonderful - especially Hiram who always remembered our names and what we wanted to order (we usually ended our days at the pool bar). We stayed in the HHonors tower on the 19th floor and our room was very nice with a great ocean view. The mini fridge in the room was nice to have and the remodeled bathroom with the tavertine shower and double sink was beautiful as well.
