The executive lounge was nice to get the evenings started with light snacks and cheap drinks. The breakfast in the lounge was very adequate and the free soda and water was great during the day. We did a lot of our eating at local restaurants (highly recommend the Parrot Club and Raices) but did eat at Morton's at the hotel. It was expensive but one of the best overall meals we've ever had! We did use the spa for massages and were pleased with those services as well. Overall, we had a great experience at the Caribe Hilton and would not hesitate to return or to recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “not bad ...”
Reviews.Author: BAR2AG4
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at this Hilton in January 2008. The front desk staff was very helpful as were the rest of the staff we encountered. The guys serving at the Atlantico grill near the pool were terrific! Lots of fun there and they made sure my younger daughter didnt feel left out. The Palmeras restaurant wasnt the greatest, and the breakfast buffet was expensive. Seventy some odd dollars for the 3 of us--for breakfast! Room service breakfast was cheaper and we got more food. The Lemongrass Asian restaurant was wonderful! Recommend reservations there... we didnt have one but they did seat us quickly at an inside table. The food was great and the atmosphere was the best. The executive lounge served a very basic breakfast, cereal, coffee and danish. We were way underdressed the one evening we went to check out the hors-d'ouvres so we didnt stay. The pool was very nice but the swim up bar was a bit cumbersome to get to, or maybe it was just me. The room we had on the 8th floor of the main building was nice and clean. A little dated except for the flat screen tv. It rained alot during our stay and the balcony had about an inch of water on it just about all the time. Not really a bother, but the drain didnt work. The lagoon was okay. Lots of rocks embedded in the water. We ended up going to Isla Verde beach instead. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, but probably wont go back to this Hilton unless we just need to stay in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Best of everything especially the staff”
Reviews.Author: rdeo
Reviews.Content: Since AAA Travel ruined our arrival time I didn't know what to expect,however we were totally surprised how accomodating the staff was especially Sonia who helped make an error by AAA into a most wonderful experience.I can not say enough about the most helpful and courteous staff,best I have seen in over 30 years of traveling.Efrain our breakfast server was terrific especially helpful giving us places to visit during our stay. The hotel is amazing,the views are great,grounds spacious and spotless,the pools and ocean views wonderful. The words that come to mind during our short stay,breathless,beautiful,outrageous. I only wish we had more time to enjoy the accomodations. Thanks to all at The Caribe Hilton. Rich Deo

Reviews.Title: “No Better Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: MsWells1
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that my girlfriends and I were kind of weary about going to Puerto Rico (which I must say turned out to be the most beautiful place and fun), much less about the hotel. But since I waited a little too late for my passport, we chose to go ahead and go. After much carousing and reviewing of all the different hotels in San Juan, we settle on the Caribe Hilton. We really didn't know what to expect because some of the reviews were very exceptional and some were down right anti-Caribe. We arrived in San Juan on Friday May 23rd and stayed until Tuesday May 27th. Upon arriving and checking in at the Caribe Hilton I notified the check in desk that I was a Hilton Honors member and immediately got a free upgrade. I'm not sure were we where staying prior but we were upgraded to the Garden Towers on the 4th floor. The room had 2 bathrooms (only one had a shower), a king size bed and a pullout sofa bed in the living room. There was a television in each room. It came with a safe and refrigerator. It was nicely decorated and gave you the feel of apartment living. We had 2 separate balconies with an entrance to each one. The view was partial garden and partial ocean, which was very nice. After we settled down into the room, two of us decided to go downstairs to one of the hotel restaurants to eat. We chose Palmeras...which was a great thing....because every Friday they have an all you can eat Seafood buffett (great for those seafood lovers). They had sauteed lobster ready to eat, stone crab claws sauteed ready to eat, fried shrimp, baked fish, cold boiled shrimp, various choices of salads with seafood...it was AMAZING. Yes, it was a little pricey...about $52 per person, but it was worth every bit of the price. While we were eating we did have a small incident take place back at our room. The other young lady left behind in the room had a nice surprise when she stepped out of the shower. There was another set of guest sitting in the living room. After trying to straighten it out herself (hard due to language constraints), I paid a visit to the front desk and spoke with the manager. She kindly apologized, changed the keys and gave us a $75.00 credit towards our room. This really did come in handy because it just about covered our tab at the restaurant. Each day was a new adventure at the hotel. There was the lively breakfast buffet that Palmera had every morning, not to mention a great menu selection too. Did I mention how awesome the wait staff is in this restaurant, especially Efrim, he's very attentive and as a guest you will not lack quality service. Then there's the mimosa's served that you could take by the pool area and layout. The pool area was absolutely beautiful and spacious. Several pools to choose from. There was small private beach, however, alongside of the Caribe's property was a public beach and there were a lot of visitors. The Caribe offered the rental of paddle boats at the hotel to take out on the water. There were water activities going on in the private area of the beach. It was great. There was never a shortage of cabs in the front of the hotel. Or you could walk 2 blocks and catch the city bus to Old San Juan to get there in 10 minutes for only .75 cents and it lets you off right by the cruise docks. The great part about this hotel is the location. It's not in the middle of all the Old San Juan hustle and bustle and it's not part of the Isla Verde fast paced strip. You can have quiet and then you can take a cab or bus to the busy areas in under 10 minutes. Any time of night or day. A great perk about this hotel is not just the boutiques that are located there in the hotel or the modern openness of the lobby, but it's the great convenience of the Starbucks. Located in the downstairs lobby. Great for the late night recoveries. Go downstairs get a cup of mojo and go back to the room to wake up. Lastly I can not go without mentioning how great the room service and housekeeping was. We were never short of towels and if we happened to use to many (because women do that sometimes) we called housekeeping for more and in a matter of 15 minutes we would have our fresh towels. We put in a late night call to room service for a request of a microwave, within a matter of 20minutes we had a microwave set up in our room, free of charge. The staff was great, service was great, ambiance was one of a kind. I will definitely be staying at the Caribe Hilton the next time I visited Puerto Rico, hands down!

Reviews.Title: “It could be so much better.”
Reviews.Author: Thor13
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton has so much going for it, but with a little more attention, it could be so much better. But to get the most out of the experience you should make sure you stay in the tower with an ocean view. The view is spectacular. Even so, the room did smell slightly musty when entering. The phone smelled like it had been wiped with a dirty cloth. The wash cloths were not replaced each day. The internet in the room was not always reliable although there was free wireless in the lobby. The bell staff was inattentive at times. The main bar tender at the beach bar had a great personality and makes a great Mai Tai. However, the margarita was one of worse. The dance lessons were given in the game room with all the accompaning noise. The person cleaning the room swept the dirt and sand in front of the door which made entering very unappealing. The whole place good use some firm management oversight and more comittment to their patrons. To save money, we walked acoss the bridge under construction to some local restaurants and found some good ones. More at my travel blog www.agingracer.com

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: NJFrequentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spend three nights with my partner at the Caribe Hilton in June and had a perfect weekend. Yes, it's pricey to eat and drink in the hotel, but you know that before you get there! I'm a Hilton HHonors gold member and we got an executive floor room in the main building. Despite being the oldest part of the property, the room was modern, clean and attractively decorated. We also had access to the Executive Lounge with free breakfast, soft drinks all day and evening cocktails and food. (The cocktails aren't free, but at only $3-4 each they are a third of the price of downstairs!) We spent much of our time relaxing on the beach and by the pools and although the hotel was busy, the area was never overcrowded. The main downstairs bar had a lively atmosphere every night, with great rum punch and mojitos. We also ate at Morton's, which was elegant and excellent as always - and it has windows overlooking the ocean - the only Morton's I've been in with windows! A 10 min walk takes you over the bridge to Condado for many casinos, restaurants etc. and a short cab ride takes you to Old San Juan. I would definately go back to the Caribe for a relaxing weekend again!

Reviews.Title: “inconsistent room quality and overall horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: bluesalley
Reviews.Content: I was booked for four nights and five days for a fairly expensive conference rate (close to 200/night) and was very disappointed. I stayed in the "lagoon villa" section. The room overlooked an active construction site with a polluted lagoon. The water in the shower and sink ran black and sooty for three minutes before looking somewhat clear enough to take a shower. I had multiple cockroach sightings. The smell of mold was overwhelming. Several others in our group have commented similiarly about the run-down condition of this hotel. When I asked for a room change, information was recorded, but then I never heard from anyone. When I checked they pretended like they had never heard the complaint before. Last but not least, the internet connection was slow and very spotty....

Reviews.Title: “Service was terrible, room was ok, food was expensive”
Reviews.Author: bahstengirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic getaway. When we arrived we could tell the service was going to be an issue. The valet/check-in stations were not well organized. We went to valet the car and told a guy we wanted to park. He told us to leave the car and then he forgot about it. We went to check in (which took 30 mins!...no one is in a rush here) and they still had not moved it. We walked over to the car and told them we wanted it parked and then they took care of it. Once we got checked in we asked to have our bags delivered to the room. After waiting 45 minutes, we called and they said they would send them up. After 15 more minutes we went downstairs to find them still sitting where we left them. We ended up taking them up ourselves. We ate by the pool and ended up spending $100 on 2 drinks each and sandwiches! We ate at most of the restaurants and found the food and service to be average with the exception of Lemongrass. While this was our most expensive meal (we ate just apps and drinks and it was still $150!) it was by far the best meal of the trip. I found the pools to be a bit chilly, crowded and noisy with lots of kids. We actually rented a car and drove to Ponce for the day. We stumbled across a place called Copamarina and will stay there next time. The pools were perfect, spread out and they had more activities on the beach (parasaling, snorkeling etc. right outside the room door!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice surpirse”
Reviews.Author: sunnyOrangeCounty_Ca
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the hilton caribe in Arpil for 2 nights. I have to say i was really worried when i got this hotel thru priceline becasue the reviews i read very mixed. Let me tell you. I loved this hotel. Ther service was very nice and the rooms very modern and tastefully decorated. They very a little small but that was ok. The bathroom was very nice and good size. Two sinks and a very nice shower. I always love a nice bathroom. One other thing i really liked was the mini refrigerator in the room. What a nice thing to have with 2 little ones. The hotel also has some toys for little kids which was a big plus for us. My kids really loved it. They also have nice shops. The only thing i can say bad was the pools. When we were there, the pool water looked very green. It did not look fresh and clean. No one was using the pools. I think they were aware of this and cleaning the pools. Nice little beach there too. Over all I had a plesant time and I would for sure go back to this hotel if i ever go to puerto rico again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton from 5/14-5/18 and loved our time here. We usually take a nice vacation once a year, and since we let our passports expire, we thought we should try Puerto Rico. The location of the resort was ok, right in the middle of everything, and an easy cab ride to Old San Juan, and Isla Verde. I would have to say that is the only downside of the property, is that you have to take a bus or cab and can't really walk to anywhere that is close. I highly recommend the Condado Area.. lots of places to eat outside the hotel (Danny's Pizza was awesome) and it's close to a couple of casino's. We ate at Morton's one night, great food, nice atmosphere, what you would expect from a nice steakhouse. We did however eat at the Parrot Club in old San Juan two nights. It was one the best places I have ever eaten, hands down. I recommend getting only appetizers and ordering a few, they were all outstanding! Don't forget desert also, the banana spring rolls were amazing! OK, be sure to see the forts. Both are really awesome if you like history. As for the rest of the hotel, lobby, pool, restaraunts were all first class and we enjoyed the pool bar immensly. Hiram and Jose will take good care of you if you take care of them. The room was a little "Dumpy" for being a Hilton, but I know the place is old. All in all, I would defintely recommend the hotel. Everything people said about prices are true, but if you are prepared, it's no big deal. It's not Mexico. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: GAtripGirl
Reviews.Content: Got a good price from Priceline. Upon check-in, a very nice guy at frontdesk gave me a great room in the HH tower where complimentary breakfast and all day long snacks + fruits + beverages are served. You need to have a HH membership in order to get all these. Nice pools but the beach is not a great one for swimming. A small fort in located in the hotel but it was closed for renovation during my stay. Room is nice, clean, big and with great view of the ocean and city. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: JohnroFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past weekend at the Caribe Hilton and absolutely loved it. Arrived around 2 PM but was advised that the room wasn't ready yet. The woman at the front desk advised that the standard check-in time is 4 PM but gave me a card with a phone number to call to find out if the room may be ready sooner. Sat down in the lobby and within 10 minutes one of the managers came over, saw the card, took it, said he would check for other available rooms, and came back with 2 card keys and directions on how to get to the room. That is what I call service and paying attention to detail as well as to your customer. Was placed in the Main Hotel. The room and the hallway had been renovated but could tell there had been some water damage in the room. No mold or stale smells though. Bathroom had some upgrades but could use some more work to give it a more polished modern look. However, it was clean and nice size and after a day some of the older features had developed a certain charm. No complaints on the room, everything up to date (minus the LCD TV), extremely comfortable bed, balcony with table and two chairs, and refrigerator (a microwave would have been nice too). Ate at Palmeras twice and had the buffet. The restaurants like most hotel restaurants are pricey but the food was good. For those without a rental car, there is a subway and a ice cream shop at the end of the block. Went there a couple of times to help offset the more costly meals. Also, took a cab to San Juan ($22 round trip) for sightseeing and to try some other restaurants (about a 10 minute ride there and 15 minute ride back due to the increased traffic). The recreational areas of the hotel were truly spectacular. From the tranquil garden area to the pool and beach areas. The hammocks and the fish feeding pier were nice extras. Always plenty of staff in the pool area adding chairs as needed and keeping things maintained. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: missmybid
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Caribe Hilton. This is a great resort, we had a wonderful time. The open air lobby is very nice and all of the staff we dealt with were excellent. The pool and beach areas are both very nice. You can rent kayaks and pool/beach toys at the hut which is located in between the beach and the pool area. There were waiters on the beach on the weekend, but not the weekday I was there. Also, on the weekend, there is yoga on the beach at 9:00 a.m. which was very good. Not to be overlooked is the small cafe in the spa building which is located at the end of the beach, in a seperate building from the hotel. They make wonderful fresh, made-to-order wraps here which we got for lunch everyday and took out onto the beach with us. They also have breakfast items and smoothies. The wraps were only about $10 each and much healthier than the menu at the pool bar. The store just across the street is a great place to go to stock up on water, beverages, and snacks. The rooms do have a refrigerator so you can keep your snacks cold. The rooms were very nice, the beds were great. The balconies are big enough to enjoy a cup of coffee on and feature a small table and two chairs. Having a Starbucks in the lobby was great. A coffee and a bagel in the morning will run you about $5. My only "negative" remark would be not necessarily about the resort but about Puerto Rico itself. The shoreline is very built up, one high rise hotel or condo building after another. The buildings just seem to be on top of each other near the water. It is not a deterrent once you familiarize yourself with the resort, but when I first arrived I was a bit disappointed with how congested the area was.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: robertwa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights for a business/pleasure trip. We found the hotel very nice and the service very attentive. When we arrived, they first gave us a room in the garden wing, but the view was terrible - overlooking the roof of another building - so we asked for different room, which they promptly gave us. This room had a beautiful view of the pool and ocean. The beach was very nice, although not too wide, and there are rock jetties that form a calm bay that is very good for swimming. My wife and I are avid snorkelers and those rocks were perfect for attracting a large number of fish that are very easy to swim to. We went on a snorkel trip on a catamaran one day during our stay and the snorkeling there was no better than that right at our hotel! There are four pools and three hot tubs that were not too crowded during our stay. In both the pool and beach areas, it was not too difficult finding lounge chairs. They have a nice tropical garden with ducks, geese, swans and a couple of peacocks. The grounds were kept immaculate. We found the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice but boring”
Reviews.Author: MPSF8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great to stay at if you are on a family vacation or on business. The rooms themself are 3 star quality, but the lobby, amenities, restaurant, etc are all 4.0-4.5 stars. If you are coming to San Juan to party and have a good time, this hotel probably isn't where you want to stay unless you are in a big group and can have fun no matter where you are.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I Expected But There's Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: chsmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from May 5th - May 8th. I liked a lot of things about the hotel (the open-air lobby, the Starbucks, the cleanliness of the rooms and the tropical garden) but there were a few issues: 1) There was no one at the check-in desk when I arrived. If you were Hilton Honors or a VIP your line was staffed but there was no one there for normal check-ins. Not the best first impression. 2) Room service trays and garbage were not picked up promptly from the hallways. When my next door neighbor had dinner his tray of half-eaten food remained outside the room until lunchtime the next day. This happened more than once. 3) Beach service was spotty. One day there was someone taking orders but the next day there was no one to be seen. I don't mind getting up to get my drinks and food but sometimes you just want to veg out and not move. 4) Food and drink prices are extraordinarily high. $10 for a Bud Light! That's ridiculous. 5) There needs to be a higher level of attentiveness to guests from some of the staff. One evening when I tried to get a cab to take me to the casino at the El San Juan Hotel, it took 5 minutes of standing around before the staff stopped chatting with each other to ask if they could help. All in all, I had a great trip because the weather in PR was wonderful and the beach at the hotel was really all I needed for a relaxing stay. Would I stay here again? Maybe if I found a really great rate but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton - We had a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: DogPower
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton in Puerto Rico from Monday, May 5 - Friday, May 9th. We had done some investigation and knew that this is the begining of the off-season. The crowds are less and prices drop some. We arrived at the hotel around 3pm. I am a Hilton Honour Silver member and was shown to a private registration desk attached to the Condado Villas. No waiting and we were able to check-in early. We had a King Villa on the 7th floor (7720) that over-looked the lagoon in which we saw a sea turtle!. The room had a full kitchen which was a little much as I didn't plan on doing any cooking. We utilized the refrigerator and we stocked it with beer, cheese, wine, etc. which was convenient and cost effective. The freezer had an icemaker which was great. There was also a table with four chairs for eating and the balcony had 3 chairs and a table. The lagoon was very pretty, but if we looked to our right there is new construction being done. The construction started around 7am. and is quite noisey. This was not an issue for us as we were off and running by 8am everyday anyway. The bathroom had a nice size shower (no tub). Closet space was sufficient. The king bed was excellent. Pillows were perfect and comforter was cozy. If you are a Hilton Honours member you can access the Executive Lounge which stocks water and soda pop. We only went there one time and grabbed some bottled water. It was nothing special. The Villa Lagoon area has a small pool which is by the garden area. It is was very quite. The main pool is nice with plenty of lounge chairs to be had. The Atlantis swim up bar makes great Mojitos, however they are $9 each. My husband and I liked to relax at the private beach area. The water is calm and the sand feels nice. It is perfect for small children as there is sufficient shallow water to play in and no waves. There are about 6 different restaurants attached with the hotel. We ate at two. Morton's Steakhouse for dinner one night and on the last day of our stay we ate at the breakfast buffet. Morton's was very good and we expected it to be pricey. The breakfast buffet was average and the bill was $50.00. Not worth the money. We had rented a car and did a lot of sight seeing..so we didn't stay and hang around at the hotel very much. But we managed to return everyday around 3pm and spend 2 hours on the beach. Perfect! Old San Juan is very close and you have many choices for dinner if you don't want to eat at the hotel. The staff at the hotel was very helpful with directions and the parking attendants were fast in retrieving the car. (Note: $20 a day for valet parking, $15 for manual). The Caribe is in a good spot to explore the North and East side of Puerto Rico. Side note: There is a great parking garage in Old San Juan. Follow the signs to the historical sites (forts). Drive up and around until you see a water fountain. The first street past the fountain turn left and the parking garage is on the left. $1.95 an hour. It is too hard to park on the streets in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.....Dirty....Moldy.....read this one. Honest.....see the pictures!”
Reviews.Author: yupoldbull
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January for 1 week. (7 people 3 rooms) It was terrible. Stay somewhere else. The food at the hotel was adequate. Pool burgers ($15) were Okâ€¦..salads were better. Best deal poolside is the large hot dog with a side of salad for $8.00. The lunch buffet looked just fair and overpriced at $26. One ice tea looked like mud and it was easily substituted with Arizona Tea. We went to the Italian restaurant in the hotel. It was Okâ€¦.even Ok++ The gnocchi and veal got the best vote. Service was very good. We went to Mortonâ€™s in the hotel. It was goodâ€¦..but it was freezing cold. Most of us had a collared short sleeve golf shirt on and it was a little brisk. Someone should have done something about the screaming 3 year old in the center section booth. The 60 minutes of screaming pretty much ruined our 7 meals. I would blame the parents first, and then the staff. The ice tea was, â€œas thick as mud,â€� and was sent back. We ordered the $8.95 side of baked potato and it never came out, but we did get to pay for it. The bone in rib eye was quite good, as was the Filet Oscar. The fillet looked Ok, but recieved very good reviews tableside. The sautÃ©ed mushrooms were outstanding, as was the overall service. We dropped $400 for dinner (without tip), 7 people, 2 beers, no desserts. It was good, overpriced, and I left unimpressed. You might find it better. A can of local light beer (Medalla) at the pool-side bar was an outrageous $6.96â€¦..add a couple of dollars for a tip and you are at $9.00 per beer. Surely not worth it, and the hotel management should â€œwake upâ€� and change the pricing. Medalla is similar to our Miller Light here in the states. The little Mini-Mart 85 meters from the lobby probably does a booming business. The marketing genius that suggested to management to charge $20 per unreturned towel has shown that he has never stayed at a good 4 star hotel. Nor, more than likely, will he ever be employed by one. Yes, you want your cheap blue and white towels back, but donâ€™t beat us up. It will get mentioned by people that rate your hotel. The concierge service was a cut above even though they were in the process of physically moving the desks and rebuilding. It took several days of tearing out and measuring, more tearing, and more measuring for everything to be moved. After the concierge desk was moved, they put up white plastic from floor to ceiling in the lobby, and began to fire nails through studs and into the concrete floor. The gun shots sounded like 9mmâ€™s being fired a distance of 5 meters with 40 mils of white plastic protecting customers that were walking down to the HonorsTower. We all ducked when the random shots were fired. The first time through was a little scary. They took good care of the two large parrots in the lobby, but let the customers walk past what sounded like a shooting range at a close distance. It was funny watching people duck. To finish with the concierge, they were extremely helpful. We dealt with at least 3 or 4 of them. They were all very good. One stands out as a â€œcan doâ€� hustler type that went the extra yard for us and was very professional. I approached him at the desk and he was excellent in highlighting the way to the Bacardi Factory Tour. (tour was Ok) I didnâ€™t get his name, but he is the only young thin large guy there that is 6â€™ 5â€� tall. Heâ€™s got the right â€œcan doâ€� attitude and is extremely professional. They were quick to make things correctâ€¦..should have been more proactiveâ€¦. than reactive. All 3 rooms had some degree of mold. Our room stunk like mold. This really ruined the stay for me. My wife is allergic to mold and we had to request the maid service to clean the mold from the shower ceiling. (It works better if you pay to have an extra service completed) We were told the renovations were done 1 year ago. It sure didnâ€™t look like it. The carpet looked like it was 5 to 10 years old. The sliding track balcony door didnâ€™t. The paint was slopped over all the outlet switches. The air conditioner appeared as thought it was original. (30 years old) It was filthy with moldâ€¦..and no filter. These types of conditions are unacceptable. The air conditioner was hard-wired to the slider, so that if the balcony slider was open, the air conditioner wouldnâ€™t work. So you had a choice, either a cool moldy roomâ€¦..or a hot fresh smelling room. Two poor choices for spending $5m on 3 rooms for 7 days. Portions of the hallway ceiling were cutout (drywall pull through holes) and remained unrepaired. This is unacceptable. Two of our rooms had nightstand lamps, one room didnâ€™t. A good Red Roof Inn would have been better than this. We got a 30 year old concreted moldy room that had been painted about 4 times. Furniture looked like it was 20+ years old. The 1.6 gpf toilet still had the tattered label on the front of it about 6â€� off the floor. The plumber never took it offâ€¦.nor did the maid service. This is the sign of a dirty room. Ironically, it was a modern low gallons per flush toiletâ€¦.but ours had a slow leak all day. (it is leaking right now) The small shampooâ€™s and mouth wash contents were horrible. The boxed bar soap was fair. I have traveled for over 30 yearsâ€¦..and this was some of the worst. Tasted and smelled like they were bulk packaged and poured out by bucket in the basement. You may like them, but ours stayed behind. The hallway ceiling drywall had "pull throughs".....square holes every 20 feet. (probably to pull cable through) Never fixed. Some in our group were at this very same location 30 years ago when it was new. (and this was the 3rd visit for them!) It's my last visit. Did I mention the loose stainless steel outdoor handrails outside the towers. No one cares! Probably broken for 20 years! As you can tell, I was unimpressed with this hotel, as well as, the entire island. If you like "dirt" go visit there. It's as close to 3rd world as I have ever seen. Rainforest was Ok. Taxi's were Ok. Several pictures attached. (pictures don't lie)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton, Hate the Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: enderart
Reviews.Content: After my first trip to Puerto Rico and staying at the one star hotel called the Hampton Inn priced at $179 a night, for only only an additional $16 I booked the week at the Hilton Caribe Hotel. What a difference, first of all the people are so friendly and tell you the reality of the island. I wanted to go Scuba Diving, they informed me what was the best way and to avoid any of the locals because everyone comes back disappointed; which I followed and it was awesome! The property itself was very cool, great pool scene, cool restaurants, awesome gym and private beach area. The room was great, cold a/c, the scene from the room you looked over some restaurants, but when you come in at around midnight you only see stars and hear the beach. The executive center is not as nice as others I have been to, like in Ecuador or Argentina; but the staff was very accomodating. All in all, this is where I am staying from now on, when I go to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: firemanAlbany_NY
Reviews.Content: We went for my son's 4 year old birthday and the hotel was excellent. Since I am a Diamond Hilton Honors member, we were upgraded to the Condado Suite, which is 2 bedrooms, 2 1/2 baths. The views from the 20th floor were excellent. The Executive lounge had a continetal breakfast, snacks all day and drinks from 5:30-8pm. The happy hour drink prices were $3-$4 a drink, very reasonable. My wife didn't care for the breakfast too much since there wasn't much protein on the breakfast bar but alot of carbs. Since it was part of the room charge, the lounge served its purpose since my son could eat alot of fruit and cheese. The onsite hotel restaurants were ok and we ate at the pool restaurant everyday. Kids under 5 eat free if there is an adult meal purchased. We would recommend this hotel to all families with children. The pools are excellent and the beach is protected with no waves to knock the children over.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!!! A+++ Best Hotel Stay Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: RedCarnationReady
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin, from the moment I stepped foot out of the taxi to The Caribe Hilton's dramatic and expansive open-air entrance...I was met with the warmest of welcomes! First of all, this self-described NYC "Sex and The City" gal is not used to Taxi drivers jumping out and opening the door for her but in PR, that's how it goes and it was...LOVELY! Where do I being...Israel, the Bellman that helped me when I arrived was eager to grab my belongings and help me settle in, you can tell that the entire Bellman team enjoys their positions and that they are a happy team. Miss Maity (the Pre-Arrivals Manager) made sure that I had accomodations on the Exec Level floor and was as lovely in person as she was on the phone. That Front Desk area is quite the pressure cooker but she and the rest of the Front Desk team handle things well and really try to make the guests' experience the BEST it can be. The Executive Lounge was the BEST, BEST, BEST!!! Mr. Omar helps keep things as smooth as possible and besides being extremely "easy on the eyes" , he is a very good manager... if you go to the Execd Lounge and see a man that looks like a Latin movie star in a custom-made Armani suit - THAT'S OMAR! Omar helped make it possible for me to extend my stay another two days and treated me like a VIP. Another Exec Lounge associate worth mentioning is Miss Annia who is both super-professional and sweet as sugar and is a real asset. The lounge is just a great place to enjoy a delicioso cafe con leche and meet other nice travelers in a calm setting. The Continental breakfast is lovely and the servers are quick to keep things tidy; there's a certain code of conduct you see up there from the staff and they are all lovely people con clase. The best part for me outdoors is the hammock area; imagine swinging in between two huge Palm Trees for hours - it's this sort of experience that blew me away because despite the grand size of the hotel, there are still...quiet...places...for...simple...solitude. Chef Pagan at Lemongrass (on premise) is a big star; a likeable guy that has created the most beautiful Asian fusion restaurant overlooking the Hilton's Tropical Gardens. Try his Cardomon Ice Cream - fantastico! Sit in the open air sofa area and have a Mango Martini and some appetizers (blue fin tuna on top of plaintains served maki-style). Just wonderful. Also, the Housekeeping Staff is lovely and get ready for the BEST BED OF YOUR LIFE!!! These beds are UNREAL. I even went on [--] to buy the pillows!!! One last note, my friend and I found beautiful branches on the beach that we wanted to bring home but someone suggested that we have them lacquered - well, I asked a bellman about this and within 5 minutes, someone from Engineering came to my room to do this for me! Can you say SERVICE! I stayed here after a 4 day stay at Las Casitas at the El Conquistador and I can say without hesitation the the Caribe Hilton and its' pride-filled staff will exceed your expectations to the point that you will invariably R=E-L-A-X like never before. It's private beach, close proximity to Old San Juan and EXCELLENT Customer Service make this the best hotel experiernce I have EVER had (and I've stayed at The Breakers in Palm Beach, The Williamsburgh Inn. etc) I am going back in a few weeks and taking my best friend - it was THAT GOOD! Two more things: There is a bus near the hotel that'll take you to Old San Juan for 75 cents, it takes 8 minutes and it is 100% safe. FYI, stores in Old San Juan basically close at 6PM. Restaurants close by 8:30 or 9PM. Have a cup of coffee at La Bombanera during the day!!! HILTON BED = LA BOMBANERA COFFEE!!! ENJOY YOUR MAGICAL STAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, incovenient location”
Reviews.Author: jtmalt
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a one night pre-cruise stay through Priceline, for about $169. The grounds of the hotel are absolutely beautiful, fronting the ocean in the Punta Terra district of San Juan, and the Condado Lagoon. There are plenty of shady walkways, a tropical garden complete with koi pond and black swans, an open air reception desk, multi level swimming pools, and a private beach in an area protected by a jetty. It's a good thing the grounds were so nice, because we spend four hours strolling them, waiting for our room to be ready. We were able to check our luggage with bell services, but their security was very lax...my wife and I both went back to retrieve items from our luggage, and no one paid any attention or questioned what we were doing. I'm glad I had luggage locks. Check in lines were long, and the reception desk was polite but firm in their insistence that my room would not be ready until exactly 4pm. My room wasn't in the main building or the tower, but in the "Condado Lagoon Villas". These peculiar rooms appear to be part of a time share or condominium venture. They're very large, with doors to adjoining rooms, and many locked closets. The bathrooms are huge, with a shower and separate tub, two sinks, and a separate water closet with toilet and bidet. Our room had a shared ground floor terrace with two other rooms, with a view of the Condado Lagoon. These rooms are off the beaten path, to say the least...so much so that it has its own reception desk and pool area. This section of the hotel gives the impression of being old and musty, but it actually wasn't bad. There was, however, a party at a beach across the lagoon on Friday night, that made things a little noisy until well into the night. There are a number of restaurants on site, including a Starbucks, and all are what I would consider to be expensive. We ate at the Italian restaurant one night, and found it to be very fussy, with poor service, but good food with large portions. A meal of chicken parmigiana for two, with no alcohol, ran over $90. At times, it seemed like a parody of a fancy restaurant. The location of the Caribe Hilton is the major drawback. Neighborhood food options are limited, and it's an inconvenient walk through a tent city full of protesters (protesting the construction of a new high rise) and across a bridge to get to the Condado district. There was a substantial police presence, including mounted units, while we were there. Checkout was less arduous, as there was an interactive TV in the room. Internet was $14.95 per day, and we were hit with an unexpected "Resort Charge" of about $24 when we checked out. I wasn't displeased with my stay, but in the future I would be more inclined to book a hotel right in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeachBoy123
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 children ages 4 and 8) spent 6 nights at the Caribe Hilton. Our review is as follows: Check In: Not so great, we arrived at 2PM and didn't get a room until after 4PM. Granted the check in time is 4PM, but the wait was longer than I expected. Room: Bedroom was well maintained with a very comfortable bed, we didn't have the flat panel TV, but other rooms in the tower and executive floors did have them. The carpets are clean and well maintained as was the furniture. There was a lot of storage space which is a plus. Bathroom: Was well maintained but there was a tile missing in the shower. The sink faucet and countertop were in good condition. Grounds: The grounds of the hotel were well maintained. The pools are large and accommodated the people using it very well. On Saturday and Sunday, chairs weren't available around 2PM all other times, chairs were available. The beach was great and shallow. It was never crowded and only had some leaves floating on the water. Others: The gardens and lobby are well maintained. Restaurants: I didn't eat anywhere expect for Atlantico for lunch and the food was OK, It was expensive but the kids ate for free or half price. Good drinks but expensive. Starbucks was good. Executive Lounge: Very nice with good selection for breakfast. They have an espresso machine that made fresh cappuccino, I was in heaven. They also have cookies at night and drinks at 5 (at $3 a drink they are a bargain). Location: Great location with a private beach, close to Condado and Old San Juan. We drove to Old San Juan every night and had dinner there. Overall: The hotel was great for families and you could enjoy yourself without feeling crowded. Remember the hotel has over 800 rooms. Puerto Rico Itself: Awesome island, great people and great food in old San Juan. Try Raeces, Sofia and Il Trammerli they were great.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: ERM10
Reviews.Content: This is a very old property and no matter how much they renovate it still shows it's age. New carpet, furniture and paint cannot hide the fact that the moldings are rotted and warped, the doors are thin as cardboard and everything is just old and tired looking. The bathroom is small and the balconies are tiny. Apart from the bartenders at the swim up bar (they are great) the service was mediocre. It took me literally 30 minutes to check in and get clarification that I was supposed to be on a Club level floor. Restaurant service was ok, not bad. Food was expensive (like everywhere else) and mediocre. The Pool was dirty in spots and tired, hot tubs were not hot in the least. They do have a nice little protected beach for kids to swim but the water is like the beaches back here in New England (except warmer of course) and not the nice Carribean blue that you hope for. I wouldn't think of staying here again. I guess we got what we paid for as this was a last minute trip and the Hilton was cheaper than other places in the area that we were looking at.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbie66MonroeCT
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is classy and EXTREMELY clean. I didn't even see a single bug in my room the whole stay. We loved the reception we received upon arrival. And in our room, there was a slight problem with the toilet that they took care of immediately once I called about it. The beds were very comfortable & the room had a nice amount of dressers, desk space & closet space. The restaurants are so expensive! The breakfast buffet was $24 per person, with no lower price for kids - and dinner buffet was $30 per person. Ridiculous! We quickly learned to favor the Starbucks for our breakfasts & snacks, and the staff there was the friendliest. Some of the hotel staff were a little snobby, like a few of the valet parking people - esp. over the phone. I hadn't planned to use the valet parking (an extra $5 per day on top of the $15 per day to park) - but otherwise I would have had to schlep across the street to a parking garage with construction all around. I felt maybe a bit of resentment of the guests from some of the staff, and I thought I was a pretty great tipper.... It was a little boring at night - we were only there Monday-Friday, and apparently there is no entertainment until the weekend. Basically, you are faced with added costs every way you turn - but otherwise, it's a great, comfortable, beautiful hotel, with several different eating options, nice pools, nice beach area, & some other nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay! Great location, beach, and pool!”
Reviews.Author: aorton
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Caribe Hilton. We had a great time. The hotel has a wonderful beach, perfect for toddlers and young kids. There is little to no waves in the beach area. There are some little rocks here and there on the beach, but they didn't bother us much. The pool area is great. There are about 4 separate pools connected via small "waterfalls." There is even a kiddie pool and 2 hot tubs! We got a great deal on our room. We paid just under $200 a night. The room was very clean, but a little small. It looked like they had recently renovated the room and expanded the bathroom. The result was a closet that was difficult to get into because it was less than two feet away from the side of the bed and you could not open the door to the safe completely because of the proximity of the bed. The beds were super comfortable and the bedding was great. The bathroom was very spacious, but only had a walk in shower. We had a balcony in our room. The door was nearly impossible to open. Our "view" looked out into a new hotel that is being built next door. Some people on our floor complained about the noise, but we hardly noticed. Generally they started work a little after 7:00 am and were finished around 3:00pm. Our room was located in the Hilton Honors tower. This gave us access to the Honors lounge. There was a free breakfast every morning in the lounge that included breads, fruit, juice, coffee, etc. Throughout the day we had access to free Cokes, water, and coffee in the lounge. In the evening they had free snack hours and a pay bar. The drinks at the pay bar was at a reduced rate, only $3 for wine & beer, and $4 for hard liquor. We had drinks once in the lobby bar and they ranged from $8-$12 (about what you would expect given the location). The lounge saved us at least $30 a day! What a nice benefit. The hotel has a number of restaurants. We only at the poolside restaurant and the casual restaurant. As one would expect they were very overpriced for the quality. At least children under 5 eat free at those locations! We also had Starbucks a few times. Take note that the Starbucks does not accept room charges or the Starbucks card. We did take advantage of the proximity of the Subway one evening for dinner. The hotel is a $10, short, cab ride into Old San Juan. Some people have indicated they walked into Old San Juan, I would not advise it. I enjoy walking, but it seems like it would be a rather long walk and the walk would take you into a few questionable areas. Old San Juan has pretty much been taken over by tourist , but the buildings are still beautiful. It rained all day one day of our vacation. I was a little disappointed that there wasn't much to do around the hotel. My son enjoyed talking to the two birds in the lobby and the tropical gardens was a nice diversion. The kids club is really not very good. The kids area includes an arcade with about 10 very old arcade games and a few toddler tables. No one was ever in the kids area when we were there to try check out games. We did do the "arts and craft" project one day. They made a little bunny pin that required the kids to glue three things on to the pin. Not really what I was expecting. Also the children's playground was a little disappointing. It really is geared to 1-2 year olds. See my photos.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: patches91
Reviews.Content: I LOVED the Caribe Hilton. I have stayed there about five times and love the service, food, and location. However, I always stay in the HHtowers and it is lovely. My friend stayed in the regular hotel and the rooms were not nearly as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynforde
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here post cruise for one night. This was a very nice, clean hotel but not worth the money. It is considered a resort which is why it probably costs more. The food choices were outrageously expensive for a family of 4 to eat at. The only restaurant within walking distance was a Subway. The pool area was nice for kids and there was a nice beach that appeared to be man-made. Overall we had a good experience here but I just felt it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Sparty92
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and will not be staying again despite that I'll have to travel to San Juan quite often for work. I checked in after a long, crappy day trying to get to San Juan and was looking forward to konking out in my room. The check-in was easy, however, only one of the two keys I was given worked. Additionally, there were several other pieces of paper in my folio which were not described. Still have no clue what they were for. Got to my room & expected a bit nicer being a Hilton Honors member. The room smelled musty & gross and it was very chilly. Tried turning up the temperature to no avail. Called Guest Services who advised Engineering would be on their way. Called Guest Services again 30 minutes later to see if they were coming that evening or when. The engineer tinkered with the unit and advised it was fixed. Unfortunately, it never did warm up, but I was too tired to deal with it and went to bed. Arrived back in the room after a day long meeting to find it freezing yet again and really, really smelly - like sewage. Had received a voicemail from the Hotel hoping my stay was going well and if there were any issues, to call the Manager on Duty. I tried calling the MOD, but no answer so I called Guest Services again. They sent up another engineer and housekeeping. This guy at least tried longer to fix the unit & housekeeping sprayed the room with some stench cover-up. Neither worked. I was checking out the following morning & didn't feel like dealing with the lack of service that was evident throughout the hotel, so I just went to dinner and then came back to the hotel to sleep. Had I been staying any more time, I would have complained to the front desk & to the Management. Not sure what good it would've done, though. Considering the Caribe Hilton? I would highly recommend you stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: DandDPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one week stay at the Caribe Hilton from April 2 thru 9, 2008. This resort property is wonderful. Beautiful grounds, great food, and friendly service. We booked an executive floor room to get the breakfast and evening snacks. Our room overlooked the pool and beach. The cost of meals and drinks here are very expensive, but we expected that. The weather for our stay wasn't great. We had a few days of rain and it was very windy everyday. We understand that strong winds are common here. We only took one tour - the city tour. Our advice is to take a cab ($10) on your own and make your own tour. The "guided" tour is not worth the money as most of the time you are on your own anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But....”
Reviews.Author: richshill
Reviews.Content: The good things about the hotel are good: room was great (stay in the main building, not the additions); restaurants were very good (see exception) and the grounds and beach excellent. We enjoyed getting a piece of bread from the attendant and feeding the fish off the end of the pier! What wasn't good. The hotel is expensive with lots of nickel and dime items; what in the world did the maid do for a "Maid Charge" of 50 cents? The breakfast buffet was $17.00 without eggs, $23.00 with eggs. I didn't have eggs but was charged the $23.00 anyhow and had to complain. Plus, as is common with Puerto Rican hotels, on top of the room charge you're hit with a "resort fee". So, it's a nice hotel with good, helpful staff and lots of niggling charges that add up quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: oregonchef
Reviews.Content: We actually checked out after day one for a seven day reservation and booked at another hotel... the service was abysmal... the night manager/front desk manager was absolutely no help in getting anything fixed... the rooms were substandard at best, and the service matched... be ware..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beautiful suite, few issues”
Reviews.Author: aintlion
Reviews.Content: Nutshell: Hotel: Excellent Service, lovely grounds Room: Fabulous but hot water is a problem. Housekeeping did a super job. Spa: Awesome service, facility and amenities need upgrading Room Service: Perfect every time Mortons: Always a pleasure. Dropped a bundle on dinner and it was wonderful and we had a great time. Rotisserie Il Giardino: If I was the F&B Manager at the Caribe Hilton I would shut it down immediately it was the worst restaurant experience I have had in years. _________________________________________________ My wife and I stayed several nights in a "San Geronimo" suite on a romantic getaway. The hotel is beautiful. The staff was very friendly. We didn't want to leave the room. In fact we wanted to stay an extra night and the staff was able to accomodate us. The San Geronimo suite is in one of the newer buildings on the hotel grounds and a short hike from the lobby. Even though the hotel was near capacity we never once had to wait for an elevator or even share an elevator. In fact, we never saw another guest in our building the entire time we were there. That was strange. The room was simply fabulous. It had a living room with a kitchenette (microwave, fridge and coffee maker) and 1/2 bath. It also had a balcony, sleeper sofa (not too comfortable to sit on, though), dining room table with 4 chairs and a 40" or so LCD TV. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed, another balcony, another TV, large closet, dressing area, and a surprisingly smallish bathroom. I was a little surprised that they didn't enlarge the bathroom but it was still very nicely equipped with great amenities. Problems in the room: Hot water was hard to come by. Eventually it came, however, it was quite annoying. We spent an afternoon at the Olas Spa and got some lovely treatments. The spa staff was very accomodating and they new how to give great massage and body wraps and I highly recommend them. The spa facility and amenities left a bit to be desired and felt old. They wanted us to shower twice but they only gave us one towel. All in all still very good experience. We had an amazing dinner at Mortons Steakhouse on property. We love Mortons. We drank too much, we ate too much and we laughed a lot. The wait staff was fun and we even made friends with some other guests there. It was a very inviting, warm atmosphere. Then the next night we had dinner at the italian restaurant on property, Rotiisserie Il Giardino, and it was exactly the opposite. We went in for dinner and the place was almost empty (a few tables seated). We were whisked to our table by the maitre d. The server brought us the menu and offered me the wine list (I was still nursing a hangover) which I declined and he all of a sudden got cold (since we weren't going to buy a $100 bottle of wine this night). We had some questions about the menu and he was very rude in answering. We placed our order which included 1 appetizer to share, 2 salads, 2 entrees, and 2 cokes. Throughout the entire dinner, this waiter never approached us again (until later). Another guy, a young hard worker, brought out the appetizer with my wife's salad. I very nicely requested that he bring my salad because I expected the appetizer first before the salad. Of course, the waiter didn't put in a salad order for me. So I asked for a salad so that my wife and I could have salad together. The appetizer was just a simple bruschetta. The topping on the bread seemed like it had been blended rather than chopped and it tasted funny. And I don't think the bread had been toasted. The salad dressings tasted watered down. Then our main courses (delivered by yet another guy not our waiter). I had veal marsala which was okay. The potatoes and the vegetables were absolutely delicious. The entree was just okay. Passable. I could get just as good a dinner at the corner pizza shop and pay 2/3 less. My wife got some chicken thing that was wayyyyy too salty. But she, too, loved the potatoes. We never did get our Cokes. Right after they brought our entrees we stopped a busboy (or waiter, there's no telling) and asked for our 2 Cokes. Seemed like it got turned into a much bigger deal than it should have been and even then it took like another 10 minutes for us to get something to drink. A refill would have been completely out of the question. Right after we left (it took 15 freakin minutes to get our check after we declined their coffee and nasty dessert) we walked over to Starbucks for coffee and dessert and a good laugh. Anyways, stay away from this restaurant. Eat dinner every night at Mortons. Oh yeah. Back to the hotel. All in all we had a wonderful time. The weather wasn't great all week so we didn't do much at the pool or beach. It was windy every second of every day and rained a bunch. But we ventured out quite a bit and we enjoyed being tourists in Old San Juan and elsewhere on the island. Aside from a couple of minor inconveniences and one lousy restaurant experience we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe”
Reviews.Author: sazcleveland
Reviews.Content: We really loved the hotel. It was perfect for a family with young kids. We were there for a week and found the staff to be more than helpful and curteous, especially Gabriel at the Concierge desk. We stayed in the Garden Wing in a 1 bedroom suite which was Huge with spectacular views of the ocean and garden. The beach was terrific and the pools were beautiful. The only downside was that the staff for the kids program was hit or miss. My kids would have loved to have the activities a llittle more organized, but it didn't effect our stay. We took a day trip to the rainforest which was great. (on our own, not thru the hotel). We did not find the hotel to be very expensive, after all, it is a resort in the Carribean. The kids ate for half price at the pool bar and the restaurants in the hotel were g reat. We had free continental breakfast on the 9th floor of the main building which was great. All in all, it was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PuertoRicoBound
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in February 2008 and highly recommend this resort for families with kids (under 10). We are Hilton Honors and had the Executive package, with a room in the Main Building, 8th floor, overlooking the fort and Condado. We could see the often-complained about (on trip advisor reviews) construction from our balcony, but we were far enough away from it that there was no noise and it did not ruin our balcony views of the ocean and the fort. We arrived 3 hours before the posted check-in time and our room was ready and waiting for us! Front desk staff was very courteous and helpful throughout our stay. One night, at about 3 a.m., our youngest came down with a horrible stomach virus and we had to call for replacement towels and bedding. Housekeeping arrived very fast (remember, it was around 3 a.m.!), with a great attitude, all the replacement supplies we needed, and they were prepared to actually clean the mess for us (but we had already cleaned up before we called). Truly wonderful service. Daily housekeeping/maid service was also prompt and efficient. Very comfortable beds! A large bathroom with tub and shower. There was one tile missing from the bathroom wall (outside the shower), and on the nightstand between the two beds there was a patch on the wall that was waiting to be repainted (both gave the room a little bit of a dingy feel, it being a Hilton I expected better visuals, although this really was just minor cosmetic). There was absolutely no moldy or musty smell in our room or in the hallway as other reviewers experienced with their rooms. Using the room card in the elevators to get to your floor required a small learning curve. Once you figure out which way to face the card strip when swiping your card and learn to be fast doing it, you'll be fine. We didn't have any trouble with it after a few tries. This is a wonderful place for kids (not teenagers -- probably too boring for teens -- but for younger kids). The beach is calm. The beach hut staff were fast and friendly. We didn't use the pools, preferring the beach instead. There are loads of activities and entertainment for the kids (many other reviewers have already listed all this, so I'll skip the details). Our kids loved the parrots in the lobby and the gameroom where games were surprisingly cheap -- and that was about the only surprisingly inexpensive thing about this hotel though! We ate off-site because the hotel restaurant food prices were too expensive. A pina colada (about $10) in the lobby bar proved quite disappointing and weak. Skip it. Upon check-in you are informed that there is a "voluntary" $1/night charge added to your bill used for supporting programs for local children. This is automatically billed unless you ask for it to be removed. Other than that, there were no surprises or unexpected charges on the bill. Check-out was quick and painless. What made this a great place to stay was the wonderful staff, the fantastic assortment of kid-friendly amenities and activities, it's close to Old San Juan, and it's an easy enough rental car ride to El Yunque. What could be better: Have a casino on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “not awful”
Reviews.Author: ccfRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the tower and was nice -- lovely bathroom and ocean-view balcony. Sadly, the week we were there there was an off-shore storm that created surf that Puerto Rico hadn't seen in two decades and all the beaches were closed. Then, a 25-foot wave washed over the sea wall and filled one of our pools with sand and debris. None of this was the Hilton's fault and they worked hard to get things back to normal. But it was Easter week and there were a zillion kids there. With the beach and one of the pools closed, it felt like a city pool at the remaining pool. The hot tubs were never hot, and I felt at least one of them should be reserved for adults. Kids belly flop in all of them all day. (Their parents seem oblivious.) As an adult with no young kids, I probably wouldn't go back. My adult daughter and I went to the casino at the Ritz Carlton one night and drooled with envy at the setting. I did, however, find the staff at the Hilton to be attentive and friendly, and the buffet breakfast included in our room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel and the safe beach!!”
Reviews.Author: florida078
Reviews.Content: We really loved it here, and like the other reviewers, wish we could have stayed longer! I didn't get a chance to visit the spa or make use of their free kayak/pedal boat hours, the salsa lessons, etc. Next time hopefully! There were a lot of activities, the pools were great, sipping on the pina coloda drinks (everyday free pina coladas around 1pm for a hr at the swimup bar) in the hot tub looking out at turquoise waters and a warm breeze in the many palm trees was amazing! There is a free breakfast room on the 2nd floor in the towers(just use your regular room key), and use of their excellent espresso machine all day, as well as pops, waters, cookies etc and a happy hour from 5-8. The best part was the beach, absolutely gorgeous with the fortified city walls and san geronimo fort framing each side of it, so effectively creating a small cove. This means that the water is shallow and is safe for families to swim. As is the case in many coastal destination spots, the undertow can be dangerous and drownings can occur. THe beach here is perfect : secluded, private and safe. There was never a problem to find lounge chairs and they freely set up umbrellas wherever you wanted. FOr kids, there is a slide in the ocean at 4ft, small play structure right on the beach and another park near the tropical fish pond, a pond with swans, daily feeding of the fish at the pier, hammocks, sandcastle building competitions, infant pool, a giant chess board outside, tennis court, basketball net, an indoor games room, craft/dance activities, a beach hut that lends out pails, shovels and water wings, etc. We will definitely be returning here!! The staff were very friendly and appreciated when you tried to speak Spanish. ps. the balcony in the room is quite nice to sit out and watch the waves.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: lovesmgd
Reviews.Content: Our stay was ok, nothing really great. We arrived about an hour earlier than check-in which is supposed to be at 4pm, however our room still did'nt become available until nearly 6pm. Several days prior to our arrival I called the hotel to confirm that everything was paid for, asked at least three times, they said yes. Well, upon check-in I was told that there would be a fee of $75/day would be held on my credit card in case we wanted to charge things to our room. Then there was a $5/day per person charge for some sort of fees. Granted the $75/day is returned to your card if not used, but it ate into the spending money we had allotted to travel to Vieques....so, we couldnt go. The restaurants at the hotel are ridiculously expensive. When asking the concierge to recommend a reasonable restaurant in town, he sent us somewhere that was still just as expensive, and the food sucked too. We finally met an awesome cab driver that we used during our trip. We asked him to suggest a restautant that he would take his family to and we ate the best food in San Juan. The grounds were beautiful. The beach was ok, but my son missed having waves. It's a good place for younger children, lots of planned activities, however we have a teenager, so there isnt anything for them. Our room did smell a bit musty, but was kept very clean. The bed was very comfortable. We had an ocean view room. The view of the ocean and San Geronimo was beautiful, however the constuction going on next door wasnt that scenic. The hotel is situated in a very convenient area. Overall our stay wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “It's just OK”
Reviews.Author: LisaK73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were away for our first vacation away since our children. I did read this website and was very confused by the reviews. One of the main reasons I choose this hotel was because it was listed as 4 stars and did not have a casino (my husband likes to gamble and I don't). I will say the service checking in was fine but when I realized the first evening that they did not mention the free breakfast that was supposed to be included we went back to the front desk. They did take a few minutes but then gave us new keys that let us into the executive floor dining area. I thought we scored big but I will say it is a basic continental breakfast and from 5 - 8 pm a cocktail hour that had awful appts. and one night only had one wine choose which had to be the worst wine of ever drank. I would say that the service and people were slow and rude but it seemed to be a common theme in PR. I thought the place was fine but more of a two or three star than a four star.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton was okay, PR is great!”
Reviews.Author: theAtlantan
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Caribe is a nice place overall.( *I'm use to staying at really nice hotels like the J.W Marriott and Ritz, so that's my point of view). I stayed in the Villas with 3 of my friends ( 3rd floor w/ ocean view). The bedroom is an okay size- 2 queen beds, nice bathroom and nice balcony view of the condado. The kitchenette is cute, it includes a small fridge, sink, microwave, cabinets, and counter space. Bedroom Cons: not much floor space for luggage, no WIFI (which was a HUUUUGE disappointment). I couldn't believe that in 2008 Hilton didn't have WIFI in the bedrooms. But we were able to pick up the WIFI from the Condado Plaza Hotel (Mariott- i think) across the water. So make sure you know how to use your phone as a modem or bring some type of wireless card if you go. (they only have free WIFI in the lobby). Room service is really expensive Bedroom Pros: Nice clean linen, nice size bathroom, nice balcony, good service. You can also buy food and store it in the cabinets and fridge. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Hilton was not as glamorous as I thought it would be, but it is nice. The lobby was clean and it's kind of cool how it's connected to the outside- meaning that when you arrive to the hotel you get out of your car and automatically step into the lobby. The pool and beach area is great, simply nice. Its not grandeur, but its very extensive- the property includes alot: gardens, pools, jacuzzis, beaches, playground area, bars, decks, ponds, exotic fish and animals and more- I was not able to fully explore this area, but my friends were able to and they LOVED it. It's a great place for couples at night. The villas has its own separate lobby which is really small, but its somewhat convenient when you need help and information. But I did NOT like all the construction being built - because of the construction going on outside the lobby of the Villas, the outside of the villa area was ugly (very gray and gloomy). Overall Hilton Pros: perfect location- the Hilton seems to be in the middle of everything (Old San Juan (5 minutes away), the Condado (5 minutes away), Isla Verde(12 minutes away), Airport (15 minutes away) plus its a low traffic area so we barely got caught in traffic (which is everywhere in PR), the Hilton pool and beach area offers the widest variety of things to do, and nice people. Overall Hilton Cons: all the Construction, no WIFI, not very glamorous, lack of floor space in rooms w/ 2 beds Most people say the Hilton is overpriced, but I personally think you are paying for the location over anything else b/c the hotel itself is not very ritzy- it's sort of aesthetically disappointing, but you have to keep in mind that this is Hilton's first hotel in the Caribbean (they actually consider it historic) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I also visited The Ritz, El San Juan Hotel, and the Intercontinental. The Ritz's beach was very disappointing and dirty.The intercontinental lobby, beach, and pool area was really pretty (i visited at night), but they all seemed kind of small (and their Casino is really small, but busy). El San Juan Hotel is the hot spot- the lobby is BEAUTIFUL and very grand i felt like i was in a fashion magazine- EVERY person there was BEAUTIFUL. It is veeeerry busy, so if you want to watch alot of beautiful people-go there. If you ever visit that hotel (especially at night) be sure to have your best and most fashionable clothes on w/ makeup & hair done etc. (women should wear dresses that compliment their body types with heels and men should just look clean and smell good). If you want to live the "high life" you should stay at a hotel like El San Juan, but if you want to relax you should stay at a hotel like the Hilton. El San Juan Hotel is sort of a place for single people (their are too many temptations there especially for men) and other hotels are better for couples and families. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OVERALL Puerto Rico Advice: First off, I lost my camera in a taxi on the first night which made me really sad (b/c i lost over 200 pics) and put a little damper on my trip. So I greatly advise everyone to find one taxi driver and stick with them throughout your stay (be sure to ALWAYS get their name, number, and taxi number or license plate). But moreover to Truly experience Puerto Rico you should rent a car. After my experience I advise you to use taxi's for a day, then drive after that- you can get more done and you feel more free! Places to visit: 1. Old San Juan is a must at night (eat at a great restaurant and walk around and visit a club or three) 2. The rain forest (this was probably the best day we had in Puerto Rico- it was BEAUTIFUL!)- bring water and/or drinks, oh and good shoes 3. Culebra, Vieques, or Gilligans Island - you MUST visit one of the three (but visiting one of those will be an all day trip because you will need to arrive early and take ferries to them (so be sure to bring snacks, drinks, snorkel equipment, and an umbrella). 4. Forts in Old San Juan (Fort San Cristobal is better than el Morro) 5. For young people: -Isla Verde at night is a must, definitely go to the clubs, bars, and El San Juan Hotel -Senor Frogs (old san juan), Brava (el san juan hotel), and just ask around. . . (Vibes seemed nice, but we didnt get to go) 6. The Condado at night is really pretty too, when we went there were singers and performers on the big lawn/park area. 7. Ponce is a nice area with many historic places, gardens, etc. . .(old french town so it looks different from old San Juan). You should plan before you get there b/c its very easy to go astray and not get as much done as you want. Remember that EVERYTHING closes early (around 6pm) so tourist activities MUST be planned early and they must be done during the day. At night Old San Juan, the Condado, and Isla Verde are the best. . .If you drive be very cautious b/c people drive very loose down there. Though Puerto Rico is an American territory - 75% of the people their speak Spanish ONLY -if not more. So you should have a basic knowledge of spanish and download some type of translation program on your phone (i just used babelfish.altavista.com- which is an online translator). Walgreens are everywhere (and that will be your grocery and everything else store during the trip (we went almost everyday:-). --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Overall I LOVED Puerto Rico and I was not ready to go back after 5 days, I felt like I needed atleast 1 or 2 more days. I loved how racism and colorism just seemed to go out the window and everyone loved/liked each other for who they were and respected everyone's individual beauty. So don't be a typical stiff American when you go- relax, have fun, talk to random people no matter their background, race, or ethnicity. Most phone companies don't charge for using your phone in Puerto Rico, but call and make sure. Okay, I think my review is long enough. . . Vive (las) Puerto Rico! lol. . . . Adios! *make sure your camera has a strap on it and put your name and number on it- I would hate for anyone else to lose their camera. * you'll easily notice that most Puerto Ricans seem to be in relationships b/c everywhere you go there will be couples *as an attractive dark-skin woman of color i felt sooo Beautiful in Puerto Rico, everywhere i went i was told how gorgeous i was, not only by Puerto Rican men (and even some women) but by many white Americans (people seem to lose their prejudices in Puerto Rico)- this made my trip even better- i felt like a Goddess there:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the right price”
Reviews.Author: logcolb
Reviews.Content: This can be a great place to stay depending on what you pay. We booked this on Priceline (bidding) for $115 per night. For that price it was a steal. We booked it for before and after a cruise. It is actually a very nice hotel in a great location and has an excellent pool and beach. The hotel has a large open air lobby which is nice but not as classy as the Wyndham El San Juan but nice enough. The hotel has been built in phases over the years. We were in the original building which I prefer since all of the rooms have great water views. Some of the later buildings have sections that look out on other buildings and parking garage, etc. The rooms are a decent size with nice bathrooms and very nice beds and bedding. The furniture is a little dated. The hotel has an excellent location on a peninsula into the water on the outskirts of Old San Juan. You are only about a 10 minute ride from the cruise ships and Old San Juan. If you are looking for a lot of nightlife and shopping outside your door this is not the place for you. The nicest part of the hotel is the beach and pool area. The beach is on its own cove, not much in the way of waves, but otherwise very nice. It has a great pool area and a nice area with hammocks and palm trees for shade. We are members of the Hilton Honors and were put on the club floor. The club floors have the use of a very nice lounge with free snacks drinks, newspapers and computer. For $115 per night this was a great deal. We were originally booked at the Marriott for the stay on the return from the cruise, but at $350 a night for the Marriott and $155 for the Hilton it was a no brainer. If you are going to pay $350 a night I would consider the El San Juan or the Marriott, but with the discount rates on the Hilton it is well worth it. My only complaint was that it does not have a casino, so you need to get a cab to go to a casino or to go to other restaurants. We ate at the Morton's on a great web promotion, 2 excellent meals for $99, but the other hotel restaurants looked very overpriced. They do have a Starbucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good for young children...BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: beachlova2
Reviews.Content: PROS: *This hotel is great for children...there are many daily activities including a play ground, basketball, tennis, feeding fish at the peir, arts and crafts, gameroom, large pool and kiddie pool with floats and noodles offered, small man-made beach with no waves, slide in beach water, paddle boats/kayaks. *There are many shops with unique clothing, art, jewlrey, gifts, etc...There is a Starbucks located in the lobby. *Good Pina Coladas...they were actually originated there. *Located 5 minutes from Old San Juan. Taxis are always available and costs about $10 per trip. *Grounds are beautiful...large pool, pond with swans and ducks, nice ocean views and city views, small old fort located on property. *Executive levels in the main building and the towers offered a continental breakfast (which included cereal, fruit, pastries, oj, coffee).
