CONS: *The rooms stink...literally. We walked in and we were welcomed with a strong scent of mildew...Yuck!!! Oh, the things we can't see...scarey. *The Service is the pitts!!! When checking in the front desk told us that we were receiving a renovated room with a beautiful ocean view. Upon arriving our room, we saw that what we received was a worn stinky room facing a concrete building being constructed. When we called about it...Oops! Sorry, all the sudden there are no other ocean view rooms available. Also, when checking out, there were charges on our room that did not belong to us. The staff was kind and never rude...but they did not go out of their way to help. *Service is very SLOW! Our room was not cleaned until 5 PM! When calling downstairs, you are either put on hold indefinitely or there is never an answer at all. Also, valet took a long time retrieving car...sometimes we felt like it would have been easier/faster to just get it ourselves. One morning during breakfast, they ran out of milk at 8:30 AM and said they could not get anymore for a while. More milk appeared about 45 minutes later. (In defense to this...the hotel is very large with many people to please, so I assume that it takes longer to respond and serve.) *Parking costs $20 per day! *There is always activity and noise going on...not a quiet place if that is what you are hoping for. Many small children running, screaming, crying...it is a positive to us to watch all the children at play, but the noise can be a bit much. *Hotel food and drinks are expensive!! All in all, our kids seemed to enjoy all the activites the hotel offered...but due to the lack of service and the rooms we would most likely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Hilton Caribe”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustinwithsun
Reviews.Content: I was pretty underwhelmed with this hotel. The pictures looked gorgeous and I was expecting a certain standard from a Hilton Hotel. Unfortunately I did not get it. We arrived at to be greeted a very snotty and downright unfriendly receptionist who rambled off the instructions to our room while rolling her eyes. The room was big and much to our surprise had a cute little kitchenette. It also had construction directly across from our balcony. Although I didn't expect to spend much time in the actual room (this is a tropical paradise after all) the never-ending jackhammer noise started to get annoying. The pool was nice with plenty of pool chairs. The drinks were stiff but expensive. The food selection in the 8 restaurants on the premises was bland, boring, and over-priced. I guess the crux of my disdain for the hotel when we called THREE times for a blanket within over the course of an hour. I won't be staying at the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Presidents week @ Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LAM4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe for our school break this year. We traveled with 3 families with kids 10-16. 10 of us all together. We have traveled every Feb break for the last 10 years. That being said my review of the Caribe Hilton is great. The biggest problem we encountered was the wind and that had nothing to do with the hotel. Our check in was quick and painless, the only glitch was that we were all not on the same floor. We did not get crazy but asked if they could move the one family and it was done the next morning. Our reservations were for the executive level. It was worth the extra money for breakfast in the morning it had something for everyone, snacks and sodas(including water) during the day and cocktail hour at night(although they now offer a cash bar where in the past it was free). We even made it a point to be back to the hotel so we could get a cookie before bed! T hey just installed a new system to get to the executive room floors(8-10) you need to slide your room key in order to push your floor button and it did not always happen on the first try and we took a "few" rides up and down till we heard the "BEEP" and knew we were going to our floor. Our rooms were fine and I thought the bed was comfy. Like I said we have been going away for the last ten years and we have slept in some really bad beds. The pool area was clean and although this was a peak break time and the hotel seemed to be busy we never seemed to have a problem getting a bunch of chairs together. It is not like we had to get out there at 6AM. We had breakfast and got out there around 9:30 The water was a bit cool for me but the kids all got in and played around. The beach area was fine. If you are looking for waves dont look here. The beach is great for little ones. Again we never had a problem getting chairs there either. Maybe we would have to walk down the beach. But we could always get a seat. They have a list of activities down by the beach they seem to have lots of things planed for the little ones. I did see a yoga class one day and a bunch of people playing bingo another. They have a volleyball net but it is in the grass( a big disappointment for our group) but like I said it was also very windy so it would not have been fun to play anyway. We never had a problem getting a towel. Sometimes they took your room number and sometimes they did not. I am not sure how they decided what system they were using. They had basketballs that you could sign out. This trip has been planned since last june. In Jan I saw on the TA forum about a food a beverage credit through go to PR.com I called my travel agent. Our trip fit all of the criteria including the hotel. So we were given a 250.00 F&B credit to each of our rooms. That took the sting out of eating at the pool bar for lunch. We just sent the kids each day over to order lunch. We ate 3 lunches and one dinner(at the restaurant near the pool) plus a few cocktails and we each only went over the 250 by 40 dollars. Not bad. One day the dads went to subway and brought it back for us. It also helped that we brought down waters with us from the executive lounge. We took the bus(.50cents) each way exact change per person to old San juan on two evenings and had dinner and a walk about. We did take cabs back. They were ten dollars each cab. I have to mention that the buses do not run like in Cancun you will have to wait up to 20 min. It was deffinaly worth it because we could move all 10 of us for 5.00 compared to the 20 or 30 dollars for the cabs each way We walked into Condado for dinner but we took a cab back. We rented a van from "target"(not related to the stores) and took a tour of El Yunke and then spent the day at Luguillo beach. The beach was beautiful and you can rent chairs and umbrella right there(5.00 and 10.00 respectively). We booked a snorkle adventure through the tour desk for one day. I would deffintaly reccomend this hotel to a friend and we look foward to visiting Puerto Rico again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes! Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: mysister'ssister
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 3 hotels during my 10 day stay in San Juan, 6 nights at the Caribe. Staff were very nice, no problem there. Pool was OK but too cold for my comfort. There were only a handful of people ever in the pool. Small beach area that I didn't swim in. Lots of lounge chairs available. Our room had a small balcony that overlooked the pool and ocean, which was nice. The room was clean, but tired. A couple mornings I couldn't get hot water for a shower, just luke warm. The walls are very thin; I could constantly hear the neighbor's TV and even their conversations. The hallways smelled musty and moldy and only one elevator was working which was a real pain. I took the stairs a couple of times and they were pretty dirty and I ended up outside where there was no re-entry. I am not a Morton's type of person but we ate there once. No one should charge that kind of money for just OK food.; any food for that matter.The Italian restaurant was OK, but pricey as well. My husband said the Tapa's restaurant was pretty bad. Drink prices at the bar were outrageous. The proximity to Old San Juan is walkable, but a long hot walk with nice sidewalks to walk on. I don't mind the walk, but I really like walking. Others may opt to take the bus for 50 cents, which we did; make sure you have exact change. Never took a cab. I was at the hotel on my husband's company's dime so it may not be fair to complain, just trying to be real. I think all the area hotels are pricey, so the Caribe is probably in line, but it seemed way over the top to me. The location is a great asset so if you want an OK place with a nice pool and easy access to Old San Juan, I'd recommend it. But bring a big fat wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Need2fly
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Caribe Hilton for one night prior to a cruise in February. While our visit was short, we found the hotel staff to be friendly with good service. The room was clean with a balcony overlooking the pool and water. We used the concierge to assist with booking last minute dinner reservations and found him to be quite helpful as well. The pool area was clean and the hotel grounds well maintained. Only a short bus ride into Old San Juan (75 cents per person as opposed to high cab fares). I wound not hesitiate to stay here again for any trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCT
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent resort. Plenty to do for everyone; great drinks in the lobby bar; interesting choice of restaurants (nothing inexpensive, though!), and a well-organized, well-managed property. Towers room we stayed in appeared to have been recently renovated. Comfortable beds, nice bathroom, appealing decor. Too bad that whole stretch of resorts in San Juan isn't on a nice, sandy beach--but lots of options for having fun.

Reviews.Title: “What has happened?”
Reviews.Author: JandPMaryland
Reviews.Content: It's amazing that we were at the hotel the same time as a couple other reviewers. We have stayed at this hotel 4 times previously and are Hilton Honors members. Every person we met had the same bad experience we did-- I can't believe the positive reviews for the same period are true. We did get great service from the front desk and from the Hilton Honors Club staff and concierge. The rest of the staff -- and we addressed this personally with the hotel manager -- displayed an almost unbelievable lack of ambition and friendliness. We waited an hour in the bar for a drink. When the waitress came we told her there were others in the bar who also had not been served, including a handicapped patron. She said she was the only server working in the bar. In the main restaurant, we had absolutely the laziest waiter I've ever met. Our meal took two hours and there were guests at only two other tables. Everything about him was slow -- he lumbered by after an hour to take our order and then came back an hour later with the bill. We discussed this with the restaurant manager. We were at the hotel 4 days and went to the pool each day. Not once were we approached by someone asking if we'd like a drink or something to eat. Don't these people exist on tips? We reported everyday, starting the first day, that our ac did not work. The rude manager we met the last day said we shouldn't have waited until the last day to report it. Doesn't he had a record of the work requests? He was absolutely horrid -- rude and lazy. I was shocked. We had never experienced this before. A staff member did tell us management had changed. This hotel has been a favorite of ours in the past and we looked very forward to our time there. But, we stayed one night at the newly re-opened La Concha and have to say that when we return to San Juan, that will be our first choice. It's part of Marriott and we belong to that points program as well. We were so turned off by the Hilton, we will probably start staying at mostly Marriott properties. What has happened in San Juan? Don't the folks there realize US economists are projecting bad times ahead and those tourist dollars will shrink? Locals might be wishing not so long from now that they hadn't been so lazy in the past.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: teachela
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Caribe is located along a beautiful Atlantic beach in Puerto Rico. While everything there is very nice...the hotel itself is a little older than we expected. Everyone we encountered there, the waitstaff at the restaurants, the bartenders, the tourist representatives, the desk clerks, and the valet workers, was extremely courteous, friendly and helpful. The food at each restaurant was delicious and fresh...a pleasant experience overall. If we so desired, we could have remained at the hotel the entire trip and had everything we needed or wanted. But, we ventured out to the city and the rainforest...great daytrips for the adventurous.

Reviews.Title: “Great and very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: 1BennBenn
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Caribe Hilton (Feb 17 to 21, 2008). It was fantastic. The room was large, clean, and comfortable with a great view over the ocean and the nearby Hotel Normandie. The fancy drinks were good. If you don't want to spend a lot on food, there is a Puerto Rican sandwich-breakfast store across the street, and a subway next to that. The bus to Old San Juan is 75 cents (change only, no dollars) and takes about 10 minutes. The walk to Condado is about 20 minutes. The package we got from Hilton was about $2000 for round trip airfare from DC and 4 nights at the hotel. If we had waited until the last minute we could have gotten it for about $1500 or $1600. The Hotel offered a trip to the rain forest for $53 per person that took six hours and was lots of fun. A very entertaining tour guide named "Yogi" took us. Stopped at at little Puerto Rican "greasy food" place (as Yogi called it) that was good, and cheap. If you are a Hilton Honors member (or maybe even if you aren't) you can have a complimentary continental breakfast on the 2d floor of the Hilton Honors Tower that is good.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonynelson
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best hotel in San Juan in terms of overall vacation experience. The hotel has a nice private beach with a protected swimming cove, great workout area, nice pools, several good restaurants, attractive common areas and incredible views. The hotel is located 5 minutes from old San Juan, 5 minutes from Candado and 10-15 from Isla Verde and the airport, so it's easy to get anywhere. Most cab rides were $10-12 with Isla Verde and the airport coming in at $19-20. I read some reviews complaining about the food prices and room quality. While there were definitely some cosmetic problems with the room, I don't understand the negativity. Overall it was a nice room with a flat panel, huge shower and plenty of storage. And who cares about the room really? I'm sure the Ritz has much nicer rooms, but their beach is public and is nowhere near as nice as the Hilton's. As for the food prices, yes they are pretty steep. But my wife and I went to dinner at a lot of different hotels and I can tell you that $9 for a pina colada isn't so steep when compared to $14 for the same drink down the road. My advice: Make sure that you budget more for food/drinks than you expect. My other advise is to bring plenty of sunscreen. If you run out and have to buy it at the sundries shop, those pina coladas will start looking really cheap. We'll be going back to this hotel--probably next time with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lizondro7
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site on the Caribe Hilton I was not very excited to go visit the Hotel. I am pleased to say that my experience was nothing less than wonderful. As soon as you walk into the lobby (which is open air) you are welcomed into a tropical paradise. We arrived at the hotel at 1pm and our room was not ready. However, the staff kept our luggage and we were allowed to used the hotel ammenities. The room was ready at around 2pm. The hotel is divided into two sections - the main building (which is the older) and the tower. We stayed in the main building room #639, which had a beautiful view of the ocean and the Condado Lagoon. Every room has a balcony with a small table and two chairs. The room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. The bed, pillows and sheets were very comfortable. The pool area is large, beautiful and very clean. It has a swim up bar and waterfalls. There is also a small private beach, a tropical garden with a pond filled with colorful fish and many benches, and a walkway along the beach for long walks. The hammock area was very relaxing. The Carbe Hilton is between Old San Juan and the Condado area - so you will need a taxi if you plan on going to Old San Juan or the Casinos. The restaurants are a bit expensive but what do you expect - its a hotel! I recommend going to the local small restaurants - La Hacienda in the Condado area - just a few minutes away. Both local and Mexican food - great ocean views - we went there and had a table next to the ocean - beautiful - the food was good and inexpensive (compared to the Hilton). I also recommend the Bombonera in Old San Juan - diner type setting - but you get to experience real local food at inexpensive prices. Many tourists come here to taste the Mallorca bread (puertorican danish), the coffee and the freshly squeezed orange juice. If you go to the Morro - one of the Trolleys stops at the Bombonera - and its free! Overall - it was a wonderful stay - I would definately stay here again and recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place, but $$$$”
Reviews.Author: MLSMan
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel, but it's pretty expensive. The Hotel bar is awesome -- get a mojito or pina colada Parking is extra $15 or $20. The beds aren't all that comfortable. But it's a good place

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced but Efficient”
Reviews.Author: Guidor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week's stay at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan PR , paying a convention rate which still was quite expensive. Every additional item was charged and the restaurants' meals & drinks were extortionate - so thanks to previous travellers who suggested the convenient Subway on the corner nearby. It is often worthwhile getting a cab into Old San Juan ($10 to $11 each way) to sample the numerous restaurants there and the vibrant street scene (a festival on the Sunday celebrating San Sebastian and noisy Birthday celebrations). The room was comfortable and the front desk did move us at our request due to the dull view across a cigarette butt strewn roof we had from the third floor room initially allocated. One bright spot was the pride in his job shown by Augustus who took care of the pool area near the tropical gardens. It was kept absolutely pristine and it was clear how much he cared for the area and the hotel guests who used it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice; book a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: MomTravels
Reviews.Content: I returned from a 4 day trip to the Hilton Caribe for professional conference. Our rooms were in the tower building, which was being billed as the HHonors Tower (I am a Hilton Honors member). I had a very lovely, two double bed, oceanview room with a small balcony. I heard from other conference members that the original part of the hotel had not yet been renovated. +Pros Spacious room Comfortable beds Large Bath with two sinks, rainshower showerhead Bathrobe included Great view -Cons Couldn't get into my room until after 6 pm on day of arrival Nice beach, but not enough area for long walks (though park nearby) There are several restaurants onsite, including Mortons Steakhouse, a tapas restaurant in the tower building, a buffet restaurant, with indoor and outdoor seating, sports bar, a swim up bar, Starbucks and beachside restaurant (and perhaps more). Wifi available in several public areas; wired service from rooms. Old San Juan is a short, $10 cab ride away. Taxi to airport is just over $20. Nice fitness center overlooking beach/water which was connected to the spa, snack bar and tennis courts. We were quite busy with the conference, but the pools, beach area and kids sandy play area looked nice. Tours, including those to the rainforest, could be arranged from the hotel. Several gift shops on site; you cannot charge to your room from most of these shops. Some construction onsite, which may be on hold right now. I heard just a bit of noise. I had not been to San Juan prior to this trip, but I would recommend this hotel to others as a home base in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull!!!”
Reviews.Author: rosette_8
Reviews.Content: I had to write a review as we were almost scared off of this hotel by what others had written. We loved it! We had a great room with amazing views (1565). It must have been newly remodeled and it was extremely nice. Very clean, comfortable and the shower.....amazing! The beds were incredibly comfortable. Everyone working at the hotel was wonderful and polite. The pool and ocean (beach) setting were wonderful and allowed you to sit at the pool and then swim in the ocean which was just as close as the pool. The pool was very clean which I am not sure how with the ocean and sand so close. Also, when we were there, there weren't many children since it wasn't anyones break, but the kids there were VERY well behaved and enjoyable to be around. No screaming Mom and Dads at tired little ones. We were there with a conference and every one of us (6 couples)had a great experiences. Even those with older rooms had no problem. Only issue would be that you couldn't charge the things in the stores to your room. That would have been nice instead of going back to your room to get money. We want to go back with the kids sometime!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aggupta
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is pretty average and like any other hotel. It is very touristy. There are a ton of Americans that stay there along with a Starbucks and a Morton's Steakhouse so don't expect to get a local experience by staying here. The pool is full of children so I would not recommend this place for a romantic get away. The gym is very small although the staff there were very helpful and able to recommend scenic routes to jog along the beach. On a positive note, the walk to Old San Juan takes about 25 minutes (about 2 miles). There is a beautiful park on the way and it is great to wander into town if you walk along the beach. On the whole, the Hilton is a clean place to stay, but don't expect to "experience" Puerto Rico at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: grapdad
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond HHonors member, so stay at Hilton whenever I can. Caribe Hilton is one of the first Hilton's in the chain, built in 1947, and continually upgraded. It probably needs it again. Our room, on the Ocean, was, as was mentioned by others, not available until 4PM, which is the guaranteed check-in time. From 2PM until 4PM, I was told our room would be avaiable in "20 Minutes". This occured 4 times. We were finally given an alternate room, which did not have as good a view as originally ordered, but was OK. Room was clean, and the new Hilton comfort bed sheets were very nice. Bed was very comfortable. Service was very nice, and the beach was awesome! The poolside food was vertually inedible, soggiy cold sandwiches, and watered drinks. Having said that, I would go back. but please see my review of the Condado Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Weather Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: IrishmomTX
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Caribe Hilton 12/27/07 to 1/2/08. Waited as expected until 4 PM to receive our rooms, however hotel did make it easy to store luggage so that grounds and pools (changing rooms available) could be explored. Received connecting rooms which was nice we were travelling with our two children in their early twenties. View was only fair could see water, pools etc by but hotel lower roof interferred with the view. Rooms were fine, beds were very comfortable. Hotel restaurants are extremely pricey. Service at Olas Health restaurant was outrageously slow. Quick lunch or breakfast alternative was the Starbucks (sandwiches & salads) or the Subway at the end of the drive. Small cafeteria at the end of the drive was closed for the holidays. Was extremely impressed with what the hotel had to offer for families with young children however might recommend Isla Verde area for families with teens or twenties. Cab ride to old San Juan was reasonable. El Morro and Bacardi tour, and Paseo de Princessa were worth the time. I was disappointed in rainforest tour as no birds or critters of any type were visible. Parrot Club in Old San Juan was excellent, also La Bombonera for breakfast. Had an enjoyable New Year's Eve at Senor Frogs.

Reviews.Title: “Kelowna, BC Travellers - Loved the Caribe!”
Reviews.Author: Jaimekelowna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton during a pre-cruise vacation for 2 nights - December 20th - 22nd, 2007. This is a big hotel with several parts to it. Towers and Villas. Also one part (I think the Garden Villas?) was undergoing a big renovation while we were there. ROOMS - We booked 2 rooms on Expedia for $195/night CAD. King beds, large bathroom with great shower. Nice. My parents had a Villa room overlooking the old Fort (newer, lower building), and we had a 13th floor room in one of the highest towers (I think called the Hilton Honours Club?).We had a nice view of the beach (see photo) right from our balcony. BEACH - great! Nice sand and water. A reef protects their private beach making it safe for swimming. Drink/Bar service right on the beach. ONLY COMPLAINT - Food is rather expensive here and there aren't really any restaurants close by. The beach bar/grill makes great lunch food though. TIP - They don't tell you this, but you can go to the Hilton Honours Club with your room key for FREE continental breakfast, free snacks and cheap bar drinks. A great extra service that is not promoted or advertised anywhere. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to old San Juan and the Caribe Hilton. We would definitely stay there again ! 2 Travellers from Kelowna, BC and 2 Travellers from Victoria, BC

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe Bad Reviews....This Hotel is Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HhonorsFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true resort on beautiful island (Puerto Rico). I would not believe the bad reviews. This hotel was great. I was at the hotel over winter break and the hotel was happening. The pools are great, service is great, and the hotel property is great. I would say that if you could get a rate below 250 it is definitely worth it. The location is a okay at best, but it is no big deal. There is a subway sandwich shop on the property and a convenience store too. Cabs are expensive in San Juan and based on zone. A 4 minute cab to old san juan is 11 dollars and Condanado is 15 ( I walked to Condanado in about 10 minutes) and don't even bother going to Isla Verde for 19 dollars. I had access to the Executive Lounge which was great. I recommend going to the lounge on floor 9 of the main building instead of going to the lounge in the Hhonors tower. They have fridges full of water and all types of pop that are free all day. I took the drinks and put them in the fridge that is in the room. I wasn't with little kids, but it is a fantastic hotel for kids. Plenty of shallow water in the pool area and the beach is protected by rocks, which limits the high waves that most of san juan sees. The beach is fantastic, not many waves, but a nice little stretch (especially compared to other hotels in San Juan). The rooms are a little above standard, but not extremely fancy. I went to the Old San Juan Hotel and Ritz and was not impressed. Those hotels are for people who want to tell people that "I stayed at the Ritz or I stayed at the InterContinental. Lunch by the pool and drinks are expensive, but what do you expect, its a hilton not a Motel 6. I am not a little kid, but the coolest thing at the hotel is the fish feeding pier. They give you bread to throw in the ocean, and you get to see many different types of fish (size and color) without having to go snorkeling or scuba diving. I did not use the spa, but it did look nice (but expensive...what do you expect). The workout facility in the Spa (which if free for guests) is fantastic and overlooks the ocean. So the moral of the story...don't believe the bad reviews and if you get a good rate don't hesitate to book it. The hotel doesn't have a casino, but the candanado hotel which is about a 10 minute walk and the Marriot which is about 15 minute walk have casinos (I'd go to the Marriott...I won Big). Keep in mind this is San Juan not Las Vegas. A couple restaurants that I definitely recommend: Parrot Club (Old San Juan/Local Cuisine/Average entree 20-30), Dragon Fly (Old San Juan/Fusion between Asian and Latino Cuisine). I could write another couple pages, but I hope you get the point. This property is fantastic...if you get a good rate book it and don't worry about the bad reviews. Keep in mind most people only review a hotel when they have a great time or a terrible experience. As you could tell, I had a great time and can't wait to go back. P.S. Don't freak out about the weather forecast before you go. I checked weather.com and it said rain for the whole week I was down there and it was sunny 99% of the time. I think they just predict rain at 50% everyday so they wont be wrong.

Reviews.Title: “I still like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: meme'x3
Reviews.Content: I still like this hotel. We stayed for 3 days, thru New Years Eve, in the garden towers and had a very nice room. There was a lot going on in the hotel but the staff found time to be attentive. One member of our party stayed in the adjacent Normandy and thought it was terrific. I am disappointed about the lack of interesting stores one would expect to see surrounding big hotels. If you want to walk in the neighborhood there's not much to see but then old San Juan is very close. Everytime I visit this city I like it more and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids, but in need of some remodel”
Reviews.Author: TejasJuez
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine a better hotel to travel to with kids. The pool area, the private beach, the games to borrow, the activities, bouncy things, fish to feed, etc. etc. This place is just beautiful beyond words. That being said, there are different types of accomodations in this massive resort, and the rate you pay and your Hilton HHonors status do seem to dictate the type of accomodation you get. We stayed in Room 515 in December 2007 for our fourth stay at the property. 515 is in the older, main part of the hotel. There are at least 3 other sections -- the Towers, the Garden Suites, and the Lagoon Villas. We have stayed only in the Towers and the main building. The main building the last 2 times we've stayed, has been in need of some remodeling. The grout around the tile and tub was cracked and black, and the tub did not turn off all the way. The wooden bathroom door and trim were starting to deteriorate from the moisture. And the tile in the bathroom was a pale mauve circa 1958, I'd guess. But everything in the room worked. The bathroom ventilation is a bit odd because you can hear people talking through it as if they were in your bathroom, but you can hear it only when you are in the bathroom. The bottom of the tub in 515 was also starting to separate from the floor, which gave a feeling of standing on a waterbed when in the bathroom. So, the room wasn't great. But we didn't really care. The tower rooms are newer and in our experience are in better condition. A tip -- book online at the Hilton website and check into the bounceback rate. It includes a huge buffet breakfast, which normally costs over $20.00 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Please Don"T Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: mommapie
Reviews.Content: Please listen to this review. We booked this hotel with our HH we had saved up. BIG MISTAKE! The 4th room we were shown was finally when we gave up at finding a nice room. Should I start with the overflowwing toilet in the 1st of the Tower rooms we were shown? Or possibly the must and mildew smell in every one of the 4? My husband and I want to save you the pain of staying at this hotel. If anyone has questions you can email me at [-]

Reviews.Title: “we made the right choice!”
Reviews.Author: cowboyhunter
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a family vacation at the Caribe Hilton. I feel obligated to write a review, as I poured over the prior trip advisor reviews so intently as I evaluated where we should stay. This was a wonderful choice! The beach, pool area and grounds of this property are beautiful. The hotel itself is very pretty, and seemed to be well maintained. Other reviews had noted differences between more recently "updated" rooms, I heard and saw nothing of it. The staff was very accomodating and pleasant. We traveled with other families with teenagers, and I will note, that there is a lack of night-life here. We did take cabs to Isle Verde, Old San Juan and Condado for dinner and gambling. The trade off for staying at the Caribe and venturing out in the evenings is well worth it. The other hotels did not compare. The Caribe was by far the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Book with Caution”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerKY
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the Executive Tower (Rm # 1969) on the 19th floor it smelled musty and we had to be changed to another room. We opened the balcony doors to help the room air out but after a couple of hours the room still smelled of mold and mildew. We thought there had been some water damage to the room. The smell was awful. The room appears very nice, but it needs some major work to correct the odor. The lobby and the outside pool area are very nice, and there are many shops and restaurants on the property. Please book with caution.

Reviews.Title: “Far surpassed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: nyfamilyLongIsland
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about the Caribe due to the mixed reviews, but it was wonderful. We are a family with two teenagers, travelled with two other families. Everyone had a great time, mostly because of the fabulous property with real resort feel, the friendly staff, and the activities. The pool and beach area were very spread out and inviting, as was the lobby. We all enjoyed activities such as bingo and volleyball, but mostly relaxed by the pool and enjoyed the beautiful ocean views. The only negative aspectof the hotel was the lack of casino and somewhat remote location. This was not a big deal as we took a short taxi ride each night to check out restaurants, hotels, and casinos that were all very nearby. Although the condado and isle verde hotels were more hopping at night, we felt that the resort feel at caribe made it more relaxing and welcoming to families. We did not eat in any of the restaurants other than the breakfast buffet which was great. We also took advantage of the towers snacks in the afternoon which was perfect for after pool and before late dinner. There is a bodega steps from the hotel for snacks, etc, and also a subway, which was fine for the kids for one lunch. We did stay in towers rooms which were very nice, newly renovated for sure, great bathroom, but small rooms. It was fine b/c we didn't spend too much time in room at all. I did take a quick look at one of the regular rooms, and it looked fine as well. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely return to the caribe hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good pre-Christmas visit”
Reviews.Author: johnboy53Durham_NC
Reviews.Content: Four of us made a three night trip to the Caribe Hilton the week before Christmas (2007). This was our 4th family stay there (and Dad had had several business visits in addition). Last year we were particularly impressed by the Executive Level lounge, where we enjoyed unlimited alcoholic beverages each evening. The hors d'oevres and desserts/coffee were also free. This was a significant factor in our returning to the Caribe. However, unannounced the hotel has changed its policy. Now there is a "cash" bar - with a barman - for a couple of hours only each evening. (Actually, they won't take cash, only charges to your room). Admittedly, at $3 for wine and (I think) $4 for spirits it's still a good deal compared with other bars in the hotel. However, it was disappointing. Presumably the free bar was felt to be open to abuse, costing the hotel more than it was prepared to pay for the goodwill. The hotel has a stated policy of not allowing children under 14 into the Executive Lounge. They need to enforce this. Frequently, small children were allowed to run around; one we saw burned her fingers "playing" with the steam option on the expresso machine. We are not against small children, but this lounge is not a suitable place for them to play. We found the hotel rather quiet: other guests opined that aggressive competition from new super-resort hotels (eg the Conquistador) is hurting the Caribe (and the Normandie Hotel next door appeared almost empty, as judged by the paucity of lit rooms at night). We ran into a demonstration one morning against the villa development on Condado: apparently some of the new building, incl the Caribe's, has encroached on the protected Old Fort site. (We didn't expect to run into a political demo against our hotel!). Overall, our stay met our expectations. Very low key and relaxing. Things we'd like improved? The infinity pool that is the centerpiece of the hotel recreation area is colder than the ocean in December. How much would it cost the hotel to heat it up a bit for its guests, who are paying plenty for the privilege of swimming in cold water? They might actually recoup the cost in swim-up patrons to the pool bar! (currently, no one is brave enough to endure to cold water to sit on the pool side of the bar). Also, get rid of the guys posted at the entrance to the pool area who check to make sure only guests get through. We encountered several who insisted we go away and return with room keys. Especially when the hotel is quiet, this comes across as tacky and unfriendly. If they insist on doing this, give the guests colored wrist bands or similar, instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Bargin”
Reviews.Author: KillTheUmp
Reviews.Content: I have read good and bad reveiws for this place. My wife & I take a cruise every 2 years. We are not wealthy and need to save 2 years for our vacation. I won the Caribe Hilton on priceline for $65 a night, stayed 2 nights. This was the most fantastic place that we ever stayed at. Our room was great the pool area is awesome and the staff friendly and helpful. I think that spoiled people who stay here are the ones who write the bad reveiws and hard working people like us the good reveiws. We are used to staying at holiday Inns, LaQuitas etc. and this place spoiled us. If you are like my wife & I stay here it was Great. Resturants are quite pricey here but we never ate at any. Subway 1 block away and a little grocery store around the corner. If you like to walk there is a Sizzler Steak House a 1/2 mile away, it is right by the Cruise Ship Port. We would recommed this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Hunter69
Reviews.Content: I stayed there June 2007, Upon my arrival I was amazed at the beautiful grounds surrounding the hotel. The pool and beach area were astonishing, The rooms marvaly decorated and well aired. The view from the room was spectacular, to eat there are so many restaurants to choose from that I was never hungry. The staff was marvelous and well mannered. I cannot wait for my next stay. You cannot beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - bad food”
Reviews.Author: travellover13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving and the scenery was wonderful - right on the ocean. The rooms were average in size in the Hilton Honors Tower (room 1659) Bathroom counters weren't kept clean but shower was. Although the hotel has seven resturants there wasn't alot of choices for breakfast or lunch. There are NO healthy food choices other than fruit. Very expensive for the buffet and lunch by the pool was just OK. Enjoyed our stay but not the food and do NOT go to the Subway across the street - old bread and a hair in my sandwich!

Reviews.Title: “Did the trick...”
Reviews.Author: mpbucks
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip over Thanksgiving week. We had read a couple of the reviews, and I would say more-or-less that our experience was consistent with what the majority of people said, but we really liked the place. Room - we stayed on the executive floor & had an "oceanfront room". The room itself was pretty new, very clean and overall we were pleased with it. Our only issue, which was a slight one, was that the oceanfront view overlooked the ocean but also overlooked the main entrance. It wasn't a big deal though as the view of the ocean & fort was pretty cool. Staying on the executive floor was worth it. They treated you pretty well and it was nice to have water & soft drinks whenever you it was open. Pool/Ocean - was very nice. There were plenty of chairs to choose from; the pool was clean; the ocean beach was private. All good things. The hot tub wasn't too hot though. Spa - we had the spa vacation, so it included all the spa had to offer. The spa itself was nothing to write home about (pretty bland), but the treatments were good & we were treated pretty well. Restaurants - Breakfasts - we had breakfast included in the spa vacation and the buffet was good. Decent selection & it seemed fresh. The knock would be that it was $23 per person, but if you are on a package that includes it, it doesn't matter & is worth it. Lunch - we ate everyday at the pool bar. The food was so-so at best and we never had great service. Dinner - we only ate at Morton's, and you really can't go wrong there. Beverages - all the beverages we had were very good, and we tried a fair amount, but they were a drop pricey. Not too bad as we've been places where they were worse, but at least they were good each time. Location - for us, this was a huge plus. We wanted to have a very relaxing vacation...and this was a great location for it. We went to visit a bunch of the other big hotels - and they are all right on top of each other with planes flying over them. This hotel was out of the main area, but very close to Old San Juan as well for a little sight seeing. One note - we booked the vacation on hilton.com. After booking I checked the site a few times to see what else was available. Each time, the price of the room dropped. We started out with just a breakfast package, but ended up with a Spa package on the executive floor for less $. Once we booked that, we still noticed the price dropped a few times. Each time, we called the hotel and they quickly adjusted our price. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone else looking.

Reviews.Title: “Negative Reviews Had Merit, Unfortunately for Us”
Reviews.Author: buckscountybabe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day trip to San Juan. We stayed at the Caribe Hilton because he was attending a conference there. I admit I was apprehensive about the negative reviews on this site, but I've found over the years that bad reviews don't always reflect the total experience, and I try to give hotels I visit the benefit of the doubt. After all, everyone has a bad day now and then! I really believe you should not let one bad experience ruin a trip. With that in mind, we checked into the Hilton with 5 days of sun and fun on our mind. I booked the room through the Hilton website and upgraded from $179/night to a $279/night room in order to have access to the Executive Lounge (more about that later) and, I thought, to have a nicer room. Au contrare! First of all, the fees, even for a resort, are pretty steep. There is the resort fee, then tax, then (I forget all the fees) but our $279 room ended up costing $359 per night. Just be sure to figure that into your budget. When I checked in I asked Michael if the room we were in was one of the renovated rooms. He said no, but it was quite nice. When I persisted asking him if we could have one of the renovated rooms in the tower, he convinced me to look at our assigned room (921 in the main building) and then come back down if we weren't happy and he would switch it for us. We went up, weren't happy with the size of the room, the size of the bathroom, the mold on the ceiling in the bathroom and the "blah" furnishings. Truth to tell, I was expecting a little more for our upgraded room. Went back down, saw a different clerk at the desk, and here's where the disappointment started. I was told (1) that none of the desk clerks had seen any of the rooms that had been renovated, so they could not tell me if they would be nicer, (2) the tower rooms were VERY far away (not true) (3) they only had one room available in the tower and it faced the parking lot on a lower floor, (4) there were better rooms, but they were being saved for VIP's, so basically tough luck! I tried telling her that it was our 32nd anniversary and we had really hoped for a nice room (it really WAS our anniversary). I was met with a blank stare - a sort of non-verbal "So What???" Well, didn't want to ruin our vacation by fighting with a front desk staff that couldn't care less, so we made do with what we were originally assigned. Please see the photos and you'll see what I mean. We actually had to draw on our sense of humor when we pulled out the single robe. I was about to call for a second robe, then took a good look and decided we really didn't need robes. It was threadbare and looked like it had not been recently cleaned. Once the room debacle was over we settled down to enjoy our vacation. In a nutshell: Beach was very nice, water warm as bathwater, no waves and minimal equipment (like noodles and floats). Great service from the umbrella guys. Had to sign a slip for our towels - only wanted to give us one apiece! Had to make sure the slip was ripped up when towels came back or be charged $20/per towel. Ouch. Especially since the towels had seen better days. Pro: Plenty of chaises. Pool was beautiful, plenty of chairs, series of pools was big, but the hot tub was definitely a "lukewarm" tub, no fluke, same on all four days. Only tried the Italian Restuarant on the last night - it was okay but nothing special. The Executive Lounge was worth the extra money. Continental breakfast, tea sandwiches and fruit during the day, free sodas and water, and $3 drinks. Never too crowded and the concierge there was very helpful. I did have an 85 minute massage for $125 which was wonderful, but I have to agree with the other reviewer who said the spa was very bare bones, no amenities, with a tiny outdoor whirlpool. (But really, can anyone complain about a massage??) My husband used the gym and said the equipment was pretty good (some old, some newer) with elipticals, treadmills and bikes. Never got too crowded either. Walked to Old San Juan one day - healthy one hour walk each way. We visited El Morro - beautiful and interesting, and only $3 to get in. Kite flyers were having a ball. Walked through Old San Juan two different days - Had dinner one night at the Berlin Cafe which had good food and service. Varied menu, some Puerto Rican specialities, plus a ton of vegetarian dishes. The other night we visited the Parrot Club, which had a fun lively atmosphere and great Puerto Rican cuisine. Be advised, many of the restaurants downtown don't accept reservations per se, but you can call ahead and get on their waiting list. You should do this especially on Friday and Saturday nights. Cab to or from the old city $10. We also toured the Cathedral, which has mass Sat. at 7PM and Sunday at 9 and 11AM. It's right down the street from Ben and Jerrys - yumm! One other great place to try for dinner is Pamela's Restaurant (recommended by the concierge). About a 10 minute cab ride (not sure of the section of the city), but right on the beach. We ate outside on the sand and had a gorgeous view and excellent seafood and service. Highly recommended. All in all a great vacation, not spoiled by the bad room or indifferent service at the hotel. YES, I will return to Puerto Rico (next time to see the rainforest), but NO I would never stay at the Caribe Hilton again. There are too many other great resorts to waste time on this has-been hotel. PS Sorry about the sideways pictures!!! Couldn't figure out how to rotate them.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else (Especially With Children)!”
Reviews.Author: FrquntTrvlr
Reviews.Content: We thought the Villas would be perfect for our needs. The kitchen and separate rooms worked out fine; but, it was the basics that were neglected by this hotel. (Even if you don't have children read this message.) After calling twice, prior to arrival, to child proof the room (ie collect wires, etc), there were lamp, phone, clock wires everywhere--not even wound up. It made the room look sloppy and cheap. The rug was falling apart. We waited over three hours for a high chair that should have already been in the room. The crib was RUSTED AND CHIPPING PAINT!!! NONE of the three televisions had the basics: NO DVD player, NO on-demand movie service, NO basic movie channels (ie HBO, Showtime, etc). There was no "honor-bar" in any of the rooms. The fans were noisy. The shower doors were broken; causing water on the floor. The thermostats failed to work. THE SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE!!!!!! For the most part the staff was nice; but for the ones who chose to feign: "No speak English". To top the time at the hotel off, on the last day we bought a slice of chocolate cake at the Starbucks only to learn, one bite into it already, that there was mold on the bottom side of the cake. GROSS!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Mellez81
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed here for 5 days the experience was nice. Not much going on during the week day except conventions and business meeting. So watch out walking around in bathing suit topsâ€¦ kind of awkward when you are around others in business suits! Hotel staff was very friendly they always acknowledged us by our names. Costumer service was extremely helpful in helping us plan our days I highly recommend you check them out if you need help planningâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great pool/beach area”
Reviews.Author: BaltoBalto
Reviews.Content: What we liked about the hotel: The pool/beach area are very well kept and really nice (although, keep in mind that the beach isn't very wide). The hotel also has lots of games/toys for kids to play with (such as slides into the ocean, floaties, etc). The service is also fantastic -- everywhere, from the reception to the staff at the pool. What we didn't like about the hotel: We weren't at all impressed with the food (at the poolside bar and grill). On that note, there is a Starbucks onsite and a Subway and mini-mart (with snack food, drinks, etc) across the street from the hotel, which were convenient. The rooms really do need an upgrade. We had one room in the main wing, which was fairly run down (especially the bathroom). The other half of our group stayed in a room in the Honors tower -- that had clearly been upgraded and was a lot nicer. Spa: I got a massage at the spa. The massage itself was good, but I was unimpressed with the rest of the spa -- it was very bare bones and not at all luxurious (prices of services were on par with other spas I have been to) -- not quite the overall experience I had been looking forward to. Other: Location is pretty good -- a ten minute drive from Old San Juan. We were told that there is also a bus that you can take from outside the hotel to Old San Juan that is pretty convenient. And of course, there are lots of taxis. If you can get to it, eat at Old San Juan instead of the hotel; there are lots of really good/fun restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Hilton Caibe”
Reviews.Author: Itravelots
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Honors Tower for the weekend on points and the stay was wonderful. The rooms were great and although we have a room that overlooked the ocean and the new construction, with the door closed you cannot hear anything. Due to the renovations the gardens are not working which I do like, but the service was great and the staff wa not in the way.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: traveller800
Reviews.Content: Was not so bad even if this hotel needs to get under renovation! THe beach and the pool have been very good as well as the restaurant but the rooms need a touch up!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place for singles and adverturists!”
Reviews.Author: jhovee80
Reviews.Content: Ok...well, I choose this hotel based off of reviews that this hotel was fun and great and so on... and so on.... I took this trip by myself looking for a great week of rest, relaxation and a little bit of fun in between. Well, I definately got the rest and relaxation but I was missing a lot of the fun part. My room was beautiful with the most gorgeous marble/glass bathroom with a big ol' sexy shower, his and her sinks and a tinyitty bitty toilet pushed up in a corner behind the bathroom door! lol!! Other then the compromised space of the toilet, the bathroom was great, the room was a decent size and the bed was hell-a comfy!!! I had a room on a high floor overlooking the ocean and resort and let's not forget the dirty old building of the second hotel tower right smack in the middle of your view. And its nothing nice to look at. Trust me. I don't know whose bright idea it was to build a new tower of the hotel over looking the old one with teases of oceanview on your right and left sides. I feel sorry for the people that were below me on lower floors because I'm sure they got to experience more of the second tower then I did as they were not high enough to over look most of the building. So anyway, I had a spa package guys. The spa was great! I received a wonderful sweedish massage, manicure, pedicure and facial. But beware people...They charge tax for spa services. Now eventhough the spa services were included in my hotel price, I was still charged around $65 in taxes for the three days I was there. Definately caught me off guard. Now as far as dining and entertainment is concerned, they have a great little bar located in the lobby. Drinks are pricey but where are they not pricey? They have $3 beers during Happy Hour so make sure you rack up. There's also a swim up bar outside at the pool where you can order burgers and finger foods which are pretty tasty. That's only if you need a quick snack. I did not eat at Morton's Steak House because of the reviews that I read about the prices and quality. So for the most part, I ate in old San Juan a couple of times, therefore, I can't comment too much on the food at the hotel. I did receive complimentary buffet breakfast at the main hotel restaurant (sorry, I forgot the name) which was pretty good. You get omlets to order and an erray of breakfast treats. The pool and beach area are very nice with tons of places to set up lounge chairs. The beach is man made (what's with these resorts with man made beaches?) But if you're looking for a hotel with the watersports and outdoor activities, then this is not the place for you!! There's no casino, no water sports, no activites, nothing!! It kind of sucked! There was really nothing special about this hotel except for the over-priced food (which was nothing to brag about either when I did get a chance to eat there) and the hell-a comfy bed. If you want good food you're gonna have to take a $20 cab ride to Old San Juan. Aguasvivas was great! And word to the wise...... If you're gonna take a trip to the Bacardi Factory, call them first to make sure they are open. I was told by one of the travel agents at the hotel that the Bacardi factory was open 7 days a week eventhough the hotel only offered its tour on Monday, Wednesday and Thursday but you can take a 20 minute ride out there yourself and get a tour. SO.... that's what I did. I hopped in a cab and went over to the Bacardi Distillery just to find out that the place was closed!!! I paid $50 for a cab ride to nowhere!!!! Also, don't be fooled by the little boutiques at the hotel. If you walk right down the street there is a little bodega that sells souveniers for half the price. I racked up on those!! Overall, the hotel was nothing exciting. The people were pleasant, they all spoke English but it was like being in New York City with a tropical feel. Everyone is Amercianized. I even met a cab driver that used to live 5 minutes from me in New Jersey! Ha!! Great people though. But this hotel gets 2 thumbs down for activities, entertainment and night life.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SerenityGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights on one of the Executive floors. This was well worth the extra $ since breakfast, lunch and snacks were free all day, plus cocktails were discounted. The hotel provided a free internet connection with printer too. The view was spectacular from all rooms, as far as I could tell. The pool was gorgeous and the beach was nice too. The hotel has put in an artificial reef on the beach which kept the water calm and made for some great snorkeling. The health club was very good too. I didn't try the spa. The down side is that the hotel is quite isolated from everything else. When I was there, quite a bit of construction was going on, which made walking to Condado Beach impossible. Not really the fault of the hotel. But, there aren't any restaurants within walking distance, so you either have to grab a cab to get something to eat or pay the prices at the hotel, quite expensive! The food was good though, even at poolside. Go to Isla Verde beach. Old San Juan is a shopper's paradise, but as I'm not into shopping, I didn't really enjoy it so much. We did take the horse and buggy ride which was nice. My favorite part was the snorkeling - it was like swimming in a tropical fish tank. Our teenagers got bored after a awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe!”
Reviews.Author: NCGoRedSox
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful trip to Puerto Rico. When I go back, I'll stay at the Caribe Hilton. The hotel is clean, staff is awesome and the beach is breath taking! I stayed in room 440 and the view from the balcony is amazing. The restaurants at the hotel are expensive (just like any other hotel...) but, a $10 cab ride will take you to Old San Juan where you can find an abundance of places to eat. Also, directly across from the Hilton is a Mini Mart where you can get sodas, beer, liquor for the fridge in your room. There is also a Subway across the street, on the corner that has a good breakfast. Housekeeping staff are awesome! Our remote didn't work when we got there. Called downstairs and no one ever showed up. Left a $2 tip for housekeeping the next day with a note "remote not working." When we returned our remote was fixed. Tip housekeeping and they will take really good care of you. At the bar, Victor (afternoons) and Vivianne (nights) are the best! There is only music Thurs - Sunday. A $19 cab ride will take you to the San Juan Hotel which has really good music in the lobby and for the younger crowd, an awesome club. Saul at the pool bar is great. Be prepared for $9 mixed drinks. The bacon cheeseburger at the pool bar is $9 with fries but, can be compared to a burger at nice resturant here. There is not an abundance of waiters walking around the pool/beach area but, the pool bar is less than a 1 minute walk from where you are. Overall, the Hilton is great and I will stay there again when I return to Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “You know, not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: zacaramarketing
Reviews.Content: Quite a bit of mixed reviews here. I am a long time Hilton customer and have stayed at many properties around the world. This was really not as bad as people make it out to be. Sure it is old but it is clean and there are people working all day long to keep it up and looking good. It could use some sprucing up but it was just fine for a long weekend or so. We were there 4 nights. Despite what others have said the beach is pretty darn nice. Clean, private and no, there are not rocks everywhere. We even saw a nice array of fish while snorkeling by the break rocks about 50 yards off shore. The pool is also very nice, even when crowded there is a chair to be found and plenty of space in the pool to relax. One thing that is true is that it is expensive to eat and drink here but why wouldn't you go off campus to Condado or OSJ to do that? Our room was nice with a large bathroom. I also understand some rooms have yet to be refurbished but they all will be in time. The people on staff were also as pleasant as they could be, except for one Concierge that had a bit of an attitude. All in all the place was just fine for a few day Caribbean getaway and I would go back. It is an old place that is kept up, keep that in mind and go enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Nestiny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton from August 12 to August 15. I did not pay for this trip so I can not complain about prices. Although I do know that many of the restaurants and drinks are pretty expensive. But delicious. Everyone was extremely helpful and to your service. No complaints. If you needed something they were there for you immediately. The grounds and rooms were super clean and spacious. We stayed in the Lagoon Villas which had 2 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, full kitchen, and living room. Absolutely gorgeous. Very well kept. I would definately reccommend the Catimiran trip. This is an all day relaxation experience. You are served food and drinks all day on the boat and stop at a deserted island to bathe in the sun or snorkel. Following that...you are brought to a deep sea reef where the schools of fish surround you. (Bring an underwater camera) We also booked a tour to see the Yungue rainforest with extended hike to La Mina falls. Gus was our tour guide...he was the BEST!!! If you hike through the forest and do not go in the waterfalls then you are crazy!!!!! It is so fresh you must drink some. Perfect. Loquillo beach and Old San Juan are also musts. All in all... the hotel was splendid and would go back in a jiffy. Bit expensive....but very nice. Say "Hola" to Pancho and Coco (the birds in the lobby) for me.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Elssa
Reviews.Content: I have never rated an hotel before. However our stay at the Caribe Hilton was so disappointing I had to write this and tell people how it really is and how it does not live up to the standards of a big hotel. First of all, eventhough we booked a room at the hilton thru the Hilton's website, we were given a room in a condominium next door that the hotel rents out for the individual owners. Bathrooms were very spacious but not very clean. Nothing in our room was working. The CD player, the safe, the TV. We went out and when we came back at 11pm, our door would not open. There was a housekeeper around and we asked her to help us. She tried her key and that didn't work either. Then she tells us that we have to go back to the front desk ( front desk is the main building next door since they put us in the comdominium) and security would have to come a fix our door... Overall, we have never been disappointed like this in any of our vacations...

Reviews.Title: “private resort!”
Reviews.Author: sahouri
Reviews.Content: went with sisters, liked the "private" resort but didnt realize we didnt get any waves from the ocean! had to travel to another hotel where they were on public beach. resort was nice, had an ALL WHITE party that sat i was there. service was nice, a lot of activities for families & kids. the bar in the pool was great. the pool was awesome. rooms were OK... awesome showers! clear glass, very spacious! decently priced considering. rest very expensive, ate at pool rest which was more affordable. wait staff service wasnt quick

Reviews.Title: “It's slipped since last time”
Reviews.Author: daveb84
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Caribe Hilton twice before, but not in about 6 or 7 years. While the property still looks terrific, the rooms and views are wonderful, and the endless construction seems to be over, it's the staff that's slipped...dramatically. (Also, the Tommy Bahama store is gone in favor of some tacky clothing shop). Upon check-in (at the Hilton Honors Gold Members line) I was treated with indifference. I had time to kill at the bar (couldn't hit the pool: pouring rain and no luggage, anyway!) and the bar staff was cordial at best. Still without a change of clothes to go out to dinner, I had to eat in the bar/lounge area. My waitress was slow, grouchy, and also indifferent to my COLD sandwich. Things in this regard did improve somewhat over the several days I was there, but it wasn't the fabulous, friendly, go-out-of-their-way service I have experienced here before. Given the chance, I'll probably stay here again, but not as enthusiastically as in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room!”
Reviews.Author: kaywoody
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a trip for our anniversary. I had requested a room in the tower based on other people's postings. Our room was large and beautifully decorated. I had paid extra for an oceanview room, and although you can definately see the ocean, we were facing out towards the city and construction on two new towers that Hilton is building. We were there from Friday night until Monday afternoon, and Monday is the only time that workers were outside working on the new construction. We were high enough up that the noise didn't bother us even when we sat out on the balcony and ate breakfast. I think if I had my choice though, I would have preferred a room on the other side of the building. The room was decorated very modern and must have been redone not too long ago. We had a large flat screen TV and a fabulous shower with both a rain-type shower head and a hand-held shower head. We didn't eat at the hotel except for Starbuck's for breakfast and one burger meal out by the pool. The hotel is pretty isolated, only a second-rate Subway nearby and one other restaurant that was within walking distance- Escambron Beach Club Restaurant. It is in Millenium Park which is about a five minute walk. The public beach there was pretty nice too. We didn't use the pool except for the hot tub which was cold. I thought maybe it was just a fluke one night, but I felt of it a couple of days later and it was still cold. The staff was very helpful and nice. Every single person was most gracious and kind. However, we were frustrated by the isolation and every single place to go was at least a $10 cab ride away. One night we wanted something quick and inexpensive to eat after we had been to the beach all day and there wasn't any options. We walked to Sizzler which is 1/2 mile (seemed closer from our balcony!) but when we came out it was pouring rain, so we took a cab- $11 for our 3-4 minute ride. Yikes! Overall, this was a nice visit and a great anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd expedition to Latin America”
Reviews.Author: mathamatical
Reviews.Content: So I arrive @ da spot on 7/21 me, wifey, 5mo old daughter and bro in law in a rental from Hertz, valet tried to hustle me...Im from da tri state, aint nothin' $21 vs $16...Im on a budget i replied to the valet. The room, 508, decent...good view from balcony(+ im a smoker). I'd like to say that the women that cleaned the room, made my stay; recognizing that i had an infant, came to the room w/ a crib as a safety measure...im feelin' dat. Next was the careful and punctual cleaning of my room daily, they got my tip/appreciation money...they even brought me dish washing liquid for the bottles plus i didnt ask for it. In any event, beautiful location, food is a bit high(ex. $100 on dinner 1 ngt..Subway @ top of blk $15 for 3/ngt) but overall nice location.With that, I took my time to explore Ft. Geronimo out back...and went to Ft. San Cristobal, sunburned but it was worth it. Condado is nice too. Souveneers down near El Morro on Calle de Fortaleza and Cristobal...Pidauga...4 days gone that fast...WILL RETURN IN NOV 07 FOR FUTHER EXPLORATION...HOLLA... MOST MERCIFUL KING

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Caribe!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marilynn1313
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful vacation at the Caribe Hilton Resort and cannot say enough about their staff and the treatment we received! I travelled with my 19 year old daughter and my seven year old and I have to say, the staff was very nice and they certainly went out of their way to accomodate children of all ages, myself included, LOL!!. One instance in particular. We were fish feeding by the small pier next to the beach area when my son's favorite hat in the whole world flew away and landed in the water between the rocks. He was devastated!! This hat has alot of sentimental value to my son, so I took a chance and asked two employees if there was anything they can do. Without question or hestitation these nice gentlemen sprung into action and before I knew it they climbed onto the rocks (which is prohibited to vacationers) and used a tool that extended very far out and managed to capture my son's hat. I was cheering and people around me kept asking "what's going on?", when I told them, they just shrugged their shoulders. My son was totally elated and thanked each and every one of them with a big hug. This was definitely a "Catch Me At My Best Caribe Moment". The room was absolutely beautiful with an ocean view and immaculate. The food in Palmeras Restaurant was great and even though we weren't VIP's, we were treated like one... See you next summer Caribe!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: aidawedo
Reviews.Content: After seeing all of the mixed reviews I was nervous about staying at the Hilton. It was good, clean, a decent place. I decided to try it for a 22 hour layover. One thing that you may like about this hotel is that the beach is private. Also there is NOTHING around the hotel area if you walk about a mile there is a park but it is pretty isolated, there are no restaurants or stores outside of the Hilton except for a crappy little Subway so you better have a car or be prepared to spend on a taxi. Yes it was expensive with everything one night is $363 for a single occupant. Good things: starbucks in lobby, private beach, nice layout. I did not understand the review that said that the beach was too far it was right there. Downside: the beach is not open so you can't go for long walks. I would recommend this place for people who want privacy and people who have kids! they have loads of stuff for kids to do on the premises and if I came with my family I would consider that. For my next layover I stayed at the intercontinental and you can read my review of that.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the Hilton Caribe”
Reviews.Author: BrittKT
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write these, but I felt compelled to after reviewing all of the negative comments. I was a bit scared to stay here after reading the reviews, but I am so glad I did! I stayed for 8 days at the Hilton Caribe in June. My boyfriend and I booked a King Executive Room, however, when we got there we opted to move into the Hilton Honors Tower. The Executive room was incredibly comfortable, and the only reason we switched to the Honors Tower was because of the HUGE shower. After reading reviews on here, I knew that I didn't want to stay in one of the old, regular [cheaper] guestrooms. Every aspect of our trip was incredible - the breakfast buffet was included in our package, and it was amazing. A bit too much for for us to handle, so we took advantage of the modest, but good breakfast offered in the Executive or Honors lounges - they have amazing cookies too! A nice feature about staying in either an Executive room or the Honors TOwer is access to their lounges, where you get free drinks [which we stocked in our fridge, so we didn't feel so bad about paying $15 for suntan lotion!] We ate at the hotel - for a buffet [which was actually worth the price!] and in the Italian restaurant, which was okay. We also had a 'romantic' meal in the hotel - which was absolutely amazing. I'm not sure if it was a mistake or not, but our drinks were also comped for during the meal - tally up a few mojitos, and that can really add up!! We were also given complinetary champagne, which was great! We toured Old San Juan - a must, Bacardi factory [free drinks!!] a snorkle excursion from Farjado was included in our stay [a must regardless if it's included or not!!!] and we treated ourselves to a couples massage in the spa [great for my boyfriend considering he was home on leave from Iraq!!!] We ate at several charming restaurants on the island, including one where you sit directly on the beach - fantastic! The concierge desk has a virtual computer where you can see menus from many restaurants, maps, etc... it's a really wonderful feature! I also love the fact there is an airline kiosk so you can check in at the hotel - really saved us some time! I also loved the private beach! It's a good size and there is plenty of room. Obviously prices at hotel restaurants are a bit on the more expensive side, I've never been one that hasn't been! I have yet to speak to anyone who's paid a little more money to stay in a nicer room & had a bad experience at the Hilton Caribe. All in all - it can be an amazing expereince here...

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: claudis927
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for our honeymoon at the Caribe Hilton!!! We had booked plane tickets but didnt have a hotel until a week before our trip. Caribe Hilton was the best deal, not too much money. The room did not have the greatest view, but I believe is because we pay the lowest price. We did not care anyway!! We only went there to sleep. the hotel grounds were great. The pool, the bar, the beach, the view.....was like paradise!!!!. The food was excellent, I never had a bad meal. ALthought the food was expensive ($75 dollars and up for two) we did not care, we were in our honeymoon and we had the best time. Old San Juan is just minutes away!! they had great Shops and restaurants. El morro is also minutes away. We cant imagine getting a better deal!!!! I cant wait to book my other trip and go back to the Caribe Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches in a HIlton?”
Reviews.Author: silstari
Reviews.Content: We got there the first night and based on the fact is was called a suite I assumed it would be a little bigger room it was not. SO I look athe window and I the frame of a building of a building under consruction I asked the bell man if they would be doing loud construction during our stay? He replied "no" I confirmed it witht he front desk however the next day I woke up to loud drilling banging and hammering. The room I was called called an ocean view room all I saw was traffic and construction and a lake from my balcony. The bell man and other staff were tipped out with the group I was with with 20% he didn't mention that either when he took the tip money. OKay so a day goes by then suddenly I see something scurry aross the floor I screamed as it headed for my shoe! It was a roach it made it's way up the wall. I called the front desk about an exterminator they explained it was just the tropical climate I saw another a day later. I have stayed in La Quinta that had better rooms! And I am sure Motel 6 probably has less rocahes. Anyways, the bathroom, pool, beach, pool bar, resturants, dining rooms, computers, lagoon, and ammenties of the hotel were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton and its PiÃ±a Coladas”
Reviews.Author: NYMotherFussers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for four nights in June 2005. We were apprehensive at first because of the many bad reviews but when we arrived, the staff checked us in right away and when we asked for an upgrade, they gave it to us. We stayed in a renovated room in the new tower and it was great, with a beautiful ocean view. The beach was clean, and you could order anything from the hotel and they serve it to you right there. There was a slide in the water which was a lot of fun. The concierge was really helpful when it came to recommending restaurants in Old San Juan. Oh, and it was quite easy to get around using the cabs. Some of the reviewers mentioned that the cab rides were expensive, but for us (we live in DC), it was really inexpensive (around $6 to get into town). Overall, a great experience at a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Just What You Want”
Reviews.Author: TJinSTL
Reviews.Content: I just took my team on a 4-day trip to Caribe Hilton. If given the chance to do it over, I would certainly return. My wife and I (particularly my wife) are very discriminating travelers. Were we to go to Puerto Rico alone, we'd be unlikely to return. However, the Caribe Hilton was certainly fine enough to satisfy us (even her), and for a work-outing, it was a perfect fit. The outside areas of the hotel are beautifully done. The water is great, the resort property is vast and diverse, and in general, it was well-kept. The public areas of the hotel were spacious, clean and inviting. As for the rooms, this is not a new hotel. It has gone through a major renovation and we were not displeased - but you can only cover up so much in a 50-year hotel. Be sure you stay in one of the newer sections of the property! Here are some I shared with our travel agent who had directed us to this property: 1. For what it is, the resort is great. Compared to other convention resorts, it scores well. As a high-end luxury retreat, it would not fare as well. The property is definately feeling its age - even in the tower where we stayed, they can only paint over, plaster over and carpet over so much. The common areas were good, and the pool/beach areas were laid out very nicely. But, it's not a new hotel. 2. I found the location to be excellent. It's 10 minutes from the airport, within walking distance of casinos and restaurants, and its location on the water was great. The property is basically encased by two old forts, surrounded by a low stone wall, and in beautiful water. The outdoor area offers a great combination of pool (with waterfalls), beach, shaded hammocks, and grassy areas lined with palms. 3. The spa was top notch. This includes the fitness center. High marks all around. 4. We ate at two of the on-property restaurants. I would suggest doing no more than eating lunch at the property. The restaurants weren't bad, they just were very over-priced for what ended up being pretty pedestrian food and service. 5. We went to three restaurants for dinner in Old San Juan. One was a local dive in a neighborhood we probably shouldn't have ventured to ... but it was great. The other two we would highly recommend: The Parrott Club and Aqua Viva. Great Food, Great Service and Great Atmosphere at both.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hilton”
Reviews.Author: headstraight
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came back from San Juan P.R. and we spent 7 days at the Hilton caribe and I must say that we enjoyed every moment of our stay. The staff was courteous and accomodatin. The pools were clean and the private beach was beutiful and safe for a five year old. I stayed in the Tower building and those rooms were great with a beutiful view of the beach and front garden.
