The room was clean and the bathromm was expansive and did not have any mildew or other growths on the fixtures or walls. The only drawback to the hotel was that the hotel is somewhat isolated from other places. So you are pretty much trapped in the facility, unless you want to spend cab money to get to the hotel and restaurant strip in Condado (half a mile or so away). If not, bring your wallet the food and drink prices are expensive (about $100.00 a day for a family of three) and they do not offer a package with meals. If you are adventerous, rent a car from Dollar across the street and explore the other parts of the island, it comes out somewhat less then the activity packages they offer. one other thing DO NOT DRIVE INTO OLD SAN JUAN take a taxi, it is better for your health and sanity.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful for a price....”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Caribe Hilton Hotel in beautiful San Juan, Puerto Rico. I have been traveling to Puerto Rico all of my life and used to stay in the Caribe Hilton in the 1970's-1980's. The hotel recently underwent rennovations in the lobby. The rennovations are nice but to me I feel that the hotel has lost a lot of it's Puerto Rican charm. It seems to have become a mega resort. What I mean by that, is that it is not anymore a tranquil hotel as I remembered from my youth but is now a bustling resort with too many people and extremely high prices. We stayed in a garden room on the 10th floor. We had a beautiful view of the gardens below, the beautiful sea surrounding us and the historic fort. The rooms are pretty well maintained although I do think they can use some rennovations. The first and last nights that we stayed at the hotel were very nice and quiet. However the 2nd night of our stay was horrible. I cannot say it is the fault of the hotel but the people staying around us. They were slamming the doors all night long which of course made it very difficult to sleep. On our first day there we arrived around lunch time and had lunch in the grille. The food was very good and the lunch menu was pretty reasonable. We also decided to have dinner there. They offer different buffets every night of the week and although the food looked good we decided to order off of the menu. The dinner was o.k. and again the prices were o.k. On our second day we decided to have breakfast also in the grille. Well, this is where they really get you. When we first sat down they did not give us a menu. There was however a menu on the table. The menu only showed 2 or 3 options and then the $20.50 buffet. Well we are not huge eaters and so did not want to spend the $20.50 for the small amount of food we would be eating. We were about to leave when my husband asked if that was all they served. At that point, the waiter said, "oh, no, we have another menu." I am assuming from what happened to us, that they try to get everyone to order the buffet so they do not give the full menu unless you ask for it. Well, needless to say, we ordered from the regular menu and to be perfectly honest, we ended up spending the same amount that we would have spent had we ordered the buffet. For an order of French Toast, eggs, orange juice and a cup of coffee it ended up costing us over $40.00. We have stayed in many resorts of this kind and even larger ones and have never, ever paid anything like that for breakfast. With that being said, I feel like they definitely take advantagebecause there are not a lot of places to go that are near the hotel. Fortunately, there is a Starbucks in the lobby and although you cannot get a hot breakfast from them at least you can get something to hold you over for breakfast and not spend a ton of money. We opted to eat breakfast at Starbucks for the remainder of our stay and it actually was quite good. If you are looking for Puerto Rican cuisine in the Condado area, we ate at 2 pretty good restaurants for dinner. The first was Ajili Mojili. It is pretty moderately priced and the atmosphere and most important the food was very good. The other place I would recommend would be Ropa Vieja. If you only have one night to eat in the Condado area then this is the place I would say to visit. The atmosphere is really nice and the food is wonderful. Check out the spa at the Normandie Hotel, right next to the Caribe Hilton. Although it is a very small spa, the service is excellent and the prices are very reasonable. All in all, the Caribe Hilton is a beautiful resort, but due to the high prices, crowds and location, in the future I will probably opt for a different hotel for my stay in the San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort with prime location”
Reviews.Author: UDSL05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights at the end of June. It has wonderful beaches, pools, and restaurants. The best part was its location. The hotel is far enough away from Old San Juan that it has its own beach and privacy, but yet just a short cab ride away. The other major resorts are out by the airport. There is so much happening in Old San Juan it was nice to be so close. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is an excursions desk across from the concierge, we used both and were impressed with the recommendations and excursions. We highly recommend the illumincecnet bay, that alone is worth a trip to Puerto Rico. It should be noted, that the rooms do not have the fit and finish of the hotels of this caliber in major North American or even European cities. These things were all minor, but I thought I would mention them because if you are expecting comparable four or five star accommodations you might be disappointed. If you are looking to have fun, relax, and enjoy the island then you will enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I was scared to death, but...”
Reviews.Author: travellorzl
Reviews.Content: I was scared to death upon reading some reviews and called to cancel but was asked not to. Upon our arrival, it was as if they had read every negative review and sought to correct things. We lucked out with no wait to check-in, our room was ready despite a brief scare and a bell person was at our taxi the second we arrived. Our room was 1564 and the view was simply unbeatable (no exaggeration). The rooms in the tower are not spacious, they are actually smallish but not the filth factory I envisioned though the maids had not looked in the tv cabinet that had something most vile in it. It still smelled after having been removed. While the shower was large I could not get the water to get hot-ever. There was intrigue about the towels; though I asked for extra towels 3 additional sets to accompany the 1 existing set-each day, the maid would take the additional sets and only ever leave 1 set. The restaurants were pricey but really no different that any restaurant in a hotel. We did make use of the minimart/mom&pop across the street. We ate in the hotelâ€™s palmeras restaurant and got the buffet (lamb/steak) $39.00 and found the food delicious and the service exceptional and gave the waiter a fantastic tip. The pina colada we tried (at the pool) was just horrible, the ameretto sours inside the bar area made my chest hurt (they had real booze-I allowed my chest to keep hurting). I was still alittle haunted by the bad reviews so we did alittle checking, we walked down the halls of the main building and did smell something moldy though we could not see inside the rooms-so donâ€™t discount those reviews-those candid reviews saved us a horror show described by so many. A lot was made about the executive lounge-it has light snacks and a cash bar-it is not worth paying anything extra for.Watch out for the birds-they seem friendly enough but we witnessed alittle aviary violence-the white cockatoo bit a man that had monopolized it for at least 30 minutes. You can have a good time at this hotel-if you use it for sleeping and a meal or two and the pool-it is not the main attraction-Puerto Rico is so see it.

Reviews.Title: “Room was flooded, clean but not friendly ppl”
Reviews.Author: kevi32
Reviews.Content: I went thinking because the cost was more that it would be a nice hotel. My first room was flooded, and the decor was way outdated! When I asked to be placed in another room, the front desk person was Rude, and almost refused to put me in another room (until I asked to speak to the manager). The hotel wants to you to pay for any and everything, and it not cheap prices. The people that work at the hotel are rude, and seem like everyone was having a bad day. I been to allot of Hotels in PR, and this is the worst. Better off Staying at any sheratons, or Holiday Inn. The hotel had high speed internet, that worked 1/2 the time and they want to charge you for it?? Most hotels in PR offer internet access for free. I will never go back. Food was ok, but again way too much money. You would think you where on Park ave in NYC. and the hotel is old and outdated, they do not even have a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great but pricey”
Reviews.Author: SCChuck
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is a great hotel - close to Old San Juan, ports and airport without being right on top of any of them. Our reservations were made at a good rate but that may be, at least in part, because of the whole passport busines. The rooms were very nice and service was very good. The best part about this hotel is the pool and beach. The pool is very nice but sometimes crowded and the beach is very nice and relatively quiet. Hammocks among the palm trees was the highlight. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights before taking a cruise and got just what we bargained for, a chance to unwind. Now, the bad news. The cost of a single mixed drink, with a modest tip, will set you back $11. And, while they have 4 restaurants on the premises, they all charge Hilton prices. We saved some cash by eating several meals at the Subway nearby and taking advantage of the small market, where you can buy a liter of PR's finest for less than the cost of one mixed drink by the pool. There are no other restaurants nearby. However, for the price of a roundtrip cab ride (about $25 - both directions) you can have a nice meal in Old San Juan and still save money. We learned from the concierge that massive renovations are due later this year - probably October to November and by the size of the renovations, I would expect a stay at the Caribe to be less enjoyable than it would be today. I would definitely call and ask about the status of renovations before making a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Service oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris&Erik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton 6/8 through 6/17. We found the staff to be very accommodating and friendly. It is unfortunate that there is some major construction going on but if you are at the front of the hotel, you do not hear it. Avoid the villas until the construction is complete! We had a beautiful view from our 13th floor tower room and found the room clean and mold free. It is nice that they provide mini fridges instead of mini bars. You can buy juices etc at the store across from the hotel. The grounds are beautiful, pool is great, and beach area is ok. There is an area of shaded hammocks that are very inviting. While you are wandering the grounds grab a handful of bread from the towel stand and head out the pier to feed the fish. The restaurants in the hotel are pretty good. Our least favorite was the Italian, too much salt used. Our favorite was the Lemon Grass. Order the filet with stilton sauce. YUM! Do not forget to say hi to Victor and Manuel, the day bartenders in the hotel lobby bar. They take VERY good care of you. Overall, we had a wonderful vacation and will go back next time we go to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Radiovet
Reviews.Content: This was once a great hotel but with time and the add ons it has suffered. The drink machine offered soft drinks at $250. each but was empty. After taking our three ones it coughed back a one and two dollars in dimes. At that price you'd think they'd keep it full. Food is extremely expensive. Breakfast for one will hit you for $30. and is average at best. Forget room service. The taxes and fees drive up the cost of a less than spectacular meal beyond where one likes to go. A $214. room rate gets more than $50. a night tacked on in taxes and resort fees. Couple all of this with a staff that has few gems in it and it is best to find another place to stay. We found the people to be condescending, partial to other Spanish speaking folks and in some instances simply rude. I had not been back to Caribe Hilton for 20 years but remembered it fondly. That memory has been updated. Sadly the hotel hasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy with the Caribe Hilton or San Juan”
Reviews.Author: JoAnnPittsburghPA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from San Juan, stayed at the Caribe Hilton, June 2nd thru June 9th. Had to change rooms 4 times requested the Hilton Towers and they put us in the main building it was very old and and dirty tub was moldy and there were holes in the walls and ceiling. Asked to be moved 2nd day, we were moved to the towers 12th floor it was nice much better room and an excellent view. Got up next morning to find check out papers from the room when I called front desk they said that the room was booked and we would have to move. We were moved to the 5th floor construction all day and no view, went down to see manager and he could not understand why the moved us but said he would put us in nice room. Finally in nice room but each time we were given a room we had to wait till 6pm to get in the room. My husband said good thing we had suitcases with wheels cause he said they got warn out from moving. The showers were nice BUT in every room there was mold on the floor they could use some clorox to clean them. I didnot find the people in San Juan to be friendly, everyone spoke Spanish, it is very expensive. All the fees they add to your room is crazy, plus to get a cab anywhere it was $15 each way and they tell you its not safe to walk. I did not find the beach to be very nice, I did think the pool was nice. If you eat breakfast in the restaurant it is over priced and the service is very bad. I feel this Hotel is more for business travelers and they are more receptive to people coming for conferences. I guess all in all I will not go back to the Caribe Hilton. We actually tried to book a cruise out of San Juan the first Sunday we were there but the change in the airline ticket would have cost us another $1,000 so we decided to stay and make the best of it. There is no place like the Radisson in Aruba, way way better....

Reviews.Title: “Great place with a wonderful view!”
Reviews.Author: JayIs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I vacationed there last year. It was by far the best time we have ever had. We spent a little bit more and got a newer room with ocean view. It was worth every penny of it. The room was located in their newer building, the "tower". It has brand new furniture. The shower is the best I have seen. This hotel has a private beach, which is a big plus. It is very clean. The staffs were friendly and helpful. We are definitely going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: urbanistaNYC
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week-long vacation in San Juan, PR. I read reviews of multiple hotels before made reservations and decided to stay at Caribe Hilton. Great choice! I was a little concerned about reviews that mentioned molding rooms that smelled awful. As soon as I booked my trip I called the hotel directly and asked for a recently renovated room. My request was honored. We were placed in HH Towers. The room was great - we asked for 2 double beds - they were so comfortable. The room was rather spacious and the bathroom was great too - with nice shower. I read in one of the reviews that if you stay in the Towers you get access to free continental breakfast. Right on! We got free breakfast every morning - just swipe your access key and it works. Another tip -- there are free appetizers and rather cheap alcohol between 5 and 7.30pm every day served in the same lounge where you eat breakfast. Everybody complains about how expensive everything at the resort is, but if you go to the executive lounge you get $3 glass of wine and $4 hard liquor.... you canâ€™t beat that, can you? Plus you get free appetizers. About food - I live in NYC so to me it didnâ€™t seem overpriced. There is Subway next to the hotel but I would rather personally get a nice sandwich and salad at the Grill at the Hotel for $7 than a nasty sandwich at Subway for $5. You decide. Food is delicious at all the restaurants located in this hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful. I donâ€™t know what others complain about - lobby is spectacular, the beach area is secluded and just perfect. Pool area is large too. No problem getting towels or umbrella. Staff is very friendly and ready to help. Example: I was ordering lunch while lounging by the pool. The waiter came over to take my order. She asked if I wanted a drink - I said no and she saw that I had a bottle of water standing on my table. In few minutes she came back with my sandwich and glass full of ice- I didnâ€™t even ask for it! Thatâ€™s what I call great service- when you donâ€™t even have to ask for it. Condado area is located across a bridge and is about 15-20 min walk away. There are many restaurants there. I was not impressed by any of them. But again, I am very picky having lived in NYC. There is a small convenience store next to the hotel. If you are out of sunscreen, donâ€™t buy it at the store located on hotel's premises (outrageous prices) - walk a few steps over to the convenience store and pay just $7. As far as activities are concerned, we went on sailing and snorkeling tour which was great! They take you to 2 different islands and there is so much fish there, itâ€™s breathtaking. I booked the trip at the activities desk at the hotel. It was $89/person including tax and it included free bus ride to Fajardo area as well. We also went to Old San Juan - not on tour, just took a cab - it was $12 on the way there and $10 back. We went to El Morro - admission is $3/person and it was really cool. The food was way better in Old San Juan than in Condado. Try Berlin Cafe. It was great. We didnt rent a car - we figured we would not need it. There are cabs everywhere and there is so much to do at the hotel plus the different tours available i thought it was unnecessary to have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Jolenie
Reviews.Content: I had some trepidations about staying at this hotel after reading some of the other reviews. After a pleasant four day stay at this hotel, I have to conclude that those who hated the place either had unrealistic expectations, or they were given a completely unrenovated room. The reviews indicate that the Garden rooms were the worst, so we knew that we wouldn't agree to stay in that wing. We did request the Hilton Honors tower, and were somewhat surprised and disappointed when we were told that they didn't have a room available in the tower. However, we were given a room on one of the higher floors in the main building, which they considered to be an "executive room". Perks included use of the Executive room which provided a free Continental breakfast, coctail hour (mainly cheese and fruit), dessert in the evening, and free access to the internet. Given the expensive restaurants in the hotel, the breakfast saved us a decent amount of money, and consisted of the usual Continental fare. The food was constantly being replenished by the staff. The room was on the smaller side, but not tiny. It had relatively new carpeting and a decent bathroom. It was well maintained and very clean. The duvet cover was pilling which was annoying because the white threads stuck to our pj's, but otherwise, the bed was comfortable. The lobby was attractive and open. The beach was great for swimming and kayaking. I loved it because the water was calm and clear. For those who like to surf, find another hotel. Palm trees provided shade if you didn't want to get an umbrella. Chairs were plentiful on the beach and by the pool. The restaurants were generally overpriced and the food just OK, except for the Lemongrass which was fabulous. It was romantic and the food was wonderful. All in all, if you view the Caribe Hilton as a 3.5 star hotel and not a 4 star hotel, you shouldn't be disappointed. We liked the fact that it was not on a crowded strip, like most of the other hotels in the Condado area and in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: rockyjoe
Reviews.Content: GREAT location with Private beach and a great pool. Rooms were very nice (not great). Room was bigger than average and had a nice balcony overlooking the ocean. My only complaint was that the front desk gave me and another guest bad directions to our rooms and we both had to come back and get better directions (the other person had to go back a third time)

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: tomn32801
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a weekend at this "resort". I say resort because they charge you a "Resort Fee". I've been in much nicer Hilton's before; but, everything in San Juan appears to have seen it's better days. More of a place for families with small children. I wouldn't recommend to singles or couples looking for a quite relaxing vacation out by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Be advised about this Hilton”
Reviews.Author: amidelaplage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton due to it's great location, attractive grounds and Hilton's reputation for quality. Though recently remodeled, it was evident that the hotel rooms were "tired" older rooms with simply some fancy new furnishigs. They failed to warn us that the ocean views were obstructed by construction, unless you stay in the higher floors. I must admit though, the bed was comforatable and the pillows were wonderful. We spent some time laying in the sun and watching families swim in the hotel's cove, only to learn from the local news later that evening that there was a city-wide alert warning people not to swim in the waters near the hotel that day due to a health hazard having to do with raw sewage being dumped into the ocean water nearby. We were surprised that the hotel chose not to limit access to the cove by its guest. Finally, when we were checking out of the hotel, we noticed a charge was posted on our bill titled Voluntary Contribution to the Children of Puerto Rico fund or similar. There was nothing voluntary about it. Apparently they conveniently slip this charge into the room bills, and unless you happen to notice and dispute it, you pay it. I told some Puerto Rican friends about this and they found it humorous that the hotel would attempt such a thing, assuring me that the funds did not get used for that purpose. So, for the next time I stay at the Caribe Hilton, I would like to thank them in advance for the "voluntary contribution" of a comfy fluffy Hilton pillow my luggage, as my wife so happens to be a former Child of Puerto Rico. Seriously, if you stay at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, ask questions and don't take anything for granted.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: movedsouth
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days in early April at the Caribe Hilton. We had a room in the Hilton Honors tower (15th floor) with ocean view. We were traveling on Hilton points and my husbnad was a diamond member. First, we really enjoyed our very relaxing stay. Our room was small for four people. There was not a lot of room to put away all the clothes. So, we had one living out of a suitcase. The room itself was in decent shape. I think it could use new carpeting. The bathroom was updated recently. We had a great view of the ocean and the beds were very comfortable. Make sure you get a topsheet on your bed. We did not and asked for one. We ate breakfast downstairs at the Hilton Honors free breakfast. It was perfect for our family as it had bagels, cereal and fruit and sweets. There is soda and water available all day at the Honors room and also had free appetizers at night. Lunches we had mostly by the pool/beach area. We found the food to be fresh and good. Dinners on property we had were, Madrid-This was just okay. I would not return although the waiters were very nice, the food was pricey and very mediocre. Il Giardano-The italian restaurant was our favorite. I would gladly go back. I had the veal parmigiana and it was excellent. We also ate twice in the buffet restaurant for dinner called Palmeras. The roasted meats night was a good variety and we enjoyed it and found the price reasonable. The lobster night was expensive and disappointing. I would not go back for that. The grounds are large and have everything for a relaxing vacation. We were truly spent much of our town at the resort. The beach is small, but the ocean was calm enough for the kids to swim and enjoy. There was very good snorkeling around the rock areas and my husband learned to scuba dive next door and swam just past the rocks with the scuba group. He said this was the best experience and highly recommends it. We would definitely go back to the Caribe Hilton. I think some rooms are older and more worn than others. I also think a smile and a "gracias" goes a long way. Be polite and people were very friendly. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: queenbuc
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an all girls trip to Puerto Rico. We originally booked the Caribe Hilton with the expectations of a nice hotel. The lobby was beautiful but after seeing the room we quickly exited stage left. Definitely not worth the money!! We got the unrenovated side. There are a lot of options in Puerto Rico and if you are going to pay, you might as well get a nice option. So we headed over to the Marriott. It was beautiful. The lobby was nice. The bell men were cute and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Our first room had some leakage problems and we were promptly relocated (with help) and given a $100 credit. After realizing all the taxi rides were going to cost a small fortune, we chose the bus. Only $.75 each way! The bus goes everywhere from Old San Juan to Isle Verde and even the airport. Old San Juan is nice and perfect for tourists. We found a little shack by the port that served the best Marlin pastelillos, the manager, Andres is really nice. We also caught the ferry over to the Bacardi plant for free drinks!!! The souvenir shops definitely werenâ€™t as cheap as the Bahamas. The clubs were okay. Too many young people though. Senior Frogs has a great atmosphere but leaves something to be desired in the food department. We decided we wanted to get away from the tourist spots and wanted to rent a car. The Hertz desk at the hotel wanted $40 a day!!! So I went down to the business center which is open 24 hours a day and booked a small compact car using Hotwire for $12.95 a day. The total for the day was less than $20. The only bad thing is the $14 parking fee at the hotel is ridiculous!!! We rode the bus to the airport, picked up the car, and hit the highway. There are small tolls as you drive up the highway, the most expensive one was $1.50. We drove up to the El Yunque rainforest, which was only a 45 minute drive. The tours from area hotels range from $40-$50. So we were expecting an entrance fee of some sort. Well to our surprise it was completely FREE. We walked the trail to the La Mina waterfall. We didnâ€™t go to the peak this time, we heard it was beautiful. Either way, you canâ€™t beat this FREE excursion. All in all we had a great trip to Puerto Rico. I would stay at the Marriott again, however, I would rather rent a condo off the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: towing3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went down for our 25th and had a great stay. Had a room in the main Bldg. in the executive floor. Had a view of the lagoon and ocean, very nice view. Very quite and laid back. Room was very nice and cleaned everyday. The view from the other side is of the ocean and the city. Were givin the chance to have either view. The exective lounge was a great extra to have. Very nice Cont. breakfast in the morning for free and were able to get water , soda for the beach for the afternoon. Save alot of money that way. Pool and the lagoon were real nice and clean. Not very many people were there so we could sit almost any where we wanted to. Service at the swim up bar was ok. Morton,s steak house was GREAT. Went into town for another dinner, the cab into old san jaun was 10.00 plus 2.00 tip. Also went to the El San Juan hotel and casino for a 20.00 cab. Hilton was a great place to really relax and just chill out and enjoy the good weather. PS. If you get a room in the new towers bldg. it is a pretty long walk to the pool and lagoon. The main Bldg. is right next to everything. The Garden view section has its own pool but very small and people tell me the rooms are very old too. If you want to just get away and chill out , the hilton is the place to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: MidgeInMichigan
Reviews.Content: We loved our week long stay at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The landscaping was incredibly beautiful with just about every type of palm tree swaying in the constant breeze from the ocean. The multiple pools including one with an infinity edge were inviting and refreshing. The service we received was excellent! The reservationists, bell captains, waiters, security personnel, housekeeping and maintenance were friendly and very helpful. The Olas Spa is a must for anyone who needs a little pampering. They also had a nice variety of restaurants and a couple of bars right on site. Our only criticism was the extremely high prices for food and drink at the hotel. Drinks including Beer started at around $8 each and most ala carte entrees including pasta dishes started at $25 and up. Of course, you could always go into town to eat but prices were a bit high there as well. All in all, we would definately recommend the Hilton Caribe to those looking to stay in Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed but OK”
Reviews.Author: Cricketer11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton earlier this week on a quick business trip. The Sttaff are luke warm and not very keen to help. Room was just OK , but clean and secure. I ate at Mortons and the service was great and the food was as expected, very good. Overall good for what I wanted but so so otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “No thank you, Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: KO75
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed. I did a lot of research on properties in San Juan so that my family and I would have a great vacation. (husband, myself, and two kids 2 & 7). Despite the reviews I had read for months (thinking the people were overcritical) I booked it anyway. I had a rate of 230 per night but felt that with all the promises it was worth it. The lobby is beautiful and the Starbucks is good...the private beach was fine... We arrived on the last flight into San Juan and arrived to the hotel about 11pm...we were not taken to the room until about midnight. It was an ordeal getting checked in and I was a HIlton Honors member. I had requested an upper level floor...I was given the Garden Terrace (if you get this...change it immediately). We had to take an elevator "down" to our room. People joked and asked if we were sleeping in the basement. The Garden Terrace is a decent hotel room with a dirty patio...with dirty cheap patio furniture...overlooking the facilities area with the exception of the plants/foliage that is place in front of the patio. There are walkways on the other side of your hedge. I did not feel it was worth staying at the hotel in that room for 230 a night (along with the 5 dollar per person...including children...surcharge per day...that's an extra hundred dollars on the bill). I spent two hours on the internet (wifi was an extra 15 dollars a day) looking for something else...not an easy feat during spring break...but we found something great and I am pleased that I was given the room otherwise I probably wouldn't have been motivated to move. If you want more choices for restaurants and shops...Isla Verde is better located.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: DebFMichigan
Reviews.Content: We were booked in a double double Villa (supposedly an upgraded room) which we found very cramped. They add a small bar type sink, a second fridge and a microwave to the Villa but the bathroom and room itself is much smaller than the Tower double double rooms. We switched to the Tower because the room was small and the view was of a construction site next door. Tower room more spacious with a beautiful view, fridge, large closet and huge bathroom with walk in shower. I would have preferred two Queen beds instead of the two Double beds which were very small. The grounds are the best part of the hotel. They have a beautiful pool area, shaded area with palm trees and hammocks and their own lagoon with beach. A lot of the hotels say "ocean front" but have no beach access. We never had a problem finding a lounge chair no matter what time we got downstairs. The staff will even bring you an umbrella and put it in the ground for you (free of charge). The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is very expensive. We spent $100 for four of us for a breakfast buffett. After that we had the free Hilton Honors breakfast and ate elsewhere for all meals. The hotel is a short cab ride to the airport as well as Old San Juan. I'd stay there again, mostly because of the grounds and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Caribe Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: ellenok
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned, reluctantly, from a week at the Caribe Hilton. We had a wonderful and relaxed week, with consistently excellent service, beautiful food, and comfortable surroundings. We arrived after midnight and checked into a room on the Executive level of the main building. Our room was simply decorated, with the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Even though we were traveling on Hilton points, we had complimentary chocolates and Evian waiting for us. The room was clean, but the carpets and upholstered furniture were rather worn and water-stained, and the room was a bit small for two adults and two teenagers. The next day, we stopped by the HHonors desk and asked if there were a larger room available. Our request was handled with grace and efficiency by Mr. Luis Sanchez â€“ he moved us into an enormous one bedroom suite at the top of the Garden building. We quadrupled our space! The Hilton is not new, and there are areas that are in need of updating. Both our first and our upgraded room had need of a bit of attention (a missing drawer pull, a shower fixture that squirted a bit), but we were clear that we were spending a week, not moving in, and had a clean and comfortable place to sleep and change and have a bit of down time. Our room was immaculately cleaned daily, with an abundance of towels. The furniture was colorful and comfortable and again, the bed was sublime. Unlike the previous reviewer, we had a beautiful meal at Mortonâ€™s. Our dinner at Lemongrass was phenomenal. We also thought the tapas at Madrid were rather uninspired, although the service was friendly, helpful, and speedy. Even the cheeseburgers at the poolside restaurant, Atlantico, were excellent. And the fruit! Lovely fresh fruit salads everyday. We generally skipped breakfast, and waited for poolside lunches at 11:00. When we needed breakfast, however, the HHonors lounge continental spread was sufficient. Room service breakfast one early morning was expensive, but VAST â€“ two orders more than fed four of us. We only enjoyed the buffet dinner at Palmeras once, and found it excellent â€“ with possibly the best lamb chops (chuletas) I have ever had. Yes, the food & beverage service is relatively expensive, but anyone who lives or travels in New York will find this Hilton no steeper. The drinks were $8, but weâ€™re paying more than $10 in New York (and even Providence) restaurants. Considering that we were traveling on Hilton points, we were happy to pay for good food and drinks. The grounds, gardens, pools, and beach are all beautiful and well cared for. I was dubious about the beach, since it looks very small in all the photos I saw, but I was pleasantly surprised to find it big enough, with plenty of room to drift off on a raft without bumping anyone. Most people seemed to prefer the pools, which were also big enough for all of us. I could go on and on, but suffice it to say, Iâ€™d be happy to return to the Caribe Hilton, even without points!

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get......”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton on a long weekend trip in November 2006. Because of my Hilton status, a room snafu at check in, and a good tip to the concigere, we were upgraded to a really nice bi-level suite. The staff was polite and accomodating and tried their best to make it a great stay. We especially enjoyed the people working at the swim up bar. They were good ambassadors of San Juan. The porperty is aging and it shows. It needs some upgrading over the next few years. Do not book this if you are fussy. Our room was layed out well with a living room on level one and a bedroom, master bath, and outdoor hot tub on the 2nd level. The unfortunate part is that it smelled funky and we had hot water issues that were finally solved on our last night. I think that it is a good $200 per night beach hotel but as you aprocach $300+ there are defiinately better options. Good travels!

Reviews.Title: “great! kids loved it, we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: clairej0
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights pre cruise and couldn't have asked for anything more. the rooms in the hilton tower were great, fab bathrooms - huge shower! pool area was lovely, great for kids of all ages and on the other side of the path from the pool was the hotels private secure beach. food for lunch was very good and reasonably priced and at night we got a taxi from the front of the hotel who took us to the hard rock cafe in town. we arranged for him ( eddie) to pick us up, and he was right on time, and he also took us to the ship and picked us up on our return and dropped us at the airport. all in all, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Vitorio21
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico is a beautiful place. The Caribe Hilton just added to the wonderful experience. When we arrived at the hotel, we were promptly greeted by a bevy of friendly employees in the most amazing open-air hotel lobby. We were checked in to our executive-level room in the main building and had no problems with the room. The room was nice and large, clean, and very comfortable. It had a king size bed with a white feather comforter and large over-stuffed pillows. The bathroom was great, with a marble tub/shower combo and sink. The view from the balcony was very nice, although not as impressive as the view from the new HHonors Tower suites. The private beach was not overly crowded and extremely beautiful. The service was great and very prompt on the beach. We were basically waited on hand-and-foot. The Hilton is also the only resort with a private beach and a fort located on the premises. During the stay, we asked to be transferred to a new room in the HHonors Towers. (Nothing to do with the hotel, merely personal reasons.) The new room was even more impressive than the first. The bathroom was completely different, in that it had a large stand-in marble shower with dual shower heads. There were also double sinks. The room also featured a flat-screen TV and a large balcony overlooking the private beach. The food was some of the best I've ever had, especially the Hilton Burger and Shrimp Skewers from the Atlantico Bar and Grill. The Italian restaurant didn't have the greatest of service, but the food was good. The Lemongrass restaurant was exceptional. I would recommend trying the apple and chicken sushi roll. We went back twice just for that. The food at the tapas restaurant wasn't that great, but the service was good. We also had dinner at Cafe Puerto Rico in Old San Juan, which was great but very touristy. Tamarind Steak and Seafood had exceptional food and great service too. Also, if you purchased an executive-level room, you were given access to the Executive Lounge, which provided breakfast, appetizers, and desserts. Good buy! We went horseback riding at the base of the El Yunque Rainforest, which is the only rainforest in the US National Forest Registry. The tour guides were funny and playful, and the horses were active and fun. We stopped off at a swimming hole and swam a little and then continued on to a mountain restaurant for drinks. Very quaint. We also snorkeled daily in the private beach, but I do recommend bringing your own snorkel equipment. The hotel charges $10/hour but you can purchase for approx $30 at the store. I enjoyed the Pina Colada at the Hilton, but the one at Barrachina in Old San Juan (both claim to be the birthplace of the Pina Colada) was better. They didn't use ice to chill the mix, leaving it thicker and less watery. It was also sweeter and had more of a pineapple taste. Old San Juan has beautiful architecture, old churches, old Spanish forts, art museums, and cobblestone streets. It also had mainstream shops and a lot of touristy shops, all with the same items. Not to mention, a lot of pigeons! Don't worry about not speaking Spanish - most people speak English and most all places have English and Spanish translations. All in all, it was a great place to visit and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 6 night stay at the Caribe Hilton (3/30-4/5). Wife and I took our two young children. We arrived around 1PM and were told our room was not ready yet (official check in time is 4PM) and were given a phone number to call to check up on room status during wait. Room was ready at 3PM and we were upgraded to an ocean front room in the tower building which was a pleasant surprise since I did not bother to ask for an upgrade seeing as the hotel was fully booked. Room in the tower building was very modern and clean with a flat screen TV and large bathroom. Only ding on room was there was no bathtub (instead a very large shower) which prefer for the little ones. As mentioned in prior reviews, the grounds are very nice. I found the staff on the whole very friendly and accomadating as well. Our package (booked through a travel agent) included complimentary breakfast. The breakfast buffet was one of the better ones I have seen compared to other hotels in this class and price range. The Lemongrass restaurant located on the property was outstanding. As a comparison, we stayed four years ago in PR at the Marriott Stelaris. Would give the Hilton higher marks on grounds, pool and private beach. Marriott's main advantage is that it is right in the heart of Condado so you can walk right out the door and hit restaurants and shopping. The Hilton is fairly isolated with only a Subway and small convenience store located near. On the whole, both hotels provide for good family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotty room service”
Reviews.Author: nemonyc
Reviews.Content: Located close to Old San Juan, nice beach. Concierge service was good. Room service was mediocre (or non-existent - read on). We were told a couple of times that a technician would be sent to adjust the airconditioner - no one showed up. We requested extra towels one evening when our room was not cleaned as we requested - and we were'nt shocked when they did not show up. Overall would recommend for location and choice of restaurants, just don;t expect stellar service.

Reviews.Title: “For laying out, this place couldn't be more convenient, but...”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMaryland
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to just lay in the sun, then this place is great. They have plenty of chairs, towels and choices: a small strip of beach sand, several pool areas, and a breezy section overlooking the ocean. Everything in the resort is very convenient: they have several places to eat (expect to pay resort prices), a swim-up bar (again, resort prices!), a Starbucks, a center to check your email, etc. So for sunbathing and relaxing, this place is great. If your looking for a more cultural, ethnic trip then being out at the resort could be a bit of a hassle. For a real taste of San Juan, you need to get outside the resort and go into Old San Juan (about a 10 minute drive). There you find more of the food and flavor of the area. Cabbing back and forth can add up quickly, but driving there is even more expensive with valeting and city parking -- plus the driving there is a little crazy -- confusing and fast-paced -- even for this city driver!. And the potholes! I thought I bottomed out the rental car twice. The spa is fair -- my massage was good -- but my facial, pedicure and maincure were barely adequate -- but if you are a big spa-goer who is used to first rate spa treatments, I'd pass on this spa and spend your time relaxing in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: judyjackson
Reviews.Content: My husband and our four children ages 10-15 stayed here during spring break. The bay/beach area is perfect for children. There are no waves, since there is a break wall far out. The hotel offers snorkel equipment, kayaks and waterbikes. The area is calm and safe enough to let your kids use the equipment (all for a price) alone, as long as they can swim. The pool is beautiful with waterfall and swim up bar. There is also a hot tub. There is plenty of room on the beach, around the pool and in the hammock area to set up for your day. We stayed in the Villas and the rooms were roomy and the bathrooms recently remodeled (marble vanities, double sinks, sepate toilet area). There is also a separate pool and hot tub for the Villas which the kids went to only in the evening. The hotel food was average, but the beach/pool area more than made up for it. Service was excellent, rooms were cleaned everyday by 10:00am, and front desk, valet and bellhops were all polite, helpful and friendly! I would go back again in an instant!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joepyeweed
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with this hotel. It is perfectly situated between Old San Juan and Condado. Old San Juan is a 30 minute walk or an easy 50 cent bus ride away. You can walk during the day, but I would take the bus at night. A cab will run you approximately $10 each way. Condado is another 20-30 minute walk in the opposite direction. The staff was friendly and helpful in recommending restaurants and things to see and do. While the hotel is waterfront, it is not beachfront, although there is a public beach nearby. The hotel was clean and pool a pleasure to sit by. Make sure to sample the free virgin pina coladas served each day from 1 to 1:30 pm at the poolside bar. The hotel organizes daily tours to El Yunque, but you can also rent a car from a small agency located directly across the street from the hotel. The agency is also next to a great simple breakfast bar for cafe con leche and a morning toast. I was not impressed with Condado and Ocean Park; Old San Juan was really the highlight of the trip for me.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: auntbuff
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by friends. I'll be back! I stayed in the "Honors Tower", the first room I was taken to didn't have quite the view I was looking for - but the bellman and the desk people very quickly assigned me to another room. I believe it was an "ocean deluxe." The view was astounding, I was able to see the pools, 2 old forts, the harbor & ocean all from my room & balcony. The sun came up on the side of the hotel where I was staying & I found myself getting up a couple of hours earlier than usual just to see the sunrise! Staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. Loved the pool area, the hammocks (be sure to put a towel down before laying on the hammocks in a bathing suit! I forgot & got rope burns on my back!) There is plenty within walking distance, and so much on the grounds of the hotel itself. It was a great central location, a short drive from Old San Juan. I could go on . . . but I would find myself wanting to hop back on a plane & check in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McLeanMommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two oldest (of 4) children on a spring break trip to San Juan to enjoy the beach, learn some history, and practice our Spanish. The beaches of San Juan are comparable to those of southern (Miami) Florida, with nice sand and clear water. We experienced some of Puerto Rico's prettiest beaches on a day trip to the offshore isle of Culebra, which has little to recommend it other than its beautiful sand and waters. San Juan's history -- especially the old Spanish fortifications -- is interesting, if a bit underwhelming. The nearby rainforest of El Yunque National Park was certainly beautiful, though not quite as spectacular as I had expected. That said, both old San Juan and El Yunque offer quick, easy, and interesting diversions if you do not want to spend all day at the beach. The people of Puerto Rico were very kind and accomodating and one young man gave us a friendly and free ride back to San Juan from Fajardo (1 hour +) one disastrous evening (long story). When my husband and I travel without children we stay at the Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton and Mandarin Oriental hotels, so we are accustomed to good hotels. However, when we travel with our kids we try to stay at hotels that have nice pools, good activities and a lot of space. The Hilton El Caribe was wonderful on all counts. The rooms themselves are best described as perfectly standard and good business-class hotel accomodations. Our room -- a King Garden Suite (# 843) -- consisted of two connecting rooms. Each room had its own entry door, work area, mini refridgerator, safe, telephone, television and balcony. The main room had a king-size bed (quite comfortable), a full bathroom (standard), and a spacious and separate entry foyer. The second room had a full-size, pullout sofabed and a half bathroom. Pleasantly, our rooms had views of the old Fort San Geronimo (on site) and the ocean, and importantly, we experienced absolutely no daytime or evening noise. The El Caribe's grounds are quite lovely and especially fun for kids. There is a large main pool, subdivided into separate pool areas with waterfalls, or a basketball hoop, a bar, or hot tubs. The Condado Villas have a separate, more secluded and smaller pool area with its own hot tub. We generally retreated to that pool area to relax at the end of the day. The hotel has a private, man-made beach with fronts a clear, calm and small little inlet. The calm, inlet ocean water has waterslides and you can rent little boats. In addition, the El Caribe's grounds have a large carp, goldfish and koi pond. There are basketball and shuffleboard areas. There is a small children's playground. There is a pier where you can feed and observe fish in the open the ocean day or night. There are chessboards and other outdoor games scattered throughout the place. For adult relaxation, there is a nice health club, outdoor morning yoga classes, three outdoor bars, lounge chairs everywhere (on the beach, by the pool, facing the ocean pier) and hammocks in a lovely grove of palm trees. The is an onsite rental car agency (Hertz), and travel tour company (didn't use it). Finally, the El Caribe has many on-site restaurant choices (though we usually went offsite), including the truly good and relaxing Lemongrass, as well as a Starbucks coffee, Morton's steak house, Madrid tapas, and a standard hotel restaurant which hosts a breakfast buffet (kids are free) and dinner every day. The hotel's location is convenient, fifteen minutes to the airport and five minutes to Old San Juan. In short, the Hilton El Caribe -- opened as the El Caribe in 1949 -- is as good a place to stay in San Juan as any, especially with children. I would certainly stay there again if I ever return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “One star room in 5-star surroundings”
Reviews.Author: staceyglow
Reviews.Content: First of all, I will state up front that I booked this hotel room through Hotwire. Because I know I am paying possibly the lowest rate in the entire hotel (which was still quite a bit of money), I don't expect the best room they have. However, I do expect to have a room at the quality level that they have promised Hotwire (which was 4 stars). I have used Hotwire on quite a few other occasions, and this has never been a problem before now. People reading this review should know that I am not one of those TripAdvisor members that appear to be chronic complainers; I don't like to let minor annoyances or inconveniences ruin my vacation, and this is the first negative travel review that I have ever written. My family and I arrived at the Hilton Caribe and I was extremely impressed by the gorgeous grounds and the beautiful lobby. An employee offered us complimentary chilled bottles of water as we checked in. I made a mental note to tell my father, a Hilton Honors Diamond level member, that this might be the place he may want to spend some of his accumulated points. Then we were shown to our room. My jaw dropped. This is a four-star hotel room? Frankly, I have had Motel 6 rooms that were nicer. The seams in the carpet were raveling. The curtain rod for the sheers had pulled out of the drywall and was hanging cock-eyed. While the view contained some lovely tropical plants, it was primarily of a side of a building covered by rust stains and dripped paint. Even though the square footage of the bathroom was rather large, it only contained a tiny, fiberglass modular shower unit (no tub) and a stand-alone single vanity. Both of them looked like very cheap Home Depot cash-and-carry fixtures. If were were staying more than one night, and my family hadn't been exhausted from our travel, I would have asked for a different room. I joked to my husband that this was probably not the room Paris stays in when she visits this hotel! I should also add that my room was accross the hall from a room that had the ice machine and the service elevator. The door to this room had extremely squeaky hinges (do they not have WD-40 in Puerto Rico?), and all night long I was treated to the loud squeaking of the door hinges and the dinging of the service elevator whenever it reached our floor (which, being the main floor, was often.). Let me say that the facilities are beautiful. This hotel is out on a nice point of land, and they have a gorgeous pool area and a beach that has a reef further out that calms the waves before they hit the swimming area. Besides the Starbucks(for breakfast the next morning). the only meal that we ate there was lunch at their outdoor bar and grill. Warning: if you are watching your budget, pay attention to your beverages. Our family had a meal of 3 chicken tender baskets, a hot dog, 2 pina coladas, 2 virgin pina coladas, and 4 soft drinks, and the bill before tip was $92.00. Turns out that that the virgin pinas were $7.50 each (they only charge you a buck more for the booze) and the cokes were $3.25 each . I realize that this is the typical prices one pays at a big-city Hilton, but they were the highest by far I had paid for drinks anywhere else in the Caribbean. I guess that going forward, I am going to have to decide whether to look cheap and ask the drink prices ahead of time or just order with my fingers crossed and hope for the best. My advice? This looks like a nice place to stay if you get a good room (I'd ask to see it first, and make sure it is in one of the newer buildings) and you can afford it. The next time we are in San Juan, our family will be exploring other options.

Reviews.Title: “Real relaxation”
Reviews.Author: CeeGee
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid-March with my teenage daughter for 5 days and booked a Spa Package. The manicure, pedicure, facial and massage were a definite treat. As HH members, we had an Executive Tower room, which was very nicely appointed. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful, especially with restaurant reservations. A definite bonus was the use of the Executive Lounge with complimentary snacks and beverages and free Internet (15 minutes pp). I was a bit disappointed that the HH Lounge had a cash bar. I've been to other Hiltons where they offered free cocktails. Yes, the $$ spent on cabs to and from Old San Juan added up, but the total was comparable to a car rental ($45 /day). We also used the gym (also nice). We had coupons for the breakfast buffet (great), lunch in the Olas Health Bar and a light supper in the Madrid Tapas Bar. Otherwise, we dined in Old San Juan and Condado. Try RaÃ­ces for native cuisine. Overall, this was a relaxing getaway that perfectly suited our needs.

Reviews.Title: “room problems, great pool and grounds”
Reviews.Author: cheryl42255
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a great view over looking the ocean and pool area. The room itself smelled damp and extremely musty. Even with the sliding door open to the balcony the smell stayed. The bathroom tub did not drain after one shower, we had 4" of standing water, the towel bar was hanging, our bed was not made as it should have been. We only had a bottom sheet and a bedspread - no top sheet or blankets. We called maintenance to fix the bathroom before 5 pm saying we would be out for dinner and if possible please fix while we were out. We came back at 8 and nothing was done. I had to call again and they came up within a half hour. They fixed the bathtub drain, the towel bar and remade the bed properly. Upon checking in the people at the front desk were great. Upon checking out early on Saturday the person at the front desk totally ignored me for at least 5 minutes - he should be fired. When I complained about the room all he said was "sorry to hear that". This hotel seems to spend a lot of time keeping up the outdoor area which is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice/Very well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: GAMAGO
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed here from 03/12-03/17 (3 nights with points and 2 paid) @ the HHonors tower. We think the hotel was really good. Although the room price was high ($260/night), other hotels like the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde (much farther from Old San Juan, no private beach, etc) were around $240! Not worth the little difference. Pros: The room was beautiful (huge bathroom), with a partial view of the bay. The staff is friendly and the pools are awesome. We didn't find a lot of kids screaming around, which I think is great. It's very close to Old San Juan (5 min ride). Nice hammock area by the beach. Cons: Yes, the beach is small but the hotel was not very crowded (even taking into account that was Spring Break), so there wasn't any problem to find a spot. The drinks are overpriced ($7 for a draft 8 oz beer!) I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “mostly pleasant”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for three nights, 3/15-18. We have concluded that room assignment is highly variable and a big determinant of how reviewers have rated the hotel. We spent our first night in the "main building." Had we been forced to stay in that room- our trip would have been VERY disappointing. Old, worn, dated, cracks, etc. I would expect more from a Motel 6! Fortunately- we moved to the "Honors Tower." Beautiful! And- since we were on the side facing Old San Juan and the ocean- it was very quiet... we did not hear ANY construction noise. It is unfortunate that within the same resort there is such variability in the quality of rooms, noise level, quality of concierge service, bar service, etc. In one case the concierge was very helpful... when someone else was at the desk- it might as well have been vacant, since NO real assistance was provided. Housekeeping was adequate- but they removed my towel which was hanging on the bathroom door hook (a chamois I bring when I travel since I often react to the detergents hotels use). Management did nothing and did not return our calls to discuss a resolution. Bell service was OK- but they "store" luggage in a roped area of the open air lobby... not secure at all! On the positive side- the beach area is NICE! It was a pleasant haven- quieter than around the bar area and much less windy. We thoroughly enjoyed Lemongrass and Madrid-San Juan. Drink service was a mixed bag... SLOW service and not necessarily tasty pina coladas- which originated at this hotel! Overall we had a nice time in SJ and plan to return... we will likely stay elsewhere- ESJ, Ritz Carlton or the Westin. We were unable to fit in a trip to the rainforest so we'll likely stay closer to that area than Old San Juan next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big-city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasubar
Reviews.Content: Generally, it is not our style to stay in large, American-owned resort hotels. But, being from Chicago, we wanted to be sure to stay some place where we knew we would be able to watch the Super Bowl (even if the end result was disappointing for Bears fans). If it wasnâ€™t for that, I would have some mixed feelings about staying here, which are best mentioned as a list of Pros and Cons: Pros â€“ Large, well-appointed room with flat-screen TV, enormous bathroom and shower and the most comfortable bed I think Iâ€™ve slept on in my life. Centrally located right between Old San Juan and Condado. Fabulous pool and very nice private beach. Great views. Everything you could want right on site, plus easy walking to convenience stores off the grounds. Staff well-trained in service. Cons â€“ Expensive, in terms of room prices and food/beverage, although not out of line for a big city hotel. Wi-fi costs $15 per day (but you might be able to tap into the free wi-fi from the Condado Plaza hotel, depending on your room location). Hotel grounds are sprawling â€“ if you forgot something in your room when youâ€™re at the pool, itâ€™s a looong walk back. Noisy construction site next door starts prompty at 7 a.m. on weekdays. Has a cookie-cutter Americanized feel without a distinctive sense of charm that would be found at a smaller inn. But overall, Iâ€™d say our experience was a positive one, and we wouldnâ€™t hesitate to return if we felt we wanted a resort-hotel experience. I might even return just to sleep in that ultra-comfy bed again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities but a tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: alsilver1
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic (and beautiful) and the amenities were great (nice beach, pools, restaurants) but the hotel was poorly maintained. Chipped paint on the door frames, garbage remained in the can near the elevator for days, light bulbs remained burned out in the lobby bathroom. Disappointing for $350 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: InternlTrvlr
Reviews.Content: The CARIBE HILTON, surprisingly, exceeded our expectations! Having read recent reviews, our expectations were quite low. We arrived quite late (11:30 p.m.) due to delays and expected a musty, moldy leftover room. We had a GREAT room!! We were put on the 8th floor of the main building; the room was VERY clean, comfortable and quite roomy! Super room with fluffy pillows, and NO MOLD (!!) & a lovely view of the lagoon, old fort, and city. Since we were starved, we ventured down to the bar in hopes of getting a few peanuts; we were greeted by a lovely young lady who suggested a club sandwich, hot wings, & salad to share with a cold, cold beer for my husband and a yummy pina colada for me. At midnight, this seemed like filet mignon; it was quite good. What a great relief! While the food at the hotel is pricey (you won't find MacDonald's prices, but what do you expect!! ), it was always good quality, no matter which restuarant. Our favorite was the Lemongrass restuarant; plan ahead & make a reservation. We loved eating on the terrace, enjoying flora, fauna, & the swans in the lagoon - especially at sunset! Even though we ate several times in Old San Juan (@ El Pescador (!), Marmelade, El Convento, Panzo, & Parrot Club) , we purposely wanted to eat 2 additional nights at the Lemongrass. A meal can be made from just the hors d'oeuvres. An excellent drink, not on the menu, is fresh mango juice with Chopin vodka, straight up. There were 3 different conventions last weekend, but they were not noisey (Boston Mutual, Psychiatrists, and a retail association). We saw very few children, and very few college students on vacation. The experience at the Caribe Hilton was very positive and enjoyable - The Caribe Hilton staff were very professional and pleasant. Their English is impeccable and they were mostly (see note below) exceedingly helpful. My only criticism of the hotel lies with the Concierge service. If you are not already booked through a convention for reservations to local events/tours, then forget it. Whenever we tried to talk with them, neither my husband nor I, nor the other couple (who also stayed at the Caribe Hilton), could get the concierge to help us! We were given an "I don't know," or an "I can't help you" (and a look of 'don't bother me'). They obviously missed the training class for personalism & positive demeanor when dealing with guests. [Then WHO IS at the hotel to help individuals?] If the general manager of the hotel reads this review (not likely!), I would suggest that he/she fire ALL of them & start again with 2 different desks - ONE DESK for conventioneers, & the SECOND DESK for individuals & families. Fortunately, the four of us are seasoned & adventurous in making our own plans, even in broken Spanish. I would strongly recommend the Caribe Hilton - certainly try to book the 8th floor with a view of the fort and book ahead for a dinner reservation at the Lemongrass restuarant. It is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid until construction is done”
Reviews.Author: socprof
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel before and liked it in the past. As other reviewers have pointed out, the location is amazing, given the hotel's private beach and that it is much closer to old san Juan than similar beachfront hotels in Isla Verde. However, the Caribe Hilton is in the midst of constructing a new addition and it is VERY LOUD (from around 7 am to 6 pm). There are many hotel rooms that are affected by the noise. Being awoken by construction noise, being unable to use the patio, and not being able to take an afternoon nap all negatively affected my attempt to have a relaxing vacation at the Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Beautiful Spot”
Reviews.Author: steadyhand98
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in or near San Juan this the hotel to stay in...Worth every penny..It has its own beach, a clean calm lagoon which is great for kids, (95% of the hotels in San Juan area do not have their own beach, they use public access beaches which are ok but not great) a very good Gym, beautiful swimming pools. (.one with a swim up bar,) very good food, and nice rooms. The hotel bars are excellent..This is where the Pina Colada was invented back in th 50's..The staff is bend over backwards friendly...The rooms are on the small side but not that big a deal since the weather is the main attraction..Views are beautful..If you call ask about the executive lounge feature..It sounds hoity toity but actually it gives you lots of free food options..It might only come with certain floors so ask first how you can get this included with the room price Renting a car is not necessary, as cabs are the best way to go anywhere,.Bus service is non existent...Old San Juan is charming with cobble stone streets and an immense Fort..Beautful lit up at night..There are some eyesores in and around San Juan but if you look past them you will see a certain charm in this area...Try walking to the Coronada area to the east of the hotel along the water and you will find a couple of cafes that have waves that come right up to the windows. We ate breakfast there...Be prepared to spend money on food as this is expensive in this part of Puerto Rico...even just basic lunch food. is high..The Hilton actually had healthy lunch type food that was somewhat less expensive than a lot of the local eateries we tried..Good veggie food cooked by locals is in the Hilton Gym cafe which is hidden away for some reason by the tennis courts..Take a cab ride to Isle Verde one evening and walk through some mega expensive hotel lobbies like the El San Juan which is spectacular (with a casino) and the Ritz Carlton..Good Mexican food sports bar called Lupis in this area..If you like snorkling take the catamaran ( you can book this in the hotel lobby) tour..It goes to an unpopulated Island off the coast .. right out of a post card..Even if you don't snorkle, the ride is great. the water warm,,...

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover5
Reviews.Content: We received this hotel for 75.00 a night for our precruise stay from Feb. 22-25, 07. (we were not tacked on any extra charges, like resort fees.) We arrived at 3, our room was ready right at 4:00. Very nervous as both workers at the desk kept saying oh what a wonderful room you got!! I told my husband I think they were trying to convince us it was a great room before we saw it!!! Well, It WAS a great room. We were in the Condado Villas. #7117. Kitchen, bath, king bed, beautiful big terrace with loungers and boy what a view!!! Thought maybe we would get a lousy room since got it so cheap--glad I was wrong. Very clean room, great maid service. Only one problem, our safe wouldn't work, needed a new part, and Carlos fixed it right on the spot!!!!!!! Food is high priced, but the day we were on the beach, my husband and I split a hamburg and fries. They were huge so we had plenty. The garden rooms hallway smelled musty. The rooms looked ok, but I would have been disappointed if we would have gotten one. No view either. Did not ever eat supper there, went to town. The bus is easy to use for only 1.75. We had breakfast at the Subway right out the front of the hotel. Pancakes, breakfast sandwiches, french toast. and the right price!!!! I would definitely stay here again, and we loved our 3 day stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Liverneck
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Caribe Hilton in Feb 2007. Overall we had a very good time. The staff is very nice and accomodating. The Spanish/Puerto Rican restaurant was excellent. The Buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant was also excellent. The beach and pool were a lot of fun for the kids (and adults). However this is not a 5 star hotel. The rooms were a little run down. The refrigerator was not working and we were told that they are "room temperature" refrigerators by the staff. This is laughable and unacceptable for a resort hotel in 2007. Nevertheless I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “show me the money”
Reviews.Author: R0J0
Reviews.Content: bad things: everything costs mucho $$$. Rental for paddle boats $35 1/2 hour. Floats $10 a day ( pick one up at your local dollar store before you come!!!) The kids' program was non-existant, may be we were there on an off week, but my daighter was very diappointed when there were no "cool kids" games and the pina colada tasting was supposed to happen at the pool bar crowded with tipsy gringos and no kids, very poorly organized, no one at the "kids paradise desk, although there was a game room with dance revolution, air hockey and other games and a TV. For all the advertising they have about kids they tell you nothing at the desk, we only learned from the check at breakfast that they ate free. The bathtub had gross tile problems, not what I expect from expensive hotel. NO movie channels, really lame, some basic cable channel and local stations. Again, not expected for th eprice we are payinng for this room. Refrigerator was not cold and there was no way to adjust it. good things: take advantage of the huge breakfast buffet, lots of delicious fresh fruit, bacon taste of old grease, decent pastry and pancakes, cereals, juices from concentrate, eggs, etc. Fill up so you fdon't have to pay 11$ for a burger and then go out to eat in OLD SAN JUAN or condado< there are four (?) restaurants in the hotel< we were going ot try the spanish but the menu was limited and very expensive> we tried lemongrass which was excellent food but again very very expensive> >>> do wal to the end of the pier and feed the many fish there< amazing> swimming in the lagoon you will also see fish> it is very very crowded here on the weekend> avoid the weekend here> i have only stayed at one other hotel in san juan (marriot) this hotel is much bigger< a whole complex by itself< there is no casino< fine with me< you can take a taxi to condado> i would like to be able to stay in old san juan< but you give up the ocean area and the big pool> btw if you have a car it is TWENTY ONE DOLLARS a day for valet service and NINETEEN for self_parking< ridiculous>

Reviews.Title: “Screaming Kids, High Prices, Poor Service & Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerNYC123j
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in the Caribe Hilton and was quite disappointed. I booked an executive level room and expected to stay on the executive level. Upon check in, I was put on a standard floor (6th floor) instead of the executive level floors 9th and 10th. When I asked why they said that the hotel was fully booked. I later found out that they will sell an executive level room to anyone that is willing to pay an extra $100 dollars and then stick you in a normal room with access to the executive level lounge. The room that I was given on the 6th floor was noisy, dirty and quite old looking. The bathroom had rust stains all over the bath tub, walls and plaster falling from the ceiling. The carpet is well worn and needs to be replaced. When I got into the bed I discovered someone elseâ€™s hair on the sheets (Disgusting). When I tried to fall asleep I was kept awake by noise coming from the room above me. After I complained twice to the desk the hotel security finally took care of the problem. The next morning when I went to the executive level lounge for breakfast I was greeted with utter chaos. There must have been 150 people in an executive level lounge made to hold 25 people at the most. In addition to that there were plenty of screaming kids running around making lots of noise (I thought this was supposed to be an executive level lounge not a day care center). The breakfast selection was lacking. I also later found out that the complimentary beverages during happy hour are no longer complimentary (Cash Bar). This is the first executive level lounge that I have ever been in that charges you for a beer. The pool area is probably the high light of this hotel. Nice large pools and a beach area. The only downside is a million screaming kids. Service at this hotel is definitely lacking. The staff is very slow and makes no effort to help you. Just to get a waiter to take your order can take upwards of 1 hour in one of the hotels restaurants. The bottom line: Overpriced Poor Service Dirty Rooms that are falling apart Screaming kids Executive Lounge is a ripe-off The next time Iâ€™m in San Juan I will stay at the Ritz Carlton

Reviews.Title: “Ritz prices for lacklustre service”
Reviews.Author: gjsny
Reviews.Content: I agree with the prior review. We also stayed in the Lagoon Villas at the recommendation of the hotel as we explained before hand we were a family and needed space. The rooms were NY boutique small. The prices are very high for what you get. We were quoted $265 a night but after taxes and valet parking fee it was closer to $399 a night. Plus we found out people at the same rate had breakfast included while we were charged $20 per person for the buffet. Add that in and you are well over $400 per night for what is a very crowded and understaffed mid range hotel. We had no movie service in our room the entire stay despite reporting it daily to the front desk and the malfunctioning electronic rooms keys were a common pain for everyone. All the restaurants on the property are expensive for the quality. On the plus side the staff/people are friendly, it has a great location and its close to Old San Juan. The concierge desk is overworked but very useful and the free wireless network access at the in premises Starbux a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: gwr333
Reviews.Content: I was a tiny bit apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews, but my family and I were quite pleased with our experience. The room in the Hilton Honors Tower was lovely...comfortable beds, nice sheets, big TV...and the bathroom was exceptional, with a huge shower area nicely appointed. The staff was helpful in arranging a tour to El Yunque (don't miss it) and in making reservations, getting taxis, etc. The place was very crowded, though, which meant lines for everything: Starbuck's (10 minutes every morning at least), towels at the pool, drinks at the pool bar, etc...After a few days there we were relaxed enough not to care so much. The spa was nice and I had a massage one morning. I wish we had discovered the Olas health bar earlier, because the food there was very good and very reasonably priced, unlike the other hotel restaurants ($27 for a plate of spaghetti...pass.) We mostly ate our dinners out as there are numerous excellent restaurants nearby. One night we felt like walking after too much mofongo and ended up walking home from the Condado. It isn't far, and there is a pedestrian bridge over the water, but the 2 blocks nearest the Hilton are in a construction site, so not the most pleasant of walks. Hopefully that will be completed soon and everyone can save the $10 taxi fare for the approximately one mile trip. My only disappointment was that the pool water was really too cold to make using the swim-up bar appealing...oh and the other complaint I would make to the management is about the two hot tubs. First of all, they are not nearly warm enough, and second, although a sign clearly says no children are allowed in, it was not being enforced. I got in for a few minutes and then some little boys with scuba masks decided to look at everyone under water...the lifeguard did nothing about it. The last straw was when 2 tiny kids IN DIAPERS got in!! At very least, they ought to reserve one of them for adults only so we don't have to be ogled underwater or bathe in pee water. Overall, we were happy with our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A great concept, but is it worth the money?”
Reviews.Author: dietzberger
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the start of a week in Puerto Rico in February, with two pre-teen children. It's a handsome place, nicely conceived and beautifully set--we wanted to be near Old San Juan. But for the prices at high season we would have expected better. The room, in the newest wing (Lagoon Villas) was attractive, but far too crowded for the price, and there was inadequate closet space for two people much less four.
