We wanted to eat at the chic Asian-fusion "Lemongrass" restaurant, set in one of the courtyards by our wing, but it was booked for a private party (a wedding reception), which went on and on very loudly, keeping us all up until (get this!) the cops shut it down way after midnight. The pools are lovely, and the beach is nice (for play, not for anything else); and we found all of the service very nice, if not always very efficient. I wouldn't have minded any of the problems had we not been paying enormous prices (as high as Disney World--where you get your money's worth).

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel BUT THE SERVICE STINKS”
Reviews.Author: PhilaTravlers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went down for the Presidents Weekend the hotel was great until Saturday when EVERYONE else showed up. Lots of kids and folks from the New York (The Island). The room (Garden) they gave us first smelled real bad and we complained and the Manager upgraded us ASAP. The pools were wonderful and the beach area was ok. They need to rake the sand to get the cigarette butts, condom and trash picked up. The food was fair and expensive but one expects that at a resort like this. Hit the market outside the hotel for drinks and snacks. Also, use the Villaâ€™s pool and hot tub, more adults and fewer kids. The pool bar was fun; Hector makes a mean Run Runner. The service / wait staff are SLOW!!! They know they have you and they take thier sweet time...Overall, it was fun however get a Villa roomâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Paris' Dad”
Reviews.Author: travelingsweet70
Reviews.Content: You can look at this hotel in a couples of ways that can sway your star rating but here are a couple of observation I had when my husband and I traveled to the caribe hilton earlier this Feb. 1. Your best bet for a relaxing vacation is always choosing the best room you can get. (remember this resort is one of the oldest in san juan...so new areas have been built some rooms upgraded and redesigned...you can have a low floor, high floor) I think the rooms can vary at caribe hilton this can sway your rating....our room was great with great view 2. Your in san juan area if your looking just to stay on el caribe premisses that have a little built up laggon area, a number of pools, a shopping plaza with a starbucks, clothing, shoes....so if you really want to stay put you could....but most people I would believe want to venture ot to old san juan or condado area....to see the scene or possilbly to go to a casino....in the neighboring area of condado...most of those hotels have them...el condado, marriott...etc...you could actually walk there but the bridge that connects caribe hilton area with condado area is a little dark at night to cross...i would cab it 3. food there is a mortons on premises....also hilton breakfast buffet...was ok......if you not a morning person ...you can just goto starbucks...but if you plan on eating breakfast everyday try to get breakfast included...could be pricey if you don't. 4. the hotel staff were excellent and there advice ...right on the money....they told us to go to a place for seafood named aquaviva in old san juan...when we were about to go exploring...the place was yummy...cerviche great...so were the oysters rockafeller...we even got to see an equestrian street show (just happened to be going on the weekend we visited) hole thing was delightful...we stumbled on a place called ropa vieja while walking in condado...was a great dinner!!!! 5. the pools were clean and beautiful....be careful who you sit next to though....one women was on her cell loudly...talking about her stupid haphazard posting of her CV on monster.com...yap yap...and how she was getting job offers...new york ...penn....NJ...if your reading this and this was you....women you got to learn to be discreet...you were too...loud...we didn't need to know your business but man we had no chioce....lol... (sorry I got off track :o) back to my review): 6. Bar areas.....very nice.....even to just check out....big screen tv indoors near main lobby...great......live music....great>>we didn't mind paying for our liquor (were from NY and bars can be pricey) BUT so people doing this (tip: drinks expensive: Get plastic cups from bar (buy a drink, keep cup) then store bears liquor in your room that you bought from airport or from shops, groceries stores (not many in the area so try to find some when your getting there or out and about otherwise you will need transportation to get to a place that has it at a good price). 7. Great location-If you stay in isla verde where a majority of the hotels are....you will have to deal with the noise of the airport...very very loud I saw reviews where for a couple of seconds you can't hear your own conversations......caribe hilton was in a perfect location....further away from airport.....only heard prop planes from small airport in the area and that was occasional. 8.Room service -yummy 9. history - this hotel has history...thats why the have so much grounds becuase they had this area for so long...most hotels don't have so much area---as you can tell by the fort on the premisses with nice views of ocean crashing on rocks...there is a view of the lagoon...there is a small beach area...very diverse...the grounds are well kept and they have a beautiful veranda area with swans...very peaceful This hotel definetly is what you make of it and your trip...If you get a nice room, happen to have great weather and go exploring...youll get the best out of this hotel... Happy travels!!!! Hasta la vista!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Day Place”
Reviews.Author: monjNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 day stay and we were very pleased!The locaction-in the daytime cannot be beat! We are Hilton Honers and were using our points for a wonderful room-inthe towers witha partial ocean view. The bed was extremely comfortable. The pool was wonderful. The beach was beautiful. The reasurants were not good! The lunch was awful-I was scared to eat it and I was very hungry. There is nothing to do at night-you have to take a cab to town.This was a great day place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, so-so service, 'cruise-shippy'”
Reviews.Author: 2fromMass
Reviews.Content: First off, I should make a disclaimer...we're not resort/cruise people; we love small boutique hotels and tend to be a bit biased against big resort properties. Still, I think we could both see the virtues and faults of the Caribe Hilton (and this was only 2 nights of a 2-week Carribean vacation). We picked it because I have oodles of Hilton points from business travel and we were attracted to the location between Old San Juan and Condado, the two areas where we were considering staying. The hotel gave us a very nice ocean-facing room with a balcony (perhaps because of my diamond status with Hilton.). The room was clean and seemed recently renovated. The beds were extremely comfortable. The A/C was way too cold, and despite changing the thermostat, it only seemed to stop cranking out cold air when we turned it all the way off. The view of the ocean, Fort San Geronimo, and over to Condado was spectacular. The hallways, on the other hand, had a fair amount of peeling paint, etc. Perhaps more renovations are on their way? The setting is beautiful... a scenic beach (on a lagoon, not the open ocean), lots of palm trees, a curvy walkway along the ocean's edge, etc. Adjacent Fort San Geronimo added a nice touch to our view. Too bad it seems to be permanently closed. Despite the beautiful location, the overall atmosphere is way to cruise-shippy for our tastes (shuffleboard, etc.). As soon as the sun came down each night, the bar (located in the open-air lobby) featured a loud lounge singer and back-up musicians whose Vegas-meets-Carribean sound echoed throughout the lobby and outdoor areas). The location--which we had predicted would be a key positive aspect--was in some ways minus. Although it's between Old San Juan and Condado, it's actually a bit far of a walk to either, requiring a $20 taxi (for about a <2 mile trip?!!) to get to most restaurants and nightlife. The sheer size of this sprawling complex--a plus for many, I'm sure, was a bit of a minus for us. It made us feel a bit detached from the rest of the city. The service was mixed. While we were waiting in the long Hilton Honors check-in line, a helpful staff member directed us to another check-in location, at the "HHonors" tower (named as an attempt to make us feel special, I suppose). The service was incredibly slow at the bars and restaurants. We ordered food service on our first night. Don't do it! Our chicken quesadilla was late, cold, flavorless, and overpriced. The executive lounge had a great view, but was packed at breakfast and the staff couldn't keep up with clearing dishes and replenishing supplies. They also cleared all of the food out immediately at 11 am (closing time), which we found particularly annoying since we had spent the last 15 minutes chasing down staff to replenish the already near-depleted supply of food as well as bowls and plates to put the food on. The concierge was very helpful in providing us info and restaurant reservations. The turndown service was also a nice extra--not something I've found at most Hiltons. We'll probably pick somewhere else when we return to San Juan, but wouldn't be totally adverse to staying at the Caribe Hilton again to save money by using Hilton points (We were not particularly interested in the other Hilton family hotels in San Juan, since they are all loacted in Isla Verde--near the airport, an area of less interest to us.). The comfortable room and beautiful setting were the main plusses. I would not plan to have any meals there, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: edmort
Reviews.Content: We spent six days here and found the property to be an all-inclusive getaway. We stayed in the Villas, which are not villas, but a new wing of the hotel. The room was great, with a nice balcany overlooking the ocean. The beach was great, good snorkling and calm, clear waters. Would reccomend this place if you really want to relax and not want to explore the island.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: upintheair-OMA
Reviews.Content: A group meeting brought us to this hotel during the third week of January. I was a bit concerned about the stay having read previous reviews which were very mixed. First the bottom line. We have a very nice stay at the hotel but the room quality is definitely a potential issue. We arrived in the early afternoon and were assigned a room in the newly renovated tower. The air conditioning did not work well and there was no way to change it (preset at the high 60's F). The toilet leaked around the base, the balcony door had no lock, and there was a strange wire protruding from the floor by the balcony door. We were given a different room and everything was fine. As noted by others the beds are wonderful. This time the air conditioning (still preset) worked fine. The flat-screen TV was a nice touch. The remainder of our stay from a room standpoint was fine but you shouldn't have this kind of issue with a "multi-star" Hilton resort and if we'd arrived later in the day our room options would have been more limited. Food at the restaurant and elsewhere in San Juan is expensive unless you stay away from the restaurants frequented by tourists. You can easily spend $50 per person without drinks. On the other hand, I did grab lunch on the run at the Subway across the street one day for around $8.00. All in all, the location is not bad (a short cab ride into old San Juan) and aside from the initial room issues, I have no complaints. But....for the price and the hotel name we shouldn't have had the problems we did. Would I stay at this hotel again? Probably not since there are many 'name brands" from which to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location/service”
Reviews.Author: Just_not_me
Reviews.Content: sharing our awesome experience.... My wife and I choose to spend two days in San Juan before our cruise. I'd say Caribe Hilton was the perfect hotel. The staff/service/amenities are just perfect. We got lucky to get a tower room (I recommend guests to request this via phone; prior to departure). In the room: - Bed was great plush top - Bathroom had amazing shower area (no tub though!) - Air conditioning was good (initially it appeared to be shabby) - Flat screen LCD TV - atleast 40" (but no HD signal :( ....) Surrounding: - Excellent private beach with water slide and a platform - Three seperate pools (they were designed to look as one!!) - Two awesome hot tubs in open - Grill restaurant/bar by the pool It was windy and raining at times.. we enjoyed the hot tub under lights when it was pouring..

Reviews.Title: “So-So Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelDoc_DC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 7 days. We were looking for a resort experience with the option to visit Old San Juan easily. While this resort had both of these, it was not special in any way. 1) The room. The room which we reserved was in the Garden Tower. This tower is 8 stories and all rooms have a vew overlooking the birdsanctuary and if you are high enough, the ocean. While the view was lovely, the room was terrible. We should have known there was a problem when we opened the door and it was mildly warped. The room was damp and mildewy. Even the carpet was damp. It seems that our door to the balcony did not seal and the island humidity had gotten the best of our room. The hotel let us switch to the newer Tower that was recently renovated. It still had a view of the ocean but everything was dry and there was no musty odor. I suspect all of the Garden rooms are mildewy and would avoid that area. 2) Restraunts. Not worth it. They are overpriced and the menus are not innovative. We wanted to eat at the resort but everytime we reviewed the menu, we were not inspired. There is so much fantastic food on the island, why waste time at a poor restraunt. 3.) Water. The beach is pleasant enough with plenty of lounge chairs. There is a spot for everyone: the tanner, the relaxer, the family, the stay in the shade. However, don't bother renting the snorkel equipment as what remains of the coral in the area is near dead. The ocean, though clear, is too murky for snorkeling and there are not many fish in that area. The best place for viewing fish on the resort is at the fish feeding pier. We had a pleasant time as it was the closest resort with a beach to Old San Juan. However, we would not visit this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Timing is all”
Reviews.Author: GailNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We were at the Caribe Hilton in the post-New Year lull and at mid-week, and couldn't have found the service more gracious and helpful and smiling, nor the hotel more pleasant. The gardens and views of the 16th-century Spanish ruins that frame the property are stunning, and the grounds, well-shaded by palms and cooled by ocean breezes, were perfect for relaxing with a book in a hammock. The spa services are a plus and most of the restaurants about what you'd expect of a hotel chain resort hotel--with the exception of Lemon Grass, a jewel of a little Latino-pan-Asian restaurant, almost hidden in a tropical garden, where we ate some of the most delicious food we've ever eaten. (I had a dream about the homemade orange-ginger-cardamom ice cream). (It's a splurge and you'll need to book ahead, but Lemon Grass is well worth it). For real San Juan and authentic Puerto Rican food, the old city is a very short cab ride away, and taxis are always available. Be sure to try the little family-run La Fonda del Jibarito on Calle Sol for delicious local specialties. My main advice would be to avoid this hotel at over-crowded times like Christmas, New Year, and spring break weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Food Poisoning”
Reviews.Author: Balt0Traveler
Reviews.Content: My family of 10 stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 2 nights before our criuse and 1 night after, which happened to be New Year's Eve. The Caribe Hilton is nice, but don't expect a sprawling resort like you get elsewhere in the Carribean. The resort itself consists of the buildings, a small garden, a nice pool and a small beach. It would probably take you only 5 minutes to take a tour of the whole place. It's surrounded by other large hotels and resorts. There's not a lot to do at the hotel due to the size. The beach is nice, but crowded, the pool was chilly and the hot tubs were jammed with kids. On our second night there my entire family ate at the buffet. They had a salad bar, taco stations, and desserts. At 4am the next morning both my brother and my neice woke up with horrible cases of food poisoning. We're not sure what they both ate, but we think it was the salad bar since my neice is a vegetarian and my brother is not. They both were completely incapacitated the next day. We alerted the hotel and they denied all responsibility. My mother had to call a doctor because they were both so ill. The doctor came to the resort and said he was stopping by numerous rooms to treat people with food poisoning. The hotel continued to deny all responsibility and made us pay the $300+ doctor bill. My mother requested a late checkout for my brother's room so we could take him straight to the cruise (we didn't want him to not have a bed and bathroom for a few hours) and the hotel gave it to him, but charged us. They even charged us for the dinner that made everyone sick! Once on the cruise we met several other groups who had the same situation at the Caribe Hilton. My neice recovered in a couple of days, but my brother was sick the entire week. All in all I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Generic, Bland, Characterless - As Far from Puerto Rico as Possible!”
Reviews.Author: utqiagvik
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Caribe Hilton is like staying in Puerto Rico while being completely insulated from the island's magical flavor or culture. The feel was that of any generic chain resort in Florida or South Padre Island Texas, except that it cost 2-3 times a much, making Florida a much better value. We stayed there six nights around New Year's, and will not repeat the experience. It was like being on a cruise ship full of pushy tourists aggressively trying to squeeze out the maximum bang from their buck (imagine hordes of people tripping frantically over each other at 8AM to bag lounge chairs at the beach/pool area ... let's dump one shoe on this chair, one on the next, a towel on the next one, a magazine on the next, the guest services directory on the next ... you get the picture). As Gold HHonors members we had access to the executive lounge, where it was like pigs at the trough ... everytime a new platter of desserts or fruit or sandwiches came out, everyone rushes in to grab what they can. The front desk, belldesk, guest services, and concierge staff were totally disorganized (concierge put us on hold indefinitely on three occasions), harried-looking, and not too friendly (the last being totally uncharacteristic of the island). In fact, the local staff seemed to have had their Puerto Rican charm completely beat out of them, as if they were told to be as generic and robotic and culture-free as possible (like to give the impression of "this is just like Omaha, honey!"). The food at the restaurants was also completely generic, with precious little island flavor, and all the so-called "local" dishes we tried were completely watered-down versions (to quote Barbara Ehrenreich, like "your regular Ohio cuisine with a tropical twist.") We ended up "escaping" into the city at regular intervals in order to avoid getting completely disheartened by how far this property is from everything that Puerto Rico represents (and also to meet some real locals and eat some real food). I think any of the hotels in the Condado or Old San Juan area would be much better bases for a tropical vacation with more Puerto Rican flavor ... the Caribe Hilton is as removed from the island as a cruise ship would be. Never again. Granted, the beach and pool area are nice, but one can get better beaches and better pools with far less crowds and at a fraction of the price in Florida. If one wants to go all the way to Puerto Rico, shutting oneself away in this generic, could-be-anywhere resort is a big mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: suznf
Reviews.Content: We (Mom, Dad & Sons 18, 20) spent 2 nights precruise at the Caribe Hilton, arriving by Taxi from SJU at about 11:00 am on Wednesday December 21, 2006. The hotel is not really within walking distance of anything except a park and a few storefronts. Cabs are readily available. The port was a 5 minute cabride. After identifing ourselves as HHonor Club members, we were moved to the Hhonors Club counter and checked in. They had us reserved for 2 rooms w/inside views (aka construction site) and two double beds. I asked if they could give us 1 room with a King. (The rooms were booked through a bidding website for cheap!) They agreed. Although our king room wouldn't be ready for at least 4 more hours, when it was- we had a beautiful view of the ocean and a nice balcony in the Towers. The room for the boys was ready immediately so we stored our luggage and headed for the pool. Our room was on the same floor as the boys but not next to them. The rooms were beautifully appointed, the beds extremely comfortable. They were still doing construction on our floor but it was quiet in the evenings and never inconvienced us. The rooms had safes in them which were in excellent condition and worked easily without any problem. As this was the home of the Pina Colada, we went to the pool bar and ordered some, Over a light (but not inexpensive) lunch of Pina Colladas & appetizers we watched an iguana climb a tree and listened to the surf break. Later the kids toured the grounds and my eldest son apparently lost a fight with a hammock. The prices of the food on the property were pretty high: a Cuban Sandwich was $14. However next door to the property is a little food joint that sells them for $4. There is also a small liquor store for water & soda as well as a Subway Sandwich franchise 1 block away with employees w/great personalities! It is actually closer to the towers then the restaurant! The Starbucks inside the hotel was excellent. Conceirge & Bellman services were superb. In fact, the bellman that welcomed us when we arrived always greeted me by name throughout our stay! The Hhonors concierge was both pleasant and helpful, as were the servicce techs that retrieved my son's cell phone when he dropped it off our balcony onto the roof 4 stories below. The lobby was open and housed a loud cockatoo and green amazon parrot with a cute vocabulary. Plenty of pool toys and lounge chairs. Some good live music too! Giving that we got such good deals on the rooms, we felt we recieved excellent value for our money. The only incident that prevents me from giving this hotel an excellent rating was on our last evening in the main bar area where they have a limited menu. A group of 8 of us ordered a round of drinks and dinner at about 11:00 (just returned from the Biobay tour in Fajardo). The waiter disappeared and didn't return for 1 1/4 hours!!! We tried to order more drinks...tried to talk to other waiters. They wouldnt talk to us. Or find our waiter. In fact everyone in our area had empty glasses and no service. One gal was out and out rude. We went up to the bar to get our drinks and the bartender was very nice, but didn't know what happened to our waiter. Finally my son went over and talked to the manager who then delivered us our drinks. Our waiter finally showed back up with food for the entire section. Seems he went to the restaurant to place everyones order at once and stayed there til all the food (and his break I am assuming) was finished. By the time we got them, they were cold. The manager comped us the last round of drinks. As we were finishing they turned the house lights on. Honestly, that was our biggest gripe. Otherwise the hotel was outstanding and I would return again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but very crowded”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerCO
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for one night, before our return home. We had originally booked the room for our first night in Puerto Rico, but our flight from the US was delayed. We were told by Expedia that our booking was non transferrable/refundable, but the hotel was understanding of our situation, which was out of our hands, and agreed to change our booking at no cost to us. What a relief! The hotel was nice, but very crowded. We waited quite a while to check in, only to find out that our room was not ready as promised. We were upgraded to a villa, which was lovely. Our villa neighbors were very noisy. Upon our complaint to the front desk, someone was sent to calm them down immediately and we had no further problems. I would probably look for a smaller, less crowded hotel the next time I am in San Juan, but the Hilton is lovely if you don't mind a crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property-but don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: missbigcee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my boyfriend Dec 12th- Dec 16th. He was there for a conference so I sent alot of time by myself on the property. First, the pros. The property is beautiful, well kept. The housekeeping was excellent. I spent time at the pool, worked out at the gym and had no complaints in those areas. The service at the pool was friendly and efficient. Now to the cons, on the night we arrived we ordered room service, we needed to call room service not twice, not three times but FOUR times to pick up our tray. It sat outside of our room for 24 hours. We went to the Pan Asian restaurant for dinner the second night and were charged $9 PER GLASS for Pellegrino sparkling water. I live in NYC and dine at fine restaurants all the time. I thought that was a little on the ridiculous side. The last morning we were there, we had breakfast at the main restaurant and our eggs and oatmeal took 30 mintues to come out and when my eggs came out they were not made correctly. Stay in the hotel, but don't eat there is the moral here.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Wallet”
Reviews.Author: RugerMan
Reviews.Content: After our stay on December 23 to 24, 2006, we procceeded to pay the Parking fee at the Parking cashier's booth, just after paying, I got "pick pocketed". I did not feel the move but later realized that it was a group job. A person with a very small cute dog distracted my family asking them to pet it as I payed. Some more distraction by a person in line right behind me, and woosh! my wallet disappered. On my way to the airport, calling the parking attendant booth did not provide any help, they refered me to hotel security, again, no help. They informed me that they have no cameras coveryng the parking booth area (?). Did not collect any info from me. -Local Police? Forget it! they're not even interested! I am still calling every day to ask if my wallet has been found. But with such an enthusiasm on their part, it seems I'm out of luck. --Never let your guard down.

Reviews.Title: “Looks aren't everything”
Reviews.Author: midgetmama
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 12/19 and paid $65 on Priceline. I've been told there's absolutely no chance of upgrades when booking on Priceline and that I would be given the worst quality room. Luckily that wasn't true, and when I arrived I was given a room in the Condado Lagoon Villas. I was traveling with my mother, and she was shocked at how nice the room was after my repeated warnings that this may not be the greatest place due to what I paid for it. The room was large, we had a great view of the lagoon, and she took numerous pictures of the bathroom because she wants to model her own after it. The grounds are beautiful, and there is plenty to do on-site. The restaurants all sound and smell good but are a little pricey. Some menus don't have prices, the Italian restaurant averaged about $30-$40 for an entree, and Madrid-San Juan seemed the most reasonable, but of course it is a tapas place so most likely has small portions. We were very tired and didn't feel like getting ready to go out for dinner, so we ordered room service. I had the house salad, she had the Caesar, and we shared a margherita pizza. The house salad did not have croutons as described on the menu (I eat salad for the dressing and croutons, not the healthy stuff), and the croutons on the Caesar were tasteless and mushy. Other than that, the salads were very good. For some reason the pizza smelled like donuts, but it tasted like pizza and was surprisingly tasty. I also got the guava cheesecake which was fantastic. None of these things seemed too expensive on the menu, but after taxes and the automatic 15% gratuity, the total came to $56.39 which seemed a lot for what we got. But whatever. The main problems I had were in the bathroom. I turned one of the sinks on and left it running for a minute while I went to get some soap I had left by the bed. When I returned, the floor was covered in water due to leaky pipes. When I wiped it up with a towel, the towel ended up covered in brown dirt. I started checking other parts of the bathroom, and it seemed it was rarely cleaned. Also, throughout the room, there were black marks all over the floor and walls. It looked like crayons or scuff marks. Finally, there was a digital scale in the bathroom that didn't work! Now I certainly don't expect or care if there's a scale in my room, but what is the point of putting one in if it doesn't function?! Overall, the hotel, including the room I was in, was very beautiful, and the staff was all friendly and pleasant (contrary to what I expected from some of the reviews I've read), but they really ought to work a little harder on keeping the place clean and maintained. I've stayed in a lot of hotels, and cleanliness has never been an issue for me, so that part was disappointing. However, I would stay there again, especially at $65 a night!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay At The Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Dave148
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a great six night stay at the Caribe. Check-in was painless. We received a free upgrade. The room was nice and clean with a great view. Self parking at the garage across the street was easy. We only ate breakfast at the hotel. As previously noted in other reviews, it's pricey but expected. The food quality was great. The hotel is a five minute drive to Old San Juan. Eric, the day Concierge is a great resource. The pools and beach were great. The exercise room at the spa was nice. Overall, a great visit. We'd definitley consider the Caribe for a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time!”
Reviews.Author: melihall
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time at this hotel! I have to admit I was leary after reading some of the other reviews on this site but went ahead with my plans! I am NOT sorry! The staff was super friendly and accomodating. Our room was clean and had a great view. You can walk right out the back door of the hotel and find the pool, the ocean, the bar..etc. I would highly recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, cannot say enough good about it”
Reviews.Author: karena1
Reviews.Content: Got to the Caribe Hilton about 5 to check in. I cannot say enough about this property and how they treated us. Understand - I don't demand "5 star" hotels, but this place was so beautiful and the staff was so nice and friendly. Here are the highlights: 1. Since it was my birthday, they upgraded us to Rm 1558 in the tower. Newly remodeled with a view that was gorgeous overlooking the water and the Condado district. Corner room which was really nice. Had a huge marble shower with the "rain" shower heads. Beds so comfy you thought you died and went to heaven. 2. My husband had called the hotel and asked to have a rose in the room for me for my birtday. They told him "that is part of our service, and we will be happy to do that at no cost to you". So a rose was waiting for me with a beautiful note from the wonderful hubby telling me to have the time of my life. 3. That evening, the staff brought up a small cupcake size birthday cake for me with "Happy Birthday" written on the plate. Very thoughtful. 4. Hotel was beautiful, unbelievable clean, beach was wonderful. They were constantly cleaning. I honestly cannot say one bad thing about the hotel. I thought it was the best hotel I had ever been in. Food was good (expensive - but you expect that). We for the most part just vegged on the beach. Weather was fantastic, around 85-87 each day, just a couple little sprinkles once or twice. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the hilton was nice”
Reviews.Author: yasmarie98
Reviews.Content: We got a nice stay, with friendly staff, very welcoming. Everything went smooth. But be awear if you are staying in the "deluxe" rooms, they are awayyyy old! Stains in the carpet, shower, doors, mirrors etc. Cracks in the floor, and the door of the balcony was hard to close because the knob was loose. The mini bar was empty and all damaged. The pool complex is nice, with a big pool and a bar area, plenty of chairs. There is an other pool, with a kiddy part and a jacuzzi at the villige area. Also a garden with many ducks and swams, kids will love it. They got a little private beach with hammocks, chairs and you can rent some water sport machinery. The "fishing dock" is close, there is a construction going there. We got the buffet breakfast once, I think is a bit over priced, 20 dollars per person, and I saw mosquitoes in the fruits! The presentation was not very good, where everything looks like been there for hours, not fresh. Overall I was please with the stay because I pay 130 a night for a garden view room with balcony(andIcould see garden and sea from there), and the purpose of my stay was to have a time off work with friends. So if you book here thinking of a luxury hotel, this is not! At least the delux rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smilin_Bob
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 separate nights stay at this hotel. A pre and post cruise stay. We hit these rooms on priceline for a great rate. We were treated as well as anybody there. A smile given gets a smile in return. We asked for a nonsmoking room with a king bed and an ocean view . Wow. very nice. The grounds here are the real treat . a private beach, fantasic pool , a very friendly staff. Take some time and explore the grounds and you will be surprised. This is a very pretty resort. I love the lobby. Our second night we were given a room in the newer Villas. a very nice room. We like the Starbucks. We ate a local restaurant on the reccomendation of the concierge. We walked the short distance accross the bridge to the Conando area. The warm nights were a welcome treat. I would stay at this hotel again and again. We loved every minute of our stay. Our thanks to the Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jkloni
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night post cruise. Main building 3rd floor. Room 318. I thought the room was just fine. Not a great view because we overlooked the roof of the main reservation area, but we were here only one night. The bed was extremely comfortable, the shower had plenty of hot water and water pressure. I did not have any type of smell in my room. The hallway smelled a tad musty, but it has to be because of all the moisture being right on the water. The pool, swim up bar and view of the ocean are just incredible. The pool area was not as clean as I would have expected from a Hilton property, but not disgusting. I don't know why people think it's ok to come from the beach into the pool to wash their feet. We smelled no odors while outside by the pool. (We had read and heard of this before. In fact, my husband was here last year and there was a very bad smell at that time out by the pool. We had drinks and ate burgers and appetizers at the swim up bar. the 8oz bacon cheeseburger with fries for $11 was very good. I thought $7 for a Corona and $3 for fountain cola was a bit pricey. We did not eat at the hotel. We went to Haceinda Don Jose for some great Mexican/Puerto Rican food instead. I liked the hotel enough that I would stay here again. Our main building room was fine, but my understanding is the Villa rooms are much nicer. We met a couple who were 1/2 thru a 2 week vacation that were initially in the Villa section but switched to the main building to be closer to everything. She said it took 15 minutes to walk from their Villa room to the main area of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: SineadG
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay in the Caribe Hilton, Stayed one night before a cruise and two nights after. On arrival it looked fantastic. Very inpressive. The reception area is huge and there is a fabulous view out to the sea. We booked a Dble Dble Deluxe ocean view room as there was 3 of us. We got our ocean view on both check ins, in different parts of the hotel, both rooms were more or less the same, I did expect better for a "Hilton" the walls looked as if the paper was peeling off in some areas and the carpet did look old, the bathroom was lovely and clean and the beds were very comfy. We were just a little dissapointed with the rooms, but for the amt of time you spend in your room... the gounds well made up for it. Pools and beach absolutely beautiful, looks exactly like the picture on their web site. We ate in Mortons Steakhouse which is on the premises, the meal was delicious. The steaks are hugh, well worth trying, but a little expensive. The price list is outside so you know what to expect before you go in. The staff were all lovely from reception to bell boys to pool tenders. No complaints there. Overall we had a great time in the Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Private Beach and Grounds, Bad Food, Fair Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PacificHeights7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 3-nights in February of this year prior to our cruise of the Panama Canal. Puerto Rico is not one of my favorite Caribbean destinations. At best, the locals tolerate the tourists. But, the Caribe Hilton is a very nice property. It has a beautiful little private beach, a scenic promenade that runs right next to the ocean, a nice pool area, a good gym, and good tennis courts with pros on staff for lessons. I took a tennis lesson while I was there. The pro was American, friendly, helpful, and a good tennis player. The property offers hotel rooms and villas. We had a hotel room. The room was okay, but there was evidence of deferred maintenance everywhere. There was a musky smell in the room. There are GIANT signs in the hallways asking the maids not to scream and talk loudly. The restaurants were very disappointing. We did not have one good meal there. The service was not good either. We took advantage of the little convenience store right across the street. We walked to El Morro and Old Town. You walk out of the property and turn right. The views of the ocean were magnificent. There were homeless people sleeping in old cars across the street. Old Town is very run down and in need of much repair. Half of the shops are empty. There is a new casino in Old Town that caters to the cruise ship crowd. In summery, the grounds of the Caribe Hilton are fantastic. They are private and that is very important in crime-ridden Puerto Rico. The rooms and service were both fair, and the food is not good. If I were ever to go back to Puerto Rico, I think I would search for a resort away from town and stay away from the ultra sleezy Condado area.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Californium
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you that my wife and I are from San Francisco, CA and this was our first time to Puerto Rico. Being the control freak that I am I researched multiple web sites reading all the reviews on Puerto Rico Hotels, ranging from 3 star to the highest priced hotels. Interestingly, I found no hotel that had a perfect score- there's always going to be some that have a problem with something. We were constrained to being close to the cruise ship, so I focused on the San Juan area. I saw lots of complaints about the Caribe, but enough good reviews to take a chance- that balanced with some of the photos people posted and the going prices at the time made it the optimal value/price ratio. We did opt for the ocean view and we did have a wonderful view of the bay. However, you could see the rooftop of the 1st floor structure and it had some noisy a/c equipment. We were on the upper level so it wasn't so bad and you couldn't hear it at all if the window was closed. The room did smell a bit moldy when we first came in - like the a/c filter hadn't been cleaned in a long time. But it went away after keeping it on for awhile and opening the window. The room was otherwise nice and clean, and the mattresses extremely comfortable- slept VERY well. But you shouldn't stay in your room- the Caribe has some wonderful facilities. The pool area is fantastic, with multiple levels. There is a pool bar that is interesting, but the drinks were so-so and a bit overpriced. The Caribe also has their own private bay and beach which is fantastic. My favorite part was all the hammocks under the palm trees- I took a nap there. That was heaven. Also a nice promenade that is right on the ocean. For eating, we tried the Spanish restaurant on the premises. I thought the food was quite good, but don't order cocktails- opt instead for a good Spanish wine as they don't do cocktails very well. The breakfast buffet is also very good and I liked the exotic fruit juices they had. Eat outside on the patio and watch the geckos go by- inside was a bit too cold for us. I wish we had tried the other restaurants, but ended up eating at Ramiros, which was highly rated but we found disappointing (except for the wine). Seems like a lot of people have problems with the service. We had none. In fact, I found the staff was very helpful and courteous and always available to answer questions. We also used the on-site tour shop to go to the rain forest. It was well run and we had a good time. However, we were at the Caribe in August which is off season. My feeling is that when the East Coast crowd shows up it takes on a different character. I can see if that place is packed with families how it could take on a more stressful atmosphere. I will stay here again if I come back to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Money Was Stolen and Management Did Not Care”
Reviews.Author: PKGii
Reviews.Content: While staying at the hotel money was stolen from wallets hidden in drawers, and pockets of clothing. The management was very patronizing, and basically said that since the money wasn't in the safe they weren't responsible. The Security Dept. did a check and found that two employees had entered the room during the time we were gone but we were informed that since they did not know which employee may have taken the money and since we had left it "unattended" there was nothing they could do. They would just "watch" the employees in the future. It is important to note that a limited amount of money was taken from two wallets - leaving us to believe that the employees take smaller amounts so hotel guests won't notice the missing funds. The only reason we noticed is because one of the wallets was dropped on the floor. Don't go to this hotel - it is not safe!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was robbed!”
Reviews.Author: UnnamedTraveler
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were celebrating our 50th birthdays, and stayed at the Caribe prior to our cruise. We went down to the pool for two hours and when we returned, found one of our wallets on the floor. Upon investigation, we discovered that we were robbed of approximately $300 in cash--from my friend's wallet hidden in a phone book in a table, my wallet in my purse, my pants pocket, and the small change and bills we had lying on the table. Hotel security conducted an investigation, including a door key computer printout, and said they would send the results. We had to BEG the manager to come up and give us new room keys and told him we did not want anyone to enter our room for the remainder of our stay. After waiting almost two months to hear from anyone at the hotel, I finally wrote to hilton and my letter was forwarded to the hotel. I received a letter from the assistant manager of security basically telling me too bad, so sad, we're not responsible. Oh, and that their employees are all monitored and have a security background check. Oh, and if I want to come back, they'll give me a room upgrade or a free dinner. A free dinner would have been nice after the theft occurred, but nothing was offered at the time. Because a couple of people entered our room while we were at the pool, they cannot pinpoint the thief, and therefore, no one is held accountable. So, if you don't mind an employee rummaging through your clothes and taking what they please, by all means stay at this hotel. I am a diamond member of Hilton, and a travel agent, and this is the first time in over 30 years of travel that my room has been robbed. My theory is that they are taking a little bit from each room and the guests aren't noticing. We only knew because they dropped one of the wallets on the floor. Lesson learned -- if this happens again, I will call the local police immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced with Sub-Par Service”
Reviews.Author: yoshiposhi_pie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Caribe Hilton for our destination wedding and while the catering department and our wedding planner did an excellent job with the actual wedding ceremony and reception, our stay and the stay of our guests at the hotel was not as pleasant. Indeed, many of us were surprisingly disappointed that a hotel bearing the Hilton name was such a let down. It was only after our stay did we learn that Hilton does not operate all of its hotels and some, including the Caribe Hilton, are run by other entities who are permitted to use the Hilton name. First, with respect to the quality of the rooms, you would expect more for what you are paying to stay here. A lot of the rooms were damp, with the sheets and walls feeling wet. There was also an odor- probably related to the dampness. Another issue was with the indifferent hotel staff, from the front desk to management. We had an incident with one of our guests' ring being stolen from their room, and after getting the runaraound, we were left with an uncooperative security personnel whose attitude was pretty much "oh well- too bad." One of the biggest peeves was at check out. If you choose to stay here, be sure to get in writing what you will be charged up front. We never had the situation before our stay here where, on top of our regular room rate, there was such a siginifcant amount of additional daily fees tacked on on top of the regular taxes and fees you would normally expect. for example, the Caribe Hilton tacks on a hefty fee for transporting luggage to your room, EVEN IF YOU CARRIED YOUR OWN BAGS TO YOUR ROOM. They also charge a daily cleaning fee, a daily resort fee, and automatically add a "donation" to a charity you never heard of. Going over the final bill was quite a frustrating experience realizing that after having tipped all the hotel staff for their various services throughout the stay, we were being charged on top of that for their services which any normal person would assume is included in the rate (i.e. maid service, a resort fee for hanging out at the pool, having your bags brought up). We will never stay here again, and would NEVER recommend this place to anybody. We have stayed at luxury resorts and budget inns, and the Caribe Hilton is by far the worst experience we have ever had out of all the places we have stayed at. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good.”
Reviews.Author: DukeNC
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with most posters here that the rooms and service at Caribe Hilton are very lacking. I was here on business staying at the Caribe for a second time. It was no better than the first go around. The rooms are really bad. I don't know how else to say it. My boss made the reservations and she is a Diamond Member. We still didn't get into the Executive Tower - "we are all full" - they told us. It's August - give me a break. So, we marched off to our rooms and the front desk clerk comes running after me. Trouble with the room key - I will be right back. It's midnight. She comes back and I just asked her straight out - someone was in that room, right? Yup. Had to move you to another floor. The rooms are just old. Everything needs updating. The bathrooms are very old. Breakfast - check it out. The fruit on the breakfast bar had mold on it. We usually just stick to the executive lounge, but we were meeting people that morning and we all went downstairs. Just okay. Location is great for me, but I just cannot abide by these rooms. Come on Hilton - $239 plus that resort fee in low season and you can't get some money to update the rooms? I think I will go back to the Ritz where our corporate rate is and put up with their bad service. At least the rooms are better.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: jayded1
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at the Caribe while attending a conference. Check in was at about 5pm and took a total of 3 minutes, however the bellstaff were not "eager" so I walked my own bags to my room. I was in the villas on the second floor, the room was of fair size with a full kitchen and great balcony. The room was fresh and recently renovated, while there were plates, sliverware and glasses no cooking utensils or pans /pots were to be found (or soap for the dishwasher)! All in all the room was great. The Caribe has a few chioces for dining and I tried most of them, Mortons Steakhouse ($$$$) was by far the best with a close second being the Palmeras ($$) they have different nightly buffets and the roasting night was great (makes me think I should have tried the Puerto Rican night as well). During the afternoons or all day on the weekend the main pool bar is a buzz of people but I was very impressed with the bar staff as even as they were outnumbered 100 to 1 the levels of service were superb and as a man I didn't have on a two piece bikini but after brief wait the bartender came over introduced himself and asked my name then made the best pina colada EVER for me twice! The hotel needs to have this guy train all their staff. The beach and pool area are great, to get a hammock during prime time you need to move fast but the best time I had was after dinner about 10:30PM and walking out the pier thingy past the hammocks and looking at the fish that are attracted to the bring lights...they were huge and I was wishing for my speargun but alas its a no fishing or swimming zone just feeding which the hotel does daily as an attraction. Overall I would happily return to the Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Surely you can find somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: elastopathy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an "executive-level" room in the newer "tower" and the room itself was not bad and had a nice view. The executive level lounge had a good seleciton of snacks and drinks throughout the day. The grounds itself are generally pretty and include a tropical garden with a pond with swans, a private beach, two pools, and several restaurants and shops. So much for the good parts. Unfortunately, there were negative aspects that significantly cut into enjoying a vacation here, and they all revolve around terrible service and overcharging. For these reasons, I would advise you to stay elsewhere. We requested a nonsmoking room with two beds and confirmed it twice. Instead, we received a room that smelled of stale smoke, was on a floor with no "non-smoking" signs, and had just a single (king-size) bed. I was hesitant to request a room change, because from my experience, there can be a punative component and the replacement room is quite often worse. The service is poor. The valets and bellmen don't come out to greet you when you drive up, and the valet service takes a very long time to retrieve your car. The concierge is curt and answers most questions with a pre-printed sheet of paper. The driving directions that they handed out actually had an error. The paper handed to me a checkin listed the incorrect location for the breakfast area and executive lounge. Internet service is $15/day, but even if you want to pay, it doesn't work. The number to call for help connects to a support person in Warsaw, Poland (really). The phone in our room stopped working one day. Our room key cards expired and had to be reprogrammed at least once and sometimes twice per day. The final insult is the over-charging. In addition to a 9% tax, be prepared to find a 10% "resort fee" and a $1/day donation to an orphanage on your bill. They told me the "resort fee" was required by Puerto Rico law (yeah, right) and they would remove the orphanage donation but their computer was not working and told me to call back when I returned home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jms238
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The open-air lobby is very nice. Our room (in the main building) was very large and had a beautiful view of the ocean and the pool. The renovation of the hotel has made the whole property very nice. The pool was nice and the hammocks were relaxing. The grounds are very nice. For those who are disillusioned with the price of extras, welcome to resort hotels! You have to know that going in. The Caribe Hilton is a nice jumping off point for Condado or Old San Juan. Public transportation is close and cheap for those who don't want to take a cab, or you can walk if you're up to it. If there are cons, it is that the room has practically no electrical outlets and that the check-in process was the longest I have ever seen. However, don't hesitate to stay here. It's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: Remona
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. From the minute I stepped out of my transportation into the open air lobby. The music from the Oasis lounge was playing a welcoming beat as an energy of relaxation filled the night. My room was in the tower on the 20th floor overlooking the ocean. The room was clean and had a wonderful bathroom. Full walk in with both a rain shower head as well as a shower massage. The bed was extremely comfortable with pillows to match. AC worked well. Tower room. The Oasis lounge was a great way to unwind at the end of a long day of business. The grounds are beautiful and relaxing. I work for a national retail company and am very tuned in to customer service. I've stayed at El Caribe Hilton on several occasions both during remodel and after. I've never had an issue with service or staff. Everyone was friendly including other travelers. I deal with people daily and on varied levels. In my opinion, people that have poor experiences more than likely have poor attitudes. Being in the service industry, I see it frequently. For all practical purposes, people that rated their stay perhaps had a bad stay because of their own false expectations. Let's face it, if you show up in a foreign or local national country, of course things will be different. As for the taxes, that's the way it is in Puerto Rico across the board. It's not just this way at the Hilton. If anything, be careful when putting gas in your car. Gas stations are known for stopping the gas flow but not stopping the ticker on the gas meter. As for the Hilton...let your hair down, pay to stay and enjoy all that it offers. I'm not a lounge or party type however the music was so contagious that I went to the bar every night and met the most wonderful people. Staff included!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: youthtrips
Reviews.Content: We recently took a group of 30 people to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Hilton Caribe for our last two nights on the island. The booking process went smoothly, but the morning of check in is when the bad customer service began. From the moment I called to confirm our check- in, to the moment we left, none of our group had good reports for their workers. Most were just unhelpful and some were just snide. I did have a run in with a pleasant clerk,one helpful valet guy, and the consierge that was more than willing to help me, but as for the rest of the time we felt as if they were doing us a favor by letting us stay there. I would hope that when you pay any amount of money for a service, you would be treated like you are paying for a service instead of feeling like an unwanted house guest that's in for the weekend. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and very convenient. The only comment on the food is to be prepared to spend more than you bargained for because EVERYTHING is an extra cost. Even the "complementary" water that most hotels (even cheap ones) give to you in the room had a hidden cost of $7.00. I personally don't like to feel as though I'm being tricked into spending my money; if I'm prepared or I feel as though I'm getting something for my money then I have no problem handing it over. All in all I'd rather pay a lot more money for a hotel that pretends to like their guests then save a couple dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arounddeworld
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one week vacation in P.R. We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 2 nights. Our experience upon arrival echoed some of the previous reviews regarding the check-in process. We were given a room in the executive tower, only to find a large hole in the ceiling, above the shower. After complaining (nicely) we were given an upgrade to the villas. Unfortunately we encountered many who were dissatisfied with their rooms. Our room was clean with a great view. The hotel was relatively close to the Condado area (15-20min walk) although there was a mini-mart across the street. We were told the walk to OSJ was only 15 minutes, in reality it was more like 50min-1 hour and we are all in great shape. The gym had decent equipment and the restaurant food was good. Overall we (2 adults-2 teens) felt it was a nice property and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: ugafan33
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at least three or four times each time thinking with some of the great reviews from many places that I would give them the benefit of the doubt. That maybe they were just busy. But after the last stay I must say it cannot just be that they are busy. The service is horrible to say the least.The wait even if you are a platinum memeber is horrendous the check in takes at least 25 minutes. The rooms are aweful .If you book with any sort of discount i.e. AAA or anything else be prepared for a view of the top of an A/C unit. Everytime I have stayed here business or pleasure the room is aweful. We went for business and my boss actually got stuck in a room with a murphy bed ( folds into the wall) and they charged 290.00 a night for this again with a viiew of roof of builiding with A/C unit The only thing nice I can say about this hotel is it has a nice pool and the Steakhouse is very good. But unless you plan on sleeping at the pool which might not be a bad idea,because the view is excellent, I would not stay here. I am going back for business in August and will not stay here again. I think four strikes and you are definitley out!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing and Enjoyable!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaie
Reviews.Content: Wow! We booked this hotel as part of our travel package through our travel agent. When reading some of the reviews here (before traveling) I was VERY worried! However, the Caribe Hilton rooms, staff, facilities and offerings were all very accommodating for us! We arrived in SJ early (10 a.m.). We were allowed to register at the front desk, change our clothes in changing rooms, explore the hotel grounds, and have a very delicious lunch. When we checked back our room was ready. I must admit I was disappointed that our "OceanVIEW" room was not oceanFRONT!! It's hard to describe but from our balcony we could see the ocean but just below our balcony was the ROOF of a smaller hotel building so we had to try to block out that cement eyesore and look way over it to see the beach. I returned to the front desk to ask for a room with a better view and was told NONE of the rooms is truly oceanFRONT and that they were full and therefore unable to move us to another room. I was not happy about that but must admit the rest of the stay (ignoring the obstructed view) was great! For the reviewer who said they didn't change the towels... there was some notice that stated in an effort to conserve energy the hotel gives the guests the option to have their towels changed daily or not. If you wanted them changed you were to take the used towels off the racks. If I had not read that bit of info I too would have been upset to return to the room & to the "same old towels"! But a quick call to housekeeping would have resolved that. We enjoyed the pool, the beach, the restaurants, the fitness room, AND had delicious pizza from ROOM Service (can u believe that?) We also took advantage of the tours available in the lobby ~ opting for a day at the rainforest. Our travel agent put together a pretty comprehensive package so we weren't hit with any surpise fees or taxes... Oh! and by the way, we took taxis from the hotel to Old San Juan a couple of times including the day we were leaving. So, once again, after checking out the bellhops held our luggage while we ran into Old SJ for a museum tour and some final shopping. All-in-all, the Caribe Hilton was beautiful and fun and the staff was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: DPDALLAS
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the best frozen drinks but then goes down hill from there. The carpets in the hallways are stained with large bleach spots. The walls in the rooms have flaking paint and water stains. The sheets are stained. The pool is open for local kids to come and go as they please, which gives little room for the hotel guest to use the pool. On the weekend the sounds of kids playing in the pools makes it impossible for the guest to get any relaxation. The staff at the front desk did not seem to know how to operate the terminals and we spent 30 min waiting in line to check in. They charged us for the Breakfast which was included in the room rate and it took 3 trips to the front desk to get them to fix the errors. 2 stars at the most

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Originally I had planned to stay at the Ritz, but a friend of mine that lives in San Juan recommended the Hiltonâ€¦BIG MISTAKE. I was going there with my wife for our 5 year wedding anniversary. My friend recommended that we stay in the Villas, but request a room on the ocean side as a new building was being built on the other side and the construction started at 4:30 a.m. I called and made the reservation 2 weeks in advance of our stay and requested the Ocean side. The day before our arrival, I sent an email to confirm. I received an email back that yes, we would receive a room, high up and on the ocean side. Also stated that we could have an early check in. We arrived at around 1:00 p.m. I was told that our high-up, ocean view room wasnâ€™t available, but that it would be ready within 1 hour. We had taken the red eye flight from Phoenix on Jet Blue and had been up for a total of 18 hours straight. Knowing that we were going to get a great room, I didnâ€™t have a problem waiting the 1 hour, so we had lunch at the hotel. At 2:30 pm I was told another 30 minutes, so we simply hung out in the lobby. At 3, told another 30 minutes. This went on for about another hour. At 4 pm we decided to take a taxi around the island. At 6 pm we came back and were given our room keys â€“ the room was on the 1st floor, with a view of a wall, over on the construction side. I went to complain and was told that they would move us to another room. I had also asked for a room with a kitchen â€“ was told that the new room had one. The new room we were given was also on the construction side and had no kitchen. I was told that the following day that they would move us to a better location. The room we were given was dirty and the curtains didnâ€™t close all the way, so in the morning, it was very hard to sleep with the loud construction noise and the sunlight coming into the room. The next day, I was told that they didnâ€™t have another room and that we would be stuck in this room. The room that they claimed had a kitchen, only had a mini refrigerator and a coffee maker â€“ I donâ€™t call this a kitchen. Our room keys stopped working 3 separate times and each time, the rude staff made us feel that it was our fault or that we were too stupid to know how to unlock the door. Funny thing is that from checking reviews online, others had the same experience. The pool was extremely dirty and hotel staff was pretty much all rude. Having a problem with paying around $300 per night for such a dump, we tried to check out. However we were told that since we didnâ€™t give 24 hours notice, we would have to pay another $200. I decided to just stick it out a few more nights â€“ things went downhill even more from here â€“ no clean towels, more rude service, AC stopped working â€“ finally on the last night of our stay in San Juan, we checked out and went to the Embassy Suites â€“ what a difference and the rooms here were only $175 per night â€“ people were extremely friendly. One last comment about the Hilton â€“ be careful of all the extra charges. When I booked over the phone, I was told that the room rate was $285 per night and 9% tax. However when checking out, I see that they also added a 10% resort fee. When I asked what this was for, I was told that it was for the upkeep of the pool, as well as for housekeeping and the bellboy service. This was always part of the hotel fee in the past. This hotel also charges $15 per day for internet access and around $8 for the 1st minute to call the States. They also force you to make a donation to â€œhomeless childrenâ€� for each day that you stay â€“ automatically appears on your bill at the time of check out. AVOID THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good things about the hotel: 1. They have the best pina coladas I have ever tasted. 2. Hotel is located on a private beach 3. Lemon Grass restaurant is top notch. Bad things about the hotel: 1. RUDE staff 2. Â½ the rooms havenâ€™t been updated. This is why you have some people liking the place and other not liking it. Problem is that you can request a remodeled room, but you will never know until you arrive what you will have. 3. They are building a high-rise building next to the hotel, and construction goes from Mon-Sat and starts at 5 am. Very hard to sleep. 4. Room keys stopped working 5 times. We stayed in the Villas so had to walk to the other side of the hotel to get new keys. This isnâ€™t much fun when you are coming back at 2-3 am. Finally on last day of our trip, the lock was replaced on our room. Staff never apologized for this. 5. They â€œnickel and dimeâ€� you at this hotel -- $14.95 for internet access per day when other hotels include this for free. $35 dollars for a 18 minute call to the US. 10% â€œresort feeâ€� for daily newspaper â€“ which we never received, access to the beach and pool and for upkeep of the hotel. 6. Pool is EXTREMELY dirty and in need of repairs. 7. They let anyone into the pool â€“ on a few times we did visit it, there were a number of locals using it. 8. Walls are paper thin. The room net to us had two adults and 7 children. Could hear them yelling and playing all day and night. When I complained, I was told that the couple runs a â€œbabysitting serviceâ€� from the room and that she has rented it for 3 months so far and is a good â€œcustomerâ€�. I could go on, but I think you get the point â€“ DONâ€™T STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: yoshapman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton in May-June 2005 for 7 nights, and it was amazing. It was our belated honeymoon, so we wanted everything to be perfect. I had luckilly signed up for a promotion a month before i went where I became a Hilton Gold member. We payed in advance on expedia for $100 a night (I dont understand why it is now $170 a night, but thats just me). The first thing I did when we got there was tell them it was our honeymoon and that I was a goldmember, and they upgraded us to an amazing oceanview room with a balcony. The view of the ocean was amazing. The room was well kept, with everything being refilled nightly. They also gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate strawberries (though I did have to remind them twice before they brought it up, but hey free is free). We frequented the Starbucks a lot, didnt eat a any of the other restaurants, but they looked nice. The bar was ok, although I ordered the same drink each night and it somehow came out differently each time, sometimes good and sometimes bad. The pools were amazing, overlooking the ocean. They had a gameroom which was small but nice to have. The location was ok - we actually walked to Old San Juan, took about 25 minutes each way, on the way back we tried to get a cab but none passed, and it was quite hot. It was also a 15 minute walk to the Wyndham hotel with a casino, and the birdge which we needed to walk over was rickity. However, lal in all the hotel was really nice and it is the sole reason we are going to another Hilton for our vacation this year in Curacao - also, we got that resort for $70 a night plus tax so cant beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay at Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: mh_ct
Reviews.Content: My parents, sister and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a week in May and were very pleased overall. Noteworthy positives (in no particular order) based on our experience : (1) Great location - very close to Escambron (one of the 4 Blue flag beaches in PR) (2) Close to Old San Juan (easily accessible by cabs/buses) (3) Small but clean private beach (which is a huge bonus if you're feeling too lazy to venture out to one of the public beaches) with several hammocks and plenty of beach chairs (4) Helpful and courteous hotel staff (5) Knowledgeable conceirge (gave us great direction to the sights in and around San Juan) (6) The hotel offers day trips/tours that originate at the hotel which are a great option for folks that dont drive. Some disadvantages: (1) The hotel does offer seven or more dining options, but we found it to be over priced (2) But if you dont want to eat at the hotel, you dont have too many options near the hotel (other than a Subway 5 mins away from the hotel enterance); but Old San Juan offers seveal options (for different budgets) and I would recommend eating before you get back to your Hotel given the lack of choices around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Caribe Hilton and the Executive Lounge 4 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Lippylulu
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at the Caribe HIlton where I traveled alone for business. I LOVED THIS HOTEL! When I checked in I told them I was a woman alone and asked for a room in a busy area of the hotel. They upgraded me to the executive level in the main building. I was able to go from my conference to my room quickly and always felt safe, and the executive lounge is fantastic! They have a free continental breakfast with more than just donuts (toast, muffins, cereal, fruit, yogurt). They have free drinks and hordeovers from 5:30-8 pm and mini desserts and cordials at night. Troughout the day there is free soda, water, coffee, fruit and little ham sandwiches which I ate for lunch rather than spend $20 for lunch at one of the restaurants. It allowed me to splurge on some really great dinners---twice at Madrid, the spanish restraunt, and once at Morton's, the upscale and pricey steakhouse. The Executive Lounge also had a computer with free high speed internet for checking email, printing boarding passes, etc. as well as 2 wide screen TV's and daily newspapers including the NY Times. Does it get much better than that? I heard the tower building rooms were better than the main building, but I was thrilled to be in the main building. The location is closer to the beach and pool, and my room was one of the largest and most comfortable I have been in. Although it did not have a balcony, it did have a HUGE picture window with an oceanfront view. From what I could tell the balconies on other rooms were very small so this was fine for me. I moved the comfy arm chair and ottoman right next to that window and felt like I was sitting above the sea. The a/c worked well and my room was always cleaned early, with turn down service too! The linens were upscale and the room was very attractive with a LARGE closet, marble bathrom, etc. When I checked in there was a flickering, buzzing lightbulb in the bathroom. One phone call and it was fixed. The bathroom had Crabtree and Eveyln toiletries. Nice! The pool area at this hotel is lovely, though it seemed a bit crowded when the hotel filled up on the weekend. I never had trouble finding a lounge chair, quiet area or shady spot. The beach is small. The water is calm, clear and clean with no rocks or yucky seeweed areas, but it is not the crystal blue water I love in the Caribbean. Again, plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas. The garden area is gorgeous and a great place to relax in the shade, read a book, etc with lovely flowers and even a couple of swans along the lagoon. I visited the SPA for a refelxology massage and must say this was a big disasppointment. The SPA itself is lovely, but they must have assigned me a beginner. Either she knew nothing about reflexology or she was really bad at it. I should have complained on the spot but I didn't. My final criticism is that the banana daiqeries at the pool bar were really lousy. I was surprised they didnt use real bananas but instead just a mix. Blech. For such a nice hotel they should really improve this. This hotel caters to families and business travelers. I would not go there for my honeymoon, but next time I go for business I will bring my family (if it was just vacation I might pick a place with a more expansive, white sand blue water beach). It would have been nice if there were some more moderately priced dining options, but I guess thats good motivation to leave the hotel. BTW, there is a Starbucks in the lobby which was great for a less expensive dessert. I have travelled extensively in the Caribbean but this was my first trip to PR. This is a top notch hotel. The restaurants were SUPERB! I gave it 5 stars though really it deserves 4 1/2. Trip Advisor should have a category for VERY good instead of just above average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, dated room, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Muriel12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe for four nights in March. The property is nice, with its own beach area, but be prepared to rely on taxis or rental car if you're interested in doing much outside of the resort property. The beach area is small but nice. They have a nice lagoon-like area for tranquil swimming. Snorkling equipment is available--for a charge, but it's worth it. Saw plenty of beautiful ocean life. I had a nice breakfast in the dining room. Very well-presented buffet with a variety of options for all tastes. I was very disappointed in the room for the price we paid ($199 per night). After being there for two nights, I chatted with a friend who was also staying there and discovered that there are very different room types in different areas of the resort. She too was paying $199 but had a VERY different room. Mine was dark and outdated with worn furnishings and a bathroom in need of renovation. Hers was bright, airy and newly renovated. Our bed was short-sheeted. One hour into sleep on the first night, I awoke to find that the bottom sheet had creeped up under my knees. I called the front desk to complain and they assured me that the matter would be resolved the next day. This happened EVERY day, despite my repeated calls. Does the hotel not have adequate-sized sheets????? I interacted with staff members at the reception desk three times and with the concierge once. All of the staff were incredibly rude. The final annoyance occurred during check-out. I reviewed my bill and saw that I had been charged a mandatory fee that went to housekeeping and bellhop staff. Upon check-in, not a single bellhop had offered to assist with luggage (even though plenty of guys were standing around). And after the battle over the sheets, I was determined not to pay a penny for housekeeping service. I was able to get the charge removed, but did not receive so much as an apology for the negligent service.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of fraudulent charges”
Reviews.Author: essman
Reviews.Content: I'm a HHonors Gold, which entitles members to late check out, when available, according to HHonors policy. I stayed in early Jan. 06, asked for late check-out, was told by Enitza in the Exec. Lounge (who was rude) that it wasn't available, and then told it was available for $75. I was ripping and declined to pay them $75 to stay until 2:00 p.m. Enitza called me in my room, said they had a "parlor room" available for 2 hours, never mentioned the $75 again, so I accepted. When I got my card statement, the total bill for the stay was higher than I expected. I had to contact the hotel several times and in Feb. I got a copy of my statement, which included the $75 charge PLUS other charges that I had not made. I had saved my reservation with the rate, which also quoted a $20 resort fee. The bill charged $25---$5 bucks, big deal. Had they not tried to rip me off, I would have let it slide. BUT, since it was next to impossible to contact anyone there and since the staff here is totally unresponsive, I had to dispute the charge with VISA. Bottom line, the charges were reversed and 2 weeks ago it was removed from my card. Not a bad property, but the customer service was obnoxious. If you like staying in a place where the staff is condescending and acts like they are doing you a serious favor by letting you stay, this is the place. Otherwise, Marriott is just down the street, in a better location, and with a better beach....and without the obnoxious attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week at the Caribe Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: velvetflip
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a wonderful week at the Caribe Hilton. We had a beautiful king deluxe room in the Hilton Honors Tower. Our room had a balcony providing amazing sea views. The bathroom was incredible - all granite, his & hers sinks, huge walk-in glass shower with sitting area and 2 shower heads. We stuffed ourselves at the breakfast buffet in Palmera's Restaurant every morning. The selection was great - fresh fruits, eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals, breads/pastries, juices and champagne, too! We had dinner at Morton's and Lemongrass. Morton's was good, what you would expect from any Morton's. Lemongrass was very quiet and intimate, but the menu was a little overdone. Still, it was a great option when we did not want to leave the hotel one night and is in a lovely setting in the hotel's garden.
