We enjoyed room service a couple of times for sandwiches and the food was also excellent. However, the hotel could speed up it's tray removal from the hall! The hotel's facilities are great. The private beach is clean with plenty of beach chairs and umbrellas available. The pools are clean and the swim up bar is a lot of fun! Oh, and don't forget to say hello to the parrots in the lobby, Pancho and Koko...they may say hello back to you! The hotel spa, Olas, is great. We had a couple's massage on our first day and it was a great start to a week of relaxation. We really liked the hotel's location - away from the busy Isla Verde "strip". It was a $20.00 cab ride from the airport, and only a $10.00 cab ride to Old San Juan. We wanted a week of complete relaxation and we got that and more at the Caribe Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 4 nights (May25th - 29th) at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. The hotel, honestly, is breathtaking. It's a small slice of paradise. I booked it a month and a half in advance. I booked directly through Hilton. I also paid for the executive lounge. Ended up paying $265 a night plus taxes and fees. However, that did include the executive level (which had a turn down service with a bottle of water nightly, use of the executive lounge where they served happy hour and dessert in the evening free of charge, as well as continental breakfast). Room was spacious, clean and up to date (even bathroom, contrary to other reviews). The ocean view was amazing (fort, other two wings). The balcony was small, but why obsess about the small stuff!!! The lobby in the hotel was open to the ocean and displayed a beautiful view of the pool and ocean. The property grounds were beautiful. I loved the 3 tiered pool with small waterfalls and tiki bar. Plenty of lounge chairs to find the perfect spot. The staff was the friendliest staff we have ever had anywhere, and willing to go out of their way to make sure you are happy. The cleaning staff too was wonderful. The concierge did an excellent job of helping us. Grounds are beautiful...if you like lying outside and relaxing...!!!! Overall stay was fantastic, and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barracuda30
Reviews.Content: Positive: My wife and I just got back from a week there. We stayed 15-23 May, and the weather was great. They have a good pool with a swim-up bar as well as a private little beach. The room was clean and housekeeping service was like clockwork every day. The room air conditioning was great (freezing if you wanted it to be) and that was OK with me, because it was pretty hot outside. There's also a good bar/lounge located next to the lobby with some live entertainmment most nights. The rooms have a small refigerator and mini-bar, hair blowers, and iren/ironing board, although our room's iron was missing. Not a big deal, I called down for one and they brought it up right away. A plus with me was the hotel internet access in the rooms. Several clothing and other stores are located in the lobby/ground floor area. The main advantage to the Hilton is its central location near Old San Juan with its historical sites and museums, the Condado area on Ashford Avenue just across the Dos Hermanos Bridge, and the easy accessibility to Highway 26. Be prepared to take plenty of photos, bring plenty of SPF35 sun protector, and buy yourself a hat for protection from the sun. Anytime you're away from the beach or the pool, it's going to be very hot. We got a bargain through Hotels(-) at $161/day room rate. Lots of great food and drink, especially if you know where to go! I would definitely stay again. Don't gamble on anything less than a 4 or 5-star hotel. Anything less gets seedy and you get what you pay for. My second choice in that area would be the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino just across the Dos Hermanos Bridge from the Hilton, or the Ritz Carlton. Negative: The only thing that really bugs me in Puerto Rico is that the hotels charge extra or separately for parking. You are a paying guest at the Caribe Hilton and yet they charge you $15 a day extra to park. The good thing about the Hilton is that they add it onto your room bill when you check out. At some others you pay as you go on a daily basis. It's just a pet peeve of mine that I think if you're a paying guest you shouldn't be charged for parking, but virtually all the hotels in San Juan do it. Somebody should complain to the tourism bureau or something. Tip: Parking is HORRIBLE in Old San Juan, so be prepared to park somewhere along Ponce de Leon Avenue (around La Casa de EspaÃ±a or the Taxation Building Hacienda), then walk straight into La Fortaleza Street in Old San Juan. Ponce de Leon Avenue turns into La Fortaleza Street from Plaza Colon (the square with a fountain and a tall statue of Christopher Columbus) onward.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time ....”
Reviews.Author: CateW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 nights at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. Let's say I was more than a little nervous about this hotel because of the negative reviews. Our flight out of JFK arrived early and our room wasn't ready when we arrived. I have to say that I was a little disappointed in the changing rooms. They were small and not well appointed so I was a little wary... but when our room was ready we got an upgrade to an ocean view room on the 8th floor. The room was spacious and the view was very nice. The room was clean, although it could have used a face lift - new carpeting and bead spreads would have made a world of difference. We spent most of our time either at the pool or on the beach, both of which were just wonderful. There was never an issue getting chairs or towels and the weather was fabulous. Due to the dining options, (Mortons, Lemongrass, an Italian and Spanish restaurant there was really no reason to leave for us). The bar was lively and the entertainment was pretty good. Puerto Rico is perfect from us because of the direct flight options out of NYC and the weather always cooperates. It's also a big plus that they have a Starbucks right in the hotel which is a great quick breakfast option and the pool bar and restuarant and beach chair service made for a very relaxing trip. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Caribe was a nice week”
Reviews.Author: recenttraveler48
Reviews.Content: Yes, it was built in the 50's, but there's a real funky charm to the place, and much of it has been totally redone. The staff -every single peron-was helpful, polite and seemed to be having fun! The hotel is short cab ride from Old San Juan, and in our view, that was a good thing. The beach was excellent, as were the pools. We had a room in the tower with a great view and beautiful breeze. We were at a convention and the hotel handled it seamlessly. You can venture out for food--there are lots of places to eat just a short cab ride away. Very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Not as terrible as the reviews”
Reviews.Author: usckim01
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and clean. I did notice some old wall areas that were not patched up properly, but nothing that hindered our stay. Concierge was very helpful and we didn't have much to complain about. I will say that we paid $90 per night on priceline and had we paid $200+ like some of the other guests, I might have been more particular about things. We didn't spend too much time at the hotel because we had lots of tours, but we were VERY grateful that we stumbled upon Lemongrass (one of the restaurants in the hotel) on our last night. I have eaten at nearly all the highest rated restaurants in NYC, plus many others spanning over 20 countries, and Lemongrass was probably up there as one of my favorite overall dining experiences. I've had higher quality food elsewhere, but when you combine the service, innovative menu, well-executed food, and chic but not overly pretentious ambience with decent prices (not cheap, but decent), it exceeded expectations. Even if you decide not to stay at the Hilton, you must try Lemongrass.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mcderni
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Caribe hilton, stayed from 5/12 - 5/15. I took my mother for the weekend as a mothers day gift. I have been a few places and I don't consider myself fussy but I have to say, I was disappointed in the whole Puerto rico experience considering how expensive everthing is over there. At first I requested a room in the main building based on a review I read here that these were the better rooms. That was not true these rooms were in desperate need of repair maybe even just a fresh coat of paint would have made it better. The bathroom I could barely turn around in and I'm only 140lbs and there was mildew in between the tiles. The second day I requested to be tranfered to a room in the executive tower because another guest told me that thes rooms were renovated. These rooms had larger bathrooms with marble walls and double sinks, but the wall in the room were again dirty. I mean writing on the walls dirty and paint peeling off. The room also smelled musty, I guess from the humidity but they should figure out how to get rid of that smell they are a large hotel. The grounds were nice. The pool was very crowded with a lot of kids running around. The restaurants, we only had breakfast in one it was ok. We mostly ate in Old San Juan. We had access to the executive lounge wher they offerd free continental breakfast which we also had one morning and that was ok also. Overall it was an ok trip, I had read the reviews by some people here and thought maybe they were just picky, but I guess not.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel; loved Lemongrass restaurant”
Reviews.Author: naturalogg
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, I was nervous to select this hotel in light of some of the bad reviews shown by prior travelers. However, I reasoned that you couldn't beat the price for a Hilton (we paid $170/night for a standard room on the pre-paid plan, 5/11-5/14) and the location seemed to be ideal (halfway between Condado and Old San Juan - we determined true walkability when we got there). We arrived around 1:30, and I checked ahead of time to see how booked the hotel would be during our stay and it appeared to be not more than 50% occupied. Nonetheless, we were told we would have to wait two hours to check in, which was fine as we were more interetested in drinks than naps at that point anyway. Had a bite and a few drinks at the Atlantico pool bar. Service was friendly but slow, hamburgers were pretty poor and not necessarily beef (as evidenced by our upset stomachs later on), but drinks were tasty and welcomed. Prices very high for the quality on food, acceptable for drinks ($11 cheeseburger, $8 pina colada, $7.50 Corona). Finally checked in around 4pm to Garden Wing room 753. Room was spacious (even bathroom, contrary to other reviews) and the view was amazing (fort, ocean, other two wings). Evidence of a few leaks in the ceiling that were roughly patched up, but not terribly offensive. Dinner first night in Madrid-San Juan restaurant on the property. Great selection of wines, tapas, and true spanish entrees. Sat at the bar; Luis, the bartender, was very helpful in advising us which menu items to steer clear of ("tortilla espanola is not fresh! not fresh at all!") and in picking out where to go and when from a tourist perspective. Slow service there as well but we were in no rush so it was fine. Food was very good and very reminiscent of northern and southern Spanish cuisines; prices were very reasonable (dinner was actually cheaper than lunch). Glass of house wine (very tasty) is $10. The next few days were delightfully lazy. There are several areas in which to sit around the water (big pool complex off of main building, smaller pool/jacuzzi area off of Garden Wing, small beach closer to the spa). Lunch from the health bar was tasty but expensive ($27 for two wraps and two cans of soda). No complaints about the pool (aside from your usual noisy families making their way through); comfy chairs and towels, ideal water temperature and generally spacious deck areas. Tried the walk to Old San Juan; probably should have brought a map as it was longer than we expected, and it takes you through some shady areas if you don't know the way very well. Cabs will take you there for $15 but you can (and SHOULD) negotiate with them, as they'll do it for as low as $7-$10 (it's a 7-minute ride). The tourism department has schedules of ridiculous fares for various rides (including airport to Hilton) but they're way out of line and, apparently, always negotiable. Old San Juan is quaint, pretty, and almost exactly what its name implies: an old spanish town, now teeming with jewelry and tourist shops in the daytime. At night, it's your typically metropolitan hot-spot, with its fair share of "urban chic" bars, nightclubs, and lounges. All reasonably priced, great atmosphere, and a lovely mix of locals and tourists. Condado is a shorter walk with a less thrilling atmosphere. More of a "strip," with pockets of visitor-friendliness scattered about. Ajili Mojili was the recommended restaurant, and rightly so with its well-prepared truly Puerto Rican cuisine. We were underdressed, even for mid-day lunch, in shorts and t-shirts but service was nonetheless friendly and attentive. The most important aspect of my review is our final night's dinner at Lemongrass in the hotel. This is one of the greatest dining experiences I have ever had, home or abroad. Atmosphere, service, food, and overall ambience was absolutely amazing, and I'd never go back to Puerto Rico without going back to this restaurant. It was priced appropriately for the quality, and it was the perfect ending to our vacation. Can't stop raving, and won't attempt to disparage any aspect of it by detailing any other aspect...I'll just say it was really, really great. And I'm usually very picky about great restaurants. I've been going to Bermuda every year since I was 2 (I'm 23), and this was a new experience for me. It's not the classiest island, but it's not trying to be. It's more like a very spanish version of Miami, as my boyfriend aptly described it. It's clearly thick with tourism, construction, political dissention, and entertainment. I prefer Bermuda, but am glad to have seen Puerto Rico and will probably go back at least once in my lifetime. Next time, however, I might stay in another part of the country and do more of a "nature sightseeing" vacation as opposed to our "R&R" vacation this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Room was fine at the Caribe.”
Reviews.Author: lyn2929
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Caribe from May 5-12,stayed in a tower room on the 13th floor/oceanfront and it was fine.If your staying at the caribe in the towers there is no need to worry.I was leary coming here because of the bad reviews but there was nothing wrong with the room,no extra charges but I booked through a travel agent so there was no additional charges. If anything needs a bad review its San Juan/Old San Juan it looked like the ghetto.It was dirty and the bars in Old San Juan looked like some speakeasy not a bar.The best places were Bacardi(very clean)and Senor Frogs but when there is a cruise ship in because if not there is no one in the place.And as far as renting a car we did at Hertz at the Caribe get the insurance the people of PR drive crazy and we parked and didn't pay right in front of the little store on the side of the hotel also they sell 6 packs of beer for $9.75 instead of paying the $6.00 for one beer at the hotel.The cab fair is a bit ridiculous everything is $10.00 for a 5 minute ride.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: monlo
Reviews.Content: 34 years ago we spent our honeymoon in the Caribe Hilton. It was a high quality hotel then. The hotel was disappointing on our recent vacation there. Paid for a "Garden View" room but had a room on the third floor with a view of the expansive roof and vents of the building below, just outside of our balcony. Many rooms have this view but it is not as offensive on higer floors. Workmen were doing (much needed) repairs directly in front of our room from a scaffolding that remained there the 3 days were in that room. We were unable to sit on the (dirty) balcony or even in our room as the men worked a few feet from our balcony. We requested a room change and were told none were available (front desk personnel were very unhelpful and unaccommodating)and to check back the next day. They would not start the process of a room change till then. Finally after much discussion with the manager the next day, we able to change to a different room. The hotel lobby is nice but it is deceiving as to the poor quality of the rooms. The rooms are very badly in need of updating and repairs. The rugs in the room were dirty. The main pool was dirty with debris. The prices for food and drinks are very high and not consistent with the true quality of this hotel. We will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the San Juan Hilton Caribe!!”
Reviews.Author: High-Maintenance2
Reviews.Content: We found this Hotel and the staff to be just excellent. We will definately go back. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. We enjoyed watching peacocks, swans, geese, and walking through the grounds where there were ponds, gazebo's, waterfalls, a fish feeding dock, hammocks, swimming pools, whirlpools, etc. Just beautiful. We had a great time and enjoyed the view of the Ocean and Gardens from our Garden Wing balcony Room. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Total Rip-Off and the Worst Hilton”
Reviews.Author: TallahasseeLassi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton for business for the SAA convention for a week, at the Government rate. The property is confusing - upon checking in they didn't tell me there was a difference between the main building and tower rooms, so exhausted after flying in, went up and down the wrong elevators dragging my suitcases trying to find my room... My "oceanview" room in the tower had a view of an ugly building roof, with a small glimpse of the ocean in horizon. When I went to open up the sliding glass door, the handle fell off the door. When I went to call for service, the phones didn't work. After complaining, they moved me to the main building, which had a view of the ocean and fort, and was acceptable, though the bathroom is small. Room service was prompt, fairly priced and acceptable (a veggie burger for $10). Here are where the problems begin...my keys deactivated 4 times - twice in one day, once when I was hand-carryying the key to the pool. I had to wait on a long line to renew my keys four times - and the manager insinuated that I didn't understand how to use my key correctly! They finally switched the lock out, but maintaned that it was my fault for deactivating keys. They "comped" me a free lunch which was nice - the seafood buffet was excellent - very, very good hotel food. Upon checking out I learned about all the hidden fees. I was chared an extra $19.50 "resort fee" for each day. When I asked about it and told them I hadn't agrees to it, they said it was impossible to take it off. I've since been dealing with Hilton corporate, who still maintain they can't take the charges off. They claim the charges cover the coffee in the room, access to the beach and pool, a local newspaper, and access to the fitness center. Last time I chacked, these were standard ameneties at all hotels! This hotel will nickel and dime you to death. There are additional charges for practially everything. I'm suprised they didn't charge us for ice. The service was mixed - sometimes we had the most freindly, professional service, and other times, we were made to feel like an imposition to the hotel. There is not much around the hotel - so it is a $10 cab ride each way into Old San Juan. I'd stay there - I've stayed at Hotel Milano and Westin - at least you can get out and walk there. And plus, they don't charge you extra for a packet of coffee in your room, a .25 local paper, and access to their gym. Caribe Hilton - what a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but check the bill before check-out!”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Kopperl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a large conference, and all in all I was pleased with the room, the facilities, and the staff. My only complaint was a mistake on the billing when I tried to separate the room charges from the food and drink billed to the room during my stay. They put both charges on the wrong card, resulting in my checking account being overdrawn. I'm still waiting to get it corrected over the phone, as their computer has been "down" for a bit. That detail aside, the time I spent there was as good as I hoped for and better than I expected given the mix of reviews. I stayed in the main tower, the closest to the lobby. I saw the rooms of colleagues in the other two towers, and I understood some of the reviews. They look adequate but a little older and worn. For the money spent, try to get a room in the main tower. The food and drink are good but a bit pricey, except for the breakfast buffet which is actually a pretty good bargain and a great spread. Both the Condado and Old San Juan are a healthy, but not too strenuous, walk from the hotel and worth the effort. I heard rumor of the walk to Old San Juan from the Hilton being unsafe, but I found myself much more frightened during a ride in an unofficial "taxi" back to the hotel from Old SJ.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Great Pool, Would stay here again !!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal152
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 4 nights (April 22-April 26). I was very concerned because of the several negative comments I had read. Me and my fiance' will not settle for "average" standards in a hotel or resort whether traveling in the states or abroad. Our experience at the Caribe Hilton was Great and we will certainly stay here again. The check-in process was rather quick and we were able to take advantage of the Executive Lounge on the 9th floor which provided free breakfast, cocktails and snacks and nightly desert. This was a definate benefit and the quality of food and drinks were superb. The view from the 9th floor lounge was amazing. Our room was a standard room on the 8th floor. Beautiful view and comfortable beds. The bathroom was a little small, however, we didnt spend much time in there! The lobby in the hotel was open to the ocean and displayed a beautiful view of the pool and ocean. The property grounds were beautiful and comparable to a Sandals resort. I loved the 3 tiered pool with small waterfalls. Plenty of spaces for families and couples alike to find a perfect spot. The ocean cove area was very nice and clean. I prefer the pool so only spent time walking there however people were snorkeling only 30' or so from the beach. I can't say enough about the property....I walked the entire grounds daily and enjoyed it all. There were several places to eat, some were pricey, but hey, you are on vacation ! The Olas Health Bar Cafe was my favorite place to eat for lunch...wonderful wraps and salads. Just a short walk over to the spa and workout area and this is a super place to grab lunch and take back to the pool area to eat. After I discovered the Olas Health Bar, I ate there every day even when my fiance' choose a burger from the Atlantico Pool Bar & Grill !! Must try one of the dee-lish wraps here. Overall, the staff was helpful, and friendly, I will agree that the pool services was slow, but it just made me get up and go to the pool bar for my own pina coladas which was no big deal. Note, when ordering a pina colada (this is the place where they were originated) ask for extra spiced rum on top. Yumm ! This place overall is somewhere I would return to again. And, we plan to very soon. Please do not listen to all the negative reviews. I give this resort a 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Lame destination for vacation and overpriced at $265/night”
Reviews.Author: MordySacramento
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton is fine if you're on a business trip but I would recommend against staying there on vacation unless you like so-so accommodations surrounded by construction. We arrived early but we're checked in without incident. However, we were in the Condado Lagoon Villas which is quite a hike from the main lobby. The room itself was OK although we did not need the kitchen, fridge, etc. The bathroom needed to be overhauled and was very small. It felt as if we were in someone's timeshare instead of a hotel. The ground themselves are OK. Some of the buildings definitely could use repair and/or update. The beach is just OK. The 10% resort fee is a joke as it's not close to being a resort. I'd stay there if on business but definitely not for a vacation. There's nothing really close to it except for freeways and construction sites. It's $10 cab ride each way to Old San Juan which was interesting but overhyped. Head somewhere else in the Caribbean!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: MrsNettyG
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 night, 6 day vacation from the Caribe Hilton and we loved it! There were many negative reviews on this website before I left and I was freaking out thinking we were going to hate the hotel. Needless to say, alot of the reviews were true, but you are on vacation and I would not let little things get me down. The hotel entrance is beautiful! Check in was smooth, but the bell boys or whatever you want to call the guys that hang out on in front of the hotel to help, are useless! The room was okay. Does it need a fresh coat of paint, yes, but who cares. Do the hallways have that humidity stench, yes, but why let that get you down! I was never in the hotel room or the hallways all that long during my stay and to pay double the price for a fancy room was not necessary (at least in my case). The pool and the beach were magnificiant. My sister-in-law warned me about the beach before I left, because when she stayed at the El San Juan, she claimed the beach was not that nice there. The beach here was beautiful and clean, but it was only for the Hilton hotel guests, so they cleaned it every night. The pool was a bit gross at the end of the day, but that is to be expected with so many kids in it. The pool was cleaned every night and I saw it with my own eyes and in the morning it was beautiful. They are defintely a bit short hand for help and are a bit slow by my standards, but friendly. So, I did not let it aggrevate me becasue I was on vacation. Other times, the help was very quick. It varied. There is no night life really and you have to venture out to eat unless you want to eat at the Hilton every night. We went into Old San Juan for two nights, Condado one night and Isle Verde another. Basically it was the same everywhere. We ate walked around a bit, nothing was opened and then went back to the hotel. You are not in walking distance of anyhting. We went to restaurants that were recommneded by the cab drivers or Hitlon employees. They were ALWAYS GREAT restaurants and cheap because they knew the area very well. If you are looking for night life, I can't help you because we did not see much or hear about much. The hotel could have done better in regards to the nighly music. It was okay, but if you had some good dancing music, I would have went to the hotel lobby area after dinner and had some drinks. We did two excursions, the rain forest and snorkling. I would skip the rain forest, but the snorkling was a lot of fun! Bottom line I expected the worse, and had a great time. Could I have stayed in a more lavish hotel, of course, but I rather the money be spent on drinks and food. I would defintely stay here again. If you have any questions, do not hesitate to e-mail me: nettya812@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: TravelerofNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton from 24-29 March. A short getaway from our 2 children. Given the range of reviews we lowered our expectations & were prepared to have a good time regardless. Arrived at 2 on Friday. Lobby was hectic & crowded. Tried to check-in at the HHonors counter, but no rooms were yet available. Had to wait until 4, plus we had to insist on a king bed room. We had upgraded our package for a king deluxe ocean view. After a 4 hr flight from Newark we went straight to the pool bar for lunch. By 4 our room was open. Garden wing 847. Room had a wonderful ocean view, overlooking a tropical garden below. Small balcony w/ 2 chairs â€“ just enough to stand out and gaze at the ocean or hang your bathing suit on the chair to dry. Room was a bit dated - new contemporary furniture, but old carpet (had cigarette burns) & the walls needed to be repainted. No doorstop on the room door so there was a large hole where the door knob smashed into the wall. No attempt at repairing the gaping hole, but someone cleaned up the floor. Expecting a deluxe bath with a rain shower â€“ mentioned by others, instead it was less than typical. We had an old tub w/ a partially working showerhead & a defective stopper. As I said we were expecting deluxe, but rather than complain & change rooms we decided this was fine. At checkout, we confirmed that we were in a king deluxe oceanview. Which means the regular rooms must be in pretty bad shape. Best asset of this hotel is the protected beach. Beach located in a cove with a breakwall so the ocean waves were very gentle lapped right up to the chairs. Beach was also private as the resort surrounded the entire beach. Plenty of chairs and someone can place an umbrella for you. Didnâ€™t bother with the pools given this nice beach. Waves were so gentle in some areas that small children were sitting in the water playing. Life guards circulated among the pools and beach area â€“ though not always present. Pools were also nice, including a walk-up bar in the pool with stools in the water. A few specialty shops in the hotel, including a gift shop selling water, sodas, munchies, etc at reasonable prices. Nothing around this hotel though â€“ a Subway shop, a few bodegas, but no other restaurants. Need to take a taxi into Old San Juan â€“ which was close, but at least 10 minute ride. Package included two drinks daily, which we took as pina coladas - which we great - whether at the beach or at the bar at night. Breakfast was buffet at Palmeras - excellent hot and cold food, great fruits, eggs prepared to order & juices. Staff were very friendly & attentive. Best to sit outside. Lunch/Dinner at Palmeras was very typical fare and a very limited menu. If you are looking for a special lunch/dinner I suggest you leave the hotel. Atlantico Pool Bar & Grill for lunch. Excellent ocean view from the outdoor grill. Staff attentive & friendly. Expecting seafood or local fare, but instead the menu was burgers & chicken w/ fried plantain chips. Still tasty though. Servers also delivered food and/or drinks to the beach & poolside. Dinner in the hotel included: Morton's Steakhouse (attached to hotel). Typical Morton's. Great steaks, $120 for two adults, no drinks. Very busy on Friday nights. Need reservation and appropriate dress. Lemongrass (attached to hotel â€“ located in the tropical garden spot). Pretentious pan asian. Sushi just okay, entrees (scallops & sea bass) tasty, but of low value. 4 sea scallops for $30. Outdoor restaurant so be careful of the mosquitos. We eat regularly in Manhattan restaurants (incl sushi) & this was expensive & disappointing. Three other restaurants on the grounds â€“ Italian, Spanish Tapas and a Spa restaurant â€“ none which we tried. Other dining spots we visited in the area were: Mohito's (Located in Old San Juan) - best calamari ever eaten. Small family-owned restaurant, simple decor, local cuisine. Tried mofongo w/ chicken - plaintain bowl stuffed w/ chicken. Reasonably priced and staff very friendly, attentive and helpful to tourists. Barrachina (Located in Old San Juan) â€“ nice atmosphere, Puerto Rican art, good sea food for lunch. Located in a nice area of OSJ. Metropol (across from Ritz-Carleton). Connected to a rooster fight arena. Menu mostly seafood and local dishes. Very nice, but distant from the resort area â€“ unless you are staying at the Ritz. All in all, the Caribe Hilton was a fine resort. Staff were attentive and friendly in the restaurants, bar and lobby. Room cleaning seemed fine and consistent. Grounds were open to the public, including access to the hotel rooms. Security were present in the lobby, but no one stopping you from touring the floors. Given the past criticisms from fellow travelers we were expecting less, but were pleasantly surprised with a great vacation. I believe we will visit the hotel again in the future with our children, as the beach and pools were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our Caribe Hilton Vacation was just wonderful. We just got back from the best vacation ever. We went with our 10 year old son and another family. We stayed in the towers. Our room was pretty and the hallways were decorated beautifully. We loved looking out at the beach and ocean everyday. You could even see Old San Juan in the distance. The lobby was gorgeous and we loved the pools and quiet beach. The staff was the friendliest staff we have ever had anywhere.I felt like I was in heaven the whole trip. I don't have one single complaint. I just hated to leave and I can't wait to visit the Caribe Hilton again. I don't see how anyone could not like this wonderful hotel! R.B. in Doylestown,PA.

Reviews.Title: “overated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Because my company assigns the hotel's for it's employees I have no choice but to endure my brief but numerous overnights at the Caribe. My last visit featured a smoking room that I did not request, and the staff refused to change my room. Even after reporting a malfunctioning air conditioner, that did not budge from a 53 degree setting, I was forced to remain in this room. On the same floor one of my co-workers reported roaches in her room, and the staff failed to move her either. The rooms generally are mildewed, damp, and musty. You don't want to drink the water in San Juan, but if you need the bottled water in the room be ready to cough up $7.00. Need to get on the internet? That's going to cost you $14.95, excessive when you consider that many hotels are providing free WIFI/LAN as a service to their guests. For those of you that have a choice, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of the Caribe Hilton we were prepared to have a so-so time on our vacation but were very happily surprised. Check-in was a breeze and we were quickly settled into a more than adequate room in the Towers. The room was large, modern and had a terrace with an exquisite ocean view. The bathroom had 2 sinks and a rain shower which was a wonderful experience. The king size bed was very confortable, which was a concern since my husband has back problems. The room was cleaned every day which included changing the sheets. We were more than comfortable in this room for the 6 nights we were there. We would recommend staying in the Towers rather than the Main, older building.The beach is in a cove which meant there were no waves, but waves could be seen in the distance. Umbrellas and chairs were always available even on the busy weekend. We thoroughly enjoyed the beach. We spent less time at the pool but it was very pretty with a swim-up bar and a jacuzzi, also a kiddy pool. We didn't bring children but there seemed to be lots of fun activities for them. Since we are Hilton Gold Card members we had access to the members lounge that had breakfast available in the morning and cocktails and food in the early evening, at no charge. We would also recommend the salad bar at the outdoor cafe in the lobby. There wasn't much to do outside of the hotel but an easy cab ride (about $10)could bring you into Old San Juan or to other hotels in the Condado area. All of the staff at the hotel were very courteous and polite. We truly had a wonderful time and we hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “See for yourself”
Reviews.Author: chyna610
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Caribe from April 7th-April 11th. Before the trip we were skeptical from reading reviews on here, however after experiencing it for ourselves we are glad we decided to go. We loved this hotel. One criticism we had was at check-in. We booked a deluxe oceanview room and upon checking in we were almost given a gardenview room. Notice I said almost. When the girl at the desk said garden wing I pointed out her mistake. Next we were told that there weren't any deluxe oceanview rooms available. Lucky for us because we were upgraded to a room on the executive floor room #928. On this floor there is a lounge that serves complimentary continental breakfast in the morning, cocktails and hors d'ouevres in the evening and dessert and cordials at night. It was nice. Our room was great also. Everything was clean and everything worked. My only one complaint with the room was the shower, more specifically the water temperautre. It is either almost scalding hot or lukewarm, nothing in between. The view from our balcony was like something from a postcard. Every night we were brought mints and bottled water. The staff were helpful and attentive from the front desk to housekeeping, waitstaff to bellhops. The location of the hotel is great. From the airport it's a flat rate of $19 plus $1 per suitcase and $.50 per small bag. We paid $10 for a cab to Old San Juan and about $20 to Isla Verde. We rented a car and drove to El Yunque which took a little under an hour and it saved money. The tour is $49 per person. The rental was $57, entrance fee $3 and refilling the car about $7, so added up and divided we saved about $30 each (there were 4 of us). There are many dining choices at the Caribe. We tried the Atlantico pool bar and grill for burgers and light fare which was good. We also tried the Italian place which was good also, especially dessert.There is a Subway right outside the hotel entrance. If you want to venture out the concierge can offer suggestions and show you menus. Everyone should try the Parrot Club. The beach is ok, the sand is a bit rocky, but the pool is wonderful.It's a multi-level with waterfalls and a swim up bar. We did aqua aerobics one morning, one of the many activities offered by the hotel. One thing they don't offer is jetskiing. Overall, the trip was great. We're already plotting a return trip and the Caribe will be our 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a long trip”
Reviews.Author: sbdhg
Reviews.Content: this hotel is more like a holiday inn with a good pool. folks there were nice but i would not recommend this hotel for a destination vacation. if you're going to be in puerto rico anyway and get a good deal on the hotel, then go for it. if you're traveling for a caribbean visit, i'd choose a different hotel with a nicer location and much more luxury. also, avoid the spa. i had poor service and an untrained provider.

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong at this hilton ...”
Reviews.Author: waterfall1824
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from April 6th to 10th ... We booked a room on the Executive Floor of the main tower. Check in was a breeze and although we arrived earlier than check in would allow, with access to the Exec Lounge we enjoyed cool drinks and snacks until our room was ready at about 2:00 P.M. Our room was lovely ... clean, king bed, balcony overlooking the ocean - just perfect. The first night we ate at Escambron, this restuarant is two blocks from the hotel, offered local fare, and the concierge gave us a coupon for a free appetizer. With a view of the Atlantic, the food was good and reasonable. We rented a car from the desk off the lobby, I called the 800 # and got a great rate, we even got an upgrade to a larger car ... We drove all over ... we went to Camuy Caves, Luguillo Beach, and had dinner in Old San Juan two nights ... It's very easy to get around when driving, and if you do have a car and want to park in OSJ there is a parking lot that charges $1.75 for two hours ... you can't miss this parking lot ... I think it's on Tetuan Street, and there are many restaurants right across the street from the parking garage ... The Hilton is wonderful ... the grounds are well kept, the pool was clean, the service and bars are good as well ... As HH Gold members we did receive comp buffet breakfast and a daily drink ... the breakfast is good (omelets, bagels and lox, champagne, etc ... etc ...) they do get $39.00 for two for this buffett, I would'nt pay that much but as HH members and included .. I'll take it! Victor at the bar in the lobby makes a great dirty Martini (according to my wife) and was very helpful in deciding to rent a car and drive ourselves to the places we went to ... The only complaint I have is that I have to go home ... There are negative reviews and the only thing my wife and I can figure out is that there are some people that are just not happy no matter what ... If you are on the fence about this property take the leap, you will not be dissapointed! Have fun! Enjoy your vacation ...

Reviews.Title: “Many positives, few negatives”
Reviews.Author: dvar
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 3 children and husband in March and overall it was a good trip and the hotel was exactly what we were looking for in nearly all respects. We stayed on the executive level and the room (jr suite) was fine for us. It was definitely not as upscale as I would have wanted if I were not traveling with my children, but with them it was okay that it wasn't fabulous. The executive lounge was a big plus for us traveling as a family. Breakfast was easy and it was a good place to stop in in the afternoon and get a soda or a coffee. I would definitely recommend paying extra for the executive lounge privilege. The cocktails in the evening were also nice and a good place to stop off before dinner. The staff on the executive floor was terrific and in fact the staff everywhere was top notch -- they got busy for a few days when a convention was in town and it was clear they were strained, but other than that they were great - helpful and incredibly friendly. The cleaning staff too was wonderful - friendly to our children and did a great job. The pool and beach were beautiful and nicely situated if you were with kids or without. The proximity of the hotel location to Old San Juan was also good and we could easily take a taxi there for dinner or otherwise - we did not feel trapped at the hotel by any means which was nice. It would have been ideal to have had a few more non-hotel restaurants in walking distance though. While the hotel was great for kids and families and I never felt too restrained in that regard (one reason we chose this hotel over the Ritz which might have been too nice for kids at my kids ages (1, 3 and 5), the kids activities were not anywhere near as good as billed and the kids' club was not open in March. They did have one night of free babysitting that was great but I would have liked to have had the option to drop my kids off a few mornings in a kids' camp - it would have made my vacation! I researched this vacation extensively and the reviews on trip advisor almost convinced me to stay elsewhere - I am glad that I didn't as I think that overall based on location, pools, staff etc, this was the best choice for our family with kids this young in PR and I think we will stay there again if we take childcare with us. BUT, if it had just been me and my husband, I would probably have chosen the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful resort-rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: momtogo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton from March 25-30, 2006. We were skeptical based on other reviews of the hotel but had some Hilton Honors points we could use for 2 free nights which helped us make our decision. First I will tell you that I have done a fair amount of traveling and have never met people nicer than the locals. The staff at the hotel especially, are exceptional and willing to go out of their way to make sure you are happy. Upon our arrival at the hotel a "VIP" was checking into the hotel in front of us. Wen it was our turn to check in, the women at the desk treated us no differently and as a matter of fact took their time to find us a wonderful room with a tremendous view. We checked into our room #1070 and were left speechless by the view. The waves crashing outside our balcony, a view of the fort and Condado, it was amazing. We then checked the room out and although it was "a renovated" room in the Towers, we could see why some people would complain. Some of the work did not look professionally done (sloppy grout around the tile, a 3 inch hole in the tile under the sink, doors not repainted, etc). We found the room to be decent but not 4 star quality. We decided we would rate the room on average a 3 star. In my opinion, the view from the room and the grounds at the hotel made up for any shortcomings in the quality of the renovation. The pool area was beautiful. There are many places to relax, never a shortage of lounge chairs. You can relax by the beach, the pool or anywhere in between. There are palm trees if you need some shade and some hammocks in a quiet shaded area as well. We ate lunch at the pool side restaurant twice. You have to try the Mango Daiquiri at the pool bar-delicious! The food was decent but expensive. There is a Subway right outside the hotel which we tried one day. Saved may be $4 but the food wasn't as good. As for the other restaurants on site, we tried the Italian place-don't bother. We had drinks at the Tapas place which was very nice and we were told the food was great. We generally found the food everywhere in San Juan to be expensive, definitely on par with Boston prices. However it was worth the extra cost in most cases, especially the Churrasco steaks at most restaurants. The location of the hotel was decent. You can walk to some parts of Condado including a casino. The cab to Old San Juan was $10-12 each way depending on where you go. The cab to the airport was $21. One thing we found out is that there are no meters in the cab, everything is a set price by the government. We thought this was a good idea. Overall, I would definitely go back to the Caribe. It was nice to have a beach/pool and be on the ocean and then only be a short drive to OSJ and other locations. There is alot of construction going on around the hotel. Hilton is builiding a new tower and movie theater, restaurants etc so I would guess that work will be going on for some time. We never heard any noise from the construction nor were we impacted in any other way by that. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Staff !”
Reviews.Author: Joopola
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend are both in the travel industry. We stayed at the Hilton Laguna Villas. The Villas are new and have excellent views of the ocean and Lagoon. The seperate check in and entrance is great and the staff is wonderful. Room service is excellent but can cost $$$. The resort is beautiful offering a nice private beach, a huge main pool, and the villas have their own small pool and spa, which although the villas pool has no bar, you can order whatever you like from room service and they will deliver it. The Hilton is a great resort and we would both return any time !!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We used the Caribe Hilton as a stop over hotel for our vaction in the Virgin Islands, spending the first Friday and last Saturday nights at the hotel. Our experiences went from bad to worse. Both rooms were in the "Executive" floors. Not much to brag about since the executive floors are the same rooms on every other floor, dated and in need of an upgrade. The staff seemed uninformed about the hotel constantly asking for someone else to answer a question. Nobody seems to know anything including when hotel services and restaurants open or close. On our second visit to the hotel they made us wait over 2 hours to check into our room. At one point I needed to get the manager to actually send someone to clean the room. By the time I got my key they were still cleaning the room, making the bed and taking things out This hotel needs an Extreme Makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Villa Review”
Reviews.Author: jturner7
Reviews.Content: We selected the Condado Villas portion of the hotel even though it was quite spendy ($600 a night for the two bedroom option) because we wanted a place to accomodate two families with toddlers. The villas worked out fine...with some short comings. There is indeed a full kitchen and it is indeed "fully equipped" with appliances -- and nothing else. Unlike the Marriott condos, there is not a single fork, glass, dishrag, pan, or anything that might be helpful in preparing even a simple snack (a picky thing, but even the trash can was too small for kitchen purposes). This coupled with the lack of food markets within walking distance of the hotel made the kitchen pretty much useless for us. We only used the fridge for food that we we brought with us from home. The rooms are indeed nice and spacious though some things are lacking such as comfortable (and abundant) seating in the common room. Also, we had trouble with all three of the toilets even though this is a very new complex. It is a long-ish walk to the main pools and the beach though there is a small but not so fancy (it looks like a backyard pool) pool adjacent to the villas. A nice touch is the staffed towel stand at the villas pool. If we had it to do again, we would probably do a private rental of a similar unit at the Westin, some of which cost much less for similar or even nicer units. I might also consider using Priceline and getting three connecting rooms for basically the same effect -- two bedrooms and a common room. We were traveling with two two-year olds and had a grand time with the pools and the beach and the birds. The buffet breakfast was loaded with kid-friendly foods though it was a little high for the adults ($20). In Old San Juan, we had great meals at Cafe Puerto Rico and Jibarito. We liked the food at Al Dente but were put off by the fact that they only had one high chair and the somewhat high prices for decent but not spectacular food.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Caribe Hilton this past weekend. We booked on expedia for $210 a night, which was a great deal given the cost of other Puerto Rican hotels. If you're looking for a weekend getaway this place will do the trick. The rooms in the tower are perfectly fine. We found the room to be completely spacious and clean, and the ocean view fantastic. The open air lobby and bar are pretty as are the hotel grounds. The beach is by far the selling point: the water is beautiful. Not a problem getting a beach chair. Ive stayed at the Water Club, the El San Juan and have been in the Intercontinental. I don't think that either of those hotels are any nicer than the Caribe Hilton although they are atleast $200 more a night. The only thing to complain about here is the service - a couple of times we sat around waiting for a waiter to come by to give us menus, to take our order, or deliver the drinks for more than 15 minutes. Management seems to be part of the problem. We noticed alot of people just standing around chatting with each other while guests clearly waited for service. The workers seemed oblivious. Of course we just (--) to ourselves, and had a laugh. We were really there for the beach and if we were paying more per night we would have been really pissed, but at $210 we overlooked the bad service. Food at the pool bar is fine grill food (burgers, etc). The prices are the same as at any hotel pool bar. I wouldn't eat at the hotel restaurants given that there are many better and cheaper restaurants on the island (in old san juan and condado). And finally, this place was completely gay friendly. My girlfriend and I held hands and kissed and didn't catch any glances or double takes. We also spotted alot of family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: AroundNAround
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place to stay. Clean with a beautiful view of ocean and garden.

Reviews.Title: “a mixed lot”
Reviews.Author: kazuo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main building, not the towers. After complaining about an unfortunate foul odor in our first room (#310), we were moved to an ocean and old fort view room (see picture). We then realized that not all of the rooms are completely renovated or the same. That's probably why there are such inconsistent reviews. Our second room appeared to be slightly newer with some minor improvements. In general the rooms are still pleasantly furnished, adequate size, and are comfortable. The hotel service and grounds are more notable. After complaining about the foul odor, and despite the fact that the hotel was almost fully booked due to a conference, management did a very good job of rectifying the situation. The concierge did an excellent job of helping us. The hotel's pool and private beach are excellent. There's also free bingo where you can win tshirts and drink coupons. I recommend requesting a room with a view of the old Spanish fort built in 1511.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: GatorTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous 14 days in Puerto Rico! We began our visit with a 3 night stay at the Hilton Ponce. While there we visited a coffee plantation, the Serrales Castle, El Yunque Rainforest, and the town of Ponce. We then rented a house near Cidra which was a beautiful rural setting in the mountains. Our last three nights were spent at the Caribe Hilton. As a Diamond member of Hilton, we have stayed at Hiltons everywhere. At $355 a night I expected a lot more for our money. The room was in the Towers but the quality was dissapointing. The toilet paper holder was broken, there were some scary stains on the walls, and the maid broke the doorhandle to the balcony when she tried to close it. While a maintenence person did come repair it, it was an obtrusion of our time and privacy. The walls in the hallway were also marred with stains. On the plus side, the bed was heavenly. My husband did have to wait ten minutes every morning for hot water in what was otherwise a beautiful shower. The beach is ideal for traveling with a family - protected from the pounding surf of the bay, the lagoon provides a gentle play area for children. The hotel provides sand toys at no cost. The pools are beautiful but there is only one hot tub. It looked like there were two but the second wasn't heated. There are additional activities posted although they don't always offer what they promise. My children were dissapointed when the posted sand castle building activity wasn't held. My biggest complaint with the hotel was the service. It seems the Caribe is catering to convention travelers. The hotel was crammed with two seperate conventions during our stay. When we made any inquiries the staff was generally rushed, haried, and even on ocasion, rude. If I were there on convention paying a reduced rate, or enjoying a stay at the cost of my company, this wouldn't be such an issue. However, as a guest paying premium rates, this level of service wasn't acceptable. Other guests I spoke to voiced the same concerns without any prompting. Don't visit the Caribe expecting to be anything more than a room number. Their size has outgrown their level of service and the maintenence of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Blue7870
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five night stay at the Caribe Hilton, and was dreading it after reading some of the reviews on this site. I have to say that I was very pleasantly surprised, especially since I tend to stay at high end hotels like Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons. I had to go to the Caribe Hilton for a meeting and decided to bring my family; I am very glad I did. We were given a new, immaculate room in the Condado Lagoon Villas with an ocean view and a HUGE bathroom, despite the fact that I was paying the meeting rate. (I did sign up for the free Hilton Honors the day before we checked in; I don't know if that made a difference.) Across the board, the staff was very friendly and the service was timely. (This goes for restaurants, pool, beach, housekeeping.) Even when my 5-year old daughter got sick with bronchitis, they were quick with getting us a doctor and changing the sheets that she threw up upon!! There is a lot for kids to do. The pool is beautiful, though a little chilly from the wind. The beach is small, but the water is calm and you can relax while watching the kids instead of fearing for their lives in the pounding surf elsewhere on the island. The garden area with the koi pond and strolling peacocks was great. We took the 1/2 day trip to the rainforest- well worth it. We ventured to a couple other hotels: the El San Juan in Isla Verde was spectacular (eat at La Piccola Fontana!!); the Condado Plaza across the bridge from the Caribe Hilton was not and seemed better suited for Atlantic City than San Juan. I hadn't been to the Caribe Hilton since I was six years old (I'm 35 now) and was expecting it to be a shabby shell of its former self. It most certainly is not, and though I would be interested in trying the Ritz or the El San Juan next time, I'd gladly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Like it Used to Be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel twice. I can tell you that the first time i went in the 90's, I had no complaints. I just went now in 2005 and it wasnt like i remembered. It was still nice. It had parrots and starbucks and nice things in the lobby. the ocean was also very nice. there were plenty of fish to see and a cool slide in the middle of the ocean (it used to have nice tanning blocks instead of the slide). I had no complaints about the gym or the spa either. The only complaints i had was mainly the room. the room was clean but it wasnt a very welcoming room but it was comfortable and average. the food was good but VERY expensive. We traveled in a group of 8 and spent about $900.00 per dinner and $45.00 per breakfast. Make sure you go to Mortons steakhouse. it is expensive but it has pictures of many celberties who have been there before. its a nice place....the rooms might be your only problem but it was still pretty good. P.S. there were many rain showers while we were there that lasted for about 5 minutes so dont get worried about it.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than I had expected”
Reviews.Author: LJNaser
Reviews.Content: We just got back on Feb. 27th from a week at the Caribe Hilton. After reading all of the reviews on this site, I was not looking forward to our trip there for a conference. But, I was pleasantly surprised. We had no problems checking in and were given a room in the Tower (Rm. 1762), which had a beautiful view of the beach and old San Juan in the distance. The bathroom was fabulous, with a marble and glass walk-in shower, with two types of showerheads -- a hand-held, and a rain-type one overhead. The room was clean and new and the only thing that had a musty smell were the pillows on one of the beds. But, our other ones were fine. We got turn-down service the first night, with a bottled water and mints left for us. During the week, the beach and pool area were relatively quiet, and we enjoyed the grounds and pool-side bar and grill. While not that big, the beach area was nice and the water was calm (although it can be quite windy by the pool). It was very family-oriented, with activites for the kids, but not overwhelming. The atmosphere did change on he weekend, when they played loud music all day and there were a lot of kids running around, as another reviewer had said. We loved the breakfast buffet. It was a bit pricey at 19.50 a person, but the food was quite good and varied, with some local specialties, too. It was nice to have a Starbucks there, too. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. At night, there was live music in the bar area, and one evening the Puerto Rico Philharmonic Orchestra played there, which we could watch for free. I'm happy to say we had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton: What have they done to this beautiful place?”
Reviews.Author: rpach10115
Reviews.Content: We went to the Caribe Hilton january 14, 2006 for 7 days. What have they done to this place? Background: I have been going to the caribe Hilton since i was a child. I loved this place. My father used to take us here every other summer. I was last here as an adult in 1999. We went back again on jan 14, 2006 for 7 days. I hate this place now. This could be any cookie-cutter hotel in south beach. Neon everywhere. What does Bright Neon have to do with a tropical resort anyway. I felt like I was on a Carnival Cruise Ship, instead of a 5 star resort. They removed the most famous lobby bar in puerto rico and replaced it with this bright neon area. Remember, This is where the Pina-Colada was invented by a bartender here in the late 50's. All of the tropical feel has been removed. The "terraced" tables and the orchastra area have also been removed. There is no more 30 piece orchastra anymore, just a 3 piece trio. There is no puerto rican tropical atmosphere here anymore. Rooms: We booked a 1 bedroom suite in the main bldg. This room, while it had a magnificent view, was old and not very well taken care of. Upon arrival, we had small red ants everywhere in BOTH bathrooms. They sent up a maid with a can of ant killer. This is how thay took care of this. I am paying over $ 800.00 per night for a room that has thousands of ants, and the best they can do is send up smoe poor maid with a can of Raid! I felt soooo bad for this maid having to breath in those fumes. Now the both rooms smell of ant killer spray. There were many cracks in the wood fixtures in the room. The door to the TV cabinet was falling off. The bed had a wood block under on of the legs to keep it up. Another wood block under the night table stand to keep it level. The mini bar had an 2 opened bottles in it. One was water, the other was coca-cola. Both were opened and put back into the minibar. This is a club-level room. I went to the club level receprion and very nicely and calmly complained. I was told that there was nothing they could do. Can you belive this. I have a room in this condition, and there is nothing they could do! Pools/Beach; It seems that they now sell passes to local residents for the pool/beach area. Everytime we went to the pool, we were asked to "sign-in" this got to be a hassel after the first few times. It is not only when you use the pool/beach, you must give your room number everytime you step out the door to the pool deck area. The pool deck area is VERY loud. There are local kids running everywhere and screaming at the top of their lungs. This is not what I paid for in a vacation. The pool/beach area is beautiful, but the atnosphere is horrible. not relaxing what so ever. Food: The food is good at every place we ate. I really do have high marks for the food/wait staff. I just wish they could be in a better hotel/resort that this newly refurbished hilton. We arrived on saturday. We spent saturday night and sunday night here. I woke up monday morning and realized I had enough of paying so much for this and not getting anywhere close to what was promised. I checked into the availability at the El Conquistodor. I was told that they had plent of rooms available. We checked out of the Hilton with 5 days left in our vacation and checked into the el conquistodor. This was the best decision we made. The el Conquistodor was beautiful. EVERYTHING was as it should have been: Beautiful hotel. beautiful room Great food Lots to do Not day passes for locals with screaming children. I know that this sounds snobbish, but when you are paying over $ 6,000 for a 7 day vacation, you just want it to be right, not to be disappointed at everything you thought it was going to be. Believe me, I am a person who "over reasearches" every place we go. I have never complained about a vacation in my life. My feeling is that"I am on vacation and I'm going to have a goo time no matter what happens". I was compleatly blindsided by the Caribe Hilton. The changes thay made must have been done by some corporate exec because they took the tropical Puerto rican feeling out of this place. It might as well be the "Fontainbleu" in Miami. A suggestion for anyone who is booked here: DO NOT STAY IN THE MAIN BLDG. ASK FOR A ROOM IN THE TOWER BLDG. I have stayed in the Tower before, it is MUCH better than the Main Bldg. We went to jamaica at the end of january, it was MUCH better than this.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Carribe Hilton from Feb. 18-24th and had a great time. We were on the 10th floor of the main hotel and our room was fine. We were there with our two children (6 and 8years old) and they loved it. They loved the pool, beach, the big chess set, kids activities and much more. We mainly ate away from the hotel but had breakfast at Hiltons Honors lounge which was fine for a light breakfast and saved money. I would not hesitate to go back and am not sure why there were so many bad reviews. Don't worry about it if your planning a trip there soon because I think you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel right after our cruise on the Golden Princess...and what a disappointment. We had to wait 2 hrs. to be checked in, due to a holiday they were celebrating that weekend. We'd requested a queen/king bed with an ocean view, and were promised a nice room...well, we were put in the tower, susposedly the new part, which took about 7 minutes to walk to, (not good for hip or back problems due to inclines in their hallways...)and when we walked into our room, fruit flies were there to greet us due to garbage left in the bathroom garbage can, towels missing off the racks, black long hair on the floor and in the tub, kids' handprints all over the balcony windows...and the ocean view we were expecting ended up being a construction site, complete with all the noise. The carpet was dirty with black scuffs all over, and every wall had dirty hand prints and scuff marks all over them too. Are the maids forgetting what the word "clean" means?? The pictures even hung crooked, and there was no mirror in the room, only the one in the bathroom. When we tried to take a shower, there was NO hot water. Disgusted, after the water being colder than the ocean, we called the front desk with our complaints numerous times, and even tho they assured us someone would come to our service...no one ever showed up until the following afternoon. It was then that we discovered the hot and cold were reversed...and this is supposed to be a $400 room????? In their dreams...NEVER AGAIN!! I've stayed in nicer motel rooms! What a disappointment! ps. The beach is very small with nowhere to walk to. The restaurants are very expensive as well. My advice if you HAVE to stay here, is check the room before you take it! You are definately paying for the Hilton name and the resort grounds...not the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Unrenovated rooms are a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reading the previous reviews of this hotel, some will wonder why we give it such a low rating. It's because we got an UNRENOVATED ROOM!! These rooms are a disaster. Jan 28 "Not a good place" and Dec 2 "Horrible room" must have been in the same hotel section. Our room was dirty, moldy and dilapidated. You could not see the lagoon because the windows were filty, inside and out. However, you could see the parking garage, the dumpster, and hear the trucks backing in to unload all during the night (a real treat, especially at 12:45 and 2:13 am!). The shower made screaching noises that would wake the dead, the toilet flush sounded like a depth charge, and the shower door did not close so the bathroom floor flooded. The sink was cracked and the pillows were like rubber bullets. Such a deal for $275/night! But the bed was comfortable and the AC worked. We complained nicely and then complained more. The hotel was over-booked so we couldn't move. Finally, after several sleepless nights, they moved us with great fanfare to a "villa". Villa, in this case, meant a small standard hotel room. The view is much nicer, the room is clean and the shower works. The linens are clearly nicer and the pillows are too. The room is still a poor value, but it is OK, and there are no truck noises, just airplanes!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price, if you're paying full nightly rate.”
Reviews.Author: RanAndNess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, Puerto Rico from Feb 14th to the 16th, for our best friends' wedding. At check-in, the process was smooth and fast, but hotel did not honor our confirmed reservation for a King size bed. We stayed on the main building, and on the 4th floor; which had a terrible moldy smell throughout our entire stay. Housekeeping was very inconsistant with clean-up times, and even neglected to clean our room on Valentine's day, when we had been out all day and into late at night due to the wedding. Food choices at the main restaurant, for breakfast and lunch, were very boring and bland. "The Islita Grounds" is a great location for a sea-side wedding, and the hotel does offer great vendors and wedding planners. Overall, the Caribe Hilton is not worth the $340 per night full rate. Luckily, the hotel is conveniently placed between Condado and Old San Juan, so if you stay here on a cheap rate, go to either area for food. We would not stay here again, but would definitely return to Puerto Rico staying @ The Ritz Carlton or The Conquistador like we have before.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I concur with other recent reviews. My stay here was great. Our flights were cancelled due to the snow in the northeast and the Caribe made it very easy for us to book the rooms again. We also stayed in the Towers, which were lovely, modern, very clean and the service all around was great. The beach/pool area is also lovely and we ended spending most of our day there (with a nice pina colada too). I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “I would totally go back”
Reviews.Author: OTNY
Reviews.Content: I definitely worried about the Hotel after reading all the mixed reviews. I just came back and totally enjoyed my stay and experience. My 2 girlfriends and I planned a long weekend that ended up being longer due to the storm in NYC. We stayed in the newer part of the the Hotel..."The Towers". Granted we paid a little extra. The bathroom was great all marble, rain shower and very clean. The staff in the hotel I felt was very nice and accomodating. Our return flight was very late at night and they let us stay until 7pm for a very reasonable fee. We loved the grounds really didn't feel the need to go anywhere else during the day. The beach is man made however very nice with a great view, the pool was fabulous. Just get down a little earlier to put a towel down on a chair in a good "sun location" We ate at the hotel 2 nights..the tapas place was great and Lemongrass was also fabulous. Great atmosphere in the tropical garden. The restaurants are expensive however coming from NYC it did not phase me and I feel well worth it. I would go back again do not listen to all the bad reviews...so overly critical.

Reviews.Title: “san juan hilton is great!”
Reviews.Author: stellastarcot69
Reviews.Content: My sons and i had a fantastic vacation at the caribe. Ali, the night manager is the greatest. he takes care of business. there is a little store at the end of the driveway that has the best food, and drinks (cheap) and delicious. I brought some stew home for my husband, but ate it on the airplane. I did not want to leave. I love San Juan. Forget Laguillo beach. falling apart, but you might enjoy a coco loco out of the coconut. Would go back today but prices are high.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: eema22
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day get away. What a wonderful experience. The Hilton was relaxing and easy. We found everyone to be very nice, friendly and helpful. Thanks to other reviews we had a lot of hints to help us. Although we booked through priceline I called the hotel directly and gave them our Hilton Honors number. They now have a section of the renovated tower just for Hilton Honors members. Although our room was not large,it was great. I loved the shower and the view of the pool and the fort. At night we shut off the air conditioner and slept with the balcony door wide open. We ate outside the hotel. There was a little , hole-in the wall place just outside the hotel (40 ft). We love to find little local places to eat. One of our favorites was Casita Blanca in Villa Palerma. You need a car to get there but it was very local and very good.It took us less than 10 min. to get there. We could not have found nicer people or better food. We also ate at the Ocean View, an open air local place near the El Conquestidor in Farado right across from we you meet the guides for foing to the bioluminesct bay. We also had homemade desserts after we were done kayaking. The kayaking through the mangroves and in the bay was unbeliveable. But I put on bugspray going out but forgot that it would wash off while swimming. I am still itching!!!!! for the brave - we drove through Pinyones on Sunday Afternoon - what a blast. Very local. Tons of Puerto Ricans, food, music. It is definately the place to be on Sun. Another recommendation - El Morro Fort late in the afternoon. It was so un real. In the large grassy park/knoll ther were lots of families flying kites. it was very slightly misty and we lay on the grass watching the scene as the sun set. People can't believ that I took the pictures - they look like professional pictures. We love puerto Rico and may even take the kids next time.

Reviews.Title: “mixed opinion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is supposed to be one of the best hotels in San Juan. This grounds are beautiful. The pools & beaches were great. The service on the grounds were great. The maid service I experienced was TERRIBLE. My cell phone was mistakingly taken by the maid service. Instead of sending it to security, the people decided to meet with me instead. This never happend because of the punctuality problem they have. I waited 2 days for my phone. It wasn't until I was arguing with the security manager. (which I had to find myself, since concierge was giving me the run-around and telling me to call housekeeping. how about you do it! you're the concierge. that's your job!) Anyway, the security manager asked why i didn't have the phone in the safe in my room. My reply- THERE WAS NO SAFE IN THE ROOM!!!! How am I supposed to protect my valuables when there's no way? He said he would put a safe in the room that night. It never happened. Long story short, the service at this place is OK. Some people were extremely helpful, but the handful of people I had to deal with regarding my phone really left a bad impression. If I were to visit Puerto Rico again, I would choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems old... The service is horrible. Nothing worked in our room. (the AC, the PHONE!!!!, the sink...) We had to ask for something 10 times before it got done. The front desk people were very rude and were not helpful... Too much for too little. I do NOT recommend this place at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't read any of the bad reviews...they are all wrong!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many different islands in the Caribbean and stayed with many well known hotel chains! I know what I am talking about and just stayed at the Caribe Hilton for my honeymoon with my husband. All of these people with their stupid little complaints had me so scared that my honeymoon was going to be ruined!!!! Don't listen to them! We booked by an accepted offer on Priceline (paid half of what the hotel was advertising on major websites), got a beautiful room in the tower with a view of the ocean and the fort, with a balacony and chairs to sit on. Our bathroom was beautiful tan marble tile throughout and had dual sinks with a large all glass stand up shower, with two different shower heads (choose your preference) and teak/bamboo accents! Our bedlinens, curtains, and valance were all VERY up-to-date and beautiful! We got a local newspaper every morning at our door and they were even upgrading all the TVs throughout the hotel during our stay at the end of January. The grounds are beautiful. The service at all bars, restaurants, and poolside were teriffic!! If you really read some of these reviews, pay close attention to what people complain about!!! Its trivial and stupid! If they were that upset about those things to write such long and daunting reviews....imagine what they must be like to deal with in person!!!! Of course they will catch some attitude from hotel employees!!! (and in my opinion...rightfully so!! If anyone would be treated badly or have horrible accomadations it would have been me and my husband b/c of the price we paid for it!!!! We kept saying..."I feel like we stole this vacation!" Oh and by the way....... Apparently of all the hotels in the area, this is the only one that was good enough for JENNIFER LOPEZ and MARC ANTHONY b/c they stayed 9 floors above us the entire week we were there b/c they were shooting a movie in Old San Juan. We personally saw them a couple of times and talked with two of their assistants in casual conversation!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at the Carribe Hilton for a business conference Jan 22-27, 2006, and it was not a good experience. When I arrived at 5:30 on a Sunday, the front desk gave me their standard check in card saying the room would be ready by 4, or perhaps earlier: they then told me it would not be ready for an hour. I finally got a room at 7:30, with no explanation, no upgrade. The room itself was on the 7th floor of the tower. It was large enough, but quite dated. The TV was small and set into a cabinet on a side wall, so you had too look sideways from the bed, and if you sat in the easy chair you were all the way on the other side of the room. There was no light by that chair, so you couldn't sit there and read in the evening. The bathroom fixtures were sort of dirty and not well made; the toilet also tended to flush itself at odd hours, quite loudly. The view was of "the lagoon", which was just a small lake with construction going on.
