The phones in my room were faulty, as often you could not hear anything, and sometimes they would fail in the middle of a call, forcing me, once I realized that the other party hadn't heard me for awhile, to call out again. It took 2 days to get them to replace the phones, and that brought another problem. They charge $1.25 per outgoing call. I went to the front desk to ask them to take off 2 of those charges, as they resulted from the hotel's phone failing in mid-call and my having to recall; if their phones worked correctly, I wouldn't have had to recall and incur the extra expenses. The front desk woman flat refused, arguing that I had made the calls and the charges were the charges. I eventually called (after I got phones which worked) the head of communications, and after several calls and messages she agreed to deduct the unnecessary charges. At my group business meeting the lights didn't work correctly, and after several days of trying to get the hotel people to fix it, our group organizer gave up. Overall, this place may have been nice back when it opened in 1949, but it isn't now, and the front line people are rude and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, accommodating staff. Excellent food. Beautiful grounds. The room was fine, not spectacular, but we didn't spend a lot of time there anyway since there was so much to do. The executive lounge option was terrific. The Spa restaurant was outstanding. We had a relaxing vacation and would go back to the Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wmac75
Reviews.Content: Treated my daughter and her fiance to a stay at this hotel and they loved it. Very romantic. Peaceful with gorgeous rooms. Meals expensive and sort of out of the way to walk other places but the beach and bars excellent. Getting around was ok due to friendly people eager to help out.

Reviews.Title: “The Caribe Hilton is both a hit and a miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week long stay at the Caribe Hilton. My husband is a Diamond Member of Hilton Honors and this stay was reward travel with HHonor points. The Caribe Hilton was not our first choice, initially we booked our reservations at the Cancun Hilton Golf & Spa resort. The Cancun Hilton informed us in November that the resort would not be operational by mid-January after Hurricane Wilma had damaged the area and resort. Upon reading many of the mixed reviews here, we werenâ€™t sure we had made the best decision and our expectations were not too high. We arrived mid-afternoon and were pleased to discover when we checked in that we had been upgraded to the Condado Lagoon Villas. We were told we couldnâ€™t get into our room until 4:00 pm, so we checked our luggage with the bellhop, walked around the grounds a little bit and finally headed up to the HHonor Executive Floor for a snack. The concierge on the Executive Level was incredibly hospitable. She welcomed us, told us a bit about the hotel, the area, including Old San Juan and Condado and checked with housekeeping a handful of times to check the status of our room and finally advised us that our room was ready. The room itself was acceptable, there was nothing exceptional worth noting, though the king size bed and pillows were very comfortable for a hotel. The air conditioner was incredibly loud, to the point you could barely hear the TV over it and the ceiling fan was rather rickety. Both of these problems could easily be resolved with routine maintenance. The bathroom was very spacious and nicely appointed with both a decent size walk-in shower and a large soaking tub. There were double sinks and the toilet itself (& bidet) was in a separate room, which is always nice. The room featured a small balcony, large enough to stand on, but not large enough for any patio furniture, etc. but did offer a fabulous view of the water, the San Geronimo Fort and Condado. Be advised that the rooms in The Villas do adjoin and you can often hear what is happening in the room next to you, especially if there is a child that raises his or her voice or a parent correcting them. If you are a Gold or Diamond Member of HHonors I would definitely encourage you to take advantage of the Executive Lounge on the 9th Floor of the main hotel building. We arenâ€™t big breakfast eaters, so we were content with the complimentary continental breakfast that was offered daily. Other offerings throughout the day include soft drinks and cookies / fruit in the afternoon, cocktails and cruditÃ©s / small appetizers in the early evening and finally cordials and dessert after 8:00 pm. We found service from the staff to be exceptional. The bartenders and servers we encountered at Atlantico, the pool bar & grill where we ate most lunches, were wonderful and we had two fabulous servers when we ordered Room Service. The Housekeeping Staff was also quite accommodating. A handful of times they arrived before we had left for breakfast or the pool or we came back mid-day and they had not yet finished our room, they were always polite and happy to come back 15 or 30 minutes later to give us the time we needed. In addition, the nightly turn down service was very nice. The bellhops were always pleasant and helpful too. Again, the Concierge staff on the Executive Level was very helpful. We also visited Las Olas Spa for massages and had good service there. I wish the same could be said for Management at the Caribe Hilton. As I said, we stayed at the hotel for one week, after our first night there we awoke to find a bill and information about express check-out had been slipped under our door. The front desk staff apologized for the error and confirmed they did, in fact, have us staying for one week. Several morning we did not receive a newspaper after trying to resolve the issue with the front desk, we spoke with the Manager on Duty who was less than helpful and simply stated that he would, â€œLook into it.â€� The Concierge desk in the main hotel lobby was hit or miss, twice we received excellent suggestions for restaurants off-site, but one staff member in particular was quite rude and flippant. When my husband inquired about taking a small plane or helicopter tour of the island (both of which he said were unavailable, which is odd, considering the HHonor Executive Level Concierge said they would be happy to arrange it for us, seems like the Concierge in the lobby was simply unwilling to go the extra mile) or possibly going skydiving he replied, â€œYou canâ€™t go sky diving on Fifth Avenue.â€� Obviously we understood that San Juan is a city and you canâ€™t go skydiving in the middle of it, but his response was inappropriate rather than asking if we meant somewhere outside the city limits. One day prior to our departure we paid for the bulk of our stay (resort fee, room charges, etc.) with Travelerâ€™s Check. To date, 3 days after our return home, the accounting department has yet to credit our bank account for the over $600 in erroneous authorization charges despite the fact most our bill was paid in cash. While this is already an inconvenience, it becomes even more annoying since the hotel does not offer a toll-free telephone number and we are forced to call Puerto Rico repeatedly to resolve this matter. The last night of our stay we called to arrange a late check-out for the following day. Check-out is at 12 noon, we were requesting one additional hour, we were told that they could not accommodate us. When pressed they said that our room was booked for the next day; while I understand that housekeeping needs time to clean and turn over a room, I find it hard to believe that allowing us one extra hour would create that much of an inconvenience when they are very strict with not allowing anyone to check-in until 4:00 pm. We dined at both Mortonâ€™s and Lemongrass onsite, neither are owned or operated by the hotel. Both meals were fantastic, but be forewarned you can not charge the meal to your room. Of course this is not a big deal, but good to know in advance. Speaking of not being able to use your room charge, you can not use it in the Sundries shop, Starbucks or the Cigar Shop, which can be a bit inconvenient if you donâ€™t know ahead of time. The â€˜Cigar Shopâ€™ if you can call it that, was basically a hodgepodge of everything with a small humidor / cigar selection. One night my husband wanted a cigar, but discovered the Cigar Shop was closed. The Concierge informed him that Mortonâ€™s sold cigars and he discovered that their cigars were less expensive (by almost half!) and was pleased with their selection. Very convenient should you decide you want a cigar in the evening after dinner. Of course you can use your room charge at the restaurants operated by the Caribe Hilton. As I mentioned, we ate lunch at Atlantico almost daily. Yes, the food is a little overpriced as Iâ€™ve seen people complain about here; but it goes with the territory, youâ€™re at a hotel! If youâ€™ve ever traveled before and / or lived in or worked in a major metropolitan area, the prices shouldnâ€™t be a surprise. One rainy afternoon we had lunch at the Oasis Bar, the same holds true. We did not dine at any of the other restaurants on premise, so I canâ€™t comment on them. Also, please note that the Oasis Bar is currently being remodeled and is only partially open at this time. The grounds of the resort are well maintained and we didnâ€™t have any difficulty obtaining a chaise by the beach or the pool. The pool can get a little crowded, but it was never so bad that we couldnâ€™t get a seat. All in all, we would return to San Juan, but not to the Hilton. As we were staying on HHonor points and not paying for our stay it was easy to overlook some of the problems / inconveniences up to this point; however, the accounting errors are inexcusable.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Caribe - really recomend it.”
Reviews.Author: medley
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. We got a great deal through Priceline. Normally when we travel with Priceline, we get the worst rooms (fair enough - we're paying much less). Based on reviews I had read on here, I wrote to the hotel before we left and asked for a more modern room in the tower part of the hotel. A bit cheeky and I didn't expect them to give it to us. We arrived at about 15.30 and went to check in. We were told that check in time had been changed to 1600 and that we could either wait for the room that had been assigned to us or take another one that was already ready (but clear indication that the room that was ready was not as good). We chose to wait and had a drink by the beautiful pool. We got into our room shortly after 1600. It was fabulous!! In the tower part of the hotel with a full view of the ocean. Very clean, very modern and in excellent condition. Good balcony with seating area overlooking the beach. The best was the bathroom which was massive and had a great 'rain' shower, two sinks etc. We couldn't have been happier. Room was cleaned thoroughly every day and papers delivered in the morning. The rest of the hotel was also excellent. Pool area was great and the beach, whilst not the best by Caribbean standards, was not bad and not many people there. Gym was also really great - overlooking the sea so you feel like you are running into the ocean. Staff were all helpful thoughout. Hotel is located in an great place - between Condado and Old San Juan - within walking distance of both so you have many options for dinner. All in all, I'd recomend this place without hesitation. Whilst I am glad I didn't pay full price for the room, I suspect I would have been pleased even if I had.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton from 12/24/05 through 12/31/05. The rooms were musty and smelled like cat urine (9th Floor Tower). They definitely need to be updated. It was either too hot or too cold in the room. We could NEVER get a chair by the pool no matter how early we tried. We ended up carrying our own chairs, table, etc. into the muddy grass every day. It really didn't feel like a pampered vacation at all. I must say that the staff was very nice. This is not the place for couples. It is definitely more kid and family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I love Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: JouJou72
Reviews.Content: This past June my husband and sister-in-law had the pleasure of traveling to Puerto Rico. We were booked on a Carnival cruise through the Southern Caribbean and our port was San Juan. We wanted to take advantage of this beautiful port, so we flew down three days before our cruise. I had always dreamed of visiting Puerto Rico and I was not disappointed when I finally got there. I had read several reviews on Trip Advisor about the various hotels in the greater San Juan area. It took me a long time before I finally settled on the Hilton Caribe. After arriving in San Juan we quickly decided after the taxi ride from the airport to rent a van. We were given directions to the hotel and we were able to find it fairly easily. The hotel is situated in a very desirable part of the city close to Old San Juan and other attractions. I loved the open air lobby when we arrived. You had immediate views of the atrium, patios and the ocean beyond. Our check in was very painless since I had called ahead and requested a room in the new tower. We had our bags taken upstairs while we enjoyed a light dinner in the bar area. The hotel was abuzz with activity that particular evening because we kept noticing limos pulling up and the most luminous dresses I have ever seen. After inquiring about what was going on, we learned that a highschool graduation was taking place in one of the ballrooms. Our room was located on the 16th floor. We had partial city and bay views, which were quite nice. The room was spacious and clean, with plenty of closet space and a nice balcony with chairs. The bathroom was the best part I thought because of the beautiful marble in the shower. The shower itself could hold a football team it was so large! I took advantage of many of the ameneties and services on site at the hotel. I enjoyed a great workout in the gym and an emergency manicure at the spa. We ate frequently at Morton's and the lovely patio restaurant for breakfast. Since we were in Puerto Rico to explore we spent a lot of time away from the hotel. I can say however that I had no complaints. The hotel has some great jewelry boutiques where I found and purchased a one of a kind ring. They have a Starbucks on site for coffee fiends and overall we had a very enjoyable experience. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MassTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caribe Hilton during Christmas holiday with my family. Always crowded at resorts during this busy week, and that is exactly what we got. Having said this we were very pleased with the service of staff throughout the property. Check in was without incident. Rooms were ready and in the part of the hotel we expected. We stayed in the main building. Our room was clean and comfortable, although a bit tired. We ate at four of the hotel restaurants during out stay and they were very good. The pool area and beach were comfortable. Travelled to Old San Juan and Candado several times via a quick cab ride. Would recommend this property to others who are looking for an above average experience, close to the excitement of Old San Juan and Candado. Thank you Caribe Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: HH_Trav
Reviews.Content: Reading some of these reviews I almost feel as though I stayed at a different hotel than the other people with negative comments. I loved the Caribe Hilton, and thought the staff was extremely accommodating (even though there were huge crowds because of the Christmas holiday they made you feel as though you were the only one). I travel all over the world and this hotel truly is tops. I was upgraded to a room in the executive towers (Hilton HHonors Diamond member) and it was terrific. Great shower, spacious room and very clean. The free breakfast and appetisers were quite a treat. Not many hotels treat their loyal customers so well and I appreciate that. The beach is small but very calm. I especially liked the shady area. Having such a palm tree retreat is a rarity and allowed for my own personal getaway away from the holiday crowds. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a pre-holiday visit to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Caribe Hilton and I must say I am surprised by the terrible reviews. We received an upgrade to an ocean view (even despite a 15 minute wait) and thought the room was average, not $400 a night good, but probably in the 2 star category. I suppose the view made it worth it for us. We do not have any children and I was taken aback at how many families with young children (newborn to 5) stayed at the Caribe--lots of yelling and tantrums, but you find that at a mall too. The staff was nice when we interacted with them and the room was cleaned each day--we also left tips for the maid, so maybe our experience was unique. The bar staff at Oasis was nice too. Olas spa is a bit over-priced, but a nice respite from the beach. The location of the hotel to Old San Juan was convenient as well for walking or taking a cab. Caribe Hilton offered the tours we wanted and was close enough to the airport to provide an extra hour in the sun before we departed the island. It was my first visit to Puerto Rico and I was pleased to be in a US territory without the added stress of customs, etc for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience at Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A foursome (me and my better half, and another couple) went down for the weekend after Thanksgiving (11/25/05-11/28/05). We'd never been to Puerto Rico or any other tropical island, and were just looking for some quick time in the sun to recover from the drama that was Thanksgiving. We made reservations on-line and paid for our room at the time of booking. Both couples upgraded to the highest room -- king deluxe. We had a really mixed experience overall. Check-in took forever. And I mean 30-45 minutes. We even joined Hilton Honors so that we could get expedited service. When we finally arrived in our room, it was immediately clear that we had not been given a 'king deluxe' room -- the furnishings looked like they were from the 1970's, the view was of the gardens (and not the ocean, as promised), and the bathroom was completely unrenovated (i.e., no rain shower). It was in the tower on the 6th floor. There was also a strong mildew odor. When loud construction started on the floor above, we immediately went back down to check-in, waited another 15-20 minutes in line, and then had to argue with the clerk about the fact that we had not been given the room we paid for. Finally a manager came over, realized the mistake, tried to upgrade us, but found there were no more upgraded rooms with king size beds. By that point we were so annoyed (and kind of hot, considering that we were still wearing our cold weather clothes) that we agreed to take two double beds, as long as the room was upgraded. And then the manager told us that it wouldn't be ready for another 60-90 minutes. So, we checked our bags and met our friends for a drink at the bar near the pool. We finally made it to our room (which was indeed a deluxe, though with two full beds) and it was a huge improvement. It was definitely worth the money to upgrade. (Incidentally, our friends were checked right into a deluxe room. But they had no hot water for the first two days -- a valve had gotten turned off -- so it all evened out in the end.) The outdoor facilities at the Hilton -- pool, pool bar, restaurant -- are top notch. The beach is small, but private, which is a big deal. (Though there are nicer stretches of beach in Condado and Isla Grande they are very, very public.) The beach at the Hilton is basically a lagoon, which makes for very peaceful swimming. The bars (one inside, one outside) were both terrific. Pina Coladas were great. We ate at Morton's and at the restaurant where breakfast/brunch is served. Both were fine, but pricey. (Though coming from NYC the prices were not such a problem.) The pool was the best part of the resort. The hot tubs (basically small pools with very hot water) were open only on and off while we were there due to some maintenance issues. Things got much quieter on Sunday and Monday -- the number of kids plummeted. If we went back to San Juan, we might consider the Caribe, but ONLY in the new villas...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Room”
Reviews.Author: MonicaFickFeinberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe and would never stay there again. Terrible experience. Room was dirty, locks did not work, tub would flood, cracks in walls, poor customer sevice, etc. The only thing that was great about the Caribe Hilton is that I complanined so much that I got a full REFUND!!! If you have a bad expereince at any hotel in P.R. you must complain and demand a full refund and you should get it. Good hotels in Puerto Rico are VERY few and far between. You must do your research. Just because the hotel in P.R. uses the "famous" and "familiar" names of hotel chains in the United States mainland, do NOT think that those same hotel chains in P.R. are the same, THEY ARE NOT!!! What ever you think of a "famous" hotel chain in the U.S. you must automatically downgrade the quality in P.R. The hotels there are NEVER the same as in the U.S. Quality has a different meaning in P.R. than the U.S. mainland. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Okay -- good location and pleasant for a few days.”
Reviews.Author: shortiekp
Reviews.Content: Good location and decent pool and beach area. Could be better if staff was better.

Reviews.Title: “Wondreful staff”
Reviews.Author: mmygrant
Reviews.Content: We had a wondrful 4 day Thanksgiving stay at the Hilton. This is our second time and we loved it even more this time. It may be a little older hotel, but the staff is better then even the Ritz. The locals are so kind to American's, and as a world traveler, I will tell you that this now can be a huge concern. You can't go wrong with thsi one.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest place I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond Member and I have stayed at Hilton Hotels all over the world. I cannot believe how rude the hotel staff was at the Caribe Hilton. It started at check in and continued for my entire stay. The HH check in line was unbelievably long and the other staff who serviced the non-HH patrons simply stood and watched. When it was finally my turn to check in, both of the check in staff members simply walked away and left me standing there for another eleven minutes. I timed it because I was so shocked by their behavior. I did get a room with a view but they put me in the older portion of the hotel and my sliding glass door was so rusted it took great strength for me to open it. The robes were ragged and torn. I asked for another one and it took two phone calls and two days to receive another robe. The next extremely terrible experience was that someone kept calling my room and hanging up. One night a man came and banged on my door and demanded I open it. Of course, I did not open my door. (I am a woman business traveler and I give great care to my personal security). I called security and explained that someone is calling my room and some just banged on my door. They said if they try to come in your room give us a call. I asked if they could have someone come up and check the hallway. The security office told me, point blank, we donâ€™t do that! Finally after bad service and a stalker of some kind, I called the HH concierge and complained. He decided to give me a free dinner at the buffet restaurant. (Which I didn't want) He made my reservation and when I arrived the hostess looked at me and didn't say a word. So, I said "I have a reservation". She then said, "Youuuuu have a reservation." I am not kidding. This hotel has terrible service. I could go on and on. I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Caribe Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: jljlalal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Puerto Rico for the first time this weekend. After reading some of the negative reviews posted, I hesitated to book at the Caribe Hilton. I took the advice of several friends, however, who had stayed over the past few years and loved it. We had such a fabulous four day weekend! Let me start with the few negatives, just to be honest and get them out of the way: 1. When we arrived, our room was not ready. We came back 45 minutes later, and our room still was not ready, but we were given a free drink coupon for the bar for both of us. When we arrived for the third time, our promised room was still not ready, but we were offered an upgrade to the executive floor. I balked at first, because I specifically asked for a room in the new tower when I made my reservation (thanks to the advice of many who posted previously), and the upgraded room was in the main building. The woman at the front desk assured me that if we were not satisified with the room that we could come back and we would be placed in the new tower. While we were a little disappointed with this entire experience, the hotel really made every attempt resolve it. To make a long story short, while our room was not as "modern" as the new tower, we had the best view of the ocean that we have ever had, the room was extremely clean and modern enough, and having use of the executive lounge was so worth any sacrifice of the amenities that we may have had in the tower rooms. 2. We were only given an additional hour when we requested a later check out on our last day. We felt that this was a bit unfair considering how we had been so understanding at our arrival. It was also a Monday, and many guests had checked out the day before, so there really was no issue of the hotel being booked. Now that those two small negatives are out of the way, the rest of this review will focus on what a great experience we had: 1. Again, as stated previously, the ocean front rooms have some of the best views I have ever seen, and much better in the main building than the tower. 2. Very, very clean and excellent maid service. 3. The previous reviews about the inside bar versus the pool bar were right on the money! Manuel, who was at the bar for most of the weekend, pours strong, generous drinks and has a great sense of humor. He took excellent care of us all weekend. 4. Executive lounge is the way to go! Happy hour every night from 5-8, free drinks that include good wines and top shelf liquor (okay, so maybe we like to drink a bit!)and hours douvers. Breakfast every morning and dessert and cordials every night. Having a private concierge was a plus, too. 5. The beach was very clean, but very average. My husband and I are really "pool people" anyway, and the Caribe has a fabulous pool. 6. The location of the hotel was perfect. Far enough from the hub of San Juan so that you felt that you were in the midst of this wonderful tropical island, but close enough to Old San Juan to take a 25 minute walk. The cab ride was $10, and the bus was twenty-five cents and comes every 10 minutes. 7. Service was excellent all around. Of course, tipping well is always greatly appreciated, and the people at the Caribe work very hard and appreciate the recognition. Finally, I want to say a few things about Puerto Rico itself. This was one of the best vacations I have taken to the Caribean. The restaurants in Old San Juan were wonderful. We at at Barrachina'a and Aguaviva and both were excellent. Aguaviva's was what I would describe as Latin Fusion, while Barrachina's was more traditional Latin. The shopping was also great- beautiful arts and crafts, a Coach Outlet (where I did some major damage), and a great mix of high end stores with funky, inexpensive places as well. Old San Juan was as beautiful a city as I have been to, and reminded me of some of the places that I visited in Europe. The people of Puerto Rico were friendly, and almost everyone spoke English. There were many New Yorkers, who chose to go back to PR for a more relaxing lifestyle, and we had fun talking to them about New York (since that is where we are from). We felt totally safe at all times and would not hestitate to go back. I know this was long, but I hope that some of you who are planning to visit will find it as helpful as I found the reviews that I read posted before I took my trip! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Well Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holger
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Caribe Hilton for a Conference. This is the second time I stayed there and I found it even more comfortable. Had a room in the old building on the ninth floor. This is one of the executive floors and the room was very comfortable. Great bed, although the bottom sheet did not quite fit the length of the oversized pillow top mattress. Room was kept very clean and there was turn down service at night. Room was large with two easy chairs. Bathroom and bedroom both well lit so reading or working at night was easy. Small balcony. On the Executive floor there is a lounge for expanded continental breakfast and other small snacks and a separate concierge. This is very convenient when there is a conference as you can eat quickly. Staff is well trained and accommodating. i did not use the pool or beach this trip as I was busy with the conference but they are attractive and well kept. Restaurants in hotel are good although they are expensive but a short taxi ride takes you to Old San Juan or to Condado. Would stay at Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: sjmcjm
Reviews.Content: It's not often that we get to take a vacation, so when we decided to leave our 9 month old twins to go away for the long weekend, we wanted somewhere warm and welcoming. We were delighted with the Caribe Hilton! The Caribe had extremely friendly staff who always smiled and said hello. We had a room in the old building on the ninth floor. The bed and temp was very comfortable. The room was very clean and well maintained. The lounge was fully staffed and fully stocked no matter when we indulged. There is no denying that meals are pricey everywhere you go on the island but that should be expected in such a touristy area. We wouldn't hesitate to bring the kids next time. The beach is child friendly because it's more of a lagoon, plus they have a wading pool. A vacation is what you make of it. Don't hesitate to make the Caribe Hilton part of your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great location”
Reviews.Author: TR_2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan for a week in October of 2004 and had a wonderful time. I read the many "mixed" reviews about this hotel and others before making our reservation. There were positive and negative reviews for almost all the hotels we considered. Based on the negative reviews of some of the older rooms at the Hilton, I called the hotel directly and reserved a renovated room in the Tower. We were thrilled with the room....ocean and lagoon view, fabulous walk-in glass enclosed shower, king size bed). Our package included the daily breakfast buffet (fantastic), plus free access to their nice fitness center. We rented a car and thought the location was great (it's the closest resort style hotel to Old San Juan) and also has easy access to Condado. The Hilton has beautiful grounds, a wonderful resort type pool and private beach....but don't go to San Juan expecting fabulous Caribbean beaches...you would need to go to resorts in other parts of Puerto Rico for those beaches. The meals at the hotel were good but pricey. We had dinner twice at Aqua Viva, a seafood restaurant in Old San Juan, and loved it! We also found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. The original part of the Caribe Hilton was built around 1950 and has a nice history...one of the first major resorts in the Caribbean....and hosted stars like Frank Sinatra....they also invented the Pina Colada here. Although extensively renovated over the years...from some of the other reviews...it sounds like some of the older physical infrastruture is showing its age. Evidently Hilton originally leased the land under the hotel from Puerto Rico....and finalized an agreement a few years ago to actually purchase the land. They are building new condo's on the hotel grounds which will be part of the Hilton. Next to that....as you look toward downtown...will be an upscale urban mall/shopping area, a casino....and eventually a "river walk" along the lagoon leading downtown and to the new Convention Center. We loved our stay at the Hilton and would definitely go back. A friend of ours always stays at the Ritz Carlton (near the airport) which seems (by the reveiws) to be the nicest hotel in San Juan. However, we wanted to be closer in town.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our trip”
Reviews.Author: 1Kitty
Reviews.Content: The joy to see all my parents and players happy and to thank me for this wonderful hotel was remarkable. Our team is from Los Angeles, CA. and we were in a baseball tournament in Puerto Rico. Our stay at the hotel was wonderful having 10 families I needed to have a nice place for them for 10 days. I highly recommend the Caribe. The rooms we had were beautiful we stayed at the Newer tower some people have posted pictures here and that helped me to know before we checked in. In some cases it may be an extra fee but well worth it, I offered the plan to the parents and some took it and others didnt but they were all pleased. The showers are beautiful and roomy. The rooms are clean and well worth it to get the ocean view. If you plan to vacation you should always either work overtime or save those bonuses so you can enjoy your trip we sure did. The pools are big and beautiful they also have a hammock area which I wasn't able to get too but geesh there are plenty of them to enjoy. Peacocks are beautiful and walk up to the pool area not bothering just looking. The secluded beach is great and take those water glasses so you can see and swim with the fish. The food is great in the restaurants and sure its pricey but well worth it. Drinks are also expensive but hey your on vacation what the heck! We rented cars and vans since we were playing baseball but the taxis were expensive so we either took the cars or walked or rode the bus once. It was worth renting the car but not too many parking places. Old San Juan was fun to shop and the prices are great for souvenirs. Across the street from the hotel is a Subway if you like sandwiches all the time which the kids did. Not far is a Sizzler but you would have to drive or take a taxi Our hotel stay at the Caribe was wonderful and I thank the TripAdvisor for letting others post reviews and pictures so we know what to expect. It helped me so much and I was not dissapointed with my stay at all and neither were the other families. The greatest joy was to see my 14 year old so excited about how our room was beautiful and the lobby had parrots and the pool was so much fun for him it was all worth it. My boys all hugged and thanked me for the wonderful time they had at the Caribe. The staff ALL THE STAFF was wonderful and so helpful. If you plan to visit the Caribe remember enjoy and be ready to spend its worth it! Will I visit again? Puerto Rico no because we will not play up there again but if I was to win a free stay at the Caribe I would be there in a instant. Thank you Hilton Caribe and GERARDO

Reviews.Title: “No Problem Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't quite understand what all the fuss is about? The hotel was great. The staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect. I read reviews before going and must say that I was nervous. The staff upgraded our room to the newely renovated tower with an ocean view since it was our honeymoon. The only down part about the stay was having to take taxi cabs everywhere. There wasn't a whole lot around the hotel but the other hotels and casinos were only a 5-10 minute walk. It gets me that people complain so much about the prices of food. The food is always overpriced at hotels. But not only were the hotel restaurants overpriced, it seemed that all the restaurants in the San Juan were a little pricey. The private beach was nice and the pool area was great. I read a review where the person was displeased about the beach. Not sure what he was expecting but it was to be on a private beach that accomidated the guests. I was told that this was the only private beach of all the hotels in the tourist area. Overall the trip was great and I would defintely stay at the Caribe Hilton again. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you're looking for!”
Reviews.Author: dknj30
Reviews.Content: Went to PR for Labor Day weekend. We were celebrating my friend's upcoming nuptuals (aka Bachelorette Party!). ROOMS: They put us on the 8th floor in the Tower building. The room we stayed in wasn't very attractive. The room looked a little run down. The bathroom had a tub in the main area, with a shower stall and a toilet stall. Both stalls were cramped! FACILITIES: The pool & lobby areas were beautiful. The hotel restaurants all range $20+. The poolside grill has munchies for $5+. The "beach" is NOT a beach. It's a lagoon. CONDADO: There's a casino across a bridge (fairly long walk; $7 by cab) about 10 minutes away. It's not packed - which I prefer!! Definitely eat at ROPA VIEJA! Great PR food! OLD SAN JUAN: Is about 15 minutes away ($12 by cab). It's quaint. SAN JUAN: Is about 10 minutes away ($10 by cab). There's a casino at the El San Juan which gets packed! There's also a club called Babylon/Brava which plays a GREAT mix of music! House, Club, Hip-Hop, Rap, Reggae, Reggaeton - everything!! Condado is a retreat from the busy streets of San Juan. If you're looking for a nice peaceful, relaxing vacation - Condado is great. If you're looking to pick up young people and hang out all night - stay in San Juan!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment abounds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Caribe Hilton from 8-16-05 to 8-21-05, as a member of a convention. I agree with another post here that said the pool area is very nice. It really is. That is the only outstanding thing about this hotel. This was my first trip ever to Puerto Rico and I was really looking forward to getting out and experiencing the culture of the island. Not possible at this hotel. There is nearly nothing within walking distance except a Subway sandwich shop. The sky-high prices of the food in the hotel ($18.95 for breakfast buffett), made the fact that there was nothing else around even worse. A taxi to Old San Juan runs about $15 from the hotel. You can catch the bus though, for a quarter. The "beach" was a joke, in my opinion. Any beach in Florida would have been better. It's nothing more than a small lagoon, separated from the sea with a wall of stones. And they rent snorkeling equipment! For what?? The lobby is nice - I loved how it was open, from the main desk all the way through the bar and out to the pool & sea. Speaking of the bar...can you say outrageous? $8 for a drink (every drink) and $6.75 for an imported beer. My room was run down, but clean. The balconies are a weird wedge-shape and since I was on the 4th floor, I had a lovely view of the rooftop of the 2nd floor lobby below me. The drone from the rooftop air conditioners drowned out any hope I'd had of listening to the sea. And air conditioning! My room was like a freezer the entire week. I slept with my head under the covers, shivering, for the first couple of nights. I kept turning the air down, down, down, but the room would not warm up. I finally had to turn the thermostat to "off" to get comfortable. I had the air set as low as 80Âº and it still would not stop running. Of course, within an hour of shutting off the AC all together, every mirror and window in the room immediately fogged up. The reservation process was a nightmare. I had to call 4 separate times to get my reservation right, and when I got there, it STILL was wrong. There were four of us in my group who travelled together, and it took the desk clerk an HOUR to get all 4 of us checked in. He assured me that my reservation really was for 5 nights instead of 1 (that was the problem I had called 4 times about to try to fix) but the morning after my first night, I had the "express checkout" papers slid under my door. There is a mandatory $4 "bellman charge" added to every reservation, as well as a .50/day "maid charge". They tried to tack on an additional dollar a day for an "in kind donation to Puerto Rican KIDS" (some charitable thing), but we were able to get those charges taken off. Not that I wouldn't have donated a dollar day to a kids' organization, but I really did not like it being added automatically to my bill. I was lying in the bathtub one morning (at about 8:00) and all of the sudden this horrible racket started. I wasn't sure if it was from the room next to me, or the room above me, but they were obviously working on the plumbing somewhere. They were banging and clanging, and then I'd hear plaster falling down the wall. It scared the you-know-what out of me. It sounded as though they were going to come right through my wall. This happened 2-3 more times during the week. They were painting the hallways, and the exterior walls. The hot tub was closed "due to renovation". The convention facilities were outstanding. If you're looking for somewhere to hold a convention, this place might work for you. Ok, so this hotel might be good if you're taking your kids. The walled-off beach would be great for little ones, and since there are little to no waves, you could let them play worry-free. And like I said, the pool is really awesome. But for an adult vacation, look elsewhere. I know I will. I would love to go back to Puerto Rico someday, and I most definitely will NOT stay at El Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun.”
Reviews.Author: Lovinbabe
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel with large swimming pools and a beach area, lots of restaurants and a good view from the rooms. Exotic garden surrounds the hotel and lobby area has a beautiful caribbean feel. Just down the road from bus stops and local shops. Taxis easily available in the hotel. Activities available every day including spanish lessons and salsa lessons. Two places to visit- Plaza las Americas (largest shopping mall in the whole of the caribbean) and Old San Juan (lots of souvenir shops and sites).

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TVI
Reviews.Content: The beach and pool are very nice and the room, as long as you get one above the 14th floor, is "OK". The rooms do need some remodeling and the folks in the lobby agreed that they were plans in the works to remodel the rooms in the tower where I stayed. I liked that it was really close to San Juan with only an 8 dollar taxi ride each way to anywhere in San Juan or Condado. There is not much going on in the lobby in the evening for entertainment so going elsewhere is usually the plan.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ltowngirl
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I was fearful that my planned vacation would be horrible. I was prepared for the worst when I arrived at the Hilton Caribe, and instead of the expected nightmare stay I had one of the MOST pleasant hotel stays ever. Let me preface my review by saying that we are avid travelers having visited over 25 countries and we always stay at upscale hotels. We (my husband and I) stayed at the Caribe for a week in August 2005. Check in was fast and without hassle. We were originally assigned a room in the main building, but having read on here that the new tower is nicer, we asked nicely to be moved and were promptly given a room in the new tower. Check out was also fast (5 minutes) and our bill was accurate and we had no problem about the $1/day they charge for a charity (I just don't understand why people willing to pay $7/drink complain about such a petty thing!) The room was as is advertised in pictures on the Hilton website. It was a good size, with with a lovely bed, and a gorgeous view of the ocean as well as old San Juan. The bathroom was very nice- two sinks, huge shower etc. Unfortunately, I forgot to take pics of the room, but just saw that another reviewer recently posted some pics of his room, and mine looked much the same. There was no smell, the carpeting had no stains and was very well taken care of. I met the cleaning lady a few different times around the elevator and she would always say hello and was very pleasant. She did a great job of leaving the room very well cleaned, and the sheets were changed daily (someone else had posted on here that this wasn't the case?). One day the shower drain was blocked and I called housekeeping and it was fixed within a few hours. The grounds are very well maintained and clean- the pool was nice but we spent most of our time on the beach. The wave breakers make the water much calmer and more pleasant to swim/float in. The water is quite clear and the sand is white. We have been to many beaches far more beautiful, but then no one comes to San Juan expecting amazing beaches. For what I saw around SJ, I think Caribe has the best beach in the area- also the fact that it is private makes it much more safe and less crowded. I LOVED the hammocks- they are under coconut trees with nice view of the ocean and a great reading spot! During the weekend the hotel/pool/lobby were very busy and quite bustling (there was a local senatorial event going on as well) but during the week it was much more quiet and more conducive to relaxing. But even on the weekend, though the pool area was noisy, the beach area and the hammocks were still quite peaceful. The location was a tiny bit inconvenient. There is a Subway sandwich a few minutes walking distance from the lobby as well as a local food shop (a must try- their cubano sandwiches were delicious.. one day I ate the rice & beans and chicken and it was so much more yummy then that which was served at the posh puerto rican restaurants- I never saw other hotel guests at this place, mostly locals- but I would definitely reccomend getting a cubano take away from here for the beach)... The lunch options at the Caribe are not great- we got sandwiches/salads for the beach twice and the food was expensive/bland... You can walk easily to Condado for more dining options- I didn't get the sense that the area was dangerous at all. We walked to Ajili Mojili (10 minutes max) as well as other dining options. To get to the Marriott area of Condado, might be advisable to take a cab. As I was with my husband, I felt safe walking this area even in the night time, but if I had been alone as a female, I would not have chosen to walk this strip alone. We one day walked to Old San Juan which was not a bad walk at all- a bit hot but there were sidewalks all along the way. Most definitely not a good idea in the dark, but in the afternoon walking on a road alongside the ocean was beautiful. In general we found local people to be very nice and helpful- cab ride from the airport was a standard $16, plus 50 cents for every piece of luggage. The trip from Caribe to OSJ was $10. Also to note is that it is worth signing up for Hilton Honors on their website. There is a lounge where HH members can enjoy breakfast (7-10AM) as well as a cocktail hour (5-7pm) for free. The breakfast was cereal/fresh fruits/croissants etc) while the cocktail hour had wines/rum punch/snacks/fruits/cheese etc. As the lobby was empty when we checked in/checked out, we did so at the reception. However, I noticed that HH members can check in/out in this lounge as well- might be useful during times when reception is busy. This hotel is ideal for couples/families. If you are singles/young looking to party, this is not really the hotel for that. There was not really that kind of scene at the Caribe- there were many young people (I myself am 26) but they mostly seemed to be couples. I have absolutely no complaints about my stay. If you normally stay at the Ritz, the Caribe might not measure up, but it was comparable to Hilton hotels elsewhere. Also, the local culture seems to be very much about taking it easy and being respectful- anything that we requested with a smile we almost always got. We saw some people being loud and red faced and obnoxious and they ofcourse were mostly ignored by the staff. I would most definitely reccomend the Caribe and would myself choose this hotel in the future if I were to return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Hope this isn't a typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Waldobman
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Hilton and my third trip to San Juan. Lets start with the good. The pool area was very nice. The beach was nice. The whole lobby being very open to the elements vs an enclosed lobby...had a carribean feel to it. My first room was a handicapped accessible room in the garden wing. I knew I was in trouble when they appologized for putting my in the room and said I could switch out the next day. They were booked. Carpet in the room had stains all over it. The garden area was blocked off with tape. They were doing construction. Next day they put me in one of the towers. I did get a balcony...with paint chipping away. The walls were scuffed up. The mini bar kept making noises. I called and asked them to fix it. The next day the problem occurred again. I gave up on them fixing it so I unplugged the mini bar instead. I was ignored at the bar in the lobby. Overall, I was very disappointed. This was my first and last stay at the Hilton Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “The most Beautiful and well kept Hotel We've ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: Francazai
Reviews.Content: Me and my new husband spent a week at the Hilton in early May 2005 for our honeymoon. The hotel, honestly, it breathtaking. It's a small slice of paradise. The pool and swim up bar are exquisite, and so are the gardens in the back with the live peacocks and swans! Check in was a little bit of a mess... We checked in, and they gave us a room key for our room. When we tried to open the door, it wouldn't open, and we soon realized from the yelling inside that the previous tenants didn't leave the room. Nonetheless, we were compensated with an upgraded room in the main wing (which is much nicer than the garden wing) for the same price. The decor is very up to date, nice marble counter tops in the bathrooms, very clean, and well kept. The air conditioning in the rooms was fantastic, and so was the balcony and our view of the ocean and pool. The buffet in the restaurant downstairs was great - a little pricey at about 25-35 US dollars a person, but very well put together. The Italian place was little too pricey for just pasta, and being an italian myself, the food was much less than authentic. It's about a 20-30 minute walk to the rest of Condado, where the night life is, and all the shops. The area feels very safe - we walked almost everywhere even late a night, and there are always cops patrolling the area. The drivers there are nuts - please - take a taxi. Don't be brave and think to rent a car. The locals understand how they drive - leave it to them - trust me - it's worth it. Plaza del Americas is a must see - it's huge and beautiful! So is El Yunque, their rain forest. Take a tour from the hotel concerige. Overall, this hotel and city are now our new benchmark to compare all other hotels and vacations to. It was truly remarkable and a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: janimmons
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7 night stay at the Caribe Hilton with my husband and two boys (ages 2 and 3). Overall, we had a great time at the Hilton, but definitely expected a little more from what Hilton desribes as a 5 star hotel. Because we used our HHonors points for the entire week, it was hard for us to complain as we weren't paying for the room. The staff at the Hilton wasn't overly friendly, but they weren't rude either. Upon checking in, we learned that our reservation was incorrect (they had us checking out a day later than we had made our reservations for - something we were able to fix with no problem, but a little concerning nonetheless). We stayed on the 11th floor of the tower and had a nice view of the ocean, Condado and construction. The major problem with the room was the musty smell. By the end of the week I had almost gotten used to it, but it was still a shock each time we returned to our room! Our bathroom ceiling did leak once. We called maintenance, but I don't know if they did anything about it or not. The restaurants and bars at the Hilton were priced as you would expect them to be, so that was not a problem for us. We drove to Old San Juan and Condado for dinner most nights. There is one really good restaurant within walking distance of the hotel - Restaurante Escambron. I'd highly recommend it. The pool/beach area was great - especially for kids. There were 2 playgrounds and a smaller pool for the kids. It was really nice that the beach was private - you definitely felt secure. All in all, I'd have to say that we had a great time on our trip, despite the smelly room. I would have complained to the management if I had been paying for the entire week, but seeing as we had the week for free, I kept my comments to myself. I wouldn't agree with the postings saying you should avoid this hotel. As long as your expectations aren't that high, you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: loubetti
Reviews.Content: This was our third 5-night stay at the Caribe Hilton since December 2004, and we continue to have nothing but good things to say about this hotel, which is a solid 4-star property. We are already planning to return in January 2006 for a longer stay. As it is the largest hotel in San Juan (and second largest in Puerto Rico), you will never see it get a "perfect" rating. With some 800 rooms now (including the new villas), even a dissatisfaction rating of 2% will yield 16 unhappy customers a day! Service, food, cleanliness all very good / excellent. Staff members are quite friendly / cordial, and you can strike up a pleasant conversation with any one of them. We have no problem with the drink / food prices, as they should be expected at an hotel such as this, and are comparable to what we pay at home in the New York city area. It's the birthplace of the Pina Colada, and Jose, William, Roberto, Hector, et al, at the Oasis Bar will serve you a great one for just $7. This hotel is NOT for those who need to gamble (no casino, and the latest I heard is that none is planned), or who need a short walk to shopping and inexpensive restaurants. It is, however, a great place to unwind, enjoy the beach / pool, and the myriad other activities offered. If you are up to it, the walk to Old San Juan is safe to do (entirely on sidewalk) and takes about 1/2 hour (dress for the heat, and bring a bottle of water along). Is the hotel "perfect", no, but I have yet to visit one even for twice the price that is. We paid $225 / night for a "deluxe plus" in the tower (1265), and were thoroughly pleased. Note: The newest restaurant "Lemon Grass" is now open, but we did not dine there; we mostly dined at Palmeras this time. Also, the Tower, and its 250+ rooms will be closed for renovation from approximately the beginning of September to just before Thanksgiving. Frankly, on a scale of 1-10, our tower rooms have always been an 8 or better!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: caribvirg
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (both 26) stayed at this hotel for one night on July 31 before a cruise. When we booked the hotel in April we were worried because of reviews we saw here but we opted to stay here anyway and we were very happy we did. We arrived around 5pm and our room was not ready yet but we were able to check our bags and explore the grounds a bit and were given free drink coupons so we were not too bothered by our delay getting into our room. When the room was ready I was pleasently surprised that our particular room looked exactly like the pictures on the website and I honestly could not find one thing to complain about. The room and bathroom were clean, the AC worked great, the bed was very comfy, and we experienced no bad odors at all. We went to Old San Juan for dinner which was great but I cannot really comment on the quality/price of food at the hotel itself (I would highly recommend Buru though for great tapas in old san juan) The grounds were perfect. We quite enjoyed laying on a hammock on the beach late at night listening to the ocean while drinking mojitos! On Saturday we got up early and grabed coffee and a bite to eat at Starbucks which was in the lobby and then spent the morning on the beach which again was clean and perfect for getting some sun and having fun in the ocean. There are a few convienience type stores around the hotel as well as a Subway about a 3 minute walk away (a safe walk as well) Overall we were very impressed with this hotel and would have no problem recommending it to others to stay at before/after a cruise. However, I probably would not recommed it to business travelers who may not be taking in the outdoor ammenites that this hotel has to offer. The hotel did not really seem to have it's act together in terms of check-in but it didn't really bother us too much as we were on vacation and were not about to let a delay in getting to our room get us down. Also, families may want to beware because of the lack of affordable food near by.

Reviews.Title: “The new Villas are awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a three room Villa July 25th to the 30th, 2005. This is the only way to go for comfort, space and luxury. The Master bedroom has a King sized bed (very comfortable), flat screen tv, nice chase, balcony and a small table to review the magazines of things to do. The Master bathroom was huge and had separate shower and large garden tub, double vanity. The middle room has a good size kitchen with a full size range, microwave oven, coffee maker, double sink and a full size refrigerator. The family room/ dinning room area is quite spacious and the balcony overlooking the lagoon and the beach is the best of both worlds. The middle room also has a bathroom (with shower) for visiting a guest. My mother stayed in the third room which had two double beds in it, a large bathroom with shower and double vanity. Her room had the best balcony (corner room) great views. Plenty of room in this 3 room villa with 1528 sqft. The Villas have a private pool and jaccuzzi or you can use the pool at the main hotel. The beach was my favorite as the waves are not as large as the rest of the island and easy to swim in. The Hilton added a floting island just off shore which you can swim to and lay on or you can lay in a hammock hanging between the palm trees (get one early). My 3 year old daughter enjoyed both play areas they have and playing in the sand. I liked the privacy of having a private beach and pool. Security does a good job of not being noticeble. The hotels on Condado had public beaches and lots of people on them. The Hilton staff was great with our family, room service was within 30 minutes all three times we ordered. Bell services was very helpful as well as valet (we tip well). Overall, it was a great stay, we rented a car and drove to several restaurants. EL Metropol was excellent both food and service. La Tasca is great for Paella. Mike Benitez is the best for a charter for deep sea fishing. I caught a Marlin and it was 200 pounds. We practiced the catch and release method, you get updates on your fish as others catch it (the tags track all the fishermen who have caught it). The cost is $525 for half a day up to 6 people or just two. The boat is 45 feet, the longest available for this price. The rain forest was awesome (a must see), the waterfalls and tower... The Hilton offers great drinks, most have mentioned the Pina Colada. The bar in the lobby makes the best, the pool bar has a watered down version. The breakfast buffet is excellent (but expensive)! At least my 3 year old had free buffet. Thanks to Lemuel Gonzalez the Villa Manager who I was able to meet upon check in and ensured we had a great stay. Also Nayla Rivera who assisted me with my reservations and flowers for my wife.

Reviews.Title: “lovely grounds”
Reviews.Author: hbsprite
Reviews.Content: I booked an executive floor room (the most expensive room type available) and was promised an ocean-front view. I was on the 7th (out of 10) floor and did have an ocean view, but it definitely wasn't ocean front. I was towards the back of the tower (away from the ocean). I expected the best and was slightly disappointed as far as my view was concerned. The room itself was in excellent condition. The furnishings were brand new and the bathroom was done in marble. There were a few minor maintenance issues with some of the wood trim looking like it had water damage. One thing I did not like was that the hotel automatically added on a $1 per day charge to your account for a donation to a children's charity. Not that I mind donating to a good cause, but I don't like the principle of it. I felt like it was forced upon me and in my rush to check out I didn't want to take the time to get the charges removed. Another similar issue occurred when I ordered room service. On the room service menu it stated that there was a $2.75 delivery fee and that the suggested gratuity was 15%. It clearly said "suggested" and never mentioned that the 15% would be automatically added on. When the food was delivered I signed the receipt and handed the delivery person a $10 cash tip (which was 20%) of the total bill. When I later examined the bill I noticed that they had already added a 15% gratuity to the bill. I was upset. I called room service and told them I felt they needed to convey that a 15% gratuity would be automatically added. I told them that the service was excellent, but not worth 35%. They offered to deliver breakfast to the room the next morning for free, but I declined as I wasn't looking for a freebie. The grounds, restaurants and pools were all top notch. There was an excellent swimming beach right outside the pool with umbrellas and beach chairs, and the grounds were beautiful. Everyone I spoke with was extremely friendly. A quick word of advice for fellow travelers.... Make sure you have a room in the tower (not one of the garden wings) and pay attention to the small print...there is some misinformation about certain charges!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing here folks, move on”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: ALMOST NOT RECOMMENDED. Stayed July 28th & 29th, clearly they have a sewer problem as the trucks (2 huge tanker trucks) came this evening again and the foul smell was evident. I'm on the verge of giving up on Hilton (just reviewed the Prague one 2 weeks ago - obviously I get around). At checkin room not available until 3:15, staff friendly (no big deal). This is a destination hotel and attracts US, South American and European tourists generally with family or friends. Room was adequate size and walls thick to mask sound. Furnishings in good condition but the general state of repair (particularly the bathroom) was fair. Hotels close to the ocean ALL struggle to keep humidity at bay, hence air conditioning runs freezer like to keep wetness in check. I noted the staff always cleaning, but the hotel appear dirty, I attribute this to the heavy guest load this property sees. Several restaurants all fairly pricey (I note that all food in the Island chain is often horribly overpriced). The hotel has a nice walking areas. The beach while not huge, is certainly a plus. Pool area has some features, but it's not a water park or place you'll swim laps. The hotel is situated a fair walk (about 15 minutes to the tourist area), however, the area is generally safe (according to my local associates) and well patroled by police. I stayed in the Tower portion which several have attributed as being the best location. All-in-all, it's simply OK

Reviews.Title: “A Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our vacation began on June 28th thru July3, 2005 with my husband and 3 teenage daughters. I would have to say that I am not one to complain and I did however check all the reviews written before we set out on our vacation. I ignored the "less favorable reviews" knowing that there are some people out there that you will never be able to please. I SHOULD HAVE PAID ATTENTION! The hotel was not at all what you see in the pictures on the internet. This hotel was very run down and neglected. Let me say that there was a foul odor the whole time we were there. It did not take us long to figure out that there was 2 sewer waste disposal trucks outside of our tower that emptied out our waste from the hotel. They were there 24 hrs and the whole time we were there. If you would walk on that side of the hotel (garden tower) there was literaly feces on the ground where it had accidently fallen out of the hoses of the trucks. When it would rain there were buckets cathing the water from the ceilings in the lobbies. The first morning we were there the bellman was running after a mouse that was in the lobby and because he could not catch him with the bucket he was using, the bellmen decided to pound him to death in front of everyone with this bucket. There was a problem with the pool. The hotel was not a place for a family. The resturants were to expensive there and because of the hotel's location there were no places you could walk to and eat. The hallways were never vacummed the whole time we were there. Everytime we would walk out of the elevator on our floor the ashtray that had fallen over with trash remained on the floor for several days before anyone did anything about it. Someone left their food on a tray outside of their hotel room and it stayed there until the next day. We had (2) rooms. They were very neglected. The a/c did not work at all in one and then the other it was too cold and stayed that way. It was soo cold that there was condensation the whole time on the windows. The other room it was clammy and hot. Some of the electrical outlets did not work and the one in the bathroom was very loose. The one time I did try to use the hair dryer it blew a fuse and shut down the air conditioning system, TV. We would lose electricals off/on our floor/room the whole time we were there. The beach was a lot smaller than it appeared in the pictures. What you don't see in the photos is all the construction going on around the streets as well as in the hotel. I could go on, and on however I cannot believe a hotel that has suffered so much neglect could still be in business. The hotel's walls were filthy. To think that this was a Hilton. I wonder when was the last time anyone from the Hilton Corporation has inspected this hotel. I can understand how it would have been a beautiful hotel in it's day but not anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Pleasure at the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Peripeteia2
Reviews.Content: Last week I visited the Caribe Hilton with my family for a conference and vaction. It was a pleasurable experience and one we will long remember fondly. The Hilton was a nice hotel with comfortable rooms and friendly staff. The food was good albeit a little pricey. We stayed in the Tower on the top floor which afforded us a magnificent view of San Juan and the beach below. Nice beach and pool. Beautiful pond area with peacocks and swans. The meeting rooms were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding family vacation”
Reviews.Author: soonerflamingo
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15 month old son and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 3 days, June 15-18, and absolutely loved it!!! The beach was wonderful for a family, it is located in a private cove, so there aren't really any waves. The water is clear, I could still see my feet, even when the water was up to my neck. There are schools of fish that are visible, which is fun to see. There is an area of the beach filled with palm trees, where the hotel has set up hammocks. A great place to pull up a beach chair with a book and relax for a few hours. The pool is very nice, with separate areas. We never felt crowded on either the beach or in the pool. It is a very big area. There are 2 seperate play grounds, one suitable for toddlers, and one for the bigger kids. There are tennis courts, a basketball court and games provided by the hotel. They are also equipped to rent toys for kids to play with in the hotel rooms, for free. The list included "Playskool" and "Fisher Price" toys for babies, up to toys suitable for young teenagers. A nice option for families. The grounds are beautiful. The lobby is open air, which gives it a lovely tropical feel. This hotel is the birthplace of the pina colada, and though pricey at $7, it is defintely worth at least one. Our room was in the newer tower, and was very pleasant. It had a very contemporary feel, with modern prints on the fabric and sleek maple furnishings. The bathroom was very nice, with a huge walk in shower, and a rain-type shower head mounted from the ceiling. All of the rooms had balconies, ours looked out onto the balcony, and we could see Old San Juan (barely) The location has been an issue with some people, but we thought it was great. We always rent a car on the island, so getting around is no problem. It took us about 5 minutes to get to Viejo San Juan, and about the same amount of time to get to the Embassy Suites (in Isla Verde). I think it is a great location, near the action of San Juan, but still right on the beach. A great compromise. There is a local sandwich shop as well as a Subway sandwich shop less than half a block from the hotel. We only ate in one of the hotel restaurants once, and it was good, though pricey. Show me a hotel of this level with cheap hotel food, though. That seems to be fairly standard. There are sooooooo many fabulous restaurants in San Juan, get out, explore, and enjoy the wonderful cuisine of this remarkable island! The service was excellent, and all of the staff were very helpful and friendly. We were very sad to have to check out when it was time to leave, and will definitely be back to the Caribe Hilton on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: ForgetTheOffice
Reviews.Content: Unlike some folks, I found the location to be great. Quite a few good restaurants were only a very short walk away as well conveniences like a drug store. We had an ocean-front room that admittedly was a bit "musky", but so are most ocean-front hotels with carpet. Nevermind the room, we stayed at the pool and (small) beach. There were some tucked-away little private areas by the waterfront, and the pool was fabulous. There was even a waterslide that some of us "big kids" enjoyed, not to mention a swim-up bar. During our stay there was some noisy renovations ongoing which are certainly completed by now.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a few months late writing as I stayed at the Caribe Hilton the first week of February 2005. My sister accompanied me on a business trip, I usually stay at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde when I travel to the island alone but I wanted her to get a feel of the area including the beach. I had not stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 10 years and they have made some nice improvements to the building and grounds. The open air lobby area leading the bar and beach is beautiful. The staff is friendly and will do their best to help you with whatever it is you need. The bar is overpriced but treat yourself to a drink at least once and enjoy the view and music. The hotel restaurants are very expensive. However, you can take public transportation or walk to Old San Juan where there are lots of places to eat at a more reasonable price. If you go into Old San Juan, try La Bombonera Restaurant at 259 San Francisco Street, it's an old luncheonette. Sit at the counter and order fresh squeezed orange juice and expresso. The prices are very reasonable and you can try some local food. The Condado bridge was being worked on when I was there but when it is open, it's a quick walk from the Hilton and is pedestrian friendly. There are many good restaurants on the Condado and on the streets behind it. Explore during the day. Back to the hotel, if you pay an additional small fee to upgrade to the Executive level, you get a continental breakfast until 10:30 am along with snacks and drinks at 5:30 pm and cordials and dessert from 8 to 10pm. It's located on the 9th floor in the old section of the hotel. My room in the old section was comfortable and had been uggraded recently with new good quality mattresses, comforters and curtains. The only complaint was the air vent in the bathroom needed cleaning. The housekeeping staff was good. It helps to tip the maids. When I stay again, I will request a room in the tower as they are a little nicer. The work out area is clean and there is a small cafe next to it with a selection of healthy lunches and juice drinks more reasonably priced than the other places to eat at the hotel. The hotel beach area offers lounge chairs and hammocks and the pool is nice with a great view of the ocean. Hotel parking is $20 per day. If you are staying for a few days,rent a car as it is very easy to drive around and there is so much to see on this beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerChicago
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days at the Caribe Hilton. First the good news -- 7 great restaurants, nice lobby and pools, a small beach behind a breakwall, so no waves and little kids can play in the ocean, very comfortable and clean standard rooms. The biggest problem with the Caribe Hilton is location. Getting around in San Juan is a huge headache and costly. The Hilton is neither in Old San Juan nor in Condado. It's in the middle, and there's nothing there but the Hilton and the Normandie hotel. It's a 30 minute walk (hot sun) to Condado and 45 minutes to Old San Juan. Tried to rent a bike ($7 an hour and a hassle). Tried to rent a scooter for all 5 days, but only option was $60 a day for 9 am to 6 pm (yes must be returned every evening!). Renting a Harley was $150 a day (but at least you could keep it for the whole stay)! Taxis won't use meters and gouge tourists $10-$20 no matter how close you go (that's $20-$40 if you return). Buses (fare: 25 cents)? Both times I tried the bus: stood at bus stops minimum of 45 minutes (including in front of Hilton). Forget it. So conceirge desk pushed renting a car ($30 a day -- bring your proof of insurance from home or you'll have to add $10 a day). Hilton adds $15 a night to park your car. But why get a car? There's not really anyplace to park in Condado and Old San Juan anyway, so having a car is a hassle not a help unless you're going outside San Juan entirely. And the traffic jams up incredibly in Old San Juan and Condado. So here's what I did: took a taxi to Walmart ($20), bought a simple, fully assembled bicycle and lock ($60), and used it for 5 days (total cost $16/day including taxi to Walmart). Then I gave it away to a stunned kid on my last day (with a note to his mom assuring her it was not stolen). Biking to Condado took 8 minutes; to Old San Juan 12 minutes. Nothing worse than getting to a place and not being able to get around at a reasonable cost. Next time I'll stay in Condado (though Hilton itself was nice -- just horrible location).

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights, I thought the room was very nice clean and a great view of the ocean. The people are very friendly and they all speak english which was great for my husband who doesnt speak spanish. They have the best pina colada and the food was good, just dont eat outside of the restaurant unless you like the birds and lizards eating with you or next to you. They have a nice pool with a bar and their own little private beach. I would stay here again, but I think there a little over priced. If you have a car rental be prepared to pay about $15.00 a day and good luck finding a parking spot. Overall I thought it was nice, just nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: chiquito
Reviews.Content: It wasn't till after I had already booked my stay at the Hilton that I found this web site and read a few reviews on this hotel. I was thinking that my stay there was going to be a nightmare. Well, it was anything but! I had a wonderfull time at the Hilton. I purchased their bounceback package, which included buffet bkfst, ocean front view, executive lounge access and use of the health club. The cushened lounge chairs & umbrellas on the private beach were also available at no extra charge. The use of the executive lounge was a highlite of our stay. At 5:30 to 8:00pm in the lounge, cocktails, wine, beer and finger food was served and 8:30 to 10:00pm they served cordials. The executive lounge crew were nothing but professional. All in all, it was the best 5 days I spent in a hotel in a long time. Dates stayed were 5/16 to 5/21/05

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carbie Hilton May23-26 2005. I found it to be very nice but far from everything. Taking cabs everywhere gets expensive so you are stuck eating all your meals in the hotel. Breakfast at the Palmeras was terrible and when I complained they didn't even offer a discount or take anything off the bill. Your better off getting a muffin at the Starbucks located in the lobby of the hotel and saving yourself $40.00 the Palmeras charges for breakfast! The room in the new tower was great (King Deluxe Plus) beautiful bathroom, great view from room 1767! The staff was helpful and quick to fix the clogged toilet in our room. I went to the Wyndam Condado Plaza for dinner and gambling one night and next time would probably stay there because it's in the middle of everything! Overall we had a good time but watch out for the prices and the pool bar, two frozen Mudslides were $19.00!!

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: dynoflash
Reviews.Content: First the check in took over an hour despite myself being a Hilton Gold Honros member. Second the room was dirty and had soiled underwear in the drawers. There was a heavy MOLD growth in the room and ventilation system which was very overpowering and which made me and my family ill.
