Third - upon check out I had a hard time to get a bell man and was forced to carry my own luggage - when I tried to use a push cart to carry my luggage the rest of the way a bell man became confrontational with me and tried to physcially pull the push cart from my hands, Mortons was a disaster Overall - worst I have experirnced and I stay in Hilton properties on a weekly basis Finally they did not process the paperwork so I can have my HHonors rewards points

Reviews.Title: “Caribe is great for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from a 7 day stay at the Hilton Caribe. We are two single girls who just completed our master's degrees and wanted a week of complete relaxation. We were very impressed with the hotel. Our room (in the new tower) overlooked the harbor and was clean and comfortable. We had great service and enjoyed all aspects of the hotel. Compared to other hotels in San Juan, this is a great option. It is afordable, conveniently located to many great areas, and beautiful. There are several restaurants in the hotel--we enjoyed the swim-up pool bar, the Italian restaurant, and Palmerra's for brunch and breakfast. Room service was also great. They delivered each order with complimentary warm cookies. Skip Morton's. We've been to other Morton's and this was awful. Way overpriced and children everywhere. It was comparable to Chucky Cheese. Terrible. The beach was great. Small, but fine. The water is so warm and clear--fish everywhere. There were definitely enough chairs and the chairs all included padding. Be careful with rafts--you can rent them by the day, but they are about $15 each! It rained for four of the seven days we visited San Juan. There is a great tanning salon around the corner, as well as a liquor store and 7-11 type place which are very convenient and more afordable than the hotel facilities. In case of rain, bring an umbrella and tour Old San Juan and the rain forest. Also, while you are there, visit other hotel properties. We went to the Wyndam and the Marriot and were amazed by how much more we enjoyed the Hilton Caribe. If you do anything in San Juan, definitely have dinner at Tangerine at the Water Club. It is AMAZING!!! So cute and so delicious. Isla Verde is a cute area as well. Old San Juan is cute, but very kitschy. Also, we were amazed by how many homeless people were there. We did not feel very safe, especially after dark. Much better to tour during the day and then stay in the resort for the evening. It was fun to visit the cruise ship docks. Bring cards, games, and books to entertain yourselves in case it rains. Puerto Rico is very commercial and San Juan is expensive and Americanized. If you are looking for a pure beach vacation, look elsewhere. If you are searching for a fun vacation with 'American' food and lots of activities, where you can use American dollars and speak English, as long as you don't care about rain, San Juan is great. We spent lots of time at the beach, read lots of books, and watched lots of pay-per-view movies. We loved the pina coladas and the swim-up bar. I returned with a great tan and am very relaxed. Just wish the weather would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went with a couple of family members May 12th through May 16th. The hotel is beautiful. The room was average: small imperfections that could be looked over. We were surprised to find that housekeeping does not come to clean your room until well in the afternoon. We finally figured out that it is probably due to hotel guests desire to sleep in and enjoy their holiday without interruptions. The day we were to check out, housekeeping was knocking on the door around 830am. In addition, this may be the reason why guests have to wait on their rooms to be ready when you check in. I didn't mind, it gives you the opportunity to explore the hotel. Make sure that you request face towels, because they were rarely provided without requesting them. They provided hand towels and bath towels though. Make sure you place all of your towels on the floor each morning, otherwise they may not provide new ones. Recommend you go to a local grocer or store in San Juan, because (of course) the hotel charges outrageous prices for water and soda. My cousin bought a 6 pack of soda (which werent full 12 ounce cans) for $6!!!!! I bought a large bottle of water for $3!!! Food is also on the high side, so dont be afraid to ask the concierge for a local eatery. They suggested La Bombonera in Old San Juan for breakfast. My breakfast was less than $6. A Subway and Sizzler is within walking distance to hotel. Pools are okay for just wading considering the fact that not one of them is over 4 ft deep. However, the swim up pool bar was my favorite spot and we stayed there until they shut down everyday of our vacation. By the way, the pool bar closes WAY too early (6pm). There is also the private beach which I loved and an area with about 4 or 5 hammocks. GREAT place to relax and enjoy the wonderful ocean breeze. Anywhere you order a drink expect it to be a REAL drink. They dont believe in watering your drinks down nor are they cheap. Expect to pay about no less than $7 for a drink. The taxi drivers were all very helpful, however, they drive like madmen. Taxi prices vary: Old San Juan was $8-$10, Plaza las Americas was $12-$16, Wyndham El San Juan (Babylon-club) was $16-$18. Overall, it was a good hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: blucy22
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Hilton has a wonderful private beach that is very relaxing and beautiful. The public beaches in San Juan are very crowded so this was a nice option to have. The pools and grounds are very well kept. The room is just average. We had the buffet breakfast every morning which was excellent! The only con was that the spa/jacuzzi was not part of your fee at the hotel and you have to pay extra for it. All in All, it is a nice place to relax, enjoy privacy, and it is family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful on the outside but terrible in the inside as far as my room is concern. First, I couldn't find my room, I had a garden view you would think wow, it was a garden view under construction, the bathroom had a shower with a drain that I was afraid to use in case of a flooding in the entire room, carpet was stained, the room service food was cold and they automatic charge (not a option) you money for the children services plus room service fee. I had problems with the phone not working, all three phones, i had to yell so the person could hear me, I let the hotel know they still charged me - I requested an upgrade and they said they had no vacancies and i said i saw a several people checking out , no no vacancies. This hotel is more for business meetings and conference there was nothing there to do when the weather was not good. The only time i enjoyed there was a woman who worked in a clothing store, she was wonderful and friendly and kind to me, other than that it was the worst time i ever had and i suggest to pick another place to stay. Never Again. Lucy in Manhattan, New York City

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: tani
Reviews.Content: Being a Hilton Hotel, I expected much more for the cost of the room. But it was close to the bus lines, although you had to dodge traffic to get there. The hotel Normandie was literally right next door and next time I go to PR I'm going to try to stay there. From the outside it was nice and I think the rooms were cheaper. The first couple nights the room was fairly nice, then I checked out to go to Vieques and when I came back they must have put me in the old part of the hotel because the quality of the rooms were remarkably different for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Caribe in March. My room wasn't ready & the hotel clerk tried talking me into a different type of room. I said no; she had an attitude. The room I had was on a low floor, overlooking a roof; and I couldn't use the balcony because of hot air vents & fumes. I did have a side view of the ocean that was nice. Ate dinner at the Morton's steak restaurant, which was lousy & expensive; including the service. The pool areas were nice & service satisfactory. The location is not a walkable one. My overall impression was of a tired property with high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice w/a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: ispin
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a vacation in Puerto Rico and it was lovely. We split our time between the Caribe Hilton and Rincon Beach Resort on the West Coast. My wife and I went with a single mom and her three children, 14, 10, and 8 (they never complained about being bored). I had read many of the reviews of the Caribe and like others, I was somewhat nervous. In the end I relied on a friend's review of her 2004 stay. Upon arriving, I was awed by the view from the open air lobby, whereas you could see the pools, and ocean. Like many others who commented, our rooms would not be ready until after 3:00 P.M. It wasn't that big of a problem because we were able to change and head to the pool/beach area. This area was very beautiful and busy (we were there over Easter weekend). Even though it was packed, we were able to find some free chairs and enjoy the pool and the surroundings. Staff was able to accomdate our request of having rooms close to each other. We were actually next door, rooms 752 & 753. The view was excellent. We could see the garden and the ocean. Even though we were on the 7th floor, you could hear the ocean water, always very relaxing. Rooms themselves were very nice and large. There were some signgs of wear but overall I was impressed. Water pressure was good, the only problem was the cold water never got cold, so we couldn't get any cold water for drinking. Hotel and area seemed very safe. If you are looking for the safety of an all-inclusive that caters to only Americans and European's this may not be for you. There were a lot of locals at the hotel and in the surrounding area, which my wife and I loved. I personally don't like the captive feel of an all-inclusive hotel. We went running several days into the Old San Juan area. It is very beautiful and old world. Regardless if you stay at the Caribe, if you are in the area you must go to Old San Juan and visit one of the forts and go to some of shops. Regarding food, we didn't eat at the restraunts at the hotel because there were so many others around the area. The family that we were with ate there a couple of times and said the food they had was pretty good. The three that stand out are the La Dorado and Ikako(?), and El Hamburger for the best burger in Puerto Rico. Get there early because they get packed minutes after they open the door. Downsides: Except the concierges, the staff was somewhat nonchalont about answering questions and tending to issues. The family we went with had a leak that was not really taken care of in a timely manner. I do agree with others who have said that they could use some work in this area, especially for the price of the rooms. There were a couple of times when there was a sewer type smell in the lobby. Not sure what that was about but we didn't spend much time there so it didn't really bother us. Location could be a bother for some people. Cab rides are $10 for either Old San Juan or Conado, where all the action is. My wife and I walked several times and you're looking at about 35 minutes to either which wasn't a problem for us. It is dark in both directions at night but it seemed pretty safe and I didn't hear about any issues while we were there. Overall a great experience and would defintely return to Puerto Rico and stay at the Caribe again.

Reviews.Title: “Room Broken Into”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Caribe in Puerto Rico from March 25 - March 27, 2005. I had a very disturbing experience, and I question the safety of the guests at this hotel, and thought you should know. On Saturday, March 26 at 6:45pm, someone walked into my room, having used a key. I was changing, and I was faced away from the door. As soon as I said "Hello - who's there" (I did not turn around immediately as I was finishing getting dressed), the person walked out of the room. I then walked into the hallway, no one was there. When I turned the corner, a bellman was there. I asked him if he had walked into my room mistakenly, he said no. I immediately went to the front desk, and alerted them of the situation. Ricardo, the desk manager on duty did not believe me. I requested the general manager, who then came over. Genero (the general manager), assured me that he would have security at my door immediately, to download the information from the lock as to what keys had been used in my lock. I then went to dinner. When I went back to my room, an hour and a half later, no one had been there. Security finally came at 10pm - 3 hours after I had talked to the manager. The manager left a voice mail at 10:30 saying the only other keys used in the lock besides keys issued to the room were housekeeping, and that "I should be safe". Housekeeping was not on my floor when the break in occurred, there was no knock prior to the person entering my room, thus I do not believe it was housekeeping. I truly believe someone - not housekeeping - got a hold of a key to my room, and used it, and only turned away when they found someone in the room. Thus, I question the safety of the guests in the hotel. I also think the manner in which management responded to my complaint was extremely poor. To wait 3 hours to get security to my room is abominable. To assume that "it must have been housekeeping" and consider the case closed is extremely lax security. I stay at hotels approximately 200 nights a year, and have done so for many years. I have only recently started staying at Hilton brand hotels, and if this is the kind of security that Hilton offers, I do not think I - or anyone - should go back.

Reviews.Title: “March 05 at the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: HAFSTBS
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel are amazing. The pool is beautiful and very clean ( a little cold but refreshing!). There seemed to be ample chair space by the pool and "beach" (which is like a lagoon/lake but with ocean water... great for kids). Our room was amazing on the 19th floor of the "New Tower" We had a great view of the lagoon and the fort in Old San Juan in the distance. We faced west and had great sunset views. Our room had a big bed, was clean and the bathroom was amazing. A big shower for two! I think from reviews I have read and from trip advisor reviews posted, if you stay here, ask for a room in the new tower, its worth it! My only complaint about this place was the service. The service from the hotel staff was pretty slow. We ate at Palmeras for breakfast and lunch once each and the service was very slow. BUT at lunch the waiter realized our frustration and comped us dessert from the buffet, which was much appreciated. But for $11 you can get an omlet and toast and for $3 more a cup of coffee you would expect better service! At the pool I saw the slowest moving drink server I have ever encountered! But the $5.50 Medilla Light (local Beers) were reasonably priced for a resort like this. I dont think they actually put alcohol in the daquiris and pina coladas, so stick to beer! Overall, the grounds and nice room was worth it! Yes, we did spend money in cabs to go to Isla Verde to the beach and to go to dinner each night in Old San Juan or Condado, (walk to subway for lunch... its cheaper and the service is better) but thats the price you pay for a resort in a city. The restaurants we went to were Parrot Club (Old San Juan), Aliji Mojili and Zabo (Both in Condado) and I highly recommend each of them!

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby and no casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed for 4 nights at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan. We paid 350 a night and found out on our way out about the 28 dollar "resort fee" and of course the 17 percent tax rate. What is the room rate for we wondered. We found out after we got there that there was no longer a Casino... someone said something abour irregularities and they lost license. Maybe will add one in 2007. The hotel beaches and pools look nice and they have plenty of chairs etc. The restaurants are uninspiring but the breakfast buffet was very good buy at 18 dollars incl champagne. The room had an ocean view but the room itself was sort of worn looking. We got the triple A rate after we arrived because it was 3:30 and I mentioned we could still cancel by 4. The hotel clerk where I made the reservation had insisted that the orig rate was the lowest and did not suggest AAA. It was a holiday weekend and we had to take something, we were in PR for a funeral. Without a Casion in PR I am not sure what the resort fee is for over and above the room fee. I am guessing they do not make as much money without the Casino and so added on this fee for more income. Don't have the bottle of water they leave out in the room or it will cost you 7 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Not to Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I now understand the mixed reviews for at the Caribe Hilton. We stayed there pre-cruise and post-cruise recently - and what a difference 7 days made! The first night was "fair" - room was not ready well after check-in time but we were compensated with a drink on the house for our inconvenience. The bar service was very slow and what surprised me the most was that the servers at the bar were not allowed to handle cash and make change -- they had to take money to a cashier station to log their transaction before providing change - this made the process very tedious and slow -- this also designates that they have a trust issue with the bar staff - not good. The room was adequate - in the renovated tower, with sliding glass door and balcony with ocean view. Bed was very comfortable but leaking toilet kept us awake much of the night. Noticed peeling paint that was in need of repair. The service in the Palmeras restaurant that night was very good. Had an excellent cruise on Celebrity Constellation - topnotch service, all the way! What a downer to return to the Caribe Hilton post-cruise and experience an entirely different experience. The room was not ready (again) and this time no drink coupons (consistency?). We were in the "old" tower this time. The view was spectacular once again, however, what's with the old wooden rotted door from the 1950's leading our to the balcony? - and the rust stains on the carpet? - and more peeling paint? - (at least the toilet didn't leak this time) - but the bath was missing soap dish and more peeling paint in the bath area. In the hallway, there are housekeepers sitting on the floor. Dinner again at the Palmeras, but this time the service was awful. Server was rude and unattentive, but manager ended up comping our meal when we brought it to her attention. But the worst was yet to come: Upon returning to the room after an evening out in Old San Juan, went out on the balcony for a nightcap and a last look at the beautiful view. The old rotted wooden door closes behind us and LOCKS! - We are locked out on the 8th floor balcony at 4:00 am! - very scary, no one around, no security down below. We end up having to remove the old rotted panel at the bottom of the door to let ourselves back in. We call resident manager and ask to be moved to another room. They said they would patch up the door for the night instead. But after we explained all the other issues with our stay, we were moved to another room (in the "new" tower). I'll never forget the stay at Caribe Hilton and would never stay there again. (We paid $280/night for this) -- True, the view is beautiful and the landscaping was impressive - but isn't it what's inside that counts sometimes? and the staff? and the management? - that's what's lacking at Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: cw0904
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton from March 18-22, 2005. After reading reviews on the Hilton I was a bit skeptical but we got a good deal for a last minute trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed in the Main building on the fourth floor. We had a view of the lobby ceiling below us but straight ahead we had a view of the Normandie and the beach. I think for the price (probably the resource we used) and the last minute booking, for the exception of the ceiling below us we had a wonderful view. Being able to wake up hearing the ocean and seeing the waves every morning was perfect. Our shower was not draining properly and it was fixed right away. The services was great. We have no complaints. It is in a perfect location between OSJ and the Condado, Isla Verde area. If we are to go back to Puerto Rico we will return to Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about hotels in San Juan before choosing one. After reading all the reviews, I still had a hard time choosing one. Even the ones that got good reviews still got many really bad reviews and they were quite pricey as well. I ended up going with the pricey one, because I thought perhaps I would at least not end up in a Cockroach palace or something. Well, I was quite pleased with the Caribe Hilton. I stayed there 3 days in February 2005 pre-cruise. I paid $1,120 for the 3 nights which included the breakfast buffet. The room was very nice and very clean. There was no mold anywhere in the room (as other reviews I read said they had terrible mold in the room). I thought the hotel was pretty...lobby and all. The grounds were just wonderful - just like a mini paradise. The only thing I was bummed about is that there was no heated Jacuzzi which I think should have been there considering the prices! We had a 4th floor room in the tower. Like a dummy, I left the sliding glass door open all night thinking that mosquitoes don't fly up that high...wrong! I was eaten alive. I had the biggest bites I have ever got in my life! Funny, I never saw one mosquito or bug! They do automatically add a $1 donation per person and per night to some charity, but I just had them take it off my bill when checking out (when I checked in, they did tell me I could have it taken off). As far as the food goes, I thought it was very good and prices were average for the beautiful and yummy breakfast buffet and for the lovely dinners. Room service was very reasonably priced and served quickly and set up very elegantly! All in all, I definitely recommend the Caribe Hilton if you don't mind paying top dollar. Just one more thing I should mention, I have stayed at just as nice (if not a little nicer) hotels in Orlando and Tampa, FL for less than $100/night. I guess San Juan is just pricey for hotels! If you have any questions, please feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Way Above Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights this past week, and I must say I was very impressed. It's hilarious how some people can have a totally different take from staying at the same hotel. We managed to get a room on the 18th floor (yes, on the newly-renovated tower). I'll let the pictures speak for themselves. Overall, the service was fast (well, for Caribbean standards) and corteous. The concierge, bell captain, and front desk personnels were very nice. We paid about $170/night, way better than the $250+ that other hotels in Condado were charging during our stay. My advice: please, please be nice when you're checking in/requesting service, etc. These guys must face hundreds of surly New Yorkers every day, and it's quite refreshing to them to have nice guests in a while. The lady who checked us in just hung up (read: slammed) on a previous guest when we appoached her. We tried to be as nice as possible (joked about, chatted her up), and we managed to get that gorgeous room facing the ocean. Overall, an excellent stay. I'd recommend this hotel to my closest friends.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Caribe get a room in the tower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe for a conference. Staff was great, rooms were very nice if you get a room in the tower. I did not see other rooms but I heard they were not renovated. My friend said the room was fine but nowhere as nice as the one I had. Bathroom is awesome big glass and tile shower with 2 shower heads. The beach is great and has pretty good snorkeling. Lots of nice little extras.

Reviews.Title: “Back from the Caribe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just got back from 4 days at the Caribe Hilton. I would say it was an average hotel. The fist room we were given was dirty and had trash all over, the next room did not have the ocean view we paid for. It was also noisy at night on our floor. On the positive side, the beach and pool area are wondeful.

Reviews.Title: “Do not spend your money here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. It is suppose to be a 5 star hotel, but in reality is only a two. The staff is indifferent, the prices were very high (2 drinks at the lobby bar for $24), and the rooms were horrible. We had a room overlooking the garden, which is under construction. The construction begins at 6am and continues until the sun goes down. The beach area was ok, as was the pool; however that is the only positive thing I can say about this place. Stay at the Marriott down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Beware--Security is an issue!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 2/19-2/25.....nice room in the tower building but had quite a few incidents where i did not feel safe. First off, the tower building is very far away from the lobby and there is NO security there, anyone can walk in off the street and have access to the floors above. There is an "eye in the sky" type device in the lobby. Opened my door one evening to find a couple milling about, they saw me and hurried away towards the stairs , not the elevators. The beach is nice, as well as the pool, until you realize that a fairly large amount of the people there are locals who have no business being there. An older boy approached my 7 year old son ( he was 14-15) and said he was there with his mother and was staying at the hotel next door. He asked him if he wanted to leave the property if he wanted to go see the pool "over there" When my son asked permission, I approached the mother and they hurriedly took off. I had read in the paper where there is an epidemic of kidnappings in Latin American countries, with children being sold into slavery, and heres my kid about to leave the property (lured?) When I complained to the manager, they ignored me and said that there is a private club that the local people can belong to and that there are members there who are locals. When I persisted and told him that i would notify the police, he dared me to go ahead, "this is a private matter the police wont get involved in" Other incidents occurred and they are too numerous to mention. And this is only in one week! The bottom line is that for this amount of money ( 385 night, plus 20 percent taxes) they should take security a lot more seriously. Someone is going to get raped or kidnapped one of these days! THIS is not a place I would take children to nor would I feel comfortable as a single women being here alone. If you are a married couple and you stay together the whole time, than I guess its ok. But ,There are too many other nice places that take security seriously and do not treat you with an attitude that they do here!

Reviews.Title: “Busy Convention Hotel But Good 7 Day Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton as a result of a conference. Based on some previous reviews, we were prepared to spend the three conference days at the hotel and then move on to another property/island to spend the rest of our vacation week. We ended up deciding to spend the entire week at the Hilton because it was better than we expected. We arrived at about 8pm as a result of our earlier American flight being cancelled out of Miami. Check-in went well; the person at the desk took quite a bit of time trying to find us a good room. We were given room 1569 in the main tower (as opposed to the lower and older garden tower). There is an executive club lounge on the 9th floor of the garden tower that is free for Hilton Diamond members or $35.00 per day for non Diamond members. Our room had a king bed, balcony, and nice bathroom with a beautiful walk in shower (no bathtub). Overall, the condition of the room was good. High-speed internet service was outrageous at $15.00 per day (more about fees later). With only about 6 rooms along our hallway, it was incredibly noisy during the day. The service people seemed to make a lot of racket and talking in the hallway. Our room had a beautiful view of the ocean and coastline. The rooms on one side of the garden tower look out over a huge roof that covers the ballroom-not the view that anyone would want to have. The pool, beach and gardens were very nice. Keep in mind that this is an older property with a lot of convention business. This hotel is celebrating its 55th anniversary this year. Our room's base rate was $200.00 per night but they add a lot of fees on top of that. There was a bellman's fee of $4.50 on the bill (never used them), maid fee of $1.00 per day(we tipped them $2.00 per day on our pillow), resort fee of $16.00 per day and a "kindness" charge of $1.00 per day (it is the hotel's childrenâ€™s charity that they sponsor). Almost every day, we came across people that had arrived only to be told that their room would not be ready until 3:00pm. We enjoyed our stay but I think the quality/location of the rooms can be hit-and-miss.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: jhone
Reviews.Content: We returned from a week's stay at the Caribe Hilton. We also stayed the first week in February last year . We were on the 4th floor in the main building with a wonderful view of the ocean. Last year we were in the same building on 6th floor. Room was large, very clean and comfortable. Maid service replaced used towels twice a day and did a superb job. Room service was always on time and meals were as ordered. We ate at all 4 of the hotel's restaurants and enjoyed them. Morton's was our favorite but the Spanish one and Italian one were very good. The Palmeras was our least favorite for dinner but the buffet breakfast was a great treat with wonderful fruit and great cooked to order items. Thought the $18.50 price to be reasonable for the value received. The grounds are especially beautiful with a great pool with swim-up bar and loads of grounds to stretch out for a wonderful tan. The Hilton has the only private beach in Puerto Rico and it is well protected from large waves by a man made barrier that is a about 200 feet out from the beach area. It is safe and clean; I noticed hotel employees making rounds daily and gathering up clumps of seaweed and other items to assure a clean and safe area. Anyone with little children would appreciate the beach area. The common areas are well kept and attractive. While the first floor lobby area is open, I never saw a bug (flying or ground type) in there the entire week. In February, the hotel is not exactly inexpensive but for a winter retreat from the snow-belt, it was a bargain to us. The location is good. It is between the congested Condado beach area and Old San Juan. Both are a $8 cab ride or, probably, a 30 minute walk. For access to some of the wonderful Old San Juan restaurants, I found the location very convenient, safe and desireable. We'll probably return next February.

Reviews.Title: “It was better than I had expected...but still not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, I visited the Caribe Hotel and after reading the reviews I was a bit terrified at what to expect. I actually took some of the reviews with me to show the front desk if they tried to pull some of the stuff some of the other reviewers said. Sure enough, right when we got there the man at the front desk said that our room wasn't ready and if we would stay in a side room and sleep on a sofa bed for that night then the next night our deluxe room with a queen size bed would be ready. Needless to say I waived the reviews in his face and told him that I had read that the Caribe did this (not having people's rooms ready) He promised the room would be ready and that they would even move our stuff. The next morning we went down and the room wasn't ready...one more night he said. The next day we got our room. Third day there though. Also yes it is off the road and we had to take taxis to everywhere. Also there was a big storm our last night and we got in a taxi and they shut down all the roads practically...we drove around for at least 45 mins. had to pay this woman something for taking us right back to our hotel. We ate at the Madrid Tapas restaurant and the food was good. Recommend Ajili Mojili which is across the bridge by all the other resorts. The concierge was somewhat helpful in finding restaurants and clubs to go to. Overall, it was okay. Grounds are beautiful though...if you like laying outside and relaxing...private beach is great for that.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time just as good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Caribe Hilton. We use Hilton Honors points for our stay, and when we checked in didn't get the room we had requested. I talked with the manager and we had to stay first night in the room they had. Only when I went to the Hilton Honors desk, did we get confirmation that they would move us to the requested room. (The rooms in the tower are much nicer.) Now the good part. Delta lost my 5 year olds bag. Sonya at the concerige worked night and day to get it back. The room we had in the tower was fantastic. The pools were clean and fun. The Hilton Honors breakfast bar and happy hour bar were a nice treat. The activities were fun. Especially for the children. They had a big arcade for rainy weather, taxi's available 24/7. Old San Juan was only $8 ride in a taxi. The travel excursions were a bit pricey, and we stayed at the pool most of the time anyways. The spa/excercise facility was state of the art. The restaurant in the spa was really good for healthy lunch. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Donna West Hartford, CT

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel in an OK island”
Reviews.Author: cgd284
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Hilton for a week from 1/31/05 to 2/4/05 and found it to be a good hotel but VERY overpriced. Then again overpriced is the theme in San Juan Puerto Rico. They just spent $60 million renovating the hotel but some sections of the hotel are still not quite up to date. The hotel has a nice beach and pool area but is not within walking distance of anything. Thats where the overpriced taxis come into play. If you must go to Puerto Rico, then this is a good choice among the hotels in San Juan (if you can get past the $18.50 breakfat buffet and $7 bottle of water from the mini bar). If you have an option go to the Dominican Republic or Mexico and spend 1/2 of the money on eveything.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahBelle
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Carbie Hilton, from a 6 night stay, after reading the mixed reviews from this website, i took mostly potivite things from it. The hotel is somewhat set back from the road, with very nice landscaping, the lobby has no doors, so the breeze was enjoyable while waiting on the long line. When you get the chance to check in, it was fast, but there was a reasonable line. We stayed in a "Garden view" room, which i am not sure if it was the oldest section, but it seemed that way. It was a decent size, two double beds, but we had some complaints. Our phone was broken, and after a couple of calls to the front desk it still wasn't fixed. The lighting in the bathroom was horrible, the closet door didn't close, both the toilet paper holder and the soap holder (in the shower) were broken. Around all the edges of the entire room and bathroom looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a long time. The air conditioning vent was clogged with dust, it only made me think of what we were breathing in, not sanitary. There were stains on the rug, dirty windows and occasionally the TV would flicker. All along the halls, they have a molding that comes halfway up the wall, the molding was falling off and we saw a sworm of tiny ants, right in front of our door. The view was nice if you kept your head straight up, but if you looked down there was construction. If you are a light sleeper, you would have been woken up by the drills and the machines, and also the Peacocks. Most of these things aren't horrible and i hate to sound picky, but when you pay $400 a night for a room, the little things should be fixed. The grounds were very nice and clean, tons of staff, if it is possibly they should clean the lagoon, there was tons of garbage floating around. Everything there is way overpriced, breakfast buffet is $18.50 a morning. Your "waitor" comes to the table, asks if you want coffee and you don't see them again. When the bill comes, there is a little saying on the paper to tip your waitor the suggested 15%. Im sorry but i am not paying someone any extra for saying 5 words, and that is it. If you don't tip them, they don't seem very happy either. The same thing goes for all the bartenders, the taxi boys, valet and everyone there that is wearing a shirt. Not to mention when we recieved our bill at the end of our stay, the hilton charged us a dollar a day to donate to their foundation, without permission, so be aware. We never had a problem finding a taxi, yet again overpriced, my problem with this hotel, is the location. You have to take a taxi everywhere, and there is nothing around the hotel. A taxi is at least $10 for about 5 minutes, it is a drive everywhere, we walked near the marriot one night and it took 45 minutes. If i could suggest to stay anywhere it would be the Wyndam Condado Plaza, or the Marriot, it is ideal if you don't want to spend every waking moment at the hotel. There are restauraunts and clubs accross the street from the Wyndam and the Marriot, more ideal location. We went horseback riding through the hotel, overpriced, but had so much fun, we went snorkling at the hotel, and there isn't anything to see except cloudy water, we ate at the italian restauraunt in the hotel, and spent $84 on two people, not including drinks, wayy over priced but the food was excellent. The outdoor eatery is all fried food, we had Mortons one night for desert and it took 30 minutes, and it was average. All in all, this hotel has no night life, but a lot to offer during the day, when you have a hotel so secluded a larger nightlife should be necessary, the rooms were below average and the grounds were above average. Like I said, if you are comming here to stay in the hotel to whole time, it is nice, but if you are looking for something to do, not the best place. Hope i helped.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: kleef
Reviews.Content: We saw mixed reviews here and decided to stay at the Caribe Hilton anyway. We were not dissapointed. We stayed in "the tower," which has refurbished rooms that were nicely appointed. The bathroom is incredible: large, with dual sinks, marble, and rainforest shower that will easily fit two people. Pool area is lush and nice. Pool was completely clean and clear while we were there. There is no outdoor hottub however which was disappointing. We ate at Madrid's Tapas and had a wonderful meal and great service. The hotel is on it's own little penisula, not far from both Condado and Old San Juan areas. Very walkable area, although not especially close to eateries and stores. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “dont go here!”
Reviews.Author: lovinthesunLISA
Reviews.Content: Definately in a seedy area! WE were scared apon arrival, and we live in the Bronx. The room the gave us was on the side of hotel were construction was going on, so we asked for a room change immediatly. WE ot it but the next room wasn't any better. The pool has garbage in it, like alot of plastic cups. The nightly entertainment is a cheesy and screeching woman, who the locals like. Taxis to Isle Verde and Old San Juan are not cheap, so just stay in one of those areas. Avoid this hotel no matter how good the deal. Actually if you are looking for an affordable & beautiful carribean spot, avoid Puerto Rico, just go to Punta Cana, Dominican Republic.

Reviews.Title: “not the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 5 days in the executive suite area. I agree with a previous review-- they need new towels- they feel like old cleaning rags. Too bad because it really is a nice hotel, very relaxing but not very clean. DO not eat in the Spain of Madrid restaurant.. found bug in water andd they did not care. Great restaurant not too many know off only rich locals-- La Casona, excellent food and service. Also, Ropa Vieja excellent Puerto Rico and Cuban cuisine. Never visit when a new Governor is taking power.. Hotel was full of security, could not get taxis. Too many areas closed off. Not to the benefit of guests who paid $441.00 per night plus another $120.00 for hotel tarriff and taxes.Overall, the hotel is nice and it is too bad that they do not invest money in a casino, new towels and upgrade their cleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: wheelspw
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the Caribe and had a good experience. I'm a Diamond member and the benefits paid off. The Executive lounge was well staffed, had a good breakfast and a great cocktail selection and hours. We only ate dinner at one of the restaurants onsite, the Tapas Room and the food was excellent. We had lunch at the Olas Spa. Its a great option for the healthy eater. The lunches there were very well and the service was great. The location was ideal as you could go 5 minutes in one direction and go to a number of great restaurants in Old City and 5 minutes in the other direction to Condado. The gym in the health spa was great, even better than most gyms you would pay for. The lagoon area/beach was very nice and well kept. The room was well appointed and nicely furnished. The balcony was tiny, we didn't bother trying to sit out on it at all and it overlooked the top of the lower section of the building with a huge air vent..not too appealing but could be easily overlooked. All in all.. a really nice option for downtown San Juan area..we would definitely go back..

Reviews.Title: “Caribne Hilton was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When looking for a pre cruise hoteI I saw many mixed reviews on the Caribe Hilton. I was a little nervous about the service and conditions I kept hearing were not up to par but I have to say Im so glad I decided to stay here. The check in was fast and the receptionist was very friendly and accomodating. The resort area was absolutely beautiful! There were several (clean) pools connected with a swim up bar, a (clean) relaxing private beach that never got crowded. The water is protected by a rock lagoon so there are no waves, theres floating platforms in the center and kayaks to rent from the towel stand. I liked the hammocks they had set up in the shade under palm trees, it was so relaxing. The restaurants were pricey but the food was very good in the Italian and International restaurants, the outdoor snack area had a fried chicken and plantain meal that I enjoyed. I ate outdoors at the International restaurant and had no problems with bugs as mentioned in another review, it was a romantic dinner. They claimed to have invented the pina colada here which was also claimed by another small restaurant in Old San Jaun but either way they were so good at the hotel. I loved the deluxe ocean view room, it was spacious and well decorated, we had a balcony with a table and chairs with an absolutely beautiful view of the pools and ocean. There was an upscale spa on the property set away from the hotel that I did not use as well as tennis courts and a beautiful old fort right next to the hotel. The hotel wasnt too far from the pier, airport or Old San Juan but the taxis were expensive. We walked to the Wyndham to play the casino one night. It was kind of far and we had to go around construction but worth it because the slots were loose! When our 2 days were up we realy did not want to leave this hotel, I could have spent the entire vacation chilling out here! I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were nice but the noise was out of control”
Reviews.Author: Mickeytoo
Reviews.Content: Went to San Juan in March of 04 stayed there for an extended weekend. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were pretty nice. However our room overlooked the garden area and the peacocks kept us up most of the night. I believe it was a white male that was the culprit. They made so much noise at times it was just unbelieveable. Also they were doing construction on part of the hotel so usually we were up all night with the peacocks and then up very early in the morning with the construction workers. Not sure if they are finished their renovations by now but beware! Also we ate breakfast at the resturant there near the pool ONCE and it was in my opinion very expensive, also there were bugs flying around and in the pastries. We soon discovered a little resturant right across the street from the hotel where we ate breakfast for a third of the cost of the breakfast at the hotel. I was also disappointed in the beaches or lack there of but I'm sure that's just mother nature and has nothing to do with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: kelfly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe for three nights early December, pre-cruise. We booked direct through Hilton, not a Price-line, etc. We paid $195/night for Executive level and were in the main building on the 10th (top) floor. The executive lounge was on the 9th floor. We had an ocean view with a small balcony. The check-in was easy; we were able to check in on the 9th floor executive lounge. The room was plenty spacious and clean. The grounds were incredible! We did not "use" the pool, but there were always plenty of loungers at it. We preferred the beach area and never had a problem getting a nice quiet spot. The staff were all quite friendly. The staff in the executive lounge were superb. Free continental breakfast; free "happy hour" with cocktails, wine, and appetizers from 5:30 - 8:00; and cordials and desserts (cookies, etc) from 8:00 - 10:00. Hotel has a nice workout facility (a short walk down the beach in a different building). There is also a spa facility in this building. Tennis courts are also available. Water sports rental (mats, etc) available. We brought our own snorkeling gear and snorkelled out near the rock barrier; saw quite a few fish. Within walking distance to OSJ (about 35 minutes) and Condado (about 35 minutes). As mentioned, very limited in restaurants nearby. We did find a local Puerto Rican diner about 2 blocks away that had tasty local dishes. No shopping close by. We really enjoyed our hikes into OSJ and Condado (different days!). I would have no probelm staying at this resort again. It would also be a nice place to stay for a longer land based vacation as opposed to precruise.

Reviews.Title: “Progressively Getting Worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The swimming pools are poorly kept with obvious signs of only GAWD knows what in the water. The Palmeras restaurant buffet seems to always be infested with fruit flies....you're better off staying at the San Juan Mariott for the money you pay here. There are no other restaurants close to this hotel so you are basically stuck with what's available at their inflated prices. The rooms are Ok - the service could be better. If you don't drink liquor have them seal the refrigerator...else they'll try to charge you for missing items. Not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask 4 More... :)”
Reviews.Author: ezalmas2
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Caribe Hilton for the past 4-Year's with my wife,daurgter & my garnd-son (10) and we alway's have a great time,We alway's go in the summer for about 10-day's when the World Congress of Salsa is being held there. My daurgter is a Pro-Dancer and compette or give dancing lessons while we're there. And the Hotel,Beach,pool or any of the show's & attivitys are the best i've seen or been in. I'll recomen this to any of my friends or co-worker's.. The breadfast buffiet are great, Lots of good food and great servies. We are already making resevations for next summer "August" to go back. Last year we stay in two-Hilton hotels, The one in San Juan for 6-days then we went to the one in Ponce which is a Hilton-Resort & Casino for 8- days and we love them both. All i can say is we had a great summer Vacation and will alway's come back. From a 1 to 10 I say it's a TEN "10" Thank you so much to the Staff of the Caribe Hilton Hotel.... The MAS Family...

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise for one night, Sunday October 24, 2004, myself, my spouse and my parents. The rooms and the hotel far exceeded my expectations, especially considering the mixed reviews I have read here. The arrangements were made through Celebrity. Both rooms were overlooking the beach and the pool, on the Executive Level, they were spacious, bright, clean and overall were great! The Executive Level included a lounge with Continental Breakfast, Complimentary Coffees, Afternoon Hors D'oeuvres, Cocktail Hour, and Evening Coffee with cordials, all complimentary. We had dinner at Morton's Steak house, it was great, expensive, but in line with every other Morton's Steak House. The breakfast buffet was very good, wine, champagne all out, so you could help yourself to mimosas, the food in the buffet was very good as well. The grounds were meticulously maintained, the pool and beach were great. The staff was professional and very friendly, really wished we could have stayed longer than a day, will definitely go back for a vacation there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were staying here due to a convention. After spending 12 hours flying or in airports we were just glad to see a bed. We were greeted by the sounds of Puerto Rico when we entered the lobby, which was lovely. If we had not been so tired, we would have asked for another room. -The mildew was horrid. I even took a picture of what the view was from the toilet in the bathroom and sent it to the hotel after we left. This bathroom had NO vents or fans, maybe that was a hotel perk...a sauna! -The picture that was to be on the wall was missing and the clips to hold it were still there with huge scratch marks on the wooden wall. -The light next to our bed was not working, when I went to touch the bulb to see if it was screwed in tight the whole socket exploded sending sparks everywhere. This was reported, but never fixed. -We could not close the doors over the TV and screws were falling out when we tried, so we left it open. -The carpets were way past cleaning time. I was glad I had slippers! -We paid and extra $35 per day so our 20 yr old daughter could join us. I don't know what the $35 was for. We never had extra towels for her, or glasses to drink from, etc. I don't feel I should have to ask for something I have already paid for on a daily basis. On the plus side: -Great view. -Good location with lots of easy transportation to town. -Very nice pool and access to the ocean. ONE FACT I learned while in PR, no one (hotels included) can own a beach and they are open to all the public. So anyone visiting PR could access the beach at any hotel! Pretty nice idea if you want to check out other hotels while you visit. -Room service was quick and good and a good value. The hotel eating establishments are a bit pricey if you eat there for most of your meals, and the only place to eat outside the hotel within walking distance is Olla's Health Bar (Healthy!!)and Subway (clean?)! -People were friendly and helpful. -If we ever stay there again I will insist on seeing the room before I sign in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MPKgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April, 2004. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beach is rather small if you like to lay on the sand. The pool area offers plenty of room to lounge. However, be prepared to get up very early to get a chair. They go fast! The service was great and the food was very good. It's in a great location and a taxi to shopping and restaurants in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with the Caribe”
Reviews.Author: kokochenille
Reviews.Content: After seeing the mixed reviews about the Hilton Caribe, we went with our gut feeling and decided to try it anyway. I must say that my boyfriend and I were very pleased with our choice. The property itself was spacious, clean and well maintained. Also the benefit of having our own private beach was phenomenal. The staff, as a whole was also courteous. As previous reviews had stated, the island is very humid, which may have potentially lead to the level of mildew content our oriinal room contained. (rm 1669)We asked to switch rooms and it was done so immediately. The mildew scent was at a minimum and the view was fantastic. (roon 1863 to be exact) The breakfast was great. (A little pricey, but very goood.) All in all, after actually going to San Juan and visiting the other hotels to see what we had passed up to stay at the Caribe, I must say that we were pleased with our choice and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe was Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days in SJ in early September. Was a little apprehensive about staying at Caribe Hilton after seeing so many mixed reviews. However, at great rate of $74 per night via Priceline, we couldn't resist. Room was perfect---clean and in very good condition. Balcony overlooked beautiful pools and the beach. The ongoing construction is on the other side of the hotel. Staff very efficient and courteous, especially Sandy at the front desk. Only complaints would be about the restaurants: food just fair and overpriced. Much more enjoyable to visit local restaurants to sample the PR specialities and atmosphere instead of a chain restaurant, such as Morton's at the hotel. Location is perfect---short drive to Old San Juan and the "Condado strip". On next trip to PR, will stay at the Caribe again. Even during the Tues night and Wed when Hurricane Jeanne hit, there were no problems. During the worst of the storm, the free coffee bar in the lobby was a busy meeting spot for many guests talking about their first hurricane experience. When we left on Thursday, grounds were cleaned up and again in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the location can't be beat for the price. But in reference to a previous posting that mentions "once you leave the U.S. you have to not expect U.S. standards" I don't know if they realized that they were still in the U.S. So that comment was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe convenience can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this resort. It is conveniently located between Old San Juan and other parts of the city. The private beach cannot be beat. I got a great rate on the executive floor that made it all worth it. This is my third time at the Caribe and I have been to almost all of the better hotels in Puerto Rico. While the restaurants are expensive, each of them has their own style and the food and service is good. On the weekends, the beach services are perfect for the kids. On the downside, there is always a funny smell in the hallways. The housekeeping staff is only average. I had a room that overlooked the construction site, but I only heard noise when out on the balcony. I spent 4 nights by myself and never felt lonely. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers, families or couples going for a quick weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman413
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton on July 24, 2004 for one night prior to our cruise. We got in rather late and were given a room that smelled moldy and had wet carpet. I called to complain about the situation and was not offered any alternative. The next morning we tried to eat breakfast but the restaurant had a horde of people in a big line waiting to eat. The view off our balcony was mainly a construction site. Other members of my family stayed there also and were put in rooms on the concierge floor for less money than I spent and had a decent stay. The management has given me a 50% refund on our room. I would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Caribe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for six nights in May, 2003 and were very satisfied with the property. The hotel itself is ideally located adjacent to the Condado Lagoon, half way between Old and New San Juan. Hilton promotes the fact that there is an old Spanish fort on the San Geronimo grounds. This was somwhat misleading as the fort, at that time, was fenced off and appears dangerously located on the rocks and coral. That being said, Caribe Hilton had several benefits. The staff were friendly and the rooms clean. Our view overlooking the San Juan coastline was absolutely breathtaking. It was very relaxing and beautiful. There are approximately 4-5 restaurants on-site including Morton's of Chicago where my wife and I had one of our best meals ever. While the exterior facade appeared somewhat dated, the management spent considerble time and money renovating the lobby/atrium. It looks really nice when you enter the building. Having visited both the Wyndham Condado and the Marriott Stellaris, I am glad we chose the Caribe Hilton in that both Marriott and Wyndham have casinos attracting a noisier, more eccentric crowd. Another nice aspect of Caribe is a private, man-made beach with a large pool with swim-up bars. All in all, this is a four-star property. Unlike other resort stays, you will probably spend a great deal of time away from the property. Old and New San Juan have many fabulous restaurants, bars, and shops to explore. There is a car rental agency across the street with affordable rates so that you can explore the rest of the island. Puerto Rico is beautfiful. We had a great time at Caribe and would definitely stay there again the next time we visit San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A truly luxurious resort and hotel experience. I stayed here for 4 nights on business and have never stayed at a nicer place than this Hilton. The view was wonderful, the food great and the rooms were clean, spacious and well-kept. The only problem I had was a leaky sink in the bathroom, but who cares when everything is so fantastic. Truly awesome hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the kids!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How was it? Really! Overall, it's wasn't as bad as some of the previous reviews mentioned. Some of the issues are true and can be a nuisance, but what did you expect? The Ritz? The hotel is great if you have little kids. The pool area was well laid out for adults and kids. The sheltered beach area was even better for little one. There were no waves to knock them over. Our room was recently renovated and was fairly clean. The bathroom was pretty nice and had a large shower. It had a good size TV with movies and games for a fee. As I mentioned, overall it wasn't that bad. But, there were some issues that were annoying. Yes, they are renovating portions of the hotel. So, the work is done during the day and there is some noise. This is a definite problem if you are trying to take an afternoon nap. Some of the elevators did not work at times, so we had to use the service ones. It was better that the stairs from the 15th floor. The hotel does show some signs of its age, but they are making an effort to refurbish it. But, things are done a little slower in PR than the states. It's just a fact. We would stay there again, but I would try to get a better rate. It you want high service and cleanliness, go to the Ritz. That is what we did. Instead of having a disappointing vacation, we leveraged our time. We stayed at the Hilton for 3 days and the rest at the Ritz. Yes, it was a little more, but it worked out just fine. After all, it is pretty difficult to sift through all these reviews. Some are good and some are bad. We have plenty of new resort properties in Orlando and it's hard for some foreign locations to compete with the amenities and service levels we expect as Americans. Once you leave the US it's always a gamble. But, I try to be fair and honest to all involved. Your vacation time is very valuable and should be taken seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton to start our honeymoon before our cruise. We were a little apprehensive because of some of the other reviews on this site but we really enjoyed the hotel. First of all everyone at the hotel was very nice and we had no problems checking in three hours early either. The open air lobby is very unique and the grounds are just gorgeous! It is an older hotel but it is still nice. We also faced the fort where there was construction but we never heard a thing. We were a little unprepared for the food prices at the restaurants in the hotel, but the prices were comprable to other restaurants in the city. We had a good experience at this hotel and would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hiton is the way to go”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from PR on July 17. We stayed at Caribe Hilton for 8 days and this is truly one of the best hotel in San Juan area, not only according to us but also according to the locals. The hotel room is around 3 star rating, and they are a bit slow is fixing things. But the view and the lanscape of the hotel really make it worth it. When you walk out to the pool area, you will have a 240 degree view of the atlantic ocean. And at night you can see huge fish under the hotel pier. The beach turned out to be the best beach in San Juan. Trust me, we look around town for a better beach and fail. The food in the hotel is expensive, but who cares, because we love to try the local eateries. There's a sandwich shop right infront of the hotel, that sale cheap and great cuban sanwiches. PR turns out to be the best vacation place I've ever visited. And I've been to Bali and Spain as a comparison. It's like having the European feeling, US convenience in the tropical setting. Don't leave PR without visiting one of the bioluminiscent lagoon. It will blow you away. Plus point, PR use US dollars, US stamps and our cel phone work as if we're in the continental US. Rent a car. The driving is not as bad as mexico city or europe. And the trafic is comparable to Houston, Texas. Try the Paella, and Mofongo (local dish made with mashed plantain filled with meat). And learn to salsa before you get there, so you can visit one of the salsa dance places. Old San Juan is only 5 minutes from the hotel. The traffic is bad to go there, but it's so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not such a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from seven days at the Caribe Hilton. The grounds are beautiful, the pools are nice and the service was good. We booked the vacation package through Liberty Travel and was surprised that when we got to the hotel that the buffet breakfast and one drink was free to us. Now for the not so nice things about the hotel. One day we were out for several hours sightseeing in Old San Juan. When we got back to our hotel room our door was open. It was not wide open, but open enough for anybody to walk it. I called the front desk and they said that the maid must have left it open and to check to see if anything was missing. Luckily nothing was missing. But that gave me an eerie feeling. Anybody could have just walked in and stolen everything. We did keep our valuables in the safe though. Another thing deals with the shower. We had a separate shower stall in the bathroom. The drain was really clogged to the point where none of the water was draining down. When my niece opened the shower door all the water came crashing out of the shower onto the floor as well as the carpet outside of the bathroom. We went to the front desk to report it and they said that they would have someone to look at it that night. Since we were going out that night we asked if someone could come the next day. The person at the front desk assured me that someone would be there first thing in the morning. When no one showed up by noon we called the front desk. Apparently someone put down that it was already fixed. They did send someone to fix it though. Someone from housekeeping was supposed to dry out the carpet, but the day we left the carpet was still wet. So much for that. The nightlife in the hotel stinks. There really is nothing for you to do and going to Old San Juan every evening gets stale after a while. The hotel had this woman singing at night in their bar. At first we thought it was Kareokee night her singing was that bad. If you want to do nothing at night I recommend this hotel. On the weekends it seems that local comes to the hotel to stay. It gets rather noisy in the pool area. Also, I might add, the sand on the beach is dirty with cigerette butts and other things that people just throw on the ground. It isn't very well kept up. If they spend less money on the grass outside of the hotel and more money on renovating the place it wouldn't be such a bad hotel to stay in. We were in the Tower section. The bodega to get the bottled water and other things is not too far from where we were staying. I doubt that I would ever go back to PR, but if I do I will not stay at the Hilton. One more thing. If you go to the Conserge to ask for places to eat or menus beware of a place called Bon Appetite. It is a service that will get you any kind of food you would like and deliver it to you. My niece and I wanted Chinese food. We ordered three things and the total was over $50. The beef with broccoli was over $17. Don't use this service if you can help it. We wound up ordering Domino's pizza instead. I hope this helps someone. If you have any questions you can email me at schills1@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Suggestion for finding a Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: halcyonlondon
Reviews.Content: Suggestion: After much research and contemplation between the Caribe Hilton, Intercontinental, and Wyndham Condado hotels, I booked the Caribe Hilton on Hotwire.com for Labor Day weekend. Saved $175.00 per 3-night stay compared with rates found elsewhere. Secured a $102.00 nightly rate plus taxes. It's a good deal, however, a bit of a crap-shoot--there's a chance that you 'll end up in either the Hilton, Wyndham, or Intercontinental. If you'll be happy at any of the three, which we were, check out Hotwire. Just you do your homework, pick a place in a four- or five-star rating, and you can usually figure out where you'll be staying. Hotwire is a role of the dice, but not entirely surprising, for certain destinations. We were betting on the Caribe Hilton, and got it. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better for the $!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that a hotel with the Hilton name, and with these prices, was so lackluster. I definitely think you could do better elsewhere. There are two major concerns: 1. OLD FACILTIES WITH POOR UPKEEP. The main building, which I stayed in, dates back to the 1950's-- and you can really tell. Everything in my room had some little problem with it: two of the lamps didn't work, the door couldn't be closed without slamming it, the toilet didn't flush all the time, my key kept not working, and one of the elevators (there were only 2, for hundreds of rooms) was out of service frequently. Overall, none of these were huge issues, but it meant lots of little hassles, that added up to not as pleasant of a vacation! I think poor housekeeping, as some other writers have suggested, was probably also part of this issue. For instance, the small red (dryclean-only-type) decorative pillows they thoughtfully placed on the bed had suspicious whitish stains on them. All I could think was, yuck! 2. There is noisy construction right next door! (as of June 2004). On whole side of the hotel (the side facing the historic small fort) now overlooks a concrete-and-iron, half-finished, condo building, with bright yellow porta-potties decoratively placed right on the beach waterline, where your eye is naturally drawn. I guess in the past this must have been an attractive water-and-greenery view, so people who stayed here in the past probably had a better experience. The construction noise wasn't really that loud, but it was constant--7 days a week including Sunday, and starting early in the morning. I really didn't end up using the balcony because of this issue. (of no view plus noise) Overall, again, this wasn't a huge issue but it did detract from the overall experience. Overall, the Frommer's guide makes this place sound much nicer than it is. I think I read there that it had "one of the nicest beaches in the area"--and while I didn't visit all the other beaches, I was really surprised that the Caribe beach was supposed to be a great beach. It was really very small and had lots of rocks once you got in the water. If you want to walk along an expansive beach you will just end up going out on the street to get to one of the public beaches (which, by the way, were perfectly nice!) Overall, my feeling is you could do better for the money. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The important things.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our 5 day stay at the Caribe Hilton was overall great. The only complaint that we had was the housekeeping, they didn't pay much attention to details. The night we checked into the hotel, there was a dirty diaper in the bathroom, the toilet seat was 'wet', there was hair in the shower and the hallways could have used some vacuuming. We complained about this the following morning and the hotel manager offered us a garden suite. We went to see the suite but decided that our 13th floor room, which was newly renovated, was much better for us even though smaller. The manager offered us another room on the 16th floor, which was identical to ours, but still the trouble of moving three floors was not going to gain us anything especially having a small child with us. So the manager gave us a $75.00 credit at the Palmera's restaurant. That was very nice! There is one aspect of our visit at the Hilton that left a lasting impression and that was guest relations. The night we arrived one of our friends felt sick and was about to pass out (diet issues), and right away one of the hotel staff saw that we were having problems and called for security. The security personnel dressed in a suit arrived with a first aid kit and oxygen. They also phoned for a doctor (which by the way will charge $120.00) but we had them cancel the doctor after our friend was feeling better after drinking a soda. Two days later another friend of ours was swimming with me out at the reef barrier when he stepped on a sea urchin which stung him in nine different places on his foot. We swam back to shore and my wife approached one of the hotel staff members who was sweeping the sidewalk and told him that our friend had been stung by something in the water. He immediately dropped the broom and literally ran to get help from the lifeguard. The lifeguard arrived with a first aid kit and after examining the foot sting, he recommend that my friend go to the hospital and have the 'splinters' removed. The Hilton security gave us a ride to the local hospital. After we were done I phoned the hotel and they picked us up and drove us back to the hotel. One more incident happened, the in-room safe code had been re-programmed accidentally. Again I called security and they attend us in a very quick and professional manner. After the incidents we went through, the housekeeping problems became minor issues. I was very impressed with the guest relations and the security personnel. Again they were all well dressed and tended to us in a very professional and prompt manner. This gave me a good sense of well being for my family and me, which is far more important than 'cosmetic' issues. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Justmyopinion76
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 5 day stay at the Caribe Hilton with a group of friends. The newly renovated (13/14th floor) ocean view rooms were lovely with great shower/bath, small balcony and wonderful beds. Via the "Puerto Rico is Fun" promotion, we had a wonderful buffet breakfast and one drink per day included in our room price, and 4th night free... a great and relaxing plus. Buffet was great, with huge fresh selection. The beach was clean, chairs plentiful and never excessively crowded- free umbrellas too. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and the concierge gave exceptional recommendations for dinner in old San Juan! The only drawbacks: some members of our party had to wait for their room on check-in, and one day our room was not made up (it was done later when we called to ask), and the view of the hotel being constructed next door from some of the rooms is disappointing (though not noisy at all from the upper tower floors); the on-site restaurants are convenient but seem overpriced and uninteresting compared to the similarly or lower-priced and more inventive food available in San Juan, just a short cab ride away. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: JaneRussel
Reviews.Content: Spent a week there on business. The staff was friendly and responsive. Rooms reminded me of kinda upscale Holiday Inn (if that is possible) but in need of some sprucing up. Bed was comfortable and room was kept clean by housekeeping staff. The food at the restuarants was acceptable but nothing to rave about. The best thing about the place is the grounds whch are very well-kept and visually appealing. The pools and beach are inviting. All things considered, not a bad place to stay. A good palce for kids. Be sure to get out of the hotel. You can ride a bus downtown for 25 cents. They are safe and pretty quick. There is a pretty good but very informal restuarant within walking distance (about a block), behind the nearby soccer stadium, called Escambron, that does good things with plantains. PR is hot in June (and July, August, and September).

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived at the caribe hilton til the minute we left my girlfriend and I were treated like a king and queen. I was a little worried because of some bad reviews but when we saw our room we were very pleased. The people that write the horrible reviews are often stuck up and usually never happy anyway. The restaurants are pricey but good at the hotel. I would suggest getting out on the town and trying the local food. The hotel grounds were very clean and the private beach was so quiet and relaxing. The best part of the trip was the catamaran. That was so nice to be out on the water snorkeling and to see all the underwater life. If you go to the bar downstairs tell jose I said hi, what a great guy..

Reviews.Title: “8 day stay at the Caribe Hilton 6/11/04 - 6/19/04”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently returned from the Caribe Hilton. We liked the private ocean front beach, that you can snorkle in (but buy snokle gear as the resort charges $10/hour). Cheap snokle gear costs about $10 at Walgreens or similar. The food at the hotel is fine, but overpriced. It's a resort afterall, and with their downtown location a little ways from other hotels and restaurants, they can afford to charge what they charge. For breakfast, go to the Normandie Hotel, which is about 50 yards from the Caribe Hilton. Their buffet breakfast is $12.95 vs. $18.95 at the Hilton. While the Caribe offers more food choices, the restaurant is fly infested and makes the food less than delectable (it's an open air/open door to the outside restaurant, but still flys are a problem.). For lunch, get a sandwich at the outdoor pool bar area. Burgers and sandwiches are still pricey, but not bad ($7 burger and fries). For dinner, take a taxi to the Marriott in Condado. It's $8 each way, but around the Marriott on Ashford St are many local restaurants and a few national chains (chili's, starbucks, dunkin doughnuts.). I recommend the restaurant Hermes (out the Marriott and take a right, about 75-100 yards down on the left. Excellent steak, fish and Mofongo (a local dish served with chicken or shrimp). Say hello to Alexandria, a beautiful young lady who works there as a server, but doesn't speaks decent English. The prices are great. $17 for Filet Mignon vs. $35 for the same steak at Mortons at the Caribe Hilton. The Marrriott also has a nice casino, if your into that. Afterwards, take a taxi from the Marriott back to the Caribe Hilton. Why not stay at the Marriott? Small pools, and public beach, which gets crowded with locals on the weekends. If you want to see the Rain Forest (El Yuque) or other very nice beaches in Puerto Rico, contact Jason in Guest Services at the hotel. He did a great job of getting us on a great tour to see Bacardi, El Yuque and the Bioluminescent Bay(which is really cool). Take a taxi to Old San Juan (El Moro) and take the tour, it's $5. Taxi $10. Then walk downtown. I wouldn't go out and about old San Juan at night, but that's me. During the day its fine, but stay on the roads with the shops (mostly around the Convento Hotel, where you would also need to get a return taxi from. ) Taxi's seem to be only available at Hotels, so it's not like NYC or Chicago where you just hail one on the street as it passes by. There is a general store across the street from the Caribe Hilton. Cokes are $.75 and they have chips, beer, rum, wine, etc. Our room was in the Tower and was recently updated. We saw other rooms that were recently updated. Overall, service in PR is not as fast as in the states, but you're on vacation, slow down and enjoy it. Beer and mix drinks are expensive at all hotels.
