E-mail me if you need any additional information. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service and attitude”
Reviews.Author: TexasEvents
Reviews.Content: What an absolute disappointment. Not only was the food below standard but the rudeness on behalf of the hotel staff was unbelievable. If you're not a local expect to get blown off or at the very least expect your food to come last. It was very apparent that if you're from the area you will end up with the best service and the best room, if you're not, good luck you're on your own. They'll move quick when it comes to taking your gratuity but good luck in locating them after that. BTW, I love how they donate a $1 a day to a kids charity program for each guest that stays. I thought this was very kind until I found that I was charged each day on my bill for it. I certainly don't mind donating but for this hotel to act as though their the ones making the donation and then charging you is ridiculous. These people need to get off their --- and learn a few things about customer service - I will not be returning to this slime hotel.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: A mixed review for this hotel: the free food for children under 5 is a bonus, although the cost of the food for adults somewhat mitigates this blessing. There is a good child vacation camp for kids 4-12. The pools and grounds are fantastic and there is a playground as well. The beach is ok if not fabulous. There are peacocks and swans in the gardens. Free internet access in the lobby. There is free bfast in the HH lounge on the 2nd floor and a happy hour everyday. On the minus side: rooms in main building are a little shabby (tolerable though); the staff frequently bristles when requests are made; the place lacks charm and the general impression is so-so.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: WindyB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week at the Caribe Hilton last February. I am very picky about the quality of hotel where I spend my free time. This hotel had everything - people were friendly, the pool area was beautiful and most of all we loved our room where we spent allot of time sitting on our balcony. We definitely will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton....Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one week at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan, PR. I was concerned due to the reviews I had read at this site, but I didn't need to be. The staff was great, responsive, available. The rooms were clean (we stayed in the tower). There was some construction to the lagoon side, our view, but not annoying. The bathroom was not perfect, but a few little things could be overlooked. My bed was so comfortable, I didn't want to get out. The beach is private, nice. Great spa. All of our meals were out of the hotel, good to just eat the local food, The Puerto Rico Cafe off of Fortaleza St in Old San Juan is a good experience, as well as Aguaviva, near plaza Colon. Enjoy the people and the history.

Reviews.Title: “was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were not happy upon checking into the hotel, we were told that our room was given away, even though it had been paid in full, plus was informed of late check in guarantee. We ended up sleeping in part of a suite on a double sleeper sofa. So spent extra time having to unpack for one night, then check into another room the next day. We had reservations for two nights. They need to do a few repairs in the rooms we stayed in. We assumed the name was very reputable so went ahead & booked yet another night for our return from a cruise before we left home. Hopefully others found their stay to be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Hilton was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like others here, when we read all of the reviews we were a little afraid of staying here. We used Hilton points to stay for free, so we assumed we would receive the lowest category room. When we were checking in, I mentioned that it was our 22nd Wedding Anniversary (and they had a corsage that I had ordered via 1-800-flowers which their Conceirge had recommended). They gave us a room in the main building (not tower). It had a great view, nice furnishings, red marble counter top in bath and comfortable bed and small balcony which had ocean view out the side. We also ate at Morton's steak house, which while expensive (and all Morton's are), was great for our Anniversary. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and nice, and so were the bellmen. We also stayed one day after our 7-day cruise so we had two stays. Again, staff was great and room in main tower was also fine. Don't be afraid to go there!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat nervous about staying at the Hilton after reading so many bad reviews. We had a wonderful time. The hotel is great, the staff is extremely helpful, everything was wonderful! I want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about staying at the Caribe Hilton after reading many of the reviews posted on the web. Therefore, I sent an e-mail to Hilton telling them my concerns and letting them know that this would be the first night of our honeymoon prior to our cruise. My first e-mail went without a response, so after about a week or two I simply copied the e-mail, re-sent & asked for a reply. Within 24 hours I had a response from Reservations letting me know that the Front Desk assigned for us one of the recently renovated rooms in the tower which had an ocean view & that the bathrooms were completely redone. Still, I was nervous because of a previous review where the same was promised but the Front Desk gave their room to someone with a similar name. When we arrived at the Front Desk, they were very nice & even mentioned that they knew we were Honeymooners, so evidently my e-mail reached the Front Desk. Our room was awesome!!! It was totally remodeled with new furnishings, carpet, etc., the bathroom was gorgeous, the shower was excellent & the ocean view even better! We ate dinner in their Italian restaurant where the food & service was outstanding. When we got back to our room, they had a sent a bottle of champagne & a box of truffles up to our room! I would definitely go back! Since we were only staying one night, I was afraid that they really wouldn't be concerned with whether or not we liked our accommodations. I am pleased to say that the opposite occurred!

Reviews.Title: “What a blast!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: oooooo My god....did I have a blast!!! I decided to take a mini weekend getaway with one of my best friends and we decided on "CARIBE HILTON" what a great choice. I was there from April 23 till April 26. The sites are awesome........you are so close to old san juan. The concierge is so helpful. I really do Love Puerto Rico and found that this mini vacation was the best thing I have ever done. Caribe Hilton made my weekend. I have the coolest tan...lol thank you so much for the 3 level pools and the private beach....what a delight. I can't wait to book my summer vacation at Caribe Hilton.............

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, food exceptional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hilton was great. I had the opportubity to stay at 3 other hotels and the Hilton was the best at accomodations. The hotel staff was also very pleasant and basically bent over backwards when asked. The place was beautifully decorated-The ocean view was also great-The pool was very nice and the room service was exceptional. We will definately stay at the Hilton-Caribe again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you use Priceline”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in 1950. So, the architecture is dated and the amenities are a bit tired. It is set up for business conventions, but has a huge outdoor pool facility with hot tubs. In addition, the dining facilities look out over the pool area to the ocean through 2-story high windows set in a panoramic semi-circle. Be warned: there is construction going on next door, which starts at 7 a.m. on weekdays. Noisy in the morning, but not as bad as Shanghai.The key for me was getting a price of $75 a night on priceline! At this price, I will suffer tired plumbing and carpets. When I arrived at the airport, we learned that there was a taxi strike. The hotel sent a van to pick us up. When I checked in, they searched for a room and upgraded me to a garden suite (huge living room in addition to king-sized bed). Downside: The large picture window in the living room looks directly into the new high-rise going up next door (50 ft away). I do not care, as I wake up at 6 a.m. and use the pool, which is on the other side of the hotel - away from the construction.There is no in-room high-speed internet, but there is a wireless service available in the lobby (I am using it now). I could not use my AT&T dial-up in San Juan.Summary: I am paying $375 for 5 nights in an ancient, but acceptable, business/resort hotel, where the employees give it a good go. I get what I need, by asking around, and enjoy the sun-filled pool and beach area. Ignore the business conferences and eat in town...sheesh. I would not pay $150 a night to stay here, though, but at $75, I see this as a bit of an adventure in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for kids!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Caribe Hilton on 4/24. I was a bit apprehensive considering some of the other reviews but we were thrilled once we got there. The view from the pool and beach area is spectacular. The room was very clean and comfortable. The food was expensive but not out of line with other hotel restaurants that I've gone to. It was very good, especially the Italian restaurant on site. Our kids loved it. They have a nice kiddy pool, the beach is very safe for them, they have two playground areas and a game room for the occasional afternoon rain shower. They have lots of beach buckets and shovels for kids to use and also rent rafts, snorkel equipment, etc. The staff was very nice to the kids as well. It was very conveniently located as well, we took taxis everywhere instead of renting a car. The tour desk has outings to almost all of the places you'd want to go. I highly recommend taking a tour to the El Yunque rainforest. My 6 year old son refused to say good bye, because he wants to go back. We agree with him.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night from an 8 night stay at the Caribe. We were a littel nervous after reading some of the reviews, so we were prepared for the worst. Our room on the 4th floor of the tower building was nothing spectacular, but clean and comfortable. The view was terrible (construction site and parking garage) but we do not spend enough time in the room to care about the view. Room had a slight smoke smell although it was supposed to be non smoking. Bed and bathroom were clean and comfortable, though not at all fancy. However, what the room lacked was made up for with the grounds. The pool and beach area are well kept and there are plenty of chairs and clean towels. We found the staff to be friendly enough, though we did not purchase any meals or drinks there because they are quite expensive. Go to the little store across the street for a cheap, good breakfast. This hotel is very busy with lots of conferences and conventions. The lobby is always bustling with people checking in and out, as well as walking around the shops (pricey) and music at the bar. We did not have any problems at check in or check out, though we did not have any charges to our room to take care of. We did the El Yunque rainforest tour from the hotel which was worth the $45 per person. You can walk to Condado but Old San Juan is more easily accessed by bus for .25. Another nice thing about the Caribe is the garden/bird sanctuary and the parrots in the lobby (Koko and Pancho). We had a few rainy moments and it was nice to go watch the peacocks and swans when we were not out at the pool. Very pretty scenery at this hotel. We would stay there again. Email me if you want any more info.

Reviews.Title: “loved the pools”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Puerto Rico April 19th. We loved the pools and the outside areas of the hotel but the room was seriously lacking - in definate need of updating. Our ocean view room was just a sliver- mostly a view of the construction of the new hotel. Lots of leaks in the bathroom and a very slow drain in the bathtub-nothing seriously bad but enough to mention. Also very high prices for drinks at the bars ($8.00 margaritas & $3.00 pops)

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews of the Caribe Hilton, and was worried that I had made the wrong decision. When we arrived on April 11, 2004 and saw how beautiful the open air lobby and lounge were, I knew that everything would be just fine. The hotel pool and beach area are well manicured and very clean. The staff is unbelievably friendly and accomodating. The room was neat and clean. The view from our balcony was wonderful. The bathroom could have been a little more modern and needed a facelift but when you go on vacation do you really want to spend all that much time in your room and bathroom? (Stay home if the answer is yes). The restaruants were terriffic, fast friendly service with delicious well presented fresh foods. I would stay at the Caribe Hilton again....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned April 9 pleasantly surprised after reading some of the other reviews. Hotel staff beginning with Dominic at the front desk to Hiriam and Rodney at the swim up bar, were helpful, friendly and entertaining. Our room in the tower was a little small for two double beds but very clean and updated. The view alone is worth the visit! Restaurants and cocktails are a little pricey but no worse than other islands I've visited. Oh and the spa...if you can fit it in do so, the perfect end to a great island vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Request a Tower Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay ay the Caribe Hilton. We got in late on a Saturday night, so our first room was not exactly what we expected. Like everyone else, we requested an ocean view, but we were put into the Garden wing on the fifth floor.The room itself was clean and comfortable, and it overloooked a lush garden with peacocks and swans. The sound of the coquis was magical. However, it also was right next to the construction site of their expansion and new casino. The next day, after several conversations with the front desk staff, who were all very helpful and friendly, we were moved to the 16th floor of the tower. This is the newest section, so the room was immaculate, the bathroom had a corner shower with a rainfall showerhead and a handheld one. Our room was always clean and neat when we returned from the pool. The pool, beach and health club are clean and beautiful. We were there during a busy week, but we never felt crowded at the pool...lots of lounge chairs and towels. There was no entertainment except for kareoke which was pretty lame, but up the street there is a piano bar with a talented singer named Roger. Go around the corner to the little deli for cheap good food. We enjoyed our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: catlover01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton March 8-14 & were very pleased. We had a great room on the 7th floor overlooking the pools, beach & ocean. We have traveled in Europe & the US & found the Caribe to be on a par with Hilton Hotels elsewhere. We appreciated check in & out in the Diamond Honors Lounge on the 9th floor, no waiting. The continental breakfast there was good & the food plentiful. We ate several meals at Palmeras, both buffet & off the menu, enjoyed the food. My 5 year old granddaughter ate free at the buffet. The pool snack bar & bar were very convienient for meals while at the pool or beach. The turn down service ensured we had dry towels after showers after the beach & pool. We had dinner one night at Mortons, I have eaten at Mortons in Phoenix, & the Caribe Mortons was just as nice & the food comparable. Reading the negative comments make me wonder if we were in the same hotel. Has anyone who was unhappy contacted Hilton corporate to voice their dissatifcation?

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first thing to note about this hotel is that it is not a tourist hotel. I assume that it functions principally as a business hotel (though I doubt it functions effectively at all). The reason that I am pointing out the misrepresentation in the classification is because we relied on the hotel's characterization as a resort when we made our vacation plans. I think the first clues to the low level of service at this hotel were the phone calls that I made prior to my arrival to find out about services and amenities. I am convinced that the hotel staff members moonlight as prison guards in a maximum security facility. Their responses range between rude and hostile. When we checked in, the front desk personnel didn't inform us of any of the hotel's offerings. She started to put us into a room in a lower category than what we reserved. If my wife hadn't specifically inquired, that would have been something that we would have had to correct after we got to our room. Even when we got our room (after the correction), it looked out over a building top that led to a big construction project. It would seem that you would reserve the lousy rooms for those times when you're straining against capacity. Now, on to the next issue: the food. I think the food and beverage staff must go dumpster diving at the other hotels to make their menus. The food was horrible! the couple of things that we ordered we inedible, and we had to give up any prospect of having decent food here. We did eat breakfast at the buffet, because it was included in our package. The buffet was the least cared-for presentation of food that I have seen in a long time. The shoddy restocking of the food items made the entire thing look like last call at a soup kitchen. And, if the poor food presentation wasn't enough to engender your displeasure, they also made sure that they didn't clean the tables between diners. Next issue: the room. Our room had this weird wood paneling that gave the effect of a low budget porno set. There was nothing appealing about the room at all. You could find a more appealing room in practically any budget hotel anywhere. I could go on and on, but you get the point...Don't ever stay here!!!! We checked out early and went to a completely different part of PR.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read many mixed reviews on the Caribe Hilton and every experience is individual and subjective but our experience was great. The hotel was beautiful and the staff friendly and attentive. We were in a rennovated room so we did not experience the complaints about old and musty rooms. We had a beautiful view and the room was always spotless. A nice touch is early evening towel service. After a day at the beach and everyone taking showers the bathroom was a mess with wet towels hanging everywhere. It was nice to come back from dinner and find fresh towels and the bathroom cleaned. We visited several hotels while we were in San Juan and we felt the Caribe Hilton had the friendliest atmosphere. The private beach and beautiful pools really make for a great fun-in-the-sun time. I would recommend the Caribe Hilton to any of my friends visiting San Juan. A lot has been written about the cost of food at the Caribe Hilton but I feel the problem is not with the cost of the food but with unrealistic expectations of visitors. The food is no more expensive that what you would pay if you ate at a Hilton in Chicago, Dallas, LA or NY. If you eat at a top-tier hotel anywhere in the world it is going to cost you more due to their overhead. That is just the facts. I have read several complaints about the cost of Mortons. I wonder if the people complaining have ever eaten at a Mortons. I have eaten at one in Dallas and in Chicago and the prices are just about the same. If you eat at a premium steak house it is going to be expensive. Room service is the best deal. They give you a lot of food and the quality is very good. Once again it is not cheap but not out of line. People have to remember that they are staying at a resort Hilton and not at a Motel 6. All-in-all I would highly recommend the Caribe Hilton and if we visit San Juan again it is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: aemlovesnegril
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent 4 nights at the Caribe Hilton and really enjoyed the resort. The grounds were beautiful and well kept and everyone who worked there was friendly. While the beach has some sort of reef (way off shore) that prevents waves from hitting the shore, the water is warm, clear and refreshing. The huge pool area with its swim-up bar was perfect, especially with the view of the Atlantic right behind it. Also, the outside restaurant, Atlantis, was great for lunch and snacks. The other restaurants were overpriced but we prefered to eat away from the hotel anyway. At night, the bar inside had entertainment and dancing; nice to relax before or after dinner in Old San Juan. OSJ is less then 10 minutes from the Hilton and is about a $7-8 cab fare. Lastly, our room was clean and good-sized, with a view of the ocean. We enjoyed the little patio off our room as well. All in all, given the hotel's proximity to OSJ, its beautiful landscape and its catering to ultimate relaxation, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They gave to much for only 179”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hilton and it was great, they gave me a great room with ocean view and all was excellent. I think people should know that they get what they pay! I pay for a executive deluxe room with ocean view and thats what I get.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: awaintroob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton on March 19 and 20. It has a lot of pluses--nice little beach, lovely swimming pool and large comfortable rooms. My kids loved the game room. It's a healthy hike to Old San Juan, but it's a beautiful walk along the ocean. Some problems--one of the two tower elevators gave out while we were there and the water went off on our last day. But on the whole we enjoyed the stay and would recommend the Caribe Hilton to anyone who wants to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on Hilton!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this facility for four days on a Honors members vacation. To say it was disappointing doesn't scratch the surface. Rooms are old and tired. We were promised an ocean view room only to arrive and find we had a room with a terrific view of the construction area (which woke us up every morning including Saturday). The Honors members club is disgraceful, tired and worn similar to rooms. On arrival at 3:30 pm our room wasn't ready (HHonors member) and the associate at the HHonors desk was miserable and only wanting to shuffle and sign without giving a reasonable explanation to the amenties on there property. I've stayed in a lot of Hiltons and this would be the last one I'd put my most valued customer up in for there points vacation. San Juan is beautiful and was a great place to vacation, to bad this hotel doesn't live up to the same billing. Cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible: The worst Hilton and definitely the worst hotel in this price range”
Reviews.Author: sara95
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were attending a professional conference in San Juan in March 15-19, 2004 and the conference was in Hilton. Before leaving, I had read the overwhelmingly negative reviews, but this was our first time in San Juan and we were not sure whether we would be comfortable commuting between Hilton and other hotels on the island, given the island's crime rate. That was a huge mistake, this hotel should'nt be a Hilton or be rated as a Deluxe or 4 star property. The rooms were moldy, with dirty carpets, dirty walls and an awful bathroom which ran the danger of overflowing anytime. Our room was in the garden wing, when at first we complained the guy at the front desk Dominic, told us very rudely that since we only paid $179 the deluxe rooms were not available to us. This was the conference rate and never said anything about inferior rooms, and we later found out that quite a few people attending the same conference and paying the same rate had rooms in the tower. After repeated complains, on our third day Greten at the front desk gave us another room with much better view in the main bldg but that was smaller and even more moldy. The front desk was extremelt rude and unfriendly and we got the worst behavior because we resembled the island look. My son has asthma and the moldy room was bothering him so much that we spent most of our time outdoors but repeated requests didnt get us a renovated room. It was nothing but an overpriced junk. I should have known better, from the reviews here, and also from my experience with other Hiltons, they are rude and noncooperative whereas others like Embassy suites in their group are so much better in trying to help you. I understand that sometimes it is not possible to switch you but two years back when we faced this king of situation in a Doubletree in Seattle with the carpet moldy and all, they shampood the carpet and sprayed the room, didnt solve the problem entirely but their effort was noteworthy. My recommendation will be to stay at Marriott in the condado area. Also that sandpit that they called a beach is disgraceful. I dont know how they can call themselves a resort....it's nothing like the Hilton Hawaiian Villages which are resorts, a few peacocks and swans sont make a n old unclean property a resort. My suggestion to the Managerment would be to take a trip to Riviera Maya and see some ot the true resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caribe Hilton from 03/22/04 to 03/37/04 it was my spring break trip with my boyfriend. I purchased the trip on Hotwire for $687 per person for flight and hotel from Chicago. I ended up spending about $1,100 per person because the food was so expensiveI thought it was a great deal and I didn't get treated worse or got a worse room then anyone else that payed full price. My room was 762 and it wasn't bad at all. The staff at the front desk, Mortons stake house, bar and grill place were very nice. The staff at the Ilatian and Spanish restaurant were ok not kind just seemed boring. The food is over priced. Do not go to Mortons steak house unless you are willing to spend about $90 for two people to eat dinner. Save money and go to the grill by the pool or to the Palmeras restaurant. This hotel loves to charge people for everything so be careful because I was charged for consuming drinks and food that are in the room when I didn't even touch the stuff. But when I told them about it they kindly took the charges off. Also if you want to buy something to drink or some chips to eat go to this little store that is right outside the hotel they sell suff for about half the price the hotel sells it for. The pool and the beach are very nice. The room was a little worn like other reviews said but I didn't care because I was never in the room and the only time I was I was sleeping. They offer snorkeling trips at the hotel I recomend going on the east wind which was $73pp and the cheapest one offered it was a lot of fun. They also have two parrets by the name of Koko and Pancho. Koko loves girls and is a sweaty, Pancho is a thief and will steal or break your watch if your wearing one. He broke mine and bit me. I had a great time and would go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The grounds and pool areas were the highlight. Our room was clean, spacious and had a great view (it helped to be on the ninth floor - lower floors do not have the same view). The staff was very friendly and seemed to appreciate that we were there but not particularly fast (not unusual in PR). The low-light was the food. Unfortunately the food was very overpriced for the quality. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I didn't believe the bad reviews until I stayed there. The hotel itself wasn't in bad shape. I would say it was pretty average. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived 3 hours after check-in time. The people who came along with us didn't even have a room even though we reserved our rooms at the same time. There was a view of the ocean, but also the neighboring construction. The hotel was secluded from the main strip by about a 20 minute walk. The staff at the front desk were unfriendly and unhelpful. The pool and beach area was beautiful however. And most restaurant staff we encountered were friendly and the food was good. We came in to a small lizard in our room one night. The balcony door was stuck. Overall, I was disappointed and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Caribe Hilton after our cruise on Feb. 28th. The property location is beautiful. The lobby is open air with a view of the ocean and pool. The staff was very helpful when we tried to check in very early after just getting off the cruise ship. They kept our luggage while we left the hotel and took a tour of Old San Juan. Our room was spacious with a king sized bed with a garden view. The property is showing a little age and weathering but overall very nice. I would recommend. Our experience was not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the Caribe Hilton. Sure the rooms were the most modern, up to date, kept hotel rooms of all time, but I thought it was a nice Caribbean charm. After all, who's really in the room that long. When there's a beautiful pool and beach area outside being in the room is a waste of time. Although the meals were a bit expensive, they were excellent and large. Coming from Wisconsin, I had never seen a hotel without a door in the front! Staying at the Caribe Hilton was a wonderful experience for me!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Prodigal_Hoosier
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four great days at the Caribe Hilton. After reading some of the reviews here we were concerned, but all the trepidation was unwarranted. The facility is not brand new, but the pools and beach are fantastic. As are the on-site restaurants. There isn't much withing walking distance, but a taxi to Old San Juan is just $7 and well worth the trip--local flavor restaurants as well as Pizza Hut, Burger King, Subway, KFC, etc. If you are going to San Juan and want to sit on a clean, private beach (we had no trouble getting all the space we wanted on the Hilton's beach) or to relax in the sun by the pools, I can't imagine there is a better place in San Juan. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and our room was ready at 3:00. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for one night en route to the Virgin Islands for our honeymoon (June 2003). We redeemed Hilton HHonors points, so we got the room for free. It was my understanding that the normal rate was $200 per night, and I would have been very upset had I paid that much for the room. The view was great, but the room was run-down and dumpy, and kind of depressing. I am normally not very picky about hotels--the Hampton Inn is typically fine with me. But our room at the Caribe Hilton was very disappointing (and on the first night of our honeymoon, no less!) The hotel's redeeming quality is its pool and lobby. The pool and grounds are well-kept, and the beach is beautiful. There's a neat swim-up bar, and the lobby has big exotic birds. I guess I'm glad we went, but frankly San Juan was a disappointment as well. It is a poor, run down town. I've heard that the resorts and the Old Town area are nice, but from the airport to the Caribe Hilton, we didn't really see anything nice and were really glad to leave. Bottom line--don't pay more than $100 per night for this hotel, and if you do go, plan to spend most of your time at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the El Caribe. Don't understand all the negative reviews, our room was clean and beautiful. Everyone connected with the hotel was pleasant and very accommodating. The conciegre, Jayson, arranged an anniversary dinner for us that was truly spectular and unforgetable. The only criticism I agree with is the Hilton Honors "lounge" -- that really was lame. Maybe if all travellers greeted everyone with a smile, they would get a smile in return. I can't fault the service and hotel personnel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our weekend at the Caribe. Excellent place to stay. My wife is a Hilton Diamond Member and we stayed on the conceirge floor. The welcome was great and the staff was always willing to help. The meals we ate were very good and the area is beautiful. About a thirty minute walk from Old San Juan along the coastline. Old San Juan is a unique experience and not overly crowded. Our stay included the Spa Package which included a pedicure and manicure, facial and full body massage for the both of us. I almost forgot, we were pleasantly surprised to receive a welcoming bottle of champagne and chocolates. I don't know where all these cry babies stayed, but for us....we'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “On Par w/ the others...like an Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place wasn't bad. The room was much like an airport Sheraton. If you are going to stay in SJ, this place is probably not much different than any of the others on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay With Kids !!”
Reviews.Author: esz344
Reviews.Content: We just returned & loved this hotel. We absolutely loved it & don't understand what everyone is complaining about. We stayed on the executive floor, where we found the food great & the cocktail hour especially fantastic. The one thing the hotel lacked is a kids' camp, which it really should add all year round (they have it for 2 weeks in the summer & part of Dec). Other than that it was really kid friendly: they lend kids toys, kids menus (not great-but decent), 2 playgrounds (which were great). It's proximity to San Juan made it a plus.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelcritique
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton pre cruise and friends of ours stayed both pre and post cruise. We both got the room on Priceline for $69. Having heard rumors of ill treatment with Priceline visitors, I wrote the Caribe a letter. They replied stating that we would have the very best room possible. When we arrived, we had a heck of a time registering (our friends had none). We gave our name to the check-in clerk and he kept insisting that we had ALEADY checked in the hotel. We argued, showed them our confirmation, my letter, etc. The clerk would just keep saying "why are you checking in again, you already checked this morning?" After about 20 minutes of this, we were finally given the key to our OCEAN FRONT room (our friends were to be just above us). Just upstairs from the lobby, we open the door to our beautiful room and...there are two adults in our bed! Boy, were we ever embarrassed and so were they! Back down to the lobby where we waited another 20 minutes to figure out the problem. No explaination, no apologies! We were then given a room in the tower (a Priceline room this time) near the construction. Our key would not work...back to the desk to get another...the second key doesn't work...a maintenance man let us in the room. We later found out that the couple in our original room had a similar last name to ours and they were given the wrong room. We checked our bill very carefully before we left. We were also afraid that the other couple might get some of our charges. Although the new room was nice and spacious, it was a little dated and miles apart from our friends as well as everything else. There was construction going on in the room above us that didn't stop until 7:30 that night. We did enjoy the grounds, beautiful view and pool area. Morton's Steakhouse was great but way over priced. The portions were also too big. My husband and I shared a small steak and got one side each. Along with the wonderful bread and a salad, we couldn't eat our entire dinner. Split your meal if you dine there. Not too crazy about the surrounding night life. We tried to find the store that has been mentioned for buying alcohol and it was a very scary adventure. We waited until Sunday morning to venture out again. Our friends had great difficulty when they tried to check back into the Caribe after the cruise. They were told the rooms were not ready. After 3:00, they were still not ready. Our friends said that dozens of people were waiting in the open air lobby (during a horrific thunderstorm) for their rooms as well. Finally, at 4:30 they were given a room. It was a horrible room, but they were too tired to argue. For the value of $69 a night, I guess we got what we paid for. I am not sure that I would try them again, however.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: manlymum
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time at the caribe hilton! after reading some negative reviews, i really was not sure what to expect- but it could not have been better.it is a beautiful hotel and all of the people we dealt with were very helpful(sandy at the front desk and the consierge jonathan).the bathrooms were lovely- all marble and no mildew. everything in the room was clean and new, the air conditioner worked perfect as did the water in the bathrooms- we were in the main building on the 4th floor. im not sure how anyone could complain about this hotel, we have lived overseas and traveled extensively,i was very impressed with this hotel and i would definitely stay at the caribe again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: gogogo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful trip...after reading past reviews we were so nervouse about our choice of hotels...we were very surprised...drinks were well proced as was food by pool....we found the staff overly helpful and friendly...our room was clean adn comfortable...the executive level was a added bonus!! The beach was great aswas the health club...they should update the lounge cgairs, pads and twels...but we will return...

Reviews.Title: “1/30 pre cruise”
Reviews.Author: pjfarr1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton before our cruise on the Constellation. The hotel was not that bad but as many suggested not worth what we paid by booking through Celebrity. There is a great workout facility, the pool and lobby area was fantastic, and the beach is nice, since many San Juan properties do not have beaches. Our room was not so good. We were in the tower section of the hotel which was adjacent to the construction (bridge, I think) and we were woken up several times by the noise. We chose to dine at Morton's of Chicago and were disappointed too. Thank goodness the cruise was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth anything near rack rates”
Reviews.Author: SueC0001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on January 22 pre-cruise. Got the room for $108 on Priceline. For that price, it was acceptable. The best rate I could find at the time for this hotel on non-auction discount booking websites was $300+. Man, would I have been livid had I paid anywhere near that. Our room, while adequate, was more suited to the lower-end Hilton brands than it was to a Hilton resort. Our room was dingy. Not dirty, just old and worn. Most disconcerting was the mold in the bathroom. Apparently there had been a leak in the wall which allowed mold to grow under the paint. The previous poster must have gotten an upgraded room at the Caribe Hilton, because I stayed at the Wyndham El San Juan several years ago, and that room was FAR superior to my room at the Caribe Hilton. Really the only thing the Hilton had going for it was the pool. It was beautiful. It rivaled the El San Juan's pool. Everything else about the Caribe Hilton was far inferior to the El San Juan-the location, the shops, the spa, the restaurants (which were comparably priced). The construction going on at the hotel was an inconvenience as well. Priceline includes this hotel in the same category as the El San Juan and Intercontinental, and it definitely is not in their league.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after a cruise on the Destiny. Immediately leaving the port, we went to the hotel and were able to check in at about 10:30 am. I got this room on Hotwire for $103 and fortunately, we got a room on the 8th floor. Everyone was friendly and unlike other reviews, our room was great. We were at the Wyndham El San Juan, precruise, and this room was better hands down. The view was spectacular. My husband was in love with it. We also enjoyed the executive lounge on the 9th floor. The pool and beach area can't be beat. The main downfall from my point of view was location. The hotel offers a lot on its property, but if you want to venture out, it's going to be at least a $6 taxi ride to go shopping or out to eat. That is, unless you choose to walk across the highway and bridge...

Reviews.Title: “DUMP - Does not deserve even one star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Affter several trips to the Ritz-Carlton in San Juan, I talked my husband into staying at the Caribe Hilton. Big mistake. We came in on the "Spa Package". I was told when I made the reservations that we received breakfast daily and spa treatments. Unfortunately NO ONE at the front desk or in Management could agree on what was included in the package; I had to inform them. Everything at the hotel was a constant battle. Check in is at 3pm and our room was not ready until 4:30pm, we were charged $550 for our spa services (until I spoke with several indifferent staff), the hotel is OLD and dirty, the bed is what you would expect in a Motel-6, the sheets are musty and moist, the air-conditioner was broken and paint was peeling. We were supposed to have a "Delux Ocean View" and overlooked the building top air conditioners. 4 hours into our stay, I looked at my husband and said "You were right" - need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice for Hilton HHonors Members”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Hilton guest, I can attest to some of the negative reviews this property gets. I try to balance my stays at hotels with a comparison of good vs. bad. Unfortunately, Caribe Hilton always has come up in the bad range.Good: Great pool, nice beach, very nice fitness center (I am not sure if they charge extra for this, I uses it for free), very nice staff (in the VIP lounge and floors), adequate room service food, great room service staff, reasonable self parking fees for the area, very close to Old San Juan, located in a great area to jog around.Bad: Rooms are old, dated, musty, in need of renovation, bathrooms are in very bad shape, a/c units don t work properly, maintenance staff is non-responsive (I am still waiting for them to repair a non-functioning safe and too-cold a/c unit, maybe by my next trip) VIP lounge is usually crowded and low on food (since its open to everybody, including small children, staying in their executive level floors, not just to Hilton HHonors top tier members), parking garage is thigh for anything larger than a Toyota Camry and some times full so you have to park in a paved lot by the construction area (don't wash your car, its going to get dirty!), there is construction going on next door and you WILL be waken up at 7:00 am by their cacophony of sounds, restaurants are not very good (eat somewhere off property), downstairs reception staff are not very nice.Overall: Not too good. If you must stay in a Hilton property in San Juan, try the Hampton Inn or the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the Caribe Hilton over the Christmas holiday after returning from a cruise. We had 4 rooms, and without exception they were disgusting. On the first night we were not allowed to check in to all of our rooms until after 6 pm . When we got in, they all smelled of mildew, all had mold, and 2 had plaster falling from the bathroom ceilings. In fact one room had a worker replastering the ceiling when we walked in. I too spoke with the manager who was COMPLETELY indifferent, not even polite. Our "partial" ocean view was also of a roof and AC units. Rooms routinely were not made up until after 5pm. {now I know why you cant check in at a reasonable hour} 2 of us actually "upgraded" to a renovated room on a higher floor for $25 {nothing is free at the Caribe} All renovated meant was the bathroom was redone {no plaster falling} same nasty moldy carpet etc. They say meals are free for kids under 5 and 50% 5-12, dont believe it. One day the waiter said only when Adults order buffet {$20 for breakfast} Next day they said only from the Childrens menu, next day when we asked for Childrens Menu, they said they dont have a childrens menu. One night our family of 10 went fo their Mexican Fajita Buffet, advertised on a big poster in the window $19 per person. When the bill came, it was at $25 per person. I went back to the poster, and they had actually taped over the $19 anded pasted a card over it that said $25!! Oh well, you get the idea...... STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Peaceful Caribe”
Reviews.Author: trexgreeley
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 5 nights during New Year's at the Caribe Hilton. A very nice hotel and not bad for the money. Great view of the ocean from the balconey even if the ballroom roof was under the balconey. You could see the waves beautifully breaking on the reefs. Pool and PRIVATE BEACH are excellent. Such a peaceful place to relax & wind down from life in the fast lane. It seems as if people writing reviews forget this is the Carribean & Puerto Rico were life is slow, sometimes slummy and definitely not like living in the USA. Restaurants are pricey. You can get the exact same food from room service for much less in price. Morton's of Chicago had the beat steak I think I have ever tasted. WHAT A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE AT THE CARIBE HILTON!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time with this aged building”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For $350 a night, we were soundly disappointed. Room 335 was cramped and our family of 3 only had 2 chairs, and no room for another one. Our view was of the roof, acres and acres of roof, and air conditioners. The drywall around the balcony door was peeled and cracked. One of the sheets had a hole in it. We paid top dollar through a travel agent and I was disgusted. Oh, the public areas and grounds are nice, but I wasn't sleeping there. I talked to manager and he was totally indifferent. He had his money and he didn't care what we thought. Hilton needs to demolish the old wing and stop ruining their reputation by sticking hapless guests in there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Added a "Resort Fee" to My Bill After I Had Prepaid through Orbitz”
Reviews.Author: mjs24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK but nothing special. I had signed up through Orbitz and paid in advance for the one night I stayed there. Hilton added a charge called "resort fee" to the bill and separately charged my credit card for that. I inquired and they just said it was an additional charge and to call Orbitz. While the stay was not a disaster, I would never stay there again and I would not use Hilton again unless I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was still there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a wonderful stay at the Caribe Hilton in beautiful San Juan. The hotel was beautiful! Private beach, pool, swim-up bar...it had the works! The room was in great conditions and the sound of the ocean and coquis (the famous Puerto Rico frog) from the balcony, was just incredible and beautiful! For those of you who like to walk, it's just a 30 min. walk from the hotel to Old San Juan. If not, a cab charges you from $6 - $8. But you should definitely visit Old San Juan. There are many places to shop, eat and visit. There is even a Marshall's and Walgreen's, which was very convenient for us. Walgreen's has a One Hour Photo service, which was also very convenient for us:) The places I would suggest you visit is El Morro, which is only $3 to get in, La Fortaleza and Parque de las Palomas (Park of the Birds). There are a few more places, but I can't remember. Also, if you are looking for some traditional Puerto Rican food, I recommend El Jibarito restaurant. It's right in Old San Juan. I don't remember the street it is on, but all you have to do is ask someone and I'm pretty sure they will lead you to it. People in Puerto Rico are so friendly and helpful. The concierge at the Caribe Hilton was so helpful. We asked about places to go dancing or just hang out and have some drinks, and he gave us a list of places to go to for everyday of the week that we were there:) I can say that the most we waisted money on, was cab fare. But, there are to car rental places right on the premises. Other than that, we had a great time and we have plans of going there again next year:)

Reviews.Title: “we just visited this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: lapochka
Reviews.Content: we didnt stay at this hotel this december 03, but we visited a bunch of them just to ge tan idea and here is what i can say: The Caribe Hilton is separately from the rest, the beach doesnt have waves(if u mind them them stay there). It's the only hotel with a kinda private beach. The territory is well kept, most of the stuff is outside, which brings some beaty to it. they have live piano player there at night, pools look nice(dont know if they are clean) Whyndham(near Hilton),-nothing special, and the beach is near the main road. The water club, it's good to visit it, but the airport is very close and u can see the plains flying by really close and to get to hte beach u have to cross a street. In order to get to a hote, u have to go through a scary alley or a cab.the lounch on the roof is nice with a good view. The Whyndham El San Juan in Isla Verde is nice. It has a nice area with shops and a lounge with live music. We stayed at MArriott-great hotel.
